jobs_titles: Data Entry Operator Junior / Part Time (Remote)
describtion: This is a remote position.<p><br></p><strong>Exciting Entry-Level Remote Data Entry Operator Opportunity!</strong><p><br></p>Are you ready to embark on an incredible journey in the world of data management from the comfort of your own home? We are thrilled to offer a unique and engaging position for an Entry-Level Remote Data Entry Operator to join our dynamic and forward-thinking team!<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>As a Data Entry Operator, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the accurate and efficient entry of data into our systems. Your attention to detail and commitment to precision will contribute to the seamless flow of information, allowing our organization to make informed decisions and deliver exceptional services to our clients. You will be entrusted with the essential task of organizing and maintaining data, ensuring its integrity, and participating in continuous improvement initiatives. Your dedication to quality will make a significant impact on our operations and drive us towards excellence.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Enter data accurately and efficiently into designated databases and systems. </li><li>Conduct regular data quality checks and promptly correct any discrepancies. </li><li>Assist in organizing and categorizing data for easy retrieval and analysis. </li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams to streamline data collection processes. </li><li>Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data management. </li><li>Uphold the strictest confidentiality and security standards when handling sensitive information. </li><li>Participate in data cleansing and validation projects to maintain data accuracy. </li><li>Identify opportunities to enhance data entry processes and propose innovative solutions. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>High school diploma or equivalent (additional education in data management or related fields is a plus). </li><li>Proficient typing skills and attention to detail to ensure accurate data entry. </li><li>Strong computer literacy and familiarity with data entry software/tools. </li><li>Excellent time management and organizational abilities to meet deadlines. </li><li>A keen eye for identifying errors and ensuring data integrity. </li><li>Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal. </li><li>Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team. </li><li>Enthusiastic about learning and adapting to new technologies and processes. </li><li>Prior experience in data entry or related fields is an advantage but not mandatory; we welcome fresh talent! </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Remote work flexibility: Work from the comfort of your home or anywhere with an internet connection. </li><li>Mentorship and growth opportunities: Learn from seasoned professionals and unlock your full potential. </li><li>Competitive compensation package: We value your skills and dedication; expect a rewarding package. </li><li>Skill development: Access to training resources to enhance your knowledge and expand your expertise. </li><li>Work-life balance: Maintain a healthy work-life balance with flexible working hours. </li><li>Inclusive and diverse environment: Be part of a team that celebrates uniqueness and promotes inclusion. </li><li>Impactful work: Contribute to projects that make a real difference and leave a mark on the industry. </li><li>Supportive team: Join a collaborative and supportive work culture that values your contributions. </li></ul><p><br></p>Ready to make your mark in the world of data management? Take the first step towards an exciting career by applying now! Join our team of data enthusiasts and become a vital part of our data-driven success story.<p><br></p><strong>Application Process</strong><p><br></p>To apply for this position, please submit your updated resume and a compelling cover letter detailing your interest in data management and relevant skills. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further assessments.<p><br></p>We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace. We encourage candidates of all backgrounds to apply.<p><br></p>#DataEntryOperator #RemoteWork #EntryLevelOpportunity #DataEnthusiast #JoinOurTeam<p><br></p>

This is a remote position.<p><br></p>Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for accuracy and organization? Are you seeking an entry-level opportunity that allows you to work remotely from the comfort of your home? Look no further! We are searching for a dedicated Data Entry Clerk to join our dynamic team and support our growing organization in managing essential data.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Utilize data software to input, update, and maintain accurate records. </li><li>Verify and correct data entries to ensure precision and completeness. </li><li>Collaborate with team members to resolve any discrepancies in the data. </li><li>Perform regular data backups to safeguard valuable information. </li><li>Handle confidential data with the utmost integrity and adherence to security protocols. </li><li>Coordinate with various departments to ensure timely and seamless data transfer. </li><li>Prepare and organize source documents before entering data to maintain efficiency. </li><li>Maintain a high level of attention to detail, identifying errors or inconsistencies in data entries. </li><li>Assist in generating reports and conducting data analysis as required. </li><li>Uphold a positive and professional attitude while accomplishing data entry tasks. </li><li>Embrace a continuous improvement mindset and suggest process enhancements. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>High school diploma or equivalent; additional certification in data entry or related field is a plus. </li><li>Proven experience in data entry or a similar role will be advantageous, but not mandatory. </li><li>Proficient computer skills and ability to navigate various data entry software and systems. </li><li>Strong familiarity with spreadsheet applications, such as Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets. </li><li>Excellent typing speed and accuracy to meet deadlines efficiently. </li><li>Exceptional attention to detail to maintain data integrity. </li><li>Strong organizational and time management abilities to handle multiple tasks effectively. </li><li>Demonstrated problem-solving skills to resolve data discrepancies. </li><li>Ability to work independently and remotely while maintaining effective communication with the team. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Work from the comfort of your home, enjoying a flexible and remote work arrangement. </li><li>Gain valuable experience and skills in data entry and information management. </li><li>Join a supportive and collaborative team that encourages growth and professional development. </li><li>Competitive entry-level salary with potential performance-based bonuses. </li><li>Access to a comprehensive benefits package, including health insurance and retirement options. </li><li>Enjoy a healthy work-life balance with flexible working hours. </li><li>Embrace a culture that promotes diversity, equality, and inclusion. </li><li>Opportunity for career advancement within the organization. </li></ul><p><br></p>Join us in this exciting role as a Data Entry Clerk and play a crucial part in maintaining our organization's data accuracy and efficiency. Your attention to detail and dedication to excellence will contribute to our continued success. Apply now and be a key player in our remote and growing team!<p><br></p>

We’re <strong>FORMA</strong>. An incubator, accelerator, and curator of today’s beauty brands.<p><br></p>We celebrate, support, and seek those changing the world through creative expression. Each brand in our portfolio is thoughtfully selected, acquired, or created because of the products it offers, the stories it tells, and the beauty it spreads.<p><br></p>We’re a team made of: Equal parts thinkers and doers. Visionaries and operators. Strategists and creatives— we're united by a fierce entrepreneurial spirit. Our dive in, roll your sleeves up, get your hands' dirty approach to every project leads to extraordinary outcomes, and to some of the most popular beauty products on shelves today. We're a creative, professional, highly collaborative, seasoned, well-oiled team. We're in the business of beauty for a reason. There's nothing our team of 200+ people love more than a good challenge, a great product, and the opportunity to make, celebrate, and spread beauty at scale.<p><br></p><strong><u>Summary Of Position</u></strong><p><br></p>The purpose of the Demand Planning Coordinator is to support the Demand Planning Team through forecasting, systematic process execution, data accuracy maintenance &amp; reporting distribution.<p><br></p><ul><li>Transform data received from external sources for transfer into our internal database.</li><li>Provide visibility to sales performance in the format, level and detail required by stakeholders.</li><li>Partner with demand planners in gathering, formatting &amp; processing demand plan data for transfer into the database.</li><li>Develop initial demand sizing for the launch of new items through collaboration with brand and sales teams.</li><li>Partner cross-functionally with Brand teams in determining item-shade contributions for newness programs.</li><li>Analyze sales performance of new launch and promotional activity against KPIs.</li><li>Assess the effect of launching new products on the performance of existing products.</li><li>Evaluate performance of brands within multiple domestic and international sales channels.</li><li>Coordinate with Supply and Brand team to communicate changes of new launch strategies in DTC and Wholesale channels.</li><li>Monitor replenishment orders from Wholesale partners and communicate deviations from forecasts.</li><li> Sporadically serve as key representative for the Demand Planning team in meetings.</li><li>Assist in lead responsibilities when implementing newly developed processes and subsequent trainings.</li><li>Identify areas of process improvement within Demand Planning.</li><li>Liaise with IT to maintain data accuracy.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills &amp; Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Proven analytical experience</li><li>Ability to build strong collaborative relationships with cross-functional teams</li><li>Aptitude in validating data accuracy</li><li>Oral and written communication competence</li><li>Ability to adhere to deadlines</li><li>Experience with Microsoft Office suite; primarily Excel, Outlook and Teams.</li><li>Ability to function effectively in a WFH environment.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Physical Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p>Must be able to perform essential functions (with or without an accommodation) without posing a "direct threat" to the health and safety to self or others.<p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Information</u></strong><p><br></p>FORMA Brands takes a market-based approach to pay, and amounts will vary depending on your geographic location. The salary range reflected here is for positions based in the Greater Los Angeles area. The successful candidate’s starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future without notice.<p><br></p>Compensation Range: $20.00 - $25.00 hourly<p><br></p>The Company reserves the right to alter, change, abolish and even combine jobs depending upon changing conditions.

<p><strong>BAR </strong>is seeking a highly motivated, personable Administrative Assistant – Office Assistant. Reporting to our Controller, the Administrative Assistant – Office Assistant provides administrative assistance and general office assistance including word processing, contract tracking, credit card reconciliation, data entry, answering phones, greeting clients, visitors, vendors and employees, ordering supplies, food and hospitality needs, and other general administrative support as assigned.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>The role requires someone who is self-directed, organized, pro-active, responsive, patient, flexible, adaptable, and pays close attention to details. An individual in this role must have a non-reactive personality, be willing to do whatever is asked and after some months of experience be able to anticipate the needs of the varied audience with whom they interact each day. A consistent personable, welcoming, yet professional approach is essential, as is having the temperament to accept that many requests made of them will be last minute or spontaneous. The position is highly visible; energy and enthusiasm are required.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Essential Duties and Responsibilities -</strong></p><p><br></p><p>Administrative:</p><p>Administrative project support for Project Managers, as assigned. Assist with contracts and contracts log. Monthly reconciliation of company credit cards for Principals Group. Update Client and vendor contact information, employee lists, seating charts, various content for company intranet and data entry as needed. Develop and maintain an understanding of projects, clients, project teams and consultants working with BAR. Knowledge of the organizational structure of BAR, the who’s who and what’s what.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>General Office:</p><p>Review inventory and order supplies and food items as needed. Assist with conference room use. Coordinate catering for meetings, when requested. First point of contact with clients, consultants, and potential employees.&nbsp;Sort and deliver incoming mail. Check voicemail 3 times daily and forward messages to appropriate parties. Expected to develop connections with clients, consultants, vendors, BAR staff. Responsible for keeping reception area, conference rooms and kitchen organized, presentable and welcoming.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Qualifications and Experience Desired:</strong></p><p><strong></strong></p><ul><li>1 year administrative assistant or office assistant experience, or transferable skills.</li><li>Can confidently communicate with staff at all levels as well as interact with clients and consultants.</li><li>Ability to manage competing priorities; highly organized, flexible and timely in work habits.</li><li>Ability to work with different kinds of people with diplomacy and tact.</li><li>Ability to keep composure and a positive attitude during stressful times/tight deadlines.</li><li>Enthusiasm for your work and the work of the firm.</li><li>Interest in providing support across multiple business functions: Admin, Facilities, Finance, IT, HR.</li><li>Excellent verbal communication skills; active listener and avid note-taker.</li><li>Basic business writing skills including awareness of appropriate style and tone.</li><li>Show initiative in seeking or developing new projects or processes.</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook.</li><li>Experience with Zoom phone, chat, and video tools.</li><li>Deltek Vision, Paylocity, Adobe CS experience a plus but not required.</li><li>Able to work onsite; this is not a hybrid or remote position.</li><li>Able to work on a computer and answer, screen, direct phone calls.</li><li>Able to lift and carry up to 20 lbs.</li><li>4 year college education preferred, not required.</li></ul><p><br></p><p>At <strong>BAR Architects &amp; Interiors</strong> our diverse practice has always had a singular focus – to create places that inspire and that stand the test of time while meeting each of our client's specific needs in unique ways. A 75+ person architecture, interiors and planning firm with offices in San Francisco and Los Angeles, we work across California and the world. Our studio environment combined with large firm resources fosters collaboration and encourages creative thinking while our size and diversity of practice offers broad opportunities for professional development. BAR has received over 200 Awards including a Firm Award from the AIA California Council and a Presidential Citation.</p><p><br></p><p>We are committed to the well-being of our employees and offer a competitive benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision and life insurance, commuter benefits, short and long term disability, long-term care, 401k &amp; Profit Sharing, and continuing education opportunities. Salary range for this position: $54,000.00 - $64,000.00.</p><p><br></p><p>Interested applicants should send a compelling letter of interest, resume, salary expectations and references to HR@bararch.com with subject line indicating: <em>Administrative Assistant - Office Assistant</em>. We look forward to hearing from you and exploring how your passion for design and your skills, experience and interests align with opportunities at BAR. BAR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.</p><p><br></p><p>No recruiters and no telephone calls, please.</p>

<strong>Company Description</strong><p><br></p>Guardant Health is a leading precision oncology company focused on helping conquer cancer globally through use of its proprietary tests, vast data sets and advanced analytics. Guardant Health has commercially launched Guardant360®, Guardant360 CDx, Guardant360 TissueNext™, Guardant360 Response™, and GuardantOMNI® tests for advanced stage cancer patients, and Guardant Reveal™ for early-stage cancer patients. The Guardant Health screening portfolio, including the Shield™ test, aims to address the needs of individuals eligible for cancer screening.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>The <strong>Front Desk</strong> <strong>Administrative Assistant</strong> will provide advanced administrative support to ensure the smooth operations along with running the front reception area. This includes responding to emails, taking messages and routing correspondence.</li><li>Handle requests and queries appropriately and timely.</li><li>Responsible for handling multiple priorities and managing complicated calendars across multiple executives and external personnel.</li><li>Manage extensive domestic and international meeting and travel arrangements that may often require changes and prepare subsequent final expense reports.</li><li>Responsible for taking meeting minutes and accurately entering data.</li><li>Support inter- and intra-departmental communications for the management team and with external clients; this will involve extensive collaboration with internal and external contacts and the handling of sensitive information.</li><li>Draft letters and documents required with minimal guidance, format templates, documents and presentations, proofread, etc.</li><li>Distribute COVID rapid tests.</li><li>Sort and distribute mail.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>College Degree preferably in business.</li><li>At least five years relative experience.</li><li>Highly-developed interpersonal skills including communication and listening skills, friendly and helpful demeanor, exhibiting a professional, energetic, proactive and enthusiastic demeanor.</li><li>Excellent verbal and written skills and attention to detail.</li><li>Demonstrate excellent judgment and influence management skills.</li><li>Proactive approach to business needs and requirements.</li><li>Discretion and confidentiality</li><li>Ability to work independently and be flexible, adjusting priorities and tasks in real time to support the objectives of the departments.</li><li>Successful experience in fast-paced entrepreneurial environment.</li><li>Excellent working knowledge of Microsoft products including; PowerPoint, Word, Excel, Outlook, and Slack.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Additional Information</strong><p><br></p>The US hourly range for this full-time position is $21.03 to $32.70 The range does not include benefits and, if applicable, overtime, bonus, commission, or equity.<em> The range displayed reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries across all US locations for the posted role with the exception of any locations specifically referenced below (if any).</em><p><br></p><em>Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including, but not limited to, job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. East Bay Innovations- Community Living Assistant<p><br></p>Also hiring applicants from Brentwood, Tracy, Mt. House, Hayward, Livermore, San Leandro, Dublin, Berkeley, Emeryville and Oakland!<p><br></p>Are you looking to gain experience in the non-profit sector, social work, social services, occupational therapy, mental health, or healthcare? If so, then East Bay Innovations (EBI) is where you want to be! No experience required!<p><br></p>What does a Community Living Assistant do?<p><br></p>You would provide 1:1 support to adults with developmental disabilities in their home and throughout their community! East Bay Innovations supports clients in Alameda County. We provide support to a diverse age group of adults with various support needs. Your goal would be to provide respectful, personal, and motivating services that enable our clients to participate in all aspects of their community, and lead meaningful lives centered around independence and empowerment.<p><br></p>Salary: $19.06 per hour<p><br></p>What's the schedule?<p><br></p>If you're a student, or someone seeking part-time work or non-traditional hours, this may be the perfect fit for you. There are opportunities to work daytime hours, weekends, evenings, and overnights, making this the perfect opportunity for those seeking to work non-traditional hours in the human services field. This position starts at part-time with opportunities to grow to full-time. We support clients throughout Alameda County.<p><br></p>What does your typical day supporting one of your amazing clients look like?<p><br></p><ul><li>You will be providing emotional support and companionship</li><li>Get some exercise and walks around their neighborhood</li><li>Do some arts and craft projects</li><li>Join in on Zoom events</li><li>Connect with friends and loved ones virtually</li><li>Meal planning and cooking meals</li><li>Light cleaning around their homes</li><li>Personal/intimate care</li><li>Wheelchair transfers</li><li>Grocery shopping and other errands </li><li>Modified, using delivery or pick up services.</li><li>We know COVID is still a real thing in our world. Our program has made some changes and modifications during the Shelter In Place. We are starting to slowly go back out in the community.</li></ul><p><br></p>Benefits:<p><br></p><ul><li>Medical coverage for those working 30 hours a week or more, with three different health plans for you to choose from.</li><li>Dental and vision coverage for both full-time and part-time staff.</li><li>Aflac- three different plans to choose from.</li><li>FSA &amp; DCFSA, Commuter and Parking pre tax benefits.</li><li>Employee EAP that include free mental health counseling sessions for you and members of your household.</li><li>403(b) retirement plan so you can invest in your future.</li><li>Education Assistance Fund, providing reimbursement for tuition, fees, and supplies for education and self-enrichment courses</li><li>Membership in the Service Employees International Union (SEIU) Local 1021.</li><li>Many opportunities for training so you can feel confident in the work you do and prepare for future career opportunities.</li><li>Paid sick leave for all employees, and paid vacation for full-time employees</li><li>Paid holidays for all</li><li>Mileage reimbursement for on-the-job driving</li><li>We show our appreciation for staff with monthly raffles, games and more, to celebrate you and the important work that you do! </li></ul><p><br></p>About Our Organization:<p><br></p>Established in 1994, East Bay Innovations (EBI) is a nonprofit human services organization that supports people with developmental disabilities, such as intellectual disabilities, autism, and cerebral palsy. Our person centered services support people to live in their own homes, make choices about how they live, work in jobs of their choosing, and enjoy being part of their communities.<p><br></p>East Bay Innovations is an equal opportunity employer. We will consider all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.<p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>XCYGycxgfB

<p><strong>Partner Success Associate - Operations </strong></p><p><strong>How to apply: </strong><span>Send a resume and thoughtful cover letter to jobs@sfnewdeal.org. Applications submitted through Easy Apply will not be screened.</span></p><p><br></p><p><span>Overview&nbsp;</span></p><p><br></p><p>SF New Deal (SFND)<span> is a 501(c)3 nonprofit that provides supportive services and financial opportunities for small businesses in San Francisco.&nbsp;</span></p><p><br></p><p><span>Our team is growing rapidly to build and deliver innovative and responsive community-centered solutions to some of San Francisco’s most persistent challenges. Since our launch in March 2020, we’ve had significant impact and disbursed over $35 million dollars to more than 660 small businesses citywide.&nbsp;</span></p><p><span>Our work is funded through private donations and government contracts.&nbsp;</span></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Our mission</strong><span> is to strengthen neighborhoods by making it easier for under-resourced small business owners to succeed.&nbsp;</span></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Our vision</strong><span> is for a vibrant San Francisco with diverse and thriving small businesses.&nbsp;</span></p><p><br></p><p><span>We’re a team of collaborative optimists and would love to have you join us and build with us.&nbsp;</span></p><p><br></p><p><strong>About the Role</strong></p><p><span>The Operations Associate will join the newly restructured Partner Success team at a critical time in SF New Deal’s journey as a small business service provider and advocacy organization. The Operations Associate will provide key support to the many distinct programs within SF New Deal’s portfolio through community engagement, field observation &amp; team discussions. The ideal candidate has a keen eye for continuous operational improvement &amp; process localization with consideration to the partners, clients &amp; communities we serve, and is comfortable resolving incidents, understanding program-specific trends, and supporting the design &amp; implementation of new solutions.</span></p><p><br></p><p><span>This role will function as a strong bridge between our Programs &amp; Partner Success departments, as well as a liaison to the many stakeholders who collaborate alongside SF New Deal to create a diverse and vibrant San Francisco. The Operations Associate will report directly to the Dir. of Partner Success, and work alongside the Program Managers who oversee individual programs within our portfolio and the Partner Experience &amp; Compliance branches of the greater Partner Success team.&nbsp;</span></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Reports to:</strong><span> Director of Partner Success</span></p><p><span>Key Responsibilities</span></p><p><em>70% Operations</em></p><ul><li><span>Act as a Partner Success liaison to the Programs team &amp; coordinate with Program Managers regarding partner management &amp; incident resolution.</span></li><li><span>Be the primary point of contact for a dedicated book of business within assigned programs.</span></li><li><span>Develop, oversee &amp; improve program-related quality management systems in observance of City mandated guidelines &amp; internal service standards</span></li><li><span>Provide on the ground support as needed through all phases of the program lifecycle and encourage better program praxis by applying in-field learnings &amp; observations</span></li></ul><p><br></p><p><em>30% Department General</em></p><ul><li><span>Be a partner advocate when collaborating with the Programs &amp; Partner Success teams by representing the emergent challenges, concerns &amp; areas of interest expressed by partners outside of a singular program context</span></li><li><span>Provide Call Center coverage to relevant language &amp; departmental lines&nbsp;</span></li><li><span>Represent SF New Deal’s mission &amp; vision to communities across the city with an eye for future partnership opportunities</span></li></ul><p><br></p><p><span>You’ll be a fit if you&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p><ul><li><span>Are excited to approach challenges from new perspectives.</span></li><li><span>Are energized by the opportunity to shape new, high impact programming in support of small businesses</span></li><li><span>Are passionate about advancing equitable pathways in entrepreneurship</span></li><li><span>Have a bias towards action</span></li><li><span>Are an empathetic, collaborative, and values-driven team player</span></li><li><span>Are self-directed and proactive; able to identify problems or areas of improvement, propose solutions, and prioritize effectively</span></li><li><span>Are excited about the prospect of helping small businesses and historically underserved communities</span></li><li><span>Are able to work independently and collaboratively with remote team members</span></li><li><span>Have a strong attention to detail, are extremely organized, and thrive managing multiple projects</span></li><li><span>Are excited to use technology to apply a data-driven approach to problem solving</span></li></ul><p><br></p><p><span>Qualifications</span></p><p><strong>Approximate Weekly Time Required:</strong><span> 40 hrs/week</span></p><p><strong>Preferred Work Days for this role:</strong><span> Monday - Friday</span></p><p><strong>Compensation and Benefits:</strong><span> Medical, Dental &amp; Vision Insurance, Paid Time Off, Matching 401k, Work from Home Stipend and Monthly Wellness Stipend, Professional Development.</span></p><p><strong>Salary range: $65,000-$75,000</strong></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Location</strong><span>: This role is primarily remote/work from home and requires a lot of time on the computer and the phone. Project depending, regular site visits may be required. The ideal candidate is in or near San Francisco.</span></p><p><br></p><p><strong>How to apply: </strong><span>Send a resume and thoughtful cover letter to jobs@sfnewdeal.org. Applications submitted through Easy Apply will not be screened.</span></p><p><br></p><p><span>Research has shown that women and people from marginalized communities apply to roles when they meet 100% of the job requirements, versus men who apply if they meet an average of 60% of the requirements. We encourage EVERYONE to apply if you have transferable skills and can add value to this role regardless of whether you have 100% of the skills and experience requested.</span></p><p><br></p><p><br></p>

with our notary department PT or FT.<br><br>At Certified Mobile Notary Service our qualified Data Entry Specialists will enjoy the freedom and profitability of working independently as a (1099) contractor while benefiting from the tools, branding, and support of a national mobile notary signing service.<br><br>Please apply today at https://certifiedmobilenotaryservice.com and click on It's strictly paid on production and commissions.<br><br>We pay our remote contractors $20.00 per 4,000 single entries submitted by spreadsheet.<br><br>In addition, you will earn a $15.00 commission per sale by sending out our email marketing ad campaigns that generate sales.<br><br>Based upon availability you can work either part-time or full-time.<br><br>Contractors are paid bi-weekly on the 1st and 15th of the month by direct deposit or we will mail your paycheck.<br><br>Please reference agent ID code CMNSAmyR

<strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong> THIS RECRUITMENT MAY BE USED TO FILL MULTIPLE POSITIONS IN THIS, OR OTHER DIVISIONS OR DEPARTMENTS BESDIES THE POSITIONS LISTED BELOW. IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN EMPLOYMENT IN THIS CLASSIFICATION, YOU SHOULD APPLY TO ENSURE YOU ARE CONSIDERED FOR ADDITIONAL OPPORTUNITIES THAT MAY UTILIZE THE APPLICANTS FROM THIS RECRUITMENT. </strong><strong> MEETING THE MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS DOES NOT GUARENTEE ADMITTANCE INTO THE EXAMINATION PROCESS. ONLY THE MOST QUALIFIED CANDIDATES WHO DEMONSTRATE THE BEST COMBINATION OF QUALIFICATIONS IN RELATION TO THE REQUIREMENTS AND DUTIES OF THE POSITION WILL BE INVITED TO TEST OR INTERVIEW. </strong><p><br></p><strong><u>The Department</u></strong><p><br></p>The Parks Division provides planning, development, operation, maintenance, and rehabilitation of City parks and open spaces. The Recreation Division provides classes and programs for all ages and abilities. We aim to promote the use of safe, clean, and attractive facilities for enjoyment and quality of life for all ages and abilities. The Cemetery Division maintains 33,000 internment sites in a peaceful public park.<p><br></p><strong><u>The Position</u></strong><p><br></p>Providing customer service at Recreation Facility Front Desk (CRC, YAC, Senior Center, Reed &amp; Grant Sports Park, Warburton and ISC Pools). The job responsibilities include data input, processing program registrations, opening and closing the desk reception area and keeping accurate records of daily sales. Daily check in of patrons, adhering to established protocols and ensuring the safety of customers as they enter and exit the facilities. Work assignment shifts will include, days, evenings and weekends.<p><br></p>As an as-needed employee, this is an "at-will" position and there is no guarantee of hours. Hours are limited to 999 in a fiscal year or 960 hours in a fiscal year for retired CalPERS annuitants<p><br></p>The Recreation Office Assistant has an emphasis on performing a variety of clerical and customer service duties at a recreation facility. An incumbent in this classification is responsible for demonstrating a high level of customer service while performing basic clerical duties including financial transactions, maintaining documents, and assisting others. Assignments are generally limited in scope, contain fairly routine duties, and are performed within a procedural framework established by higher-level employees.<p><br></p>Typical Duties<p><br></p>Each position in this classification may not include all the duties listed below, nor do the examples cover all duties that may be performed.<p><br></p><strong><u>Under General Supervision</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Greets employees, visitors, and the public, assisting with routine inquires and requests and providing a high level of customer service</li><li> Answers telephone calls, providing routine information, taking messages, and routing calls to the appropriate destination</li><li> Maintains and updates records including attendance, inventory, and basic financial transactions; files and retrieves files, forms, inventories, logs, and other documents</li><li> Registers program and class participants; enters data into and retrieves data from standard business software, databases, and online systems; posts a variety of information on forms, records, reports, and files</li><li> Makes reservations for recreation facilities</li><li> Maintains office area; creates and arranges program displays</li><li> Orders, maintains, and distributes a variety of supplies and equipment; maintains and monitors invoices and purchase orders; maintains simple inventory records</li><li> Opens and closes facility in accordance with established procedures</li><li> Performs other related duties as assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE<p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Graduation from high school or possession of a GED; and</li><li> Six (6) months of general clerical or customer service experience; and</li><li> Must be at least 18 years of age at time of application</li></ul><p><br></p>LICENSES AND/OR CERTIFICATES<p><br></p><ul><li> Possession of a valid California Class C driver's license is desirable</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Other Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> As a condition of employment, incumbents will be required to be fingerprinted in accordance with State of California law</li><li> Must be able to perform all of the essential functions of the job assignment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Meeting the minimum qualifications does not guarantee admittance into the examination process. Only the most qualified candidates who demonstrate the best combination of qualifications in relation to the requirements and duties of the position will be invited to test. </strong><p><br></p><strong> Federal law requires all employees to provide verification of their eligibility to work in this country. Please be informed that the City of Santa Clara will not sponsor, represent, or sign documents related to visa applications/transfers for H1B or any other type of visa which requires an employer application. </strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Knowledge Of</u></strong><p><br></p>Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities<p><br></p><ul><li> Correct English grammar, spelling, and punctuation</li><li> Modern office practices, procedures, and methods, including filing and the operation of standard office equipment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Ability To</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Operate personal computer hardware and software and a variety of standard office equipment</li><li> Communicate clearly and effectively in English in person, over the telephone, and in written correspondence</li><li> Demonstrate sensitivity, tact, and excellent customer service while interacting with others</li><li> Issue and follow oral and written instructions</li><li> Exercise sound and effective judgment within established guidelines</li><li> Organize, coordinate, and complete duties to meet scheduled deadlines</li><li> Perform routine arithmetic calculations</li><li> Prepare, maintain, and reconcile routine accounting and numerical records</li><li> Establish and maintain effective working relationships with those contacted in the course of work</li><li> Work in a team-based environment and achieve common goals</li><li> Lift and carry objects weighing up to twenty-five (25) pounds</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Information</u></strong><p><br></p>You must answer all job-specific questions in order to be considered for this vacancy or your application will be deemed incomplete and withheld from further consideration. Applications must be filled out completely (i.e. do not write “see resume or personnel file.”) To receive consideration for the screening process, candidates must submit a <strong>1) Cover Letter and, 2) Resume. </strong>Incomplete applications will not be accepted. Application packets may be submitted online through the “Apply Now” feature on the job announcement at www.santaclaraca.gov . <strong>This position is continuous or open until filled: Applications will be reviewed on July 16, 2021 and on a bi-weekly basis for consideration to the position. If you are interested in applying you are encouraged to apply as soon as possible, before the position is closed.</strong><p><br></p>The City of Santa Clara is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants for all job openings will be considered without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status or any other consideration made unlawful under any federal, state or local laws. The City of Santa Clara is committed to offering reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at (408) 615-2080 or HumanResources@santaclaraca.gov .<p><br></p>Closing Date/Time: Continuous

<strong>About Castilleja</strong><p><br></p>Castilleja is a dynamic, diverse, and intentional educational community for students in grades 6–12 that believes in the power of women learning and women leading. Founded in 1907, Castilleja fulfills its mission to educate young women to become confident thinkers and compassionate leaders with a sense of purpose to effect change in the world. Every member of the Castilleja community is responsible for fostering an equitable, respectful, and just community. We value building and sustaining authentic relationships and work together to create a collaborative learning and working environment.<p><br></p><strong>About The Position</strong><p><br></p>If you are a friendly, positive, administrative professional, with a keen eye on details and creative approach for problem solving, you would be an excellent fit for this opportunity! We are looking for a front desk administrator to oversee the reception area of our 6TH Grade Middle School. In this role you will:<p><br></p><ul><li>Greet and welcome clients and visitors in a friendly and professional manner, ensuring a positive first impression of Castilleja.</li><li>Administer students' attendance.</li><li>Answer and direct incoming phone calls promptly and efficiently, providing accurate information or routing calls to the appropriate Faculty or Staff member.</li><li>Manage the Middle School general email inbox, responding to inquiries and forwarding messages as necessary</li><li>Schedule and coordinate appointments, meetings, and conference room reservations, maintaining an organized and up-to-date calendar</li><li>Perform various administrative tasks, such as maintaining the reception area's cleanliness and organization, ordering office supplies, managing incoming and outgoing mail, and provide support with document preparation and data entry.</li><li>Help daily with lunch service. </li></ul><p><br></p>Key Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li> Previous experience as a receptionist or in a customer service role is preferred.</li><li> Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with a friendly and professional demeanor.</li><li> Strong organizational skills and ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment.</li><li> Proficient in using computer systems, including Google Suite and email management.</li><li> Attention to detail and ability to maintain accuracy in data entry and scheduling.</li><li> Bilingual English/Spanish is a plus</li><li> Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment</li><li> High School diploma and some college coursework</li></ul><p><br></p>Compensation and Benefits:<p><br></p>Comprehensive Health Benefits<p><br></p>Superior TIAA Retirement<p><br></p>Castilleja uses a competitive salary scale which takes into account experience, education and skill level. The salary for this position ranges from $55,000 to $67,500<p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>wezJj6DUsV

<strong>Job Description And Duties</strong><p><br></p><strong> This is a re-post. If you previously applied, there is no need to re-apply as your application is on file and will be considered. </strong><p><br></p>Under the general direction of the Office Services Supervisor II, the Office Technician (OT) (Typing) serves as the Court Clerk in the Workers Compensation Division, performing a wide range of the most difficult clerical duties. In that role, the OT evaluates of a variety of incoming legal documents and correspondence using the Electronic Adjudication Management System (EAMS). The incumbent will also provide assistance to the Disability Evaluation Unit (DEU), the workers’ compensation judges, and court personnel.<p><br></p>This posting may be used to fill future vacancies in accordance with 2 CCR<p><br></p><ul><li>249.3</li></ul><p><br></p>To be considered for this Office Technician (Typing) job opportunity, applicants must be either reachable on an employment list, have transfer eligibility or have reinstatement eligibility. To take the exam and gain employment list eligibility, please click here to access the exam bulletin: https://www.calcareers.ca.gov/JOBSGEN/4PB24.PDF<p><br></p>You will find additional information about the job in the <strong> Duty Statement </strong>.<p><br></p><strong>Working Conditions</strong><p><br></p>This position is located at:<p><br></p>100 Paseo de San Antonio, Suite 241<p><br></p>San Jose, CA 95113-1402<p><br></p>The OT(T) works in a smoke-free DWC Office under LED lighting, controlled temperature, quiet to moderate noise levels; equipped with cubicles computer, and other office equipment. Ability to retrieve and transport legacy box files in a safe manner.<p><br></p><strong>Position Details</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Code #:</strong><p><br></p>JC-365152<p><br></p><strong>Position #(s):</strong><p><br></p>400-678-1139-620<p><br></p><strong>Working Title:</strong><p><br></p><strong> Court Clerk </strong><p><br></p><strong>Classification:</strong><p><br></p>OFFICE TECHNICIAN (TYPING)<p><br></p>$3,369.00 - $4,217.00 A<p><br></p><strong># of Positions:</strong><p><br></p>1<p><br></p><strong>Work Location:</strong><p><br></p>Santa Clara County<p><br></p><strong>Job Type:</strong><p><br></p>Permanent, Full Time<p><br></p><strong>Department Information</strong><p><br></p>The Department of Industrial Relations (DIR) was established in 1927. Its mission is to improve working conditions for California's wage earners and to advance opportunities for profitable employment in California. DIR administers and enforces laws governing wages, workplace safety and health, apprenticeship training programs, and medical care and other benefits for injured workers. DIR also publishes materials and holds workshops and seminars to promote healthy employment relations, conducts research to improve its programs, and coordinates with other agencies to target egregious violators of labor laws and tax laws in the underground economy.<p><br></p>Electronic Submission of Applications preferred. Application Packages maybe submitted electronically through your CalCareer Account at https://jobs.ca.gov/ Applications must be received electronically by 11:59 p.m. on or before the above final filing date.<p><br></p>Please only submit ONE application. Electronic applications submitted through your CalCareer Account are highly recommended and will be received/processed faster than other methods of filing.<p><br></p>If you are unable to apply electronically through your CalCareer account, please mail a completed and signed State Examination/Employment Application STD Form 678 and application package to the mailing address provided in the “Application Instructions” section below and ensure the following:<p><br></p>Clearly indicate the Job Code #, Position Number and the Title of this position in the “Examination or Job Title(s) For Which You Are Applying” section located on the first page of your State Examination/Employment Application STD Form 678.<p><br></p><ul><li> Clearly indicate the basis of your eligibility (cert, transfer, reinstatement, etc.) in the “Explanations” section located on the first page of your State Examination/Employment Application STD Form 678. </li><li> Remove and do not submit the “Equal Employment Opportunity” questionnaire (page 5) with your completed State Examination/Employment Application STD Form 678. This page is for examination use only. </li><li> Do not include your full Social Security Number on your documents and/or do not provide any LEAP information. </li></ul><p><br></p>Department Website: http://www.dir.ca.gov<p><br></p><strong>Special Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> The position(s) require(s) the ability to type at a minimum speed as designated on the Class Specifications (link available in the additional documentation section). You must obtain a valid typing certificate confirming your ability to meet the minimum typing speed, prior to being hired. Additional information regarding acceptable typing tests is available at the CalCareers.ca.gov website. </li></ul><p><br></p>The position requires the ability to type at a minimum speed of not less than 40 words per minute for ordinary manuscript or printed typewritten materials. A valid typing certificate confirming the ability to meet the minimum typing speed must be obtained prior to being hired. Additional information regarding acceptable typing tests is available at the CalCareers.ca.gov website.<p><br></p><strong>Application Instructions</strong><p><br></p>Completed applications and all required documents must be received or postmarked by the Final Filing Date in order to be considered. <strong>POSITION</strong>: Desk Clerk<p><br></p><strong>LOCATION(S)</strong>: Page St Studios, San Jose, CA<p><br></p><strong>HOURS PER WEEK</strong>: APPROX. 20 HOURS PER WEEK GRAVEYARD SHIFTS. Some evening and weekend work may be required.<p><br></p><strong><u>Description Of Position</u></strong><p><br></p>Under the supervision of the Property Manager, the desk clerk is responsible for the security of the public areas of the building. Greet guests, answer questions, and answer the telephone. Monitor the security / TV system screens, walk the property, and report any suspicious activity. Desk clerk is responsible for the clean appearance of the desk area and for enforcing rules regarding the lobby and library areas. Other duties as assigned by the Property Manager.<p><br></p><strong><u>Prerequisites</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> High School Diploma or equivalent</li><li> Ability to relate well to residents, guests, and other staff.</li><li> Must be able to show they can exercise good judgment.</li><li> Must be flexible in attitude and work schedule</li><li> Must have good communication skills and telephone manners.</li><li> Previous experience of similar type desirable.</li><li> Demonstrate ability to work alone and follow directions.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>The following duties are normal for this position but this list is not to be deemed all-encompassing. Other duties may be required and assigned.<p><br></p><ul><li>Be the public person at the front desk. Always present a good appearance (neat and clean). Greet guests and give entry to vendors or those (other than residents) visiting the property.</li><li>Give entry and provide assistance to vendors or those (other than residents) visiting the property.</li><li>Ensure visitor log, daily log, and other front desk forms are kept up to date.</li><li>Answer incoming telephone calls and route telephone messages.</li><li>Answer questions, give information regarding application and unit availability, answer the telephone, and take messages that are legible and complete in content.</li><li>Post and distribute tenant notices.</li><li>Observe the TV security monitors and report any suspicious activity. In the event of an emergency, respond to the appropriate service by calling 911 and then the Property Manager.</li><li>Enforce policy regarding after hours guests. Register all overnight guests.</li><li>Enforce prohibition against eating food in the lobby area and make sure that all litter is picked up immediately. Notify the janitor for large clean-up needs.</li><li>Responsible for after hours writing of work order requests on the Maintenance Request Form including all relevant information such as date received and permission to enter.</li><li>Perform other duties as requested by the Property Manager.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Physical Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Computer use.</li><li> Sitting at desk for extended periods of time.</li><li> The ability to lift/move/carry up to and including 50 pounds.</li></ul><p><br></p>The above intends to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. It is not intended to include all duties and responsibilities. The order in which duties and responsibilities are listed is not significant.<p><br></p>Charities Housing is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status, or any other classification protected by state or federal law. If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. Charities Housing is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.<p><br></p>We are looking to make an immediate hire. This position will remain open until it has been filled. If we receive resumes from qualified candidates, we reserve the right to start the hiring process at any time.<p><br></p>Principals only. No calls please. We will only respond to those persons who are deemed qualified at the sole discretion of Charities Housing. For more information about Charities Housing, please visit our website www.charitieshousing.org.<p><br></p>No relocation will be provided.<p><br></p><strong><em>Job Posted by ApplicantPro</em></strong>

Thank you ***<p><br></p>We are looking for a highly organized and self-motivated person who craves a challenge and feels energized to roll up their sleeves. You will work in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment. You’ll be part and parcel with the Retro ops team, and while your primary responsibility will be candidate scheduling and communication, you will also work on various initiatives and special projects. You’ll be juggling multiple balls at once sometimes, but affirmatively within the constraints of a healthy, happy working environment.<p><br></p><strong>What you’ll do in this role:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Recruiting inbox to zero, daily (including weekend) by 10 pm</li><li>Schedule a high volume of candidate calls </li><li>Keep candidate records updated and organized in the applicant tracking system (Lever): resumes, feedback, internal and external candidate-related communication </li><li>Coordinate on-site candidate visits, including scheduling and logistics</li><li>Work cross-functionally with hiring managers to fill their job requisitions</li><li>Maintain minimum time intervals for response to candidates</li><li>Continually assess recruitment process and workflows to identify inefficiencies and opportunities to improve/streamline</li><li>Occasionally communicate to candidates and hiring managers into the evening and some weekends</li><li>You will report to the VP of Operations</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>You might thrive in this role if you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>2+ years in recruiting, marketing/advertising, or sales</li><li>Are resourceful and can figure out how to solve unusual tasks</li><li>You move fast and maintain a high level of attention to detail, organization, and follow-up </li><li>Possess strong interpersonal skills and enjoy connecting with intellectually curious individuals</li></ul><p><br></p>Our mission is to extend healthy human lifespan by one decade.<p><br></p>Retro develops therapies for diseases driven by the biology of aging. We work on (1) partial reprogramming, (2) blood factors, and (3) autophagy to rejuvenate cell and tissue function with the ultimate aim of adding years to healthy human lifespan. We are looking to expand our exceptional team at our Redwood City location. The annual salary range for this role is $70,000 - $85,000. Total compensation also includes generous equity and benefits. Benefits and perks:<p><br></p><ul><li> Medical, dental, and vision insurance for you and your family</li><li> 401(k) plan with 4% matching</li><li> Unlimited time off and 10 company holidays per year</li><li> Paid parental leave</li><li> Annual learning &amp; development stipend</li><li> Free lunch and snacks</li></ul>

<strong>COMPANY SUMMARY</strong><p><br></p>The John Stewart Company is a full-service housing management, development and consulting organization that began in 1978 with a commitment to providing high quality service in the affordable housing sector. We work to enrich the lives of our residents and employees, while delivering our services cost‐effectively, efficiently and with the highest levels of professionalism, compassion, integrity and respect.<p><br></p><strong>SUMMARY OF THE POSITION</strong><p><br></p>Under the direction of the Property Manager, the Desk Clerk monitors traffic in and out of the building, communicates with tenants, visitors and staff. Writes end of shift reports and incident reports, writes work orders, enforces project policies in a manner consistent with fair housing regulations, and keeps the reception area neat.<p><br></p><ul><li>Answer telephones, direct calls, take messages and make emergency calls when situations arrive.</li><li>Assist with office responsibilities such as completing work orders, comment cards, visitor violation forms and other duties assigned by management.</li><li>Inform visitors of visitor policy, check visitor ID and sign visitors in and out of the building.</li><li>Complete incident reports to record unusual building activity.</li><li>Distribute resident mail on daily basis.</li><li>Fill in as requested when other desk clerks are absent.</li><li>Testing of annual tuberculosis may be required as well as following Exposure Control Protocol for blood borne pathogens.</li><li>On-call shifts may be required.</li><li>High school graduate or GED certificate.</li><li>Experience working with people of various cultural backgrounds, especially those with special needs is a plus.</li><li>Knowledge of federal, state and local laws and Fair Housing guidelines.</li><li>Ability to read, understand and communicate fluently in English.</li><li>Good sense of awareness, urgency and follow procedures to solve problems.</li></ul><p><br></p>Benefits for Employees who work 30+ hours/week -<p><br></p><ul><li>Medical, dental and vision care; preventative medical care paid at 100%.</li><li>Vacation leave of up to ten days per year in the first year.</li><li>Up to 72 hours of sick time per year.</li><li>Flexible Spending Accounts for Health Care and Dependent Care.</li><li>Company paid Life AD&amp;D Long Term Disability.</li><li>Free, confidential counseling through our Employee Assistance Program.</li><li>Commuter benefit program.</li><li>Discounts for AT&amp;T, ClassPass, and Weight Watchers.</li><li>$50 annual Wellness Reimbursement.</li><li>Matching 401(K) Retirement Savings Plan of up to 2% of your compensation (for any employee who works 20 hours or more per week).</li></ul><p><br></p>Benefits for Employees who work less than 30 hours/week -<p><br></p><ul><li>Free, confidential counseling through our Employee Assistance Program.</li><li>Commuter benefit program.</li><li>Discounts for AT&amp;T, ClassPass, and Weight Watchers.</li><li>$50 annual Wellness Reimbursement.</li><li>Matching 401(K) Retirement Savings Plan of up to 2% of your compensation (for any employee who works 20 hours or more per week)</li></ul><p><br></p>See what our employees are saying about the company here!<p><br></p>The John Stewart Company provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws.<p><br></p>The John Stewart Company will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative.<p><br></p><strong>Effective January 1, 2020, the California Consumer Privacy Act requires businesses that meet certain minimum threshold requirements to provide a “notice at collection” to applicants for employment who reside in California. The notice at collection describes the categories of personal information to be collected about these California applicants and the purposes for using that personal information. Therefore, we have posted the Company’s “Notice At Collection For California Applicants” here. Please review this Notice at your convenience.</strong>

IAM Hourly represented employees who currently work at the main (Sunnyvale/Palo Alto) unit, Santa Cruz, VAFB or Eastern Range facilities must apply to open requisitions on Brass Ring to be considered for the position.<p><br></p>Performs the collection and destruction of non-accountable sensitive, classified or proprietary material in accordance with predetermined collection schedules exercising a knowledge of procedures, factory locations, work areas and collection points; collects sensitive, classified or proprietary material at established locations by loading and unloading materials into special security approved carts and containers; transports material from established collection points to a Material Destruction Facility by manual means or by utilizing designated Company vehicles, which will be used for the performance of the duties described herein; sorts out all non-destructible materials prior to document destruction; operates material destruction equipment to completely destroy all collected materials and ensure that materials not destroyed are stored in accordance with applicable security regulations.<p><br></p>Determine proper method of loading, unloading, lifting, positioning, security storage bins used for sensitive information Performs onsite/offsite document destruction of sensitive information using destruction equipment. Operates a company vehicle and destruction equipment in a safe, professional manner. Shows proficiency in handling and maneuvering trucks and operating destruction equipment. Transports security bins, documents, equipment, hard drives and supplies to and from customer locations or within the facility while complying with traffic regulations.<p><br></p>Performs safety and maintenance checks on truck and destruction equipment. Follows all safety requirements as outlined in company policies. Completes all necessary paperwork or database input accurately as required. Handle necessary paperwork; reconcile load with, and report discrepancies to proper personnel.<p><br></p>Maintains cleanliness of truck interior/exterior and security storage bins/destruction equipment. Direct and perform the loading, securing and unloading of own loads as required.<p><br></p>Candidate must be able to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI clearance.

Pomelo is on a mission to improve the lives of immigrants and their loved ones abroad by extending the U.S. credit system internationally. We are proud to be the first fintech company to combine international money transfer and credit, making money transfers refreshingly free, fast, and secure.<p><br></p>As an early-stage start-up, we are building a product that rethinks what money transfer can do for people, existing at the intersection of family, personal finance, consumer credit, and global remittances.<p><br></p>We’re a team of ~30 and are growing our San Francisco headquarters. Our investors include Keith Rabois of Founders Fund (CEO at OpenStore, former COO of Square), Kevin Hartz (Co-founder/CEO of Xoom), The Chainsmokers, The Weeknd, and more.<p><br></p>Your Role<p><br></p>We’re looking to hire an Office Manager to work out of our HQ office in San Francisco (near the Ferry Building). As with all of our roles, this position offers the opportunity to wear multiple hats in an effort to make our company as successful as possible. The ideal candidate will be excited to take on various tasks from office management to special projects to scheduling/coordination.<p><br></p><ul><li>Serve as the point person and face of our office, owning various office manager duties including inventory/supplies, maintenance, mailing, equipment, and invoices</li><li>Own the office aesthetic and help to design and decorate our new space</li><li>Manage various projects including company offsites and team activities</li><li>Manage contract and price negotiations with office vendors, service providers and office lease</li><li>Address employee queries regarding office management issues (hardware equipment, travel arrangements, etc.)</li><li>Liaise with facility management vendors, including cleaning, catering, and security services</li><li>Plan in-house or off-site activities (parties, celebrations, and conferences)</li><li>Partner with HR and IT to assist with new hire onboarding</li><li>Schedule meetings, appointments, and interviews</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience as an Office Manager, Project Manager, or Administrative Assistant</li><li>Knowledge of Office Administrator responsibilities, systems, and procedures</li><li>Hands-on experience with office machines (e.g. fax machines and printers)</li><li>Familiarity with various software applications, including Google Workplace (GDoc, Sheets, etc.) and Greenhouse</li><li>Excellent time management skills and ability to multitask and prioritize work</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with strong attention to detail</li><li>Strong organizational and planning skills, with the ability to operate in a fast-paced environment</li><li>A creative mind with an ability to suggest improvements and find creative solutions</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits And Perks</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>❤️ A meaningful mission and an opportunity for direct social impact. We’re putting real money back in the hands of the people who need it most and helping immigrants and their families realize the American dream. </li><li>👥 An amazing team and culture. You’ll have peers from both top tech companies (e.g. Google, Twitter, Microsoft) and other successful startups (e.g. Affirm, Remitly, MemSQL). We empower each other to do great work and continue growing. </li><li>💪 Opportunity for major impact, learning, and growth. </li><li>🏥 Platinum-level health insurance (medical, dental, vision) — with 100% covered by the company for you and 50% for dependents. </li><li>🌴 PTO: 3 weeks in your first year, 4 weeks thereafter, plus national holidays</li><li>✈️ $1,500 annual travel stipend</li><li>😌 $300 annual wellness stipend</li><li>🖥 $500 home office setup stipend</li><li>🗺 Twice-a-year company retreats. Previous trips include skiing in Park City and getting sun and surf in Cabo, Mexico.</li></ul>

<p><strong>Job Summary:</strong></p><p>A Financial Services company is in search of an executive assistant with 1year year experience to provide support to executives and handle various office tasks.
