describtion: <strong><u>Full Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>BALANCE is seeking a HYBRID (On Site and Work from home Combination) Housing Counselor in San Francisco.</strong> Our Housing Counselor provides accurate, relevant, and helpful information to assist clients and potential clients in developing solutions regarding housing, down-payment assistance, money management, debt management and credit related issues via in-person, telephone, or virtual consultation.<p><br></p>This position provides counseling and education, if needed, to clients in San Francisco and across the country.<p><br></p><ul><li> Preferably HUD Certified Counselor.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Essential Duties And Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each of the essential duties listed below. This is a hybrid role requiring s a combination between onsite work on one of our San Francisco Locations and work from home.<p><br></p>Bilingual in Spanish, Filipino, Chinese (Cantonese or Mandarin), is preferred but not required.<p><br></p>HOUSING<p><br></p><ul><li>Assists clients in developing specific strategies towards achieving homeownership, lending process, affordability, down-payment assistance programs, fair housing and how to create and maintain overall financial and homeownership stability in the future.</li><li>Housing application assistance</li><li>Produces a written action plan that supports the counselor's conclusion as to the course of action that promotes the client's best interests or the client's choice of action and motivates the client to implement it. </li><li>Prepares mailing of preliminary paperwork to clients in a timely manner. </li><li>Conduct housing education workshops</li><li>Ensure compliance with the current housing regulations. </li><li>Counsels proficiently in any of the following programs, as defined by management:</li><li>Pre-purchase Counseling</li><li>Rental Counseling</li><li>Default Counseling, if applicable</li><li>Post-purchase, if applicable</li></ul><p><br></p>MONEY MANAGEMENT<p><br></p><ul><li>Assists clients in developing specific strategies to resolve past and present financial concerns, establish and achieve financial goals, and create and maintain overall financial stability in the future.</li><li>Provides general information to clients about bankruptcy, collections, court judgments, credit issues, credit reports, housing issues, consumer protection laws, student loans, wage attachments, financial planning to clients. </li><li>Confers with clients to ascertain available monthly income after living expenses to meet credit obligations.</li><li>Explains credit report ratings and protections laws to clients and provides answers to client's questions.</li></ul><p><br></p>ADMINISTRATIVE<p><br></p><ul><li>Promptly answers incoming calls from clients and determines nature of problem or question to establish course of action to address problem or question.</li><li>Schedules appointments for clients, confirms daily appointments, and reschedules appointments as necessary and performs regular follow ups.</li><li>Performs elements of on-going casework as needed to provide service and problem-solving assistance for client inquiries and account management.</li><li>Reporting and documenting session information, activities, and outcomes.</li></ul><p><br></p>Other duties as may be assigned.<p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES</strong><p><br></p>The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required:<p><br></p><ul><li>Familiarity with city, state, and federal housing programs.</li><li>Self-motivated with a strong commitment to assisting families and individuals towards self-sufficiency.</li><li>Analytical - Collects and researches data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data.</li><li>Problem Solving - Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics.</li><li>Technical Skills - Assesses own strengths and weaknesses; Pursues training and development opportunities; Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills; Shares expertise with others.</li><li>Customer Service - Manages difficult or emotional customer situations; Responds promptly to customer needs; Responds to requests for service and assistance; Meets commitments.</li><li>Interpersonal Skills - Demonstrates empathy, focuses on solving conflict, not blaming or shaming; maintains confidentiality; listens to others without interrupting; keeps emotions under control.</li><li>Oral Communication - Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; listens and gets clarification; responds well to questions.</li><li>Written Communication - Writes clearly and informatively; edits work for spelling and grammar; Varies writing style to meet needs; Able to read and interpret written information.</li><li>Teamwork - Balances team and individual responsibilities; Gives and welcomes feedback; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Puts success of team above own interests.</li><li>Quality Management - Looks for ways to improve and promote quality; Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness.</li><li>Ethics - Treats people with respect; Keeps commitments; Works ethically and with integrity; Upholds organizational values.</li><li>Organizational Support - Follows policies and procedures; Completes administrative tasks correctly and on time; supports organization's goals and values; Values and respects diversity.</li><li>Language - Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to write reports and business correspondence. Effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.</li><li>Judgment - Exhibits sound and accurate judgment; Makes timely decisions.</li><li>Motivation - Sets and achieves challenging goals; Measures self against standard of excellence.</li><li>Planning/Organizing - Prioritizes and plans work activities; Uses time efficiently.</li><li>Professionalism - Approaches others in a tactful manner; Reacts well under pressure; Treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; Accepts responsibility for own actions; Follows through on commitments.</li><li>Quality - Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; Applies feedback to improve performance; Monitors own work to ensure quality.</li><li>Quantity - Meets productivity standards; Completes work in timely manner.</li><li>Safety and Security - Observes safety and security procedures; Reports potentially unsafe conditions; Uses equipment and materials properly.</li><li>Adaptability - Adapts to changes in the work environment; Able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events.</li><li>Attendance/Punctuality - Is consistently at work and on time; Ensures work responsibilities are covered when absent; Arrives at meetings and appointments on time.</li><li>Dependability - Follows instructions, responds to management direction; Takes responsibility for own actions; Keeps commitments; Completes tasks on time or notifies appropriate person with an alternate plan.</li><li>Initiative - Volunteers readily; Undertakes self-development activities; Asks for and offers help when needed. Interested in ongoing learning opportunities.</li><li>Innovation - Meets challenges with resourcefulness.</li><li>Mathematical - Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.</li><li>Reasoning Ability - Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.</li><li>Technology - Proficiency in Microsoft Office Applications (Word, Excel, Access, Outlook, etc.) web and app-based client management systems.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Education And/Or Experience</u></strong><p><br></p>Associate's degree: or one to two years related experience and/or training (EAP, financial services, counseling, banking, credit, and collection); or equivalent combination of education and experience.<p><br></p><strong>CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS </strong><p><br></p>Must successfully pass and obtain the HUD Housing Counselor Certification within 60 days of hire.<p><br></p><strong><u>Other Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>Bilingual in Spanish, Filipino, Chinese (Cantonese or Mandarin), is preferred but not required.<p><br></p>Job Type: Full-time<p><br></p>Pay: $30.25 - $31.25 per hour<p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>401(k)</li><li>401(k) matching</li><li>Dental insurance</li><li>Disability insurance</li><li>Employee assistance program</li><li>Employee discount</li><li>Health insurance</li><li>Life insurance</li><li>Paid time off</li><li>Retirement plan</li><li>Vision insurance</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Schedule</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>8 hour shift</li><li>Day shift</li><li>Monday to Friday</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Application Question(s)</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Are you Bilingual in either Spanish, Cantonese, Mandarin, Tagalog or Vietnamese?</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Education</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>High school or equivalent (Required)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>License/Certification</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>HUD Certification (Required)</li></ul>

The Position<br><br>The Public Works Department is responsible for the maintenance of City streets, parks, trees, street lights, traffic signals, traffic signs, pavement markings, buildings and mobile equipment. The Department is also responsible for the San Leandro Shoreline Recreation Area, the maintenance of the San Leandro Marina, the Bay Trail and the shoreline marshlands.<br><br>The Eligible List established from this recruitment will be used to fill current Maintenance Worker Entry vacancies and any future vacancies that may occur within the City, while the list remains active. Employment Lists shall remain in effect for one year, unless terminated or exhausted.<br><br>Definition: Performs a variety of semi-skilled tasks in connection with cleaning, maintenance, and repair of streets, parks, equipment, public buildings and related City facilities and related work as required.<br><br>Distinguishing Characteristics: This is an entry level general maintenance classification in the Maintenance Worker series. Incumbents typically learn on the job, using a variety of tools.<br><br>Supervision Exercised and Received: Exercises no supervision. Receives general supervision from a section supervisor; receives lead direction from higher level staff.<br><br>Duties and Responsibilities<br><br>Essential Functions: The essential functions of the classification may include, but are not limited to, the functions below and are subject to changes in operational necessity.<br><ul><li>Performs minor maintenance and operates motorized equipment, power and hand tools; and performs more complex duties for training purposes;</li><li>Works independently or as a part of a crew involved with construction, maintenance and repair of City facilities involving paving, plumbing, carpentry, landscaping, painting, electrical and/or mechanical equipment;</li><li>Follows all safety rules and protocols included in the Injury and Illness Prevention Program; takes appropriate action as required to identify and correct safety hazards and report safety concerns to his/her supervisor;</li><li>Removes trash/debris from parks, streets or other City facilities; and</li><li>Cleans restrooms and other City facilities and replaces supplies and equipment as needed;</li><li>For detailed information about the job classification, visit Maintenance Worker - Entry.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>To be considered, an applicant must have the required experience, training, education, knowledge and abilities as stated below.<br><br>Experience and Education Guidelines: Any combination equivalent to experience and education that would most likely provide the required knowledge and abilities would be qualifying. A typical way to obtain the knowledge and abilities would be:<br><br>Education: High school diploma or certified equivalent (GED).<br><br>Experience: Six months of general maintenance experience.<br><br>Licenses/certifications/other requirements: Must be willing to work such hours as are necessary to accomplish the job requirements; travel to attend meetings, seminars and conferences; and perform field work. Classification requires the possession and continued maintenance of a valid class "C" California driver's license for operating a motor vehicle.<br><br>Additional Information<br><br>Wondering what to expect during the recruitment process? Please visit the City's Job Opportunities page for additional information.<br><br>Deadline to apply:July 30, 2023 at 5:00 p.m.Review of submissions:ongoingPanel interviews weighted at 100%:Tentatively scheduled for the week of August 14, 2023Department-level interviews:To be determinedJob Offer:Selected candidate(s) will receive a conditional job offer.<br><br>Information contained herein is subject to change without notice.<br><br>The City of San Leandro is an Equal Opportunity Employer. For more information regarding ADA accommodation or Veteran's preference, please visit the City's employment FAQ's page.<br><br>For current benefits information, please refer to the Benefits Program page located under the Human Resources Department on the City of San Leandro website at www.sanleandro.org. <p>Please send resume in WORD format should you be interested in the following Administrative Specialist position located in San Francisco, CA. This is a full-time, direct-hire position with a salary between 80-90K with awesome benefits. If you’re not interested, please forward to your colleagues as we do pay referral fees.</p><p> </p><p><strong>Job Title: </strong>Administrative Specialist</p><p><strong>Location: </strong>San Francisco</p><p><strong>Salary:</strong> 80-90K</p><p><strong>Eligible for OT</strong>: YES</p><p><strong>Degree Required: </strong>HIGHLY PREFERRED</p><p><strong>Work Environment:</strong> Hybrid (3 days in office/2 days remote)</p><p> </p><p>The Administrative Specialist provides administration, organizational, technical, and project-based support to the Co-Managing Partner, as well as other attorneys and other legal personnel time permitting.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Responsibilities include but are not limited to:</strong></p><p> </p><ul><li>Scheduling meetings and coordinating all aspects of those meetings, including but not limited to creating/editing PowerPoint slides and other information.</li><li>Managing the Co-Managing Partner’s Outlook calendar.</li><li>Coordinating in-person and video meetings; including, reserving conference rooms, ordering meals, arranging for any IT equipment needed (i.e. laptop, projector, audio/video equipment), sending Outlook meeting requests, greeting clients, checking in guests in the lobby for large meetings, etc.</li><li>Accurately coordinating travel arrangements via the firm’s Travel department.</li><li>Processing expenses in Chrome River for expense reimbursements.</li><li>Updating attorneys’ contact lists as well as preparing, editing, and proofreading routine correspondence.</li><li>Editing client prebills as directed and processing client billing in accordance with firm policies and procedures (in coordination with the Billing department).</li><li>Assisting with ad hoc projects in coordination with other departments such as Finance &amp; Accounting, Information Technology, Marketing, Talent, HR, etc. to accomplish assigned projects. </li><li>Setting up new client matters; completing client label requests, requesting on-site/off-site client files from the firm’s Information Governance and Conflicts &amp; Client Intake departments.</li><li>Performing a variety of administrative responsibilities to develop systems and processes to manage the work efficiently as well as providing general support as assigned. </li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Qualifications: </strong></p><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum of three (3) years of legal support experience in a professional work environment. </li><li>Two-year degree or equivalent experience considered.</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Office required including PowerPoint and Excel. Proficiency in iManage or a comparable document management system is a plus.</li><li>Ability to clearly and effectively communicate, in oral and written form, with individuals at all levels within the Firm and outside the Firm.</li><li>Demonstrate a high level of attention to detail and pride in high quality deliverables.</li><li>Must have the ability to multi-task and prioritize in a fast-paced environment using good judgment.</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills to build successful working relationships and to work within a team environment exhibiting the ability to collaborate effectively as well as work independently </li><li>Exceptional client service, both internal and external.</li><li>Ability to perform responsibilities with tact, diplomacy, discretion and respect for confidentiality and diversity. </li><li>Ability to work additional hours, as necessary.</li></ul><li></li>

<strong>COMPANY SUMMARY</strong><p><br></p>The John Stewart Company is a full-service housing management, development and consulting organization that began in 1978 with a commitment to providing high quality service in the affordable housing sector. We work to enrich the lives of our residents and employees, while delivering our services cost‐effectively, efficiently and with the highest levels of professionalism, compassion, integrity and respect.<p><br></p><strong>SUMMARY OF THE POSITION</strong><p><br></p>Under the direction of the Property Manager, the Administrative Assistant is responsible for assisting with the overall operation of the facility. They must relate well to people, have demonstrated sensitivity to and interest in the targeted clientele and exercise good judgment when interacting with residents, clients and staff.<p><br></p><ul><li>Basic administrative duties such as filing, copying, faxing, scanning, mailings and answering the phone. </li><li>Conduct interviews for annual re-certification, complete re-certification related documents and maintain tracking log for tenants.</li><li>Receive and prepare work orders and work order history files.</li><li>Utilize Boston Post our property management software or relevant waiting list programs.</li><li>Create and update spreadsheets, fliers, reports and other documents as requested.</li><li>Manage schedules such as set up appointments and reminders.</li><li>Complete data entry and projects in a timely and accurate manner.</li><li>Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.</li><li>Ability to read, write and excellent communicate skills in English.</li><li>A minimum of 2 years of administrative assistance experience.</li><li>Professional demeanor with the ability to adapt to last-minute changes.</li><li> Highly organized with the ability to prioritize to meet deadlines.</li></ul><p><br></p>Benefits for Employees who work 30+ hours/week -<p><br></p><ul><li>Medical, dental and vision care; preventative medical care paid at 100%.</li><li>Vacation leave of up to ten days per year in the first year.</li><li>Up to 72 hours of sick time per year.</li><li>Flexible Spending Accounts for Health Care and Dependent Care.</li><li>Company paid Life AD&amp;D Long Term Disability.</li><li>Free, confidential counseling through our Employee Assistance Program.</li><li>Commuter benefit program.</li><li>Discounts for AT&amp;T and ClassPass.</li><li>$50 annual Wellness Reimbursement.</li><li>Matching 401(K) Retirement Savings Plan of up to 2% of your compensation (for any employee who works 20 hours or more per week).</li></ul><p><br></p>Benefits for Employees who work less than 30 hours/week -<p><br></p><ul><li>Free, confidential counseling through our Employee Assistance Program.</li><li>Commuter benefit program.</li><li>Discounts for AT&amp;T and ClassPass.</li><li>$50 annual Wellness Reimbursement.</li><li>Matching 401(K) Retirement Savings Plan of up to 2% of your compensation (for any employee who works 20 hours or more per week)</li><li>Up to 72 hours of sick time per year.</li></ul><p><br></p>The John Stewart Company provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws.<p><br></p>The John Stewart Company will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative.<p><br></p><strong>Effective January 1, 2020, the California Consumer Privacy Act requires businesses that meet certain minimum threshold requirements to provide a “notice at collection” to applicants for employment who reside in California. The notice at collection describes the categories of personal information to be collected about these California applicants and the purposes for using that personal information. Therefore, we have posted the Company’s “Notice At Collection For California Applicants” here. Please review this Notice at your convenience.</strong>

Make an extraordinary impact.<br><br></strong>CareMore is a proud member of the Elevance Health family of brands, offering clinical programs and primary care options for seniors. describtion: <strong><u>Company Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>The John Stewart Company is a full-service housing management, development and consulting organization that began in 1978 with a commitment to providing high quality service in the affordable housing sector. We work to enrich the lives of our residents and employees, while delivering our services cost‐effectively, efficiently and with the highest levels of professionalism, compassion, integrity and respect.<p><br></p><strong><u>Summary Of The Position</u></strong><p><br></p>Under the direction of the Property Manager, the Desk Clerk monitors traffic in and out of the building, communicates with tenants, visitors and staff. Writes end of shift reports and incident reports, writes work orders, enforces project policies in a manner consistent with fair housing regulations, and keeps the reception area neat.<p><br></p><ul><li>Answer telephones, direct calls, take messages and make emergency calls when situations arrive.</li><li>Assist with office responsibilities such as completing work orders, comment cards, visitor violation forms and other duties assigned by management.</li><li>Inform visitors of visitor policy, check visitor ID and sign visitors in and out of the building.</li><li>Complete incident reports to record unusual building activity.</li><li>Distribute resident mail on daily basis.</li><li>Fill in as requested when other desk clerks are absent.</li><li>Testing of annual tuberculosis may be required as well as following Exposure Control Protocol for blood borne pathogens.</li><li>High school graduate or GED certificate.</li><li>Experience working with people of various cultural backgrounds, especially those with special needs is a plus.</li><li>Knowledge of federal, state and local laws and Fair Housing guidelines.</li><li>Ability to read, understand and communicate fluently in English.</li><li>Good sense of awareness, urgency and follow procedures to solve problems.</li></ul><p><br></p>Benefits for Employees who work 30+ hours/week -<ul><li>Medical, dental and vision care; preventative medical care paid at 100%.</li><li>Vacation leave of up to ten days per year in the first year.</li><li>Up to 72 hours of sick time per year.</li><li>Flexible Spending Accounts for Health Care and Dependent Care.</li><li>Company paid Life AD&amp;D Long Term Disability.</li><li>Free, confidential counseling through our Employee Assistance Program.</li><li>Commuter benefit program.</li><li>Discounts for AT&amp;T and ClassPass.</li><li>$50 annual Wellness Reimbursement.</li><li>Matching 401(K) Retirement Savings Plan of up to 2% of your compensation (for any employee who works 20 hours or more per week).</li></ul><p><br></p>Benefits for Employees who work less than 30 hours/week -<p><br></p><ul><li>Free, confidential counseling through our Employee Assistance Program.</li><li>Commuter benefit program.</li><li>Discounts for AT&amp;T and ClassPass.</li><li>$50 annual Wellness Reimbursement.</li><li>Matching 401(K) Retirement Savings Plan of up to 2% of your compensation (for any employee who works 20 hours or more per week)</li><li>Up to 72 hours of sick time per year.</li></ul><p><br></p>The John Stewart Company provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws.<p><br></p>The John Stewart Company will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative.<p><br></p>Effective January 1, 2020, the California Consumer Privacy Act requires businesses that meet certain minimum threshold requirements to provide a “notice at collection” to applicants for employment who reside in California. The notice at collection describes the categories of personal information to be collected about these California applicants and the purposes for using that personal information. Therefore, we have posted the Company’s “Notice At Collection For California Applicants” here. Please review this Notice at your convenience.<p><br></p>ID: 2023-4853<p><br></p>Type: Regular Part-Time<p><br></p>External Company URL: http://jsco.net/employment-opportunities/<p><br></p>Equal Opportunity Employer: The John Stewart Company provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws.<p><br></p>The John Stewart Company will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative.

weekly paychecks </li><li> Health, dental, vision, and life insurance </li><li> 401(k) savings plan </li><li> Awards and recognition programs </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Maxim Healthcare Services</u></strong><p><br></p>Maxim Healthcare Services has been making a difference in the lives of our patients, caregivers, employees and communities for more than 30 years. Founded in 2001, WaveStrong is an industry leader in enterprise and cloud information security consulting services. We pride ourselves on our best-of-breed security solutions and services that span a myriad of government, education, and business verticals. Our staff is comprised of both certified technical and business professionals who can help you successfully navigate the complexities of planning, design, implementation, and management of securing data. Our approach is vendor agnostic giving our customers the freedom to choose the best customized security model for their business.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Manage financial records, including accounts payable/receivable, expense tracking, and financial reporting</li><li>Proficiency in using NetSuite or similar ERP software. Ability to coordinate office operations effectively</li><li>Answer phones and support associates in daily office operations</li><li>Maintenance of office supplies and monthly supply orders. </li><li>Finance experience and familiarity with financial administration. </li><li>Assist with audit invoices from contractors for accuracy and maintain tracking spreadsheet</li><li>Organize company lunches and small events. </li><li>Extensive knowledge of MS Office Suite (especially Outlook, Word, and Excel)</li><li>Must be self-sufficient, detail-oriented, proactive, organized, fast learning, and problem-solving</li><li>Must have a positive attitude and professionalism in all written and verbal contact. </li><li>Ability to multi-task and prioritize as well as picking up new programs and concepts quickly. </li><li>Nice to have Human resources management practices and procedures</li></ul>

<strong>Who is Spring Fertility?</strong><p><br></p>We're a passionate, dedicated team of leading physicians and scientists who came from some of the best research hospitals and fertility centers around the world to become the fastest growing fertility group in the country. We offer the most patient-centric, individualized, flexible and compassionate care. Our mission is to partner with our patients to help them achieve their goals, whatever those may be. We believe everyone deserves a family if they want one, and our team is dedicated to guiding our patients on their unique journeys!<p><br></p><strong>Why should you join our team?</strong><p><br></p>We are a mission-driven organization that is looking for high performers, movers, shakers and innovators! We are working hard to create a first-class fertility practice, but we know how to have fun too! We are growing quickly and care deeply about the development of our team, both professionally and personally. We value optimism, compassion and teamwork, and above all, are united by our shared commitment to put patients first.<p><br></p>Role Summary<p><br></p>The Front Desk Coordinator is essential to establishing an excellent experience for all of our incoming patients. They partner with our providers and patients in growing their families. We are looking for a dependable and motivated team player with exceptional interpersonal skills and a professional attitude to join our team. Because of the very high level of care we deliver, we are looking to hire a lively, enthusiastic person who is creative and able to provide personalized care in a fast-paced environment.<p><br></p>Some day-to-day responsibilities include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Makes an excellent first impression for all incoming patients</li><li>Checks patients in and out for appointments and manages clinic-wide schedule</li><li>Monitors and facilitates patient compliance and readiness for their initial visit</li><li>Schedules a wide array of appointments for patients and anesthesia for the surgical center</li><li>Processes patients' payments and creates receipt batch for Finance</li><li>Proactively advocates for patients</li></ul><p><br></p>Education, Licenses, Certifications<p><br></p><ul><li>Associate's or Bachelor's degree </li><li>Exceptional customer service skills </li></ul><p><br></p>Employment Type<p><br></p>This is a full-time non-exempt onsite position that requires early hours, rotational weekends and holidays.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation</strong><p><br></p>The salary range for this role is $22-$25/hr. Salary is based on several factors including job related knowledge and skill set, depth of experience, certifications and/or degrees.<p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p><strong><em>Investing in you today</em></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive Medical, Dental, and Vision Plans </li><li>Paid Time Off to enjoy "you" time! </li><li>Additional benefits - WageWorks Commuter Benefits, Pet Insurance, Discounted rates on home and auto insurance</li><li>Career development and cross-training opportunities </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Investing in your future</em></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>401k Match with up to 4% matching</li><li>Fertility Benefits Program </li><li>Paid Life and Disability Insurance </li></ul><p><br></p><em>In accordance with state law, Spring Fertility requires all on-site (or remote employees who come on-site) to be vaccinated for COVID-19. To be considered for employment opportunities at Spring Fertility, candidates must be fully vaccinated (including booster(s) if eligible) by potential start date. If not eligible to be boosted at this present time, it will be required when you meet eligibility should you be offered a position at Spring. Exceptions will be made for candidates who are not able to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons under federal, state, and local laws </em><p><br></p><em><strong>Don't have it all? We still welcome you to apply! </strong></em><p><br></p>At Spring Fertility, we believe that everyone who wants a family deserves to have one, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, or religion. Just as we acknowledge and value the diversity of goals, life experiences, and unique paths to parenthood among our patients, we also actively celebrate diversity within our organization. We are an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to a safe and inclusive work environment for all. We recognize that diversity among our team allows us to not only more effectively serve our patients, but also to advance innovation and opportunity within our field. We encourage qualified applicants of every background, ability, and life experience to apply to our employment opportunities.<p><br></p><em><strong>We are scientists. We are humanists. We are passionate about fertility. </strong></em><p><br></p>Visit our Careers Page to learn more about us! www.springfertility.com/careers<p><br></p>CCPA disclosure notice here.

<strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Under, supervision to perform specialized clerical work in independently reviewing and processing property appraisal, assessment, or exemption records and files.<p><br></p><strong>NOTE: Candidates who meet the employment standards will be invited to take an online examination. The online exam is tentatively scheduled for August 17th, </strong><strong>2023, through August 21st, 2023. The online exam will be administered </strong><strong>through a secure third party. Qualifying candidates will be notified with examination instructions via the email address attached to their application.</strong><p><br></p><strong> COVID-19 Risk Level - LOW </strong><p><br></p>Typical Tasks<p><br></p><ul><li>Checks property statements, forms, records, and other assessment materials for accuracy, completion, and conformance with established procedures; </li><li>Compiles and maintains special indexes, lists, files, and records; </li><li>Follows up to secure required or additional information; </li><li>Proofs, compares, and researches various records and documents; </li><li>Computes and extends figures; </li><li>Assembles data and prepares reports; </li><li>Logs, coordinates, and maintains deadlines for submission of appraisal-related data for computer entry; </li><li>Resolves errors resulting from incorrect data entry; </li><li>Prepares tax roll change petitions; </li><li>Verifies and makes corrections to the assessment roll (current assessor's work file). </li><li>Maintains proper flow of work assigned; </li><li>Operates a variety of office machines including computer terminals; </li><li>May meet the public and answer inquiries regarding assessment procedures, regulations and policies; </li><li>May contact businesses title companies, attorneys, or taxpayers to obtain information on ownership of assessable properties; </li><li>May offer orientation and answer procedural questions for new employees and coworkers; </li><li>Prepares and types a limited variety of correspondence; </li><li>May scan incoming documents, commits batches to the system, and verifies them for accuracy; </li><li>May accept payments from the public; </li><li>Performs related work as required.</li></ul><p><br></p>Employment Standards<p><br></p><strong><u>Education</u></strong><p><br></p>Demonstrated education, training or work experience to attain the ability to perform the above tasks and the knowledge and abilities listed below<p><br></p><strong>Experience Note:</strong> The knowledge and abilities required to perform this function are normally acquired through training and experience equivalent to two (2) years of increasingly responsible clerical work experience which included six (6) months in an assessor's office, mortgage company, title company or financial lending institution, appraisal company, surveyors, real estate mortgage brokers, real estate brokers, Internal Revenue Service, recorder's office or other related business or government agency.<p><br></p><strong><u>Knowledge Of</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Office practices and procedures including indexing, filing, and recordkeeping systems; </li><li>General assessment or appraisal practices, procedures, regulations, and terminology as related to clerical activities; </li><li>Telephone procedures and etiquette; </li><li>Customer service principles, including the handling of irate people; </li><li>Basic computer applications.</li></ul><strong>Ability to:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Apply and explain regulations, office policies and procedures to the public and to co-workers; </li><li>Rapidly and accurately perform basic arithmetical computations; </li><li>Use calculators and other office machines; </li><li>Process workload under pressure of deadlines and interruptions; </li><li>Deal tactfully with members of the public; </li><li>Establish and maintain effective work relationships with others; </li><li>In some positions, train and guide the work of other lower level clerical employees; </li><li>In some positions, read and interpret maps, titles, property descriptions and related documents; </li><li>Prepare basic forms, schedules, and correspondence; </li><li>Type and/or use a computer keyboard with moderate speed and accuracy.</li></ul><p><br></p>Benefit and Retirement information may vary from bargaining unit to bargaining unit.Due to changes in State Law, current pension provisions described in the union contracts are not automatically applied. Specific pension benefits for new hires who start on or after January 1, 2013 may be different than indicated in the union contracts.<p><br></p>Click hereto access all Memoranda of Understanding and most recent Summary of Changes.<p><br></p>Closing Date/Time: 7/21/2023 11:59 PM Pacific

companies_names: The Millennium Group, Where Service Matters
describtion: Now is a great time to join our growing company! The Millennium Group (TMG) is an award-winning business process outsourcing firm focused on print, mail, document scanning, reception, and related office support services for Fortune 500 companies, professional service firms, and institutions of higher education. TMG is looking for highly motivated, enthusiastic team players interested in a career rather than just a job. With a team of over 1,500 nationwide associates, TMG is seeking an individual who can uniquely contribute to our 30+ years of success in the industry.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Will cover positions in the mailroom or lobby or with the facilities team as needed. </li><li>Must have great customer service skills, be reliable and self-motivated. </li><li>Act as first point of contact for clients and guests. Greets customers, vendors, job applicants, associates from other locations, and other visitors with high degree of professionalism and courtesy. </li><li>Maintain safe and neat appearance of office reception area. </li><li>Take and relay messages; provide information and customer service to callers/guests. </li><li>Coordinate Video conferences, reserve visitor offices and oversee communal office meeting spaces. </li><li>Submit Facility requests for items that need to be repaired. </li><li>Receive, count and process all incoming items, letters and packages. </li><li>Deliver packages to departments and cubicles using P.D.A system to scan and sign for packages. </li><li>Prepare and package outgoing materials to prevent in-transit damage. </li><li>Prepare all appropriate shipping documentation. </li><li>Utilize postage machine to properly meter outbound mail. </li><li>Assist in maintaining office supplies inventory. </li><li>Deliver office supplies and copy paper and stock conference rooms and print copy stations. </li><li>Ability to commute to locations located in downtown San Francisco and Oakland. </li><li>Other duties as assigned. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>High School diploma or GED equivalent required. </li><li>1 to 2 years' experience in shipping &amp; receiving or mailroom preferred. </li><li>Facilities or facilities coordinator experience preferred. </li><li>Driving will be required at some of the work locations. </li><li>Must have reliable transportation to report to different work locations as needed. </li><li>Strong verbal communication and phone skills. </li><li>Consistently demonstrates professional demeanor, appearance and attitude. </li><li>Ability to appropriately handle confidential and highly sensitive material. </li><li>Proficiency in MS-Office: Word, Excel, Outlook, and Power Point.</li></ul>

The Matian Firm in San Jose is looking for a <strong>Temporary File Clerk</strong> to assist the Immigration Department on a full-time basis for a 30 day period of time from start date. As a File Clerk, you will be assigned administrative and clerical tasks such as; Shredding, filing documents, retrieving files, distributing mail, making copies, scanning documents and generating new files for new contracts. This position reports to the assigned Immigration Attorney.<p><br></p><strong>Primary Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Work in a team environment to ensure the preparation of documents. </li><li>Organizing, distributing, or tracking documents according to departmental procedures</li><li>Provide mail to departments and individuals</li><li>Ensure filing, preparation, and scanning of documents and correspondence. </li><li>Keep detailed records of all incoming documents and file accordingly</li><li>Assist with all administrative tasks. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Required Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Education: High School Diploma / GED (or higher)</li><li>1+ years of experience using Microsoft Excel, edit, sort/filter and save spreadsheets (can maintain complex spreadsheets). </li><li>1+ years of office experience</li><li>Bilingual (English/Spanish) preferred, but not required</li><li>$18-$20 Hourly</li></ul><p><br></p>The Matian Firm, APC is an equal employment opportunity employer, and we welcome everyone regardless of their race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or genetics. We're dedicated to providing an inclusive, open, and diverse work environment.

jobs_titles: Administrative Assistant - Hunters Point East West - San Francisco
describtion: <strong><u>Company Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>The John Stewart Company is a full-service housing management, development and consulting organization that began in 1978 with a commitment to providing high quality service in the affordable housing sector. We work to enrich the lives of our residents and employees, while delivering our services cost‐effectively, efficiently and with the highest levels of professionalism, compassion, integrity and respect.<p><br></p><strong><u>Summary Of The Position</u></strong><p><br></p>Under the direction of the Property Manager, the Administrative Assistant is responsible for assisting with the overall operation of the facility. They must relate well to people, have demonstrated sensitivity to and interest in the targeted clientele and exercise good judgment when interacting with residents, clients and staff.<p><br></p><ul><li>Basic administrative duties such as filing, copying, faxing, scanning, mailings and answering the phone. </li><li>Conduct interviews for annual re-certification, complete re-certification related documents and maintain tracking log for tenants.</li><li>Receive and prepare work orders and work order history files.</li><li>Utilize Boston Post our property management software or relevant waiting list programs.</li><li>Create and update spreadsheets, fliers, reports and other documents as requested.</li><li>Manage schedules such as set up appointments and reminders.</li><li>Complete data entry and projects in a timely and accurate manner.</li><li>Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.</li><li>Ability to read, write and excellent communicate skills in English.</li><li>A minimum of 2 years of administrative assistance experience.</li><li>Professional demeanor with the ability to adapt to last-minute changes.</li><li>Highly organized with the ability to prioritize to meet deadlines.</li></ul><p><br></p>Benefits for Employees who work 30+ hours/week -<ul><li>Medical, dental and vision care; preventative medical care paid at 100%.</li><li>Vacation leave of up to ten days per year in the first year.</li><li>Up to 72 hours of sick time per year.</li><li>Flexible Spending Accounts for Health Care and Dependent Care.</li><li>Company paid Life AD&amp;D Long Term Disability.</li><li>Free, confidential counseling through our Employee Assistance Program.</li><li>Commuter benefit program.</li><li>Discounts for AT&amp;T and ClassPass.</li><li>$50 annual Wellness Reimbursement.</li><li>Matching 401(K) Retirement Savings Plan of up to 2% of your compensation (for any employee who works 20 hours or more per week).</li></ul><p><br></p>Benefits for Employees who work less than 30 hours/week -<p><br></p><ul><li>Free, confidential counseling through our Employee Assistance Program.</li><li>Commuter benefit program.</li><li>Discounts for AT&amp;T and ClassPass.</li><li>$50 annual Wellness Reimbursement.</li><li>Matching 401(K) Retirement Savings Plan of up to 2% of your compensation (for any employee who works 20 hours or more per week)</li><li>Up to 72 hours of sick time per year.</li></ul><p><br></p>The John Stewart Company provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws.<p><br></p>The John Stewart Company will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative.<p><br></p>Effective January 1, 2020, the California Consumer Privacy Act requires businesses that meet certain minimum threshold requirements to provide a “notice at collection” to applicants for employment who reside in California. The notice at collection describes the categories of personal information to be collected about these California applicants and the purposes for using that personal information. Therefore, we have posted the Company’s “Notice At Collection For California Applicants” here. Please review this Notice at your convenience.<p><br></p>ID: 2023-4825<p><br></p>Type: Regular Full-Time<p><br></p>External Company URL: http://jsco.net/employment-opportunities/<p><br></p>Equal Opportunity Employer: The John Stewart Company provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws.<p><br></p>The John Stewart Company will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative.

ESFM’s clients include many household names from Life Science, Technology, Oil &amp; Gas and Manufacturing markets.<p><br></p>ESFM self-performs 80% of all IFM solutions provided to clients. Their portfolio of service categories includes Environment, Health &amp; Safety, Facilities Maintenance &amp; Engineering, Sustainability, Janitorial &amp; Industrial Cleaning, Laboratory Support and Workplace solutions. This self-performance model creates a consistent hospitality experience for clients, resulting in higher engagement and productivity from their employees.<p><br></p>In 2020, ESFM (formerly Eurest Services) won the George Graves Award for Facility Management Achievement from the International Facilities Management Association (IFMA).<p><br></p><strong>Job Summary</strong><p><br></p><strong>Summary: </strong> Performs a variety of clerical duties, including answering telephones, bookkeeping, typing, word processing, office machine operation and filing.<p><br></p><strong>Essential Duties and Responsibilities: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Trains other staff members to perform work activities, such as using computer applications. </li><li>Answers telephones, directs calls, takes messages and runs errands. </li><li>Prepares meeting agendas, attends meetings and records/transcribes minutes. </li><li>Makes travel arrangements. </li><li>Completes work schedules, manages calendars and arranges appointments. </li><li>Opens and routes incoming mail, answers correspondence and prepares outgoing mail. </li><li>Compiles, copies, sorts and files records of office activities, business transactions and other activities. </li><li>Completes and mails bills, contracts, policies, invoices and checks. </li><li>Operates office machines, such as photocopiers and scanners, facsimile machines, voice mail systems and personal computers. </li><li>Types, formats, proofreads and edits correspondence, reports and other documents. </li><li>Reviews files, records and other documents to obtain information to respond to requests.</li><li>Computes, records and proofreads data and other information. </li><li>Processes and prepares documents, such as business or government forms and expense reports. </li><li>Maintains and updates filing, inventory, mailing and database systems. </li><li>Communicates with customers, employees and others to answer questions; disseminates or explains information; takes orders and addresses complaints. </li><li>Collects, counts and disburses money; performs basic bookkeeping; completes banking transactions. </li><li>Troubleshoots problems involving office equipment. </li><li>Performs other duties as assigned. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Associates At ESFM Are Offered Many Fantastic Benefits.</strong><p><br></p>Both full-time and part-time positions offer the following benefits to associates:<p><br></p><ul><li> Retirement Plan </li><li> Associate Shopping Program </li><li> Health and Wellness Programs </li><li> Discount Marketplace </li><li> Identity Theft Protection </li><li> Pet Insurance </li><li> Voluntary Benefits, including Critical Illness Insurance, Accident Insurance, Hospital Indemnity Insurance, Legal Services, and Choice Auto and Home Program </li></ul><p><br></p>In addition, full-time positions also offer the following benefits to associates:<p><br></p><ul><li> Medical </li><li> Dental </li><li> Vision </li><li> Life Insurance/AD </li><li> Disability Insurance </li><li> Commuter Benefits </li><li> Employee Assistance Program </li><li> Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs) </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Compass Group: Achieving leadership in the foodservice industry</strong><p><br></p>Compass Group is an equal opportunity employer. At Compass, we are committed to treating all Applicants and Associates fairly based on their abilities, achievements, and experience without regard to race, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other classification protected by law.<p><br></p>Qualified candidates must be able to perform the essential functions of this position satisfactorily with or without a reasonable accommodation. Disclaimer: this job post is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all essential responsibilities, skills, tasks, or requirements associated with this position. While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the position posted, the Company reserves the right to modify or change the essential functions of the job based on business necessity. *We will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with a criminal history (including relevant driving history), in a manner consistent with all applicable federal, state, and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, and the New York Fair Chance Act. We encourage applicants with a criminal history (and driving history) to apply.<p><br></p>ESFM

We’re a fast-growing, sustainably run series B consumer fintech company and we want to find a culture + people + office ops person who can scale our unique energy across the org! If you're the go-to road trip planner, passenger seat music picker, and backseat storyteller / snackmaster all rolled into one, with a deep sense of integrity and a love for sustainable fun, we're looking for you!<p><br></p>With your culture hat, you’re going to be planning onsite and offsite events, help manage and send books and other swag out from the team library, and generally embody and scale the energy and values of the company. You'll be involved with our leadership in thinking about our values as our company and how we can communicate them across the company.<p><br></p>With your people hat, you’re going to help survey, plan, and manage our health insurance and payroll. You'll also be helping manage our Performance Management cycles. You’ll be handling the important functions traditionally called “HR” that help people feel like people.<p><br></p>Finally, with your office hat, you'll be helping us optimize and manage the office so the team can maximize our time together.<p><br></p>Your impact<p><br></p><ul><li> Fulfill traditional roles of HR and office manager</li><li> Create light and flexible processes for handling the growing needs from 50+ to 100+<br></li></ul><p><br></p>Your background<p><br></p><ul><li> Competitive academic or extracurricular achievement, e.g. a degree from a selective school or strong college athletics</li><li> Experience in planning or chairing social activities- Strong sense of optimism and understanding of human psychology and the impact drivers in a work setting</li><li> Creativity and adaptability especially as it pertains to receiving guided feedback and use of first principle solutions</li><li> Ability to listen, negotiate, and guide sensitive discussions while realizing the importance of employee happiness in business success</li><li> Enjoyment organizing and keeping events “on track”</li><li> A hunger to learn and an insatiable appetite for improvement and progressive change<br></li></ul><p><br></p>Note: You must be in the SF Bay Area comfortable being in our FiDi office on a daily basis.

describtion: We are one of the leading marketing and sales firms in the Hayward area. Our Entry Level Client Coordinators work together in a fast-paced environment to create excitement and interest in the outreach campaigns we carry out. The Full Time, Entry Level Client Coordinator will assist with the expansion of our newest client, which is one of the largest telecommunication producers in the world.<p><br></p>The Entry Level Client Coordinator will focus on community outreach, interacting directly with people, and should be adaptable as we test and compare various marketing strategies to bring our clients the best results possible. To continue expanding our clients' reach in the Hayward area, the Client Coordinator will focus on lead generation, client acquisition, sales, and customer service. Entry Level Client Coordinators receive full marketing and sales training with the opportunity to move into a management role within our team.<p><br></p><strong>Entry Level Client Coordinator Responsibilities </strong>:<p><br></p><ul><li>Comply with all client marketing and sales guidelines</li><li>Effectively communicate product knowledge to prospective customers</li><li>Engaging with consumers and effectively educating them to drive sale</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Entry Level Client Coordinator Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>1-2 years of marketing, sales, or customer service experience</li><li>Strong desire to continue learning and developing professional skill sets</li><li>Exceptional customer service and communication skills</li><li>Positive attitude and competitive spirit</li><li>Ability to stand for extended periods of time</li><li>Able to problem-solve effectively</li><li>Ability to work in a fast-paced marketing and sales environment</li><li>Comfortable speaking in front of both small and large groups</li><li>Strong desire to work in the management/ marketing or sales field</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>Ywbz0MlrR7<p><br></p>

If you have excellent communication skills, a knack for problem-solving, and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we want to hear from you!<br><br>At our company, we specialize in residential electrical services, including the installation of EV chargers, whole house batteries, and solar systems. Ensure our team of technicians is fully scheduled throughout the day, optimizing routes and eliminating any gaps in their schedules.<br><br>Provide outstanding customer service by promptly addressing scheduling queries and coordinating with our CSR Team to accommodate availability, updates, or re-tasking requests.<br><br>Assist technicians as needed, ensuring they have all the support required to deliver exceptional service.<br><br>Keep everyone in the loop! Communicate with dispatch, management, and customers regarding traffic, weather conditions, delivery status, and any concerns or issues that arise.<br><br>Maintain a clear line of communication with the Operations and Permitting team, keeping them updated on daily scheduling demands, and addressing any concerns that may impact operations.<br><br>Embrace flexibility and take on additional duties as assigned by the Operations Manager.<br><br><strong><u>Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>High School Diploma or GED required. Attention to detail is essential!<br><br>Strong organizational skills and the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment.<br><br>Remain cool under pressure, maintaining professionalism at all times.<br><br>Work well under the guidance of a supervisor, utilizing pre-set guidelines to make decisions that contribute to the efficiency and success of the company.<br><br><strong><u>Schedule And Compensation<br><br></u></strong>Prior experience in dispatching is preferred.<br><br>This is a part-time position with flexible hours. Choose any two hours between 6:00 am and 11:00 am, and any two hours between 2:00 pm and 6:00 pm, Monday to Friday.<br><br>Compensation: $15.00 - $19.00 per hour.<br><br>Join our team and be part of an exciting journey in the residential electrical services industry! describtion: <strong>Company Description</strong><p><br></p><strong>About:</strong><p><br></p><strong>THIS IS A CITYWIDE EXAM</strong><p><br></p>San Francisco is a vibrant and dynamic city, on the forefront of economic growth &amp; innovation, urban development, arts &amp; entertainment, as well as social issues &amp; change. This rich tapestry of culture and ideas is sustained by our City's commitment to heighten the quality of life for San Franciscans and residents of the greater Bay Area. Our employees play an important role not only in making our City what it is today, but also in shaping the future of San Francisco. The City &amp; County of San Francisco employs more than 28,000 individuals in various professional jobs and diverse array of services such as maintaining city streets and parks, driving buses and cable cars, providing public health services, keeping the streets safe and firefighting. If you ever wondered what it is like to work for the San Francisco Unified School District, check out our core values video https://www.youtube.com/watchv=pPAmEkJdEB4 and follow us on social media!<p><br></p>Application Opening: June 30, 2023<p><br></p>Application Deadline: July 31, 2023<p><br></p>Compensation: $50,815 - $61,503<p><br></p>Recruitment ID: X00030<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>Under supervision, performs data entry and office clerical work of average difficulty in connection with the preparation and maintenance of a wide variety of operating, financial, purchasing, accounting and similar records. Requires responsibility for: explaining existing office policies and procedures in connection with providing information to the public; making routine contacts with other departmental personnel and the general public in connection with office operations; gathering, preparing and maintaining departmental, personnel, financial and operating reports and records.<p><br></p><u><em>What you will be doing:</em></u><p><br></p><ul><li>Enters accounting and financial statements, contracts, payrolls, receipts, and similar materials into the appropriate system and submits to authorizing officials. </li><li>Monitors budget by logging purchases for contracts, purchases and other office needs in a spreadsheet or ledger. </li><li>May compose and type routine correspondence requiring knowledge of departmental operations and regulations. </li><li>Receives and communicates with the general public in connection with providing information on departmental activities and/or directs them to other personnel. </li><li>May receipt and account for moderate amounts of money. </li><li>Receives, organizes and files a wide variety of office documents. </li><li>Assembles materials and information from various sources relative to the typing of a wide variety of documents and distributes to staff and/or the general public. </li><li>Operates various office machines. </li><li>Checks and reviews a variety of documents for sufficiency and conformance to</li><li>established standards and requirements. </li><li>Submit and track work order requests for building maintenance issues. </li><li>Purchase, inventory and monitor the use of office supplies. </li><li>Performs other related duties as assigned. </li></ul> Qualifications<p><br></p><strong>How to Qualify:</strong><p><br></p>One (1) year of verifiable clerical experience. Experience must have<p><br></p>included data entry, answering telephones, and filing. Working as a sales<p><br></p>clerk or restaurant help does not qualify.<p><br></p>Substitution:<p><br></p>A recognized clerical training program of 240 hours or the equivalent of 15<p><br></p>semester units in graded clerical college units may substitute for up to 6 months<p><br></p>of experience.<p><br></p>Applicants must meet the minimum qualification requirement by the final filing date unless otherwise noted.<p><br></p>Note: One year of full-time employment is equivalent to 2000 hours. (2000 hours of qualifying work experience is based on a 40-hour work week.) Any overtime hours that you work above forty (40) hours per week are not included in the calculation to determine full-time employment.<p><br></p><strong>Verification: </strong><p><br></p>Applicants may be required to submit verification of qualifying education and experience at any point during the recruitment and selection process. If education verification is required, information on how to verify education requirements, including verifying foreign education credits or degree equivalency, can be found at https://sfdhr.org/how-verify-education-requirements<p><br></p>Note: Falsifying one’s education, training, or work experience or attempted deception on the application may result in disqualification for this and future job opportunities with the City and County of San Francisco.<p><br></p>All work experience, education, training and other information substantiating how you meet the minimum qualifications must be included on your application by the filing deadline. Information submitted after the filing deadline will not be considered in determining whether you meet the minimum qualifications. Resumes will not be accepted in lieu of a completed City and County of San Francisco application. Applications completed improperly may be cause for ineligibility, disqualification or may lead to lower scores.<p><br></p><strong>Selection Procedures:</strong><p><br></p>After application submission, candidates deemed qualified must complete all subsequent steps to advance in this selection process, which includes the following:<p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualification Supplemental Questionnaire (MQSQ)<em>:</em></strong> Candidates will be required to complete a MQSQ as part of the employment application. This MQSQ is designed to obtain specific information regarding an applicant's experience in relation to the Minimum Qualifications (MQ) for this position. The MQSQ will be used to evaluate if the applicant possesses the required minimum qualifications.<p><br></p><strong>Written Multiple-Choice Examination: (Weight: 100%)</strong><p><br></p>Candidates deemed eligible and admitted to the examination process will be administered a written multiple-choice test designed to measure knowledge, skills and/or abilities in job-related areas which may include but not limited to: .<p><br></p><ul><li>Knowledge of English spelling and grammar. </li><li>Knowledge of arithmetic (addition, subtraction, multiplication and division). </li><li>Knowledge of the use of common office machines and equipment. </li><li>Ability to use good judgment in making routine decisions in accordance with existing laws, ordinances, regulations and departmental policies and procedures. </li><li>Ability to establish and maintain satisfactory working relationships with departmental</li><li>personnel and the public. </li><li>Ability to accurately enter written information into computer software. </li><li>Ability to verify data from multiple sources in accordance with office policies and</li><li>procedures. </li><li>Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing. </li><li>Ability to compile information from various sources for publication and distribution. </li><li>Knowledge of Microsoft Office products (Word and Excel). </li><li>Knowledge of Google products (Gmail, Docs, Sheets). </li></ul><p><br></p><em>This is a standardized examination and, therefore, test questions and test answers are not available for public inspection or review. For your reference, a Multiple-Choice Test Preparation Manual is available on the </em><em>DHR Website</em><p><br></p>Additional Information<p><br></p><strong>Eligible List/Score Report: </strong>A confidential eligible list of applicant names that have passed the civil service examination process will be created, and used for certification purposes only. An examination score report will be established, so applicants can view the ranks, final scores and number of eligible candidates. Applicant information, including names of applicants on the eligible list, shall not be made public unless required by law. However, an eligible list shall be made available for public inspection, upon request, once the eligible list is exhausted or expired and referrals resolved. The eligible list/score report resulting from this civil service examination process is subject to change after adoption (e.g., as a result of appeals), as directed by the Human Resources Director or the Civil Service Commission.<p><br></p>The duration of the eligible list resulting from this examination process will be of 18 months, and may be extended with the approval of the Human Resources Director.<p><br></p>To find Departments which use this classification, please see<p><br></p><u>https://sfdhr.org/sites/default/files/documents/Forms-Documents/Position-Counts-by-Job-Codes-and-Department-FY-2021-22.pdf</u>.<p><br></p><strong>Terms of Announcement and Appeal Rights: </strong><p><br></p>Applicants must be guided solely by the provisions of this announcement, including requirements, time periods and other particulars, except when superseded by federal, state or local laws, rules or regulations. [Note: The correction of clerical errors in an announcement may be posted on the Department of Human Resources website at <u>https://careers.smartrecruiters.com/CityAndCountyOfSanFrancisco1/</u>. The terms of this announcement may be appealed under Civil Service Rule 110.4. Such appeals must be submitted in writing to the Department of Human Resources, 1 S Van Ness Avenue, 4th Floor, San Francisco, CA 94103-5413 by close of business on the 5th business day following the issuance date of this examination announcement. Information concerning other Civil Service Commission Rules involving announcements, applications and examination policies, including applicant appeal rights, can be found on the Civil Service Commission website at <u>http://sfgov.org/civilservice/rules</u>.<p><br></p><strong>Background:</strong><p><br></p>As a finalist for a job, you will be fingerprinted, and your fingerprints will be sent to the California Department of Justice (DOJ) and the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI). The resulting report of your conviction history (if any) will be used to determine whether the nature of your conviction (or arrest, in limited circumstances) conflicts with the specific duties and responsibilities of the job for which you are a finalist. If a conflict exists, you will be asked to present any evidence of rehabilitation that may mitigate the conflict, except when federal or state regulations bar employment in specific circumstances, such as:<p><br></p><ul><li>Candidates for positions with the Unified School District and the Community College</li><li>District may be disqualified from consideration should their conviction history not meet the standards established under the California Education Code. </li><li>Candidates for positions with the Recreation and Park Department may be disqualified from consideration should their conviction history not meet the standards established under California Public Resources Code 5164. </li><li>General Information:</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Additional Information Regarding Employment with the City and County of San Francisco:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Information About the Hiring Process </li><li>Conviction History </li><li>Employee Benefits Overview </li><li>Equal Employment Opportunity </li><li>Disaster Service Worker </li><li>ADA Accommodation </li><li>Veterans Preference </li><li>Seniority Credit in Promotional Exams [required for Combined, Promotive, Entrance (CPE) Exams only] </li><li>Right to Work </li><li>Copies of Application Documents </li><li>Diversity Statement </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>How To Apply</strong><p><br></p>Applications for City and County of San Francisco jobs are <strong>only </strong>accepted through an online process. Visit <u>https://careers.smartrecruiters.com/CityAndCountyOfSanFrancisco1/</u> and begin the application process.<p><br></p><ul><li>Select the “I’m Interested” button and follow instructions on the screen </li></ul><p><br></p>Applicants may be contacted by email about this recruitment and, therefore, it is their responsibility to ensure that their registered email address is accurate and kept up-to-date. Also, applicants must ensure that email from CCSF is not blocked on their computer by a spam filter. To prevent blocking, applicants should set up their email to accept CCSF mail from the following addresses (@usd.edu, @sfgov.org, @sfdpw.org, @sfport.com, @flysfo.com, @sfwater.org, @sfdph.org, @asianart.org, @sfmta.com, @sfpl.org, @dcyf.org, @first5sf.org, @famsf.org, @smartalerts.info, and @smartrecruiters.com).<p><br></p>Applicants will receive a confirmation email that their online application has been received in response to every announcement for which they file. Applicants should retain this confirmation email for their records. <strong>Failure to receive this email means that the online application was not submitted or received. </strong><p><br></p><strong>Exam Analyst Information: </strong>If you have any questions regarding this recruitment or application process, please contact the exam analyst at Kenneth Watts at wattsk@sfusd.edu.<p><br></p>The City and County of San Francisco encourages women, minorities and persons with disabilities to apply. Applicants will be considered regardless of their sex, race, age, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition (associated with cancer, a history of cancer, or genetic characteristics), HIV/AIDS status, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, military and veteran status, or other protected category under the law.

<strong><u>Essential Functions</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Assist the Executive Assistant in preparing expense reports for Senior Executives Travel Expense Reports on a daily/weekly basis.</li><li>Receive, sort and organize incoming mail packages and direct them to appropriate staff.</li><li>Manage the FedEx outgoing shipments for the office through our online shipping label system.</li><li>Process travel for approved personnel on a nationwide level including; booking travel, maintaining accurate records, providing credit card authorization forms to companies we do business with etc.</li><li>Coordinate the ordering of office supplies and materials creating purchase orders in Oracle.</li><li>Maintain office cleanliness and audit kitchen, copy room and office supplies on a monthly basis and re-order as needed.</li><li>Other office coordination tasks as assigned.</li></ul><p><br></p><em>Autonomy</em> – You will be responsible for managing your daily and weekly tasks with autonomy and timely and effective communication to the Executive Assistant and other managers.<p><br></p><em>Relationships</em> – You will be managed by the Executive Assistant and will be supporting the Executive Assistant and other department managers.<p><br></p><em>Working Patterns</em> – You will be working in a front office capacity with light public interaction.<p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>A combination of experience and education that provides you the knowledge and ability to perform the essential functions listed above.</li><li>Knowledge and experience in Word and creating spreadsheets in Excel.</li><li>Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively and timely report on your daily work load and status of projects.</li><li>Familiarity with creating mailing labels</li><li>Familiarity with reconciling receipts for business travel</li><li>Proficient in MS Office including; Outlook, Word and Excel</li><li>Outstanding organizational skills</li><li>Ability to take initiative to complete work with great attention to detail</li><li>Familiarity with Oracle is a plus</li><li>Able to work during regular business hours with occasional overtime</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Physical Activities Required To Perform Essential Functions</u></strong><p><br></p>Ability to stand, walk and sit up for long periods of time.
