Definition<p><br></p>**THIS RECRUITMENT IS OPEN UNTIL FILLED, AND MAY CLOSE AT ANY TIME. APPLICATIONS ARE SCREENED ON A REGULAR BASIS **<p><br></p>The Recreation Administrative Assistant classification is responsible for providing outstanding customer service at the Recreation facilities while performing basic clerical tasks and light maintenance to ensure facilities are safe, presentable, and welcoming. Assignments are generally limited and routine in scope and are performed within a procedural framework established by higher-level employees. Although Recreation Administrative Assistants are trained to work interchangeably at the Milpitas Community Center, Milpitas Sports Center, and Barbara Lee Senior Center, most are assigned a regular weekly schedule at one of the three facilities and have the option to pick up additional shifts at any facility.<p><br></p><strong>DISTINGUISHING CHARACTERISTICS</strong><p><br></p>This is a temporary, unbenefited position and is considered extra help.<p><br></p>Examples of Duties<p><br></p>Duties may include, but are not limited to the following:<p><br></p><ul><li>Greet members of the public, visitors, delivery personnel, and employees arriving at the facility. Provide directions and assist with check-in as needed. </li><li>Respond to in-person, phone, and e-mail inquiries, handling routine requests promptly and professionally, routing complex inquiries to the appropriate staff member, taking messages, and following up on inquiries as needed. </li><li>Process registration, rental, and membership transactions in the ActiveNet system and perform cashier duties </li><li>Maintain the office and lobby areas, including bulletin boards, literature racks, and lobby decor. Data entry, generating reports, filing, and retrieving files. </li><li>Receive and distribute supply orders and maintain inventory records. </li><li>Open and close building in accordance with established procedures.</li></ul><strong>QUALIFICATIONS</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Knowledge Of</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Basic office functions </li><li>Customer service techniques</li><li>Appropriate use of office equipment</li><li>Basic record-keeping</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Ability To</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Maintain a professional front desk environment by providing friendly, professional, efficient customer service to diverse external and internal clients. </li><li>Understand and enforce facility rules, policies, and procedures, demonstrate leadership, public relations, and good decision-making skills</li><li>Understand, accurately explain, and enthusiastically promote in conversation the programs, services, rentals, and special events offered departmentwide.</li><li>Maintain attention to detail when processing transactions and paperwork.</li><li>Perform various cleaning and maintenance duties as directed to maintain a clean and safe facility, including front desk and lobby environment.</li><li>Promptly reporting safety concerns and emergencies and mitigating hazards.</li><li>Ability to work independently, as this employee may be the only staff in the building during certain early or late shifts.</li><li>Prepare and maintain reports</li><li>Represent the City of Milpitas Recreation and Community Services in a professional manner Follow the City’s and Recreation and Community Services’ policies and regulations.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Education And Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum age at the time of hire is 18 years old. </li><li>No experience is required. Some office and/or customer service experience is preferred. Strong communication skills in English, both written and spoken. Bilingual communication skills in Spanish, Vietnamese or Chinese are a plus.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Typical Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:</strong><p><br></p>Essential duties require the following physical abilities and work environment. Essential duties require prolonged sitting, computer use, and telephone use in an office environment and be able to reach, squat, lift, and carry up to 25 pounds. Work is typically accomplished in an indoor environment with heavy public contact.<p><br></p><strong>SUPERVISION RECEIVED AND EXERCISED</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Supervision is received from a Recreation Services Supervisor, or higher, job classification. </li><li>No supervision is exercised over others.</li></ul><p><br></p>The City of Milpitas is an Equal Opportunity/ADA employer. Reasonable accommodation in the application, examination, and selection process will be made upon request to Human Resources at (408) 586-3090.<p><br></p>The information contained in this announcement does not constitute either an expressed or implied contract and these provisions are subject to change.<p><br></p>City of Milpitas Temporary/ Seasonal Employee* Benefits at a Glance<p><br></p><strong><u>Retirement Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>Federal law requires that employees who are not members of the City retirement plan (CalPERS) be covered under an alternate retirement plan (PARS).<p><br></p>6% of your salary will be deducted for participation in the PARS plan. The City will also contribute 1.5% of your earnings to your PARS account every pay period.<p><br></p><strong>Paid Time Off</strong><p><br></p>In accordance with State Law, after 90 days, Temporary/Seasonal employees receive 24 hours to use for sick leave.<p><br></p><strong>Work and Life</strong><p><br></p>Temporary/Seasonal employees are eligible for membership at the Milpitas Sports Center.<p><br></p>Temporary/Seasonal employees are eligible for membership in Commonwealth Credit Union, which offers a broad range of financial and investment services.<p><br></p>Temporary/Seasonal employees may qualify for Transportation Reduction Incentive Program (TRIP) cash incentive or transit subsidies based on their commute method.<p><br></p><strong>Health Insurance</strong> (Not available to most Temporary/Seasonal Employees)<p><br></p>Temporary employees in a non-clerical position hired in the Planning, Engineering and Building Divisions may qualify for participation in CalPERS health, Delta Dental and Vision. (per Res. 7062) o Multiple plans available through CalPERS Health; plans with Kaiser rate or lower are paid by the City.<p><br></p>Delta Dental: City paid<p><br></p>Vision: City paid<p><br></p><ul><li>Temporary/Seasonal employees are limited to work no more than 1000 hours per Fiscal Year.</li></ul><p><br></p>Closing Date/Time: Continuous

We are looking for an enthusiastic Front Office Coordinator to join our team. If you love creating spaces where your colleagues can focus, collaborate and do their best work, you might be a great fit for this role!<p><br></p><strong>About Anthropic</strong><p><br></p>Anthropic is an AI safety and research company that’s working to build reliable, interpretable, and steerable AI systems. We want AI to be safe and beneficial for our customers and for society as a whole. Our interdisciplinary team has experience across ML, physics, policy, business and product.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Greeting and managing our visitors and contractors. You’ll be the first impression for our guests and work with security to help track and greet visitors, and make them feel welcome. You’ll also be escorting and directing vendor contractors who are here to do one-off and recurring tasks to ensure compliance with our policies</li><li>Delivery and mail management, including Amazon deliveries, larger office deliveries, staff and priority mail, shipping requests, and tracking delivery requests and returns</li><li>Calendar management. Making sure to notify when there are service needs or planned visiting personnel that overlap with office holidays or highly-sensitive events</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>You might be a good fit if you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Enjoy making people feel welcome and hosting visitors</li><li>Have a service and solution-based mindset/internal customer orientation, and are excited to take on essential but behind-the-scenes tasks so others can do impactful work</li><li>Enjoy rolling up your sleeves and handling day-to-day tasks as they arise – no task is too big or too small</li><li>Desire to learn more about the ways our team contributes to the overall mission at the company</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Strong candidates may also:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Have 1-2 years of experience as an office assistant, coordinator, or similar</li><li>Have previous experience working with vendors or security systems</li><li>Have previous hospitality experience</li><li>Exhibit an interest in or passion for AI</li><li>Speak more than one language</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Candidates need not have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Previous experience working with AI directly </li><li>Proficiency in computer science </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Annual Salary (USD)</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>The expected salary range for this position is $115k-$160k. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Logistics</strong><p><br></p><strong>Location-based hybrid policy: </strong>Currently, we expect this role to be in our office 4-5 days per week.<p><br></p><strong>Deadline to apply</strong>: None. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.<p><br></p><strong>US visa sponsorship: </strong>We do sponsor visas! However, we aren't able to successfully sponsor visas for every role and every candidate; operations roles are especially difficult to support. But if we make you an offer, we will make every effort to get you into the United States, and we retain an immigration lawyer to help with this.<p><br></p><strong>We encourage you to apply even if you do not believe you meet every single qualification.</strong> Not all strong candidates will meet every single qualification as listed. Research shows that people who identify as being from underrepresented groups are more prone to experiencing imposter syndrome and doubting the strength of their candidacy, so we urge you not to exclude yourself prematurely and to submit an application if you're interested in this work. We think AI systems like the ones we're building have enormous social and ethical implications. We think this makes representation even more important, and we strive to include a range of diverse perspectives on our team.<p><br></p><strong> Compensation and Benefits </strong> *<p><br></p>Anthropic’s compensation package consists of three elements: salary, equity, and benefits. We are committed to pay fairness and aim for these three elements collectively to be highly competitive with market rates.<p><br></p><strong>Equity</strong> - On top of this position's salary (listed above), equity will be a major component of the total compensation. We aim to offer higher-than-average equity compensation for a company of our size, and communicate equity amounts at the time of offer issuance.<p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong> - Benefits we offer include:<p><br></p><ul><li> Optional equity donation matching at a 3:1 ratio, up to 50% of your equity grant. </li><li> Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance for you and all your dependents. </li><li> 401(k) plan with 4% matching. </li><li> 21 weeks of paid parental leave. </li><li> Unlimited PTO – most staff take between 4-6 weeks each year, sometimes more!</li><li> Stipends for education, home office improvements, commuting, and wellness. </li><li> Fertility benefits via Carrot. </li><li> Daily lunches and snacks in our office. </li><li> Relocation support for those moving to the Bay Area. </li><li> This compensation and benefits information is based on Anthropic’s good faith estimate for this position, in San Francisco, CA, as of the date of publication and may be modified in the future. The level of pay within the range will depend on a variety of job-related factors, including where you place on our internal performance ladders, which is based on factors including past work experience, relevant education, and performance on our interviews or in a work trial. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>How We're Different</strong><p><br></p>We believe that the highest-impact AI research will be big science. At Anthropic we work as a single cohesive team on just a few large-scale research efforts. And we value impact — advancing our long-term goals of steerable, trustworthy AI — rather than work on smaller and more specific puzzles. We view AI research as an empirical science, which has as much in common with physics and biology as with traditional efforts in computer science. We're an extremely collaborative group, and we host frequent research discussions to ensure that we are pursuing the highest-impact work at any given time. As such, we greatly value communication skills. We're trying to build a core of knowledge and intuition about the most robustly effective innovations in AI, and so thoroughly-documented null results are almost as valuable as positive discoveries. We do not have boundaries between engineering and research, and we expect all of our technical staff to contribute to both as needed.<p><br></p>The easiest way to understand our research directions is to read our recent research . This research continues many of the directions our team worked on prior to Anthropic, including: GPT-3 , Circuit-Based Interpretability , Multimodal Neurons , Scaling Laws , AI &amp; Compute , Concrete Problems in AI Safety , and Learning from Human Preferences .<p><br></p><strong> Come work with us! </strong><p><br></p>Anthropic is a public benefit corporation based in San Francisco. We offer competitive compensation and benefits, optional equity donation matching, generous vacation and parental leave, flexible working hours, and a lovely office space in which to collaborate with colleagues.

<strong>Who is Spring Fertility?</strong><p><br></p>We're a passionate, dedicated team of leading physicians and scientists who came from some of the best research hospitals and fertility centers around the world to become the fastest growing fertility group in the country. We offer the most patient-centric, individualized, flexible and compassionate care. Our mission is to partner with our patients to help them achieve their goals, whatever those may be. We believe everyone deserves a family if they want one, and our team is dedicated to guiding our patients on their unique journeys!<p><br></p><strong>Why should you join our team?</strong><p><br></p>We are a mission-driven organization that is looking for high performers, movers, shakers and innovators! We are working hard to create a first-class fertility practice, but we know how to have fun too! We are growing quickly and care deeply about the development of our team, both professionally and personally. We value optimism, compassion and teamwork, and above all, are united by our shared commitment to put patients first.<p><br></p>Role Summary<p><br></p>The Front Desk Coordinator is essential to establishing an excellent experience for all of our incoming patients. They partner with our providers and patients in growing their families. We are looking for a dependable and motivated team player with exceptional interpersonal skills and a professional attitude to join our team. Because of the very high level of care we deliver, we are looking to hire a lively, enthusiastic person who is creative and able to provide personalized care in a fast-paced environment.<p><br></p>Some day-to-day responsibilities include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Makes an excellent first impression for all incoming patients</li><li>Checks patients in and out for appointments and manages clinic-wide schedule</li><li>Monitors and facilitates patient compliance and readiness for their initial visit</li><li>Schedules a wide array of appointments for patients and anesthesia for the surgical center</li><li>Processes patients' payments and creates receipt batch for Finance</li><li>Proactively advocates for patients</li></ul><p><br></p>Education, Licenses, Certifications<p><br></p><ul><li>Associate's or Bachelor's degree </li><li>Exceptional customer service skills </li></ul><p><br></p>Employment Type<p><br></p>This is a full-time non-exempt onsite position that requires early hours, rotational weekends and holidays.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation</strong><p><br></p>The salary range for this role is $22-$25/hr. Salary is based on several factors including job related knowledge and skill set, depth of experience, certifications and/or degrees.<p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p><strong><em>Investing in you today</em></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive Medical, Dental, and Vision Plans </li><li>Paid Time Off to enjoy "you" time! </li><li>Additional benefits - WageWorks Commuter Benefits, Pet Insurance, Discounted rates on home and auto insurance</li><li>Career development and cross-training opportunities </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Investing in your future</em></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>401k Match with up to 4% matching</li><li>Fertility Benefits Program </li><li>Paid Life and Disability Insurance </li></ul><p><br></p><em>In accordance with state law, Spring Fertility requires all on-site (or remote employees who come on-site) to be vaccinated for COVID-19. To be considered for employment opportunities at Spring Fertility, candidates must be fully vaccinated (including booster(s) if eligible) by potential start date. If not eligible to be boosted at this present time, it will be required when you meet eligibility should you be offered a position at Spring. Exceptions will be made for candidates who are not able to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons under federal, state, and local laws </em><p><br></p><em><strong>Don't have it all? We still welcome you to apply! </strong></em><p><br></p>At Spring Fertility, we believe that everyone who wants a family deserves to have one, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, or religion. Just as we acknowledge and value the diversity of goals, life experiences, and unique paths to parenthood among our patients, we also actively celebrate diversity within our organization. We are an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to a safe and inclusive work environment for all. We recognize that diversity among our team allows us to not only more effectively serve our patients, but also to advance innovation and opportunity within our field. We encourage qualified applicants of every background, ability, and life experience to apply to our employment opportunities.<p><br></p><em><strong>We are scientists. We are humanists. We are passionate about fertility. </strong></em><p><br></p>Visit our Careers Page to learn more about us! www.springfertility.com/careers<p><br></p>CCPA disclosure notice here.

<strong>Position Description: </strong>Cashier<p><br></p><strong>Reports to: </strong>Service Manager/Controller<p><br></p><strong>Position Information: </strong>The Cashier is responsible for the receipt of payment from customers and employees in payment for goods or services, and accurately records the amounts received. Must present a professional, friendly image. Perform general clerical duties. Must present a professional appearance.<p><br></p><strong>Position Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Receive cash, checks and credit card payments from customers and record amount received.</li><li>Flag and close repair orders.</li><li>Make change and issue receipts to customers.</li><li>Responsible for daily cash reconciliation.</li><li>Refer customers who have additional questions to the service consultant or other appropriate individual.</li><li>Handle customer complaints with integrity and poise and escort or refer the customer to the appropriate individual for further communication.</li><li>Perform general clerical duties.</li><li>Attend training classes as directed by supervisor.</li><li>Follow policies and procedures as set forth in Employee Handbook.</li><li>Any other duties as assigned.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:</strong><p><br></p>Educational: High school diploma or the equivalent preferred.<p><br></p>Experience: Knowledge of CDK, preferred.<p><br></p>Special Skills (i.e., licenses, certifications, etc.): Excellent oral communication skills. Ability to read and comprehend instructions and information. Ability to work well with customers. General math skills. Ability to use personal computer applications including word processing and spreadsheet applications.<p><br></p><strong>Physical Demands and Working Conditions:</strong><p><br></p>Frequently works on a computer or doing other “close vision” work. Finger and hand dexterity required to operate a cash register and handle cash. Occasionally requires the ability to lift 20 pounds of material.<p><br></p><em>THE ABOVE DECLARATIONS ARE NOT INTENDED TO BE AN “ALL-INCLUSIVE” LIST OF THE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE JOB DESCRIBED OR OF THE SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED TO PERFORM THE JOB. RATHER, THEY ARE INTENDED ONLY TO DESCRIBE THE GENERAL REQUIREMENTS OF THE JOB.</em><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>cBjuBSzqzs

Help Help <strong>Requirements</strong> <strong> Conditions of Employment</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You must be a U.S. citizen.</li><li>Selective Service - Males born after 12/31/59 must be registered or exempt from Selective Service see http://www.sss.gov/ </li><li>All Federal employees are required to participate in Direct Deposit/Electronic Funds Transfer for salary payments.</li><li>DHS uses e-Verify, an Internet-based system, to confirm the eligibility of all newly hired employees to work in the United States. Learn more about E-Verify , including your rights and responsibilities.</li><li>This position has been identified as a drug testing designated position (TDP) for purposes of the CISA's Drug-Free Workplace Program. All applicants tentatively selected for this position will be required to submit to a drug test to screen for illicit/illegal drug use prior to receiving a final offer of employment. A final offer of employment is contingent upon a negative drug test result. After appointment, you may be subject to periodic random drug testing.</li><li>You must be able to obtain and maintain a security clearance suitable for Federal employment as determined by a background investigation. This may include a credit check, a review of financial issues, as well as certain criminal offenses and illegal use or possession of drugs.</li><li>One-year probationary period may be required.</li><li>This position may be designated as essential personnel. Essential personnel must be able to serve during continuity of operation events without regard to declarations of liberal leave or government closures due to weather, protests, and acts of terrorism or lack of funding. Failure to report for or remain in this position may result in disciplinary or adverse action in accordance with applicable laws, rules, and regulations (5 U.S.C. 7501-7533 and 5 CFR Part 752, as applicable).</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>To be considered minimally qualified for this position, you must demonstrate that you have the required experience for the respective grade level in which you are applying.</strong><p><br></p><u><strong>You qualify for the GS-13 grade level, if you have:</strong></u><p><br></p><strong>EXPERIENCE: </strong>At least one (1) year of specialized experience at the GS-12 grade level (or equivalent) performing the following duties:<p><br></p><ul><li>Managing multiple office administrative systems and tasks including travel, overseeing the Executive Secretariat process, shipping and receiving, Web Time and Attendance, Human Capital, Performance and Learning Management System, fleet vehicle management, and liaison to property/facility management;</li><li>Providing analysis and advice to senior management on the evaluation of government programs and operations; AND</li><li>Interpreting administrative laws, policies, regulations, and precedents applicable to the region.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>National Service Experience</strong> (i.e., volunteer experience): Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.<p><br></p><strong>All qualification requirements must be met by the closing date of this announcement.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Education</strong><p><br></p>Some federal jobs allow you to substitute your education for the required experience in order to qualify. For this job, you must meet the qualification requirement using experience alone--no substitution of education for experience is permitted.<p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Information</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Permanent Change of Duty Station (PCS) Expenses will not be paid.</li><li>Other incentives may be authorized.</li><li>If you receive a conditional offer of employment for this position, you will be required to complete an Optional Form 306, Declaration for Federal Employment , and to sign and certify the accuracy of all information in your application, prior to entry on duty. False statements on any part of the application may result in withdrawal of offer of employment, dismissal after beginning work, fine, or imprisonment.</li><li>This position has been designated excluded from bargaining unit representation under the national security provision of 5 U.S.C. 7112(B)(6).</li><li>Under provisions of the Civil Service Reform Act, first time supervisors and/or managers will be required to serve a one-year probationary period. You may also be required to complete an appropriate supervisory training course within one year of assignment to this position.</li></ul> <strong>Reasonable Accommodation Requests: </strong>This agency provides reasonable accommodation to applicants with a disability covered under the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process, contact the CISA Office of Equity, Diversity, Inclusion and Accessibility (OEDIA) by sending an email to CISAOEDIAFO@cisa.dhs.gov and accommodations@hq.dhs.gov with the subject line, "Reasonable Accommodation Request @CISA." In the email itself, you <strong>must </strong>include your name, vacancy announcement number(s), and state your intent to seek a reasonable accommodation. Decisions on requests for Reasonable Accommodations are made on a case-by-case basis. For more information, please go to the Reasonable Accommodations at DHS website.<p><br></p><strong>Current or Former Political Appointees</strong>: The Office of Personnel Management (OPM) must authorize employment offers made to current or former political appointees. If you are currently, or have been within the last 5 years, a political Schedule A, Schedule C, Non-career SES or Presidential Appointee employee in the Executive Branch, you must disclose this information to the Human Resources Office.<p><br></p><strong>Shared Certificate: </strong>When CISA completes their selections, the remaining list of qualified candidates may be shared with other DHS Component agencies who are hiring for similar positions. You will have an opportunity to opt-in if you would like your name, application materials, and assessment results shared to be considered for employment with other DHS Component agencies. There is no guarantee of further consideration, and you can continue to explore other job opportunity announcements.<p><br></p>Read more<p><br></p><ul><li> Help Help A career with the U.S. government provides employees with a comprehensive benefits package. As a federal employee, you and your family will have access to a range of benefits that are designed to make your federal career very rewarding. Opens in a new window Learn more about federal benefits .</li></ul><p><br></p>Review our benefits<p><br></p>Eligibility for benefits depends on the type of position you hold and whether your position is full-time, part-time or intermittent. Contact the hiring agency for more information on the specific benefits offered.

<p><strong>Ultimate Staffing is looking for an Office Lead to join an innovative, tech company in Santa Clara, CA!</strong></p><p><strong><span class="ql-cursor"> </span></strong></p><ul><li><strong><u>100% ON-SITE</u></strong></li><li><strong>Monday-Friday 8am-5pm</strong></li><li><strong>Contract-to-Hire</strong></li><li><strong>$28-35 depending on experience</strong></li><li><strong>Start ASAP</strong></li></ul><p><br></p><p>The Office Lead is the face of the company. While managing the front desk duties, they are to greet clients and employees. Must be willing to take on additional tasks as needed. Ultimately, our Office Lead should be able to ensure the smooth running of the office and lead the company’s direction regarding HR, Finance and operational systems and procedures.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Responsibilities Include</strong></p><p>• Open and close the office during operating hours</p><p>• Greeting clients and employees</p><p>• Distribute mail and handle shipping/deliveries</p><p>• Maintain snack program including ordering and cycling of products </p><p>• Catering / Lunch program administration</p><p>• Order extra lunches for guests and employees</p><p>• Manage conference room setups</p><p>• Order and maintain office supplies</p><p>• Manage business card orders</p><p>• Concur administration of new hires / terms</p><p>• Badge creation and distribution</p><p>• Assist with event intake and scope creation for WPS</p><p>• Assist with internal communications with office updates</p><p>• Coordinate the SF / SC shuttle and any special shuttles</p><p>• Develop and manage the needs of the offices, forming a strong relationship with IT and HR</p>

<strong>Job Description And Duties</strong><p><br></p>Looking for an office support position in state government working with nice people? Join the Department of Industrial Relations, Office of the Director Legal Unit, and be part of a great team in a busy government legal office.<p><br></p>We are looking for an Office Technician (Typing), which is a clerical and office support position, working under the general supervision of our Legal Support Supervisor I, in the Office of the Director Legal Unit, located in Oakland, California. The OT handles a variety of clerical, office support, administrative and organizational responsibilities, including staffing our front reception desk and main phone line. The OT also processes a substantial volume of incoming and outgoing mail; receives deliveries and processes shipments; assists the legal secretaries with paper filing; drafts and types correspondence; calendars hearings and other matters; accesses case information in the workers' compensation Electronic Adjudication Management System (EAMS) for case-related information in order to support attorneys and their secretaries; and provides other general support to the legal secretaries, special investigators and attorneys.<p><br></p>The OT also orders (through Fi$Cal), organizes, and maintains routine office supplies for OD Legal, including by monitoring supply levels and determining when products may need to be ordered; maintains toner and paper supplies for printers, copiers, and postage machines and assists with maintenance requests; assists in the organization, maintenance and clearing of filing and storage areas, including by taking inventory, organizing files, and assisting in the archiving, storage, removal and destruction of records and other materials; and organizes, maintains and updates a variety of law library materials. As directed by the Legal Support Supervisor, the OT also assists with office set-up needs, including clearing, organizing and setting up offices and cubicles for incoming attorneys, investigators, legal secretaries and other staff.<p><br></p>Please see the Duty Statement for a full description of the duties of this position.<p><br></p>This posting may be used to fill future vacancies in accordance with 2 CCR<p><br></p><ul><li>249.3</li></ul><p><br></p>You will find additional information about the job in the <strong> Duty Statement </strong>.<p><br></p><strong>Working Conditions</strong><p><br></p>This position is located in the Elihu Harris State Building, at 1515 Clay Street, Suite 701, Oakland, California.<p><br></p>This is a full-time position located in the Department of Industrial Relations, Office of the Director Legal Unit ("OD Legal"), 1515 Clay Street, Suite 701, Oakland, California, 94612. The building is 22 stories tall and houses offices for several State of California agencies. OD Legal is located on the 7th Floor. Use of the elevators is mandatory, as access to the stairs is locked for security reasons. There is security screening; employees are issued badges. Employees in this position work in cubicles, at desks, and are required to work extensively on computers. This is a full-time, Monday through Friday, position. There is some flexibility as to the specific work schedule, which will be determined after hire in consultation with the supervisor. This is a full-time in-office position with duties that cannot be performed through telework.<p><br></p><strong>Position Details</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Code #:</strong><p><br></p>JC-377218<p><br></p><strong>Position #(s):</strong><p><br></p>400-112-1139-061<p><br></p><strong>Working Title:</strong><p><br></p><strong> OT </strong><p><br></p><strong>Classification:</strong><p><br></p>OFFICE TECHNICIAN (TYPING)<p><br></p>$3,369.00 - $4,217.00 A<p><br></p><strong># of Positions:</strong><p><br></p>1<p><br></p><strong>Work Location:</strong><p><br></p>Alameda County<p><br></p><strong>Job Type:</strong><p><br></p>Permanent, Full Time<p><br></p><strong>Department Information</strong><p><br></p>The Department of Industrial Relations (DIR) was established in 1927. Its mission is to improve working conditions for California's wage earners and to advance opportunities for profitable employment in California. DIR administers and enforces laws governing wages, workplace safety and health, apprenticeship training programs, and medical care and other benefits for injured workers.<p><br></p>Electronic Submission of Applications preferred. Application Packages maybe submitted electronically through your CalCareer Account at https://jobs.ca.gov/ Applications must be received electronically by 11:59 p.m. on or before the above final filing date.<p><br></p>Please only submit ONE application. Electronic applications submitted through your CalCareer Account are highly recommended and will be received/processed faster than other methods of filing.<p><br></p>If you are unable to apply electronically through your CalCareer account, please mail a completed and signed State Examination/Employment Application STD Form 678 and application package to the mailing address provided in the “Application Instructions” section below and ensure the following:<p><br></p>Clearly indicate the Job Code #, Position Number and the Title of this position in the “Examination or Job Title(s) For Which You Are Applying” section located on the first page of your State Examination/Employment Application STD Form 678.<p><br></p><ul><li>Clearly indicate the basis of your eligibility (cert, transfer, reinstatement, etc.) in the “Explanations” section located on the first page of your State Examination/Employment Application STD Form 678. </li><li>Remove and do not submit the “Equal Employment Opportunity” questionnaire (page 5) with your completed State Examination/Employment Application STD Form 678. This page is for examination use only. </li><li>Do not include your full Social Security Number on your documents and/or do not provide any LEAP information.</li></ul><p><br></p>Department Website: https://www.dir.ca.gov/<p><br></p><strong>Special Requirements</strong><p><br></p>This position requires the incumbent to perform sustained typing of at least 40 words per minute. Typing Certificate – 40 WPM typing certificate issued within the last four (4) years and certified from a five (5) minute typing test.<p><br></p><strong>Application Instructions</strong><p><br></p>Completed applications and all required documents must be received or postmarked by the Final Filing Date in order to be considered. Dates printed on Mobile Bar Codes, such as the Quick Response (QR) Codes available at the USPS, are not considered Postmark dates for the purpose of determining timely filing of an application.<p><br></p>Final Filing Date: 7/26/2023<p><br></p>Who May Apply<p><br></p>Individuals who are currently in the classification, eligible for lateral transfer, eligible for reinstatement, have list eligibility, are in the process of obtaining list eligibility, or have SROA and/or Surplus eligibility (please attach your letter, if available). SROA and Surplus candidates are given priority; therefore, individuals with other eligibility may be considered in the event no SROA or Surplus candidates apply. Individuals who are eligible for a Training and Development assignment may also be considered for this position(s).<p><br></p>Applications will be screened and only the most qualified applicants will be selected to move forward in the selection process. Applicants must meet the Minimum Qualifications stated in the Classification Specification(s).<p><br></p>How To Apply<p><br></p>Complete Application Packages (including your Examination/Employment Application (STD 678) and applicable or required documents) must be submitted to apply for this Job Posting. Application Packages may be submitted electronically through your CalCareer Account at www.CalCareers.ca.gov. When submitting your application in hard copy, a completed copy of the Application Package listing must be included. If you choose to not apply electronically, a hard copy application package may be submitted through an alternative method listed below:<p><br></p>Address for Mailing Application Packages<p><br></p>You may submit your application and any applicable or required documents to:<p><br></p>Department of Industrial Relations<p><br></p>Attn: Certifications Unit<p><br></p>2180 Harvard Street Suite 160<p><br></p>Sacramento , CA 95815<p><br></p>Address for Drop-Off Application Packages<p><br></p>You may drop off your application and any applicable or required documents at:<p><br></p>Department of Industrial Relations<p><br></p>2180 Harvard Street Suite 160<p><br></p>Sacramento , CA 95815<p><br></p>08:00 AM - 04:00 PM<p><br></p>Required Application Package Documents<p><br></p>The following items are required to be submitted with your application. Applicants who do not submit the required items timely may not be considered for this job:<p><br></p><ul><li>Current version of the State Examination/Employment Application STD Form 678 (when not applying electronically), or the Electronic State Employment Application through your Applicant Account at www.CalCareers.ca.gov. All Experience and Education relating to the Minimum Qualifications listed on the Classification Specification should be included to demonstrate how you meet the Minimum Qualifications for the position.</li><li>Resume is optional. It may be included, but is not required.</li></ul><p><br></p>Applicants requiring reasonable accommodations for the hiring interview process must request the necessary accommodations if scheduled for a hiring interview. The request should be made at the time of contact to schedule the interview. Questions regarding reasonable accommodations may be directed to the EEO contact listed on this job posting.<p><br></p><strong>Equal Opportunity Employer</strong><p><br></p>The State of California is an equal opportunity employer to all, regardless of age, ancestry, color, disability (mental and physical), exercising the right to family care and medical leave, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, military or veteran status, national origin, political affiliation, race, religious creed, sex (includes pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding and related medical conditions), and sexual orientation.<p><br></p>It is an objective of the State of California to achieve a drug-free work place. Any applicant for state employment will be expected to behave in accordance with this objective because the use of illegal drugs is inconsistent with the law of the State, the rules governing Civil Service, and the special trust placed in public servants.

describtion: <strong>El Camino Health is committed to hiring, retaining and growing the best and brightest professionals who will carry our mission and vision forward. We are proud of our reputation in the community: One built on compassion, innovation, collaboration and delivering high-quality care. Come join the team that makes this happen.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Applicants MUST apply for position(s) by submitting a separate application for each individual job posting number they are interested in being considered for.</strong><p><br></p><u><strong>FTE</strong></u><p><br></p>1<p><br></p><strong><u>Scheduled Bi-Weekly Hours</u></strong><p><br></p>80<p><br></p><u><strong>Work Shift</strong></u><p><br></p>Evening: 8 hours<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>As part of the unit-based team, this position is responsible for providing secretarial and administrative support, such as word processing, report preparation, new employee orientation, etc. to support the management and clinical staff of the unit/department.<p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>High school diploma or equivalent.<p><br></p>Two (2) plus years of secretarial experience or current enrollment in a Nursing Program (LVN/RN).<p><br></p>Ability to work with minimum direct supervision.<p><br></p>Excellent English verbal and written communication skills.<p><br></p>Excellent organizational skills.<p><br></p>Able to work effectively as a team member under multiple demands and expectations.<p><br></p>Proficient use of PC, Windows and Word Processing.<p><br></p>Able to perform general office duties such as typing filing and operating office machines (fax, photocopier, adding machine).<p><br></p><strong><u>License/Certification/Registration Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p>none<p><br></p><strong><u>Salary Range</u></strong><p><br></p>31.49 - 39.04 USD Hourly<p><br></p><strong>The Physical Requirements and Working Conditions of this job are available. El Camino Health will provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with a disability if that will allow them to perform the essential functions of a job unless doing so creates an undue hardship for the hospital, or causes a direct threat to these individuals or others in the workplace which cannot be eliminated by reasonable accommodation.</strong><p><br></p>Sedentary Work - Duties performed mostly while sitting; walking and standing at times. Occasionally lift or carry up to 10 lbs. Uses hands and fingers. - (Physical Requirements-United States of America)<p><br></p><strong><u>An Equal Opportunity Employer</u></strong><p><br></p><em>El Camino Health seeks and values a diverse workforce. The organization is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of qualifications and competencies. El Camino Health prohibits discrimination in employment based on race, ancestry, national origin, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, marital status, age, medical condition or any other status protected by law. In addition to state and federal law, El Camino Health also follows all applicable fair and equitable employment policies from the County of Santa Clara.</em>

<strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Summary</strong><p><br></p>*These positions will work weekends. Please see work schedule below.*<p><br></p>The custodian will sweep, vacuum, spot carpets, clean carpets, scrub, mop, wax, and polish floors; clean classrooms, laboratories, lavatories, locker rooms, blackboards, white boards, windows, venetian style blinds; replenish lavatory supplies, empty wastebaskets and recycling bins and remove trash/recycling from campus buildings, replace lamps in light fixtures; lock and unlock doors and windows as required; safeguard building or equipment; and other duties listed in the Classification and Qualification Standards of the CSU system and the Department Standards Guideline may be assigned in order to meet customer and campus needs. Different shift operational needs may vary to some degree and individual assignments on a given date are determined by available staffing, campus customer needs, and customer expectations.<p><br></p><strong><u>Key Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Removes and replenishes all dispenser supplies and materials</li><li>Dusts, sweeps, mops, and scrubs floors with department approved chemicals</li><li>Cleans walls, mirrors, partitions, fixtures, and ventilation coverings</li><li>Cleans toilets, urinals, and sinks with department approved chemicals</li><li>Removes and empties all trash/recycling containers daily to appropriate locations</li><li>Transports materials between buildings and utilizes vehicles</li><li>Sweeps, dust mops, mops, and vacuums daily; spots carpets, strips, waxes, and polishes floors weekly</li><li>Cleans and maintains door and entry glass daily</li><li>Organizes and moves tables and chairs to campus standard</li><li>Checks and changes light bulbs/tubes daily in all areas</li><li>Utilizes personal protective equipment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Knowledge, Skills &amp; Abilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Must be able to successfully complete the Defensive Driver Training Program provided by the State of California for CSU campuses and pass the course exam</li><li>May be required to lift 50 pounds</li><li>Ability to use and care for custodial supplies and equipment</li><li>Ability to read and write at a level appropriate to the duties of the position</li><li>Ability to implement a customer service approach, with a commitment to high ethical standards</li><li>Ability to take initiative and independently plan, organize, coordinate and perform work in various situations</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to communicate verbally at a level appropriate to the duties of the position</li><li>Ability to follow simple oral and written directions</li><li>Ability to understand chemical/product mixing ratios and ability to label containers accordingly</li><li>Requires the possession of a valid California Driver’s License for the operation of any vehicle or equipment required for position and in any emergency situation</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>License </strong><p><br></p>A valid driver's license is required for this position. Out of state candidates selected for the position must obtain a State of California driver's license within 10 days of hire in accordance with the California Department of Motor Vehicles regulations.<p><br></p>Once hired the employee must successfully complete the Defensive Driver Training Program provided by the State of California for California State University campuses.<p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Six months of full time custodial or service industry experience in an institutional or commercial setting</li><li>Six months of full-time experience with industrial commercial equipment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Compensation</u></strong><p><br></p>Classification: Custodian<p><br></p>Anticipated Hiring Range: up to $3,338/month<p><br></p>CSU Salary Range: $3,338/month - $4,490/month<p><br></p>San José State University offers employees a comprehensive benefits package typically worth 30-35% of your base salary. For more information on programs available, please see the Employee Benefits Summary.<p><br></p><strong>Application Procedure</strong><p><br></p>Click Apply Now to complete the SJSU Online Employment Application and attach the following documents:<p><br></p><ul><li>Resume</li><li>Driver's License</li></ul><p><br></p>This position is open until filled.<p><br></p><strong>Work Schedule </strong><p><br></p>Selected candidates will be placed in one of the following shifts based on operational needs.<p><br></p>Sunday through Thursday 10:30 p.m. to 7:00 a.m.<p><br></p><strong>Contact Information</strong><p><br></p>University Personnel<p><br></p>jobs@sjsu.edu<p><br></p>408-924-2252<p><br></p><strong>CSU Vaccination Policy</strong><p><br></p>The CSU strongly recommends that all individuals who access any in-person program or activity (on- or off-campus) operated or controlled by the University follow COVID-19 vaccine recommendations adopted by the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the California Department of Public Health (CDPH) applicable to their age, medical condition, and other relevant indications and comply with other safety measures established by each campus. The system wide policy can be found at https://calstate.policystat.com/policy/9779821/latest/ and questions may be sent to jobs@sjsu.edu.<p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Information</u></strong><p><br></p>Satisfactory completion of a background check (including a criminal records check) is required for employment. SJSU will issue a contingent offer of employment to the selected candidate, which may be rescinded if the background check reveals disqualifying information, and/or it is discovered that the candidate knowingly withheld or falsified information. Failure to satisfactorily complete the background check may affect the continued employment of a current CSU employee who was offered the position on a contingent basis.<p><br></p>The standard background check includes: criminal check, employment and education verification. Depending on the position, a motor vehicle and/or credit check may be required. All background checks are conducted through the university's third party vendor, Accurate Background. Some positions may also require fingerprinting. SJSU will pay all costs associated with this procedure. Evidence of required degree(s) or certification(s) will be required at time of hire.<p><br></p>SJSU IS NOT A SPONSORING AGENCY FOR STAFF OR MANAGEMENT POSITIONS. (e.g. H1-B VISAS)<p><br></p>All San José State University employees are considered mandated reporters under the California Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act and are required to comply with the requirements set forth in CSU Executive Order 1083 as a condition of employment. Incumbent is also required to promptly report any knowledge of a possible Title IX related incident to the Title IX Office or report any discrimination, harassment, and/or retaliation to the Office of Equal Opportunity.<p><br></p><strong>Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Crime Statistics Act and Campus Housing Fire Safety Notification: </strong><p><br></p>Pursuant to the Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act, the Annual Security Report (ASR) is also now available for viewing at https://www.sjsu.edu/clery/docs/SJSU-Annual-Security-Report.pdf. The ASR contains the current security and safety-related policy statements, emergency preparedness and evacuation information, crime prevention and Sexual Assault prevention information, and information about drug and alcohol prevention programming. The ASR also contains statistics of Clery crimes for San José State University locations for the three most recent calendar years. A paper copy of the ASR is available upon request by contacting the Office of the Clery Director by phone at 408-924-1501 or by email at clerycompliance@sjsu.edu.<p><br></p>Pursuant to the Higher Education Opportunity Act, the Annual Fire Safety Report (AFSR) is also available for viewing at https://www.sjsu.edu/clery/docs/SJSU-Annual-Fire-Safety-Report.pdf. The purpose of this report is to disclose statistics for fires that occurred within SJSU on-campus housing facilities for the three most recent calendar years, and to distribute fire safety policies and procedures intended to promote safety on Campus. A paper copy of the AFSR is available upon request by contacting the Housing Office by phone at 408-795-5600 or by email at uhs-frontdesk@sjsu.edu.<p><br></p><strong>Equal Employment Statement</strong><p><br></p>San José State University (SJSU) is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer committed to nondiscrimination on the basis of age, ancestry, citizenship status, color, creed, disability, ethnicity, gender, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, race, religion or lack thereof, sex, sexual orientation, transgender, or protected veteran status consistent with applicable federal and state laws. This policy applies to all SJSU students, faculty and staff programs and activities. Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, and certain other federal and state laws, prohibit discrimination on the basis of sex in all education programs and activities operated by the university (both on and off campus).

jobs_titles: Patient Admin Specialist III - Pelvic Health Center - Full Time, Days (8HRS)
describtion: If you're ready to be part of our legacy of hope and innovation, we encourage you to take the first step and explore our current job openings. Your best is waiting to be discovered.<br><br>Day - 08 Hour (United States of America)<br><br><strong>This is a Stanford Health Care job.<br><br></strong><strong><u>A Brief Overview<br><br></u></strong>The primary responsibility of the Patient Administrative Specialist is to handle new patient coordination, surgery scheduling, and other front office functions in the outpatient clinical setting. A Patient Administrative Specialist supports any and all administrative tasks related to the daily operations of the clinic.<br><br><strong>Locations<br><br></strong>Stanford Health Care<br><br><strong><u>What You Will Do<br></u></strong><ul><li>Primary Function:</li><li>Proficiency of level II skills.</li><li>AND</li><li>Performs secondary specialized function 30% or more of time. </li><li>Specialized Functions:</li><li>- Master Scheduling,</li><li>- New Patient Coordination,</li><li>- Authorization Coordination,</li><li>- Surgery/Procedure Scheduling,</li><li>- Specialized data collection/coordination. </li><li>Level II Duties:</li><li>Working with care teams, patients, and outside facilities to obtain necessary information, diagnostic imaging, pathology, and other vital information required for care.</li><li>Assures appropriate verifications and authorizations are complete before patient sees provider, in addition to preparing patient medical records for clinic appointments.</li><li>Assists patients and physicians in scheduling ancillary tests before and after clinic visits.</li><li>Assists patients and physicians by scheduling treatment appointments for patients, including surgery, ITA, radiology, etc.</li><li>Ensures that all scheduled patients are eligible for services requested and /or determines patient eligibility.</li><li>Informs patient’s authorization and collects payment for new and returning patients, using the scheduling system.</li><li>Coordinates care by scheduling, editing and maintaining routine patient physician appointments for new and returning patients. </li><li>Plus expertise in one or more additional specialized functions (performed 30% or more of the time):</li><li>Schedules complex appointments and surgeries requiring strong knowledge of procedures, department protocols and timing.</li><li>Functions independently to complete activities related to the registration process. Responsible for completeness, accuracy, and timeliness of data.</li><li>Documents patient liability and communicates this information to the patient, and appropriate staff.</li><li>Serves as resource to other staff in the area of registration, benefits, and authorization process.</li><li>Reviews and analyzes all registration edit reports, and ensures that corrections to the database are made in a timely fashion.</li><li>Maintains master appointment schedule. Schedules appointments in scheduling systems. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Education Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> High School Diploma/GED. </li><li> Associate degree or Bachelor's degree in health related field from an accredited college or university preferred. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Experience Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> Two plus (2+) years’ experience working in healthcare setting (i.e. hospital, medical/dental office, nursing facilities etc.). <br></li></ul><strong><u>Required Knowledge, Skills And Abilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Expert in Level II KSAs: </li><li>Basic PC Skills (Windows, Excel, and Word). </li><li>Good communication, customer service, interpersonal skills and cross cultural competency. </li><li>Working knowledge of EPIC or other patient database. </li><li>Ability to foster relationships, build trust with providers, nurses, staff, and patients and to work in a collegial team environment and stressful interactions. </li><li>Ability to plan, prioritize, and organize work independently with attention to detail and deadlines scheduling and ITA scheduling. <br></li></ul><strong>Licenses and Certifications<br></strong><ul><li>None <br></li></ul><strong><u>These Principles Apply To ALL Employees<br><br></u></strong><strong>SHC Commitment to Providing an Exceptional Patient &amp; Family Experience<br><br></strong><em>Stanford Health Care sets a high standard for delivering value and an exceptional experience for our patients and families. Candidates for employment and existing employees must adopt and execute C-I-CARE standards for all of patients, families and towards each other. C-I-CARE is the foundation of Stanford’s patient-experience and represents a framework for patient-centered interactions. Simply put, we do what it takes to enable and empower patients and families to focus on health, healing and recovery.<br><br>You will do this by executing against our three experience pillars, from the patient and family’s perspective: <br></em><ul><li>Know Me: Anticipate my needs and status to deliver effective care</li><li>Show Me the Way: Guide and prompt my actions to arrive at better outcomes and better health</li><li>Coordinate for Me: Own the complexity of my care through coordination<br></li></ul><strong>Equal Opportunity Employer Stanford Health Care (SHC) strongly values diversity and is committed to equal opportunity and non-discrimination in </strong><strong>all of</strong><strong> its policies and practices, including the area of employment. Accordingly, SHC does not discriminate against any person on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation or gender identity and/or expression, religion, age, national or ethnic origin, political beliefs, marital status, medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, or disability, or the perception of any of the above. People of all genders, members of all racial and ethnic groups, people with disabilities, and veterans are encouraged to apply. Qualified applicants with criminal convictions will be considered after an individualized assessment of the conviction and the job requirements.<br><br></strong>Base Pay Scale: Generally starting at $32.17 - $36.21 per hour<br><br>The salary of the finalist selected for this role will be set based on a variety of factors, including but not limited to, internal equity, experience, education, specialty and training. This pay scale is not a promise of a particular wage.

The Matian Firm is looking a<strong> Mail Clerk</strong> to join our San Jose office. Mail clerks will manage outgoing/incoming messages and packages, ensuring labeling and packaging for outgoing post and keeping detailed records of all incoming packages, including weight and dimensions, among other responsibilities. You will provide mail directly to all departments and individuals. This position reports to the Human Resources department.<p><br></p><strong>Primary Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Work in a team environment to ensure the preparation of documents. Organizing, distributing or tracking mail according to departmental procedures</li><li>Ensure delivery, preparation, and scanning of correspondence. </li><li>Ensure labeling and packaging for outgoing post. </li><li>Arrange for deliveries with delivery companies such as FedEx. </li><li>Forward misdirected mail. </li><li>Keep an inventory of mailing supplies, such as envelopes and stamps. </li><li>Certify mail. </li><li>Keep detailed records of all incoming packages, including weight and dimensions. </li><li>Log incoming mail-in company systems. </li><li>Provide mail to both departments and individuals, ensuring the relevant parties approve them. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Required Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Education: High School Diploma / GED (or higher)</li><li>Bilingual (English/Spanish) is highly preferred</li><li>1+ years of office experience to include the use of document management software and equipment. </li><li>Experience using Microsoft Excel (can maintain complex spreadsheets) to open, edit, sort/filter and save spreadsheets (can maintain complex spreadsheets).*</li></ul><p><br></p>Here at the Matian Firm, <strong>we offer medical, dental, and vision insurance. We have a great compensation package including a 401(k) plan</strong>. <strong>Some perks include catered lunches, complimentary parking, paid time off, and more</strong>! Come be apart of our growing firm and its opportunities for your career development. You will learn and develop alongside a team of professionals who aim to excel in the legal industry.<p><br></p>The Matian Firm, APC is an equal employment opportunity employer, and we welcome everyone regardless of their race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or genetics. We are dedicated to providing an inclusive, open, and diverse work environment.

jobs_titles: Entry-Level Bookkeeper/Administrator for a Construction Company

describtion: <strong><u>Overview</u></strong><p><br></p>ITS ConGlobal is the industry-leading provider of intermodal rail terminal services, auto loading and unloading and container depot services. We take pride in consistently delivering superior and reliable service, a broad scope of services and an exemplary safety record. We’re currently seeking one Full time Administrative Assistant and a Part Time Administrative Assistant.<p><br></p>The Administrative Assistant is responsible for overseeing the day to day administrative tasks including but is not limited to answering phones, customer service and data entry.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><strong> Administrative Assistant </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Supports general business operations through administrative duties </li><li> Carries out administrative tasks such as managing team calendars, scheduling meetings, phone and email correspondence and maintaining client files </li><li> Communicates effectively with clients and the team </li><li> Maintains office supplies, mail, databases and clean receptionist area </li><li> Enforces and upholds all ITS rules, regulations &amp; policies </li><li> Partners with our customers to problem solve and improve terminal performance </li><li> Other assigned tasks </li></ul><p><br></p>This is an exciting time at ITS and we’re seeking individuals who want to build the engine and paint the canvas! We offer full time employees the following; competitive compensation, benefits, 401K, vacation and the ability to create &amp; implement vs. observe and maintain.<p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong> Requirements </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Related administrative support experience </li><li> Good Typing skills </li><li> Candidate must be organized and detail oriented </li><li> Must demonstrate strong communication skills; both oral and written </li><li> Maintain accurate records of customers’ equipment inventory </li><li> Exceptional organizational, multi-tasking and time management skills </li><li> Proficiency in Microsoft Office / Web Based Data systems </li><li> Strong Work Ethic </li><li> Eagerness to learn in an upbeat atmosphere </li><li> Must be able to work Full Time - Monday - Friday 7AM - 4PM (some weekend days may be required); Part Time - Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday 4PM - 9PM </li></ul><p><br></p>All qualified applicants will be given equal consideration regardless of race, age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, color, religion, protected veteran status or national origin.

<p>We are <strong>Impress</strong>. We believe everyone deserves a smile they’ll love.</p><p><br></p><p>We are the largest chain of ortho clinics with fully digital processes. We have revolutionized the invisible orthodontic sector with the best team of professionals specialized in making people smile and using the latest technology for the diagnosis, treatment, and follow-up of all cases.</p><p><br></p><p>Our business model, a true combination of medical expertise and digitalization has been recognized in the top fastest-growing Health-Tech companies by Forbes and we are currently listed as a LinkedIn Top 10 start-up!</p><p><br></p><p>Born in Barcelona in 2019, in just 3 years, we’ve grown to pioneer leading care, flagship clinics and state-of-the-art tech across 8 countries and more than 100 locations, and we are expanding fast! Our aim is to improve people’s health and quality of life across the globe.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>ABOUT THE ROLE: </strong></p><p><strong> </strong></p><p>We’re looking for an experienced Treatment Coordinator to help customers who visit our clinics become Impress Patients. Our Patients come into our clinics with the goal of feeling more confident and perfecting their smiles. Our Treatment Coordinator helps patients achieve the smile of their dreams by partnering with our Doctors to deliver an exceptional in-clinic experience and consultation.</p><p>This is an opportunity to make a meaningful impact by selling our patented treatment to the Bay area community. You’ll be scheduled to perform up to 40 Free Consultations per week, this includes clearly articulating Impress’s industry-changing technology, presenting treatment goals to patients, and starting new patients on their orthodontic treatment. We will also train you on how to assist the doctor in procedures that help patients progress towards the smile they’ve always wanted.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>HOW YOU’LL HAVE AN IMPACT</strong></p><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieve a same-day conversion rate of 60% or more and same monthly conversion results of 75%</li><li>Drive high patient satisfaction by clearly communicating treatment goals and next steps</li><li>Lead all pre-sale preparations (confirm appointments and post-appointment follow-ups),</li><li>Convert prospects to active patients (we supply the leads through our marketing channels).</li><li>Send prompt follow-up communication to patients, enter all information timely in our electronic medical records, send communications to General Dentists and assist with follow-up sales and patient communication. Update Slack channel with patient feedback.</li><li>Provide a smooth hand-off to our treatment planner team so patients have a phenomenal experience.</li><li>Assist the doctor in all procedures and occasionally perform indirect delivery of orthodontic attachments to patients’ teeth and refinement visits throughout a patient’s treatment time (about 1-3 visits over 6-18 months).</li><li>Provide clinical care to all our existing patients. This included performing procedures independently, such as using an intraoral scanner to take images of patients' teeth and using a CBCT scanner to take advanced, 3D images of patients' teeth.</li><li>Maintain clinic equipment such as scanners, x-rays, and dental units, export patient scans &amp; x-rays.</li><li>Perform other duties as assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>WHAT YOU’LL BRING</strong></p><p><br></p><ul><li>2-3 years of working experience</li><li>Must be willing and able to be onsite in clinic each day</li><li>Must be able to work a flexible schedule based on the needs of the business. This can include nights, holidays, and weekends.</li><li>Must be able to travel between clinics within the market if necessary for operations and patient care</li><li>Must be living in the market of the clinic.</li><li>Typical physical demands, twisting and ability to lift 45 lbs, able to stand for 8 hrs at a time, and coordinate movement of small instruments.</li><li>1+ years sales experience preferred</li><li>You love to collaborate and work with members of different team members jumping in to provide support to members of your team if needed.</li><li>You lead with empathy, patience and a positive attitude.</li><li>You are intrinsically motivated to provide the best experience and care to customers, constantly looking for ways to improve processes and drive results.</li><li>You are adaptable and flexible - excited to work in an environment that is constantly evolving.</li><li>You are an excellent communicator, regardless of channel (written &amp; verbal) or group of people (both internal and externally.</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>NICE TO HAVE</strong></p><p><br></p><ul><li>Prior sales experience in sales quotas and conversion</li><li>Prior experience in a dental/orthodontist office assisting medical professionals</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>WHAT WE’LL BRING</strong></p><p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive medical, dental, and vision coverage</li><li>Bonus compensation paid monthly</li><li>Commuter benefits</li><li>Opportunity for growth as the company expands</li><li>Free orthodontic treatment</li><li>A diverse group of smart people with backgrounds from healthcare to tech to entertainment</li><li>The chance to join an exciting early-stage startup during its growth phase</li><li>Compensation Range: $21 - $26 per hour plus commissions</li></ul>

Gunderson Dettmer is the only business law firm of its kind - exclusively serving the global venture capital and emerging technology marketplace. With more than 400 attorneys in eleven offices - from Silicon Valley to Singapore - we innovate for innovators, accelerate entrepreneurship, and help build companies at every stage of the growth lifecycle. We are committed to being the employer of choice by working together to create an environment, in which each of our people can grow, take initiative, and develop a fun, fulfilling and financially rewarding career.<p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p>In addition to offering competitive salaries, we also offer an excellent benefit package, which includes full medical, dental and vision coverage; 401(k) Profit Sharing Plan; Flexible Spending Account and Paid Time Off.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>Gunderson Dettmer has an opening for a <strong>Junior Staff Accountant</strong> in our Silicon Valley office on a hybrid schedule. Primary responsibilities of the position include performing client billing functions, collections, accounts receivable and month-end activities. This position offers an incredible opportunity to learn how the start-up world works, how companies receive investments and their path toward sales or public offerings.<p><br></p><strong>Job Requirements</strong><p><br></p>Candidate should be proficient in Excel, Access and Word and must possess strong verbal, written and interpersonal skills. This position requires good judgment, initiative, flexibility and team work.<p><br></p><strong>Educational Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BS/BA degree in business administration, finance or accounting</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Status</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Full Time, Non-Exempt</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Schedule</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>8:30am-5:00pm PT</li></ul><p><br></p>The anticipated hiring salary for this role is $60k-$70k annually, dependent upon experience and qualifications.<p><br></p>Gunderson Dettmer is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.<p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>efAGd6cA5Y

Any applicant for state employment will be expected to behave in accordance with this objective because the use of illegal drugs is inconsistent with the law of the State, the rules governing Civil Service, and the special trust placed in public servants.<p><br></p><strong>Position Details</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Code #:</strong><p><br></p>JC-373880<p><br></p><strong>Position #(s):</strong><p><br></p>800-310-1139-912<p><br></p><strong>Working Title:</strong><p><br></p><strong> Office Technician (Typing) </strong><p><br></p><strong>Classification:</strong><p><br></p>OFFICE TECHNICIAN (TYPING)<p><br></p>$3,369.00 - $4,217.00 A<p><br></p><strong># of Positions:</strong><p><br></p>1<p><br></p><strong>Work Location:</strong><p><br></p>Alameda County<p><br></p><strong>Job Type:</strong><p><br></p>12 Month Limited Term - Full Time<p><br></p><strong>Department Information</strong><p><br></p>Are you interested in making a difference in the lives of fellow Californians while achieving your career goals? Do you set high standards for yourself and enjoy a collaborative and challenging work environment? The California Department of Social Services (CDSS) serves, aids and protects needy and vulnerable children and adults in ways that strengthen and preserve families, encourage personal responsibility and foster independence. CDSS employees are our most important resource in serving California’s needy and vulnerable children and families.<p><br></p>CDSS’ goal is to foster a culture that values diversity, equity, and inclusion within our Department, that actively invites the contribution and participation of all people, and is representative of the varied identities and different perspectives in California. In our role as public administrators, our charge is to ensure that our programs and our workplaces provide all Californians the opportunity to thrive.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description And Duties</strong><p><br></p><strong>Please Note: A Statement of Qualifications must be submitted along with your application in order to be considered for this position. Please see "Special Requirements" section for Statement of Qualifications instructions.</strong><p><br></p>The California Department of Social Services, Legal Division, is recruiting to fill one fulltime Office Technician (OT) (Typing) in our Oakland office.<p><br></p>The position is limited-term through 6/30/2024, and may convert to permanent. Job duties include: performing receptionist duties, answer incoming telephone calls and directing callers and visitors to the appropriate staff members; setting meetings and maintaining calendars in Microsoft Outlook; assisting the Division’s Attendance Coordinator which includes processing employee benefits, time reporting sheets, new hire documents, workers’ compensation, disability and FMLA documents for staff assigned to the Legal Division; developing and maintaining filing systems for sensitive and confidential documents; participating in support staff training and staff meetings; maintaining an inventory of office supplies and preparing repair work orders for business service needs; performing mailing services; compiling, copying, and assembling materials; typing general correspondence; updating and maintaining the Legal Division staff telephone roster; and other duties as assigned to include assisting management and analyst staff within the Administrative Legal Services Branch (ALSB) with general clerical tasks.<p><br></p>You will find additional information about the job in the <strong> Duty Statement </strong>.<p><br></p><strong>Special Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> The position(s) require(s) the ability to type at a minimum speed as designated on the Class Specifications (link available in the additional documentation section).
