<strong>About The Opportunity</strong><p><br></p>JOB SUMMARY<p><br></p>Reporting to the Director of Public Safety, the Administrative Scheduling Coordinator is responsible for key management &amp; distribution, departmental training coordination, and departmental scheduling. This position includes both a public-facing component, as well as internal record and data management.<p><br></p>The Administrative Scheduling Coordinator will also serve as a backup for the office manager to ensure that the Public Safety walk-in center is fully staffed during operational hours. Additional shift hours and responsibilities may be required during particular times of year such as commencement, move-in/out, and other major university events. Additional shift hours and responsibilities may be required during major unexpected university incidents.<p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>Reliability, diligence and punctuality. Efficient time management techniques &amp; strong organizational skills. Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to multi-task and prioritize responsibilities.<p><br></p>Ability to express oneself clearly and concisely, orally and in writing. Strong computer skills, typing skills, and ability to learn new software. Team and goal oriented. Ability to exercise discretion and tact in handling confidential information.<p><br></p><strong>Key Responsibilities &amp; Accountabilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Departmental Scheduling (50%)</li></ul><p><br></p>The Department of Public Safety is a 24/7 operation with numerous officers and responsibilities. This position will be required to monitor the schedule on a daily basis to ensure that all shifts are filled. A requirement of this position will be to maintain a calendar of university events to ensure that all major events have appropriate staffing levels. This position will also monitor detail and overtime requests and schedule appropriately. Some afterhours and weekend monitoring and schedule adjustments will be required.<p><br></p><ul><li> Training Coordination (30%):</li></ul><p><br></p>The Department of Public Safety continues to expand upon various training requirements. This position will be responsible for the identification of vendors, scheduling of officers, invoicing, and the maintenance of all department training records.<p><br></p><ul><li> Key Management (20%): The Department of Public Safety is currently responsible for all non-residential key distribution and tracking. This is a public facing position that will monitor the approval, request, distribution, and tracking of all building keys.</li><li> Serve as a backup for the office manager position, to ensure that the Public Safety walk-in center is fully staffed during operational hours.</li></ul><p><br></p>The expected hiring range is $31,42/hour to $40.00/hour based on the position's responsibilities and scope.<p><br></p><strong>Position Type</strong><p><br></p>Safety and Security<p><br></p><strong>Additional Information</strong><p><br></p>Northeastern University considers factors such as candidate work experience, education and skills when extending an offer.<p><br></p>Northeastern has a comprehensive benefits package for benefit eligible employees. This includes medical, vision, dental, paid time off, tuition assistance, wellness &amp; life, retirement- as well as commuting &amp; transportation. Visit https://hr.northeastern.edu/benefits/ for more information.<p><br></p>Northeastern University is an equal opportunity employer, seeking to recruit and support a broadly diverse community of faculty and staff. Northeastern values and celebrates diversity in all its forms and strives to foster an inclusive culture built on respect that affirms inter-group relations and builds cohesion.<p><br></p>All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.<p><br></p>To learn more about Northeastern University’s commitment and support of diversity and inclusion, please see <em>www.northeastern.edu/diversity</em>.

The Position<p><br></p>***This is an open continuous recruitment***<p><br></p>***Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply immediately***<p><br></p>The City of Oakland is an equal opportunity employer that values workforce diversity, inclusion, and equity. Oakland has a long history of activism around issues of justice and equity. Both oppression and this resistance to oppression have shaped the city’s historical roots and the lives of its residents to this day. As public servants to one of the most diverse cities in the nation, we strive to develop employees who understand the harm and impacts of systemic inequity to create lasting, meaningful outcomes for everyone. Oakland strives to establish an environment that embraces the richness of culture, community, and individualism of employees.<p><br></p><strong><u>About The Oakland Police Department</u></strong><p><br></p>Mission Statement<p><br></p>The Oakland Police Department’s mission is to provide police service focused on public safety and the sanctity of life, to hold ourselves accountable to a high standard of conduct, efficiency, and efficacy, and to promote mutual respect between the Department and the Communities of Oakland.<p><br></p>Vision<p><br></p>We will work in partnership with our Community, recognize the successes of our staff, build a team of professionals who are trained and developed to provide top quality Service, hold ourselves and each other accountable, and continually seek to be the exemplar for 21st Century Constitutional Policing, Community engagement, and positive employee morale within the police profession.<p><br></p>Core Values<p><br></p><ul><li>Fairness: We value fairness in our dealings with our Community and with each other. Fairness is the opportunity to deliver services to our Community and make decisions that are impartial, equitable, and just.</li><li>Integrity: Though it includes a consistency between our statements and our actions, integrity is more than service to the truth. Integrity encompasses a transparency and accountability that are born from a desire to do the right thing, even when times are difficult.</li><li>Respect: Mutual respect begins at home; we value respect throughout our organization, both up and down the chain of command. How we treat each other will be reflected in the way every staff member will be expected to treat every member of our Community.</li><li>Service: Our decisions are constantly guided by our mission of providing services focused on public safety and quality of life, while also ensuring that our services are provided in an efficient and effective manner</li><li>Teamwork: Purpose of mission and adherence to values are best drawn out from employees who are supported, valued, and developed. Whether through peer, supervisory, or command support and mutual respect, OPD expects that our staff all work together to achieve our common goal.</li></ul>The City of Oakland is accepting applications for an exciting opportunity in the Oakland Police Department's Communications Division. Come and join a wonderful team of professionals dedicated to serving the citizens of Oakland. Start an exciting career and become a 9-1-1 Dispatcher!<p><br></p>Police Communications Dispatchers receive approximately one year of on-the-job training and must attend a POST-certified basic dispatcher course. During training, working hours and days off vary. Dispatchers may work any of the three shifts in a 24-hour period; may be required to work a schedule with rotating days off; often work weekends, holidays, and overtime as required by emergencies or Departmental needs. This is a public contact position.<p><br></p><strong><u>We Are Looking For Someone Who</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>possess the ability to act promptly, logically, and decisively;</li><li>can communicate clearly;</li><li>is able to read, comprehend and retain information;</li><li>will maintain a calm and professional demeanor even under stressful situations;</li><li>has the ability to adapt to changing situations;</li><li>is able to multi-task;</li><li>is highly self-motivated; and</li><li>will display a high level of integrity.</li></ul><p><br></p>The sensitivity of the position calls for emotionally stable applicants. Applicants must have a satisfactory record as a law-abiding citizen. Final candidates will undergo a thorough background investigation, a polygraph examination, and a medical examination. Excessive alcohol usage, drug abuse, a poor work record or any falsification of employment information are grounds for disqualification from employment consideration.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Typically Be Responsible For</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Receiving and screening telephone calls and recording data </li><li>Analyzing calls for priority level</li><li> Using computer-aided keyboard and data entry equipment or manually recording and relaying information (often of an emergency nature) to appropriate units </li><li> Receiving, transmitting, and recording data </li><li> Running queries in automated warrant information systems </li><li> Answering questions from the public </li><li> Dispatching from a mobile command center, as requested </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> A few reasons why you might love a career as a Police Communications Dispatcher: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> The work you do directly impacts the public and City of Oakland residents </li><li> You will have the ability to demonstrate your honesty, moral and ethical decision-making skills </li><li> In this role, you will use your fact-finding abilities to identify needs, make decisions, and address issues </li><li> There are lots of opportunity for growth within the City of Oakland </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> A few challenges you may face as a Police Communications Dispatcher: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> You must remain calm to effectively handle high-stress situations </li><li> This position requires that you are careful about details and thorough in completing tasks </li><li> You will need to maintain composure when faced with callers in aggressive, angry, or emotional situations </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Competencies Required</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Professional &amp; Technical Expertise : Applying technical subject matter to the job </li><li> Analyzing &amp; Interpreting Data : Drawing meaning and conclusions from quantitative or qualitative data </li><li> Using Technology : Working with electronic hardware and software applications </li><li> Attention to Detail : Focusing on the details of work content, work steps, and final work products </li><li> Displaying Ownership and Accountability : Holding self and others accountable for measurable high-quality, timely, and cost-effective results </li><li> Handling Stress : Maintaining emotional stability and self-control under pressure, challenge, or adversity </li><li> Learning Agility : Seeking learning opportunities and applying the lessons to one’s work </li><li> Professional Integrity &amp; Ethics : Displaying honesty, adherence to principles, and personal accountability </li><li> Oral Communication : Engaging effectively in dialogue </li><li> Writing : Communicating effectively in writing</li><li> Customer Focus : Attending to the needs and expectations of customers </li><li> Professional Impact : Presenting self as a positive representative of the organization </li><li> Teamwork : Collaborating with others to achieve shared goals</li></ul>*Click on the link below to see a video on what it's like to work for the City of Oakland! Working for the City of Oakland<p><br></p>Read the complete job description at: Class specifications<p><br></p><strong> Note </strong>: This is a continuous recruitment process; eligible candidates may remain on the eligible list for 2 years.<p><br></p><strong><strong>This recruitment is open to all qualified candidates.</strong></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>If you are a current, SEIU-represented, permanent employee of the City and Port of Oakland you may apply at: Police Communications Dispatcher - RESTRICTED (Continuous) </li><li>If you possess 3 years of experience as a Police Dispatcher, you may be eligible to apply as a Lateral applicant; you may apply at: Police Communications Dispatcher - LATERAL (Continuous) </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Requirements For Application</u></strong><p><br></p>Any combination of education and experience that is equivalent to the following minimum qualifications is acceptable.<p><br></p><strong>Education</strong>: Equivalent to graduation from high school<p><br></p><strong>Experience</strong>: Two years of recent full-time equivalent of responsible work experience. College education may substitute for experience on a year for year basis.<p><br></p><strong>Typing</strong>: minimum typing speed of 35 words per minute (wpm).<p><br></p><strong><u>Other Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Must be eighteen (18) years of age or older.</li><li>Must pass a thorough background investigation.</li><li>Must pass the P.O.S.T. Public Safety Dispatchers' Basic Course within one year of appointment as a condition of continued employment.</li></ul><strong>Bilingual Requirements: </strong>A select number of positions filled through this recruitment will require selective bilingual skills in one or more of the following languages: Cantonese, Mandarin, or Spanish. Please note, identified bilingual skills will be tested prior to a final offer of employment. Candidates must pass the bilingual skills test to achieve placement on and/or remain on the bilingual skills eligible list. NOTE: Bilingual skills are not required for most positions.<p><br></p><strong><u>Background Investigation, Psychological And Medical Assessment</u></strong><p><br></p>Final candidates will undergo a thorough background investigation by the Oakland Police Department Backgrounds Unit which may include, but is not limited to:<p><br></p><ul><li>A thorough review of the completed PHS</li><li>A polygraph</li><li>A criminal history check consisting of a fingerprint check with the California Department of Justice and FBI</li><li>A drug history check (certain drug usage may result in an automatic disqualification)</li><li>A credit history check</li><li>Interviews with previous and past employers and co-workers</li><li>Present and past neighborhood checks</li><li>Education verification</li><li>Driving record check</li><li>Checks with Law Enforcement agencies in the area you live</li><li>Military history (if applicable)</li></ul>Unfavorable information revealed during the background investigation is grounds for rejection or discharge.<p><br></p>After a conditional job offer is made, candidates will be assessed for compliance with Police Department medical and psychological standards. Any remaining background issues will be resolved during the post-offer phase. Character-related information discovered during the post-offer stage may be grounds for revocation of the conditional job offer and removal from hiring consideration. In addition, the City Physician will evaluate each candidate to determine their ability to meet the physical demands of the job. The medical exam includes a drug-screening test.<p><br></p>Supplemental Information<p><br></p><strong>This is a Continuous Recruitment. Candidates are only eligible to apply once every six (6) months. Candidates that earn their place on the resulting eligible list may remain active on the eligible list for up to two (2) years.</strong><p><br></p><strong>The Selection Process</strong><p><br></p><strong>Application Filing</strong>: All applicants must apply online at https://www.governmentjobs.com/careers/oaklandca and submit the information as indicated on the job announcement by the final filing date.<p><br></p><strong>Police Communications Dispatcher Typing Assessment</strong>: Candidates that clearly demonstrate that they possess the required minimum qualifications will be invited to participate in an online typing assessment. The typing assessment will consist of three, five-minute timed typing tests. The scores attained on the three typing assessments will be averaged to determine candidate's average net WPM. Candidates must demonstrate the ability to type at least 35 average net words per minute. <strong>Note, a typing certification will NOT be accepted in lieu of the required typing assessment; all candidates are required to take and pass the typing assessment. </strong> Candidates are only permitted to participate in the typing assessment once every 6 months. <strong>(Qualifying</strong><strong>)</strong><p><br></p><strong>CritiCall Performance Assessment</strong>: Candidates that pass the required typing assessment will be invited to participate in the online CritiCall Performance Assessment. CritiCall is designed to measure applicant's knowledge, skills, and abilities to complete exercises that replicate some aspect of the job. The assessment may be timed and include the following performance tests or simulations: data entry, call summarization, cross referencing, memory recall, prioritization, map reading, spelling, sentence clarity, reading comprehension. Candidates must receive a passing score, in order to be placed on the eligibility list. <strong>Note, we do NOT accept CritiCall results from other agencies. ( <strong>Weighted 100% ) </strong><p><br></p><strong>TENTATIVE EXAM DATES</strong><p><br></p><strong>For applications received between 04/11/2023 - 05/15/2023</strong><p><br></p>Typing Assessment (virtual):05/22/2023 - 05/26/2023<p><br></p>CritiCall Assessment (virtual):06/01/2023 - 06/07/2023<p><br></p><strong>For applications received between 05/16/2023 - 06/19/2023</strong><p><br></p>Typing Assessment (virtual): 06/26/2023 - 06/30/2023<p><br></p>CritiCall Assessment (virtual): 07/06/2023 - 07/12/2023<p><br></p><strong>For applications received between 06/20/2023 - 07/24/2023</strong><p><br></p>Typing Assessment (virtual): 07/31/2023 - 08/04/2023<p><br></p>CritiCall Assessment (virtual): 08/10/2023 - 08/16/2023<p><br></p><strong>For applications received between 07/25/2023 - 08/28/2023</strong><p><br></p>Typing Assessment (virtual): 09/04/2023 - 09/08/2023<p><br></p>CritiCall Assessment (virtual): 09/14/2023 - 09/20/2023<p><br></p><strong>For applications received between 08/29/2023 - 10/02/2023</strong><p><br></p>Typing Assessment (virtual): 10/09/2023 - 10/13/2023<p><br></p>CritiCall Assessment (virtual): 10/19/2023 - 10/25/2023<p><br></p>The City of Oakland reserves the right to modify the selection process as necessary to conform to administrative or business necessity.<p><br></p>Candidates that are placed on the eligible list will be sent a <strong>Personal History Statement (PHS)</strong> with submission deadlines and instructions. Please note, additional names of successful candidates may be added to the eligible list periodically; candidates’ names will be merged onto the existing eligible list. <strong>Candidates who are active on the eligible list may not re-apply while their name is active on the </strong><strong>eligible list.</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>The Recruitment Process</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>The City of Oakland works with a Civil Service system. Applicants apply online, and HR staff review their experience, education, and training listed on the application against the “minimum qualifications” listed for each position. </strong><p><br></p><strong>Candidates who demonstrate that they meet the minimum qualification requirements are then invited to participate in an assessment process to measure their knowledge, skills, and abilities in job-related areas. </strong><p><br></p>C andidates who pass each stage in the process will be placed on an eligible list. Some candidates may receive extra points, for example, if you are a Veteran with an honorable discharge, or if you are a current City of Oakland resident. If you’re applying to a “restricted ” posting and you are eligible as a current City employee, you may also receive additional points for your City service. Extra points are only applied to passing scores, so if you do not pass every part of the testing process, you cannot use extra points to pass.<p><br></p><strong>What’s in it for you?</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Retirement - CalPERS (California Public Employees’ Retirement System) with a pension formula of 2.5% @ 55 (for Classic CalPERS members) and 2% @ 62 for new CalPERS members. Classic Employees contribute 8% of pre-tax wages. The City of Oakland does not participate in Social Security </li><li>Health - The City of Oakland pays the full cost of employee and eligible dependent coverage at the Kaiser rate. Other plans include Anthem, Blue Shield, United Health Care, and other HMO and PPO plans </li><li>Dental - Delta Dental full premium for employees and eligible dependents </li><li>Vision - VSP full premium for employees and eligible dependents </li><li>Sick leave - Employees accrue 12 days per year</li><li>Deferred Compensation - 457(b) pre-tax plan and an after-tax ROTH 401(k)plan</li><li>Other benefits include a Flexible Spending Account, Wellness Program, Employee Assistance Program, Tuition Reimbursement, Life Insurance up to $200k &amp; Employee Training.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Applicants are required to submit criminal history information upon request after receiving a conditional offer of employment. If the requested information is not furnished in a timely manner, applicants will not qualify for further consideration and will be removed from the eligible list. </strong><p><br></p><strong>NOTICE: The City of Oakland has adopted a COVID-19 Employee Mandatory Vaccination Policy. </strong>Under the policy, all employees must, as a condition of employment: (1) report their vaccination status to the City no later than November 15, 2021; and (2) be fully vaccinated and verify that vaccination status to the City no later than November 29, 2021, unless the employee has applied for an exemption and is awaiting the City’s response or has been granted an exemption, or unless stricter State or Federal legal requirements apply. If offered employment, you will receive instructions regarding how to provide verification of vaccination or how to apply for an exemption which will be required prior to your start date. You may read the entire policy here (Download PDF reader) (Download PDF reader) .<p><br></p>The City of Oakland reserves the right to modify the selection process and date of examination as necessary to conform to administrative or business necessity. The information contained in this announcement is subject to change and does not constitute either an expressed or implied contract.<p><br></p><strong><u>How To Apply</u></strong><p><br></p>Apply prior to the closing time of the job announcement and allow at least two to three hours to submit your application if you are a new user of the system. <strong> APPLICATIONS ARE ACCEPTED ONLINE ONLY. </strong>You may apply and view current openings by visiting our employment opportunities webpage at: http://agency.governmentjobs.com/oaklandca/default.cfm .<p><br></p>If you do not have access to a computer, there are computer stations available at any City of Oakland Public Library. There are also workstations at the Human Resources Management Department, 150 Frank H. Ogawa Plaza, 2nd Floor, Oakland, CA 94612. Workstations are available during regular business hours (normally 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.).<p><br></p>Our online application system is provided by NeoGov. If you have problems while applying online, please contact NeoGov's Live Applicant Support at (855) 524-5627 between 6:00 AM and 5:00 PM Pacific Time, Monday - Friday. You may also call the City of Oakland Human Resources Management Department during regular business hours at (510) 238-3112 for information; however, we are unable to provide technical support for the online application system.<p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits May Include*</u></strong><p><br></p>The City of Oakland is committed to the wellbeing of its employees and offers comprehensive health and wellness services along with an array of other benefits for most positions.<p><br></p><ul><li> CalPERS Medical</li><li> Dental</li><li> Vision</li><li> Medical Waiver Plan - Cash-In-Lieu</li><li> Flexible Spending Accounts</li><li> Commuter Benefits</li><li> Group &amp; Supplemental Life Insurance</li><li> Employee Assistance Program (EAP)</li><li> Guaranteed Ride Home (GRH)</li><li> Pension Benefits</li><li> Deferred Compensation</li><li> Specific benefits may vary depending on the assignedspecific bargaining unit. Information regarding most benefits can be reviewed here: Employee Benefits Information Current MOUs may be reviewed here: City of Oakland Labor Agreements</li></ul><p><br></p>Closing Date/Time: Continuous

The Department of Radiology core values are based on professionalism, integrity, personal responsibility, and service. Our culture promotes, recognizes, and values the role of staff as partners in an environment that attracts and fosters the highest quality staff.<br><br>The Department of Radiology is seeking an experienced Administrative Associate (AA) to provide 50% time and effort to support the Interventional Radiology Division and the other 50% FTE to support the Breast Imaging Division. All assignments are subject to change. The AA will work with expert faculty and through their support contribute to better patient clinical care and research outcome. The AA responsibilities encompass a spectrum of clinical, education and research coordination and support. The candidate must be highly organized, extremely detail oriented, and able to multi-task and work independently.<br><br><strong>Duties Include<br></strong><ul><li>Respond to inquiries, and determine and take appropriate action as required. Serve as a resource regarding a defined set of policies and procedures.</li><li>Perform duties associated with scheduling, organizing, and operating conferences, seminars, and events, including recommending vendors for services, overseeing the production and distribution of materials, coordinating logistics, and serving as liaison with internal and external vendors.</li><li>Draft and/or generate routine communications; coordinate production (formatting, copying, etc.) and dissemination of documents, such as presentations, course handouts, grant proposals, conference and seminar materials, complex reports, brochures, and displays. </li><li>Plan and schedule calendar(s) based on consultation, resolve calendaring conflicts, and arrange travel in compliance with unit, university, and sponsor policies.</li><li>Process and monitor routine financial transactions, which may include researching and resolving discrepancies.</li><li>Maintain office supplies and equipment; obtain vendor quotations, as needed. Coordinate office moves. </li><li>May serve as the point of contact for general maintenance, health and safety, and other facility concerns within the unit(s); report any incidents or potential safety problems to appropriate representatives. Track completion of required training.</li><li>Maintain approved content on websites.</li><li>May perform human resources transactional support, e.g. time cards, I9s, and/or faculty affairs support.</li><li>May guide and train student and/or contingent workers including scheduling, assigning, and prioritizing workloads, setting appropriate deadlines, and reviewing work for quality and timeliness. </li><li> - Other duties may also be assigned<br><br></li></ul>Stanford is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Stanford welcomes applications from all who would bring additional dimensions to the University’s research, teaching and clinical missions.<br><ul><li>Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. All candidates must be eligible to work in the U.S.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Education &amp; Experience (required)<br></strong><ul><li>High school diploma and three years of administrative experience, or combination of education and relevant experience.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Knowledge, Skills And Abilities (required)<br></strong><ul><li>Proficient computer skills and demonstrated experience with office software and email applications.</li><li>Demonstrated success in following through and completing routine tasks.</li><li>Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. </li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills.</li><li>Ability to prioritize and multi-task. <br><br></li></ul><strong>PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS*:<br></strong><ul><li>Constantly perform desk-based computer tasks.</li><li>Frequently sitting.</li><li>Occasionally stand/walk, reach/work above shoulders, grasp lightly/fine manipulation, grasp forcefully, use a telephone, sort/file paperwork or parts, lift/carry/push/pull objects that weigh up to 10 pounds.</li><li>Rarely twist/bend/stoop/squat, kneel/crawl.</li><li> Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Work Standards<br></strong><ul><li>Interpersonal Skills: Demonstrates the ability to work well with Stanford colleagues and clients and with external organizations.</li><li>Promote Culture of Safety: Demonstrates commitment to personal responsibility and value for safety; communicates safety concerns; uses and promotes safe behaviors based on training and lessons learned.</li><li>Subject to and expected to comply with all applicable University policies and procedures, including but not limited to the personnel policies and other policies found in the University's Administrative Guide, http://adminguide.stanford.edu.<br><br></li></ul>As an organization that receives federal funding, Stanford University has a COVID-19 vaccination requirement that will apply to all university employees, including those working remotely in the United States and applicable subcontractors. To learn more about COVID policies and guidelines for Stanford University Staff, please visit https://cardinalatwork.stanford.edu/working-stanford/covid-19/interim-policies/covid-19-surveillance-testing-policy

companies_names: The Millennium Group, Where Service Matters
describtion: Now is a great time to join our growing company! The Millennium Group (TMG) is an award-winning business process outsourcing firm focused on print, mail, document scanning, reception, and related office support services for Fortune 500 companies, professional service firms, and institutions of higher education. TMG is looking for highly motivated, enthusiastic team players interested in a career rather than just a job. With a team of over 1,500 nationwide associates, TMG is seeking an individual who can uniquely contribute to our 30+ years of success in the industry.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Will cover positions in the mailroom or lobby or with the facilities team as needed. </li><li>Must have great customer service skills, be reliable and self-motivated. </li><li>Act as first point of contact for clients and guests. Greets customers, vendors, job applicants, associates from other locations, and other visitors with high degree of professionalism and courtesy. </li><li>Maintain safe and neat appearance of office reception area. </li><li>Take and relay messages; provide information and customer service to callers/guests. </li><li>Coordinate Video conferences, reserve visitor offices and oversee communal office meeting spaces. </li><li>Submit Facility requests for items that need to be repaired. </li><li>Receive, count and process all incoming items, letters and packages. </li><li>Deliver packages to departments and cubicles using P.D.A system to scan and sign for packages. </li><li>Prepare and package outgoing materials to prevent in-transit damage. </li><li>Prepare all appropriate shipping documentation. </li><li>Utilize postage machine to properly meter outbound mail. </li><li>Assist in maintaining office supplies inventory. </li><li>Deliver office supplies and copy paper and stock conference rooms and print copy stations. </li><li>Ability to commute to locations located in downtown San Francisco and Oakland. </li><li>Other duties as assigned. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>High School diploma or GED equivalent required. </li><li>1 to 2 years' experience in shipping &amp; receiving or mailroom preferred. </li><li>Facilities or facilities coordinator experience preferred. </li><li>Driving will be required at some of the work locations. </li><li>Must have reliable transportation to report to different work locations as needed. </li><li>Strong verbal communication and phone skills. </li><li>Consistently demonstrates professional demeanor, appearance and attitude. </li><li>Ability to appropriately handle confidential and highly sensitive material. </li><li>Proficiency in MS-Office: Word, Excel, Outlook, and Power Point.</li></ul>

Help Help <strong>Requirements</strong> <strong> Conditions of Employment</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You must be a U.S. citizen.</li><li>Selective Service - Males born after 12/31/59 must be registered or exempt from Selective Service see http://www.sss.gov/ </li><li>All Federal employees are required to participate in Direct Deposit/Electronic Funds Transfer for salary payments.</li><li>DHS uses e-Verify, an Internet-based system, to confirm the eligibility of all newly hired employees to work in the United States. Learn more about E-Verify , including your rights and responsibilities.</li><li>This position has been identified as a drug testing designated position (TDP) for purposes of the CISA's Drug-Free Workplace Program. All applicants tentatively selected for this position will be required to submit to a drug test to screen for illicit/illegal drug use prior to receiving a final offer of employment. A final offer of employment is contingent upon a negative drug test result. After appointment, you may be subject to periodic random drug testing.</li><li>You must be able to obtain and maintain a security clearance suitable for Federal employment as determined by a background investigation. This may include a credit check, a review of financial issues, as well as certain criminal offenses and illegal use or possession of drugs.</li><li>Current Federal employees must meet time-in-grade requirements.</li><li>One-year probationary period may be required.</li><li>This position may be designated as essential personnel. Essential personnel must be able to serve during continuity of operation events without regard to declarations of liberal leave or government closures due to weather, protests, and acts of terrorism or lack of funding. Failure to report for or remain in this position may result in disciplinary or adverse action in accordance with applicable laws, rules, and regulations (5 U.S.C. 7501-7533 and 5 CFR Part 752, as applicable).</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>To be considered minimally qualified for this position, you must demonstrate that you have the required experience for the respective grade level in which you are applying.</strong><p><br></p><u><strong>You qualify for the GS-13 grade level, if you have:</strong></u><p><br></p><strong>EXPERIENCE: </strong>At least one (1) year of specialized experience at the GS-12 grade level (or equivalent) performing the following duties:<p><br></p><ul><li>Managing multiple office administrative systems and tasks including travel, overseeing the Executive Secretariat process, shipping and receiving, Web Time and Attendance, Human Capital, Performance and Learning Management System, fleet vehicle management, and liaison to property/facility management;</li><li>Providing analysis and advice to senior management on the evaluation of government programs and operations; AND</li><li>Interpreting administrative laws, policies, regulations, and precedents applicable to the region.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>National Service Experience</strong> (i.e., volunteer experience): Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.<p><br></p><strong>Time-in-Grade Requirements: </strong>Under competitive merit promotion procedures, any individual who is currently holding, or who has held within the previous 52 weeks, a General Schedule position under a non-temporary appointment in the competitive or excepted service, must meet "time-in-grade" requirements (have served 52 weeks at the next lower grade of the grade for which you are applying).<p><br></p><strong>Time After Competitive Appointment:</strong> By the closing date specified in this job announcement, current Federal civilian employees must wait at least 90 days after their latest non-temporary appointment from a competitive service referral certificate before promotion, transfer, reinstatement, reassignment, or detail.<p><br></p><strong>All qualification requirements, including Time-in-Grade, must be met by the closing date of this announcement. Qualification AND Time-in-Grade claims will be subject to verification.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Education</strong><p><br></p>Some federal jobs allow you to substitute your education for the required experience in order to qualify. For this job, you must meet the qualification requirement using experience alone--no substitution of education for experience is permitted.<p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Information</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Permanent Change of Duty Station (PCS) Expenses will not be paid.</li><li>Other incentives may be authorized.</li><li>If you receive a conditional offer of employment for this position, you will be required to complete an Optional Form 306, Declaration for Federal Employment , and to sign and certify the accuracy of all information in your application, prior to entry on duty. False statements on any part of the application may result in withdrawal of offer of employment, dismissal after beginning work, fine, or imprisonment.</li><li>This position has been designated excluded from bargaining unit representation under the national security provision of 5 U.S.C. 7112(B)(6).</li><li>Under provisions of the Civil Service Reform Act, first time supervisors and/or managers will be required to serve a one-year probationary period. You may also be required to complete an appropriate supervisory training course within one year of assignment to this position.</li></ul> <strong>Reasonable Accommodation Requests: </strong>This agency provides reasonable accommodation to applicants with a disability covered under the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process, contact the CISA Office of Equity, Diversity, Inclusion and Accessibility (OEDIA) by sending an email to CISAOEDIAFO@cisa.dhs.gov and accommodations@hq.dhs.gov with the subject line, "Reasonable Accommodation Request @CISA." In the email itself, you <strong>must </strong>include your name, vacancy announcement number(s), and state your intent to seek a reasonable accommodation. Decisions on requests for Reasonable Accommodations are made on a case-by-case basis. For more information, please go to the Reasonable Accommodations at DHS website.<p><br></p><strong>Current or Former Political Appointees</strong>: The Office of Personnel Management (OPM) must authorize employment offers made to current or former political appointees. If you are currently, or have been within the last 5 years, a political Schedule A, Schedule C, Non-career SES or Presidential Appointee employee in the Executive Branch, you must disclose this information to the Human Resources Office.<p><br></p><strong>Shared Certificate:</strong> When CISA completes their selections, the remaining list of qualified candidates may be shared with other DHS Component agencies who are hiring for similar positions. You will have an opportunity to opt-in if you would like your name, application materials, and assessment results shared to be considered for employment with other DHS Component agencies. There is no guarantee of further consideration, and you can continue to explore other job opportunity announcements.<p><br></p>Read more<p><br></p><ul><li> Help Help A career with the U.S. government provides employees with a comprehensive benefits package. As a federal employee, you and your family will have access to a range of benefits that are designed to make your federal career very rewarding. Opens in a new window Learn more about federal benefits .</li></ul><p><br></p>Review our benefits<p><br></p>Eligibility for benefits depends on the type of position you hold and whether your position is full-time, part-time or intermittent. Contact the hiring agency for more information on the specific benefits offered.

We are one of the leading marketing and sales firms in the Hayward area. Our Entry Level Client Coordinators work together in a fast-paced environment to create excitement and interest in the outreach campaigns we carry out. The Full Time, Entry Level Client Coordinator will assist with the expansion of our newest client, which is one of the largest telecommunication producers in the world.<p><br></p>The Entry Level Client Coordinator will focus on community outreach, interacting directly with people, and should be adaptable as we test and compare various marketing strategies to bring our clients the best results possible. To continue expanding our clients' reach in the Hayward area, the Client Coordinator will focus on lead generation, client acquisition, sales, and customer service. Entry Level Client Coordinators receive full marketing and sales training with the opportunity to move into a management role within our team.<p><br></p><strong>Entry Level Client Coordinator Responsibilities </strong>:<p><br></p><ul><li>Comply with all client marketing and sales guidelines</li><li>Effectively communicate product knowledge to prospective customers</li><li>Engaging with consumers and effectively educating them to drive sale</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Entry Level Client Coordinator Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>1-2 years of marketing, sales, or customer service experience</li><li>Strong desire to continue learning and developing professional skill sets</li><li>Exceptional customer service and communication skills</li><li>Positive attitude and competitive spirit</li><li>Ability to stand for extended periods of time</li><li>Able to problem-solve effectively</li><li>Ability to work in a fast-paced marketing and sales environment</li><li>Comfortable speaking in front of both small and large groups</li><li>Strong desire to work in the management/ marketing or sales field</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>Ywbz0MlrR7<p><br></p>

<strong>Company Description</strong><p><br></p>As a leading healthcare education organization, Unitek Learning’s family of schools helps thousands of students launch and accelerate their careers every year. As a rapidly growing and highly successful company, Unitek is also a great place to pursue a rewarding and challenging career. We offer a competitive salary, generous benefits, unlimited growth potential, and a collegiate work environment.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>We are looking for an Admissions Representative to join our team. This will be a HYBRID position. Some work will occur on campus and some work can be done remotely.<p><br></p>Under direct supervision, this position will recruit qualified students for the college’s academic programs in a compliant, appropriate and professional manner. Provide basic information, routine guidance and assistance to potential students on matters related to enrollment and the admissions process. Evaluate and resolve student inquiries, issues, and problems, and ensure appropriate action is taken to the satisfaction of the student, Unitek College, and/or relevant regulatory agencies. Uphold enrollment standards by complying with related governmental regulations and standards of accreditation, and by enrolling only students who meet eligibility requirements as published in the college’s catalog. Demonstrate positive attitude and motivation, concern for students, teamwork, excellent time management skills and the work ethic to follow-through on commitment to students and the organization. This position exists to ensure the timely payment of benefits and administration of claims in compliance with state law.<p><br></p><strong>What You Will Do</strong><p><br></p>Deliver basic to intermediate administrative support to Claims Examiners.<p><br></p><ul><li>Contacts insured or other involved persons to obtain necessary information to process claim.</li><li>Documents conversations or information on appropriate enterprise resource planning (ERP) system.</li><li>Organizes and works with Examiner using computer to enter, access, search and retrieve data.</li><li>Stays current with diary tasks and procedural changes.</li></ul><p><br></p>Imparts exceptional customer service to internal and external customers, including insureds.<p><br></p><ul><li>Provides information to insured, injured worker or providing referrals to outside vendors as requested by the Examiner.</li><li>Processes claims for indemnity payments and state mandated forms.</li><li>Processes non-medical payments.</li><li>Organizes and works with Examiner using computer to enter, access, search, and retrieve data.</li></ul><p><br></p>Assist Claims Examiner with complete post-claims resolution and related administrative projects.<p><br></p><ul><li>Schedules appropriate medical appointments, calculate mileage and send appointment letter reminders.</li><li>Interaction with nurse on case management regarding return to work status.</li><li>Support Claims Examiners in the preparation, processing and monitoring of payments. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You Bring To The Role</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>High school diploma or general education degree (GED), required. </li><li>Minimum 1 year of related experience and/or training; or, equivalent combination of education and experience. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge And Skills</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Solid customer service, phone and time management skills.</li><li>Intermediate Microsoft Office Suite: Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint as well as the ability to learn enterprise resources planning (ERP) software. </li><li>Excellent data entry, strong attention to detail and ability to prioritize assignments.</li><li>Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals.</li><li>Ability to compute rate, ratio and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.</li><li>Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed but uninvolved written or oral instructions.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation</strong><p><br></p>The hourly range listed for this position, $18.6515 to $29.4119, is exclusive of fringe benefits and potential bonuses. If hired at ICW Group, your final base salary compensation will be determined by factors such as skills, experience and/or education. In addition, we believe in the importance of pay equity and consider internal equity of our current team members as part of any final offer. We typically do not hire at the maximum of the range in order to allow for future and continued salary growth. We also offer a substantial benefits package outlined below.<p><br></p><strong>WHY JOIN ICW GROUP? </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Challenging work and the ability to make a difference</li><li>You will have a voice and feel a sense of belonging</li><li>We offer a competitive benefits package, with generous medical, dental, and vision plans as well as 401K retirement plans and company match</li><li>Bonus potential for all positions</li><li>Paid Time Off with an accrual rate of 5.23 hours per pay period (equal to 17 days per year)</li><li>10 paid holidays throughout the calendar year</li><li>Want to continue learning? We’ll support you 100%</li></ul><p><br></p>ICW Group is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. ICW Group will not discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex/gender, age, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.<p><br></p>

<strong>Company Description</strong><p><br></p>As a leading healthcare education organization, Unitek Learning’s family of schools helps thousands of students launch and accelerate their careers every year. As a rapidly growing and highly successful company, Unitek is also a great place to pursue a rewarding and challenging career. We offer a competitive salary, generous benefits, unlimited growth potential, and a collegiate work environment.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>We are looking for an Admissions Representative to join our team. This will be a HYBRID position. Some work will occur on campus and some work can be done remotely.<p><br></p>Under direct supervision, this position will recruit qualified students for the college’s academic programs in a compliant, appropriate and professional manner. Provide basic information, routine guidance and assistance to potential students on matters related to enrollment and the admissions process. Evaluate and resolve student inquiries, issues, and problems, and ensure appropriate action is taken to the satisfaction of the student, Unitek College, and/or relevant regulatory agencies. Uphold enrollment standards by complying with related governmental regulations and standards of accreditation, and by enrolling only students who meet eligibility requirements as published in the college’s catalog. Demonstrate positive attitude and motivation, concern for students, teamwork, excellent time management skills and the work ethic to follow-through on commitment to students and the organization. Use Company approved Admissions materials during telephone calls, interviews and enrollment process. Observe and adhere to all company polices and best practices. Exercise judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate course of action.<p><br></p><strong>Building Relationships</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Take inquiry calls from all potential students interested in knowing or receiving information about the programs—including entrance requirements, curricula and academic standards—and encourage qualified prospects to schedule an appointment for an interview</li><li>Return web inquiries and calls promptly to all potential students and give accurate information about the programs, including entrance requirements, curricula and academic standards</li><li>Make outbound phone calls to potential students that have expressed interest in attending the institution. Outbound calling efforts are a key component of this role</li><li>Participation in organized phone-a-thons and dialing campaigns according to company best practices is required and is an essential part of day-to-day activity</li><li>Initiate unsolicited leads and generate new business when not responding to outstanding inquiries or working with current prospective students</li><li>Follow up on all inquiries that fail to schedule or show for an interview</li><li>Follow up with interviews that did not progress in the enrollment process and dropped/cancelled students to resolve any issues or address concerns</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Interviews</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Schedule and conduct student interviews, wherein any reference to Financial Aid complies with the stated Company Policy</li><li>Utilize only approved company materials during the interview process, and conduct interviews according to the stated policies and process at all times</li><li>Meet with the potential students to explain the program offering and match the college’s benefits and advantages to the student’s needs. Discuss and advise suitable programs in accordance with the student’s desires, qualifications and objectives</li><li>Make all efforts to ensure that admissions management meets with the potential student and is well informed about the student’s motivations and concerns about attending the college</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Mentoring and Guidance</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Provide basic information and routine advice, guidance and assistance to students using established procedures and policies on available programs and eligibility requirements, including the application of policies, procedures and documentation regarding the admissions process</li><li>Serve as a liaison between student and campus, and make all necessary enrollment forms available and assist in completion as needed (including reviewing applications and related documentation for compliance, partnering with Finance to ensure a high level of customer service during the transition, and following up to ensure that financial aid packaging is complete)</li><li>Mentor and advise students to help them identify their unique skills and interests</li><li>Address any easily-resolved inquiries, questions, concerns or issues (may refer more difficult issues to a more experienced staff member),and ensure appropriate action is taken to the satisfaction of the student, Company, and/or regulatory agencies in compliance with policy, procedures and legal requirements</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Administrative</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Accurately account for all inquiries and the admissions activity associated with all Inquiries</li><li>Complete daily activity reports</li><li>Ensure that all pre-start paperwork is completed accurately and in a timely manner</li><li>Keep all required reports current and accurate, including information stored in the system</li><li>Attend and successfully complete all training for this position, as required at any time by the Company</li><li>Perform other duties as assigned by local leaders</li><li>Attend meetings as directed by supervisor</li></ul><p><br></p>Pay Range: $55000-$59000/yr<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Internal hire: minimum 1 year as Admissions Representative Campus Associate</li><li>External hire: minimum 2 years customer service, telemarketing or sales experience(including admissions experience)</li><li>Demonstrated ability to fulfill Company Key Behaviors</li><li>Excellent presentation skills</li><li>Bachelor’s degree preferred</li><li>Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite: Word, Excel, Outlook</li><li>Ability to work assigned/flexible hours necessary to complete the job on a weekly basis</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Additional Information</strong><p><br></p><strong>We Offer:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Medical, Dental and Vision starting the 1st of the month following 30 days of employment</li><li>2 Weeks’ starting Vacation per year. Increasing based on years of service with company</li><li>10 paid Holidays and 1 Floating Holiday</li><li>401K with a Company Match</li><li>Company Paid Life Insurance at 1x’s your annual salary</li><li>Leadership development and training for career advancement</li><li>Tuition assistance and Forgiveness for you and your family up to 100% depending on program</li></ul>

<strong>Warehouse - Data Entry Specialist 1<br><br>Oakland, CA<br><br>$18.50/hr<br><br>8:00am - 4:30pm, M-F<br><br></strong>Job Description: Most work is seated but involves intensive and constant keying of information into data system. Employee carries one carton of documents to/from pallet to computer workstation on average every 5-7 minutes. Carton weight ranges from 30-50 lbs. Carry distance may be up to 15-20 feet. Hand height for pulling or returning carton to pallet ranges from 13” to 45”.<br><br>Protective footwear is required and shall meet ASTM F2413-11 "Standard Specification for Performance Requirements for Protective ( Safety) Toe Cap Footwear” and have a slip-resistant rating designated as "Better or Best”<br><br><strong><u>Job Summary/Work Schedule<br><br></u></strong>Normal Work Schedule: 5 days a week, 9 hours a day including 30-minute lunch and two 15-minute breaks.<br><br>Description of position and job requirements: The Data Entry Specialist pulls individual medical files from the storage box, identifies required data fields from each file, and enters that information into the database for the client. One box at a time is carried to the workstation, where individual files are pulled and data is entered. When all files have been reviewed, they are returned to the box, which is in turn carried back to the pallet. Maximum storage height on each pallet is 5 boxes. Except for the periods when boxes are physically being moved (5% of time), work is performed from a seated position (95% of time).<br><br>Performance is measured based on the number of key strokes.<br><br><strong><u>Essential Functions<br></u></strong><ul><li> Must maintain consistent high frequency of keystrokes (10,000 kph), with 100% accuracy confirmed by 'double key' verification</li><li> Carry cartons ranging in weight from 30-50# for distances up to 20 feet on a frequency of one box every 5-7 minutes</li><li> Lift and lower cartons from/to pallet and from/to workstation. Cartons range in weight from 30-50#, with lift heights ranging from 13” to 45”, on a frequency of one box every 5-7 minutes<br></li></ul>*Attire must be presentable and appropriate for the working environment*

<strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong>Robert Half currently has a open position for a Payroll Clerk at a dynamic company. In this role, you will be required to support the Payroll department in a variety of duties, including data entry, reconciliation of timecards, paycheck distribution and providing statements to various departments. You should have the capability to effectively communicate with both the internal team and outside customers. This Payroll Clerk position offers the tremendous opportunity to work with an industry leader and company that offers a strong career growth trajectory. This permanent position is a terrific opportunity and is based in the Livermore, California area.<br><br>Major responsibilities<br><ul><li> Maintain office efficiency by fulfilling clerical duties such as filing, scanning, faxing, photocopying, etc.</li><li> Make reports easily accessible by administer/saving them as instructed</li><li> Produce and run custom reports</li><li> Other duties as assigned</li><li> Obtain timesheet approvals by contacting employees via email and phone</li><li> Comprise data into spreadsheets and the payroll system</li><li> Maintain payroll operations by training/instructing employees in the proper use of payroll-related systems including entry of timesheets, online access of pay statements, etc.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> Qualified in Payroll software</li><li> Enthusiasm when it comes to learning new systems and ideas</li><li> 1+ years of previous payroll experience</li><li> Excellent verbal, written, and social skills</li><li> Excellent attention to detail</li><li> Data entry, document management, file creation and previous records experience required</li><li> Strong organization skills</li><li> Strong familiarity with construction project accounting</li><li> Union payroll experience</li><li> Comprehensive knowledge of payroll for under 100 employees<br></li></ul>Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.<br><br>Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity – even on the go.<br><br>All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be legally authorized to work in the United States. This candidate will have exposure to working cross-functionally with many internal groups including: App Store Business Management, Editorial, Marketing, Operations, Production, in addition to working with some of the largest App Store developers on the platform.<br><br><br><br>Location: Los Angeles, Santa Clara Valley (could also be remote)<br><br><br><br>Skills: Organizational Effectiveness, Strategic Communications, Cross Functional Leadership, Project Management,<br><br><br><br>Nice to have: Partner Management, Mobile Apps, Business Analytics<br><br><br><br>Key Qualifications<br><br><br><br>2-3 years of experience across partnership management, project management or product management<br><br>Excellent communication skills and proven track record of professionalism with external facing clients / developers<br><br>Deep curiosity about the mobile apps ecosystem, with a passion for video streaming content<br><br>Exceptional problem-solving and analytical stills, with strong attention to detail<br><br>Strong ability to work cross-functionally and within a matrixed org<br><br>Demonstrated ability to develop and deliver great presentations<br><br>Positive, hard-working attitude with the ability to work independently<br><br><br><br>Description<br><br><br><br>Meet and build close relationships with top app developers<br><br>Partner with App Store Business Managers to advocate for developer promotion on the App Store<br><br>Ensure the App Store Editorial team is aware and leaning into the latest and greatest content for our customers<br><br>Manage program support and content coordination for top App Store content; inclusive of roadmap management, data input, information sharing with cross-functional teams, partner approvals, post-campaign reporting and more.

<strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong> Become our next marketing/membership coordinator at our Palo Alto Junior Museum! </strong><p><br></p>Our Marketing/Membership coordinator will assist with the marketing of a children’s zoo and museum and its programs and special events..Must be available to work weekdays and weekends.<p><br></p>The Palo Alto Junior Museum &amp; Zoo is a place where children and their caregivers come to learn, explore, play, discover, and get curious about science and nature. Learn more about our Palo Alto JMZ HERE.<p><br></p><strong>This is an SEIU Hourly (limited-benefits) position that is budgeted to not exceed 1,000 hours per fiscal year. The number of hours per week and schedule will be determined based on assignment.</strong><p><br></p>Essential Duties<p><br></p><strong>Essential and other important responsibilities and duties may include, but are not limited to, the following:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develops and distributes digital and print collateral to publicize museum programs, public hours, exhibits, and special events.</li><li>Works with Supervisor to develop social media strategy and with staff and intern to create posts for Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and other popular channels.</li><li>Prepares monthly reports summarizing market analytics. Assists supervisor in preparing reports.</li><li>Maintains contact lists for constituents-families, schools, partner organizations and other organizations through which the museum advertises programs, exhibits and events.</li><li>Participates in staff meetings to identify marketing needs and opportunities.</li><li>Works with Supervisor and online ticketing system to support and manage membership renewal process.</li></ul><strong>Related Functions:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Implement Departmental goals and objectives with respect to marketing.</li><li>Perform related duties and responsibilities as required.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Sufficient education, training and/or work experience to demonstrate possession of the following which would typically be acquired through:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Two years marketing or communication experience.</li></ul><strong>Ideal candidate qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> AA degree or Bachelor's with emphasis on marketing or communication preferred. </li><li>Excellent written skills.</li><li>Some graphic design ability preferred.</li></ul><strong>Special Requirements: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>TB Testing</li><li>Valid Driver’s License</li></ul><p><br></p>The City of Palo Alto is an Equal Opportunity Employer. In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act, the City will provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities and encourages both prospective and current employees to discuss potential accommodations with the employer.<p><br></p>City of Palo Alto offers the following benefits to those in a SEIU Hourly position:<p><br></p>Medical Stipend<p><br></p>$3.34 effective the pay period including July 1, 2018.<p><br></p>$3.41 effective the pay period including July 1, 2019.<p><br></p>$3.48 effective the pay period including July 1, 2020.<p><br></p>Sick Leave<p><br></p>Earn .03 hour of sick leave for each hour worked.<p><br></p>Retirement<p><br></p>City of Palo Alto PST (Part-time, Seasonal &amp; Temporary Employees) Retirement Plan<p><br></p>Please note: The City does not participate in CA State Disability Insurance (SDI) or Social Security.<p><br></p>Closing Date/Time: Continuous

weekly paychecks </li><li> Health, dental, vision, and life insurance </li><li> 401(k) savings plan </li><li> Awards and recognition programs </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Maxim Healthcare Services</u></strong><p><br></p>Maxim Healthcare Services has been making a difference in the lives of our patients, caregivers, employees and communities for more than 30 years. This position is part of the Eligibility, Recruitment, Selection, Enrollment and Attendance (ERSEA) Head Start/Early Head Start team, within the Child Development Program at Wu Yee Children’s Services. Primary duties consists of reviewing, tracking and coding attendance for the Head Start/ Early Head Start Center based program options and the Early Head Start Family Child Care Program option. Duties also entail preparation of reports on attendance and daily communication with center staff for tracking attendance. This is a full-time position, M-F, 8:00am-4:30pm or 8:30am-5:00pm.<br><br><strong>NOT A REMOTE POSITION<br><br></strong><strong>Location:<br></strong><ul><li>880 Clay St. San Francisco CA, team meetings</li><li>Other duties as assigned<br><br></li></ul><strong>Knowledge/Experience/Skills Required: <br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Business Administration preferred.</li><li>Minimum of 2 years data entry experience required.</li><li>Self-motivated and able to work both independently and in a team setting.</li><li>Strong organizational skills, including
