describtion: <strong>Research Administrator 1225944</strong><p><br></p>A leading University is seeking a Research Administrator. The successful candidate will support faculty sponsored research as well as finance activities related to the school and its associated centers. The ideal candidate has basic knowledge of governmental regulations, and familiarity with federal grant applications (e.g., National Science Foundation, US Department of Education). The company offers a <strong>great work environment!</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Research Administrator Pay And Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Hourly pay: $45/hr </li><li>Worksite: Leading University (Palo Alto, CA 94305)</li><li>W2 Employment, Retirement Savings Program </li><li>20 hours/week, 2 Month Assignment, Possible extension/conversion</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Research Administrator Responsibilities</u></strong>  <ul><li>Manage the proposal preparation and/or post award activities on grants, contracts, program projects, and federal grants, both routine and complex. </li><li> Research Administration:</li><ul><li>Participate with the principal investigator in the preparation of the administrative components of proposals within the parameters of sponsored and non-sponsored research guidelines. </li><li>Oversee and communicate the submission process, both paper and electronic; review documents for completeness and compliance.</li><li>Develop, prepare, and finalize project budgets, and provide budget justification.</li><li>Serve as liaison and active partner between principal investigators, Office of Sponsored Research, research groups, and other departments; respond to sponsor inquiries. </li><li>Collaborate with the Office of Sponsored Research to ensure awards are set up properly and cost-sharing requirements are fulfilled; initiate cost transfers.</li><li>Review and approve expenditures, advise on post-award spending and commitment activity, and oversee compliance related to funds and revenue.</li><li>Develop and communicate reports supporting project status; create effective forecasting and decision aides.</li><li>Understand, apply, and advise on university and government policies for projects.</li><li>Serve as a resource on the subject area and overall technical resource to the principal investigator and other university staff.</li><li>Participate in and contribute to process improvements. Lead other staff in group projects.</li><li>May participate as a mentor and provide cross-training as needed, may cover for other research/finance administrators as needed.</li></ul><li> Finance:</li><ul><li>Review and approve transactions (credit card purchases, expense requests, journals, and fund transfers) to ensure compliance with our business expense policies.</li><li>Review and manage service agreement submissions.</li><li>Support regular reporting and auditing.</li><li>Manage labor schedules and process labor distribution adjustments.</li><li>Perform and design ad-hoc analyses of large complex data sets; reconcile complex accounts.</li><li>Construct and assemble data for budgeting and decision-making; develop conclusions, and present high-level summary of recommendations. May develop the annual budget for individual department/unit.</li><li>Participate as a member of a project team; support new initiatives.</li><li>Develop and maintain desktop procedures and process documentation for area of responsibility.</li><li>Respond to questions from community members regarding our finance policies and procedures. </li></ul></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Research Administrator Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>3 years of job related experience, or a combination of education and relevant experience. </li><li>Bachelor's degree.</li><li>Pre- and post-award grants management experience.</li><li>Proposal budgeting and submissions experience.</li><li>Basic knowledge of governmental regulations, and familiarity with federal grant applications (e.g., National Science Foundation, US Department of Education).</li><li>Advanced knowledge and application of internal policies, external regulations, precedents, and systems. </li><li>Ability to understand, interpret, and communicate policies and procedures.</li><li>Excellent oral, written, and communication skills.</li><li>Excellent analytical skills; demonstrated proficiency in Excel and web-based tools.</li><li>Strong accounting and grant budgeting skills; knowledge of accounting principles.</li><li>Knowledge of procurement needs, including sole sourcing, cost analyses, vendor requirements, and small business reporting.</li><li>Knowledge of property management requirements related to our University or non- our University title of equipment and fabrications.</li><li>Competency in project management.</li><li>Extreme attention to detail.</li><li>Ability to work well independently, but also to seek or offer assistance when needed.</li><li>Ability to review a proposal or manage a project with understanding of the overall scope and goal of each sponsored project.</li><li>Excellent time management and organizational skills.</li><li>Knowledge of finance systems.</li></ul><p><br></p>Compensation: From $45.00 to $45.00 per hour

<strong>Job Title: </strong>Office Admin<p><br></p><strong>Department: </strong>People Ops<p><br></p><strong><strong>Job Level: </strong></strong>L3/L4<p><br></p><strong><strong>FLSA: </strong></strong>Exempt<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p><em>An office admin plays a crucial role in overseeing the operations of our Redwood City office. You will utilize your skills as a highly organized and detail-oriented individual to provide a safe, efficient and engaging work environment. You will be responsible for </em><em>managing building access and safety, planning company events, maintaining office and food/lunch services, managing vendors, and providing general administrative support.</em><p><br></p><strong><u>Key Duties/Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Be onsite 9-5 to oversee day-to-day office operations and provide general administrative support at RWC office.</li><li>Greet visitors, receive packages, respond to mail &amp; calls.</li><li>Maintain facilities and reception keeping the office clean and presentable. Work with engineering &amp; operations to ensure a cohesive environment between office and warehouse. </li><li>Purchase office supplies and equipment and maintain proper stock levels.</li><li>Own the weekly All Hands presentation. Create the company-wide presentation and host as part of the people opes team</li><li>Maintain kitchen supplies, snacks &amp; beverages. Daily lunches for onsite staff.</li><li>Act as the primary point of contact for external vendors and service providers, including the building management , maintenance and cleaning services, food and beverage vendors, and other related service providers.</li><li>Coordinate team building, social activities &amp; holiday party for RWC employees. </li><li>Collect and prepare information for onsite meetings with staff and outside parties</li><li>Support the People Ops team with office projects like workspace improvements, new hires &amp; SWAG.</li><li>Synchronize interview schedules with recruiting staff and welcome onsite interview candidates. </li><li>Assist with coordinating interviews and travel arrangements, completing expense and mileage reports for executive staff. </li><li>Performs other related duties as assigned. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Abilities &amp; Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Proficient with Google Drive, Confluence, Slack, Zoom, Canva, and Concur. Ability to help design and edit graphic presentations and materials.</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills. Great customer service skills</li><li>Exceptional organizational skills and impeccable attention to detail.</li><li>High degree of courtesy and professionalism in dealing with people, from Board members to interview candidates. </li><li>Thrive in a do-it-yourself, start-up environment.</li><li>Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.</li><li>Ability to work across multiple time zones. </li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Education/Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree or 5+ years of office administration or executive assistant experience</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Physical Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><em>The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.</em><p><br></p><ul><li>Prolonged periods of sitting/standing at a desk and working on a computer. The employee routinely is required to sit; stand, walk; talk and hear; use hands to keyboard</li><li>Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.</li><li>Ability to lift 30 lbs. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits Summary</u></strong><ul><li>We hire the best, not only will you be surrounded by exceptionally smart and motivated people, but we believe excellent compensation and benefits are an essential part of our company's success.</li><ul><li>HDHP &amp; PPO Medical plan options</li><li>Dental/Vision</li><li>401K &amp; Roth Match options</li><li>Stock Options</li><li>4 Months Parental Leave</li><li>STD/LTD Life Insurance </li><li>Employee Assistance Programs </li><li>Fitness Reimbursement </li><li>Provided Daily Lunch </li><li>Free Snacks/Beverages</li><li>Work Schedule flexibility</li><li>Cell phone / internet reimbursement</li><li>Employee bonus programs</li></ul></ul><p><br></p>The pay range for this position is $60K - $85K base pay. Pay is dependent on the applicant's relevant experience.<p><br></p><strong><em>Bear Robotics, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion or religious creed, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, military or veteran status, citizenship, or other characteristics protected by state or federal law or local ordinance.</em></strong>

BuildZoom is the leading online marketplace for residential remodeling and construction services, a huge market that is ripe for disruption and that accounts for $500B in annual expenditures. Backed by top investors (Founders Fund, Y Combinator, 8VC), we guide homeowners through the challenge of finding and hiring the right contractor for their project, saving them time, money, and stress.<p><br></p>We are looking for a talented individual to join our Growth team, which leverages both organic, paid and outbound channels to drive a large volume of consumer demand into the marketplace. As a Growth Operations Associate, you’ll be responsible for coordinating efforts and acting as a force multiplier to improve the operations behind a suite of demand channels including content marketing (SEO), SEM, and our affiliate network.<p><br></p>Key Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Improve content marketing efforts by analyzing and optimizing the operational efficiency of our content marketing team and ensuring alignment of its topical focus with our highest yield markets and topic areas</li><li>Drive forward and prioritize a range of initiatives focused on improving lead generation and utilization efforts in collaboration with leadership, product/engineering, and our go-to-market (GTM) teams</li><li>Rigorously track KPI’s and work closely with our GTM and product/engineering teams to meet monthly demand and fulfillment targets</li><li>Build and maintain reporting/dashboards and consistently communicate the efficacy of various initiatives to leadership and relevant stakeholders</li><li>Dive deep into the underlying data to develop a more comprehensive understanding of channel unit economics, funnel performance, and identify growth opportunities<br><br></li></ul>Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li>Undergraduate degree in a quantitative field preferred</li><li>2+ years of experience in an analytical role (eg consulting, finance, bizops). Bonus points for growth and/or operations experience in a startup environment</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to clearly articulate complex issues and solutions</li><li>Advanced spreadsheet skills are a must, experience with SQL preferred (or a willingness to learn)<br><br></li></ul>Applicants have rights under Federal Employment Laws.<p><br></p>If a disability prevents you from applying for a job through our website, please contact careers@buildzoom.com.

<strong>About Us</strong><p><br></p>Rooted in the 1960s era of glamorous travel, Le Méridien remains a gathering place for people to savor the good life and delight in the discovery of destinations worldwide. Le Méridien San Francisco, located in the Financial District, offers a truly unique experience in every one of its 360 stylish guest rooms and suites. Our goal is to delight our guests with the element of discovery. We are seeking associates who enjoy exceeding guest expectations and strive to deliver a playfully sophisticated level of service. We offer competitive benefits for all associates including a comprehensive medical plan, free employee meal per shift, discounted public transportation, all associate outings, and more.<p><br></p>An opportunity to help rebrand and transition into Marriott’s Autograph Collection portfolio, a completely renovated and redesigned luxury destination, creating the newest jewel of San Francisco’s Embarcadero/Jackson Square/FiDi neighborhood. Oh, and we have fun, work hard and laugh a lot. This is an exciting time in the hotel’s history – you should be part of it!<p><br></p>Don't meet every single requirement of this job? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At HEI we are dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to still send in your information. You may be the perfect candidate for this or for other roles within our organization!<p><br></p>We value U.S. military experience and invite all qualified military candidates to apply.<p><br></p><strong>Overview</strong><p><br></p>An opportunity to help rebrand and transition into Marriott’s Autograph Collection portfolio, a completely renovated and redesigned luxury destination, creating the newest jewel of San Francisco’s Embarcadero/Jackson Square/FiDi neighborhood. Oh, and we have fun, work hard and laugh a lot. This is an exciting time in the hotel’s history – you should be part of it!<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Create spreadsheets to track important customer information and orders.</li><li>Transfer data from hard copy to a digital database.</li><li>Update customer information in a database.</li><li>Organize existing data in a spreadsheet.</li><li>Verify outdated data and make any necessary changes to records.</li><li>Operate common office equipment, like scanners and printers.</li><li>Search for and investigate information contained in files.</li><li>Perform regular database backups to secure data.</li><li>Input text-based and numerical information from source documents.</li><li>Provide occasional administrative support.</li><li>Sort and organize hard copies of paperwork after entering data electronically.</li><li>Review data for deficiencies or errors.</li><li>Assist with special projects that require large amounts of data entry.</li><li>Provide data entry support across departments on an ad-hoc basis.</li><li>Type in data quickly and efficiently.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Hotel experience preferred. </li><li> High School Diploma, Bachelor's Degree preferred. </li><li> Basic administrative knowledge such as business letters, formats and telephone etiquette. </li><li> Ability to effectively deal with internal and external customers, some of whom will require high levels of patience, tact and diplomacy. </li><li> Ability to access and accurately input information into a computer using Microsoft Office Suite. </li><li> Ability to follow written and verbal instructions. </li><li> Ability to stand and/or sit and continuously perform essential job functions for duration of shift with or without reasonable accommodation. </li><li> Ability to set-up and maintain filing systems. </li><li> Effective verbal and written communication skills. Ability to adapt communication style to suit different audiences, such as effectively communicating with supervisors, coworkers, public etc. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p>HEI Hotels and Resorts is committed to providing a comprehensive benefit program that offers you choices for your physical, mental and financial wellness, creating value in your most important investment - you!<p><br></p>For your physical and mental wellness we offer competitive Medical and Dental programs through Anthem Blue Cross Blue Shield as well as Vision insurance programs through EyeMed. Our Vacation, Sick and Holiday programs are available for you to rejuvenate with time off. For your financial wellness, HEI provides a wide array of coverage, including Supplemental, Spousal and Child Life insurance as well as Short and Long-Term Disability plans. Our 401(k) Savings Plan with matching funds, and discounts through our 'YouDecide' and Hotel Room Discount programs provide additional incentives for choosing HEI as the employer of your future. Specific details and eligibility of these programs vary by location and employment status.<p><br></p>We proudly partner with DailyPay, a voluntary benefit that allows our associates access to their earnings when they want them.<p><br></p>HEI Hotels and Resorts is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

Learn about an exciting industry (market research) and have fun testing new products while earning a nice income Part-Time or Full-Time. Benefits: Very competitive pay rate Weekly pay Work around your own schedule Learn about an exciting industry Telecommute (you can work from home, work, or school) A paid Product Tester position is perfect for those looking for a 100% remote job, an entry-level opportunity, or seasonal, temporary, or part-time work. The hours are completely flexible, and no previous experience is necessary.<p><br></p>Our paid Product Testers come from all backgrounds and industries, ranging from customer service and sales to administrative assistants. If you are a manager, receptionist, warehouse or factory worker, driver, medical assistant, nurse, cleaner, college student, messenger, maid, teacher, retail associate, salesperson, secretary, server, janitor, cashier, contract worker, or intern who is looking for a flexible part-time or seasonal job, you should try paid Product Testing to supplement your income. Also, if you have been involved in accounting, clerical jobs, marketing, management, security, or data entry jobs, you may be a good fit for a fully remote paid Product Tester Position

Stanford University, one of Silicon Valley’s largest and unique employers, has immediate openings for Administrative Associates to provide administrative support to faculty in the School of Medicine. Stanford’s mission is to educate future leaders and promote interdisciplinary, world-class research and teaching. This passion makes Stanford an intensely creative and rewarding place to work. This is an excellent opportunity for a highly self-motivated learner willing and eager to take on new challenges in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.<br><br><strong>Duties Include<br></strong><ul><li>Respond to inquiries, and determine and take appropriate action as required. Serve as a resource regarding a defined set of policies and procedures.</li><li>Perform duties associated with scheduling, organizing, and operating conferences, seminars, and events, including recommending vendors for services, overseeing the production and distribution of materials, coordinating logistics, and serving as liaison with internal and external vendors.</li><li>Draft and/or generate routine communications; coordinate production (formatting, copying, etc.) and dissemination of documents, such as presentations, course handouts, grant proposals, conference and seminar materials, complex reports, brochures, and displays. </li><li>Plan and schedule calendar(s) based on consultation, resolve calendaring conflicts, and arrange travel in compliance with unit, university, and sponsor policies.</li><li>Process and monitor routine financial transactions, which may include researching and resolving discrepancies.</li><li>Maintain office supplies and equipment; obtain vendor quotations, as needed. Coordinate office moves. </li><li>May serve as the point of contact for general maintenance, health and safety, and other facility concerns within the unit(s); report any incidents or potential safety problems to appropriate representatives. Track completion of required training.</li><li> - Other duties may also be assigned<br><br></li></ul><strong>Desired Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Prior work experience in academic health care setting .</li><li>Prior experience with Stanford on-line ordering and financial reporting systems.</li><li>Knowledge of medical terminology.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Education &amp; Experience (required)<br><br></strong>High school diploma and three years of administrative experience, or combination of education and relevant experience.<br><br><strong>Knowledge, Skills And Abilities (required)<br></strong><ul><li>Proficient computer skills and demonstrated experience with office software and email applications.</li><li>Demonstrated success in following through and completing routine tasks.</li><li>Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. </li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills.</li><li>Ability to prioritize and multi-task. </li><li>Ability to handle highly confidential material and provide a highly professional, courteous and efficient point of contact.</li><li>Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment.<br><br></li></ul><strong>PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS*:<br></strong><ul><li>Constantly perform desk-based computer tasks.</li><li>Frequently sitting.</li><li>Occasionally stand/walk, reach/work above shoulders, grasp lightly/fine manipulation, grasp forcefully, use a telephone, sort/file paperwork or parts, lift/carry/push/pull objects that weigh up to 10 pounds.</li><li>Rarely twist/bend/stoop/squat, kneel/crawl.</li><li> Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Work Standards<br></strong><ul><li>Interpersonal Skills: Demonstrates the ability to work well with Stanford colleagues and clients and with external organizations.</li><li>Promote Culture of Safety: Demonstrates commitment to personal responsibility and value for safety; communicates safety concerns; uses and promotes safe behaviors based on training and lessons learned.</li><li>Subject to and expected to comply with all applicable University policies and procedures, including but not limited to the personnel policies and other policies found in the University's Administrative Guide, http://adminguide.stanford.edu.<br><br></li></ul><strong>The expected pay range for this position is $56,000 to $77,000 annually.<br><br>Stanford University provides pay ranges representing its good faith estimate of what the university reasonably expects to pay for a position. The pay offered to a selected candidate will be determined based on factors such as (but not limited to) the scope and responsibilities of the position, the qualifications of the selected candidate, departmental budget availability, internal equity, geographic location and external market pay for comparable jobs.</strong>

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:<p><br></p><ul><li> Customer service functions, including: greeting visitors, answering telephones, and guiding clients and their pets to exam rooms</li><li> Scheduling and confirming appointments</li><li> Placing outbound calls for follow-ups and reaching out to prospective clients</li><li> Presenting and explaining fees, including processing payments</li><li> Recommending, selecting, and obtaining products and services, including prescriptions</li><li> Answering questions regarding products and services, including educating clients on general animal husbandry and non-medical pet care (i.e., heartworm prevention, housebreaking, and flea &amp; tick control)</li><li> Managing medical records, charts, reports and correspondence QUALIFICATIONS:</li><li> At least one year of proven past experience helping customers</li><li> High School Diploma/GED or equivalent</li><li> Excellent listening and communication skills</li><li> Compassion for pets and people—as well as awareness and understanding of others’ reactions</li><li> Proven decision-making skills to choose the most appropriate course of action</li><li> The ability to integrate new information into problem-solving</li><li> Proficiency in Microsoft Office</li><li> Willingness to work non-traditional hours, including nights, weekends and holidays</li><li> The ability to lift up to 40 lbs. and be exposed to hazards associated with pets such as allergies, contagious diseases, noises, odors, bites, scratches, and animal waste BENEFITS: We offer competitive compensation along with a comprehensive benefits package, including, medical/dental/vision and paid vacation (for F/T employees only), 401(k), generous personal pet care discounts and more!If you are a current associate, you need to apply through our internal career site. Please log into Workday and click on the Career worklet on the landing page or search for Find Jobs. Benefits: We offer competitive compensation along with a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision and paid vacation/sick days, 401(k), generous employee pet discounts and more!</li></ul><p><br></p>The information in this position description indicates the general nature and level of work to be performed. It is not designed to be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of associates assigned to this job. Management reserves the right to revise the job description or require that other tasks be performed when the circumstances of the job change (for example, emergencies, change in personnel, workload, or technical development)<p><br></p>We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer - Veterans / Disabled. For a complete EEO statement please see our career page at vcacareers.com

This position will provide administrative and operational support to our new lab, the department training grant and department initiatives on diversity. The ideal candidate will have excellent interpersonal and computer skills and will be able to operate independently in multiple areas. Developmental Biology is one of the premier basic science departments in the country, attracting stellar graduate students and fellows who advance to positions as top scientists and academic leaders in their field.<p><br></p><strong><u>Duties Include</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Act on behalf of the supervisor or department manager in regards to establishing priorities and identifying and resolving problems that are administrative in nature.</li><li>Oversee and/or perform duties associated with scheduling, organizing, and operating complex conferences, seminars, and events, including arranging with vendors for services, overseeing the production and distribution of materials, administering logistics, and managing event within budget.</li><li>Compose and draft documents and correspondence for presentations, course handouts, grants, conferences, seminars, and reports; perform substantial editing and fact checking. communicates safety concerns; uses and promotes safe behaviors based on training and lessons learned.</li><li>Subject to and expected to comply with all applicable University policies and procedures, including but not limited to the personnel policies and other policies found in the University's Administrative Guide, .</li></ul> <em>The expected pay range for this position is $66,000 to $91,000 per annum. POSITION SUMMARY: The Sorter is responsible for safely and efficiently processing incoming recyclable materials so that outbound commodities are acceptable for sale to various brokers or mills.<p><br></p><strong><u>Principal Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Sort and segregate recoverable materials (e.g., aluminum, plastic, glass, paper, etc.) from incoming waste.</li><li>Deposit recoverable materials safely and efficiently into appropriate chute.</li><li>Assist other sorters on an as-needed basis with heavy or bulky items.</li><li>Follow all Company safety policies and procedures, including stopping the conveyor belt in emergency situations.</li><li>Inspect incoming loads for unacceptable waste; remove unacceptable items as required.</li><li>Communicate with equipment operators regarding incoming loads of special waste or other loads that require special attention.</li><li>Perform other job-related duties as assigned.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Previous experience working in a Recycling Facility sorting recyclable materials.</li></ul><p><br></p>Why choose Republic?<p><br></p>Joining Republic isn’t just about taking on a new job, it’s about making a commitment to create a more sustainable world together. Our people provide an essential service, serving and impacting customers, neighborhoods, and communities everywhere.<p><br></p><strong><u>As a Company, We Are Proud Of Our Values And Encourage Those Who Share In Our Aspirations To Join Our Team</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> We protect our colleagues and communities through safe practices everywhere, every day.</li><li> We are committed to serving our customers and communities by going above and beyond to exceed expectations.</li><li> We take action to improve neighborhoods and communities by being environmentally responsible and creating a more sustainable world.</li><li> We are driven to deliver results in the right way.</li><li> We encourage a human centered culture that honors the unique potential and dignity of every person.</li></ul><p><br></p>Republic Services is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.<p><br></p><em>The statements used herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of the work being performed by an employee in this position, and are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties and skills required by an incumbent so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the Company.</em>

describtion: ProHealth Home Care and Hospice is a locally owned Home Health and Hospice Agency focused on providing clinical excellence and compassion, on patient at a time.<p><br></p>ProHelath Hospice is seeking volunteers for caregiver relief sitting/visits for a client in Los Altos, CA (as needed)<p><br></p><em><strong>How you'll help </strong></em><p><br></p><ul><li>Provide caregiver relief (adult sitting) for the patient's loved one who often lack the opportunity to take time for themselves. (No direct care. These visits will be scheduled in advance &amp; as needed by the primary caregiver)</li></ul><p><br></p>By providing your time, you will allow a primary caregiver time to tend to matters outside of the home (Ie; grocery shopping, medical appointments or general time for self - typically 1-4 times per month)<p><br></p>For more information about becoming a volunteer, please contact the Director of volunteer services.<p><br></p><strong><u>About ProHealth</u></strong><p><br></p>ProHealth Home Care is a locally owned Home Health and Hospice agency focused on providing clinical excellence and compassion, one patient at a time. Over the past decade, ProHealth has brought quality healthcare home for thousands of patients in our community with a keen focus on personalized care.<p><br></p>This is a volunteer opportunity provided by VolunteerMatch, in partnership with LinkedIn for Good.

jobs_titles: Human Resources Coordinator- Legal - Silicon Valley
describtion: Are you looking for an opportunity to grow your career in HR while gaining valuable learning experience? Here's an exciting opportunity for you to join a top-tier global law firm in Silicon Valley as a Human Resources Coordinator.<p><br></p><ul><li> Global Top Tier organization</li><li> Forward looking and progressive</li><li>Growing, fast paced environment</li><li>Diverse and Inclusive<br></li></ul><p><br></p>As a Human Resources Coordinator, you will be responsible for:<p><br></p><ul><li>Ensuring timely completion of transactional responsibilities for the department and office.</li><li>Managing employee onboarding and offboarding processes.</li><li>Providing assistance to attorneys, paralegals, and staff on HR and benefits-related questions.</li><li>Coordinating timekeeping activities, generating reports, and answering routine questions on Kronos.</li><li>Acting as the point of contact for PTO-related questions.</li><li>Coordinating new hire orientations and managing the process for employees leaving the firm.</li><li>Understanding benefits eligibility rules and acting as a Lifecycle Resource Navigator for the office.<br></li></ul><p><br></p>What makes you a great candidate for this role:<p><br></p><ul><li>Strong organizational and time-management skills</li><li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills</li><li>Minimum of one to three years of experience in an HR-related role, preferably with experience in HRIS systems, onboarding/offboarding, benefits administration, and employee relations</li><li>Comprehensive knowledge of HR function, policies, and procedures</li><li>Ability to work in a team environment with a customer service focus.<br></li></ul><p><br></p>If this sounds intriguing to you, let’s discuss in details you can get in touch with Shagun Sharma on ss@elliottscotthr.com or you can directly call her on +13326005303 anytime between 11-2pm EST on weekdays.<p><br></p>Job Code – SS/17203<p><br></p>Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only.<p><br></p>By applying for this position, you consent to the collection, use and disclosure of your personal data to Elliott Scott HR Recruitment Ltd. and all relevant third parties for the purpose of processing your application for this job position. You understand and acknowledge that your personal data will be processed in accordance with our Privacy Policy https://www.elliottscotthr.com/privacy-policy<p><br></p>Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

<strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong> Customer Care Representative I, II, III (Full Time &amp; Remote)<br><br>NV/ CA/ AZ <br><br></strong>Tiered Sign-On Bonus: $1000.00 ($500 after training completion (will be defined by the business) and the remaining $500 after 6 months of active employment)<br><br><strong> Build the Possibilities. Make an extraordinary impact. <br><br></strong>CareMore is a proud member of the Elevance Health family of brands, offering clinical programs and primary care options for seniors. We are a team of committed clinicians and business leaders passionate about transforming American healthcare delivery. As a Customer Care Representative, you will be responsible for responding to internal and external customer questions via telephone and written correspondence regarding insurance benefits, provider contracts, eligibility and claims.<br><br><strong><u>How You Will Make An Impact<br></u></strong><ul><li> Analyzes problems and provides information/solutions. </li><li> Operates a PC/image station to obtain and extract information; documents information, activities and changes in the database. </li><li> Thoroughly documents inquiry outcomes for accurate tracking and analysis. </li><li> Develops and maintains positive customer relations and coordinates with various functions within the company to ensure customer requests and questions are handled appropriately and in a timely manner. </li><li> Researches and analyzes data to address operational challenges and customer service issues. </li><li> Provides external and internal customers with requested information. </li><li> Under immediate supervision, receives and places follow-up telephone calls / e-mails to answer customer questions that are routine in nature. </li><li> Uses computerized systems for tracking, information gathering and troubleshooting. Outbound calls are conducted in the ZipDrug business area. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Here’s What Elevance Health Offers<br></u></strong><ul><li> A career path with opportunity for growth </li><li> Ability to obtain your Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree or further your education with tuition reimbursement. </li><li> Affordable Health Insurance, Dental, Vision and Basic Life </li><li> 401K match, Paid Time Off, Holiday Pay </li><li> Quarterly incentive bonus and annual increases plan based on performance. <br></li></ul>At Elevance Health, the team is comprised of the best and the brightest from diverse experiences, cultures, and backgrounds. The differences we each bring to the table are a part of what makes our company so successful.<br><br><strong><u>Minimum Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> Requires a HS diploma or GED </li><li> Previous experience in an automated customer service environment </li><li> Or any combination of education and experience which would provide an equivalent background. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Preferred Skills, Capabilities, And Experiences<br></u></strong><ul><li> A passion for serving others with the ability to be empathetic and the desire to go above and beyond to help resolve members questions at the first point of contact </li><li> A customer advocate willing to listen and find creative solutions to address and resolve customers questions, issues or concerns </li><li> A composed individual able to multi-task, navigating multiple computer applications and working efficiently while communicating and serving the customer </li><li> Must have a strong work ethic and sense of responsibility to your teammates and our members, demonstrated by the simplest things like being on time and available to meet member’s needs, to being accountable for commitments made to customers or others and ensuring follow-ups are completed. </li><li> Flexible and quick learner, willing to adapt to changing customer and business needs. </li><li> Bilingual (Spanish) Preferred <br></li></ul>For candidates working in person or remotely in the below locations, the salary* range for this specific position is $15.50 to $20.00<br><br>Locations: California; Nevada<br><br>In addition to your salary, Elevance Health offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). The salary offered for this specific position is based on a number of legitimate, non-discriminatory factors set by the company. The company is fully committed to ensuring equal pay opportunities for equal work regardless of gender, race, or any other category protected by federal, state, and local pay equity laws.<br><ul><li> The salary range is the range Elevance Health in good faith believes is the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. This range may be modified in the future and actual compensation may vary from posting based on geographic location, work experience, education and/or skill level. Even within the range, the actual compensation will vary depending on the above factors as well as market/business considerations. No amount is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable under the terms and conditions of the applicable policies and plans. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.<br></li></ul>Please be advised that Elevance Health only accepts resumes from agencies that have a signed agreement with Elevance Health. Accordingly, Elevance Health is not obligated to pay referral fees to any agency that is not a party to an agreement with Elevance Health. Thus, any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Elevance Health.<br><br><strong>Be part of an Extraordinary Team<br><br></strong>Elevance Health is a health company dedicated to improving lives and communities – and making healthcare simpler. A Fortune 20 company with a longstanding history in the healthcare industry, we are looking for leaders at all levels of the organization who are passionate about making an impact on our members and the communities we serve. You will thrive in a complex and collaborative environment where you take action and ownership to solve problems and lead change. Do you want to be part of a larger purpose and an evolving, high-performance culture that empowers you to make an impact?<br><br>We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, and incentive bonus programs (unless covered by a collective bargaining agreement), medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, stock purchase plan, life insurance, wellness programs and financial education resources, to name a few.<br><br>The health of our associates and communities is a top priority for Elevance Health. We require all new candidates in certain patient/member-facing roles to become vaccinated against COVID-19. If you are not vaccinated, your offer will be rescinded unless you provide – and Elevance Health approves – a valid religious or medical explanation as to why you are not able to get vaccinated that Elevance Health is able to reasonably accommodate. Elevance Health will also follow all relevant federal, state and local laws.<br><br>Elevance Health has been named as a Fortune Great Place To Work in 2022, has been ranked for five years running as one of the 2023 World’s Most Admired Companies by Fortune magazine, and is a growing Top 20 Fortune 500 Company. To learn more about our company and apply, please visit us at careers.ElevanceHealth.com. Elevance Health is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, citizenship status, color, creed, disability, ethnicity, genetic information, gender (including gender identity and gender expression), marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other status or condition protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact ability@icareerhelp.com for assistance.

You've come to the right place!<p><br></p>Fooda is looking for people to help take care of clients and receive incoming bulk orders for lunch.<p><br></p>Must be available Monday to Friday, 10:30am to 1:30pm.<p><br></p>Fooda is looking for a reliable Delivery On-Site Attendant who is concerned with customer satisfaction and who is hospitable and presentable towards our restaurant partners and clients. As a Delivery On-Site Attendant, you will be responsible for ensuring our clients receive their lunch quickly and accurately. Delivery On-Site Specialists are the link the between our Fooda Delivery Drivers and clients. This is an independent contractor opportunity with a competitive hourly rate.<p><br></p><strong><u>Who You Are</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Customer service focused</li><li>Team-oriented</li><li>Extremely Punctual </li><li>Dependable</li><li>Strong Communicator</li><li>Detail Oriented</li><li>Exudes Hospitality</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Reliable transportation</li><li>Valid driver’s license</li><li>Car Insurance</li><li>Clean driving record supported by a motor vehicle report</li><li>Must be willing to use smart phone during working hours</li><li>Must be able to lift up to 40 pounds</li><li>Ability to work Monday-Friday from 10:30am-1:30pm </li></ul><p><br></p>Must be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. No phone calls or recruiters please.<p><br></p>The safety and wellbeing of our employees and customers is a top priority. As a condition of employment for the Delivery Onsite Specialist, all hired candidates will be required to submit proof of COVID19 vaccination.
industry: IT Services and IT Consulting,Food and Beverage Services

jobs_titles: Fully Remote Part-Time Bilingual Patient Navigator (Mental Health)
describtion: Introduction: Clarity Squared Behavioral Inc. is seeking a compassionate and bilingual individual to join a fully remote team as a Bilingual Mental Health Patient Navigator. In this role, you will have the opportunity to provide essential support to our diverse clientele, bridging the language gap and ensuring effective communication. If you are fluent in both Spanish and English, possess excellent organizational skills, and have a genuine passion for mental health, we encourage you to apply.<p><br></p>Job Summary: As a Bilingual Mental Health Patient Navigator, you will be responsible for managing the front-end operations and facilitating communication between our mental health professionals and clients. Your ability to fluently communicate in both Spanish and English will play a crucial role in creating a welcoming and inclusive environment. Your daily tasks will include scheduling appointments, maintaining client records, responding to inquiries, and supporting administrative duties.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p>Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Schedule and coordinate appointments for Spanish and English-speaking clients, ensuring accurate and timely communication. </li><li>Explain Patient Financial Responsibility in a completely transparent and easy-to-understand fashion and collect deductibles and co-pays</li><li>Maintain thorough and up-to-date client records, adhering to confidentiality and privacy regulations. </li><li>Respond to phone calls, emails, and other inquiries in both Spanish and English, providing accurate and helpful information</li><li>Assist with administrative tasks such as data entry and billing processes</li><li>Handle crisis situations calmly and professionally, following established protocols</li><li>Demonstrate empathy, respect, and cultural understanding to create a supportive environment</li><li>Uphold strict confidentiality and privacy guidelines when handling sensitive client information</li></ul><p><br></p>Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>High school diploma or equivalent (Bachelor's degree preferred)</li><li>Fluency in Spanish and English, with excellent verbal and written communication skills in both languages</li><li>Must work in a HIPPA compliant environment</li><li>Previous experience in a receptionist or administrative role in a healthcare setting, preferably in a mental health</li><li>Familiarity with mental health terminology and practices is a plus</li><li>Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to multitask</li><li>Proficiency in computer systems and software (e.g., MS Office, Athena electronic medical records, etc.)</li><li>Compassionate and empathetic nature, with the ability to remain calm in stressful situations. </li><li>Understanding of the importance of confidentiality and privacy in the mental health industry</li><li>Cultural sensitivity and ability to work effectively with diverse populations</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p>Very competitive compensation. Work from home/remote. Highly collaborative organization that treats you like family. Excellent potential for professional development. Possibility for a transition to full time.

<strong><u>Who we are</u></strong><strong>: </strong> La Clínica de La Raza is a community-based health center committed to providing culturally appropriate, high-quality, and accessible health care to the diverse communities of the San Francisco Bay Area. We have spent over 40 years advocating for and creating a health-home for the many that have been denied access to care. As health care activists, we are dedicated to ensuring that individuals who do not have healthcare coverage receive the same quality healthcare as those who do. From our genesis as a community health center in 1971, we understood that we cannot heal our communities without also addressing the economic and social factors that affect health. Many times, this requires that we go outside and provide services in other settings that link individuals to our health center for preventive and primary care. Over 90,000 individuals come to La Clínica because it is a welcoming place that addresses the whole person, coordinating and connecting them to a broad network of services to improve and maintain their health and well-being. While we are still known for our activism and spirit of social justice, we are also proud to have grown into a sophisticated provider of primary health care services with 35 sites across Alameda, Contra Costa and Solano counties.<br><br><strong><u>Who you are</u></strong><strong>: </strong>We are looking for Clinical Office Assistants who are inspired to deliver a great experience to our patients and who want to play an important role in patient-centered care. Clinical Office Assistants are the first face and point of contact with our patients. You will be challenged to be an efficient task-master while at the same time providing a human touch and an excellent overall patient experience. Many people excel in one of these areas, but it takes someone with a special combination of skills and character to do both. To be successful, you need to enjoy interacting with people from diverse backgrounds, to feel energized by a fast-paced clinic environment, and remain cool under pressure even when serving a person who is upset, disrespectful, or impatient. You should have a successful history of being responsible, reliable and capable of solving problems while being friendly and helpful in seeking ways to support other care team members.<br><br><strong><u>Major Areas of Responsibility include but are not limited to: <br><br></u></strong><strong>Customer Service<br></strong><ul><li>Greet visitors, ascertain purpose of visit, and register patients in the appropriate electronic system. </li><li>Determine source of payment by verifying program eligibility in government or insurance plans.</li><li>Collect payment for services rendered, operate cash register, and maintain an accurate till.</li><li>Hear and resolve patient complaints or escalate appropriately. </li><li>Participate in problem-solving to assure targets for revenue and customer satisfaction are met.</li><li>Answer telephone inquiries and provide information or route incoming telephone calls to the appropriate person or department.</li><li>Schedule, confirm, and process appointments.<br></li></ul><strong>General Office Duties<br></strong><ul><li>Perform general office duties such as sorting mail, filing and photocopying.</li><li>Receive and route messages or documents, such as laboratory results, to appropriate staff.</li><li>Retrieve and enter data into medical records system.</li><li>Assist patients in completing forms. </li><li>Operate standard office equipment including computer, calculator, fax and copy machines.</li><li>Screen and monitor requests, completing or routing as assigned. </li><li>Inventory stock, order, and verify receipt of medical, lab, or office supplies or equipment. </li><li>Perform record keeping duties as required. <br></li></ul><strong>Commitment to Quality <br></strong><ul><li>Contribute to a welcoming clinical space and healthy work environment through proactive relationship building, direct communication, and practicing sound judgment.</li><li>Communicate and work effectively with all members of the care team to best serve patients. </li><li>Participate fully in huddles, staff meetings, team building activities and assigned development opportunities. </li><li>Adherence to La Clínica’s ethical and professional standards, including policies and procedures.</li><li>Complete required trainings and policy acknowledgements in timeframes granted.</li><li>Perform other related duties as required.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Job Requirements<br><br></u></strong><strong>Knowledge <br></strong><ul><li>Knowledge of basic medical/dental terminology and office procedures and processes</li><li>Effective approaches to customer service delivery.</li><li>Modern medical office and computer systems and applications, especially MS Word, Outlook.</li><li>Knowledge of Electronic Health Records and Electronic Practice Management systems preferred.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Abilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Demonstrated good judgment in identifying effective solutions or approaches to customer service related problems.</li><li>Ability to maintain strict confidentiality regarding patient information</li><li>Clear and effective written and verbal communication skills in English. </li><li>Ability to follow oral and written instructions.</li><li>Bilingual in English and Spanish preferred (or Specify Language). </li><li>Ability to perform arithmetic calculations.</li><li>Minimum typing speed of 25-30 wpm.</li><li>Self-motivated and able to work independently as well as collectively to complete daily tasks.</li><li>Ability to perform detailed administrative work methodically with speed and accuracy.</li><li>Demonstrate flexibility and ability to accept changes gracefully. </li><li>Ability to work professionally and collaboratively in team environment.</li><li>Ability to communicate and work congenially with people from various ethnic, socio-economic, and educational backgrounds and life experience.</li><li>Ability to participate with other staff in Saturday and evening rotation.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Other Certifications And Experience<br></u></strong><ul><li>High school diploma/equivalent. </li><li>1-2 years of experience in a clinical or similar professional office setting. </li><li>Meet all health clearances required for healthcare settings. </li><li>Medical Office Assistant Certification preferred.</li></ul>

<p><strong>San Francisco Bay University (SFBU), a small-sized nonprofit, WASC-accredited, university situated in the heart of Silicon Valley in Fremont, California, seeks a highly motivated Admissions Counselor.&nbsp;SFBU’s mission is to offer inclusive, innovative, and inspirational education for lifelong careers and our vision is to set the standard as a national model of higher education in service of the common good.</strong></p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>At SFBU, students come first. We prioritize students’ needs by fostering personal engagement between faculty, staff, and students. We are committed to providing affordable quality education with a deep commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, and social justice.&nbsp;Our professors are accomplished professionals who provide real world experience in the classrooms to enhance the learning experience and prepare students for future careers. Our student body is reflective of the rich cultural diversity of the world, supported by a dynamic and inclusive learning environment. Moreover, our university reflects the vibrancy of the Silicon Valley.</strong></p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>SFBU is in growth mode and we are looking to make a difference in our communities by enhancing access to affordable education for all students. The Admissions Counselor will be instrumental in bringing these opportunities to prospective students.</strong></p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Primary </strong><strong>Responsibilitie</strong><strong>s</strong><strong>:</strong></p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><span>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span>Reports to Senior Director of Undergraduate and Graduate Admissions &amp; Recruitment Marketing.</p><p><span>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Plays a vital role as a member of the Admissions team, actively involved in recruiting and enrolling students through visiting high schools, community colleges, and community organizations for information sessions, college fairs, wor</span>kshops and additional programming<span>.</span></p><p>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Manage assigned geographic territories, including travel locally and possibly out of state.</p><p>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<span>Coordinate and implement outreach and yield activities.&nbsp;Compile, analyze, and report data for the assigned territory; report on any trends within territories; report regularly on admissions funnel for territories and recruitment/yield activities throughout funnel.</span></p><p>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Participate in admissions events.</p><p><span>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Demonstrates a thorough understanding and alignment with the university’s mission, vision, and values.</span></p><p><span>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Stays up to date on the university’s academic programs, support services, and co-curricular offerings.</span></p><p><span>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Provides exceptional customer service by promptly responding to inquiries/requests, providing clear and accurate information, and maintaining positive relationships. </span></p><p><span>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Collaborates with faculty, staff, alumni, students, and high school and community college teachers and counselors to coordinate recruitment efforts.</span></p><p><span>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Counsels and guides applicants through admission policies and procedures. </span></p><p><span>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Offers solutions to applicant inquiries and concerns regarding admission. </span></p><p><span>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Evaluates applications for admission and follows up with applicants. </span></p><p><span>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Assists in the creation of promotional materials for admissions programs and activities.</span></p><p><span>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Maintains strict confidentiality of records, correspondence, and sensitive information.</span></p><p>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<span>Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.</span></p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong></p><p><span>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Bachelor’s degree.</span></p><p><span>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><strong>0-2</strong><strong> </strong><span>years of direct admissions experience</span>;<span> related experience</span>; o<span>r equivalent combination of experience, training, and/or education.</span></p><p><span>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Must be able to travel in state and out of state. Must be flexible to work evenings and weekends as well as extended hours during peak periods.</span></p><p>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<span>Demonstrated strong commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, and social justice.</span></p><p><span>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span>C<span>ustomer service orientated and display a high level of professionalism.</span></p><p><span>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span>Ability<span> to follow procedures and have a strong attention to detail.</span></p><p><span>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Demonstrated ability to work in a fast paced, high-volume environment, both independently and collaboratively.</span></p><p><span>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Position requires excellent written and oral communications and interpersonal skills.</span></p><p><span>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Knowledgeable of higher education admissions and general university functions and services.</span></p><p><span>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Proficient with computers, including browser-based software services, Microsoft Office, CRMs, and email.</span></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p><span> </span>Salary = 60k - 70k</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><span>Application Instructions </span></p><p><span>To ensure full consideration, please submit: </span></p><p><br></p><p>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<span>Letter of interest which describes your experiences based on the stated responsibilities, and your demonstrated commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, and social justice.</span></p><p>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<span>Current CV/ resume. </span></p><p>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<span>Names and contact information of 3 references.&nbsp;</span></p><p><span>Application screening will begin immediately and continue until the position is closed. </span></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Physical Characteristics:</strong></p><p><span>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Must be able to lift and carry up to 20lbs.</span></p><p><span>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The employee is required to crouch, walk, reach, grasp, carry, and push.</span></p><p><span>●&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The employee is occasionally required to sit or stand for long periods.</span></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p> This job description is not a contract between San Francisco Bay University (SFBU) and the employee. SFBU has the right to change the employee’s job duties at its discretion.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><span>SFBU is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer:</span></p><p><span>&nbsp;</span></p><p><span>SFBU is committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment. </span>SFBU<span> does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by law.</span></p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><span>&nbsp;</span></p>

<strong>Job ID:</strong> 230658<p><br></p><strong>Location Name:</strong> CA-FSC SF Off (0174)<p><br></p><strong>Address:</strong> 525 Market St, 4th Floor, San Francisco, CA 94105, United States (US)<p><br></p><strong>Job Type:</strong> Full Time<p><br></p><strong>Position Type:</strong> Regular<p><br></p><strong>Job Function:</strong> Merchandising<p><br></p><strong>Remote Eligible:</strong> Hybrid Schedule<p><br></p><strong><u>Company Overview</u></strong><p><br></p>At Sephora we inspire our customers, empower our teams, and help them become the best versions of themselves. We create an environment where people are valued, and differences are celebrated. Every day, our teams across the world bring to life our purpose: to expand the way the world sees beauty by empowering the ExtraOrdinary in each of us. We are united by a common goal - to <strong>reimagine the future of beauty</strong>.<p><br></p><strong><u>The Opportunity</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Position:</strong> Merchandise Coordinator, Merchandising<p><br></p><strong>Location:</strong> San Francisco, CA<p><br></p><strong><u>About Merchandising At Sephora</u></strong><p><br></p>Our merchandising team is constantly building brands, starting trends, and developing entirely new product categories. And our merchants don’t stop at selection—they bring the assortment to life through breakthrough curation and storytelling across our stores and digital properties.<p><br></p>The Merchandising team is at the center of the action! Our team collaborates with digital, marketing, education, inventory planning partners and brands to deliver the best assortment and customer experience in beauty! You are a great fit for this team if you have a passion for all thing’s beauty, strong analytical skills and attention to detail, and a dedication to collaboration.<p><br></p><strong><u>Your Role At Sephora</u></strong><p><br></p>As a Merchandise Coordinator, you will be the key support role to the merchant team assisting on all aspects of the day to day needs of the business. You will play a pivotal role in team admin, reporting, and data entry for product assortments. Reporting to the Merchant, you will:<p><br></p><ul><li>Effectively communicate key information and changes with internal and external stakeholders in a timely manner</li><li>Prepare for all brand meetings (schedule meetings, prepare reports and agenda, order lunches)</li><li>Conduct weekly and monthly reports (including sku, location, collection and subclass), send out Vendor monthly reports, and adhoc reports for merchant team</li><li>Work closely with brands and assistant merchant to review deliverables and timelines for new product launches and SKU ownership throughout the entire lifecycle of the SKU: creation, maintenance, and pricing </li><li>Manage price changes and brand chargebacks</li><li>Manage submission of complexion products to the production team </li><li>Lead comp collection from vendors for all departments: organize, collect and track</li><li>Assist with the creative review process for all in-store placements within brand portfolio, ensuring accurate product representation across gondolas, Beauty on the Fly and animations</li><li>Demonstrate our Sephora values of Passion for Client Service, Innovation, Expertise, Balance, Respect for All, Teamwork, and Initiative.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>We’re Excited About You If You Have</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>1-3 years of relevant professional corporate experience </li><li>High level of initiative, able to work independently on multiple projects and tasks in a fast-paced environment. Ability to independently prioritize and manage time. </li><li>Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively operate with high energy and flexibility in a dynamic team environment. </li><li>Ability to exercise utmost attention to detail.</li><li>Excellent written and oral communication skills.</li><li>Digital literacy: proficient in Excel inclusive of VLOOKUP and Pivot Tables, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook.</li><li>Strong analytical competence.</li><li>Quickly learn new systems &amp; tools.</li><li>A genuine interest in beauty and retail!</li></ul><p><br></p>The target hourly pay for this position is $28.00 - $30.00 per hour. The actual hourly pay offered depends on a variety of factors, which may include, as applicable, the individual applicant’s qualifications for the position; years of relevant experience; specific and unique skills; level of education attained; certifications or other professional licenses held; other legitimate, non-discriminatory business factors specific to the position; and the geographic location in which the applicant lives and/or from which they will perform the job. Individuals employed in this position may also be eligible to earn bonuses. Sephora offers a generous benefits package to full-time employees, which include comprehensive health, dental and vision plans; a superior 401(k) plan, various paid time off programs; employee discount/perks; life insurance; disability insurance; flexible spending accounts; and an employee referral bonus program.<p><br></p><strong>While at Sephora, you’ll enjoy… </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>The people. You will be surrounded by some of the most talented leaders and teams – people you can be proud to work with. </li><li>The learning. We invest in training and developing our teams, and you will continue evolving and building your skills through personalized career plans.</li><li>The culture. As a leading beauty retailer within the LVMH family, our reach is broad, and our impact is global. It is in our DNA to innovate and, at Sephora, all 40,000 passionate team members across 35 markets and 3,000+ stores, are united by a common goal - to reimagine the future of beauty.</li></ul><p><br></p>You can <strong>unleash your creativity</strong>, because we’ve got disruptive spirit. You can <strong>learn and evolve</strong>, because we empower you to be your best. You can <strong>be yourself</strong>, because you are what sets us apart. <strong><em>This</em>, is the future of beauty. Reimagine your future, at Sephora.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Sephora is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company.</strong> We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military/veteran status, or disability status. Sephora is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities.<p><br></p>Sephora will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law.

describtion: You've come to the right place!<p><br></p>Fooda is looking for people to help take care of clients and receive incoming bulk orders for lunch.<p><br></p>Must be available Monday to Friday, 10:30am to 1:30pm.<p><br></p>Fooda is looking for a reliable Delivery On-Site Attendant who is concerned with customer satisfaction and who is hospitable and presentable towards our restaurant partners and clients. As a Delivery On-Site Attendant, you will be responsible for ensuring our clients receive their lunch quickly and accurately. Delivery On-Site Specialists are the link the between our Fooda Delivery Drivers and clients. This is an independent contractor opportunity with a competitive hourly rate.<p><br></p><strong><u>Who You Are</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Customer service focused</li><li>Team-oriented</li><li>Extremely Punctual </li><li>Dependable</li><li>Strong Communicator</li><li>Detail Oriented</li><li>Exudes Hospitality</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Reliable transportation</li><li>Valid driver’s license</li><li>Car Insurance</li><li>Clean driving record supported by a motor vehicle report</li><li>Must be willing to use smart phone during working hours</li><li>Must be able to lift up to 40 pounds</li><li>Ability to work Monday-Friday from 10:30am-1:30pm </li></ul><p><br></p>Must be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. No phone calls or recruiters please.<p><br></p>The safety and wellbeing of our employees and customers is a top priority. As a condition of employment for the Delivery Onsite Specialist, all hired candidates will be required to submit proof of COVID19 vaccination.
