describtion: The Client Coordinator works with clients, patients and active caregivers to identify open shifts, availability, and coordinate schedules. The Client Coordinator understands the needs, requirements, and preferences of all client types (patients, facilities, referral sources, caregivers, and staff) and optimizes staffing ratios. Through daily interaction with clients and caregivers, the Client Coordinator builds relationships with clientele to foster additional business opportunities.<p><br></p><strong><u>Essential Duties And Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Builds relationships with Maxim clients and active caregivers to understand their scheduling needs, requirements, and preferences</li><li>Coordinates and confirms schedule with clients and active caregivers</li><li>Records caregivers’ correspondence, needs, availability, and schedule in system of record</li><li>Ensures all placements adhere to applicable compliance and contract requirements</li><li>Partners with Business Development Manager, Clinicians, Recruiters, and Field Support staff to debrief on staffing shortages, client satisfaction, and business development opportunities</li><li>Performs on-call as needed or assigned</li><li>Assists with other duties as needed</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>High School degree or equivalent required, some completed college coursework preferred</li><li>One year work experience in a team environment</li><li>Must meet all federal, state, and local requirements</li><li>Proficiency in MS Office, Internet, and email</li><li>Must be energetic, highly motivated, and able to work in a fast-paced environment</li><li>Must be highly organized, detail oriented, and have exceptional planning and problem solving skills</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Wage/Salary Information</u></strong><p><br></p>$22 - $27 per hour, plus $2000 annual bonus potential<p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>At Maxim Healthcare Services, we firmly believe that our employees are the heartbeat of our organization and we are happy to offer the following benefits:<p><br></p><ul><li> Competitive pay &amp; weekly paychecks </li><li> Health, dental, vision, and life insurance </li><li> 401(k) savings plan </li><li> Awards and recognition programs </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Maxim Healthcare Services</u></strong><p><br></p>Maxim Healthcare Services has been making a difference in the lives of our patients, caregivers, employees and communities for more than 30 years. We offer private duty nursing, skilled nursing, physical rehabilitation, companion care, respite care and behavioral care for individuals with chronic and acute illnesses and disabilities. Our commitment to quality customer service, compassionate patient care, and filling critical healthcare needs makes us a trusted partner wherever care is needed.<p><br></p>Maxim Healthcare Services is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.<p><br></p>"Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Initiative, Maxim Healthcare will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records"

GOALS is founder-run, values-driven Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) company. If you are passionate about helping kids with autism special needs, a job and career in ABA could be a great fit for you! Behavior Techs work under the supervision of a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to implement behavior plans at a client’s home or a community setting. Behavior Techs work help clients acquire a variety of new skills from communication, social skills, life skills, reducing problem behaviors and much more. At GOALS, we believe in helping the whole family and that everyone deserves access to care.<p><br></p>GOALS is currently hiring across the East Bay for Behavior Technicians, with opportunities to work in a school setting.<p><br></p>GOALS provides comprehensive, paid training in the principles of ABA and provides opportunities for shadowing and mentorship. GOALS for Autism believes strongly in quality of life for staff and provides staff ample time for personal growth and staff development. If you want to truly make a difference in the lives of kids with autism while working for a company that cares about you, we want you to apply!<p><br></p>Day in the life of a GOALS Behavior Tech could include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Traveling to a client’s home and other community settings to deliver services</li><li>Working 1:1 with children and adolescents to implement a behavioral plan</li><li>Incorporating families and caregivers into therapy sessions per the treatment plan</li><li>Collecting detailed and accurate data collection and service notes</li><li>Receiving ongoing support and mentorship from GOALS supervisors</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Part and full-time positions available.</strong><p><br></p>Get to know more about us and our culture -<p><br></p>What GOALS can offer you:<p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive Salary from $18–25 / hour</li><li>Paid in-house training</li><li>Paid travel time</li><li>Flexible work schedule</li><li>Tuition reimbursement</li><li>Comprehensive support and training to prepare and maintain RBT credential</li><li>Benefits for full time employees, including healthcare dental, life insurance, 401K</li><li>Leadership growth and development</li><li>Supervision opportunities for individuals accruing BCBA hours</li><li>Creative, diverse, and forward-thinking company culture</li><li>Opportunity to work with an amazing team of advocates making a positive difference in the lives of individuals and families.</li></ul><p><br></p>Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li>Passion for helping special needs kids and patience is a MUST!</li><li>Reliable, timely, organized and great attention to detail</li><li>Ability to pass a background check</li><li>Ability to obtain negative TB test</li><li>Reliable transportation, public or private</li><li>High School Diploma or equivalent required</li><li>College credit, Associates, or Bachelors degree preferred</li><li>Childcare and/or special needs experience preferred</li><li>Monday-Friday Availability preferred</li></ul><p><br></p><em> <br><ul><li>Disclaimer: All employment offers are conditional upon COVID-19 vaccination status or approved vaccination exemption*<br><br></li></ul>Powered by JazzHR<br><br>AcxDYSApC1</em>

<strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>Reddaway, one of the fastest growing regional LTL transportation providers, is a team-oriented company looking for a Clerk to provide administrative support and customer service to the Reddaway’s outstanding operations personnel and customers. To those who accept our challenge, we offer:<p><br></p><ul><li>Overtime After 8 Hours Daily</li><li>401k Plan</li><li>Excellent Benefits Program with no benefit premium cost for the employee</li><li>Respected Company with Longevity</li><li>Team Oriented Work Environment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Essential Duties And Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Copy data and compile records and reports. Tabulate and post data into computer system. Record orders for service.</li><li>Answer phones and provide customer assistance in response to inquiries. Refer to appropriate personnel as needed. May investigate customer complaints. May adjust complaints.</li><li>Receive, count and pay out petty cash. Prepare, issue, and send out receipts, bills, invoices, statements, and checks.</li><li>Maintain office supply inventory. Order and stock supplies as needed.</li><li>Operate office machines, such as adding, calculating, and scanning machines.</li><li>Use mainframe computer terminal or personal computer for access to and entry of data.</li><li>Open and route incoming mail, answer correspondence, and prepare outgoing mail. Maintain office files.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Basic computer literacy.</li><li>Effective organizational and prioritization skills for managing multiple tasks with interruptions from phone calls.</li><li>Effective verbal, interpersonal and written communication skills for handling phone inquiries, composing correspondence, dealing with customers and assisting management.</li><li>Ability to type with speed and accuracy.</li><li>Ability to work varied shifts and days of the week.</li><li>These worker characteristics are normally acquired through completion of a high school education or equivalent, courses in operating office equipment and 6 to 9 months related work experience.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience in the transportation industry.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Yellow Corporation, along with all subsidiary companies, are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer</strong>

companies_names: Indian Health Center of Santa Clara Valley
describtion: <strong>Job Description</strong>: <strong>Medical Transcriptionist</strong><p><br></p><strong>Reports to</strong><strong>:</strong> Associate Director of Clinical Informatics<p><br></p><strong>Status</strong><strong>:</strong>Part-Time Regular, Non-Exempt<p><br></p><strong>Position Summary</strong><strong>: </strong>The Medical Transcriptionist interprets and transcribes external clinical notes regarding patient assessment, workup, therapeutic procedures, clinical course, diagnosis, prognosis, etc. into the patient’s Electronic Health Records in order to document patient care and facilitate delivery of health care services. He/she ensures accuracy of electronic clinical notes and keeps confidentiality in compliance with HIPAA guidelines. This could be an excellent opportunity for International Medical Graduates. The IHC is a Patient Centered Health Home and all employees are an integral part of this model of care delivery.<p><br></p><strong><u>Duties &amp; Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Transcribes external medical notes such as assessments/consultations, referrals, progress notes, discharge summaries, etc., into the IHC EHR system to provide a permanent record of patient care specially for new IHC members</li><li>Identifies mistakes in reports, and check with previous medical providers to obtain the correct needed information</li><li>Performs data retrieval duties from external EHR systems or other media such as CDs for data inclusion in internal electronic medical records</li><li>Demonstrates an understanding of the medico-legal implications and responsibilities related to the transcription of medical records to protect the patient and the organization</li><li>Communicates with external healthcare facilities to ensure accuracy and completeness of records of new and established patients</li><li>Operates designated word processing, internal registries, and other software as directed to complete the assignments </li><li>Scribes for Providers in IHC three Medical Departments</li><li>Assists with manual lab results reconciliation</li><li>Follows policies and procedures to contribute to the efficiency of the IHC Medical Records Office and Back Office</li><li>Others duties related to the nature of this position as assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Qualifications, Knowledge &amp; Abilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Associate degree or equivalent in health related field</li><li>Medical background preferred</li><li>Knowledge of medical transcription guidelines and practices</li><li>Knowledge of medical terminology, anatomy and physiology, disease processes, signs &amp; symptoms, clinical medicine, surgery, diagnostic tests, radiology, pathology, pharmacology, and the various medical specialties as required in areas of responsibilities</li><li>Knowledge of procedure codes, diagnosis codes, and medical records procedures preferred</li><li>Able to read, write and speak English fluently </li><li>Excellent written and oral communication skills, including English usage, grammar, punctuation, and style</li><li>Excellent organizational and customer service skills</li><li>Ability to work under pressure with time constrains </li><li>Ability to stay calm while working quickly and with a high degree of accuracy</li><li>Flexibility, initiative, and reliability</li><li>Familiarity with medical computer software and data entry</li><li>Experience using Microsoft Office software packages (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint)</li><li>Knowledge of &amp; ability to work with the American Indian community &amp; other minority populations preferred</li><li>Ability to maintain strict confidentiality</li><li>Ability to function independently and as a team member within diverse environments as well as with a diverse staff composition</li><li>Ability to carry out all responsibilities in an honest, ethical &amp; professional manner and demonstrate good judgment</li><li>Participate as a proactive representative of the Patient Centered Health Home</li><li>Perform duties utilizing the Team-Based Approach</li><li>Performs other duties as assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Physical Requirements</u></strong><ul><li>Will be working in a fast paced non-profit community health clinic environment and must be able to:</li><ul><li>sit, stand and walk for extensive periods of time;</li><li>lift up to 35 pounds; and</li><li>stoop, squat, or bend frequently</li></ul><li>Possess the manual and finger dexterity as well as the eye-hand coordination sufficient to accomplish the duties associated with your job description</li><li>Ability to visually observe as well as hear and communicate with patients and professional staff</li><li>Ability to do extensive work on the computer and the telephone in communicating with staff, patients, and vendors</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Working Conditions</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Potential exposure to airborne and blood borne infectious diseases and pathogens</li><li> Normal working hours will be from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm although hours may vary depending upon business need</li><li>Must be able to work independently and meet deadlines while also being an effective leader and collaborating with the agency-wide management team</li></ul><p><br></p>Preference is given to qualified American Indians in accordance with the American Indian Alaskan Native Preference Act (Title 25, U.S. Code Sections 472, 473 and 473a). Other than the above, the Indian Health Center of Santa Clara Valley is an equal opportunity employer including minorities, women, disabled and veterans.

The Staff Accountant will take full ownership of the accounts payable accounting function as well as help with accounting projects and general journal entries. They must pay attention to detail to not let important details slip through the cracks or derail a project. This person will manage multiple priorities at a time in a fast-paced environment. In addition, we are looking for someone who is passionate about creating and building processes to maximize efficiency and reduce costs for the organization.<br><ul><li>Provide clerical accounts payable support</li><li>Process all incoming invoices from vendors</li><li>Keep prompt and professional communication with vendors</li><li>Prepare weekly check runs</li><li>Protect business against unintentional overpayment</li><li>Practice effective monitoring to ensure vendor payments are in timely manner</li><li>Tie out PO to invoices, input and verify all credit card transactions</li><li>Monitor and reconcile all credit card transactions</li><li>Monitor and reconcile all check deposits</li><li>Calculate and record commissions</li><li>Record all cash outflow transactions</li><li>Support quarterly reviews and annual audits performed by external auditors</li><li>Complete special projects as needed</li><li>Other duties as assigned by Manager<br><br></li></ul><strong>Requirements<br><br></strong><strong>Required Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Intermediate to advanced Excel skills (can maintain complex spreadsheets)</li><li>Excellent communication skills and the ability to prioritize/balance multiple tasks in order to meet team goals and deadlines</li><li>Ability to interact with both internal and external departments/customers in a positive manner</li><li>Willingness to contribute beyond the defined role to meet our needs as circumstances require</li><li>Critical thinking skills to identify process improvements and efficiencies</li><li>Self-starter and strong desire to achieve results</li><li>An eye for detail; you triple check your work to ensure accuracy of accounting records</li><li>Highly efficient in accounts payable duties and genuinely enjoys working in a collaborative and fast-paced environment<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in accounting or finance (or related degree)</li><li>2 or more years of relevant experience in an AP or general accounting function preferred</li><li>NetSuite experience is preferred<br><br></li></ul><strong>Benefits<br><br></strong>Steri-Tek offers medical, dental, vision, 401K with matching, and paid holiday and paid time off.<br><br>Compensation: $87,500 - $101,700 annualized salary<br><br>Work schedule: Monday - Friday (hybrid: 3 days in office/ 2 days remote); 8:00am - 5:00pm<br><br>Steri-Tek follows equitable hiring practices. Flexibility in our hiring process allows hiring of talent at levels different from what are posted. The compensation range outlined is based on a target budgeted base salary. Individual base pay depends on various factors such as relevant experience and skill, Interview assessments and responsibility of role, job duties/requirements. Offers are determined using our equitable hiring practices. Steri-Tek offers additional compensation in the form of benefits premiums, 401k matching, and On Target Earning commissions for appropriate positions. Base pay ranges are reviewed each year. We are committed to the principle of pay equity – paying employees equitably for similar work.

<strong><u>Job Duties</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Shift: 40 hours per week, Monday- Friday </li><li>How many open positions: 1 position</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Duties And Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Assists physicians with procedure set-ups, patient procedures and examinations.</li><li>Performs patient care, including vital signs, weights, rooming, assisting with procedures, medication administration (vaccinations) and injections and other necessary tests.</li><li>As required, performs waived testing (urine dipstick, urine pregnancy test, blood glucose testing), perform EKGs, and administers immunizations. Collects and sends specimens to appropriate labs for testing per protocol.</li><li>Schedules and edits and maintains patient-physician appointments for new and returning patients, using the scheduling system.</li><li>Acts as non-clinical liaison/concierge/navigator for the referred patients in any way the patient needs before, during or after an encounter with a medical facility.</li><li>Informs patient’s authorization and collects payment for new and returning patients, using the scheduling system.</li><li>Collects patient demographic and insurance data and enters it into systems as well as assigns medical record numbers</li><li>Assures appropriate verifications and authorizations are complete before the patient sees a provider</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Education </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>High School Diploma or GED equivalent Required</li><li>Medical Assistant Certificate/Diploma from an approved school /institution or equivalent documented training. Required</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>1 - 5 years of directly related experience Required</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Licenses and Certifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BLS - Basic Life Support required</li><li>CMA - Certified Or Registered Medical Assistant preferred</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Health/Dental/Vision Insurance</li><li>Sick time off</li></ul>

<p><strong>Our client is an international commercial real estate developer, owner and manager! The company has an extraordinary team of passionate professionals who promote within and are dedicated to cultivating careers for exceptional talent needs a highly organized and outgoing Administrative Coordinator for their Property Management team.</strong></p><p><strong> </strong></p><p><strong>Job Description</strong> – The Administrative Coordinator will primarily focus on supporting the property management team with periodic reporting responsibilities. With excellent customer service skills, the Administrative Coordinator will also work with tenants resolving issues and executing on special requests. The successful Administrative Coordinator will work with vendors and other building management team members to ensure procedures are followed throughout the building. Additional responsibilities for the Administrative Coordinator include the following:</p><p> </p><p><strong>Responsibilities Include:</strong></p><ul><li>Provides direct administrative support to Director, Operations (Account Manager), Chief Engineer (CE) and tenants as needed</li><li>Serves as the main point of contact (POC) for service requests from tenants</li><li>Entry of tenant service requests into work order system</li><li>Ensures that 100% of the Certificate of Insurance (COI) for tenants and contractors are accurate and in compliance with standards</li><li>Enforces compliance with insurance requirements among tenants, contractors, vendors and suppliers. Documents incidents of potential liability to property and equipment and forwards information to appropriate risk management personnel.</li><li>Codes and splits invoices based on cost centers and services performed</li><li>Prepares bill backs/re-bills for special tenant requests</li><li>Prepare manual adjustment forms for all miscellaneous tenant service requests and ensure they are billed back/re-billed to tenants monthly</li><li>Ensure engineers take monthly readings from electric meters for tenants that have supplemental units.</li><li>Assists in management audits and prepares all files and records in preparation for the audit</li><li>Internal and external correspondence</li><li>Create, maintain, review, purge and forward files to appropriate storage location in accordance with company record retention policy</li><li>Update and file all documents for vendors and tenants and ensure that contract and lease administration files are accurate and up to date</li><li>Maintain and update tenant contact databases</li><li>Organize departmental meeting and travel arrangements</li><li>Manages the new tenant welcome and orientation program</li><li>Revises and distributes updated property manuals (as needed) within the portfolio with the assistance of the property team members. Property manuals include, but are not limited to the Tenant Handbook, Team Handbook, Hazard Communication Program, Building and Tenant Emergency Response Manuals, Space Utilization Guide and Lease Summary Book</li><li>Processes all aspects of accounts receivable</li><li>Obtains completed W-9 forms from all vendors</li><li>Negotiates office equipment leases and maintenance agreements while ensuring technological advancement of support systems fall within budget guidelines</li><li>Tracks budget line items relating for administrative account purchases and resolves negative variances relative to budget</li></ul><p> </p><p><strong>Position Requirements</strong></p><ul><li>2 years of previous Administrative Coordinator experience with commercial real estate experience a real plus!</li><li>Highly proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook.</li><li>Professional, reliable, flexible and have a positive, can-do attitude.</li><li>Excellent attention to detail with strong customer service skills and ability to prioritize</li><li>Ability to communicate well in both written and verbal communication forms.</li><li>Proactive attitude and volunteers willingly to take on additional responsibilities and assist with other team members’ projects.</li><li>Strong interest in real estate.</li></ul><p> </p><p><strong>Education</strong></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree preferred or similar work experience</li></ul><p> </p><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><ul><li>PTO, PST, Medical, Dental, and Vision</li></ul>

jobs_titles: Administrative Associate for DLSS and Human Resources
describtion: Stanford Libraries is seeking a full-time Administrative Associate to join the University Librarian’s office at Stanford Libraries. The Libraries values are rooted in a commitment of mutual respect, the idea that every member of the staff has something to contribute, and that learning is constant. We seek a team member who is ready to share their skills and perspectives.<br><br><strong>About Stanford Libraries<br><br></strong>Stanford Libraries is a network of over 15 libraries with over 400 employees. We are committed to fueling the teaching, learning and research across Stanford by acquiring, stewarding, and making available a robust collection, currently in excess of 12 million items. Everyone in the organization plays a vital role in fulfilling that objective. Our dedication to discoverability and information management also has us engaged in dynamic global partnerships. We are constantly building and strengthening our organization, and we recognize striving for excellence is a marathon and not a sprint. We are constantly trying to strike the right pace and admit there are times when we find ourselves at a fast jog. While we hope to always find candidates who fit within our organization, what we truly seek is someone who will add to our culture, our profession as well as the greater academic arena. We are invested in the success of our teams and the individuals who represent Stanford Libraries.<br><br><strong>About The Position<br><br></strong>The Administrative Associate will be a member of the administrative support team providing high level administrative support to the Executive group of the Stanford Libraries University Librarian’s office. You will maintain the confidentiality of information coming through the University Librarian’s office, provide support with calendaring, financial transactions such as expense reimbursements, event coordination, order supplies and other administrative support as outlined. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, possess excellent interpersonal, organizational and customer service skills with attention to detail and must be able to work with people across all levels internal and external to the organization.<br><br>Core Duties*:<br><ul><li>Act on behalf of the supervisor, department manager, or chair in regards to establishing priorities and identifying and resolving problems that are administrative in nature.</li><li>Oversee and/or perform duties associated with scheduling, organizing, and operating complex conferences, seminars, and events, including arranging with vendors for services, overseeing the production and distribution of materials, administering logistics, and managing events within budget.</li><li>Compose and draft documents and correspondence for presentations, course handouts, grants, conferences, seminars, and reports; perform substantial editing and fact checking. Create, maintain, modify, and/or ensure accuracy of content in various unit documents, displays, reports, brochures, social media, and/or websites.</li><li>Plan and schedule calendar(s) with limited consultation, resolve calendaring conflicts, and arrange travel in compliance with unit, university, and sponsor policies.</li><li>Create complex reports and spreadsheets which may utilize specialized software and systems.</li><li>Oversee and/or process a variety of complex financial transactions; produce, monitor, and reconcile budget statements; research, identify, and resolve discrepancies. May assist with capital or special equipment requests and/or vendor selection.</li><li>Coordinate and monitor routine maintenance services completion. </li><li>May lead staff or supervise day-to-day work of student and/or temporary workers, including scheduling, assigning, and prioritizing workloads, setting appropriate deadlines, reviewing work for quality and timeliness, and providing performance review input.</li><li>Act as time and leave administrator for the DLSS staff.</li><li> - Other duties may also be assigned<br><br></li></ul>The job duties listed are typical examples of work performed by positions in this job classification and are not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, tasks, and responsibilities. Specific duties and responsibilities may vary depending on department or program needs without changing the general nature and scope of the job or level of responsibility. Employees may also perform other duties as assigned.<br><br><strong>Minimum Requirements<br><br></strong>Education and Experience:<br><ul><li>High school diploma and four years of administrative experience, or combination of education and relevant experience.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Minimum Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities<br></strong><ul><li>Advanced computer skills and demonstrated experience with office software and email applications.</li><li>Demonstrated success in following through and completing projects.</li><li>Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills.</li><li>Ability to prioritize, multi-task, and assign work to others.</li><li>Ability to take initiative and ownership of projects.</li><li>Ability to routinely and independently exercise sound judgment in making decisions.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Other Relevant Demonstrated Experience Include<br></strong><ul><li>Ability to act with tact and diplomacy and maintain</li><li>confidentiality</li><li>Excellent problem solving and analytical skills</li><li>Work with a high degree of independence</li><li>Project management experience<br><br></li></ul><strong>Physical Requirements<br></strong><ul><li>Constantly perform desk-based computer tasks.</li><li>Frequently sitting.</li><li>Occasionally stand/walk, reach/work above shoulders, grasp lightly/fine manipulation, grasp forcefully, use a telephone, sort/file paperwork or parts, lift/carry/push/pull objects that weigh up to 10 pounds.</li><li>Rarely twist/bend/stoop/squat, kneel/crawl.</li><li> - Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Work Standards<br></strong><ul><li>Interpersonal Skills: Demonstrates the ability to work well with Stanford colleagues and clients and with external organizations.</li><li>Promote Culture of Safety: Demonstrates commitment to personal responsibility and value for safety; communicates safety concerns; uses and promotes safe behaviors based on training and lessons learned.</li><li>Subject to and expected to comply with all applicable University policies and procedures, including but not limited to the personnel policies and other policies found in the University's Administrative Guide, http://adminguide.stanford.edu.<br><br></li></ul>Stanford is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Stanford welcomes applications from all who would bring additional dimensions to the University’s research, teaching and clinical missions. We believe Stanford’s future success will be shaped by the diverse perspectives, unique experiences, and inclusive culture of its community.<br><br>The expected pay range for this position is $60,000-$81,000 per annum. Stanford University provides pay ranges representing its good faith estimate of what the university reasonably expects to pay for a position. The pay offered to a selected candidate will be determined based on factors such as (but not limited to) the scope and responsibilities of the position, the qualifications of the selected candidate, departmental budget availability, internal equity, geographic location, and external market pay for comparable jobs.<br><br><strong>Why Stanford Is For You<br><br></strong>Imagine a world without search engines or social platforms. Consider lives saved through first-ever organ transplants and research to cure illnesses. Stanford University has revolutionized the way we live and enrich the world. Supporting this mission is our diverse and dedicated 17,000 staff. We seek talent driven to impact the future of our legacy. Our culture and unique perks empower you with:<br><ul><li>Freedom to grow. We offer career development programs, tuition reimbursement, and course auditing. Join a TedTalk, watch a film screening, or listen to a renowned author or global leader speak.</li><li>A caring culture. We provide superb retirement plans, generous time-off, and family care resources.</li><li>A healthier you. Choose from hundreds of health or fitness classes at our world-class exercise facilities. We provide excellent health care benefits.</li><li>Discovery and fun. Stroll through historic sculptures, trails, and museums.</li><li>Enviable resources. Enjoy free commuter programs, ridesharing incentives, discounts and more.</li></ul>

jobs_titles: Tester of New Products.(100% Remote) - No Exp Required, Part/Full Time ($25-$45/hour)
describtion: Job Description:<p><br></p>Work as a Remote Product Tester from home (no experience required). Evaluate products to provide user feedback to companies and market research firms to ensure proper product certification and greater market access.<p><br></p>Participation in our Remote Product Testing job is 100% remote, free, secure, and private. Learn about an exciting industry (market research) and have fun testing new products while earning a nice income Part-Time or Full-Time. Benefits: Very competitive pay rate Weekly pay Work around your own schedule Learn about an exciting industry Telecommute (you can work from home, work, or school) A paid Product Tester position is perfect for those looking for a 100% remote job, an entry-level opportunity, or seasonal, temporary, or part-time work. The hours are completely flexible, and no previous experience is necessary.<p><br></p>Our paid Product Testers come from all backgrounds and industries, ranging from customer service and sales to administrative assistants. If you are a manager, receptionist, warehouse or factory worker, driver, medical assistant, nurse, cleaner, college student, messenger, maid, teacher, retail associate, salesperson, secretary, server, janitor, cashier, contract worker, or intern who is looking for a flexible part-time or seasonal job, you should try paid Product Testing to supplement your income. Also, if you have been involved in accounting, clerical jobs, marketing, management, security, or data entry jobs, you may be a good fit for a fully remote paid Product Tester Position

<strong>About Us:</strong><p><br></p>Mollie Stone’s Markets is a local, family owned grocery store chain in the San Francisco Bay area, serving customers since 1986. With over 30 years of exemplary performance in the market, Mollie Stone’s continues to make a difference in people’s lives through food. Currently maintaining 9 Grocery Stores, a Produce Warehouse and Headquarters in Mill Valley, CA, we succeed in the industry by ensuring we deliver a large variety of exciting and quality products in an attractive and positive environment.<p><br></p><strong>About the Role:</strong><p><br></p>Mollie Stone's Markets seeks a responsible person for our Step-up Head Clerk/Backup Bookkeeper position for our Burlingame location. The Head Clerk assumes leadership for the store in the absence of the Store Manager, Assistant Store Manager, and Second Assistant. This individual must have a passion for customer service, food, and a desire to provide a tailored shopping experience for all customers. This position is Part Time for the perfect candidate.<p><br></p><strong>Essential Functions:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Effectively manages the Store and supervises the employees in absence of Store Manager, Assistant Store Manager, and second Assistant.</li><li>Ensure store is secure, properly closed and prepared for the next business day.</li><li>Ensure the store provides and achieves exceptional customer service and all related operational goals and objectives.</li><li>Completes supervisory paperwork accurately and in a timely manner.</li><li>Oversee the processing and stocking of new shipments.</li><li>Handles emergencies and customer complaints.</li><li>Process sales at register.</li><li>Responsible key holder.</li><li>Performs other duties as may be assigned.</li><li>Manage the administration of weekly payroll to the corporate payroll department.</li><li>Processing the daily deposit and balancing the books.</li><li>Complete weekly reports and paperwork.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Previous experience in grocery.</li><li>Previous experience in a management role-at least one year.</li><li>Ability to give exceptional customer service.</li><li>Demonstrate leadership skills and ability to motivate and execute through others.</li><li>Previous cash handling skills.</li><li>Ability to make sound decisions when necessary and know when to ask for help.</li><li>Strong written and oral communication.</li><li>Intermediate computer skills.</li><li>Able to work a flexible schedule including evenings, weekends, and some holidays.</li><li>Local candidates only.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Physical Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Must be able to regularly lift at least 50 lbs.</li><li>Standing: Up to 8 hours per day.</li><li>Seating: Up to 1 hours per day.</li><li>Walking: Up to 6 hours per day.</li><li>Reaching: Up to 4 hours per day.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Pay scale</strong>: $23.50 - $25.48/hour depending on industry experience.<p><br></p><strong>About the Benefits:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>This is a union position with competitive pay.</li><li>Comprehensive Medical Insurance</li><li>Dental and Vision Insurance</li><li>Life Insurance</li><li>Employee Assistance Program</li><li>Pension Program</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Entertainment Discounts</li><li>Employee Discount on Mollie Stone’s Purchases</li><li>Paid Time Off</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Why should you apply?</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You want to enjoy what you do.</li><li>You know what it takes to provide outstanding customer service.</li><li>You would like to join a local, family owned company who values you.</li><li>You get to enjoy and rely on great benefits and perks for you and your family.</li><li>You’ll have opportunity to learn, grow and advance in your career.</li></ul><p><br></p>Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time.<p><br></p><strong>Mollie Stone’s Markets is an Equal Opportunity Employer</strong><p><br></p><strong><em>Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.</em></strong><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>NMkUIhIMMa

<strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>Reporting to the Director of Resources and Operations, and receiving work direction from the Resource Analyst, under general supervision, the Administrative Support Coordinator independently provides various administrative and support services to the Department Chair, Resource Analyst, faculty, and students of the Justice Studies Department within the College of Social Sciences. This position works with the Department Coordinator and shares responsibility for the day-to-day operations of the department offices. The Administrative Support Coordinator is responsible for reconciling the department Research Foundation accounts, operating expenses in the Operating Fund, and PACE funds as well as other accounts/funds for the department. This position is also responsible for working with the Department Coordinator to train student assistants; processing ISA and Student Assistant appointments; assisting with department events; handling faculty and student confidential information; distributing information to students, faculty, and the general public; submitting and tracking facility and key requests; processing and reviewing travel and other reimbursement requests. Provides backup front desk coverage and phone support to the Department Coordinator.<p><br></p><strong><u>Key Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Assist in reconciling operating fund expense budget to Data Warehouse reports</li><li>Assist with Research and Tower Foundation accounts to Foundation reports monthly</li><li>Provide balance and expenditure information to the department Chair and department Analyst</li><li>Assist with reconciling operating funds and foundation Pro-cards and Go-cards monthly</li><li>Prepare Operating Fund and Foundation travel authorizations and expense reimbursements for faculty and students</li><li>Prepare and review purchase requisitions, travel authorizations and reimbursements, other reimbursements as needed</li><li>Assist department Analyst with budget related projects</li><li>Responsible for training student assistants</li><li>Assist in processing ISA and Student Assistant appointments</li><li>Assure student time is submitted by UP deadlines so that students are paid in a timely manner</li><li>Assist faculty and Chair in grade changes, clearing incompletes, and other similar tasks</li><li>Assist in issuing permission codes as needed for designated Justice Studies courses</li><li>Support faculty and students with travel processes and procedures</li><li>Assist Chair, and department Analyst with faculty recruitment, temporary faculty evaluations and RTP as needed</li><li>Responsible for student outreach</li><li>Provide other department, faculty and student support as requested/needed</li><li>Independently perform the day-to-day tasks for the operation of the department offices</li><li>Assist with department event planning and coordination</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Knowledge, Skills &amp; Abilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Knowledge of software applications: DocuSign, word processing, spreadsheets, G Suite (e.g., Gmail, Google drive), database management, Adobe Acrobat, and graphics design software (e.g., Illustrator, InDesign, or Photoshop)</li><li>Knowledge of fund accounting practices and the ability to maintain multiple detailed spreadsheets</li><li>Ability to handle multiple work priorities, and independently prioritize, organize and plan work and projects</li><li>Ability to learn and interpret data, policies and procedures, and apply that knowledge to departmental decision making</li><li>Ability to train students to assure their understanding of work assignments</li><li>Ability to work with campus organizations and outside vendors to plan, organize, and implement events</li><li>Strong oral and written communications skills</li><li>Excellent customer service and public relations skills</li><li>Ability to communicate with constituents in a professional and respectful manner</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Completion of a high school program, technical/vocational program, or their equivalents</li><li>Three years of related office work experience</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree</li><li>Administrative experience working in an office with complex and diverse tasks similar to the Department of Justice Studies in the College of Social Sciences</li><li>Excellent written communication skills</li><li>Excellent customer service and public relations skills</li><li>Experience with SJSU policies and procedures specifically dealing with Procurement Services, FD&amp;O, Admissions and Records, Tower/Research Foundation and processing of invoices/reimbursements/requisitions/ and travel requests</li><li>Experience with Microsoft Office Suite, PeopleSoft, CMS/FTS,CFS, G Suite (e.g., Gmail, Google Drive), graphics design software, Adobe Acrobat, DocuSign</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Compensation</u></strong><p><br></p>Classification: Administrative Support Coordinator II<p><br></p>Anticipated Hiring Range: $4,441/month - $4,500/month<p><br></p>CSU Salary Range: $3,681/month - $6,034/month<p><br></p>San José State University offers employees a comprehensive benefits package typically worth 30-35% of your base salary. For more information on programs available, please see the Employee Benefits Summary .<p><br></p><strong>Application Procedure</strong><p><br></p>Click Apply Now to complete the SJSU Online Employment Application and attach the following documents:<p><br></p><ul><li>Resume</li><li>Letter of Interest</li></ul><p><br></p>All applicants must apply within the specified application period: <strong>May 15, 2023 through May 31, 2023</strong>. This position is open until filled; however, applications received after screening has begun will be considered at the discretion of the university.<p><br></p><strong>Contact Information</strong><p><br></p>University Personnel<p><br></p>jobs@sjsu.edu<p><br></p>408-924-2252<p><br></p><strong>CSU Vaccination Policy</strong><p><br></p>The CSU strongly recommends that all individuals who access any in-person program or activity (on- or off-campus) operated or controlled by the University follow COVID-19 vaccine recommendations adopted by the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the California Department of Public Health (CDPH) applicable to their age, medical condition, and other relevant indications and comply with other safety measures established by each campus. The system wide policy can be found at https://calstate.policystat.com/policy/9779821/latest/ and questions may be sent to jobs@sjsu.edu .<p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Information</u></strong><p><br></p>Satisfactory completion of a background check (including a criminal records check) is required for employment. SJSU will issue a contingent offer of employment to the selected candidate, which may be rescinded if the background check reveals disqualifying information, and/or it is discovered that the candidate knowingly withheld or falsified information. Failure to satisfactorily complete the background check may affect the continued employment of a current CSU employee who was offered the position on a contingent basis.<p><br></p>The standard background check includes: criminal check, employment and education verification. Depending on the position, a motor vehicle and/or credit check may be required. All background checks are conducted through the university's third party vendor, Accurate Background. Some positions may also require fingerprinting. SJSU will pay all costs associated with this procedure. Evidence of required degree(s) or certification(s) will be required at time of hire.<p><br></p>SJSU IS NOT A SPONSORING AGENCY FOR STAFF OR MANAGEMENT POSITIONS. (e.g. H1-B VISAS)<p><br></p>All San José State University employees are considered mandated reporters under the California Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act and are required to comply with the requirements set forth in CSU Executive Order 1083 as a condition of employment. Incumbent is also required to promptly report any knowledge of a possible Title IX related incident to the Title IX Office or report any discrimination, harassment, and/or retaliation to the Office of Equal Opportunity.<p><br></p><strong>Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Crime Statistics Act and Campus Housing Fire Safety Notification: </strong><p><br></p>Pursuant to the Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act, the Annual Security Report (ASR) is also now available for viewing at https://www.sjsu.edu/clery/docs/SJSU-Annual-Security-Report.pdf. The ASR contains the current security and safety-related policy statements, emergency preparedness and evacuation information, crime prevention and Sexual Assault prevention information, and information about drug and alcohol prevention programming. The ASR also contains statistics of Clery crimes for San José State University locations for the three most recent calendar years. A paper copy of the ASR is available upon request by contacting the Office of the Clery Director by phone at 408-924-1501 or by email at clerycompliance@sjsu.edu .<p><br></p>Pursuant to the Higher Education Opportunity Act, the Annual Fire Safety Report (AFSR) is also available for viewing at https://www.sjsu.edu/clery/docs/SJSU-Annual-Fire-Safety-Report.pdf . The purpose of this report is to disclose statistics for fires that occurred within SJSU on-campus housing facilities for the three most recent calendar years, and to distribute fire safety policies and procedures intended to promote safety on Campus. A paper copy of the AFSR is available upon request by contacting the Housing Office by phone at 408-795-5600 or by email at uhs-frontdesk@sjsu.edu .<p><br></p><strong>Equal Employment Statement</strong><p><br></p>San José State University (SJSU) is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer committed to nondiscrimination on the basis of age, ancestry, citizenship status, color, creed, disability, ethnicity, gender, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, race, religion or lack thereof, sex, sexual orientation, transgender, or protected veteran status consistent with applicable federal and state laws. Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, and certain other federal and state laws, prohibit discrimination on the basis of sex in all education programs and activities operated by the university (both on and off campus).

Are you committed to excellence and looking for opportunities to advance your career?<p><br></p>Are you passionate about technology and startups and want to engage deeply with some of the most innovative early-stage companies in the world?<p><br></p>Do you want to work for a company that <em>really </em>values work/life balance?<p><br></p><strong>Attivo is for you!</strong><p><br></p>Attivo Partners is a full-service finance and accounting consulting firm with our HQ in San Francisco, California and a presence &amp; clientele in the major start-up hubs across the US. We provide our emerging growth clients with CFO, accounting, and finance services across industries and at all stages of early growth – from zero to &gt;$50M in revenue.<p><br></p>At Attivo, we work with some of the most exciting emerging growth companies backed by leading venture capital firms. Working with Attivo means collaborating with a team that has extensive experience with venture-backed companies and deep finance and accounting expertise. We are excited by the accounting, finance and business challenges inherent in working across many different companies, which provide our team members with excellent opportunities for learning and growing.<p><br></p>At Attivo, we take mentoring and training seriously and our partners devote time and energy to developing and nurturing talent. We are a passionate group of people and live our values in everything we do:<p><br></p><ul><li>Relationships that last</li><li>Data-driven insights</li><li>Growth-focused mindset</li><li>Collaboration-first environment</li><li>Culture-conscious</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Role Overview</strong><p><br></p>The ideal candidate is a resourceful problem solver who will take ownership of critical accounting tasks. This team member will be a key player in ensuring the client's accounting and reporting function will scale and support the client's rapid growth. Enthusiasm and willingness to learn are key to the success of the Staff Accountant.<p><br></p>This is a work from home position with location preference in the San Francisco Bay area.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Solid understanding of GAAP</li><li>Experience with standard software solutions preferred, for example: QuickBooks Online, Xero, Netsuite, Bill.com, Gusto, Expensify, Carta</li><li>Highly detail oriented with excellent organizational skills</li><li>Fast learner with high degree of professional curiosity and desire to learn</li><li>Ability to manage multiple priorities</li><li>Enjoy a collaborative, team-oriented environment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance 2+ years of progressive accounting experience with direct exposure to accounting operation duties like AP, AR, and cash reconciliations Experience working in a fast-paced technology, or professional services environment</li></ul><p><br></p>Education &amp; Experience<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance</li><li>4+ years of progressive accounting experience</li><li>Experience working in a fast-paced technology, or professional services environment</li></ul><p><br></p>Professional Attributes<p><br></p><ul><li>Professional integrity</li><li>High energy and enthusiasm, with a strong commitment to exceeding client expectations</li><li>Flexibility and openness to work on a variety of assignments, industries, and roles</li><li>Ability to learn quickly, make an immediate impact, and provide value-added service to our clients </li><li>Strong communication &amp; interpersonal skills, displaying the ability to connect and build relationships with clients, firm leadership, &amp; peers </li><li>Confidence in professional aptitude and ability to effectively convey skills, knowledge, and qualifications to clients </li><li>Team player with a strong desire to be an active, long-term participant in Attivo's growth</li><li>Entrepreneurial spirit and passion for startups and early-stage growth companies</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Salary Range</strong><p><br></p>Attivo offers a competitive base plus bonus, and opportunities for advancement. The starting salary range for Staff Accountant is approximately $85,000 to $100,000 per year plus bonus.<p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p>Benefits for full-time employees include: Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance (100% coverage for employees on base plan, 70% coverage for additional family members), participation in Flexible Spending Accounts and 401(k), 3 weeks PTO, voluntary Life Insurance &amp; Disability plans, and work-from-home allowance. Primary caregivers and others requiring a flexible work schedule or reduced hours are encouraged to apply; benefits may be prorated for part-time hires.<p><br></p><strong>Final Notes</strong><p><br></p>Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.<p><br></p>Attivo Partners is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to a diverse workplace. People from diverse racial, ethnic and cultural backgrounds, women, LGBTQ+ individuals, and persons with disabilities are highly encouraged to apply.

jobs_titles: Tissue Bank and SART Data Coordinator
describtion: <strong>Who is Spring Fertility?</strong><p><br></p>We're a passionate, dedicated team of leading physicians and scientists who came from some of the best research hospitals and fertility centers around the world to become the fastest growing fertility group in the country. We offer the most patient-centric, individualized, flexible and compassionate care. Our mission is to partner with our patients to help them achieve their goals, whatever those may be. We believe everyone deserves a family if they want one, and our team is dedicated to guiding our patients on their unique journeys!<p><br></p><strong>Why should you join our team?</strong><p><br></p>We are a mission-driven organization that is looking for high performers, movers, shakers and innovators! We are working hard to create a first-class fertility practice, but we know how to have fun too! We are growing quickly and care deeply about the development of our team, both professionally and personally. We value optimism, compassion and teamwork, and above all, are united by our shared commitment to put patients first.<p><br></p>Role Summary<p><br></p>This position is responsible for performing high quality IVF laboratory ancillary work to ensure correct cryo inventory keeping, correct receiving and releasing of cryo material, as well as correct and timely data entry in the SART/NASS system. The Tissue Bank team leads in charge of this position, consult and advise other staff groups/members regarding patient cryo inventory and IVF laboratory procedures and outcomes regarding human assisted reproductive techniques (ART).<p><br></p>The cryo-SART coordinator works collaboratively with clinical teams, the IVF Laboratory team, the Tissue Bank team, as well as with other SPRING Fertility departments as needed, to fulfill his/her duties and ensure patient satisfaction and accuracy of information.<p><br></p>Primary duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to the following (Cryo coordinator):<p><br></p><ul><li>Provide high quality service and directions to patients seeking to transport eggs, sperm or embryos to or from SPRING Fertility in a timely manner to ensure treatment timelines and IVF laboratory schedule are adhered to. </li><li>Provide high quality service and coordination with other clinics or cryo-banks involved in the transport eggs, sperm, or embryos to or from SPRING Fertility. </li><li>Organize and prepare necessary paperwork to safely and lawfully transport eggs, sperm or embryos. This includes appropriate consents, originating clinic paperwork and consents, Infectious Disease results and necessary FDA paperwork. </li><li>Maintain records of all received and shipped out tissue. </li><li>Update EMR with all tissue transport paperwork for egg, sperm, and embryo shipments. </li><li>Make sure dry shippers are properly charged and logged before every use. </li><li>Maintain an updated quality control and internal performance assessment of the dry shippers. </li><li>Work with IVF laboratory and providers to dispose of tissue in a timely manner. </li><li>Be aware and updated on clinic and IVF laboratory SOPs regarding transport and storage of cryopreserved material. </li><li>Work with IVF laboratory embryologists and providers for correct embryology interpretation of results and reports coming from other clinics. </li><li>Take active part in the writing, implementing, and updating of transport and cryo consents. </li><li>Take active part in the writing, implementing, and updating of tissue transport SOPs to ensure proper shipment preparation and data entry. </li><li>Comply with regulations and laws for human ART in the U.S. and California when performing duties and responsibilities. </li><li>Adhere to the policies and rules of SPRING Fertility and assure that work is performed in accordance with ASRM and FDA standards. </li><li>Scrupulously follows laboratory and clinic SOPs as well as comply with all safety policies and standards. </li><li>Work with billing department to ensure proper and timely invoice creation. </li><li>Communicate effectively and compassionately with patients and other SPRING Fertility team members. </li></ul><p><br></p>Primary duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to the following (SART coordinator):<p><br></p><ul><li>Enter appropriate data to SART in an efficient and correct manner. </li><li>Comply with regulations and guidelines from SART and assure that work is performed in accordance with their standards. </li><li>Meet all deadlines for data entry and submission of data to SART as set by regulatory agencies. </li><li>Take active part in the writing, implementing, and updating of clinic SOPs regarding SART and NASS data entry. </li></ul><p><br></p>Education<p><br></p>Bachelors in Science in Biological or Chemistry preferred with degree in reproductive Biology as priority.<p><br></p><strong>Employment Type</strong><p><br></p>This is a full-time (40 hours a week/8 hours per day) on-site, non-exempt position.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation</strong><p><br></p>The salary range for this role is $22-$30/hr. Salary is based on several factors including job related knowledge and skill set, depth of experience, certifications and/or degrees.<p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p><strong><em>Investing in you today</em></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive Medical, Dental, and Vision Plans </li><li>Paid Time Off to enjoy "you" time! </li><li>Additional benefits - WageWorks, Pet Insurance, Discounted rates on home and auto insurance</li><li>Career development and cross-training opportunities </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Investing in your future</em></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>401k Match with up to 4% matching</li><li>Fertility Benefits Program </li><li>Paid Life and Disability Insurance </li></ul><p><br></p><em>In accordance with state law, Spring Fertility requires all on-site (or remote employees who come on-site) to be vaccinated for COVID-19. To be considered for employment opportunities at Spring Fertility, candidates must be fully vaccinated (including a booster if eligible) by potential start date. If not eligible to be boosted at this present time, it will be required when you meet eligibility should you be offered a position at Spring. Exceptions will be made for candidates who are not able to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons under federal, state, and local laws. </em><p><br></p><em><strong>Don't have it all? We still welcome you to apply! </strong></em><p><br></p>At Spring Fertility, we believe that everyone who wants a family deserves to have one, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, or religion. Just as we acknowledge and value the diversity of goals, life experiences, and unique paths to parenthood among our patients, we also actively celebrate diversity within our organization. We are an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to a safe and inclusive work environment for all. We recognize that diversity among our team allows us to not only more effectively serve our patients, but also to advance innovation and opportunity within our field. We encourage qualified applicants of every background, ability, and life experience to apply to our employment opportunities.<p><br></p><em><strong>We are scientists. We are humanists. We are passionate about fertility. </strong></em><p><br></p>Visit our Careers Page to learn more about us! www.springfertility.com/careers<p><br></p>CCPA disclosure notice here.

The role of Dispensary Associate is more customer service and success than sales. exceptional service for new and existing customers</li><li>Point of sale system entry</li><li>Respond to customer requests for information in a patient and informative way</li><li>Maintain a basic understanding of the products available within the retail location</li><li>Be able to follow best practices established by the store for customer engagement and compliance</li><li>Projects a positive image of the organization to employees, customers, industry, and community</li><li>Ability to build long term relationships with customers for referrals and repeat business</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>A minimum of 1 years in a customer service role in a retail or hospitality environment</li><li>Minimum 21 years of age (or as required by state regulations)</li><li>A minimum of a High School diploma is required</li><li>Intermediate-level math skills</li><li>Exceptional customer service skills</li><li>Strong attention to detail and ability to solve and resolve problems in a calm, professional, and courteous manner</li><li>Strong computer-based skills</li><li>Dynamic interpersonal and communication skills</li><li>Ability to stand for long periods of time</li><li>Personal experience with cannabis</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Desired Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Analytical skills to assess data, facts, and figures</li><li>Proven expertise and experience to accurately manage a register</li><li>Experience training new hires in a previous job</li><li>Experience as a “key holder” in a retail environment</li><li>Knowledge of the state’s cannabis regulations</li><li>5+ years in retail</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About KANNA</u></strong><p><br></p>Here at KANNA we support and carry social equity brands in an effort to better and empower our community. We’re proudly black owned and we’re committed to providing tested, high quality cannabis products at competitive prices. Welcome to YOUR elevated cannabis experience.<p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>PTO</li><li>Tips</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Equal opportunity employer</strong><p><br></p>KANNA is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Established in 1996, Community Bank of the Bay is an independent, multiple award-winning community-focused bank with over 25 years of active financial investment in businesses and individuals in the San Francisco Bay Area. Our clients include numerous organizations from many industries, including local nonprofits, multi-generational businesses, creative professionals, and owner-operators experiencing change, growth, or expansion.<p><br></p>At CBB, we believe you can only truly serve a community when you are part of it. As the first Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) formed in California, we are actively involved in local community life. In fact, that’s the whole thought behind community banking: your funds invested locally, through local decisions, by local people, driving the success of the broader community. Our mission is to foster and promote economic development in the communities we serve.<p><br></p>At Community Bank of the Bay, our employees are our greatest asset, and we recognize that our success as a community bank is because of our extraordinary staff. We offer a welcoming, friendly, caring work environment with competitive compensation, a strong and robust benefits program, and an emphasis on healthy work/life balance.<p><br></p>Our six core values of Sustainability, Empowering, Respect, Trust, Commitment and Relationship building represent what we stand for and believe in as an organization. Every day, we strive to align our behaviors to these core values in everything we do.<p><br></p><strong>Overview</strong><p><br></p>The New Accounts Officer is responsible for performing a broad variety of financial services such as opening and closing deposit accounts, renewing certificate of deposit, and assisting customers with various types of account problems. Answers customer questions regarding Community Bank of the Bay services and performs a variety of account maintenance. Assists customers with monetary transactions. May be responsible for managing a portfolio of customers by taking ownership for the relationship and being the primary point of contact for their customer issues. Assists or refers customers with any and all questions or problems that arise. Attends to telephone inquiries and transactions for customers. Responsible for complying with bank policies, procedures, laws and regulations, and security procedures. Performs various branch functions as required.<p><br></p><ul><li>Location: San Jose</li><li>Job Type: Full-time</li></ul><p><br></p>Duties and Responsibilities<p><br></p><ul><li>Assumes responsibility for the effective and professional performance of financial service functions</li><li>Presents and explains bank services, products, and mission to customers to meet their financial needs. Opens and closes accounts, orders checks, and debit cards. May rent safety deposit boxes. </li><li>Answers questions and solves problems for customers by listening to problems, collecting data, securing answers. Resolves customer account problems. Takes stop payment orders</li><li>Renews and updates certificate of deposit accounts</li><li>Receives and directs customers and telephone calls. Responds to inquiries and questions, or directs them as necessary. Records and relays messages</li><li>Performs file maintenance and account changes as needed. </li><li>Performs address changes for customers</li><li>Maintains IRA accounts and answers questions regarding IRAs</li><li>Assumes responsibility for establishing and maintaining effective, professional business relations with customers</li><li>Resolves customer requests and questions promptly, courteously, and professionally</li><li>Keeps customers informed of Community Bank of the Bay services and policies</li><li>Assumes responsibility for establishing and maintaining effective coordination and working relationships with coworkers and management</li><li>Assists area personnel as required</li><li>Keeps supervisor informed of area activities and significant problems</li><li>Completes required reports and records accurately and promptly</li><li>Attends meetings as required</li><li>Assumes responsibility for related duties as required or assigned</li><li>Actively and professionally cross sells Company services. </li><li>Performs research and NSF duties as needed</li><li>Other duties as assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p>EDUCATION/CERTIFICATION:<p><br></p><ul><li>High school graduate or equivalent</li></ul><p><br></p>REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE:<p><br></p><ul><li>Understanding of financial services and products provided</li><li>Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, and Outlook)</li></ul><p><br></p>EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:<p><br></p><ul><li>1 year of financial institution experience in new accounts or universal banker role. </li></ul><p><br></p>SKILLS/ABILITIES:<p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent data entry skills</li><li>Exceptional phone demeanor and customer service skills; Ability to listen attentively and assess callers’ needs</li><li>Positive with a can-do attitude</li><li>Punctual, reliable, adaptable, and a team player</li><li>Ability to operate related computer applications and business equipment</li><li>Solid math and bookkeeping abilities</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Subsidized Medical, Dental, &amp; Vision </li><li>Basic Life/Accidental Death and Disbursement Insurance, Long-term Disability Insurance</li><li>Employee Assistance Program</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>401K Retirement Plan</li><li>Flexible Spending Accounts – Medical &amp; Dependent Care</li><li>Paid Vacation and Sick days</li><li>11 paid Holidays per year</li><li>Volunteer Day</li><li>Gift Matching Contribution to Non-Profit Organizations of employee’s choice</li><li>Green Car Program Subsidy for eligible Hybrid and Electric Vehicles</li><li>Employee Referral Program</li></ul><p><br></p>Base Salary Range<p><br></p>$24 - $33 an hour<p><br></p>Salary may vary depending on multiple factors including but not limited to skill level, depth of work experience, education, relevant licenses/credentials, and geographic location.<p><br></p><em>EOE, including disability/vets. <em>Job candidates must be legally eligible to work in the United States.</em></em>

describtion: Job Description:<p><br></p>Work as a Remote Product Tester from home (no experience required). Evaluate products to provide user feedback to companies and market research firms to ensure proper product certification and greater market access.<p><br></p>Participation in our Remote Product Testing job is 100% remote, free, secure, and private. Learn about an exciting industry (market research) and have fun testing new products while earning a nice income Part-Time or Full-Time. Benefits: Very competitive pay rate Weekly pay Work around your own schedule Learn about an exciting industry Telecommute (you can work from home, work, or school) A paid Product Tester position is perfect for those looking for a 100% remote job, an entry-level opportunity, or seasonal, temporary, or part-time work. The hours are completely flexible, and no previous experience is necessary.<p><br></p>Our paid Product Testers come from all backgrounds and industries, ranging from customer service and sales to administrative assistants. If you are a manager, receptionist, warehouse or factory worker, driver, medical assistant, nurse, cleaner, college student, messenger, maid, teacher, retail associate, salesperson, secretary, server, janitor, cashier, contract worker, or intern who is looking for a flexible part-time or seasonal job, you should try paid Product Testing to supplement your income. Also, if you have been involved in accounting, clerical jobs, marketing, management, security, or data entry jobs, you may be a good fit for a fully remote paid Product Tester Position

Experience (required)</u></strong><p><br></p>High school diploma and three years of administrative experience, or combination of education and relevant experience.<p><br></p><strong><u>Knowledge, Skills And Abilities (required)</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Proficient computer skills and demonstrated experience with office software and email applications.</li><li>Demonstrated success in following through and completing routine tasks.</li><li>Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. </li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills.</li><li>Ability to prioritize and multi-task. </li></ul> <strong>PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS :</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Constantly perform desk-based computer tasks.</li><li>Frequently sitting.</li><li>Occasionally stand/walk, reach/work above shoulders, grasp lightly/fine manipulation, grasp forcefully, use a telephone, sort/file paperwork or parts, lift/carry/push/pull objects that weigh up to 10 pounds.</li><li>Rarely twist/bend/stoop/squat, kneel/crawl.</li></ul> <em> - Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.</em><p><br></p><strong><u>Work Standards</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Interpersonal Skills: Demonstrates the ability to work well with Stanford colleagues and clients and with external organizations.</li><li>Promote Culture of Safety: Demonstrates commitment to personal responsibility and value for safety; communicates safety concerns; uses and promotes safe behaviors based on training and lessons learned.</li><li>Subject to and expected to comply with all applicable University policies and procedures, including but not limited to the personnel policies and other policies found in the University's Administrative Guide, .</li></ul> <em>The expected pay range for this position is $56,000 to $77,000 per annum. Stanford University provides pay ranges representing its good faith estimate of what the university reasonably expects to pay for a position. The pay offered to a selected candidate will be determined based on factors such as (but not limited to) the scope and responsibilities of the position, the qualifications of the selected candidate, departmental budget availability, internal equity, geographic location and external market pay for comparable jobs.</em>

Arnold &amp; Porter has an opening for an Administrative Specialist in the San Francisco office. The Administrative Specialist provides administration, organizational, technical, and project-based support to the Co-Managing Partner, as well as other attorneys and other legal personnel time permitting.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Scheduling meetings and coordinating all aspects of those meetings, including but not limited to creating/editing PowerPoint slides and other information.</li><li>Managing the Co-Managing Partner’s Outlook calendar.</li><li>Coordinating in-person and video meetings; including, reserving conference rooms, ordering meals, arranging for any IT equipment needed (i.e. laptop, projector, audio/video equipment), sending Outlook meeting requests, greeting clients, checking in guests in the lobby for large meetings, etc.</li><li>Accurately coordinating travel arrangements via the firm’s Travel department.</li><li>Processing expenses in Chrome River for expense reimbursements.</li><li>Updating attorneys’ contact lists as well as preparing, editing, and proofreading routine correspondence.</li><li>Editing client prebills as directed and processing client billing in accordance with firm policies and procedures (in coordination with the Billing department).</li><li>Assisting with ad hoc projects in coordination with other departments such as Finance &amp; Accounting, Information Technology, Marketing, Talent, HR, etc. to accomplish assigned projects. </li><li>Setting up new client matters; completing client label requests, requesting on-site/off-site client files from the firm’s Information Governance and Conflicts &amp; Client Intake departments.</li><li>Performing a variety of administrative responsibilities to develop systems and processes to manage the work efficiently as well as providing general support as assigned. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum of three (3) years of legal support experience in a professional work environment. </li><li>Two-year degree or equivalent experience considered.</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Office required including PowerPoint and Excel. Proficiency in iManage or a comparable document management system is a plus.</li><li>Ability to clearly and effectively communicate, in oral and written form, with individuals at all levels within the Firm and outside the Firm.</li><li>Demonstrate a high level of attention to detail and pride in high quality deliverables.</li><li>Must have the ability to multi-task and prioritize in a fast-paced environment using good judgment.</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills to build successful working relationships and to work within a team environment exhibiting the ability to collaborate effectively as well as work independently </li><li>Exceptional client service, both internal and external.</li><li>Ability to perform responsibilities with tact, diplomacy, discretion and respect for confidentiality and diversity. </li><li>Ability to work additional hours, as necessary.</li></ul><p><br></p>The anticipated base salary for this position is $67,500 to $95,000. The actual base salary offered will depend on a variety of factors, including without limitation, the qualifications of the individual applicant for the position, years of relevant experience, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held, and if applicable, the location in which the applicant lives and/or from which they will be performing the job.<p><br></p>
