Qualifications </strong> </p><ul><li>Require a High School GED/Diploma </li><li>Preferred but not required: a certificate of completion for another form of further education such as an accredited business college, city college or university, or is in the process of doing so. </li><li>Preferred but not required: Proficient working knowledge of Mac and PC computing platforms with excellent skills in Microsoft Office Excel and other Office programs. </li><li>Experience with database management tools </li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills, communication skills and English proficiency (verbal and written) </li><li>Prior experience in retail, sample coordination or managing stock inventory will be highly regarded </li><li>Has an acute sense of urgency, understands how to prioritize tasks according to critical needs and is extremely organized </li><li>Ability to think and react in a high-energy, fast paced environment </li><li>Proven ability to meet stringent deadlines </li><li>Is obsessed with accuracy and pays great attention to detail </li><li>Self-motivator, proactive, and works independently </li><li>Position requires prolonged periods of time standing and kneeling </li><li>Must be able to lift to 25 lbs.</li></ul>

<strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>Reporting to the Interim Vice Provost Undergraduate Education and receiving work lead direction from the Undergraduate Education Resource Operations Analyst, the Undergraduate Education Coordinator provides administrative and clerical support to unit, including primary support for Academic Internships and support for Academic Preparation Programs. The position is responsible for office coordination, web site creation and maintenance, managing calendars, maintaining data for reports, and scheduling and coordinating events. The position contributes to creating and sustaining a responsive environment for SJSU students, staff and faculty. This position acts as the front-line receptionist greeting students and visitors; maintaining office filing systems and performing additional support functions.<p><br></p><strong><u>Key Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Updates and maintains Undergraduate Education website, and other websites in the unit</li><li> Applies academic policies and procedures relating to Undergraduate Education at SJSU</li><li> Support office staff in maintaining the catalog and creating reports</li><li>Reviews and processes New Partner Proposal form (NPPF) requests for accuracy and completeness</li><li>Activates approved internship placement sites in the SJS4 database</li><li>Researches and interprets policies and procedures to make independent judgements related to the Early Assessment and Early Start programs</li><li>Coordinates and makes travel or room arrangements for APP meetings and workshops</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Knowledge, Skills &amp; Abilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to communicate with stakeholders in an effective, professional and respectful manner</li><li>Excellent interpersonal, customer service and public relations skills</li><li>Ability to maintain confidentiality and appropriately handle sensitive communications with employees and external agencies</li><li>Expertise in using office systems including Office Suite, PeopleSoft, OU Campus, Adobe products, etc.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Completion of a high school program, technical/vocational program, or their equivalents</li><li>Three years of related office work experience</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree </li><li>Experience with computer skills and working knowledge of common software suites (Microsoft, Google, and Adobe), along with data entry and web content management systems</li><li>Experience in organizing and maintaining records and data on special projects</li><li>Experience with student support (i.e., class scheduling, records and enrollment, and familiarity with curriculum)</li><li>Experience using PeopleSoft Student Administration</li><li>Experience with customer service, office administration and project management, social media, and event coordination</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Compensation</u></strong><p><br></p>Classification: Administrative Support Coordinator II<p><br></p>Anticipated Hiring Range: $4,173/month - $4,250/month<p><br></p>CSU Salary Range: $3,681/month - $6,034/month<p><br></p>San José State University offers employees a comprehensive benefits package typically worth 30-35% of your base salary. For more information on programs available, please see the Employee Benefits Summary .<p><br></p><strong>Application Procedure</strong><p><br></p>Click Apply Now to complete the SJSU Online Employment Application and attach the following documents:<p><br></p><ul><li>Resume</li><li>Letter of Interest</li></ul><p><br></p>All applicants must apply within the specified application period: <strong>July 10, 2023 through August 1, 2023</strong>. This position is open until filled; however, applications received after screening has begun will be considered at the discretion of the university.<p><br></p><strong>Contact Information</strong><p><br></p>University Personnel<p><br></p>jobs@sjsu.edu<p><br></p>408-924-2252<p><br></p><strong>CSU Vaccination Policy</strong><p><br></p>The CSU strongly recommends that all individuals who access any in-person program or activity (on- or off-campus) operated or controlled by the University follow COVID-19 vaccine recommendations adopted by the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the California Department of Public Health (CDPH) applicable to their age, medical condition, and other relevant indications and comply with other safety measures established by each campus. The system wide policy can be found at https://calstate.policystat.com/policy/9779821/latest/ and questions may be sent to jobs@sjsu.edu .<p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Information</u></strong><p><br></p>Satisfactory completion of a background check (including a criminal records check) is required for employment. SJSU will issue a contingent offer of employment to the selected candidate, which may be rescinded if the background check reveals disqualifying information, and/or it is discovered that the candidate knowingly withheld or falsified information. Failure to satisfactorily complete the background check may affect the continued employment of a current CSU employee who was offered the position on a contingent basis.<p><br></p>The standard background check includes: criminal check, employment and education verification. Depending on the position, a motor vehicle and/or credit check may be required. All background checks are conducted through the university's third party vendor, Accurate Background. Some positions may also require fingerprinting. SJSU will pay all costs associated with this procedure. Evidence of required degree(s) or certification(s) will be required at time of hire.<p><br></p>SJSU IS NOT A SPONSORING AGENCY FOR STAFF OR MANAGEMENT POSITIONS. (e.g. H1-B VISAS)<p><br></p>All San José State University employees are considered mandated reporters under the California Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act and are required to comply with the requirements set forth in CSU Executive Order 1083 as a condition of employment. Incumbent is also required to promptly report any knowledge of a possible Title IX related incident to the Title IX Office or report any discrimination, harassment, and/or retaliation to the Office of Equal Opportunity.<p><br></p><strong>Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Crime Statistics Act and Campus Housing Fire Safety Notification: </strong><p><br></p>Pursuant to the Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act, the Annual Security Report (ASR) is also now available for viewing at https://www.sjsu.edu/clery/docs/SJSU-Annual-Security-Report.pdf. The ASR contains the current security and safety-related policy statements, emergency preparedness and evacuation information, crime prevention and Sexual Assault prevention information, and information about drug and alcohol prevention programming. The ASR also contains statistics of Clery crimes for San José State University locations for the three most recent calendar years. A paper copy of the ASR is available upon request by contacting the Office of the Clery Director by phone at 408-924-1501 or by email at clerycompliance@sjsu.edu .<p><br></p>Pursuant to the Higher Education Opportunity Act, the Annual Fire Safety Report (AFSR) is also available for viewing at https://www.sjsu.edu/clery/docs/SJSU-Annual-Fire-Safety-Report.pdf . The purpose of this report is to disclose statistics for fires that occurred within SJSU on-campus housing facilities for the three most recent calendar years, and to distribute fire safety policies and procedures intended to promote safety on Campus. A paper copy of the AFSR is available upon request by contacting the Housing Office by phone at 408-795-5600 or by email at uhs-frontdesk@sjsu.edu .<p><br></p><strong>Equal Employment Statement</strong><p><br></p>San José State University (SJSU) is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer committed to nondiscrimination on the basis of age, ancestry, citizenship status, color, creed, disability, ethnicity, gender, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, race, religion or lack thereof, sex, sexual orientation, transgender, or protected veteran status consistent with applicable federal and state laws. This policy applies to all SJSU students, faculty and staff programs and activities. Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, and certain other federal and state laws, prohibit discrimination on the basis of sex in all education programs and activities operated by the university (both on and off campus).

jobs_titles: Specialist, Inventory Fulfillment and Logistics, Part Time
describtion: This position is 100% On-site in San Francisco, CA<p><br></p><u><strong>Who we are</strong></u><p><br></p>Getaround is the world’s first connected carsharing marketplace. Launched in 2011, Getaround is available today in more than 1,000 cities across the United States and Europe.<p><br></p>We connect safe, convenient, and affordable cars with people who need them to live and work via our peer-to-peer marketplace. Our proprietary connected car technology allows guests to book and unlock a wide variety of vehicles directly from our app without ever having to meet anyone in person, carry an access card, wait in line, or coordinate picking up keys, unlike traditional rental car services.<p><br></p>Getaround is focused on providing economic opportunities to local communities. Our community includes guests who rely on our cars for on-demand mobility and entrepreneurial hosts (car owners) who share cars on our platform including those who operate their own carsharing businesses.<p><br></p>Through carsharing, we aim to lessen greenhouse gasses and reduce pollution. Studies show that when carsharing is available, people drive less and drive vehicles more appropriate for their use case, which can reduce household carbon emissions by up to 40%. Also, shared cars are used more frequently and retired more quickly, accelerating the adoption of newer, more energy-efficient vehicles.<p><br></p>Our mission is to empower people to carshare everywhere by enabling the shift away from car ownership, want to join us?<p><br></p><u><strong>The Opportunity</strong></u><p><br></p>The Inventory Fulfillment &amp; Logistics Specialist is responsible for processing twice weekly outbound fulfillment and inbound returns of our proprietary hardware and accessories, while providing proactive communication to ensure inventory levels are adequate. Your detailed organization and methodical thinking will ensure our fulfillment arm runs smoothly and defined SLAs are met. The best part? You have flexibility in determining your schedule! This is a part time position (8-12 hours per week) and needs to be onsite 2 days per week, ideally non-consecutive days, and complete open POs in 4-6 hours shifts.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You’ll Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Maintain accurate inventory counts, track active SKUs utilizing inventory management software and conduct physical counts as needed</li><li>Physically fulfill and manage POs (~40+/mo) daily</li><li>Create shipping profiles and maintain data cleanliness with our FedEx business account </li><li>Follow SOPs for all processes surrounding shipping to ensure SLAs and budgets are met and update as needed</li><li>Maintain optimal warehouse layout and cleanliness </li><li>Ensure all inventory, tools and supplies are in their correct locations and re-stocked at end of shift</li><li>Ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of company information, data, and systems.</li><li>Ensure that security policies and procedures are followed</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You’ll Need</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum of 1+ years of relevant work experience. Can be a combination of training, education, and relevant work experience</li><li>Comfortability with learning new and existing shipping tools (UPS/FedEx), warehouse management systems, and/or order processing systems</li><li>Working knowledge of Google Suite, primarily Gmail, Google Sheets, and Google Docs and Slack</li><li>Ability to work independently and effectively with diverse teams</li><li>Strong work ethic and punctuality</li><li>Excellent and proactive communications skills</li><li>Be able to lift 50 pounds (with or without accommodations)</li></ul><p><br></p>$20 - $22 an hour<p><br></p>(*Exact compensation may vary based on skills and experience)<p><br></p>This is an hourly position.<p><br></p>At Getaround, we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no matter your race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, <em>your perspective has value. </em><p><br></p>Come join us in continuing to make Getaround a great place to work!

jobs_titles: Typist Clerk III - Multiple Openings / Multiple Locations
describtion: <strong><u>Requirements / Qualifications<br><br></u></strong><strong>BASIC FUNCTION:</strong> Perform a variety of responsible and technical clerical duties requiring specialized knowledge and independent judgment involving frequent and responsible public contact; provide for proper input and output of a variety of data. <strong>Work available in:<br></strong><ul><li>Multiple locations (Elementary, Middle and High Schools)</li><li>Varying hours per day </li></ul> <strong>EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:</strong> Any combination equivalent to: high school diploma or equivalent and responsible clerical experience.<br><br><strong>REQUIRED DOCUMENTS:</strong> <em>The following <u>MUST</u> be attached to application on or before the deadline:<br></em><ul><li>High School Diploma or Equivalent OR Associate's Degree OR Bachelor's Degree OR Higher Education Degree<br></li></ul><strong>AND<br></strong><ul><li>Typing Certificate for 50 words net per minute from clear copy.<br></li></ul><strong>SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS/CERTIFICATES:</strong> ATTACH TO APPLICATION per district standard: current typing certificate (within last 6 months) for 50 NWPM (5-minute test with 5 or less errors). Original typing certificate must be verified. Internet certificates are not acceptable. A practical job skills test may be administered as part of the interview process. If selected for the position, out-of-district applicants must be T.B tested and fingerprinted.

Limited-time signing bonus offered <p><br></p><ul><li>Full-time Role - $1,000</li><li>Awarded after 90 continuous days of employment in good standing</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About The Role</strong><p><br></p>As a member of our Evening Operations team you will ensure that customer orders are accurate, up to Rinse quality standards, and delivered on time. This role has significant upside for exceptional performers who are motivated to learn quickly and want to work for a company committed to their professional development. We have an amazing team and want you to become a part of it!<p><br></p><ul><li>4:30PM - 1AM</li><li>$23/hr (First 2 weeks will be delivery driver training)</li><li>Equity: All Rinse City Operations Coordinators have the opportunity to earn and vest equity (options) after working at the company for 90 days.</li><li>Health benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision for full-time employees)</li><li>Paid leave</li><li>401k</li><li>Snacks</li><li>Rinse credit towards any Rinse-provided services like laundry and dry cleaning.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>In this role, you will...</strong><p><br></p>Join the team as one of our “air traffic controllers” for day-to-day operations. You’ll learn to create delivery routes, dispatch delivery drivers, and troubleshoot any delivery issues<p><br></p><ul><li>Coordinate with the Customer Care team and Operations team to deliver exceptional customer service.</li><li>Identify and analyze operational challenges and come up with creative solutions to help streamline operations.</li><li>Create and implement effective procedures that support Bay Area operational efforts.</li><li>Run our mobile warehouse operations (we will train you in operating our 16ft truck)</li></ul><p><br></p>As the ideal candidate, you...<p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to overcome challenges and effectively solve problems</li><li>Are cool as under pressure</li><li>Thrive in ultra-fast-paced environments</li><li>Welcome change with open arms</li><li>Are proficient Google Docs, And iOS devices (proficiency is a plus)</li><li>Breathe our core values of Taking Ownership, Respect, Honesty, and working to Delight and Amaze our customers</li><li>Can lift up to 50 pounds</li><li>Have a driver's license with a clean driving record.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>You’ll Love Working at Rinse Because…</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>We offer competitive compensation, Health benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision for full-time employees), paid leave, 401k, weekly lunch, all-day snacks and Rinse credit towards any Rinse-provided services!</li><li>We have built a high-caliber team and have a tight-knit, collaborative work environment that values honesty and open communication</li><li>You will take pride in creating Interesting and impactful work at a promising startup that would be proud to tell your mom about!</li><li>Our office is in the heart of SOMA</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Rinse</strong><p><br></p>Rinse is building the first and largest national, and eventually global, brand in clothing care. We're taking on a massive consumer problem and creating a significantly better dry cleaning and laundry experience through the combination of "smart scheduling" and best-in-class quality, all supported by a strong technology backbone.<p><br></p>Applicants will be required to submit to a criminal background and DMV check prior to commencing employment.<p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>byvDkMIrnJ

<strong>What To Expect<br></strong>As maintenance support, the team member’s responsibilities will be focused on assisting maintenance team in maintaining all spares for the production lines and planned preventive maintenance schedules implementation by using maintenance operating system to support vehicle manufacturing. This team member will be required to work with cross-functional teams (Maintenance Support, Engineering Team, Spares Team and FLUX Development Team) to implement planned spares and 100% inventory availability with accuracy. The candidate will act as a single point of contact for EMT’s (Engineering and Maintenance Teams) and support EMT’s in creating planned preventive maintenance schedules, PM checklists, work orders, assets, and create dispatches during planned or unplanned downtime for all critical or non-critical maintenance activities and projects in FLUX dispatch management module.<br><br><strong>What You’ll Do<br></strong> * Replenish Critical Line Side spares at all designated areas at the line on daily basis.<li> Process Critical Spares Parts and work closely with spares planner’s &amp; buyer’s for addition in Maintenance Operating System (FLUX).</li><li> Accurate systematic inventory, identifying spare parts, organizing and stocking parts for M3/Y Lineside Lockers/racks as per standard process.</li><li> Process RMAs, Return Orders, Site-to-Site Transfer, Handover’s to spare warehouse and handle Adhoc shipments.</li><li> Responsible of learning all new FLUX features and for training EMT’s for new Flux features. * Analyze planned spares consumption and identify projected shortages to mitigate production lines downtime.</li><li> Analyze Preventive Maintenance Schedules (PMs) data on daily basis and report to maintenance manager.</li><li> Compiles, verify and submit/present periodic/scheduled reports to the management with constructive feedback.</li><li> Deliver spares &amp; equipment between various locations within the Fremont plant as when and where needed by Maintenance &amp; Engineering Team’s (EMT’s).</li><li> Collect suppliers packing slips against spares shipments purchase orders and report to project coordinator.</li><li> Provide backup for coworkers as required.<br><br></li><strong>What You’ll Bring<br></strong> * Advance Microsoft Excel experience required (formulas, vlook, creating pivot tables and graphs).<li> Experience in Inventory, Stocking and RMA process experience.</li><li> Understanding of spares inventory management systems.</li><li> Ability to learn Tesla internal tools and systems.</li><li> Intermediate level expertise on MS Office (Excel &amp; PowerPoint), MYSQL is a plus.</li><li> Must have command of the English language, both written and verbal.</li><li> Must be reliable, have good initiative, committed, and quality focused.</li><li> Demonstrated skills in supplier operational and relationship management.</li><li> Passionate and high energy, with the diplomacy and cooperative style necessary to positively influence others, both inside and outside of Tesla.</li><li> Able to present scheduled reports to higher management with high level of accuracy and professionalism.</li><li> Ability to analyze data and problem-solving skills.</li><li> Ability to maintain a safe working environment.</li><li> Ability to perform repetitive duties while standing for long periods of time.</li><li> Ability to lift 30-50lbs.</li><li> Forklift Certification is a plus.<br><br></li><strong>Benefits<br></strong>Along with competitive pay, as a full-time Tesla employee, you are eligible for the following benefits at day 1 of hire:<li> Aetna PPO and HSA plans &gt; 2 medical plan options with $0 payroll deduction</li><li> Family-building, fertility, adoption and surrogacy benefits</li><li> Dental (including orthodontic coverage) and vision plans, both have options with a $0 paycheck contribution</li><li> Company Paid (Health Savings Account) HSA Contribution when enrolled in the High Deductible Aetna medical plan with HSA</li><li> Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)</li><li> LGBTQ+ care concierge services</li><li> 401(k) with employer match, Employee Stock Purchase Plans, and other financial benefits</li><li> Company paid Basic Life, AD&amp;D, short-term and long-term disability insurance</li><li> Employee Assistance Program</li><li> Sick and Vacation time (Flex time for salary positions), and Paid Holidays</li><li> Back-up childcare and parenting support resources</li><li> Voluntary benefits to include: critical illness, hospital indemnity, accident insurance, theft &amp; legal services, and pet insurance</li><li> Weight Loss and Tobacco Cessation Programs</li><li> Tesla Babies program</li><li> Commuter benefits</li><li> Employee discounts and perks program<br><br></li>Expected Compensation<br><br>$20.00 - $62.00/hour + cash and stock awards + benefits<br><br>Pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements dependent on the position offered. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.<br><br>#MFG

describtion: The City of Petaluma, uniquely situated on the Petaluma River at the Northern end of the San Francisco Bay, offers a vibrant cultural, outdoor, and gastronomic scene. Residents enjoy unparalleled natural beauty along with deep engagement with their community. Life in Petaluma is the perfect mix of country and city, offering biking, hiking, paddling, arts, music, and shopping as well as outstanding food and craft beverages. The City celebrates family and cultural diversity, and is a community of people who care about making Petaluma a place they're proud to call home. The new City Clerk will bring the knowledge and proven experience to assess current operations of the City Clerk’s Office and institute innovative processes, modifications, and technological efficiencies where necessary. The ideal candidate is emotionally intelligent, a strong communicator, and gets along well with others. Staying calm under pressure, bringing passion for local government and community service, and taking on new initiatives is essential to success in this role.<p><br></p>Qualified candidates possess a Bachelor’s degree as well as five (5) years of experience in supporting an elected/appointed government body. A Master’s degree, Certified Municipal Clerk (CMC), and Master Municipal Clerk (MMC) are highly desirable.<p><br></p>The current salary for the City Clerk is $164,883; salary placement is dependent on qualifications and experience. The City also offers an excellent benefits package. If you are interested in this outstanding opportunity, please visit our website at www.bobmurrayassoc.com to apply online. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to call Ms. Valerie Phillips at (916) 784-9080.<p><br></p><strong>Filing Deadline: August 27, 2023</strong>

The Division of Oncology , in the Stanford University Department of Medicine, is seeking a highly organized and professional Administrator (Administrative Associate 3) with exceptional customer service skills to join our team.<p><br></p>The Administrative Associate 3 will work closely with the division assistant manager to ensure that all administrative aspects of the role are functioning effectively. The AA3 will support 3 to 4 faculty. One world-renowned lymphoma expert who serves on committees for national and international professional associations and presents lectures and talks locally and internationally. The AA will also support 3 newly recruited UML faculty.<p><br></p>This role involves heavy and complex calendar management, travel coordination, and resolving conflicts related to scheduling.<p><br></p>As an Administrative Associate in the Division of Oncology at Stanford University, you will provide administrative and operational support to the Department’s faculty and staff members in a dynamic work environment. Regardless of the assignment, you'll be expected to demonstrate strong business judgment, professional etiquette, and exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills. In addition to having a “can-do” attitude and positive demeanor, you must have extraordinary communication skills that allow you to interact with a diverse group of people. Our core values are based on professionalism, integrity, responsibility, and commitment to mission. We foster a team culture which promotes and recognizes the contribution of each member to our success as a division.<p><br></p>The work of the Division of Oncology bridges the worlds of basic science, clinical diagnosis and the treatment of cancer. Our basic investigative activities concentrate on immunology, genetics/genomics, pharmacology, DNA repair and oncogene action. Our clinical science covers each cancer type; has a strong focus in clinical trials of new diagnostic and therapeutic approaches, and in correlative laboratory studies. Our work is supported by a portfolio of peer-reviewed grants, industrial agreements and research endowments.<p><br></p><strong>Duties Include</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Act on behalf of the supervisor, department manager, or chair in regards to establishing priorities and identifying and resolving problems that are administrative in nature.</li><li>Oversee and/or perform duties associated with scheduling, organizing, and operating complex conferences, seminars, and events, including arranging with vendors for services, overseeing the production and distribution of materials, administering logistics, and managing event within budget.</li><li>Compose and draft documents and correspondence for presentations, course handouts, grants, conferences, seminars, and reports. Perform substantial editing and fact checking. Create, maintain, modify, and/or ensure accuracy of content in various unit documents, displays, reports, brochures, social media, and/or websites.</li><li>Plan and schedule calendar(s) with limited consultation, resolve calendaring conflicts, and arrange travel in compliance with unit, university, and sponsor policies.</li><li>Oversee and/or process a variety of complex financial transactions; produce, monitor, and reconcile budget statements; research, identify, and resolve discrepancies. May assist with capital or special equipment requests and/or vendor selection.</li><li>Coordinate and monitor routine maintenance services completion. Plan and coordinate office moves and/or minor renovation projects.</li><li>May lead staff or supervise day-to-day work of student and/or temporary workers, including scheduling, assigning, and prioritizing workloads, setting appropriate deadlines, reviewing work for quality and timeliness, and providing performance review input.</li></ul><p><br></p>The job duties listed are typical examples of work performed by positions in this job classification and are not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, tasks, and responsibilities. Specific duties and responsibilities may vary depending on department or program needs without changing the general nature and scope of the job or level of responsibility. Employees may also perform other duties as assigned.<p><br></p><strong>Desired Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Demonstrated experience in a medical environment. </li><li>Experience with medical literature searching and acquisition of articles, abstracts, and web - based information and familiarity with Adobe Acrobat,</li><li>Pub Med and End Note reference manager.</li><li>Experience utilizing Stanford purchasing and reimbursement systems.</li><li>Extremely detail oriented</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education &amp; Experience (required)</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>High school diploma and four years of administrative experience, or combination of education and relevant experience.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge, Skills And Abilities (required)</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Advanced computer skills and demonstrated experience with office software and email applications.</li><li>Demonstrated success in following through and completing projects.</li><li>Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.</li><li>Excellent Strong verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills.</li><li>Ability to prioritize, multi-task, and assign work to others.</li><li>Ability to take initiative and ownership of projects.</li><li>Ability to routinely and independently exercise sound judgment in making decisions.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Physical Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Constantly perform desk-based computer tasks.</li><li>Frequently sitting.</li><li>Occasionally stand/walk, reach/work above shoulders, grasp lightly/fine manipulation, grasp forcefully, use a telephone, sort/file paperwork or parts, lift/carry/push/pull objects that weigh up to 10 pounds.</li><li>Rarely twist/bend/stoop/squat, kneel/crawl.</li></ul><p><br></p>Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.<p><br></p><strong>Working Standards</strong><p><br></p>Interpersonal Skills: Demonstrates the ability to work well with Stanford colleagues and clients and with external organizations.<p><br></p>Promote Culture of Safety: Demonstrates commitment to personal responsibility and value for safety; communicates safety concerns; uses and promotes safe behaviors based on training and lessons learned.<p><br></p>Subject to and expected to comply with all applicable University policies and procedures, including but not limited to the personnel policies and other policies found in the University’s Administrative Guide, http://adminguide.stanford.edu/ .<p><br></p><strong>The expected pay range for this position is $66,000 to $91,000 per annum.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Stanford University provides pay ranges representing its good faith estimate of what the university reasonably expects to pay for a position. The pay offered to a selected candidate will be determined based on factors such as (but not limited to) the scope and responsibilities of the position, the qualifications of the selected candidate, departmental budget availability, internal equity, geographic location and external market pay for comparable jobs.</strong><p><br></p><strong>At Stanford University, base pay represents only one aspect of the comprehensive rewards package. The Cardinal at Work website provides detailed information on Stanford’s extensive range of benefits and rewards offered to employees. Specifics about the rewards package for this position may be discussed during the hiring process.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Why Stanford is for you</strong><p><br></p><strong>Our Culture And Unique Perk s Empower You With</strong><p><br></p>Imagine a world without search engines or social platforms. Consider lives saved through first-ever organ transplants and research to cure illnesses. Stanford University has revolutionized the way we live and enrich the world. Supporting this mission is our diverse and dedicated 17,000 staff. We seek talent driven to impact the future of our legacy.<p><br></p><ul><li>Freedom to grow. We offer career development programs, tuition reimbursement, or audit a course. Join a TedTalk, film screening, or listen to a renowned author or global leader speak.</li><li>A caring culture. We provide superb retirement plans, generous time-off, and family care resources.</li><li>A healthier you. Climb our rock wall, or choose from hundreds of health or fitness classes at our world-class exercise facilities. We also provide excellent health care benefits.</li><li>Discovery and fun. Stroll through historic sculptures, trails, and museums.</li><li>Enviable resources. Enjoy free commuter programs, ridesharing incentives, discounts and more.</li></ul><p><br></p>Stanford is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Laney College<br><br>Any one position may not include all of the duties listed nor do listed examples includes all tasks which may be found in positions of this class. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty of the position satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions required for the position.<br><br><strong><u>Job Duties<br><br></u></strong>Supports the Admissions and Records area in a variety of duties including data entry, customer service, and telephone support.<br><ul><li> Assists students by providing accurate information regarding registration, graduation, and transcript requests.</li><li> Assists in the distribution and collection of forms, including petitions for degrees and certificates, credit by examination, and transcripts, etc.</li><li> Processes official transcript requests.</li><li> Packages official transcripts.</li><li> Logs and reconciles payments for official transcripts.</li><li> Supports and provides relief for campus staff at each of the four colleges.</li><li> Maintains filing system for incoming transcripts.</li><li> Verifies student attendance.</li><li> Operates a variety of modern office equipment.</li><li> Performs other related duties as required.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> One (1) year of experience in student registration, admissions and records maintenance or an equivalent combination of training and qualifying experience that could likely provide the desired knowledge, skills and abilities to perform the duties of the position.</li><li> Knowledge and proficiency in the operation and use of personal computers utilizing word processing, spreadsheet and database management software programs (e.g., MS Office Suite, MS Word, Excel, Access and PowerPoint, etc.) and the Internet browser, web sites and e-mail.</li><li> Ability to type accurately from clear copy. <strong>Title: EFT Specialist</strong><p><br></p><strong> Job Location: Hayward, CA<br><br>Hiring salary range: $23.95 - $30.72 per hour <br><br></strong><strong> Fremont Bank founded in 1964, </strong> is one of the oldest independently owned banks in the Bay Area and is one of the top rated mid-tier banks in the nation. <strong> Voted a Top Workplace for 2022 and for the past twelve consecutive years, </strong> Fremont Bank has an immediate opening for an <strong> EFT Specialist in Hayward, CA. <br><br></strong><strong><u>Position Overview<br><br><br><br></u></strong>The <strong>EFT Specialist</strong> will be processing incoming and outgoing domestic and foreign wires using multiple wire transfer software systems. The Specialist will handle incoming and outgoing ACH file loading, and transactions including: ACH Non-Posted items, ACH Return Deposit items, ACH Correction Notices, ACH Reg E, Death Notification Entries, and Reclamations. The EFT Specialist will also be responsible for monitoring risk in both the Wire and ACH areas using risk mitigation software. Other functions can include: General Ledger Reconciliation, preparation of statistical spreadsheets and maintaining ACH Billing log. Must be able to process all transactions accurately, timely, meeting strict deadlines, adhering to policies and procedures, and must comply with the NACHA operating rules/guidelines when answering general ACH questions and ACH research requests.<br><br><strong>Role and Responsibilities <br></strong><ul><li> Process incoming/outgoing domestic and foreign wires </li><li> Upload and download ACH files from Fedline Advantage system. </li><li> Balance and process end of day files for wires and ACH </li><li> Process ACH Non-post , EIM ACH items and balance daily </li><li> Process ACH Return Deposit Items and Corrections notices </li><li> Process ACH Reg E returns </li><li> Monitor for risk in both wires and ACH </li><li> Preform OFAC checks on both Wires and ACH IAT files </li><li> Process Branch Cash Orders and Deposits </li><li> Perform General Ledger Reconciliation </li><li> Answer phone calls and research requests </li><li> Block preparation </li><li> Maintain ACH Billing log </li><li> Monitor Wireroom email box <br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> Previous banking experience performing monetary transactions, research and account maintenance in a high volume environment </li><li> Strong data entry skills with ability to handle complex, multi layered transactions in a high volume, detailed environment </li><li> Experience Introduction<p><br></p>This examination is being given to fill current vacancies in the various County departments and to establish an eligible referral pool which may be used to fill future vacancies. This classification is the entry-level clerical classification in San Joaquin County.<p><br></p><strong> This recruitment will be utilized to fill part-time and temporary positions only. </strong><p><br></p>Based on the nature of the assignment, candidates may be asked to work shifts, nights, weekends, holidays or pass a background investigation.<p><br></p>Offers of employment are contingent upon passing a background investigation. Some departments may also require a pre-employment drug-screen or full law enforcement background.<p><br></p>Resumes will not be accepted in lieu of application; a completed application must be postmarked or received online by the final filing deadline.<p><br></p>Note: All correspondences relating to this recruitment will be delivered via e-mail. The e-mail account used will be the one provided on your employment application during time of submittal. Please be sure to check your e-mail often for updates. If you do not have an e-mail account on file, Human Resources will send you correspondence via US Mail.<p><br></p>TYPICAL DUTIES<p><br></p><ul><li>Greets persons entering office and answers telephones; determines purpose of visit or call; directs persons to appropriate individuals or offices; takes and transmits messages; may search for and provide general information concerning rules, regulations, policies, and procedures. Obtains required information from agency clients and completes forms; waits on public counter for purpose of issuing documents. </li><li>Gathers, processes, and maintains information related to departmental operations, records, and files; screens source material for completeness and accuracy; adds, posts, or verifies notations. </li><li>Formats documents, charts, reports and forms using word processor, typewriter, or other office equipment; edits for punctuation and spelling; proofreads for accuracy and consistency. </li><li>Performs basic computations and calculations; may compute, collect and receipt monies and fees and issue receipts; may maintain basic ledgers and accounts; may process accounts receivable and make deposits. </li><li>Sorts, codes, and files correspondence, forms, records, reports, documents, and other materials; searches files to obtain requested information. </li><li>Receives, opens, sorts, time stamps, routes, and weighs mail; addresses, stuffs, and seals envelopes; affixes and records postage. </li><li>Operates a variety of standard office machines such as copiers, calculators, microfiche readers, computers, multi-line phones, and cash registers; may operate a switchboard in a large department; may dispatch vehicles. </li><li>Proofreads typewritten material. </li><li>May compose routine letters and memoranda; may type short items.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Experience</strong> <strong>:</strong> On e year of general office clerical work.<p><br></p><strong> Substitution :</strong> One year of business training in an approved vocational training program may substitute for the above-required experience; <strong> OR </strong>b) Completion of 30 semester/45 quarter units at an accredited college or university may substitute for the above-required experience.<p><br></p>KNOWLEDGE<p><br></p>General office practices and procedures; personal computer systems and general office computer software; fundamental public relations techniques; basic filing and recordkeeping systems; standard language mechanics; standard correspondence and report formats; basic arithmetical operations related to clerical processes; basic cash handling procedures.<p><br></p>ABILITY<p><br></p>Utilize standard office procedures and equipment; operate computers and related software; follow oral and written directions; establish and maintain effective working relationships with others; communicate effectively with others; write clearly and legibly; perform basic arithmetical operations; match names and numbers.<p><br></p><strong><u>Physical/Mental Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><strong> Mobility </strong>-F requent operation of a data entry device; repetitive motion; sitting for long periods; walking; occasional standing, pushing, pulling, reaching, grabbing, bending, squatting, climbing; <strong> Lifting </strong>-Frequently 5 pounds or less; occasionally 5 to 30 pounds; <strong> Visual </strong>-Constant good overall vision and reading/close-up work; frequent color perception and use of eye/hand coordination; occasional use of depth perception and peripheral vision; <strong> Hearing/Talking </strong>-Frequent hearing of normal speech, hearing/talking on the telephone, talking in person; <strong> Emotional/Psychological </strong>-Frequent decision making, concentration, and public contact; <strong>Special Requirements</strong> -Some assignments may require working weekends, nights, and/or occasional overtime; <strong><u>About The Employer</u></strong><p><br></p>Stockton Unified School District (SUSD) began providing services to students in 1852 and is located in the heart of California’s Central Valley near the banks of the San Joaquin River. SUSD is the 17th largest school district in California, whereby 38,000 PK-12th grade students come to us to experience an academic journey that leads to high school graduation and success in college, careers, and as actively-engaged community members. The District also serves a number of adults through our Stockton School For Adults. SUSD is made up of thirty-seven Head Start classes, fifty-three state preschool classes, three First 5 preschool classes, forty-one K-8 schools, four comprehensive high schools, three small high schools, an alternative high school, a special education school, a school for adults, and five dependent charter schools. Our district mission is to graduate every single youth college, career, and community ready. Stockton Unified School District is dedicated to providing high-quality first instruction, rigorous curriculum, and supporting academic achievement and social-emotional development supported by Multi-Tiered System of Supports (MTSS). The District's work is guided by three focal goals:<p><br></p><ul><li> Every child by the end of third grade will read and comprehend at the proficient level.</li><li> Every child will have access to high quality, rigorous first instruction.</li><li> Every child, by the end of 12th grade, will graduate and be college, career, and community ready.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Information</strong><p><br></p><strong>Date Posted:</strong> 7/18/2023 <strong> Application Deadline:</strong> 8/1/2023 4:00 PM Pacific<p><br></p><strong> Employment Type:</strong> Full Time <strong> Length of Work Year:</strong> 8 hours -12 Months<p><br></p><strong> Salary:</strong> Range 36, $3,428.00 - $4,166.00 Monthly <strong> Number Openings: (At time of posting)</strong> 1<p><br></p><strong>Contact:</strong> Leslie Armstrong <strong> Email:</strong> larmstrong@stocktonusd.net<p><br></p><strong>Phone:</strong> 209-933-7065 2146<p><br></p><strong>Location:</strong> Transportation Department<p><br></p><strong>Schedule:</strong> 7:00 am - 4:00 pm (8 hours per day)<p><br></p>Job Description / Essential Elements: <strong>Print</strong><p><br></p>ADMINSTRATIVE ASSISTANT BASIC FUNCTION: Under the direction of an administrator, perform varied and responsible secretarial and administrative assistant duties to relieve the administrator of administrative and clerical detail; plan, coordinate and organize office activities and coordinate flow of communications for the assigned supervisor. ESSENTIAL DUTIES: Perform varied and responsible secretarial and administrative assistant duties to relieve the administrator of administrative and clerical detail; plan, coordinate and organize office activities and coordinate flow of communications; assure smooth operations of assigned office. Compile information and prepare a variety of reports related to assigned activities; process and evaluate a variety of forms and applications related to assigned functions; duplicate and distribute materials as needed. Receive visitors, including administrators, staff, parents and the public and provide information or direct to appropriate personnel; respond to inquiries and provide detailed and technical information concerning policies and procedures where judgment, knowledge and interpretation of procedures and regulations are required. Assure timely communications between assigned office and District employees; initiate phone calls to receive and transmit information; resolve issues as appropriate; refer difficult situations to the administrator; maintain confidentiality of sensitive and privileged information. Receive, screen and route telephone calls; take and relay messages as appropriate; serve as a resource to others concerning policies and procedures; respond to requests for records and other documents as directed. Receive, sort and distribute mail; prepare and distribute informational packets and bulk mailings as directed. Input data into an assigned computer system; generate a variety of mandated and requested computerized reports according to established time lines; maintain automated records; assure accuracy of input and output information. Compose, independently or from oral instructions, note or rough draft, a variety of materials including inter-office communications, applications, requisitions, forms, letters, contracts, brochures, legal documents, memoranda, bulletins and other materials; review and proofread a variety of documents. Maintain calendars and schedules of meetings, appointments and conferences; attend and participate in a variety of assigned meetings; take notes as requested; prepare and distribute summary of minutes as assigned. Provides backup secretarial support to a director as assigned by the position. Maintain regular and prompt attendance in the workplace. OTHER DUTIES: Perform related duties as assigned. KNOWLEDGE OF:<p><br></p><ul><li>Modern office practices, procedures and equipment.</li><li>Telephone techniques and etiquette.</li><li>District organization, operations, policies and objectives.</li><li>Applicable laws, codes, regulations, policies and procedures.</li><li>Record-keeping techniques.</li><li>Correct English usage, grammar, spelling, punctuation and vocabulary.</li><li>Interpersonal skills using tact, patience and courtesy.</li><li>Oral and written communication skills.</li><li>Operation of a computer and assigned software.</li><li>Methods of collecting and organizing data and information.</li><li>Business letter and report writing, editing and proofreading. <p><u>ROLE OVERVIEW</u></p><p>Balyasny Asset Management is seeking a Data Quality Analyst to join the Data Intelligence Group’s centralized Data Quality team the United States or Toronto. The ideal candidate should possess strong technical skills, particularly in Python, and SQL, and have previous experience in working with financial data. In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring the accuracy and integrity of our investment data through validation, cleansing, and enrichment. You will work closely with our data teams to develop scalable solutions to enhance our overall data quality.</p><p><br></p><p><em><u>As a Data Quality Analyst, you will be responsible for:</u></em></p><ul><li>Scrutinize and curate vast amounts of data across various asset classes to maintain a high level of quality of in-house data by authoring programmatic checks.</li><li>Designing systems and approaches to identify data quality anomalies and strategies for remediation.</li><li>Analyze and validate data using Python, and SQL, and other tools as required. </li><li>Develop and maintain scalable solutions and documentation to empower data owners.</li><li>Collaborate with stakeholders to identify data requirements and ensure data is fit for purpose.</li><li>Participate in projects to improve data quality and data management processes.</li></ul><p><br></p><p><u>QUALIFICATIONS &amp; REQUIREMENTS</u></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.</li><li>3+ years of professional experience in data quality analysis, particularly with financial data. </li><li>Track record of excellent troubleshooting and creative problem-solving abilities.</li><li>Strong analytical skills and experience in working with data, data pipelines, and/or APIs. </li><li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams. </li><li>Ability to multitask and manage competing priorities in a fast-paced environment.</li><li>Demonstrated experience participating in QC processes related to the measurement, management, and remediation of data quality anomalies.</li><li>Familiarity with Python, specifically Pandas and NumPy, AWS, Snowflake, and/or SQL.</li><li>Experience with Refinitiv, Bloomberg, and FactSet data is preferred.</li></ul>

describtion: Title: BFH Case Manager<p><br></p>REPORTS TO: Program Manager<p><br></p>CLASSIFICATION: Non-exempt, Full Time<p><br></p>COMPENSATION: $30/Hr. plus eligible for benefits including: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, paid holidays, sick time, 401K plan<p><br></p>Agency Description:<p><br></p>Amigos de Guadalupe fulfills its mission by focusing on four strategies: Expansive Outreach (Alcance Comunitario), Trusted Information &amp; Referral (Amigos de Confianza), Targeted Direct Services Program (Comunidad Fortalecida) and Case Management (Compañerismo). The Housing Case Manager will be mostly focused on comunidad fortalecida and compañerismo .<p><br></p>Founded on the principles of justice and advocacy, Amigos de Guadalupe Center for Justice and Empowerment partners with the Si Se Puede Collective and local agencies to make social services more accessible to the Mayfair Community; to strengthen individuals and the community through education; and to address social inequities by creating strong leaders through community organizing.<p><br></p>Primary Duties<p><br></p>Reporting to the Program Manager, the Case Manager will work with families referred to the Bringing Families Home (BFH) program. The program's goal is to reduce the number of families in the child welfare system (CWS) experiencing or at risk of homelessness, to prevent foster care placement, and to increase family reunification by providing supportive services. The Case Manager will be a liaison between client and the Program Manager by evaluating, interpreting, and determining the needs of clients by using effective listening and practicing sound, independent judgment. The Case Manager will perform a variety of clerical operational functions in support of the BFH program. This position requires commitment to daily timelines, accurate data entry and record keeping, attention to detail, and skill in responding effectively and tactfully to inquiries from clients. The Case Manager actively models and communicates the mission and vision and supports a culture of empowerment, team building, and open communication.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Process referrals for eligible households</li><li>Complete assessments and/or referral to the appropriate program as needed</li><li>Accurately record time spent on assigned tasks</li><li>Maintain client files and electronic records in HMIS </li><li>Maintain compliance with BFH grant requirements</li><li>Return calls and follow up with current clients on scheduled basis</li><li>Establish and maintain effective communication with clients, team members and others as appropriate, and consult with other staff regarding client referrals to appropriate housing resources and supportive services.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Skills &amp; Abilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Demonstrate initiative, creativity, and assertiveness in implementing BFH program</li><li>Knowledge of issues impacting renters </li><li>Understanding of the child welfare system</li><li>Ability to develops a comprehensive, client-driven case plan with both short-term and long-term identified goals</li><li>Complete a timeline and measures for each goal</li><li>Monitor progress towards goals in regularly scheduled sessions</li><li>Create, evaluates and adjuss individual case plans as needed </li><li>Empower clients to become involved in their own planning and goal setting</li><li>Refer clients to appropriate resources to assist with meeting goals</li><li>Maintain client files, including conversations, warnings, progress towards goals, and documentation of any incidents</li><li>Collect data necessary to meet funding requirements and statistical reports</li><li>Demonstrated effective communication skills</li><li>Manage a number of projects and issues simultaneously</li><li>Prioritize and organize information</li><li>Work effectively under pressure</li><li>Ability to work with diverse groups of people</li><li>Demonstrated success with extensive public contact with individuals and small and large group settings</li><li>Ability to be flexible and adaptable</li><li>Perform with tact, patience, and sensitivity</li><li>Participate in agency initiatives, special events, and other duties as assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bilingual proficiency in Spanish &amp; English is required</li><li>BA degree recommended</li><li>Ability to learn quickly</li><li>Understanding of, sensitivity to, and respect for the diverse academic, socio-economic, ethnic, religious, and cultural backgrounds, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, disability, and age.</li><li>Must be willing to submit to and pass a background check</li></ul><p><br></p>Knowledge<p><br></p><ul><li>Awareness of social issues impacting East San Jose residents</li></ul><p><br></p>Physical Demands<p><br></p>To perform essential functions for the role, you should be able to:<p><br></p><ul><li>Speak, listen, and communicate with both adults and children</li><li>Use hands or fingers to handle objects, tools, or controls</li><li>Walk, sit, and reach with hands and arms</li><li>Occasionally lift or move up to 30 pounds</li></ul><p><br></p>Amigos de Guadalupe is an equal opportunity employer. describtion: Job Characteristics<p><br></p><ul><li>OPEN &amp; PROMOTIONAL JOB OPPORTUNITY***</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Police Dispatcher I</strong><p><br></p><strong> Please note: This position is open until filled and may close at any time. </strong><p><br></p>The City of Concord's Police Department is currently seeking customer-service oriented individuals who enjoy working in a highly productive yet fast-paced environment to serve as their next Police Dispatcher.<p><br></p><strong><u>The Police Department</u></strong><p><br></p>The members of the Concord Police Department are dedicated to providing the highest quality police services in order to enhance community safety, protect life and property, and reduce crime and the fear of crime. To do this, we pledge to develop a partnership with the community, lead a community commitment to resolve problems, and improve the safety and quality of life in our city.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Be Doing In This Role</u></strong><p><br></p>Dispatchers are an integral part of the Police Department by acting as a critical link between the community and police units in the field. They help maintain the safety of our community by taking command of situations in a sensitive and straightforward manner while also showing consideration and respect to others. They receive emergency and non-emergency calls and act as the liaison between the community, other agencies, department personnel, and field units.<p><br></p><strong><u>We Are Looking For Someone Who</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Can assess situations accurately, make quick decisions, and use sound judgement</li><li>Has excellent oral and written communication skills</li><li>Is naturally compassionate and comfortable speaking to individuals who are emotional or stressed</li><li>Can multi-task and quickly prioritize needs</li><li>Can work in a collaborative team environment and take instruction well</li><li>Stay composed and control their own emotions</li><li>Has the technological skills to operate multiple computers, programs, radios and recording equipment</li><li>Has excellent attention to detail and organization skills</li><li>Is familiar with or can quickly learn the city of Concord and can read maps to find routes, locations, and addresses</li><li>Is flexible and can adapt to any situation</li><li>Embraces and embodies the City’s Mission, Vision and Values .</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Excellent Benefits Package</u></strong><p><br></p>This position is represented by Teamsters Local 856 and receives an excellent benefits package, including but not limited to:<p><br></p><ul><li>$2.00/hour shift differential for night shift and $2.50/hour for grave shift</li><li>$120/month bilingual pay for qualifying languages</li><li>Generous contributions to health, dental and vision plans</li><li>Employer paid life insurance and contributions to retirement plans</li><li>Fully paid tuition reimbursement program</li><li>Employer paid Employee Assistance Program and robust peer support program</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><strong><strong> SELECTION PROCESS </strong></strong></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Submit a completed City of Concord employment application and the required supplemental question responses online at www.cityofconcord.org . Only application materials submitted online will be accepted.</li><li> All qualified applications and supplemental responses will be competitively evaluated, and the most qualified candidates will be invited to an online examination which will include a Criticall 911 Dispatcher Test and typing test. For more information regarding the Criticall exam, answers to frequently asked questions, and a test preparation guide, please visit criticall911.com .</li><li> Successful candidates will be placed on the hiring list and referred tot the department for further consideration to fill the current regular vacancy, as well as others occurring over the next 12 months. Additional examination steps may include a dispatcher orientation, panel interview, sit along, polygraph, and thorough background check.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>POLICE DISPATCHER I</strong><p><br></p><strong>Purpose</strong><p><br></p>In support of police law enforcement and other public safety functions, performs activities related to the processing of service requests including communications and dispatch, status monitoring, information development and communication, and records and files maintenance in a computer-aided environment; performs related and other work as required all within the context of the City's Mission of providing responsive, cost effective, and innovative local government services through a collaborative effort with the community to make Concord a city of the highest quality.<p><br></p><strong>Equipment, Methods &amp; Guidelines</strong><p><br></p>Uses computer-aided dispatch system, including 911 emergency telephone, Telephone Device for the Deaf (TDD) and other multi-line telephone systems, various law enforcement telecommunications systems, multi-channel radio console with headsets and telephone handsets, video display terminals, computer keyboards, and alarm systems. Resource materials include hardware and software documentation, Dispatcher Training Manual, Dispatcher Training Guide, call-out schedules, maps, standardized service request classifications, level of response decision criteria, policies, regulations, operating procedures, directives, and violation codes contained in both City and other agency reference documents and manuals.<p><br></p><strong>Working Conditions</strong><p><br></p>Work is located in the Police Communications Center with variable lighting intensity and background noise. Work includes pressures generated by the necessity for appropriate and timely responses and follow-up required by emergency and routine events that often occur simultaneously. Work also involves prolonged periods of sitting. Incumbents are subject to shift assignments including evenings, weekends, and holidays; and to shift holdovers, early work calls, and scheduled overtime.<p><br></p><strong>Physical Demands</strong><p><br></p>Work emphasizes clear speech, visual and hearing acuity, and manual dexterity; prolonged periods of sitting and of wearing a headset; may occasionally perform moderate lifting (such as 30-50 pound boxes of computer paper), carrying, pushing, pulling and stooping. Must be able to work in an environment with randomly occurring periods that are dominated by crisis situations and stress filled working conditions.<p><br></p><strong>Supervisory Guidance Received/Given</strong><p><br></p>Supervision received is intended to prescribe both general and detailed methods for achieving objectives. This is the entry level dispatcher classification and incumbents' activities are subject to close monitoring in an extended on-the-job training regime.<p><br></p>Examples of duties include, but are not limited to<p><br></p>Under close observation, receives, interprets, classifies, prioritizes and responds to call of a routine and emergency nature, including those calls involving life-threatening situations. Enters relevant information by computer keyboard and, as appropriate, transmits message for dispatching.Under close observation assigns calls to police units for necessary action, determining how many and which units are required for response. May coordinate with patrol supervisors regarding deployment of personnel. Visually monitors video display terminals and aurally monitors police radio frequencies to ensure correct status of officers and pending and dispatched calls, making "on-line changes" via keyboard as appropriate. Calls out Public Works standby personnel, performs call outs for various local government entities, and monitors local government radio for their status.Determines appropriate communications or research channels selecting from emergency telephone lines, radio room telephone lines, business telephone lines, police radio channels, other agency radio channels, and manual computerized information systems.Under close observation, provides information to officers expeditiously, in areas such as warrants, vehicles, driver's licenses, parole, and criminal history information. Interprets or clarifies coded responses from various systems for police officers or other parties. Confirms warrants with responsible agencies, receives warrants and updates status of warrants.As acquired skills develop, accesses and updates information in a variety of on-line Law Enforcement data systems, including systems which contain confidential data.Develops, confirms, and relays information by contacting persons such as those in the internal chain of command; relatives of those involved in incidents; employers; hospitals; sworn and non-sworn public safety personnel at other agencies; other City departments; ambulance services; detoxification centers; tow companies; attorneys; state parole; animal control; commercial establishments; alarm companies; and schools.Monitors other public safety and emergency preparedness radio traffic; fire panel and security system boards; local government radio channels; and jail and complaint desk alarms, and takes appropriate actions.Maintains various logs and records of activities, such as radio transmissions, telephone calls received, call-outs and tow requests, equipment failure log, and personal time keeping and attendance.Follows defined alternative procedures in the event of computer or other equipment malfunction such as performing shut down and start up procedures. Performs various tasks to ensure proper operation of equipment such as setting and resetting computer system, video display terminals, mobile data terminals and printers; and changing print ribbons, paper, and recording tapes.Performs activities related to the operation of a county-wide law enforcement radio system (CLERS) such as monitoring radio channel and issuing all points bulletins following county protocol and procedures.Promotes the City's Mission to make Concord a city of the highest quality by providing responsive, cost-effective, and innovative government services; understands and subscribes to the Vision and Values Statement adopted by the City.Performs other work as assigned.<p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge and Abilities:</strong><p><br></p>Basic knowledge of the use of data processing equipment for data entry systems. Ability to read, comprehend, and retain relevant sections of various California codes such as the Penal, Health and Safety, Municipal, Welfare and Institutions, and Vehicle codes; interdepartmental regulations, policies and procedures; various hardware and software documentation; Federal Communications Commission Regulations.<p><br></p>Ability to learn and make effective use of the resources, equipment, methods, procedures, and nomenclature included in and associated with computer-aided dispatch and automated information systems and other aspects of the work; to learn the geographic layout of the City, including location of streets, street names, freeways, shopping centers, industrial parks, hotels, and other landmarks. Ability to remain calm in situations of stress; to assess events quickly and accurately; to adapt communications and behavioral styles appropriately in response to individuals and situations; to obtain and accurately record required information; to effectively classify and prioritize service requests; to act promptly and decisively; to make acceptable decisions; to quickly search and find information from resource systems, manuals, maps and other documents and to accurately and concisely convey such information orally and in writing; to spell accurately and use correct grammar; to speak clearly, concisely and audibly; to perform multiple tasks simultaneously; to meet the physical requirements of the work; to understand and carry out oral and written instructions; and to establish and maintain cooperative and effective relationships with those contacted in the course of work.<p><br></p><strong>Education:</strong> Satisfactory completion of high school or the equivalent.<p><br></p><strong>Experience: </strong>Two years of related work experience that has provided the knowledge, skills and abilities necessary to perform the duties of a law enforcement dispatcher in a computer-assisted environment.<p><br></p><strong><u>Other</u></strong><p><br></p>Ability to operate an alpha-numeric keyboard with sufficient speed and accuracy to provide efficient input into a computer terminal, measured by the ability to type at a rate of 35 words per minute (net).<p><br></p>Must have normal (or correctable to normal) hearing and eyesight and a clear and audible voice for radio and telephone communications.<p><br></p>Must successfully pass the dispatcher testing administered by the City in accordance with POST Standard Section 1018(c).<p><br></p>Must successfully complete a thorough background investigation as a condition of employment.<p><br></p>A California Driver's License and a satisfactory driving record are conditions of initial and continued employment.<p><br></p>The City of Concord takes pride in offering a generous benefits program that provides flexibility for the diverse and changing needs of our qualifying employees.<p><br></p>For a complete overview, click here .<p><br></p>Below is a brief listing of what the City offers:<p><br></p><ul><li>Dental &amp; Vision Insurance </li><li>Employee Assistance Program </li><li>Health Insurance </li><li>Holidays </li><li>Life Insurance </li><li>Pre-tax Savings Benefits </li><li>Retiree Medical (3 levels based on date of hire) </li><li>Retirement Program </li><li>Short-term Disability*and Long-term Disability </li><li>Social Security/Medicare </li><li>Vacation &amp; Sick Leave</li></ul>*Not available for sworn personnel.<p><br></p>Closing Date/Time: Continuous

<strong>About The Opportunity</strong><p><br></p>Reporting to the Dispatch Supervisor, the Public Safety Dispatcher is responsible for the day-to-day communications function of the Communications Center for the Oakland Campus. The dispatcher will be responsible for answering all calls for service as well as the dispatching of officers to these calls. The dispatcher may also be responsible for monitoring the public safety walk-in center during non-business hours or as needed.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Receive emergency and non-emergency telephone calls</li><li>Determine the nature, location, and priority of requests and dispatch appropriate resources in accordance with established procedure</li><li>Enter, update, and retrieve information from a variety of computer systems</li><li>Disseminate mass emergency notification alerts when necessary</li><li>Monitor radio traffic, security alarms, fire alarms, and video security cameras</li><li>Provide referral services and victim resources</li><li>Research, collect, analyze, document, and disseminate public safety intelligence</li><li>Undergo initial training and maintain knowledge through continuing education</li><li>Monitor the 24/7 public safety walk-in center and dispatch officers as needed for walk-in reports</li><li>Other duties as assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Mandatory Job Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>High School Diploma or GED equivalent</li><li>One or more years of relevant experience</li><li>A valid U.S. Driver’s License</li><li>Certification in a POST Public Safety Dispatcher course or the successful completion of a qualifying course within 6 months of hire</li><li>APCO certification within six months of hire</li><li>Candidates must pass a criminal background check</li><li>Candidates will be subject to a drug test and psychological exam</li><li>Must currently possess, or must achieve within first three months; CPR (BLS/HCP) certification</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Required Skills</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and quickly synthesize information</li><li>Ability to remain calm, stay focused, and utilize sound judgement in rapidly evolving, stressful emergency situations</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Strong computer skills, typing skills, and ability to learn new software</li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively with a wide variety of people</li><li>Has a professional phone manner and a service mentality</li><li>Is team and goal oriented</li><li>Ability to exercise discretion in handling confidential information</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree in criminal justice, communications, leadership, or other related area is preferred</li><li>Former dispatch or law enforcement experience strongly preferred </li><li>Call-taking experience preferred</li><li>Experience in a higher education setting preferred</li><li>Certifications in any applicable training and courses related to the dispatch function &amp; emergency communications.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Additional Information</strong><p><br></p>Click here to see an overview of the University’s comprehensive benefits package including educational incentives, comprehensive medical coverage, retirement plans, and fitness/wellness programs.<p><br></p>Northeastern University is an equal opportunity employer, seeking to recruit and support a broadly diverse community of faculty and staff. <strong>STAR of California</strong> <strong>is looking for qualified Behavior Technicians (ABA therapists) in</strong><strong> Mountain View, CA</strong><strong>.</strong> <strong>You will be providing direct face-to-face Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) treatment services to children with autism in their home, school, or community settings where we provide state-of-the-art behavioral services.  Professional experience with children or special needs is required. </strong><p><br></p><strong>Pay: $23.00 - $28.00</strong><strong> per </strong><strong>hour</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Must have scheduling availability within the hours of 8:00am-5:00pm or 12:00pm-8:00pm, Monday to Friday </li><li>Must be able to travel to case assignments across the Santa Clara County or Alameda County service locations where clients are served </li><li>Proof of high school diploma or BA/BS degree in Psychology, Education, or Special Education or related field. Candidates with incomplete degrees will be considered based on experience</li><li>Transportation with a Valid CA Driver's License &amp; Proof of auto liability insurance  </li><li>Min 1 year of professional experience with children or special needs is required for all Behavior Technician positions</li><li>Ability to sustain energy level that can keep up with active children</li><li>Ability to lift, pull and/or push at least 30 lbs</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Highlights </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Guaranteed a minimum of 30 hours paid but may work over 30 hours as needed </li><li>Earn $250 per BT (ABA therapist) or Mental Health hire with our employee referral program </li><li>Full-time Behavior Technicians (BTs) qualify for Paid Time Off (PTO), Paid Holidays, and wage increases</li><li>Comprehensive healthcare benefits including Medical, dental, vision, disability, life insurance benefits, 401k, and more! </li><li>Drive time and mileage reimbursement traveling between client visits </li><li>Paid ABA training to help earn Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) certification</li><li>Earn your supervision hours for Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) exam</li><li>Discounted student tuition with the University of California, Santa Barbara's (UCSB) BCBA program </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities And Daily Tasks</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Working under the direction of a program supervisor you will teach clients how to communicate, play, make friends, and function more independently while helping resolve challenging behaviors</li><li>Collect, organize, and summarize behavioral data on the child's treatment goals  </li><li>6-month commitment period to stay with the company</li><li>Full ABA training to ensure you are ready on day one!
