describtion: The Presidio Trust is actively seeking a resourceful, mission-driven and highly skilled professional who can quickly on-board into the position of Administrative Services Specialist in the Department of Administration. Once an Army Base, the Presidio of San Francisco is now a new kind of national park. The 1,500-acre Presidio is richly layered in history, is a natural oasis for wildlife, plants, and people, and offers iconic views known around the world. In its third decade as a park, public awareness and enjoyment of this exceptional place continues grow. As an Administrative Services Specialist you will be charged with establishing rigorous administrative standards and practices that will ensure the Trust can effectively and efficiently achieve the Forever Park vision. You will support the Director of Administration ensure the Trust as whole has an administrative culture and practicing norms that assists all Divisions, Departments, and individual staff work in effective and efficient working environment. You will interact closely with various Trust departments to coordinate Policy, Process, and Procedures as well as serve as the point of contact for Department support of administrative staff. Our ideal candidate is highly organized, forward-thinking, has a can-do attitude, and is comfortable engaging with leaders and staff within the Trust. You have excellent collaboration and communication skills, remain focused and calm under pressure, and are passionate about sharing this treasured National Park and National Historic Landmark with the public. This is a full-time position with benefits and a starting pay range of $102,888 to $117,294. The starting base salary is dependent on the experience and qualifications of the candidate. Applications received by July 27, 2023 will receive first consideration. We are planning to hold the first round of interviews the week of August 7th, the second round of interviews the week of August 14th, make a job offer by the end of August, and set a work start date of mid-September 2023. Responsibilities<p><br></p><ul><li>Develop and support the management of a centralized Trust administration service function, including records management and compliance, purchase card program, employee travel, agency master calendar, and enterprise templates.</li><li>Perform analysis to support the development of policies and procedures that enhance Trust-staff administrative performance. Assess staff utilization of the appropriate performance-based systems, tools, process, and procedures.</li><li>Administer the Trust's policy structure. Coordinate administrative functions necessary to delivering a policy and procedure process that ensures all published policies, process, and procedures are up to date and accessible. Provide notification of new, revised, or rescinded policies to Trust employees.</li><li>Administer the Trust purchasing audit procedure to mitigate fraud, waste, and abuse in the use of appropriated and non-appropriated funds. Conduct the necessary analysis to provide the Director with a quarterly report to ensure accountability to agency authorities, and other decision-making authorities.</li><li>Administer the processes for compliance to support the mandatory reporting required by federal agency laws and regulations. Work with the appropriate staff to develop consistent reporting across all key programs in the Trust.</li><li>Assist the Director, in coordination with the Office of the General Counsel, to evaluate orders coming in from the Federal Government (including but not limited to Executive Orders) that require updates to Trust policy and procedures.</li><li>Organize and execute all training and related content for centralized administration functions, together with internal Learning lead.</li><li>Other duties as assigned. Required Qualifications Bachelor's degree in administration, business, economics, or related field; AND Five (5) years of progressively responsible experience in a variety of administrative specialties. Demonstrated critical thinking skills - ability to define problems, identify relationships, evaluate and assess impacts, and arrive at conclusions when analyzing complex or highly sensitive topics. Ability to articulate, interpret, and clearly explain, orally and in writing, complex issues and findings using research and data analysis. Ability to research novel problems and issues, rapidly and thoroughly, where there are conflicting requirements and scarce or limited guidelines. Effective collaboration, written and oral communication, project management, and problem-solving skills. Ability to effectively manage and prioritize multiple, competing tasks and projects in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. Demonstrated experience researching, developing, implementing and continuously improving administrative policies, procedures and/or systems. Track record of utilizing technology and/or increasing your own technology skills to make work more efficient, user-friendly and easier to run and maintain. Proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Teams. Demonstrated emotional intelligence and cultural humility; interest and ability to connect with and engage a diversity of people by showing empathy and sensitivity to their individual perspectives and needs. Demonstrated ability to balance the needs of the business, manager and staff while managing risk for the organization. Exceptional self and organizational awareness. Optimistic and positive attitude with a demonstrated deep commitment to exceptional customer service Ability to work in a hybrid onsite work environment, which requires on-site presence on a recurring and as-needed basis. Desired Qualifications Compliance oversight, Records Management, policy development.Process and procedure writing and oversight.Administrative supervisory experience in a government agencyInteragency, cross-sector, and Department of Interior experienceDemonstrates the Trust values of Service, Inclusiveness, Stewardship, Responsibility, and SustainabilityDemonstrates a good sense of humor and a passion for the mission of the Presidio Trust About the Trust Operations Division The newly established Trust Operations Division supports both internal and external customers. The division's purpose is to enhance the process efficiency of the organization, provide critical support services that make working at the Trust easier, and sustain strong relationships with employees, the public, and key stakeholders. The division includes the Administration and Contracting Department, the Project Management Office (PMO) and the Marketing and Communications Department. Background Investigation The Presidio Trust has identified this position as subject to an employment background investigation which shall consist of a review of applicable county, state and Federal criminal and civil records, state bankruptcy indexes, driver's license. An individual's granting of a background investigation and resulting report is voluntary. However, employment in this sensitive position is contingent upon the successful completion of an employment background investigation. The Presidio Trust may refuse to hire an individual, may rescind an offer of employment to an individual, or may review and terminate the employment of a current employee not successfully completing the background investigation. COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement All Presidio Trust employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or obtain an approved medical or religious exemption. Employment is contingent upon submitting a COVID-19 Certification of Vaccination or qualifying for an exemption when hired. The Presidio Trust is an equal opportunity employer, offering a competitive benefits package. To apply, download the employment application from our website at www.presidio.gov/presidio-trust/jobs and submit your application to our email address listed on our website.</li></ul>

jobs_titles: Desk Clerk - Leigh Avenue Senior Apartments
describtion: <strong>COMPANY SUMMARY</strong><p><br></p>The John Stewart Company is a full-service housing management, development and consulting organization that began in 1978 with a commitment to providing high quality service in the affordable housing sector. We work to enrich the lives of our residents and employees, while delivering our services cost‐effectively, efficiently and with the highest levels of professionalism, compassion, integrity and respect.<p><br></p><strong>SUMMARY OF THE POSITION</strong><p><br></p>Under the direction of the Property Manager, the Desk Clerk monitors traffic in and out of the building, communicates with tenants, visitors and staff. Writes end of shift reports and incident reports, writes work orders, enforces project policies in a manner consistent with fair housing regulations, and keeps the reception area neat.<p><br></p><ul><li>Answer telephones, direct calls, take messages and make emergency calls when situations arrive.</li><li>Assist with office responsibilities such as completing work orders, comment cards, visitor violation forms and other duties assigned by management.</li><li>Inform visitors of visitor policy, check visitor ID and sign visitors in and out of the building.</li><li>Complete incident reports to record unusual building activity.</li><li>Distribute resident mail on daily basis.</li><li>Fill in as requested when other desk clerks are absent.</li><li>Testing of annual tuberculosis may be required as well as following Exposure Control Protocol for blood borne pathogens.</li><li>High school graduate or GED certificate.</li><li>Experience working with people of various cultural backgrounds, especially those with special needs is a plus.</li><li>Knowledge of federal, state and local laws and Fair Housing guidelines.</li><li>Ability to read, understand and communicate fluently in English.</li><li>Good sense of awareness, urgency and follow procedures to solve problems.</li><li>Experience with PSH</li><li>Spanish Speaking a plus</li></ul><p><br></p>Benefits for Employees who work 30+ hours/week -<p><br></p><ul><li>Medical, dental and vision care; preventative medical care paid at 100%.</li><li>Vacation leave of up to ten days per year in the first year.</li><li>Up to 72 hours of sick time per year.</li><li>Flexible Spending Accounts for Health Care and Dependent Care.</li><li>Company paid Life AD&amp;D Long Term Disability.</li><li>Free, confidential counseling through our Employee Assistance Program.</li><li>Commuter benefit program.</li><li>Discounts for AT&amp;T and ClassPass.</li><li>$50 annual Wellness Reimbursement.</li><li>Matching 401(K) Retirement Savings Plan of up to 2% of your compensation (for any employee who works 20 hours or more per week).</li></ul><p><br></p>Benefits for Employees who work less than 30 hours/week -<p><br></p><ul><li>Free, confidential counseling through our Employee Assistance Program.</li><li>Commuter benefit program.</li><li>Discounts for AT&amp;T and ClassPass.</li><li>$50 annual Wellness Reimbursement.</li><li>Matching 401(K) Retirement Savings Plan of up to 2% of your compensation (for any employee who works 20 hours or more per week)</li><li>Up to 72 hours of sick time per year.</li></ul><p><br></p>The John Stewart Company provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws.<p><br></p>The John Stewart Company will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative.<p><br></p><strong>Effective January 1, 2020, the California Consumer Privacy Act requires businesses that meet certain minimum threshold requirements to provide a “notice at collection” to applicants for employment who reside in California. The notice at collection describes the categories of personal information to be collected about these California applicants and the purposes for using that personal information. Therefore, we have posted the Company’s “Notice At Collection For California Applicants” here. Please review this Notice at your convenience.</strong>

Stanford University, one of Silicon Valley’s largest and most unique institutions, is seeking an Administrative Associate 3 to provide administrative or operational support with limited supervision. Candidate may work autonomously and will have a strong business acumen, excellent writing skills, ability to multi-task, be extremely organized &amp; detailed, self-motivated, team oriented, and must hold masterful communication skills that allow high level interactions within a diverse academic and medical community.<br><br>Stanford Otolaryngology – Head &amp; Neck Surgery (OHNS) has a warm and collegial culture among our community of Faculty, Residents, Fellows/Instructors, Researchers, and Administrative Staff.<br><br>Visit us at: https://med.stanford.edu/ohns.html<br><br><strong>Duties Include<br></strong><ul><li>Act on behalf of the supervisor, department manager, or chair in regards to establishing priorities and identifying and resolving problems that are administrative in nature.</li><li>Oversee and/or perform duties associated with scheduling, organizing, and operating complex conferences, seminars, and events, including arranging with vendors for services, overseeing the production and distribution of materials, administering logistics, and managing event within budget.</li><li>Compose and draft documents and correspondence for presentations, course handouts, grants, conferences, seminars, and reports; perform substantial editing and fact checking. Create, maintain, modify, and/or ensure accuracy of content in various unit documents, displays, reports, brochures, social media, and/or websites.</li><li>Plan and schedule calendar(s) with limited consultation, resolve calendaring conflicts, and arrange travel in compliance with unit, university, and sponsor policies. </li><li>Create complex reports and spreadsheets which may utilize specialized software and systems.</li><li>Oversee and/or process a variety of complex financial transactions; produce, monitor, and reconcile budget statements; research, identify, and resolve discrepancies. Experience (required)<br><br></strong>High school diploma and four years of administrative experience, or combination of education and relevant experience.<br><br><strong>Knowledge, Skills And Abilities (required)<br></strong><ul><li>Advanced computer skills and demonstrated experience with office software and email applications. </li><li>Demonstrated success in following through and completing projects. </li><li>Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. </li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills. </li><li>Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills. </li><li>Ability to prioritize, multi-task, and assign work to others. </li><li>Ability to take initiative and ownership of projects. </li><li>Ability to routinely and independently exercise sound judgment in making decisions<br><br></li></ul><strong>PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS*:<br></strong><ul><li>Constantly perform desk-based computer tasks.</li><li>Frequently sitting.</li><li>Occasionally stand/walk, reach/work above shoulders, grasp lightly/fine manipulation, grasp forcefully, use a telephone, sort/file paperwork or parts, lift/carry/push/pull objects that weigh up to 10 pounds.</li><li>Rarely twist/bend/stoop/squat, kneel/crawl.</li><li> - Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.<br><br></li></ul><strong>The expected pay range for this position is $66,000 to $91,000 per annum. Specifics about the rewards package for this position may be discussed during the hiring process.</strong>

Stanford University, located between San Francisco and San Jose in the heart of California's Silicon Valley, is one of the world's leading teaching and research universities. Since its opening in 1891, Stanford has been dedicated to finding solutions to big challenges and to preparing students for leadership in a complex world.<p><br></p>Supporting that mission is a staff of more than 10,000, which is rooted in a culture of excellence and values innovation, collaboration, and life-long learning. To foster the talents and aspirations of our staff, Stanford offers career development programs, competitive pay that reflects market trends and benefits that increase financial stability and promote healthy, fulfilling lives. An award- winning employer, Stanford offers an exceptional setting for professionals looking to advance their careers.<p><br></p>The Department of Genetics at Stanford University is seeking an Administrative Associate to provide administrative support working under general supervision of three faculty members. Please note this position could potentially be a hybrid role with three days working on-site and two days working remotely.<p><br></p><strong>Duties Include</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Act on behalf of the supervisor, department manager, or chair in regards to establishing priorities and identifying and resolving problems that are administrative in nature.</li><li>Compose and draft documents and correspondence for presentations, course handouts, grants, conferences, seminars, and reports; perform substantial editing and fact checking. Create, maintain, modify, and/or ensure accuracy of content in various unit documents, displays, reports, brochures, social media, and/or websites.</li><li>Plan and schedule calendar(s) with limited consultation, resolve calendaring conflicts, and arrange travel in compliance with unit, university, and sponsor policies. </li><li>Create complex reports and spreadsheets which may utilize specialized software and systems.</li><li>Oversee and/or process a variety of complex financial transactions; produce, monitor, and reconcile budget statements; research, identify, and resolve discrepancies. May assist with capital or special equipment requests and/or vendor selection.</li><li>Coordinate and monitor routine maintenance services completion. Plan and coordinate office moves and/or minor renovation projects.</li></ul><p><br></p>Below are the links to the labs this position will support. We will only be considering submissions which include both a resume and cover letter.<p><br></p>https://www.altemoselab.org/ .<p><br></p>https://danielssynbio.net/<p><br></p>https://gitlerlab.org/<p><br></p><ul><li> - Other duties may also be assigned.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Desired Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>At least two years of administrative experience working in a higher education institute.</li><li>At least one year of experience with coordinating pre-award research grant proposal submissions. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education &amp; Experience (required)</strong><p><br></p>High school diploma and four years of administrative experience, or combination of education and relevant experience.<p><br></p><strong>Knowledge, Skills And Abilities (required)</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Advanced computer skills and demonstrated experience with office software and email applications. </li><li>Demonstrated success in following through and completing projects. </li><li>Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. </li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills. </li><li>Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills. </li><li>Ability to prioritize, multi-task, and assign work to others. </li><li>Ability to take initiative and ownership of projects. </li><li>Ability to routinely and independently exercise sound judgment in making decisions</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS*:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Constantly perform desk-based computer tasks.</li><li>Frequently sitting.</li><li>Occasionally stand/walk, reach/work above shoulders, grasp lightly/fine manipulation, grasp forcefully, use a telephone, sort/file paperwork or parts, lift/carry/push/pull objects that weigh up to 10 pounds.</li><li>Rarely twist/bend/stoop/squat, kneel/crawl.</li><li> - Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Work Standards</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Interpersonal Skills: Demonstrates the ability to work well with Stanford colleagues and clients and with external organizations.</li><li>Promote Culture of Safety: Demonstrates commitment to personal responsibility and value for safety; communicates safety concerns; uses and promotes safe behaviors based on training and lessons learned.</li><li>Subject to and expected to comply with all applicable University policies and procedures, including but not limited to the personnel policies and other policies found in the University's Administrative Guide, http://adminguide.stanford.edu . </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>The expected pay range for this position is $60,000 to $81,000 per annum. Stanford University provides pay ranges representing its good faith estimate of what the university reasonably expects to pay for a position. The pay offered to a selected candidate will be determined based on factors such as (but not limited to) the scope and responsibilities of the position, the qualifications of the selected candidate, departmental budget availability, internal equity, geographic location and external market pay for comparable jobs.</strong><p><br></p>As an organization that receives federal funding, Stanford University has a COVID-19 vaccination requirement that will apply to all university employees, including those working remotely in the United States and applicable subcontractors. To learn more about COVID policies and guidelines for Stanford University Staff, please visit https://cardinalatwork.stanford.edu/working-stanford/covid-19/interim-policies/covid-19-surveillance-testing-policy .

<strong><em>Salary: $22 - $26 / per hour </em></strong><p><br></p><p><br></p><strong><em> Maxim Healthcare Services </em></strong> is hiring for an Mental Health Behavioral Technician in San Jose area $22-26 per hour.<p><br></p><strong><u>What We Do</u></strong><p><br></p>We aim to improve the lives of children and families living with autism by providing a behavioral intervention plan to children while working one on one in an in home environment. Our BT’s will help children on the spectrum learn effective social, motor, language, communication and cognitive skills using Applied Behavior Analysis techniques.<p><br></p><strong> Position: </strong> Behavior Therapist/Technician (Entry-Level and Experienced)<p><br></p><strong> Pay: </strong> Dependent on experience<p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Paid Orientation and Training</li><li> Weekly Pay</li><li> Flexible hours/scheduling</li><li> Referral Bonuses</li><li> 40+ hours of paid behavioral training</li><li> 40 hours of BCBA Supervision signed off (for RBT Certification)</li><li> Mileage reimbursement driving in between clients</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Who You Are</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Enjoys working with children!</li><li> Playful, friendly, sociable, and quick on your feet!</li><li> Ability to lift 75-90 lbs frequently</li><li> Has reliable transportation</li><li> Access to internet, cell-phone usage, and email</li><li> Willing to commute up to 20 miles to client(s) homes</li><li> Communicates effectively with Supervisors and Schedule Coordinators</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Follow instructions of the BCBA/Program Supervisor</li><li> Provide behavior assistance/interventions to assigned clients</li><li> Work with clients, families, and communities to implement client treatment plan</li><li> Complete and document session per policies and procedures</li><li> Attend and participate in any in-service training</li><li> Playtime is learning time, so having fun is expected as well!</li></ul><p><br></p>If interested please apply directly or reach out to the Healthcare Recruiter, <strong><em>Rosie Morones</em></strong> at<u> 408-914-9153</u><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>At Maxim Healthcare Services, we firmly believe that our employees are the heartbeat of our organization and we are happy to offer the following benefits:<p><br></p><ul><li> Competitive pay &amp; weekly paychecks </li><li> Health, dental, vision, and life insurance </li><li> 401(k) savings plan </li><li> Awards and recognition programs </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Maxim Healthcare Services</u></strong><p><br></p>Maxim Healthcare Services has been making a difference in the lives of our patients, caregivers, employees and communities for more than 30 years. We offer private duty nursing, skilled nursing, physical rehabilitation, companion care, respite care and behavioral care for individuals with chronic and acute illnesses and disabilities. Our commitment to quality customer service, compassionate patient care, and filling critical healthcare needs makes us a trusted partner wherever care is needed.<p><br></p>Maxim Healthcare Services is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

NAI Northern California is among the fastest growing commercial real estate brokerages, and a top 10 Commercial brokerage. Local offices are located in San Francisco, Oakland and San Jose, and the global network has 400+ offices. NAI Northern California is seeking a Real Estate Administrative Assistant for one of their top producing teams who is willing to help support the team in their day to day real estate activities so they can perform to their highest ability. If you love diversity, fast paced, multi tasking, and want to join a company and make a direct impact, we’d love to hear from you.<p><br></p>We are an energetic team with a lot to do. We are collaborators, open to new ideas, have a lot of fun (we like to keep it light) and we work hard to see results. If you feel this might be the culture for you to thrive in, please keep reading!<p><br></p>You will be supporting a top producing licensed Commercial Real Estate Team. And describing it as "your life mission will be to make everything magically smooth and efficient for your team. You make sure things get done quick and well. You are not just an assistant, you are an air traffic controller.<p><br></p>Typical Daily Duties Include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Conduct skilled property searches using CoStar and LoopNet platforms</li><li>Use Adobe InDesign to prepare tour books for upcoming appointments</li><li>Send email blasts and other marketing campaigns</li><li>Accurate data entry into Salesfore.com CRM application</li><li>Variety of tasks including phone calls, setting appointments for multiple parties, setting reminders, and planning ahead for confirmation of appointments</li><li>Manage real estate transactions from listing, in contract to closing</li><li>Monitor the paperwork, track transaction status, and coordinate with related parties to ensure a smooth and timely transaction process</li><li>Ensure transaction information is collected, organized and documented per legal and ethical business practice</li><li>Keep interested parties informed of transaction status by updating checklists, providing weekly updates to staff and brokers, distributing executed closing statements and effectively communicating with accounting team</li><li>Agreement preparation (listing, sale and lease transactions)Communicates professionally and effectively with brokers, staff and clients<br></li></ul><p><br></p>Qualifications &amp; Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li>Previous experience with Marketing and Administrative duties at a real estate office is preferred</li><li>Knowledge of Adobe InDesign is required</li><li>CA BRE license is highly desired</li><li>Must be highly organized, with high degree of professionalism in both appearance and communication</li><li>Work experience in commercial real estate preferred but not necessary</li><li>Independently motivated, able to take initiative and act with minimal oversight or direction</li><li>Experience with MS Office and GSuite</li><li>Database experience</li><li>Experience supporting multiple people at the same time</li><li>Ability to prioritize and multitask efficiently</li><li>Comfortable with performing some intricate/tedious tasks with a high degree of accuracy</li><li>Experience with Loopnet, CoStar, and other real estate listing services (a plus)</li><li>Submit a cover letter with your resume explaining how your skills and background match this role</li><li>A typing test is required. Show us your typing prowess! In fact, use this link to practice! Test Your Typing Speed!<br><br></li></ul>What’s So Different About NAI Northern California?<p><br></p>Collaboration: We take this seriously. We believe that the scarcity mentality and teamwork do not mix. We believe that competition inspires us to do great things, but collaborating with others elevates everyone.<p><br></p>Platform: We’ve implemented a world-class CRM, training program, and culture. We have great events that bring everyone together for fun, community involvement and celebration of our successes.<p><br></p>Support: We invest in technology. Our management is accessible, involved, and focused on the team’s goals.<p><br></p>More About Us:<p><br></p>NAI Global is the largest Commercial Real Estate Brokerage Network in the world and a global “Top 5” Commercial Real Estate Company with 400+ offices and over 7,800 professionals. The culture we have grown in Northern California is a major competitive advantage to our team.<p><br></p>What Are Our People Doing &amp; Saying?<p><br></p>"Working at NAI Northern California gives you the benefit of working for a global brand, combined with the feel and culture of a Bay Area startup. Our open, transparent platform and our strong collaboration lend to one of the most unique work environments in the industry. Ultimately, I opted for NAI over the competing firms because I felt that it gave me the best chance to grow and fulfill my potential."<p><br></p>– Anonymous, Senior Vice President – NAI Northern California Top Performer

describtion: Job Characteristics<p><br></p><ul><li>OPEN &amp; PROMOTIONAL JOB OPPORTUNITY***</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Police Dispatcher I</strong><p><br></p><strong> Please note: This position is open until filled and may close at any time. </strong><p><br></p>The City of Concord's Police Department is currently seeking customer-service oriented individuals who enjoy working in a highly productive yet fast-paced environment to serve as their next Police Dispatcher.<p><br></p><strong><u>The Police Department</u></strong><p><br></p>The members of the Concord Police Department are dedicated to providing the highest quality police services in order to enhance community safety, protect life and property, and reduce crime and the fear of crime. To do this, we pledge to develop a partnership with the community, lead a community commitment to resolve problems, and improve the safety and quality of life in our city.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Be Doing In This Role</u></strong><p><br></p>Dispatchers are an integral part of the Police Department by acting as a critical link between the community and police units in the field. They help maintain the safety of our community by taking command of situations in a sensitive and straightforward manner while also showing consideration and respect to others. They receive emergency and non-emergency calls and act as the liaison between the community, other agencies, department personnel, and field units.<p><br></p><strong><u>We Are Looking For Someone Who</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Can assess situations accurately, make quick decisions, and use sound judgement</li><li>Has excellent oral and written communication skills</li><li>Is naturally compassionate and comfortable speaking to individuals who are emotional or stressed</li><li>Can multi-task and quickly prioritize needs</li><li>Can work in a collaborative team environment and take instruction well</li><li>Stay composed and control their own emotions</li><li>Has the technological skills to operate multiple computers, programs, radios and recording equipment</li><li>Has excellent attention to detail and organization skills</li><li>Is familiar with or can quickly learn the city of Concord and can read maps to find routes, locations, and addresses</li><li>Is flexible and can adapt to any situation</li><li>Embraces and embodies the City’s Mission, Vision and Values .</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Excellent Benefits Package</u></strong><p><br></p>This position is represented by Teamsters Local 856 and receives an excellent benefits package, including but not limited to:<p><br></p><ul><li>$2.00/hour shift differential for night shift and $2.50/hour for grave shift</li><li>$120/month bilingual pay for qualifying languages</li><li>Generous contributions to health, dental and vision plans</li><li>Employer paid life insurance and contributions to retirement plans</li><li>Fully paid tuition reimbursement program</li><li>Employer paid Employee Assistance Program and robust peer support program</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><strong><strong> SELECTION PROCESS </strong></strong></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Submit a completed City of Concord employment application and the required supplemental question responses online at www.cityofconcord.org . Only application materials submitted online will be accepted.</li><li> All qualified applications and supplemental responses will be competitively evaluated, and the most qualified candidates will be invited to an online examination which will include a Criticall 911 Dispatcher Test and typing test. For more information regarding the Criticall exam, answers to frequently asked questions, and a test preparation guide, please visit criticall911.com .</li><li> Successful candidates will be placed on the hiring list and referred tot the department for further consideration to fill the current regular vacancy, as well as others occurring over the next 12 months. Additional examination steps may include a dispatcher orientation, panel interview, sit along, polygraph, and thorough background check.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>POLICE DISPATCHER I</strong><p><br></p><strong>Purpose</strong><p><br></p>In support of police law enforcement and other public safety functions, performs activities related to the processing of service requests including communications and dispatch, status monitoring, information development and communication, and records and files maintenance in a computer-aided environment; performs related and other work as required all within the context of the City's Mission of providing responsive, cost effective, and innovative local government services through a collaborative effort with the community to make Concord a city of the highest quality.<p><br></p><strong>Equipment, Methods &amp; Guidelines</strong><p><br></p>Uses computer-aided dispatch system, including 911 emergency telephone, Telephone Device for the Deaf (TDD) and other multi-line telephone systems, various law enforcement telecommunications systems, multi-channel radio console with headsets and telephone handsets, video display terminals, computer keyboards, and alarm systems. Resource materials include hardware and software documentation, Dispatcher Training Manual, Dispatcher Training Guide, call-out schedules, maps, standardized service request classifications, level of response decision criteria, policies, regulations, operating procedures, directives, and violation codes contained in both City and other agency reference documents and manuals.<p><br></p><strong>Working Conditions</strong><p><br></p>Work is located in the Police Communications Center with variable lighting intensity and background noise. Work includes pressures generated by the necessity for appropriate and timely responses and follow-up required by emergency and routine events that often occur simultaneously. Work also involves prolonged periods of sitting. Incumbents are subject to shift assignments including evenings, weekends, and holidays; and to shift holdovers, early work calls, and scheduled overtime.<p><br></p><strong>Physical Demands</strong><p><br></p>Work emphasizes clear speech, visual and hearing acuity, and manual dexterity; prolonged periods of sitting and of wearing a headset; may occasionally perform moderate lifting (such as 30-50 pound boxes of computer paper), carrying, pushing, pulling and stooping. Must be able to work in an environment with randomly occurring periods that are dominated by crisis situations and stress filled working conditions.<p><br></p><strong>Supervisory Guidance Received/Given</strong><p><br></p>Supervision received is intended to prescribe both general and detailed methods for achieving objectives. This is the entry level dispatcher classification and incumbents' activities are subject to close monitoring in an extended on-the-job training regime.<p><br></p>Examples of duties include, but are not limited to<p><br></p>Under close observation, receives, interprets, classifies, prioritizes and responds to call of a routine and emergency nature, including those calls involving life-threatening situations. Enters relevant information by computer keyboard and, as appropriate, transmits message for dispatching.Under close observation assigns calls to police units for necessary action, determining how many and which units are required for response. May coordinate with patrol supervisors regarding deployment of personnel. Visually monitors video display terminals and aurally monitors police radio frequencies to ensure correct status of officers and pending and dispatched calls, making "on-line changes" via keyboard as appropriate. Calls out Public Works standby personnel, performs call outs for various local government entities, and monitors local government radio for their status.Determines appropriate communications or research channels selecting from emergency telephone lines, radio room telephone lines, business telephone lines, police radio channels, other agency radio channels, and manual computerized information systems.Under close observation, provides information to officers expeditiously, in areas such as warrants, vehicles, driver's licenses, parole, and criminal history information. Interprets or clarifies coded responses from various systems for police officers or other parties. Confirms warrants with responsible agencies, receives warrants and updates status of warrants.As acquired skills develop, accesses and updates information in a variety of on-line Law Enforcement data systems, including systems which contain confidential data.Develops, confirms, and relays information by contacting persons such as those in the internal chain of command; relatives of those involved in incidents; employers; hospitals; sworn and non-sworn public safety personnel at other agencies; other City departments; ambulance services; detoxification centers; tow companies; attorneys; state parole; animal control; commercial establishments; alarm companies; and schools.Monitors other public safety and emergency preparedness radio traffic; fire panel and security system boards; local government radio channels; and jail and complaint desk alarms, and takes appropriate actions.Maintains various logs and records of activities, such as radio transmissions, telephone calls received, call-outs and tow requests, equipment failure log, and personal time keeping and attendance.Follows defined alternative procedures in the event of computer or other equipment malfunction such as performing shut down and start up procedures. Performs various tasks to ensure proper operation of equipment such as setting and resetting computer system, video display terminals, mobile data terminals and printers; and changing print ribbons, paper, and recording tapes.Performs activities related to the operation of a county-wide law enforcement radio system (CLERS) such as monitoring radio channel and issuing all points bulletins following county protocol and procedures.Promotes the City's Mission to make Concord a city of the highest quality by providing responsive, cost-effective, and innovative government services; understands and subscribes to the Vision and Values Statement adopted by the City.Performs other work as assigned.<p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge and Abilities:</strong><p><br></p>Basic knowledge of the use of data processing equipment for data entry systems. Ability to read, comprehend, and retain relevant sections of various California codes such as the Penal, Health and Safety, Municipal, Welfare and Institutions, and Vehicle codes; interdepartmental regulations, policies and procedures; various hardware and software documentation; Federal Communications Commission Regulations.<p><br></p>Ability to learn and make effective use of the resources, equipment, methods, procedures, and nomenclature included in and associated with computer-aided dispatch and automated information systems and other aspects of the work; to learn the geographic layout of the City, including location of streets, street names, freeways, shopping centers, industrial parks, hotels, and other landmarks. Ability to remain calm in situations of stress; to assess events quickly and accurately; to adapt communications and behavioral styles appropriately in response to individuals and situations; to obtain and accurately record required information; to effectively classify and prioritize service requests; to act promptly and decisively; to make acceptable decisions; to quickly search and find information from resource systems, manuals, maps and other documents and to accurately and concisely convey such information orally and in writing; to spell accurately and use correct grammar; to speak clearly, concisely and audibly; to perform multiple tasks simultaneously; to meet the physical requirements of the work; to understand and carry out oral and written instructions; and to establish and maintain cooperative and effective relationships with those contacted in the course of work.<p><br></p><strong>Education:</strong> Satisfactory completion of high school or the equivalent.<p><br></p><strong>Experience: </strong>Two years of related work experience that has provided the knowledge, skills and abilities necessary to perform the duties of a law enforcement dispatcher in a computer-assisted environment.<p><br></p><strong><u>Other</u></strong><p><br></p>Ability to operate an alpha-numeric keyboard with sufficient speed and accuracy to provide efficient input into a computer terminal, measured by the ability to type at a rate of 35 words per minute (net).<p><br></p>Must have normal (or correctable to normal) hearing and eyesight and a clear and audible voice for radio and telephone communications.<p><br></p>Must successfully pass the dispatcher testing administered by the City in accordance with POST Standard Section 1018(c).<p><br></p>Must successfully complete a thorough background investigation as a condition of employment.<p><br></p>A California Driver's License and a satisfactory driving record are conditions of initial and continued employment.<p><br></p>The City of Concord takes pride in offering a generous benefits program that provides flexibility for the diverse and changing needs of our qualifying employees.<p><br></p>For a complete overview, click here .<p><br></p>Below is a brief listing of what the City offers:<p><br></p><ul><li>Dental &amp; Vision Insurance </li><li>Employee Assistance Program </li><li>Health Insurance </li><li>Holidays </li><li>Life Insurance </li><li>Pre-tax Savings Benefits </li><li>Retiree Medical (3 levels based on date of hire) </li><li>Retirement Program </li><li>Short-term Disability*and Long-term Disability </li><li>Social Security/Medicare </li><li>Vacation &amp; Sick Leave</li></ul>*Not available for sworn personnel.<p><br></p>Closing Date/Time: Continuous

<strong>About The Opportunity</strong><p><br></p>Reporting to the Dispatch Supervisor, the Public Safety Dispatcher is responsible for the day-to-day communications function of the Communications Center for the Oakland Campus. The dispatcher will be responsible for answering all calls for service as well as the dispatching of officers to these calls. The dispatcher may also be responsible for monitoring the public safety walk-in center during non-business hours or as needed.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Receive emergency and non-emergency telephone calls</li><li>Determine the nature, location, and priority of requests and dispatch appropriate resources in accordance with established procedure</li><li>Enter, update, and retrieve information from a variety of computer systems</li><li>Disseminate mass emergency notification alerts when necessary</li><li>Monitor radio traffic, security alarms, fire alarms, and video security cameras</li><li>Provide referral services and victim resources</li><li>Research, collect, analyze, document, and disseminate public safety intelligence</li><li>Undergo initial training and maintain knowledge through continuing education</li><li>Monitor the 24/7 public safety walk-in center and dispatch officers as needed for walk-in reports</li><li>Other duties as assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Mandatory Job Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>High School Diploma or GED equivalent</li><li>One or more years of relevant experience</li><li>A valid U.S. Driver’s License</li><li>Certification in a POST Public Safety Dispatcher course or the successful completion of a qualifying course within 6 months of hire</li><li>APCO certification within six months of hire</li><li>Candidates must pass a criminal background check</li><li>Candidates will be subject to a drug test and psychological exam</li><li>Must currently possess, or must achieve within first three months; CPR (BLS/HCP) certification</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Required Skills</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and quickly synthesize information</li><li>Ability to remain calm, stay focused, and utilize sound judgement in rapidly evolving, stressful emergency situations</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Strong computer skills, typing skills, and ability to learn new software</li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively with a wide variety of people</li><li>Has a professional phone manner and a service mentality</li><li>Is team and goal oriented</li><li>Ability to exercise discretion in handling confidential information</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree in criminal justice, communications, leadership, or other related area is preferred</li><li>Former dispatch or law enforcement experience strongly preferred </li><li>Call-taking experience preferred</li><li>Experience in a higher education setting preferred</li><li>Certifications in any applicable training and courses related to the dispatch function &amp; emergency communications.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Additional Information</strong><p><br></p>Click here to see an overview of the University’s comprehensive benefits package including educational incentives, comprehensive medical coverage, retirement plans, and fitness/wellness programs.<p><br></p>Northeastern University is an equal opportunity employer, seeking to recruit and support a broadly diverse community of faculty and staff. Northeastern values and celebrates diversity in all its forms and strives to foster an inclusive culture built on respect that affirms inter-group relations and builds cohesion.<p><br></p>All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.<p><br></p>To learn more about Northeastern University’s commitment and support of diversity and inclusion, please see <em>www.northeastern.edu/diversity</em>.<p><br></p><strong>The expected hiring range for this position is USD $33/hour</strong><p><br></p><strong>Position Type</strong><p><br></p>Safety and Security<p><br></p><strong>Additional Information</strong><p><br></p>Northeastern University considers factors such as candidate work experience, education and skills when extending an offer.<p><br></p>Northeastern has a comprehensive benefits package for benefit eligible employees. This includes medical, vision, dental, paid time off, tuition assistance, wellness &amp; life, retirement- as well as commuting &amp; transportation. Visit https://hr.northeastern.edu/benefits/ for more information.<p><br></p>Northeastern University is an equal opportunity employer, seeking to recruit and support a broadly diverse community of faculty and staff. Northeastern values and celebrates diversity in all its forms and strives to foster an inclusive culture built on respect that affirms inter-group relations and builds cohesion.<p><br></p>All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.<p><br></p>To learn more about Northeastern University’s commitment and support of diversity and inclusion, please see <em>www.northeastern.edu/diversity</em>.

describtion: <strong>Highgate Hotels<br><br></strong>Highgate is a premier real estate investment and hospitality management company widely recognized as an innovator in the industry. Highgate is the dominant player in U.S. gateway markets including New York, Boston, Miami, San Francisco and Honolulu. Highgate also has an expanding presence in key European markets through properties in London, Paris, Barcelona, Vienna and Prague. Highgate's portfolio of global properties represents an aggregate asset value exceeding $10B and generates over $2B in cumulative revenues. The company provides expert guidance through all stages of the hospitality property cycle, from planning and development through recapitalization or disposition. Highgate also has the creativity and bandwidth to develop bespoke hotel brands and utilizes industry leading proprietary revenue management tools that identify and predict evolving market dynamics to drive out performance and maximize asset value. With an executive team consisting of some of the industry's most experienced hotel management leaders, the company is a trusted partner for top ownership groups and major hotel brands. Highgate maintains corporate offices in London, New York, Dallas, and Seattle.<br><br><strong>Location<br><br></strong>Located atop San Francisco's famed Nob Hill at the corner of California and Powell streets, Stanford Court hotel is steps from the city's best dining, shopping, entertainment and cultural attractions. The hotel features 393 well-appointed rooms and suites, offering comfortable accommodations for leisure and business travelers in a prime location. With a storied history dating back nearly 140 years, Stanford Court sits on the historic site of renowned "Big 4" railroad mogul, university founder, and U.S. senator Leland Stanford's elaborate private mansion. Leland Stanford was at the forefront of innovation in his era, and today's Stanford Court hotel pays homage to his legacy by representing the new frontier of innovation for the 21st century.<br><br><strong><u>Overview<br><br></u></strong>The Accounts Receivable Clerk is responsible for ensuring proper review, timely processing and communications of all guests billing and the collection thereof, in accordance with Highgate Hotel's policies and procedures.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Assist the sales effort in establishing customer credit in accordance with Highgate Hotel's policies and procedures, to include but not limited to the application process, reference checks, credit limits, direct bill listing, deposit requirements and other credit related activities.</li><li> Provide customers with accurate and timely invoices, statements and schedules.</li><li> Respond effectively to customer inquiries in a timely fashion. Communicate all issues and/or disputes to operating departments and supervisor.</li><li> Maintain an efficient collection process to include an organized filing and tracing system, issue demand letters, monitor returned checks and chargebacks, perform collection calls and prepare bad debt write-offs.</li><li> Ensure proper internal control by monitoring the guest ledger, advance deposit ledger and any other related subsidiary ledgers.</li><li> Implement credit training in operating department to include proper credit card, cash and check acceptance, limits and approval for direct bill listing.</li><li> Monitor and prepare financial reports in accordance with Highgate Hotel requirements meeting various due dates; i.e., month end aging reports, weekly aging transmission to the Corporate Office, etc.</li><li> Attend and contribute to periodic meetings (pre-convention, credit, etc.) to maintain favorable working relationships between employees to improve morale, productivity and efficiency.</li><li> Keep supervisor informed of any unusual events and/or deviations of policies or procedures.</li><li> Ensure overall guest satisfaction.</li><li> Maximize productivity, identify problem areas, and assist in finding and implementing solutions.<br><br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Education &amp; Experience:<br><ul><li> High School diploma or equivalent required.</li><li> At least one year of progressive experience in a hotel or related field preferred.</li><li> College course work in related field helpful.</li><li> Ability to understand and utilize basic computer equipment and applications, to include word processing and spreadsheet applications.<br><br></li></ul><strong><u>Physical Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> Flexible and long hours sometimes required.</li><li> Sedentary work - Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally, and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects.<br><br></li></ul>General Requirements<br><ul><li> Maintain a warm and friendly demeanor at all times.</li><li> Must be able to effectively communicate both verbally and written, with all level of employees and guests in an attentive, friendly, courteous and service oriented manner.</li><li> Must be effective at listening to, understanding, and clarifying concerns raised by employees and guests.</li><li> Must be able to multitask and prioritize departmental functions to meet deadlines.</li><li> Approach all encounters with guests and employees in an attentive, friendly, courteous and service-oriented manner.</li><li> Attend all hotel required meetings and trainings.</li><li> Maintain regular attendance in compliance with Highgate Hotel Standards, as required by scheduling, which will vary according to the needs of the hotel.</li><li> Maintain high standards of personal appearance and grooming, which includes wearing the proper uniform and nametag.</li><li> Comply with Highgate Hotel Standards and regulations to encourage safe and efficient hotel operations.</li><li> Maximize efforts towards productivity, identify problem areas and assist in implementing solutions.</li><li> Must be effective in handling problems, including anticipating, preventing, identifying and solving problems as necessary.</li><li> Must be able to understand and apply complex information, data, etc. from various sources to meet appropriate objectives.</li><li> Must be able to cross-train in other hotel related areas.</li><li> Must be able to maintain confidentiality of information.</li><li> Must be able to show initiative, including anticipating guest or operational needs.</li><li> Perform other duties as requested by management.<br><br></li></ul>Salary Range: $ 29.39 per hour

Headquartered in the San Francisco Bay Area, Energy Recovery has manufacturing, research and development facilities across California and Texas with sales and on-site technical support available globally. For more information, please visit www.energyrecovery.com.<p><br></p>Job Summary:<p><br></p>ERII is seeking a qualified candidate for an immediate full-time job opening for the position of Document Control Specialist, with the Engineering team in the San Leandro, CA facility. This role will be key for the engineering as well as operations and will have a direct impact on the organization.<p><br></p>Major Duties &amp; Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Create part numbers, BOMs, product configurations and manage item master data in a Document Management System and interface seamlessly with production based ERP system. </li><li>Initiate, process, route and distribute Engineering Change Orders with direction from process owners and engineers. </li><li>Understand quality and manufacturing specifications and process dispositions of nonconformities, RMAs etc. </li><li>Verify and ensure the accuracy of ECO documentation, part numbers, drawing revision, spec sheets for commercial parts, cross reference to vendor part numbers, etc. </li><li>Communicate with suppliers and vendors and coordinate determination of part structures and review documentation </li><li>Provide informational support to all employees regarding Engineering data, statistical analysis and reporting </li><li>Assist in preparation of product documentation packages </li><li>All other projects and duties as assigned <br><br></li></ul>Skills &amp; Requirements<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with implementing and maintaining Product Lifecycle process, such as: BOM Management, ECR, ECO, and Deviation processes in a production environment. </li><li>Experience with known PLM systems, such as Agile, Oracle PLM, Arena PLM or others. </li><li>Experience with integration of product documentation with ERP systems like Microsoft AX, Baan, SAP etc. is needed. </li><li>Able to interface with all parties and help to develop meaningful and efficient processes. </li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills. </li><li>Excellent understanding of technical engineering terms (mechanical &amp; process codes). </li><li>Ability to read technical drawings (electrical and mechanical) a plus. </li><li>Exposure to ISO 9001 compliant processes is highly desirable. </li><li>Minimum of 3 years and preferably 5 years of industry experience. </li><li>Experience with ANSI Y14.5 drawing standards, GD&amp;T and design for manufacturability is a plus. <br><br></li></ul>We are an EOE/AA employer committed to workforce diversity.<p><br></p>No recruiters or phone calls.<p><br></p>The below range is the range that we reasonably believe to be the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. The salary range for this role is $35 to $40.

<strong>About The Role</strong><p><br></p>We are looking for a responsible Contract Administrator to join our team. Your main duties will be to prepare, negotiate and review various company contracts, including purchases, sales and business partnerships.<p><br></p>A successful Contract Administrator will demonstrate a strong attention to detail along with the ability to discover potential risks for our company. You should also analyze contracts with an eye toward reducing costs and increasing profits, while ensuring compliance with the law. Our ideal candidate has previous experience managing contracts and is familiar with legal requirements and terms of use.<p><br></p>Ultimately, you should ensure all our contracts conform to legislative requirements and meet our company goals.<p><br></p><em><strong>This position is full time, on-site at headquarters location in Santa Clara. No relocation benefits will be offered for this position. Only local candidates will be considered. </strong></em><p><br></p><strong>What You’ll Do</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Prepare and review sales and purchase and other contracts and agreements</li><li>Negotiate contract terms with internal and external business partners</li><li>Review and update existing contracts</li><li>Explain terms and conditions to managers and interested parties</li><li>Ensure that employees understand and comply with company contracts</li><li>Analyze potential risks involved with specific contract terms</li><li>Stay up-to date with legislative changes and coordinate with the legal department as needed</li><li>Ensure all deadlines and conditions described on contracts are met (e.g. payments and shippings)</li><li>Maintain organized system of physical and digital records</li><li>Create language standards for existing and new contracts</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Proven work experience as a Contract Administrator, Contract Manager or relevant role</li><li>Experience as a Paralegal is a plus</li><li>2-4 years of increasingly responsibilities and experience reviewing, drafting, and negotiating commercial contracts</li><li>Knowledge of legal requirements involved with contracts</li><li>Excellent writing skills</li><li>Keen attention to detail, with an ability to spot errors</li><li>Strong analytical and organizational skills</li><li>Ability to work with varying seniority levels, including staff, managers and external partners</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Education and Experience Required:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BS degree in Business Administration; additional qualifications in law are a plus</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p><strong>What We Offer</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Health, Dental, and Vision care for you and your family</li><li>401K savings plan with employer matching</li><li>Generous PTO leave and paid holidays</li><li>Casual work culture</li><li>Team bonding activities, catered lunches, and free snacks in office</li></ul><p><br></p><em><strong>Anatomage is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not offer H1B Sponsorship at this time. Local candidates preferred.</strong></em><p><br></p><strong>Who is Anatomage?</strong><p><br></p>Founded in 2004, Anatomage is a world-leading health care technology company. Anatomage is committed to transcending the limitations of existing medical education with innovative products that elevate the teaching and learning process. Our staff is relentlessly committed to quality and customer satisfaction, striving to make sure our customers realize the full benefits of our unique products.<p><br></p>Anatomage is the global 3D medical application leader. Our products are currently installed and used in thousands of universities, institutions, clinics, and hospitals all over the US and world-wide. The Anatomage Table is the most technologically advanced 3D anatomy visualization system for anatomy education and is being adopted by many of the world’s leading medical schools and institutions.<p><br></p><strong>About Anatomage</strong><p><br></p>Anatomage has been financially robust and growing for 18 consecutive years. Doctors world-wide have enthusiastically responded to the company’s products, making us a market leader and setting the industry standard. Currently, thousands of clinics and hospitals use Anatomage's software for patient diagnosis and treatment planning. Leading radiology equipment companies use Anatomage’s software as a key component in their systems.<p><br></p>Anatomage offers the world’s first and only life-sized virtual dissection table. Students can learn anatomy and physiology using highly interactive and accurate real human-based digital data. Institutions can offer high quality education without worrying about chemicals, facility costs, and regulatory issues. Hundreds of schools have adopted the Anatomage Table as the main teaching tool for students.<p><br></p>At Anatomage, there is an opportunity to work alongside the best in the field. With a diverse group of people from various technical, clinical, and artistic backgrounds, Anatomage provides a culture where distinguished individuals can work and collaborate in an organic manner. Our team members all bring unique strengths and talents to their group and embrace each other's diverse perspectives. Anatomage offers a distinct work experience with an exceptional opportunity to develop careers. Our philosophy is to foster a dynamic work environment, and we are proud to let our employees' knowledge and responsibilities grow with the company.<p><br></p><strong>Fraud Recruitment Disclaimer</strong><p><br></p>It has come to our notice that fraudulent and fictitious job opportunities are being circulated on the Internet. Prospective candidates are being contacted by certain individuals, mainly through telephone calls, emails and correspondences, claiming they are representatives, subsidiaries or under contract with Anatomage, Inc., and, thus, pretending to represent Anatomage. The main purpose of these correspondences and announcements is to obtain privileged information from individuals, or to induce people to pay a fee for services related to recruitment or training or a new role.<p><br></p>Anatomage does not:<p><br></p><ul><li>Send job offers from free email services like Gmail, Yahoo mail, Hotmail, etc.;</li><li>Request payment of any kind from prospective candidates for employment or any sort of fees;</li><li>Authorize anyone to either collect money or arrive at any monetary arrangement in return for a job at Anatomage; and</li><li>Request or require personal documents like bank account details, tax forms or credit card information as part of the recruitment process</li></ul><p><br></p>Legitimate emails from<strong> @anatomage.com</strong> domains are from the organization, anything outside of the stated domain is likely a scam and fraudulent email. If you have received an offer from any domain other than<strong> @anatomage.com</strong>, it is likely a scam and not a legitimate offer. <strong>P</strong><strong>lease do not provide any personal information to the imposters posing as recruiters or the HR manager of Anatomage, Inc. </strong>We recommend blocking and reporting their accounts for unauthorized and fraudulent behaviors.

Living Carbon is a public benefit corporation with a mission to responsibly rebalance the planet’s carbon cycle using the inherent power of plants. We believe that gigaton scale CO2 drawdown will only happen if solutions are both beneficial to the environment and profitable to landowners. We’ve developed photosynthesis-enhanced seedlings that capture carbon faster on underperforming and degraded land. In addition to improving carbon capture rates we are also working on extending the durability of nature based sequestration. We’re backed by some of the most prominent investors in Silicon Valley including Temasek, Toyota, Felicis Ventures, Y Combinator, and Chris Sacca of LowerCarbon Capital.<p><br></p>If you believe that climate change is the defining global emergency of the century and want to join an ambitious project that’s working on a biological solution, we’d love to hear from you.<p><br></p>We are looking for a dedicated and mission driven individual to join the Operations Team and to take ownership of Living Carbon’s office space and team activities, including organizing and coordinating office administration duties, implementing office procedures and planning and hosting team events. Your role is to create and maintain a pleasant work environment, ensuring high levels of organizational effectiveness, communication and safety.<p><br></p>The ideal candidate has excellent time management and organizational skills and thrives in a fast-paced environment. Organizational skills will be crucial for successful candidates in this role, and we will also look to this individual to bring creativity and fresh ideas towards the layout and operations of Living Carbon’s headquarters in the San Francisco Bay Area.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Own the function and format of Living Carbon’s Headquarters, including common spaces, meeting rooms, and the organizational style of our open office space</li><li>Develop creative ideas to bolster Living Carbon’s unique culture, such as by hosting engaging team building activities and fun events </li><li>Curate interesting engagement opportunities, such as organizing tasty and healthy team lunches and designing cool branded gear for employees and partners </li><li>Support planning of onsite visits to the Living Carbon HQ (for interview candidates, visiting partners, investors, media guests, etc.) </li><li>Support recruiting and onboarding efforts, especially in regard to onsite interviews and new hire office setup at the Living Carbon HQ and Living Carbon’s Lab in Charleston, SC</li><li>Organize and plan team meetings and off-sites by assisting with the production of materials and pre-reads</li><li>Interface across diverse teams to support overlapping operations and construction projects for Living Carbon’s office spaces and adjacent onsite laboratory spaces</li><li>Bring creative ideas and operational support to Living Carbon’s participation at conferences and special events</li><li>Coordinate with Lab Operations on shipping and receiving</li><li>Be onsite Monday - Friday from 9:00am to 5:00pm<br><br></li></ul>Qualifications<p><br></p><ul><li>2-3+ years of experience in office management, admin management, and/or operations management </li><li>Bachelor’s degree in related field a huge plus</li><li>Incredibly organized, with superb attention to detail and a strong ability to execute</li><li>Excellent with time management and able to quickly shift tasks and priorities as needed</li><li>Communicate, perform, and react well under pressure or ambiguity</li><li>Enjoy optimizing processes to make them more efficient</li><li>Adept at handling sensitive information and situations with care and confidence</li><li>Motivated by Living Carbon’s mission and able to bring creative ideas to build the team culture</li><li>Strong technical / computer skills: proficient in Apple / GSuite / Microsoft Office software applications and experience hosting and coordinating virtual Zoom meetings<br><br></li></ul>Living Carbon PBC offers competitive compensation, and generous healthcare, dental and vision insurance.<p><br></p>Living Carbon PBC is an equal opportunity employer.<p><br></p>We believe the best solutions to climate change are created by diverse teams. Living Carbon is focused on building a multicultural and inclusive team with strong representation from the many diverse communities disproportionately impacted by climate change. As a public benefit corporation, ensuring solutions to slow climate change are widely distributed to all peoples is critical to the success of our mission.<p><br></p>$70,000 - $100,000
