Classified as a low to moderate security facility, the hospital has a bed capacity to treat up to 1,362 patients on an attractive campus with treatment units located on 138 acres. Staff is dedicated and committed to delivering high quality, cost-effective, professional services and specialized programs in an environment that promotes continuous improvements in treatment for individuals with mental disabilities.<p><br></p>All Hospital Locations:<p><br></p>Effective October 1, 2021, in accordance with California Department of Public Health (CDPH) State Public Health Order of August 5, 2021, all workforce members in DSH state hospitals are required to be fully vaccinated with a COVID-19 vaccination regimen. Prior to your first day, you will be required to fill out a COVID-19 Vaccination Consent Form .<p><br></p>Effective March 1, 2022, in accordance with CDPH State Public Health Order of December 22, 2021, hospital workforce members currently eligible for booster doses must have received their booster dose.<p><br></p><ul><li> If you are fully vaccinated, you must provide evidence of vaccination prior to your start date. </li><li> If you are not fully vaccinated, you have the option to receive a vaccine from one of the State Hospitals prior to your start date. </li><li> If you are not fully vaccinated and choose to complete a request for an exemption, you must submit this exemption and receive approval prior to your start date. </li><li> If you are not yet eligible for a booster, you must be in compliance no later than 15 days after the recommended timeframe for receiving the booster dose. </li></ul><p><br></p>All State Hospital Locations:<p><br></p>Please note that start dates will be dependent upon if and when proof of vaccination or exemption requirements are submitted timely and approved.<p><br></p>Face Coverings<p><br></p>While working on-site, employees must follow current face covering guidance as issued by CDPH.<p><br></p>Department Website: http://www.dsh.ca.gov<p><br></p>Department Website: https://www.dsh.ca.gov<p><br></p>Special Requirements<p><br></p><ul><li> The position(s) require(s) the ability to type at a minimum speed as designated on the Class Specifications (link available in the additional documentation section). You must obtain a valid typing certificate confirming your ability to meet the minimum typing speed, prior to being hired. Additional information regarding acceptable typing tests is available at the CalCareers.ca.gov website. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> A typing certification is required for Office Technician (Typing) position. </strong><p><br></p><strong><u>The California Department Of Human Resources Has Approved Certificates From The Following Entities</u></strong><p><br></p>Please provide a typing certificate issued within the last four years that certifies your ability to type at a speed of 40 WPM. DSH-Napa will honor typing certificates certified from a five (5) minute typing test that meets the CalHR requirements, with a minimum of 40 WPM (words per minute).<p><br></p>Any State Agency/Department (the Agency/Department that you are applying to may also give you a typing test) The Employment Development Department’s (EDD) One-Stop Career Centers may offer free typing tests. For a location near you, visit EDD’s website at http://www.edd.ca.gov/Jobs_and_Training/pubs/osfile.pdf .<p><br></p>Business Schools or Colleges.<p><br></p>Adult Education Centers<p><br></p>Skills and Business Education Centers.<p><br></p>Typing certificates issued by the Internet or Employment Agencies, and Typing Certificates issued for a typing test under five (5) minutes are not acceptable.<p><br></p>Application Instructions<p><br></p>Dates printed on Mobile Bar Codes, such as the Quick Response (QR) Codes available at the USPS, are not considered Postmark dates for the purpose of determining timely filing of an application.<p><br></p>Final Filing Date: Until Filled<p><br></p>Who May Apply<p><br></p>Individuals who are currently in the classification, eligible for lateral transfer, eligible for reinstatement, have list eligibility, are in the process of obtaining list eligibility, or have SROA and/or Surplus eligibility (please attach your letter, if available). SROA and Surplus candidates are given priority; therefore, individuals with other eligibility may be considered in the event no SROA or Surplus candidates apply.<p><br></p>Applications will be screened and only the most qualified applicants will be selected to move forward in the selection process. Applicants must meet the Minimum Qualifications stated in the Classification Specification(s).<p><br></p>How To Apply<p><br></p><strong><u>If You Choose To Not Apply Electronically, a Hard Copy Application Package May Be Submitted Through An Alternative Method Listed Below</u></strong><p><br></p>Complete Application Packages (including your Examination/Employment Application (STD 678) and applicable or required documents) must be submitted to apply for this Job Posting. Application Packages may be submitted electronically through your CalCareer Account at www.CalCareers.ca.gov. When submitting your application in hard copy, a completed copy of the Application Package listing must be included.<p><br></p>Address for Mailing Application Packages<p><br></p>You may submit your application and any applicable or required documents to:<p><br></p>Department of State Hospitals<p><br></p>Attn: EXAM AND HIRING UNIT<p><br></p>2100 Napa/Vallejo Hwy.<p><br></p>Napa , CA 94558<p><br></p>Address for Drop-Off Application Packages<p><br></p>You may drop off your application and any applicable or required documents at:<p><br></p>Department of State Hospitals<p><br></p>EXAM AND HIRING UNIT<p><br></p>2100 Napa/Vallejo Hwy.<p><br></p>Napa , CA 94558<p><br></p>08:00 AM - 05:00 PM<p><br></p>Required Application Package Documents<p><br></p><strong><u>Required</u></strong><p><br></p>Applicants who do not submit the required items timely may not be considered for this job<p><br></p>The following items are required to be submitted with your application.<p><br></p><ul><li>Current version of the State Examination/Employment Application STD Form 678 (when not applying electronically), or the Electronic State Employment Application through your Applicant Account at www.CalCareers.ca.gov. All Experience and Education relating to the Minimum Qualifications listed on the Classification Specification should be included to demonstrate how you meet the Minimum Qualifications for the position.</li><li>Resume is optional. It may be included, but is not required.</li></ul><p><br></p>Applicants requiring reasonable accommodations for the hiring interview process must request the necessary accommodations if scheduled for a hiring interview. The request should be made at the time of contact to schedule the interview. Questions regarding reasonable accommodations may be directed to the EEO contact listed on this job posting.<p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>Benefit information can be found on the CalHR website and the CalPERS website.<p><br></p>Contact Information<p><br></p>The Human Resources Contact is available to answer questions regarding the position or application process.<p><br></p>Department Website: https://www.dsh.ca.gov<p><br></p><strong><u>Human Resources Contact</u></strong><p><br></p>Caroline Kurema<p><br></p>(707) 253-5634 ext: 5634<p><br></p>caroline.kurema@dsh.ca.gov<p><br></p>Please direct requests for Reasonable Accommodations to the interview scheduler at the time the interview is being scheduled. You may direct any additional questions regarding Reasonable Accommodations or Equal Employment Opportunity for this position(s) to the Department's EEO Office.<p><br></p><strong><u>EEO Contact</u></strong><p><br></p>Tiffani Emerson Morris<p><br></p>(707) 253-5562<p><br></p>Tiffani.emersonmorris@dsh.ca.gov<p><br></p>California Relay Service: 1-800-735-2929 (TTY), 1-800-735-2922 (Voice) TTY is a Telecommunications Device for the Deaf, and is reachable only from phones equipped with a TTY Device.<p><br></p>Equal Opportunity Employer<p><br></p>The State of California is an equal opportunity employer to all, regardless of age, ancestry, color, disability (mental and physical), exercising the right to family care and medical leave, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, military or veteran status, national origin, political affiliation, race, religious creed, sex (includes pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding and related medical conditions), and sexual orientation.<p><br></p>It is an objective of the State of California to achieve a drug-free work place. Any applicant for state employment will be expected to behave in accordance with this objective because the use of illegal drugs is inconsistent with the law of the State, the rules governing Civil Service, and the special trust placed in public servants.<p><br></p>Closing Date/Time: Until Filled

companies_names: Habitat for Humanity Greater San Francisco
describtion: <strong>Client Service Specialist- Home Preservation</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Location: San Francisco</li><li>Pay Rate: $30.30- $32.20/hr</li></ul><p><br></p>Come be part of the affordable, homeownership movement! Join us and make an impact on people’s lives! Habitat for Humanity Greater San Francisco believes in the power of homeownership to create generational impact.<p><br></p>To this end, we build homes for first-time homeowners and sustain homeownership by helping long-time homeowners retain their home as an asset for generations to come.<p><br></p><strong>Your Impact </strong><p><br></p>The Client Service Specialist supports Habitat GSF’s Home Preservation Department which invests in selected neighborhoods that have experienced disinvestment and racial segregation across our tri-county region- San Francisco, San Mateo, and Marin counties. The Home Preservation program provided critical repairs and rehabs to low-income homeowners to prevent displacement and to stabilize communities. This a grant-funded position through June 2024, with the potential for renewal with program success<p><br></p>Externally, the Client Services Specialist acts as a critical point of contact with the communities we serve, supporting those in need of critical repairs for the home they’ve owned for years. Starting with initial engagement with a prospective applicant, the Specialist provides clear information about program benefits, requirements, and obligations. They maintain consistent, clear communication, and assists clients to move smoothly and efficiently through each stage of the process until homeowners receive repairs. The Specialist will take a hands-on, culturally sensitive approach, recognizing the importance of building connections and relationships with clients, many of whom are new to complex real estate transactions.<p><br></p>Internally, the Specialist will communicate progress with HGSF loan officers and other staff regarding a client’s application status, help colleagues access data to make decisions at critical stages of the process, and secure the necessary documents and agreements to move applicants forward. The Specialist will input and manage a wide range of sensitive data in Salesforce, track progress, and ensure compliance goals are met. This is a central role that requires on-going collaboration with many staff members and requires a strong, communicative team player that is highly organized and capable of managing multiple tasks simultaneously.<p><br></p><strong><u>Primary Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>Client Engagement and Support (45%)<p><br></p><ul><li>Respond to inquiries from prospective applicants. </li><li>Educate and inform applicants and prospective applicants about home repair opportunities and their respective requirements through one-on-one meetings and information sessions. </li><li>Maintain positive, consistent, and timely communication with all applicants about their application status through intake, screening, eligibility review, and selection. </li><li>Troubleshoot applicant issues and concerns, focusing on fairness, equity, and transparency. </li><li>Ensure application completeness in advance of eligibility review.</li><li>Coordinate the preparation of loan agreements, including securing necessary paperwork from clients and scheduling meetings to review loan terms and other agreements.</li><li>Review loan documents, disclosures, and any additional disclosure agreements with clients in an inclusive, culturally competent, and transparent manner.</li><li>Maintain compliance as a Qualified Loan Originator, considering local, state, and federal rules &amp; regulations. </li></ul><p><br></p>Project Coordination (35%)<p><br></p><ul><li>Conduct application intakes to ensure transparency and accuracy for internal and external compliance purposes, in accordance with HGSF and funder requirements. </li><li>Maintain accurate electronic records in Salesforce. </li><li>Track and provide timely reports to key team members on the status of milestones associated with repairs of homes for existing low-income homeowners; including applicant intake, application screening, application/eligibility review, selection, loan closings, and construction progress. </li><li>Troubleshoot tech issues, as needed. </li></ul><p><br></p>Program Support (20%)<p><br></p><ul><li>Facilitate educational opportunities within lending program components, including workshop scheduling, partnership development, and providing resources and referrals. </li><li>Support marketing and outreach strategies as necessary. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Demonstrated experience in client relations or customer service in a government, business (such as hospitality), or nonprofit setting. </li><li>Excellent organizational and prioritization skills and the ability to manage an unpredictable workflow. </li><li>Ability to gather, organize, analyze, and present quantitative and qualitative data succinctly to team members to support effective application review and decision-making. </li><li>Awareness of and sensitivity to cultural and socioeconomic characteristics of populations served. </li><li>Demonstrated success as a relationship builder and collaborator; able to work with diverse individuals and groups of people.</li><li>Excellent written and oral communication skills; must be able to communicate with care, clarity, and integrity.</li><li>Proficiency with Microsoft Office programs and databases are necessary</li><li>Ability to work on weekends, nights, and outside the office up to 30% of the time</li><li>Ability to work in our tri-county service area with frequent travel to Marin County as needed up to 30% of regular schedule.</li><li>Must have a valid CA driver’s license and cleaning driving record. Must have access to the ongoing use of a personal vehicle for regular client visits across our tri- county region.</li><li>Must be able to pass background check including credit check and DMV check. (In accordance with state and county law: convictions do not necessarily rule out employment, it depends on the nature and severity of the conviction and is evaluated on a case-by-case basis, check is conducted on last 7 years only). </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Familiarity with Salesforce a strong plus. </li><li>Knowledge and familiarity of and/or interest in affordable housing and/or lending. </li><li>Familiarity with lending products or loan origination as a plus. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Work Environment</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>This job operates in a professional office environment.</li><li>This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, photocopiers, and filing cabinets.</li><li>This role can require work on weekends, nights, and outside the office in the areas we serve, which is approximately 20% – 30% of the time. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Physical Demands</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>This is a largely sedentary role; however, some filing is required.</li><li>This would require the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets, and stand or bend as necessary.</li><li>Must be able to travel. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Compensation for this role is competitive, DOE.</li><li>This full-time position offers medical, dental and vision insurance, life insurance, long-term disability, employee assistance program (EAP), Flex Savings Account (FSA), 403b retirement account, commuter benefits, 20 paid vacation days, 3 front loaded sick days (accrue up to 72 hours per year), and 13 paid holidays. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>EEO: </strong>Habitat Greater San Francisco is an equal opportunity employer. Habitat Greater San Francisco strives to reflect the diverse community it serves. Applicants who contribute to this diversity are strongly encouraged to apply. Reasonable accommodation is available for qualified individuals with disabilities, upon request.<p><br></p>Habitat GSF receives federal funds through Self-Help Homeownership Opportunity Program (SHOP) and is required by federal law, to the greatest extent possible, to provide job training and employment opportunities to Section 3 residents. *Section 3 residents are defined as public housing residents or low-income persons who live in metropolitan area or non-metropolitan counties where HUD-assisted projects are located.<p><br></p><strong>If interested, please apply directly using link below: </strong>https://grnh.se/e063bcd96us

We focus our mission on our people. We foster an environment of growth and opportunity, where we strive to push all our employees forward and help them grow their careers within our company. We hold our business to high standards to ensure that we hit our goals and bring our clients the results they need to hit their objectives. These standards ensure that everyone who works with us is brought up to our level of expectations where they can achieve success in our business. We are also proud to give back to our communities. We involve ourselves with philanthropic efforts that better the communities around us. Our office culture is about giving back and the personal and professional growth of our team.<p><br></p><strong>What we look for in an entry-level Customer Service Representative candidate:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Great interpersonal skills and customer service</li><li>Excels in sales or directly interacting with customers in-person</li><li>Comfortable in fast-paced environments</li><li>Ability to self manage, think on your feet, solution-oriented</li><li>Enjoy working with and helping others</li><li>Typically looking for more growth opportunities and stable careers</li></ul><p><br></p>We have a high success rate of training people with these backgrounds for our entry-level positions.<p><br></p><strong>Customer Service Representative Benefits Include:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>On the job training</li><li>Advancement opportunities based on performance</li><li>Travel opportunities</li><li>Management Development</li><li>Supportive, high energy, team environment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Customer Service Representative Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Outgoing personalities</li><li>Strong work ethic</li><li>Desire to learn and grow professionally</li><li>Enjoy working with and helping people</li><li>Goal-oriented and self-motivated</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What we believe:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience gained is unparalleled</li><li>Representatives will grow not only professionally but personally as well</li><li>We partner everyone with developed professionals to ensure success</li><li>Training and developing transferable skills is the best opportunity for growth in management</li><li>Investing in the team with training and promoting from within is the most successful way to grow</li><li>Participating in local community charities</li><li>Compensation with full commission for someone to have uncapped earnings and no ceilings on what they can make</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>8SdOuzfRTm

jobs_titles: NWIC Document Processor & Administrative Assistant (Administrative Support Assistant, Level I),
describtion: <strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Application Process<p><br></p>This position is open until filled. For full consideration, please submit an application, along with a cover letter and resume.<p><br></p>Please review the position description listed above for full scope of responsibilities and qualifications.<p><br></p>Position Purpose<p><br></p>Reporting to the Administrative Manager, Northwest Information Center (NWIC), with additional lead work direction from the Administrative Support Coordinator and Researchers, the NWIC Document Processor and Administrative Assistant performs general office, clerical and secretarial support in support of the NWIC. Working under direct supervision with detailed instructions, the incumbent processes newly submitted historical resource reports and/or records into the NWIC’s bibliographic and GIS database; assists in general office duties; and assists historical resources consultants conducting research at the NWIC.<p><br></p><strong><u>Key Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>This position requires completion of a high school program or its equivalent and some experience in an office environment. A Bachelor of Arts degree or equivalent education and experience, and/or an internship at NWIC or 4 months records search training strongly preferred. Working knowledge of English grammar, spelling, and punctuation required. Beginning proficiency with computers and Microsoft Office and Google Suite and the ability to use standard office equipment, word processing and related computer software packages required. Knowledge of Adobe programs or Esri geographic information system program and familiarity with USGS topographic maps strongly preferred.<p><br></p>Salary and Benefits<p><br></p>Salary for this position is anticipated to be in the range of $19.26 to $23.64 an hour. This is a part time, temporary, non-exempt position. Reappointment to this position is dependent upon the individual's performance as well as administrative and budgetary considerations. The university reserves the right to terminate this appointment earlier than the scheduled expiration date.<p><br></p>Supplemental Information<p><br></p>Sonoma State University is committed to achieving excellence through teaching, scholarship, learning and inclusion. In line with our Strategic Plan and our Seawolf Commitment, our values include diversity, sustainability, community engagement, respect, responsibility, excellence and integrity. We strive to cultivate a community in which a diverse population can learn and work in an atmosphere of civility and respect. We encourage innovation, experimentation and creativity, as well as contributions to equity and inclusion, in the pursuit of excellence for all members of our university community.<p><br></p>The University is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. We consider qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, genetic information, medical condition, disability, marital status, or protected veteran status. Mandated Reporting: This position may be considered a "mandated reporter" under the California Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act and is required to comply with the requirements set forth in CSU Executive Order 1083 as a condition of employment.<p><br></p>Per the CSU COVID-19 Vaccination Policy , it is strongly recommended that all faculty, staff, administrators, and students who are accessing campus facilities follow COVID-19 vaccine recommendations adopted by the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the California Department of Public Health (CDPH) applicable to their age, medical condition, and other relevant indications. Any candidates advanced in a currently open search process should be prepared to continue to help us protect and maintain a healthy Seawolf Community. More information related to campus level requirements can be found here: https://risk.sonoma.edu/covid- compliance-and-monitoring- office .<p><br></p><strong>CSU Out of State Policy - </strong>Sonoma State University, as part of the CSU system, is a State of California Employer. As such, the University requires all employees upon date of hire to reside in the State of California. As of January 1, 2022 the CSU Out-of-State Employment Policy prohibits the hiring of employees to perform CSU-related work outside the state of California.<p><br></p>A background check (including a criminal records check) must be completed satisfactorily before any candidate can be offered a position. Failure to satisfactorily complete the background check may affect the application status of applicants or continued employment of current employees who apply for this position.<p><br></p>Sonoma State University is not a sponsoring agency for staff positions (i.e. H-1B visas).<p><br></p>Positions are posted for a minimum of 14 calendar days.<p><br></p>For questions related to the application process, please reach out to hr@sonoma.edu . The ADA Coordinator is also available ( hraccommodations@sonoma.edu ) to assist individuals with disabilities in need of accommodation during the hiring process.<p><br></p>Sonoma State University's Annual Security Report includes summaries of institutional policy relating to campus safety, drug and alcohol use, sexual assault, and other matters. The report is published in compliance with the Clery Act and includes three years of certain crime statistics that occurred in Clery Act defined geography. A paper copy of the report may be requested in person by emailing the Clery Compliance and Safety Office at clery@sonoma.edu .<p><br></p>Pursuant to the Higher Education Opportunity Act, the Annual Fire Safety Report (AFSR) is available for viewing at https://housing.sonoma.edu/ resources/fire-safety . The purpose of this report is to disclose statistics for fires that occurred within Sonoma State University student housing facilities for three years, and to distribute fire safety policies and procedures intended to promote safety on campus. A paper copy of the AFSR is available upon request by contacting the Residential Education and Campus Housing at housing@sonoma.edu .<p><br></p>Closing Date/Time: Open until filled

<strong>We are now hiring Great People Who Care!</strong><p><br></p>We are looking for a fearless and accountable Courtesy Team Member who is positive and passionate! Our Courtesy Team Members will be responsible for executing a wide variety of tasks throughout the front end of the store, including bagging groceries, collecting carts and cleaning. A Courtesy Team Member is a responsible team player and always ready to learn. A Courtesy Team Member can work at a fast pace, has a keen eye for detail, and will provide a memorable experience to all our customers!<p><br></p>Be part of our store team and help us make a positive impact in our customer’s lives. Working with us is like working with FAMILY. We promise our Team Members open and honest communication and opportunities for growth with our company. Our leaders lead with passion and purpose, and celebrate you with meaningful recognition. We promote a healthy life balance because we believe your personal well-being is essential.<p><br></p>We have a passion for food, and we share an inspiring vision, “To change the way the world eats, one plate at a time.”<p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive compensation, paid weekly</li><li>Retirement Benefits</li><li>Medical, dental, and vision insurance for yourself and eligible dependents</li><li>Tuition Reimbursement for qualified courses</li><li>Scholarship opportunities for continued education</li><li>Family leave and paid time off</li><li>Store discount programs (10% off household groceries, free items)</li><li>Discounts to amusement parks, gym memberships, mobile phone plans, etc. </li><li>Employee Assistance Program (free financial, legal, and mental health services)</li><li>Fun work environment where you have the opportunity to nourish your community.</li></ul><p><br></p>The range displayed reflects the range the company reasonably expects to pay for the position. The actual compensation offered to the selected individual(s) will depend on their relevant education, training, or experience, among other bona fide factors.<p><br></p>USD $17.00/Hr.<p><br></p>USD $17.00/Hr.<p><br></p>A Courtesy Team Member is a responsible, friendly person who can safely work in a fast-paced environment and provide excellent customer service.<p><br></p>A Courtesy Team Member’s responsibilities include<p><br></p><ul><li>Bagging customers' groceries in a neat, orderly fashion. Diploma or equivalent.</li><li>Ability to communicate effectively with the public both verbally and in writing.</li><li>Knowledge of medical terminology preferred.</li><li>Knowledge of computer data entry, information retrieval, and Microsoft word preferred. </li><li>Familiarity with Third-Party Reimbursement programs preferred.</li><li>Ability to maintain the highest level of confidentiality when dealing with patient records and personal information.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Who We Are: </strong> The Mission Neighborhood Health Center (MNHC) is a non-profit, multi-site community health organization offering comprehensive health services in the Mission and Excelsior Districts of San Francisco. jobs_titles: Front Desk Enrollment Coordinator, 2023-2024 School Year
describtion: <strong>Job Details</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>School Summary</strong><p><br></p>California Connections Academy is a network of tuition-free public online schools for students in grades K–12. The network of schools is operated by the nonprofit California Online Public Schools and currently includes six schools serving students in 32 counties in California, including Orange and San Joaquin counties. California Connections Academy schools are accredited by the Schools Commission of the Western Association of Schools and Colleges (WASC).<p><br></p><strong><u>Position Summary And Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>Working from our office located in Ripon, CA, the Front Desk Enrollment Coordinator is responsible for daily administrative tasks of the school and charter network, such as answering phones and emails, receiving visitors, assisting the administration and teachers with administrative tasks, filing, generating reports, completing paperwork, mail and shipping tasks, updating and maintaining school and student records (both physical files and electronic), and operating office equipment. This position may also include the potential of limited annual travel for teambuilding and professional development purposes.<p><br></p>The Administrative Assistant will also be a crucial member of the Enrollment Team within the Business Services Department and will also help facilitate the registration process for prospective students, ensuring that families have a seamless and positive experience from initial contact to official enrollment. The Enrollment Coordinator serves as a knowledgeable resource for applicants about California Connections Academy by providing them with information, guidance, and support throughout the enrollment journey. The role of an Enrollment Coordinator is crucial in ensuring that a family’s first interactions and experience with the school is a positive one. By providing exceptional customer service, support, and information, these Coordinators contribute to the school’s overall success and growth, fostering a diverse and engaged student community.<p><br></p><strong><u>Key Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Application Assistance: The Enrollment Coordinator guides prospective families through the application process, assisting them in completing necessary forms, gathering required documents, and ensuring the submission of accurate and complete They offer personalized support to applicants, addressing their questions and concerns promptly and professionally.</li><li>Information Resource: The Enrollment Coordinator is often the first person that prospective families may speak with from the school, and is expected to be able to provide in-depth information about the school’s programs, enrollment requirements, policies, and properly connect families with other school staff to discuss more specific questions or concerns when necessary.</li><li>Collaborative Coordination: The Enrollment Coordinator collaborates with various departments within California Connections Academy to ensure a smooth enrollment process for applicants. They communicate and coordinate effectively with these departments to resolve any enrollment-related issues, track application statuses, and provide timely updates to applicants.</li><li>Data Management: The Enrollment Coordinator maintains accurate and up-to-date records of applicants, including contact information, application materials, and communication history. They will utilize the school’s enrollment systems to track applicant progress, generate reports, and resolve customer issues.</li><li>Document Review: The Enrollment Coordinator may review documents that are submitted during the registration process, and is expected to be knowledgeable about the school’s requirements to ensure that families understand what submissions will be accepted. In instances where traditional documents are unavailable, the Enrollment Coordinator can work with the family to find a solution to allow the application to proceed while still remaining compliant with school policies.</li><li>Withdrawal Support: The Enrollment Coordinator will also assist with required withdrawal tasks when a student exits the These tasks may include providing withdrawal letters to the family and district of residence.</li><li>Front Desk Tasks: These duties include the tasks necessary to help keep the office running smoothly and efficiently. The Front Desk/Enrollment Coordinator will be in charge of answering the main phone line for the Northern California office and routing calls to the appropriate staff member as necessary, mail and shipping duties, operating office equipment and maintaining office supplies, scheduling appointments, various errands outside the office as needed, assist with school events and meetings, and may assist school administration with a wide variety of daily responsibilities.</li><li>Other duties as assigned. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications And Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in a relevant field preferred (such as education, counseling, or business administration) or equivalent work experience.</li><li>Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written, with a strong ability to engage and connect with diverse individuals.</li><li>A customer-focused approach, displaying empathy, patience, and professionalism in all interactions.</li><li>Exceptional organizational skills with the ability to multitask, prioritize, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.</li><li>Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools, Google Apps and web-based applications is essential</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and make informed</li><li>A keen attention to detail to ensure accuracy in data entry and document processing</li><li>Demonstrated ability to work well in a team environment</li><li>Previous experience in educational fields such as enrollment management, admissions, or student services is highly desirable.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Physical Capabilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to carry loads of up to 20 pounds over a distance of several meters on a weekly basis</li><li>Ability to transport loads (with assistance of dolly, cart or co-worker) 25 pounds or more over a distance of 100 meters on an occasional basis</li><li>Ability to move files, documents or supplies around an office space on a daily basis</li><li>Ability to work at a computer work station for 8 hours per day</li><li>Repetitive bending or twisting for a duration of approximately one hour two to five times per week</li><li>Occasional need to ascend a short ladder or step stool</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>California Connections Academy strives to create an inclusive environment that welcomes and values the diversity of the people we serve. We foster fairness, equity, and inclusion to create a workplace environment where everyone is treated with respect and dignity.</strong><p><br></p>This position ranges from $25.00-$28.00 per hour based on relevant education and experience.

<p>Title: Payroll Analyst/Accountant</p><p>Locations: Emeryville, CA</p><p>Pay Rate: $29-31/hour</p><p>Contract: 3 months w/ a high extension or conversion rate</p><p> </p><p>Duties:</p><ul><li>Assist with calculating, processing and validating full cycle, pro-rated and manual payments, supplemental wages, garnishments, tax corrections and adjustments for the bi-weekly payroll cycles for employees working across the U.S. </li><li>Perform cycle, quarter, and year closing audits, complete reconciliation and validate transactions before transmission, including preparing files for next level review and approval.</li><li>Investigate and respond to inquiries from employees and other internal or external sources regarding payroll-related needs.</li><li>Responsible for preparing, validating, and delivering recurrent reports to internal and external partners timely.</li><li>Perform other duties and assignments upon request</li><li>Assist with payroll and benefit reconciliations.</li><li>Coordinate mail distribution for HR team</li></ul><p> </p><p>Requirements:</p><ul><li>Have a comprehensive understanding of fundamental payroll tasks, such as paycheck calculations, taxation principles, preparing ledgers and journals, transfers, journal entries and deposits.</li><li>Have knowledge of payroll and accounting procedures and concepts (Business Unit, General Ledger Journal Entries, GAAP at minimum).</li><li>Have experience in handling transactions for various countries in multiple currencies.</li><li>Understand payroll-related regulations (wage and hour laws, IRS rules regarding supplemental wages, legal guidelines for wage garnishments, etc.).</li><li>Experience in Microsoft Suite, specifically Excel and additionally have experience working in Payroll/HR systems and account reconciliation software.</li><li>High School diploma required</li><li>Bachelors degree preferred</li></ul><li></li>

<strong>IT Technician (SHORT-TERM, TEMPORARY)<br><br>West Valley-Mission Community College District<br><br></strong><strong><u>Definition<br><br></u></strong>Closing Date:<br><br>SHORT-TERM, TEMPORARY STAFF POOL<br><br>This recruitment is being conducted to fill temporary assignments for the upcoming semester that can begin as soon as summer 2023. Applications for Short-Term, Temporary Staff pools are continually accepted (unless otherwise specified) by the District and will be added to the application pool for review by hiring authorities on an as-needed basis. Should you be invited for an interview, you will be contacted by a District representative.<br><br>POSITION DEFINITION<br><br>To perform responsible technical duties related to computer hardware and software customer support and training; provide project support and maintenance for new and modified systems and programs; support server technologies; and to maintain, install, troubleshoot, and configure desktop computers and related peripheral equipment.<br><br><strong><u>Assignment<br><br></u></strong>This is a temporary, hourly position, with possible assignments located at either WVMCCD campus:<br><ul><li>Mission College, Santa Clara, CA</li><li>West Valley College, Saratoga, CA<br></li></ul>Generally, most assignments are Monday-Friday, 8:30am-5:00pm. Hours may vary depending on departmental needs.<br><br><strong><u>Salary And Benefits<br><br></u></strong>$46.45 (hourly)<br><br>Due to the temporary nature of this position, benefits are not included.<br><br><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Any combination of experience and education that would provide the required knowledge and abilities is qualifying. A typical way to obtain the required knowledge and abilities would be:<br><ul><li>Two years of responsible technical information technology experience.</li><li>Equivalent to an Associate’s degree from an accredited college with major coursework degree in information systems or a related field.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Examples Of Duties And Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Duties may include, but are not limited to, the following:<br><ul><li>Coordinate and provide technical support, over the telephone, through email, remotely and/or in person to district personnel; troubleshoot and solve standard software, hardware, voice network, telecommunications and network problems.</li><li>Install, configure, troubleshoot, modify, and update district supported hardware and software as required by area of assignment.</li><li>Configure, maintain, and utilize systems management appliance as required.</li><li>Perform routine component replacements and upgrades as required by area of assignment.</li><li>Provide one-on-one training pertaining to the use of standard applications, equipment and/or systems, such as audio/video equipment, telecommunication equipment and systems, personal computers, laptop computers, mobile devices and general office software.</li><li>Provide first-level and second-level assistance to customers; verify the location of the problem; elicit information from end user on the nature of the issue; resolve issue or refer to higher level staff when necessary.</li><li>Ensure that new and upgraded systems work effectively with current systems and programs; determine and document proper installation parameters for software and hardware in order to ensure smooth integration, transition and efficiency.</li><li>Create user IDs, modify user profiles, re-set passwords, maintain email accounts, email distribution lists and perform regular file maintenance; set up user access permissions consistent with district policies and procedures; document changes and revisions.</li><li>Inform management of existing or potential problems; maintain problem logs; communicate with higher-level staff regarding documentation, testing and scheduling concerns; communicate installation, production and/or testing problems to users and keep them apprised of schedule changes.</li><li>Assist in system moves, adds and changes; review installation sites and plans.</li><li>Adhere to district standards for network and system hardware and software; develop network and system related documentation.</li><li>Perform duties related to asset management of hardware and software related to area of assignment; perform administrative duties such as data entry and billing activities.</li><li>Perform related duties as assigned.<br></li></ul><strong>For more information on this position and to apply, please visit our website at the following link:</strong> wvm.peopleadmin.com<br><br>Applicants who, due to a disability, require accommodations to complete the application, testing or interview process, please contact Human Resources at (408) 741–2174 to arrange for assistance.<br><br><em>West Valley-Mission Community College District is an Equal Opportunity Employer.<br><br></em>Copyright ©2022 Jobelephant.com Inc. jobs_titles: Administrative Floater, Administrative Support Team, Stanford Law School
describtion: The Administrative Services Support Team at Stanford Law School, a premier administrative support unit, has an immediate opening for an Administrative Floater. This position seeks an experienced administrative specialist to provide support for the various law school departments with general administrative needs. The purpose of this position is to provide support for backup needs due to excessive workloads, vacation or other personal leave. The ideal candidate should be comfortable working independently with different groups and changing environments. The successful candidate will also maintain a broad range of administrative and research duties, and is expected to work collaboratively with many departments within the Law School and externally to achieve a broad range of programmatic and academic goals. The position is part of the Administrative Support Team and reports to the Director of Administrative Support Services.<br><br>Stanford Law School, on the campus of one of the world’s leading research universities, offers unmatched opportunities. We are known for our collegial culture, which is intimate and egalitarian. In this close-knit community, collaboration and the open exchange of ideas are essential to life and learning. Students, faculty, staff, alumni — all support and inspire each other to explore, excel and contribute to the world through law.<br><br><strong>Essential Job Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Act on behalf of the supervisor, department manager, or chair in regard to establishing priorities and identifying and resolving problems that are administrative in nature.</li><li>Independent judgment for establishing priorities and identifying and resolving problems relating to faculty or department needs and competing deadlines.</li><li>Oversee and/or perform duties associated with scheduling, organizing, and operating complex conferences, seminars, and events, including arranging with vendors for services, overseeing the production and distribution of materials, administering logistics, and managing event within budget.</li><li>Compose and draft documents and correspondence for presentations, course handouts, grants, conferences, seminars, and reports; perform substantial editing and fact checking. Create, maintain, modify, and/or ensure accuracy of content in various unit documents, displays, reports, brochures, social media, and/or websites.</li><li>Plan and schedule calendar(s) with limited consultation, resolve calendaring conflicts, and arrange travel in compliance with unit, university, and sponsor policies.</li><li>Coordinate complex travel arrangements, both domestic and international, prepare itineraries, and obtain visas and other travel documentation needed. Create complex reports and spreadsheets which may utilize specialized software and systems.</li><li>Oversee and/or process a variety of complex financial transactions; produce, monitor, and reconcile budget statements; research, identify, and resolve discrepancies.</li><li>Research articles, topics, and case law using various internet search engines and research databases.</li><li>Troubleshoot technical requests for computer, printer or application problems; escalate issues to IT as needed.</li><li>Create complex reports and spreadsheets which may utilize specialized software and systems.</li><li>May lead staff or supervise day-to-day work of student and/or temporary workers, including scheduling, assigning, and prioritizing workloads, setting appropriate deadlines, reviewing work for quality and timeliness, and providing performance.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Education And Experience<br><br></strong>High school diploma and four years of administrative experience, or combination of education and relevant experience. Bachelor's degree preferred.<br><br><strong>Knowledge, Skills And Abilities<br></strong><ul><li>Advanced computer skills and demonstrated experience with Microsoft office suite, and email applications, as well as strong internet research and database skills.</li><li>Demonstrated success in following through and completing projects</li><li>Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Excellent grammar, spelling, proofreading skills. </li><li>Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills.</li><li>Establish priorities and handle multiple time-sensitive projects. </li><li>Ability to take initiative and ownership of projects.</li><li>Ability to routinely and independently exercise sound judgment in making decisions.</li><li>Ability to gather, process, analyze and report information. Must be a creative problem solver. </li><li>Knowledge of computer-based research programs such as Lexis or Westlaw. Will be expected to gain working knowledge of Stanford systems, including Oracle, if not already proficient. </li><li>Dependability and strong commitment to professional development and process improvement.<br><br></li></ul>Please submit both a cover letter and resume to be considered for the position.<br><br>Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of the job.<br><br>Stanford is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and is<br><br>committed to recruiting and hiring without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual<br><br>orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other<br><br>characteristic protected by law.

<strong>About Us:</strong><p><br></p>Short Story is an award winning, technology-powered retailer dedicated to petite women 5'4" and under. Our mission is to create a seamless shopping experience for millions of petite women so they can dress with effortless confidence. As a fast-growing startup, we're revolutionizing retail with a data-driven learning system that leverages customer feedback to create exceptional, tailored products. We've been recognized by top publications like Forbes, Fortune and are backed by top institutional investors who share our vision of building the world's next great consumer brand.<p><br></p>At Short Story, we celebrate petiteness, boldness, and modern womanhood. Our culture combines an insatiable hunger for data, an unwavering commitment to creating superior products, and a hustle startup mentality. We have a strong sense of urgency. Since 2019, we've cultivated a team of dedicated problem solvers and fashion enthusiasts. We're excited for you to join us on this exhilarating journey.<p><br></p>Short Story is a brand that celebrates petiteness, boldness, and modern womanhood. Our culture is one that blends an obsession with data, passion for a truly better product, and a scrappy startup mentality. We've been recognized by Buzzfeed, WhoWhatWear, People, and rated the #1 Best Clothing Styling Service by USA Today. We've grown rapidly in the last 2.5 years and have big plans for growth in 2022.<p><br></p>We're hiring several Customer Support Associates to join our CX team. Our ideal candidate is someone who is passionate about startups, ecommerce, consumer brands, and emerging technologies with a focus on doing the right thing for people, clients, and the world.<p><br></p><strong>About the Role:</strong><p><br></p>As part of the Client Experience team, you will ensure our clients have a smooth, delightful experience.<p><br></p><strong>You will be responsible for:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> CX Operations: Responding to and managing client experience inquiries in our various channels</li><li> Ad-Hoc Tasks: Complete ongoing clerical, administrative, and routine tasks to keep our day to day client experience operations running smoothly</li><li> Data Analytics: Track performance on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis by assisting with the collection of data and explaining the "why" of what happens</li><li> User Interviews: Facilitate regular interviews with users to collect feedback and insights to better serve our audience</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong>:<p><br></p><ul><li> 2+ years of experience in customer service</li><li> Fluent English</li><li> Perfect writing</li><li> Familiarity with Slack, Zendesk, Google Sheets</li><li> Attention to detail</li><li> Previous experience working in ecommerce or a tech startup is a plus</li><li> Must be flexible and able to wear many hats</li><li> Able to translate client experience into recommendations</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Schedule and Location:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 40 hours a week (may include some weekend and evening hours)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Type</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Full-time</li></ul>

We have openings for <strong>HOURLY</strong> <strong>($24/HR)</strong> shifts in San Francisco, San Mateo, and Santa Clara counties.<p><br></p><ul><li>WEEKLY PAY, PAID ORIENTATION, PAID TRAINING</li><li>FULL BENEFITS - Includes Medical, Vision, and Dental coverage to every team member who work 20 hours or more a week</li><li>PAID TIME OFF - Start accruing PTO on your first day of work!</li><li>24 HR ON CALL LINE - Be a part of a team that supports you day or night! Gerontologists, nurses and social workers - as well as field supervisors - answer your questions and help you learn new ways to provide excellent care to clients</li><li>EARN SAGE BUCKS - Earn extra TAX Free Dollars $$$ that can be redeemed through the AwardCo Recognition Platform (e-gift cards, Amazon Store)</li><li>CARE PROVIDER REFERRAL BONUS - Earn an extra $500-$1000 when we hire your Caregiver referrals.</li><li>MONTHLY TEAM OUTINGS - MONTHLY TEAM BUILDING EVENTS -Joins us for fun activities held in different parts of the bay.</li><li>QUALITY OF LIFE ACTIVITIES - Learn from our dedicated Hummingbird therapeutic activity specialists assigned to each and every home care client.</li><li>ACCESS TO LIFEWORKS - Employee Assistance Program</li><li>ACCESS TO BENEFITS HUB - Get employee discounts on local deals, tickets and travel!</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Must have at least one year of experience working with a Home Care agency</li><li>Must have experience working with Dementia clients</li><li>Driver highly preferred</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Works closely with Home Care Director to create meaningful activities.</li><li>Closely follows care plan provided by Home Care Director and conducts activity program on a daily basis.</li><li>Observes and monitors the client’s condition, notifying Care Management staff of any significant change in client’s status.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>TEXT "sage" to 650-629-0780 to apply!</strong><p><br></p>Sage Eldercare Solutions has been a premier agency since 2001. We have built a reputation for superior client service dedicated to offering wise eldercare solutions that promote quality of care and quality of life for older adults.<p><br></p>You can read more about us at [www.SageEldercare.com](http://www.sageeldercare.com/)<p><br></p>Check out this 3 minute video to see why care providers and clients appreciate Sage: [https://vimeo.com/277516950](https://vimeo.com/277516950)<p><br></p><em>Sage Eldercare Solutions requires applicants to be fully up-to-date with their vaccinations against COVID-19, including the booster dose, if eligible. We do not make work-related decisions based on any legally protected characteristic or in an unlawful manner. We will engage in a prompt, good faith, interactive process with applicants who require reasonable accommodations. We encourage applicants to initiate this interactive process promptly with Sage whenever such accommodations may be required.</em><p><br></p><em>At Sage Eldercare Solutions we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment and building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. Sage is an equal opportunity employer.</em><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>Cm35hTSqg9

<strong>About The Opportunity</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>The Graduate Admissions Counselor serves as an integral part of the growth of Khoury College of Computer Sciences on the west coast. This position will have an emphasis on building a pipeline for enrollment to the Align Master’s program for students from non-technical backgrounds, in addition to enrollment to the direct entry Master’s programs in computer and data sciences. Align allows intellectually curious students to earn a Master of Science in Computer or Data Science regardless of their undergraduate degree and background. Working as a key member of Khoury’s national recruitment team and under the supervision of the Director of Recruitment Operations, this position is responsible finding prospective domestic students and supporting them throughout the discovery and admissions process, consistently rooted in a strong customer service mindset.<p><br></p>This position will execute on the recruitment strategy in the region by developing a pipeline of prospects by developing relationships with and building a presence at area feeder schools, running local area recruitment events such as preview nights and Break into Tech events, and developing relationships with community groups and organizations that represent our target markets.<p><br></p>This position will track all leads in our CRM, nurture leads as specified by our developed cadence and keep all data up to date in the CRM.<p><br></p>This position will work closely with the Director of Graduate Recruitment in California and other EM recruiters in the region to coordinate outreach and reach economies of scale.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>LEAD GENERATION:<p><br></p><ul><li>Strategize with regional Director of CS and Khoury Recruiting team to execute on regional strategy to build the prospective student funnels. </li><li>Conduct recruiting events in region and and virtually, including webinars, campus visits, and info sessions. </li><li>Support regional and national events. </li><li>Develop and maintain relationships with targeted local universities, community organizations, guidance counselors, and other key influencers.</li><li>Look for creative opportunities to generate net new leads. Implement recruiting strategy at regional level. </li><li>Track all leads in CRM. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Lead Nurture</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Follow up, track and communicate with prospective students through email, phone, text, one on one and group appointments.</li><li>Provide timely response to inquiries all the way to matriculation stage, related to curriculum, scholarship &amp; financial aid, etc., providing excellent customer service, responding to questions as they arise and reaching out proactively.</li><li>Prepare and maintain records and reports related to assigned activities. Maintain student data into systems and run reports and analyze trends in domestic recruitment.</li><li>Actively own prospective records and update records throughout the outreach stages.</li><li>Perform other clerical, office and data entry tasks as needed.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree required. </li><li>3+ years of experience in student recruitment or admissions required. </li><li>Experienced public speaker, comfortable in front of groups big and small. </li><li>Willingness and ability to travel is necessary. </li><li>Ability to work independently, be self-directed, be a good team player and meet goals is critical to success. </li><li>Must be detail oriented and with strong organizational skills.</li><li>Capacity to work a flexible schedule including some evenings and weekends is required. </li><li>Ability to lift at least 20 lbs and move furniture around to set up facilities / rooms for events is required. </li><li>Sales experience a plus. </li><li>Familiarity with CRM (salesforce or slate) is required.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Documents To Submit</strong><p><br></p>Resume and cover letter<p><br></p><strong>About Khoury College</strong><p><br></p>Khoury College is committed to building a diverse and inclusive community among students, faculty and staff. We strongly encourage applicants from underrepresented groups, individuals with disabilities, veterans, and those with diverse experiences and backgrounds. We invite you to join a fast-moving, ambitious college with an underlying mission that is driven by our motto of “CS for Everyone.”<p><br></p>The expected hiring range for this position is USD $58,100 to USD $74,075 based upon the position’s scope and responsibilities.<p><br></p><strong>Position Type</strong><p><br></p>Enrollment<p><br></p><strong>Additional Information</strong><p><br></p>Northeastern University considers factors such as candidate work experience, education and skills when extending an offer.<p><br></p>Northeastern has a comprehensive benefits package for benefit eligible employees. This includes medical, vision, dental, paid time off, tuition assistance, wellness &amp; life, retirement- as well as commuting &amp; transportation. Visit https://hr.northeastern.edu/benefits/ for more information.<p><br></p>Northeastern University is an equal opportunity employer, seeking to recruit and support a broadly diverse community of faculty and staff. Northeastern values and celebrates diversity in all its forms and strives to foster an inclusive culture built on respect that affirms inter-group relations and builds cohesion.<p><br></p>All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.<p><br></p>To learn more about Northeastern University’s commitment and support of diversity and inclusion, please see <em>www.northeastern.edu/diversity</em>.

independently<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Develop efficient and effective qualitative methods, measures, and guidelines to continuously improve quality processes and practices.</li><li>Perform extensive backend (preferably SQL server or other RDBMS) testing, writing medium to complex SQL scripts to validate data between multiple sources.</li><li>Hands on experience with backend database testing along with ability to analyze and test different DB objects (Stored procedures, functions, views) that are used by web applications.</li><li>Management and execution of test scenarios and test cases and, where possible, develop and execute automated test scripts to verify software functionality and adherence to business requirements.</li><li>Experience with reports testing (ex - Tableau) to ensure data credibility and accuracy of insights derived from the BI reports.</li><li>Provide accurate report of test progress to the management team and follow up with development team on defects; participate in root cause analysis discussions for all defects</li><li>Analyze the business requirements, write test scenarios and execute the test cases.</li><li>Meet aggressive deadlines while also ensuring quality changes are released into production</li><li>Efficient in performing data analysis with large datasets and capable of solving analytical comprehension and manipulation</li><li>Manage and execute the creation and distribution of data quality reports.</li><li>Work with development team to correct data quality errors.</li><li>Determine root cause for data quality errors and make recommendations for long-term solutions.</li><li>Resolve all internal data exceptions in timely and accurate manner.</li><li>Comply with the project standards on testing policies, criteria, strategy, and procedure</li><li>Working experience in HealthCare industry is highly <strong>Clinical Research Coordinator 1203266 </strong><p><br></p>A leading University is seeking a Clinical Research Coordinator. The successful candidate will perform duties related to the coordination of clinical studies, coordinate moderately complex aspects of one or more clinical studies, and work under the close direction of the principal investigators and/or study coordinators/supervisors. The ideal candidate has proficiency with Microsoft Office.<p><br></p><strong><u>Clinical Research Coordinator Pay And Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Hourly pay: $26/hr </li><li>Worksite: Leading University (Palo Alto, CA 94304)</li><li>W2 Employment, Group Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Retirement Savings Program, PSL </li><li>40 hours/week, 11 Month Assignment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Clinical Research Coordinator Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Serve as primary contact with research participants, sponsors, and regulatory agencies. Coordinate studies from startup through close-out.</li><li>Determine eligibility of and gather consent from study participants according to protocol. Assist in developing recruitment strategies.</li><li>Coordinate collection of study specimens and processing.</li><li>Collect and manage patient and laboratory data for clinical research projects. Manage research project databases, develop flow sheets and other study-related documents, and complete study documents/case report forms.</li><li>Ensure compliance with research protocols, and review and audit case report forms for completion and accuracy with source documents. Prepare regulatory submissions, and ensure institutional Review Board renewals are completed.</li><li>Assemble study kits for study visits, monitor scheduling of procedures and charges, coordinate documents, and attend monitoring meetings with sponsors, acting as a primary contact.</li><li>Monitor expenditures and adherence to study budgets and resolve billing issues in collaboration with finance and/or management staff.</li><li>Interact with the principal investigator regularly, ensuring patient safety and adherence to proper study conduct.</li><li>Ensure essential documentation and recording of patient and research data in appropriate files per institutional and regulatory requirements.</li><li>Participate in monitor visits and regulatory audits.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Clinical Research Coordinator Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>2 years of related work experience and a 2-year college degree or, </li><li>A Bachelor’s degree in a related field or an equivalent combination of related education and relevant experience.</li><li>Research experience working with participants would be ideal.</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills.</li><li>Proficiency with Microsoft Office.</li><li>Knowledge of medical terminology.</li><li>Organized and good communication skills.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Shift</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Monday to Friday from 08:00 AM to 04:30 PM.</li><li>Occasional evening and weekend hours.</li></ul><p><br></p>Compensation: From $26.00 to $26.00 per hour

<strong>Freight Processor&nbsp;(healdsburg / windsor)</strong>Hawley &amp; Co.<p><br></p><p><span>compensation:&nbsp;$18.00 - $20.00 per hour</span>&nbsp;</p><p><span>employment type:&nbsp;full-time</span>&nbsp;</p><p><span>job title:&nbsp;Freight Processor</span>&nbsp;</p><p>Job description</p><p>Position: Freight Processor</p><p><br></p><p>Job Description:</p><p><br></p><p>The Freight Processor will schedule incoming and outgoing cargo and freight shipments to be transported via truck, train, air, or other means. The Freight Processor will be responsible for 3dcustoms and freight vendor invoices to confirm accuracy in order for the invoice to be processed for payment.</p><p><br></p><p>Essential Duties &amp; Responsibilities:</p><p><br></p><p>· The Freight Processor will be responsible for customs and freight vendor invoices to confirm accuracy in order for the invoice to be processed for payment</p><p><br></p><p>· Specialist will ensure all import/export clearance activities are completed in compliance with applicable government rules and regulations</p><p><br></p><p>· Review freight invoices to validate all necessary backup documentation such as export clearance, PL/Loading information and BL/AWB are included in the invoice packet and confirm billed amount is accurate</p><p><br></p><p>· Maintain shipping files to ensure items that would be required for governmental review are available and file information is listed on the container log for easy reference</p><p><br></p><p>· Communicate with customs agents and freight forwarders on any issues discovered to obtain necessary adjustments prior to submission to AP for processing</p><p><br></p><p>· Review ERP system for processing blocks</p><p><br></p><p>· Supports compliance to policies and procedures to meet requirements of Jacquard Products as well as foreign governments</p><p><br></p><p>· Works directly with service providers to identify improvement opportunities</p><p><br></p><p>· Collects shipping orders from clients.</p><p><br></p><p>· Prepares estimates for postal or freight rates, shipping charges, and tariffs.</p><p><br></p><p>· Chooses appropriate shipping method and prepares bills of lading, invoices, and other shipping documents.</p><p><br></p><p>· Confirms proper import/export documentation and classifies goods into appropriate fee or tariff groups.</p><p><br></p><p>· Facilitates delivery of cargo from clients to the loading platform.</p><p><br></p><p>· Schedules and negotiates transportation of goods with shipping or freight companies.</p><p><br></p><p>· Documents shipment costs and weights.</p><p><br></p><p>· Notifies customers, passengers, or consignees of the arrival of freight or baggage and arranges delivery.</p><p><br></p><p>· Traces and locates lost shipments when necessary.</p><p><br></p><p>· Pick, pull, and pack orders as necessary.</p><p><br></p><p>· Performs other related duties as assigned.</p><p><br></p><p>Qualifications:</p><p><br></p><p>· 2-3 Years of experience in related field</p><p><br></p><p>· Licenses &amp; (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel)</li><li> Able to sit and work with computers for 8 hours a day.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation and Benefits:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> $27-28/hour</li><li> Full insurance package, including medical, dental, vision, and life.</li><li> 401(K)</li><li> PTO and Student Loan Reimbursement Program</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Schedule:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Onsite in our Hayward office</li><li> Monday-Friday, 8:00am-5:00pm</li></ul><p><br></p>If this sounds like an exciting challenge to you, apply now. Stanford University, Department of Neurology and Neurological Sciences is seeking anAdministrative Associate 3 (hybrid)to provide administrative or operational support with limited supervision. May be responsible for leading other administrative staff or subordinates. This position will support a senior faculty member and will provide back-up support to the Department Chair and the Chair’s Executive Assistant.<p><br></p>https://med.stanford.edu/neurology.html<p><br></p><strong>Duties Include</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Act on behalf of the supervisor, department manager, or chair in regards to establishing priorities and identifying and resolving problems that are administrative in nature.</li><li>Oversee and/or perform duties associated with scheduling, organizing, and operating complex conferences, seminars, and events, including arranging with vendors for services, overseeing the production and distribution of materials, administering logistics, and managing event within budget.</li><li>Compose and draft documents and correspondence for presentations, course handouts, grants, conferences, seminars, and reports; perform substantial editing and fact checking. Create, maintain, modify, and/or ensure accuracy of content in various unit documents, displays, reports, brochures, social media, and/or websites.</li><li>Plan and schedule calendar(s) with limited consultation, resolve calendaring conflicts, and arrange travel in compliance with unit, university, and sponsor policies. </li><li>Create complex reports and spreadsheets which may utilize specialized software and systems.</li><li>Oversee and/or process a variety of complex financial transactions; produce, monitor, and reconcile budget statements; research, identify, and resolve discrepancies. May assist with capital or special equipment requests and/or vendor selection.</li><li>Coordinate and monitor routine maintenance services completion. Plan and coordinate office moves and/or minor renovation projects.</li><li>May lead staff or supervise day-to-day work of student and/or temporary workers, including scheduling, assigning, and prioritizing workloads, setting appropriate deadlines, reviewing work for quality and timeliness, and providing performance review input.</li><li> - Other duties may also be assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Desired Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Prior work experience at Stanford University and/or in higher education preferred</li><li>Understanding of the organization of Stanford Medicine or similar academic medical center preferred</li><li>Ability to work independently, prioritize workload and meet strict deadlines</li><li>High level of attention to detail and accuracy.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to act with tact and maintain confidentiality.</li><li>Demonstrated problem solving and analytical skills.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to work well with Stanford colleagues and clients and with external organizations.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education &amp; Experience (required)</strong><p><br></p>High school diploma and four years of administrative experience, or combination of education and relevant experience.<p><br></p><strong>Knowledge, Skills And Abilities (required)</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Advanced computer skills and demonstrated experience with office software and email applications. </li><li>Demonstrated success in following through and completing projects. </li><li>Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. </li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills. </li><li>Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills. </li><li>Ability to prioritize, multi-task, and assign work to others. </li><li>Ability to take initiative and ownership of projects. </li><li>Ability to routinely and independently exercise sound judgment in making decisions</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS*</strong>:<p><br></p><ul><li>Constantly perform desk-based computer tasks.</li><li>Frequently sitting.</li><li>Occasionally stand/walk, reach/work above shoulders, grasp lightly/fine manipulation, grasp forcefully, use a telephone, sort/file paperwork or parts, lift/carry/push/pull objects that weigh up to 10 pounds.</li><li>Rarely twist/bend/stoop/squat, kneel/crawl.</li><li> - Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Work Standards</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Interpersonal Skills: Demonstrates the ability to work well with Stanford colleagues and clients and with external organizations.</li><li>Promote Culture of Safety: Demonstrates commitment to personal responsibility and value for safety; communicates safety concerns; uses and promotes safe behaviors based on training and lessons learned.</li><li>Subject to and expected to comply with all applicable University policies and procedures, including but not limited to the personnel policies and other policies found in the University's Administrative Guide, http://adminguide.stanford.edu </li></ul><p><br></p>The expected pay range for this position is $66,000 to $91,000 per annum.<p><br></p>Stanford University provides pay ranges representing its good faith estimate of what the university reasonably expects to pay for a position. The pay offered to a selected candidate will be determined based on factors such as (but not limited to) the scope and responsibilities of the position, the qualifications of the selected candidate, departmental budget availability, internal equity, geographic location and external market pay for comparable jobs.

Make an extraordinary impact.<br><br></strong>CareMore is a proud member of the Elevance Health family of brands, offering clinical programs and primary care options for seniors. REPORTS TO:Service Manager CLASSIFICATION: Nonexempt<p><br></p>POSITION SUMMARY Cashiers can be under a lot of pressure during busy shifts. It is important that you are always pleasant and efficient.
