Working with us is like working with FAMILY. We promise our Team Members open and honest communication and opportunities for growth with our company. Our leaders lead with passion and purpose, and celebrate you with meaningful recognition. We promote a healthy life balance because we believe your personal well-being is essential.<p><br></p>We have a passion for food, and we share an inspiring vision, “To change the way the world eats, one plate at a time.”<p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive compensation, paid weekly</li><li>Retirement Benefits</li><li>Medical, dental, and vision insurance for yourself and eligible dependents</li><li>Tuition Reimbursement for qualified courses</li><li>Scholarship opportunities for continued education</li><li>Family leave and paid time off</li><li>Store discount programs (10% off household groceries, free items)</li><li>Discounts to amusement parks, gym memberships, mobile phone plans, etc. </li><li>Employee Assistance Program (free financial, legal, and mental health services)</li><li>Fun work environment where you have the opportunity to nourish your community.</li></ul><p><br></p>The range displayed reflects the range the company reasonably expects to pay for the position. The actual compensation offered to the selected individual(s) will depend on their relevant education, training, or experience, among other bona fide factors.<p><br></p>USD $15.75/Hr.<p><br></p>USD $15.75/Hr.<p><br></p>A Courtesy Team Member is a responsible, friendly person who can safely work in a fast-paced environment and provide excellent customer service.<p><br></p>A Courtesy Team Member’s responsibilities include<p><br></p><ul><li>Bagging customers' groceries in a neat, orderly fashion. Verifies prices for cashiers when necessary</li><li>Collect shopping carts from the parking lot, assist customers to their cars with their groceries</li><li>Always maintain a cheerful, helpful attitude toward all customers and other Team Members</li><li>Maintain cleanliness and tidiness of store and restrooms</li><li>Assist with “go backs” and accompany customers to locate items throughout the store</li></ul><p><br></p>Desired qualifications include<p><br></p><ul><li>Friendly and customer service oriented.</li><li>Self-motivated, with a high attention to detail, quality and presentation</li><li>Skills to communicate effectively with coworkers and customers</li><li>Ability to work independently, effectively manage time and multitask in a fast-paced environment</li><li>Ability to read, understand and follow through on verbal and written directions</li><li>Ability to reliably meet required work schedule and adhere to company attendance policy</li><li>MUST BE AT LEAST 16 YEARS OF AGE WITH A VALID WORK PERMIT</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Employees may occasionally experience the following physical demands for an extended period </strong><p><br></p>Standing, Sitting, Lifting + Stocking (Up to 50 lbs.), Pushing, Keyboarding, Telephone Use, Walking, Bending<p><br></p><strong>Must be 18 years of age or 16 years of age with a valid work permit</strong><p><br></p><em>For Internal Transfers/Promotion Candidates</em><p><br></p><ul><li> No disciplinary action during the past 6 months</li><li> Your current leader must recommend that you apply for this position and provide an endorsement upon request from HR.</li><li> You may be asked to accept a part-time position if that is the only position available</li></ul>

<strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>For over 45 years Pathways has been a Bay Area pioneer, leader, and innovator in Hospice, Home Health and Palliative Care. We provide care at home or in settings such as assisted living, a nursing home, or the hospital. We have offices in Sunnyvale, South San Francisco, and Oakland. Patients and their families know us for our personalized, high-quality care, delivered with empathy, kindness, and respect.<p><br></p><strong>TITLE:</strong> Foundation Administrative Associate<p><br></p><strong>SCHEDULE:</strong> M-F (100% Onsite)<p><br></p><strong>HOURS:</strong> 8:30am-5pm<p><br></p><strong>Office Location: </strong>Sunnyvale<p><br></p><strong>(Please include a Cover Letter with your application)</strong><p><br></p>The posted compensation range of $21.19/HR - $29.13/HR is a reasonable estimate that extends from the lowest to the highest pay Pathways Home Health &amp; Hospice in good faith believes it might pay for this particular job, based on the circumstances at the time of posting. Pathways Home Health &amp; Hospice may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range as permitted by law.<p><br></p><strong><u>Position Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>Responsible for the administrative support and office management of the Foundation department, including general administrative and fundraising duties and support, filing electronic and hard copies of documents, performs routine accounting tasks regarding donation processing, and team member and Foundation Board support.<p><br></p><strong><u>Organizational Relationships</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Reports to the Director of Development</li><li>Participates as a member of the Foundation team to support the activities of the team members and Board members as assigned.</li><li>Collaborates with other Pathways’ staff as required for events, grants and special projects</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Areas Of Responsibility</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Administrative Functions</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Responsibility for general administrative duties in the Foundation and observes confidentiality of donors and families Personal Identifiable Information.</li><li>Greets the public and represents the organization in a professional manner in person and on the telephone.</li><li>Responsible for the neat and orderly appearance of all common areas of the Foundation work space including volunteer areas and storage room.</li><li>Creates and maintains systems to ensure office organization.</li><li>Updates and Maintains the Office Procedure Manuals</li><li>Oversees, in conjunction with the IT department, the maintenance of all office equipment, telephone, and information systems.</li><li>Monitors and maintains office supplies and printed materials inventory per established guidelines and as requested.</li><li>Completes routine accounting tasks including processing credit cards, and managing purchase orders, invoices, and expense tracking.</li><li>Uploads critical documents to the appropriate location on the shared drive.</li><li>Responsible for general office filing and storage organization, on-site and off-site.</li><li>Responsible for routine correspondence memos, agendas, documents, minutes, spreadsheets, and proofreading.</li><li>Supports the activities of the Foundation Board and Honorary Board, including preparing minutes, board packets and materials, scheduling meetings, arranging meeting details, and taking minutes.</li><li>Logistical support for department team members, including arranging meetings, preparing materials, taking minutes, and other tasks as directed.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Development And Fundraising Functions</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Monitors obituaries daily and works closely with the Database Manager to apprise them of the information.</li><li>Accurately enters data into the donor databases and produces reports as needed.</li><li>Supports special events as requested.</li><li>Provides administrative and project support and assistance to the Foundation team members as requested.</li><li>Participates on committees as requested.</li><li>Performs other duties as assigned consistent with skills and training and the mission and goals of Pathways.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Three years of progressively responsible administrative support experience. Nonprofit fundraising environment and/or healthcare organization preferred.</li><li>Demonstrated interest in fund development. (fundraising efforts)</li><li>Must have strong interpersonal, communication and customer service skills.</li><li>Must be a proactive self-starter.</li><li>Must demonstrate proficiency with computers, including Microsoft Suite, Google Suite and Adobe.</li><li>Knowledge and experience with donor databases, Raiser’s Edge preferred.</li><li>Must be flexible, well organized, and detail-oriented.</li><li>Excellent time management skills, able to multi-task and maintain efficiency despite distractions and numerous interruptions</li><li>Must demonstrate a positive can-do approach to work.</li><li>The ability to flex their work schedule to meet departmental needs, including occasional evenings and weekends.</li><li>Personal automobile with valid automobile insurance available for work as needed.</li><li>California driver’s license and current automobile insurance with $100,000/$300,000 limits.</li></ul>

jobs_titles: Staff Accountant for Accounts Payable and Payroll
describtion: RDMS is a boutique accounting firm located in Petaluma, CA that focuses on the restaurant &amp; hospitality industry. We are lucky to help independent restaurants navigate the complicated aspects of running their business through strong accounting practices. We are experiencing significant growth and are looking for individuals with experience in Payroll and Accounts Payable processing.<br><br>As a back-office solution for small businesses, we assist our clients in all of their administrative needs and processing invoices/payroll is paramount to good data! We are looking for someone with strong communication skills and strict attention to detail. The right candidate appreciates being part of a team and understands the value they will bring to both our company and the clients they work with.<br><br>We offer flexible (but consistent) hours, a relaxed office environment, the ability for remote work and are focused on accuracy and meeting deadlines.<br><br>Entry level experience in Accounts Payable is a plus for a candidate, but strong academic performance or other relevant in accounting is equally considered. Payroll experience, while valuable, is not required as we will train this skill.<br><br><strong>Reporting To:</strong> Staff Accountant Manager<br><br><strong>Responsibilities – Accounts Payable:<br><br></strong><strong> <br></strong><ul><li> Organize and enter all supplied invoice data utilizing Restaurant365</li><li> Follow-up with vendor communication from statement reconciliation and payment updates</li><li> Preparing check previews and providing firm’s management approved client check runs</li><li> Provides information to vendors and clients, reconciles vendor statements, researches and resolves past due items; researches and resolves account payable questions</li><li> Posts manual checks from client communication to keep vendor accounts up to date</li><li> Prepares the IRS Form 1099 Reports</li><li> Learns responsibilities and functions of the purchasing activities of clients and maintains an eye for transactions that are not typical per client</li><li> Scans and uploads supplied invoices to an internal software program.</li><li> Assist with month end close accounting entries</li><li> Filling, copying, data entry as required for all firm functions<br><br></li></ul><strong>Responsibilities - Payroll:<br></strong><ul><li> Maintain client’s payroll databases for new hires, terminations, direct deposits, manual checks, accruals, garnishments and rate changes utilizing our Workflow Software;</li><li> Assist in auditing time and attendance records and communicating to clients to educate them on our standards and processes</li><li> Importing/entering records into both ADP and Paychex for time and attendance to maintain timely payroll processing</li><li> Submit previews and development audits for our clients to review prior to final submissions</li><li> Maintain the pay period, quarterly and annual folders of payroll reporting per client</li><li> Handle workers comp audit reporting as they occur.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Skills / Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li> Ability to work collaboratively with both clients and teammates</li><li> Ability to manage projects and assignments with extreme accuracy and efficiency: detail oriented</li><li> Excellent communication, organization, analytical, and problem-solving skills</li><li> Introductory knowledge of accounting principles/practices</li><li> Proficient with spreadsheet and word processing applications<br><br></li></ul><strong>Requirements<br></strong><ul><li> An Associate's Degree in accounting, business, finance or related field or equivalent experience is required; Bachelor's Degree preferred</li><li> Prior internship / work experience is a plus</li><li> This position may occasionally require evening/weekend work resulting in overtime</li><li> Background in the restaurant industry is not required (FOH, BOH, Management), however, experience is a plus. A passion for the travel, dining out, wine, craft beer, etc is absolutely part of our corporate culture!!<br><br></li></ul><strong>Compensation<br></strong><ul><li> Hourly: $28 to $32/hr, DOE</li><li> PTO</li><li> 401k Participation</li><li> Medical Benefits</li><li> Paid Holiday and Sick Leave</li><li> Office Outings<br><br></li></ul>If interested, please reply with the following:<br><ul><li> Current resume with cover letter</li><li> Rate requirements - submissions without rate requirements will not be responded to.<br><br></li></ul>Flexible work from home options available.

<strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Looking for a job with an exciting new company that truly puts people before profit? Look no further! iXsystems is a bootstrapped, Silicon Valley company that builds free Open Source software and is expanding its presence in Maryville, Tennessee. We make work fun with things like company team-building events, complimentary food and drinks in the lounge, and a laid-back and flexible atmosphere that allows creativity to thrive. We are big on promoting from within and opportunities to move up in the company are everywhere for high-performers that want to take their careers to the next level.<p><br></p><ul><li>Processes invoices - Promptly records all invoices received. Ensures all recurring disbursements are recorded per accrual accounting standards.</li><li>Manages trade accounts payable using the AP module in SAP and other programs </li><li>Establishes and maintains relationships with new and existing vendors </li><li>Responds to all electronic and voice inquiries within 24 business hours.</li><li>Ensures bills and other payment commitments are processed per department procedures and payments are on time and accurate.</li><li>Cross-checks purchase orders, prices, terms of payment, and other charges. Ensures all payments have been approved per the approval limit policy</li><li>Maintains electronic vendor files</li><li>Tracks and records liabilities for all taxes. Reminds other departments of upcoming renewals, and periodic obligations.</li><li>Maintains 36-39 day DPO, which accounts for all non-standard payment terms. Pays all invoices when due.</li><li>Performs basic accounting tasks such as account maintenance, recording entries, and reconciling the Accounts Payable sub-ledger and general ledger.</li><li>Maximizes use of electronic payments</li><li>Performs quarterly review and maintenance on ACH, wire, and ACH positive pay limits and expiration dates to ensure transactions don't bounce.</li><li>Proactively alerts Purchasing re: disputes, and other issues; </li><li>Processes taxes using states portals </li><li>New Vendors - Collects W9s and 1099-related data from all new vendors</li><li>Participates in cash flow forecast - submits schedule at the beginning of each month and updates weekly</li><li>Partners with Purchasing to get favorable terms and conditions from vendors</li><li>Provides Quarterly and year-to-date updates on purchasing and management of spending trends by the vendor</li><li>Calendars and meets all periodic payable obligations including but not limited to states' income taxes, property tax filings, insurance policy renewals</li><li>Works closely with the rest of the accounting team.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Minimum 5 years experience in working in a similar position.</li><li>Detail-Oriented and Accurate</li><li>Working knowledge of accounting standards</li><li>Understands financial documents</li><li>Excellent basic math skills</li><li>Critical thinking -adheres to rules but is able to work independently</li><li>Proactive problem solver</li><li>Compares vendor invoices with company records and resolves discrepancies</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Base Pay Range</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>The base pay range of this position is $30.25-$33.65 hourly. Additional compensation through the Incentive Bonus Program is available for this position.</li></ul><p><br></p>Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for positions in the job category within which this position falls. The actual offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location, education, and prior experience.<p><br></p>So what are you waiting for? Let’s join forces and spread the word about Open Source software. Send us your resume and apply, and we’ll reach out to you so we can tell you more about the opportunities at iXsystems. We look forward to hearing from you!<p><br></p><strong><u>Equal Employment Opportunity</u></strong><p><br></p>iXsystems, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants in all company facilities without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, pregnancy, childbirth, physical disability, mental and intellectual disability, age, military status or status as a Vietnam-era or special disabled veteran, marital status, registered domestic partner or civil union status, gender (including sex stereotyping and gender identity or expression), medical condition (including, but not limited to, cancer-related or HIV/AIDS-related), genetic information, or sexual orientation in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

companies_names: NCIRE - The Northern California Institute for Research and Education
describtion: <strong>Job Details<br><br></strong><strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong>The Research Assistant II will be acting as the Study Coordinator for a hybrid clinical and research program in respiratory conditions. In addition, the Research Assistant II will also assist with performance of other clinical and research projects, and assist with managing the daily chores and activities of our hybrid clinical and research group.<br><br><strong><u>Essential Functions<br></u></strong><ul><li>Recruit, screen, coordinate visits, monitor, and document the general well-being of participating patients and research subjects during their evaluation.</li><li>Administer detailed respiratory health questionnaires.</li><li>Assist in performing breathing tests such as pulmonary function and cardiopulmonary exercise testing.</li><li>Collect and enter data and maintain an accurate database.</li><li>Process biological samples (including blood as well as other samples such as sputum) via centrifugation, separation of fluid and cell components, storage of the samples in an organized manner in -80 ultracold freezer or liquid nitrogen tank.</li><li>Maintain laboratory supplies, order supplies as needed, and maintain an organized and functional laboratory environment.</li><li>Assist in preparing and maintaining clinical and research regulatory protocol and preparation of standard operating procedures; maintain accurate study protocol; maintain accurate subject records including consents and study participation.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Additional Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Help other group personnel and oversee the daily operations as needed.</li><li>Coordinate efforts with other study sites through remote interaction.</li><li>Coordinate the medical record abstraction of</li><li>Participate in remote weekly and monthly national meetings with other members of the study group.</li><li>Assist PI with recruitment, hiring, and training research assistant(s) and other staff including interns, contractors, and/or consultants as necessary for the project</li><li>Coordinate research project activities ensuring objectives are met and documented in status</li><li>Under the general direction of the PI, investigate new project ideas, conduct literature reviews, produce research summaries and explore new clinical cohorts of</li><li>Design and produce figures and tables for data presentation in manuscripts, abstracts, posters and power point presentations for PI, residents and</li><li>Prepare procedure reports including pulmonary function and cardiopulmonary procedure</li><li>Manage CHR/IRB activities including preparation of new project applications for submission, and revisions/renewals of ongoing</li><li>Prepare and maintain annual progress reports for several funding institutions including NIH, and private<br></li></ul><strong><u>Job Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>BA/BS or higher educational degree such as MS or MPH in life</li><li>At least 1 year experience in clinical care or research coordination and/or study management</li><li>Ability to manage multiple projects, tasks and priorities to achieve desired goals</li><li>Strong organizational and oral and written communication skills</li><li>Computer literacy with full working knowledge of MS Word, Excel, Endnote, Adobe and Pubmed.</li><li>Ability to work independently</li><li>Strong people skills and reliability<br></li></ul><strong><u>Working Conditions/Environment<br><br></u></strong>The work environment for this position is in a medical clinic and research laboratory. It may include some minor annoyances such as noise, temperature variations, etc. The incumbent may sustain posture in standing or seated position and may utilize a computer terminal for prolonged periods of time.<br><br>The hourly range for this position is $23.64-$33.46.

<strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong> Customer Care Representative I, II, III (Full Time &amp; Remote)<br><br>NV/ CA/ AZ <br><br></strong>Tiered Sign-On Bonus: $1000.00 ($500 after training completion (will be defined by the business) and the remaining $500 after 6 months of active employment)<br><br><strong> Build the Possibilities. Make an extraordinary impact. <br><br></strong>CareMore is a proud member of the Elevance Health family of brands, offering clinical programs and primary care options for seniors. We are a team of committed clinicians and business leaders passionate about transforming American healthcare delivery. As a Customer Care Representative, you will be responsible for responding to internal and external customer questions via telephone and written correspondence regarding insurance benefits, provider contracts, eligibility and claims.<br><br><strong><u>How You Will Make An Impact<br></u></strong><ul><li> Analyzes problems and provides information/solutions. </li><li> Operates a PC/image station to obtain and extract information; documents information, activities and changes in the database. </li><li> Thoroughly documents inquiry outcomes for accurate tracking and analysis. </li><li> Develops and maintains positive customer relations and coordinates with various functions within the company to ensure customer requests and questions are handled appropriately and in a timely manner. </li><li> Researches and analyzes data to address operational challenges and customer service issues. </li><li> Provides external and internal customers with requested information. </li><li> Under immediate supervision, receives and places follow-up telephone calls / e-mails to answer customer questions that are routine in nature. </li><li> Uses computerized systems for tracking, information gathering and troubleshooting. Outbound calls are conducted in the ZipDrug business area. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Here’s What Elevance Health Offers<br></u></strong><ul><li> A career path with opportunity for growth </li><li> Ability to obtain your Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree or further your education with tuition reimbursement. </li><li> Affordable Health Insurance, Dental, Vision and Basic Life </li><li> 401K match, Paid Time Off, Holiday Pay </li><li> Quarterly incentive bonus and annual increases plan based on performance. <br></li></ul>At Elevance Health, the team is comprised of the best and the brightest from diverse experiences, cultures, and backgrounds. The differences we each bring to the table are a part of what makes our company so successful.<br><br><strong><u>Minimum Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> Requires a HS diploma or GED </li><li> Previous experience in an automated customer service environment </li><li> Or any combination of education and experience which would provide an equivalent background. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Preferred Skills, Capabilities, And Experiences<br></u></strong><ul><li> A passion for serving others with the ability to be empathetic and the desire to go above and beyond to help resolve members questions at the first point of contact </li><li> A customer advocate willing to listen and find creative solutions to address and resolve customers questions, issues or concerns </li><li> A composed individual able to multi-task, navigating multiple computer applications and working efficiently while communicating and serving the customer </li><li> Must have a strong work ethic and sense of responsibility to your teammates and our members, demonstrated by the simplest things like being on time and available to meet member’s needs, to being accountable for commitments made to customers or others and ensuring follow-ups are completed. </li><li> Flexible and quick learner, willing to adapt to changing customer and business needs. </li><li> Bilingual (Spanish) Preferred <br></li></ul>For candidates working in person or remotely in the below locations, the salary* range for this specific position is $15.50 to $20.00<br><br>Locations: California; Nevada<br><br>In addition to your salary, Elevance Health offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). The salary offered for this specific position is based on a number of legitimate, non-discriminatory factors set by the company. The company is fully committed to ensuring equal pay opportunities for equal work regardless of gender, race, or any other category protected by federal, state, and local pay equity laws.<br><ul><li> The salary range is the range Elevance Health in good faith believes is the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. This range may be modified in the future and actual compensation may vary from posting based on geographic location, work experience, education and/or skill level. Even within the range, the actual compensation will vary depending on the above factors as well as market/business considerations. No amount is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable under the terms and conditions of the applicable policies and plans. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.<br></li></ul>Please be advised that Elevance Health only accepts resumes from agencies that have a signed agreement with Elevance Health. Accordingly, Elevance Health is not obligated to pay referral fees to any agency that is not a party to an agreement with Elevance Health. Thus, any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Elevance Health.<br><br><strong>Be part of an Extraordinary Team<br><br></strong>Elevance Health is a health company dedicated to improving lives and communities – and making healthcare simpler. A Fortune 20 company with a longstanding history in the healthcare industry, we are looking for leaders at all levels of the organization who are passionate about making an impact on our members and the communities we serve. You will thrive in a complex and collaborative environment where you take action and ownership to solve problems and lead change. Do you want to be part of a larger purpose and an evolving, high-performance culture that empowers you to make an impact?<br><br>We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, and incentive bonus programs (unless covered by a collective bargaining agreement), medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, stock purchase plan, life insurance, wellness programs and financial education resources, to name a few.<br><br>The health of our associates and communities is a top priority for Elevance Health. We require all new candidates in certain patient/member-facing roles to become vaccinated against COVID-19. If you are not vaccinated, your offer will be rescinded unless you provide – and Elevance Health approves – a valid religious or medical explanation as to why you are not able to get vaccinated that Elevance Health is able to reasonably accommodate. Elevance Health will also follow all relevant federal, state and local laws.<br><br>Elevance Health has been named as a Fortune Great Place To Work in 2022, has been ranked for five years running as one of the 2023 World’s Most Admired Companies by Fortune magazine, and is a growing Top 20 Fortune 500 Company. To learn more about our company and apply, please visit us at careers.ElevanceHealth.com. Elevance Health is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, citizenship status, color, creed, disability, ethnicity, genetic information, gender (including gender identity and gender expression), marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other status or condition protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact ability@icareerhelp.com for assistance.

jobs_titles: Research Compliance Analyst 3 (6230U), Research Admin & Compliance - #56348 - 56348
describtion: <strong><u>About Berkeley</u></strong><p><br></p>At the University of California, Berkeley, we are committed to creating a community that fosters equity of experience and opportunity, and ensures that students, faculty, and staff of all backgrounds feel safe, welcome and included. Our culture of openness, freedom and belonging make it a special place for students, faculty and staff.<p><br></p>The University of California, Berkeley, is one of the world’s leading institutions of higher education, distinguished by its combination of internationally recognized academic and research excellence; the transformative opportunity it provides to a large and diverse student body; its public mission and commitment to equity and social justice; and its roots in the California experience, animated by such values as innovation, questioning the status quo, and respect for the environment and nature. Since its founding in 1868, Berkeley has fueled a perpetual renaissance, generating unparalleled intellectual, economic and social value in California, the United States and the world.<p><br></p>We are looking for equity-minded applicants who represent the full diversity of California and who demonstrate a sensitivity to and understanding of the diverse academic, socioeconomic, cultural, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, and ethnic backgrounds present in our community. When you join the team at Berkeley, you can expect to be part of an inclusive, innovative and equity-focused community that approaches higher education as a matter of social justice that requires broad collaboration among faculty, staff, students and community partners. In deciding whether to apply for a position at Berkeley, you are strongly encouraged to consider whether your values align with our Guiding Values and Principles , our Principles of Community , and our Strategic Plan .<p><br></p>At UC Berkeley, we believe that learning is a fundamental part of working, and our goal is for everyone on the Berkeley campus to feel supported and equipped to realize their full potential. We actively support this by providing all of our staff employees with at least 80 hours (10 days) of paid time per year to engage in professional development activities. To find out more about how you can grow your career at UC Berkeley, visit grow.berkeley.edu .<p><br></p>Departmental Overview<p><br></p>Research Administration and Compliance (RAC) is the administrative office at UC Berkeley responsible for facilitating and ensuring campus compliance with federal, state, and university regulations pertaining to research administration, including policies governing research animal care and use , human research subjects protection , financial conflict of interest in research , and grants and contracts administration .<p><br></p>Application Review Date<p><br></p>The First Review Date for this job is: August 2, 2023<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Reviews complex research protocols when applying federal regulations, state regulations, and University policies to ensure and document compliance.</li><li>Provides guidance on preparing and revising research agreements</li><li>Determines appropriate level of review.</li><li>Applies research compliance professional concepts to review and pre-review complex research protocols, as well as documentation of research.</li><li>Communicates with researchers and provides guidance on how to resolve particular issues and meet requirements of external regulatory bodies, and properly documents these actions in accordance with all applicable laws, regulations, policies, and procedures.</li><li>Classifies and analyzes disclosures related to conflicts of interest.</li><li>Understands and coordinates complex disclosure cases where multiple policies can impact a single project.</li><li>Trains individuals and departments on relevant compliance processes, forms, and policies.</li><li>Classifies and analyzes international export controls on commodities.</li><li>Performs restricted party screening (RPS) as appropriate.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Demonstrated self-discipline and sound, independent judgment in completing complex assignments.</li><li>Thorough knowledge and ability to apply all relevant Federal, state, and university regulations, policies, and federal guidance documents.</li><li>Thorough knowledge and experience with quantitative and qualitative research design; scientific research concepts and terminology.</li><li>Demonstrated proficiency in public speaking, and writing.</li><li>Conflicts of Interest: Understanding of equity/stock options, consulting agreements, and other corporate documents related to research and analysis of potential Strong communication and teamwork will be vital in this role. Though you would be starting out as a Customer Service Rep, there is plenty of opportunity to move up in Management here on the Gaia Team!<br><br><strong>Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Schedule: Monday - Friday 8:30 am - 5 pm</li><li>Greet and engage clients with a positive demeanor when they’re Will Calling materials</li><li>Answer phone calls while providing excellent customer service</li><li>Respond to email inquiries in a timely fashion</li><li>Conduct stock checks, order placements, and send confirmations</li><li>Perform data entry and up keep on daily logs</li><li>Follow up with clients on open orders and cancellations of unneeded orders</li><li>Schedule delivery routes efficiently and confirm deliveries</li><li>Assist the outside sales team by providing general information about products and services to clients and potential dealers</li><li>Have open communication with management to remain updated on new products, policies, and services</li><li>Perform other duties as assigned.<br><br></li></ul> <strong>Requirements:<br></strong><ul><li>High School Diploma</li><li>Customer Service Experience (At least 1 year)</li><li>Knowledge of the Google Suite, Gmail, and MS Office Suite</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Great time management skills with the ability to prioritize work</li><li>Strong organizational skills</li><li>General computer and virtual skills</li><li>US Work Authorization<br><br></li></ul> <strong>Benefits:<br></strong><ul><li>Health, Vision, Dental Insurance </li><li>Paid time off</li><li>Holiday pay</li><li>401k with 4% employer match </li><li>Employee discount</li><li>Extensive opportunity for promotion within! <br><br></li></ul><strong>**Gaia is an equal opportunity employer.**</strong>

describtion: <strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Hourly Rate of $18.00 an Hour</strong><p><br></p><strong>HIRING IMMEDIATELY!</strong><p><br></p><strong>Perks - PAID WEEKLY! Employee discount, flexible schedule</strong><p><br></p><strong>About Us!</strong><p><br></p>Follett is a fast-paced, innovative team that serves over half the students in the US! Help us deliver a superior campus experience with state-of-the-art digital content, course materials and merchandise at your campus.<p><br></p><strong><u>About The Role</u></strong><p><br></p>As a Season Retail Sales Associate, you will be interacting with students with a commitment to delighting our customers in our vibrant store culture in any or all the following ways, working the cash register, stocking shelving, processing on-line orders, shipping, and receiving and other tasks that may be needed.<p><br></p>This is a seasonal position at the campus bookstore that may require you to have availability to work on a weekly basis. This period could be anywhere from a few days to no longer than 90 days with occasional weekends, and flexibility in scheduling for opening, midday, or closing shifts during our Fall Rush.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Do</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Operate cash register, accepting cash, credit or financial aid payments.</li><li>Carry and straighten merchandise, stock shelves, price merchandise and may assist in setting up displays and signs.</li><li>Pick, process and pack orders for shipping</li><li>May provide customer service/sales functions for special events (including but not limited to graduation and athletic events)</li><li>Support a store environment where all associates and customers are welcome</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Must be a minimum of 18 years of age to be considered for employment.</li><li>Strong customer service skills including effective communication.</li><li>Ability to stand on your feet for the length of your shift</li><li>Ability to lift 25-50 lbs regularly with or without reasonable accommodations</li><li>Computer literacy.</li><li>Ability to prioritize and organize workload.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>Previous retail, customer service or clerical experience<p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Information</u></strong><p><br></p>All candidate information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines

We are here to revolutionize the tile industry. By implementing an innovative online platform paired with an unmatched product and customer service, we've made it easier than ever to shop for beautiful, sustainable tile sourced and handcrafted in the USA. Our tireless commitment to innovation, transparency and sustainability have not gone unrecognized. We've had the honor of making the 2015 &amp; 2016 Inc. 5000 list as one of the fastest-growing private companies in the U.S. and are the only tile company recognized as a for how we use business as a force of good. With an innovative product, an ambitious team, and an inspiring mission, we're changing the way you think about tile.<p><br></p>We are currently looking for a fantastic Customer Support Specialist to strengthen our fast-growing, dynamic team. You’ll be on the front line, helping our customers and sales team achieve success. We’re talking about someone passionate about helping others and supporting a great team (it also helps if you love interior design or tile!). We are a fun company and we want to work with people who love life &amp; love their job.<p><br></p>We provide competitive compensation that includes a base hourly wage + company bonus play + stock options, health and wealth benefits, other perks, a rich culture, continued professional development through ongoing training, experimenting, and opportunities to grow within the organization. The pay range for this role is $20 - $22 an hour.<p><br></p>The Role<p><br></p><ul><li>Represent our brand and story to our customers. First and foremost, you will be evangelizing who we are and what we make to our customers when speaking with them. This role is part of a superstar team that answers phone calls, emails, text messages, and website chat.</li><li>Assist our commercial &amp; residential sales teams with any and all needs that they may have including data entry of sample requests and orders, order tracking, coordination of shipping or other logistics information, processing payments, and providing service excellence for any post-shipment follow-up.</li><li>Confidently support our customers in the tile buying process from initial product questions to installation disasters ensuring full customer satisfaction. </li><li>Use our Salesforce.com platform to drive customer satisfaction and support sales.</li><li>Support our organization in any other necessary way - will do whatever it takes to make our sales team and customers love you and love us.</li><li>Hybrid work structure where employees can work remotely or from the office (Aromas, CA), as needed based on the demands of specific tasks.</li></ul><p><br></p>You're a Great Fit if You...<p><br></p><ul><li>Want a foot in the door at a company with an innovative and entrepreneurial culture.</li><li>Want to support a sales organization that focuses on selling in a way that meets the needs of today's customers.</li><li>Are resourceful, confident in your abilities to connect with people, and want to learn and grow with a team.</li></ul><p><br></p>What We're Looking For<p><br></p><ul><li>Have 1+ years of background providing world-class customer service in a retail or hospitality environment, call center or help desk.</li><li>Have excellent verbal and written communication skills with an ability to communicate with a wide variety of professional groups.</li><li>Have knowledge of (or desire to learn) tile materials and installation process for ceramic and glass tiles.</li><li>Wicked strong computer skills</li><li>Salesforce.com experience a plus.</li></ul><p><br></p>We're building a diverse and inclusive work environment where we learn from each other. We welcome people of diverse backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and a fun/all-in place to work. We offer full benefits coverage, PTO, 401(k) match, maternity/paternity leave, life insurance and disability, employee stock options, and more. Come join the team at Fireclay!<p><br></p>If you require a reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to people@fireclaytile.com<p><br></p>

<p>Please send resume in WORD format should you be interested in the following Administrative Specialist position located in San Francisco, CA. This is a full-time, direct-hire position with a salary between 80-90K with awesome benefits. If you’re not interested, please forward to your colleagues as we do pay referral fees.</p><p> </p><p><strong>Job Title: </strong>Administrative Specialist</p><p><strong>Location: </strong>San Francisco</p><p><strong>Salary:</strong> 80-90K</p><p><strong>Eligible for OT</strong>: YES</p><p><strong>Degree Required: </strong>HIGHLY PREFERRED</p><p><strong>Work Environment:</strong> Hybrid (3 days in office/2 days remote)</p><p> </p><p>The Administrative Specialist provides administration, organizational, technical, and project-based support to the Co-Managing Partner, as well as other attorneys and other legal personnel time permitting.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Responsibilities include but are not limited to:</strong></p><p> </p><ul><li>Scheduling meetings and coordinating all aspects of those meetings, including but not limited to creating/editing PowerPoint slides and other information.</li><li>Managing the Co-Managing Partner’s Outlook calendar.</li><li>Coordinating in-person and video meetings; including, reserving conference rooms, ordering meals, arranging for any IT equipment needed (i.e. laptop, projector, audio/video equipment), sending Outlook meeting requests, greeting clients, checking in guests in the lobby for large meetings, etc.</li><li>Accurately coordinating travel arrangements via the firm’s Travel department.</li><li>Processing expenses in Chrome River for expense reimbursements.</li><li>Updating attorneys’ contact lists as well as preparing, editing, and proofreading routine correspondence.</li><li>Editing client prebills as directed and processing client billing in accordance with firm policies and procedures (in coordination with the Billing department).</li><li>Assisting with ad hoc projects in coordination with other departments such as Finance &amp; Accounting, Information Technology, Marketing, Talent, HR, etc. to accomplish assigned projects. </li><li>Setting up new client matters; completing client label requests, requesting on-site/off-site client files from the firm’s Information Governance and Conflicts &amp; Client Intake departments.</li><li>Performing a variety of administrative responsibilities to develop systems and processes to manage the work efficiently as well as providing general support as assigned. </li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Qualifications: </strong></p><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum of three (3) years of legal support experience in a professional work environment. </li><li>Two-year degree or equivalent experience considered.</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Office required including PowerPoint and Excel. Proficiency in iManage or a comparable document management system is a plus.</li><li>Ability to clearly and effectively communicate, in oral and written form, with individuals at all levels within the Firm and outside the Firm.</li><li>Demonstrate a high level of attention to detail and pride in high quality deliverables.</li><li>Must have the ability to multi-task and prioritize in a fast-paced environment using good judgment.</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills to build successful working relationships and to work within a team environment exhibiting the ability to collaborate effectively as well as work independently </li><li>Exceptional client service, both internal and external.</li><li>Ability to perform responsibilities with tact, diplomacy, discretion and respect for confidentiality and diversity. </li><li>Ability to work additional hours, as necessary.</li></ul><li></li>

Patreon is the best place for creators to build memberships by providing exclusive access to their work and a deeper connection with their communities. We’re building a content and community platform where creators can engage directly with their fans and monetize their creativity, while maintaining full ownership over the work they make and the communities they create.<br><br>We’re leaders in the membership space with 250,000+ active creators and over $3.5 billion paid directly to creators on our platform. Our team is building tools to optimize the creator-to-fan relationship, including native video, enhanced podcasting features, improved creation tools, and new community experiences. We’re continuing to invest heavily in building the most talented team in the Creator Economy and are looking for a <strong>Data Engineer</strong> to support our mission.<br><br>This role is available to those wishing to work in our SF and NY offices on a hybrid work model or those wishing to be fully remote in the United States.<br><br><strong>About The Role<br><br><br></strong><ul><li>Work on a tight-knit team of highly motivated and experienced data engineers with frequent collaboration with data scientists, product managers and product engineers.</li><li>Work on both “data analytics” and “data infrastructure” type projects in a fast-paced, high-growth startup environment.</li><li>Build core data sets and metrics to power analytics, reports and experimentation.</li><li>Write real-time and batch data pipelines to support a wide range of projects and features including our creator-facing analytics product, executive reporting, FP&amp;A, marketing initiatives, model training, data science analytics, A/B testing, etc.</li><li>Help manage and build out our data platform and suite of data tools.</li><li>Be a driver of a data-centric culture at Patreon. Work autonomously on large green field initiatives and help define data best practices at the company.<br><br></li></ul><strong>About You<br><br><br></strong><ul><li>Expert in SQL, Spark and Python or Scala</li><li>Significant experience modeling data and developing core data sets and metrics to support analytics, reports and experimentation. Solid understanding of how to use data to inform the product roadmap.</li><li>Enjoy collaborating with Data Scientists, Product Managers and Product Engineers. Comfortable playing the role of a Project Manager in order to drive results.</li><li>Have previously built real-time and batch data pipelines using tooling such as Airflow, Spark, Kafka, S3, Fivetran, Census, etc. Experience working with event tracking frameworks, data observability frameworks and experimentation frameworks.</li><li>Experience managing and working with Data Warehouses and Data Lakes such as Redshift, Big Query, Snowflake, Delta Lake, etc.</li><li>Highly motivated self-starter that is keen to make an impact and is unafraid of tackling large, complicated problems and putting in the work to ensure high craft deliverables.<br><br></li></ul><strong>About Patreon<br><br><br></strong>Patreon powers creators to do what they love and get paid by the people who love what they do. Our team is passionate about making this mission and our core values come to life every day in our work. Through this work, our Patronauts:<br><br><ul><li>Put Creators First | They’re the reason we’re here. When creators win, we win. ****</li><li>Build with Craft | We sign our name to every deliverable, just like the creators we serve. </li><li>Make it Happen | We don’t quit. We learn and deliver. </li><li>Win Together | We grow as individuals. We win as a team. <br><br></li></ul>We hire talented and passionate people from different backgrounds across the organization. If you’re excited about a role but your past experience doesn’t match with every bullet point outlined above, we strongly encourage you to apply anyway. If you’re a creator at heart, are energized by our mission, and share our company values, we’d love to hear from you.<br><br>Patreon is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other protected class.<br><br>Patreon offers a competitive benefits package including and not limited to salary, equity plans, healthcare, unlimited paid time off, company holidays and recharge days, commuter benefits, lifestyle stipends, learning and development stipends, patronage, parental leave, and 401k plan with matching.<br><br>The posted range represents the expected salary range for this job requisition and does not include any other potential components of the compensation package, benefits and perks previously outlined. Ultimately, in determining pay, we'll consider your experience, leveling, location and other job-related factors.<br><br>San Francisco Pay Range<br><br>$139,000 — $193,500 USD

<strong>Job ID:</strong> 227599<p><br></p><strong>Location Name:</strong> CA-FSC SF Off (0174)<p><br></p><strong>Address:</strong> 525 Market St, 4th Floor, San Francisco, CA 94105, United States (US)<p><br></p><strong>Job Type:</strong> Full Time<p><br></p><strong>Position Type:</strong> Regular<p><br></p><strong>Job Function:</strong> Information Technology<p><br></p><strong><u>Company Overview</u></strong><p><br></p>At Sephora we inspire our customers, empower our teams, and help them become the best versions of themselves. We create an environment where people are valued, and differences are celebrated. Every day, our teams across the world bring to life our purpose: to expand the way the world sees beauty by empowering the Extra Ordinary in each of us. We are united by a common goal - to <strong>reimagine the future of beauty</strong>.<p><br></p><strong><u>The Opportunity</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Your role at Sephora:</strong><p><br></p>As a Data Engineer at Sephora, you will: Gather requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, business process descriptions, business analysis and workflow analysis. Perform data migration from Enterprise data warehouse to new data platform. Create source to Stage and Stage to Target data mapping documents indicating the source tables, columns, data types, transformation required and business rules to be applied. Collect and analyze business data to develop solutions. Write SQL queries to analyze large datasets and resolve business engineering needs. Analyze and report on computer systems application implementation using Cognos, Tableau, SQL, and Big Data (Hive). Work with Tableau testing on mobile and web platforms. Define aggregation logic for new reporting requests. Analyze new source ingestion required for migration. Develop production support architecture, design, configuration, customization, integration and user acceptance testing. Work on multiple computer systems engineering projects using Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Agile development methodologies. (Position allows some work-from- home flexibility, with schedule to be approved by manager. Must be able to work on site as required).<p><br></p><strong><u>We Are Excited About You If You Have</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s or foreign equivalent degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Information Systems.</li><li>Three (3) years of experience in data engineering and business analytics.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Experience Must Include</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Azure Databricks</li><li>Agile</li><li>SDLC</li><li>Microsoft SQL server</li><li>Cognos, SSAS Cube</li><li>Kafka</li><li>Tableau</li><li>Data analysis and mapping, data profiling, functional and data testing. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Salary:</strong> $141,000 to $155,000 per year depending on experience<p><br></p>Please visit our career website for additional information about our benefits package<p><br></p><strong>While at Sephora, you’ll enjoy… </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>The people. You will be surrounded by some of the most talented leaders and teams – people you can be proud to work with. </li><li>The learning. We invest in training and developing our teams, and you will continue evolving and building your skills through personalized career plans.</li><li>The culture. As a leading beauty retailer within the LVMH family, our reach is broad, and our impact is global. It is in our DNA to innovate and, at Sephora, all 40,000 passionate team members across 35 markets and 3,000+ stores, are united by a common goal - to reimagine the future of beauty.</li></ul><p><br></p>You can <strong>unleash your creativity</strong>, because we’ve got disruptive spirit. You can <strong>learn and evolve</strong>, because we empower you to be your best. You can <strong>be yourself</strong>, because you are what sets us apart. <strong><em>This</em>, is the future of beauty. Reimagine your future, at Sephora.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Sephora is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company.</strong> We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military/veteran status, or disability status. Sephora is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities.<p><br></p>Sephora will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law.

describtion: Laguna Games is the developer of Crypto Unicorns, the #1 NFT project on Polygon, and now one of the fastest-growing games. We are looking to hire an experienced Data Engineer to join our team. You are self-motivated, goal-orientated, and a strong team player. As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the data infrastructure that supports our gaming platform. You will work closely with our product, engineering, and data science teams to collect, process, and analyze large amounts of data generated by our gaming platform to inform our business decisions and improve user experience. You will work and innovate at the forefront of web3 gaming, bringing together unique technologies to deliver a new gaming experience.<p><br></p>As a Data Engineer at our Web3 Gaming Startup, Key Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Develop and maintain the data pipeline that ingests, processes and stores large amounts of data generated by our gaming platform</li><li>Design and build scalable data solutions that support the real-time analytics and reporting needs of the business</li><li>Collaborate with the product, engineering and data science teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions to improve user engagement, retention and monetization</li><li>Build and maintain data models, data warehouses and data marts to support business intelligence and reporting needs</li><li>Ensure data quality, integrity and security across all data sources and systems</li><li>Monitor and optimize data performance and scalability, and identify and resolve any data-related issues and bottlenecks</li><li>Keep up-to-date with the latest trends, tools and technologies in data engineering and apply them to improve our data <strong>About Amino - What We Do</strong><p><br></p>At Amino, we are a leading innovator in healthcare, empowering individuals to take charge of their healthcare journey. Our powerful digital tools help navigate and unlock the full potential of health plan options. With Amino's cutting-edge solutions, health plan members can easily understand and make informed decisions about their benefits, considering factors such as available programs, provider network quality, and cost.<p><br></p>We are excited to announce that we have recently secured additional funding to fuel our growth and continue developing market-leading navigation tools. As part of this journey, we are looking for a talented and driven Data Engineer to join us. You will play a vital role in helping millions of people understand and optimize their health plan options.<p><br></p><strong>The Role</strong><p><br></p>As a Data Engineer at Amino, you will be at the heart of our organization. Your primary responsibilities will involve processing, transforming, and organizing large and complex datasets that power our products. We are expanding our data sources and enhancing our current offerings, and we need a Data Engineer to help us build competitive and compliant healthcare guidance products.<p><br></p><strong>Key Priorities and Projects:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborate with Product Managers, Architects, and senior leadership to translate high-level requirements into detailed plans. </li><li>Integrate new data sources from vendors and internal systems into our ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) pipelines. </li><li>Enhance our editorial tools for creating and maintaining accurate data about health entities. </li><li>Modernize our orchestration infrastructure using open-source tools like dbt and Dagster. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Impact you will have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Revamp and expand critical data pipelines that drive our existing and future products. </li><li>Mentor other junior data engineers and share your expertise. </li><li>Collaborate closely with data scientists and software engineers in related teams. </li><li>Influence the foundational aspects of data modeling and warehousing, benefiting various teams across the company. </li><li>Utilize modern data stack technologies to build the foundation for Amino's next-generation data assets. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Technologies you will work with:</strong><p><br></p>Snowflake, Python 3, dbt, Docker, AWS, Looker, Databricks, Spark, Jenkins CI/CD, Airflow, Dagster, Terraform, PostgreSQL, RDS, Elasticsearch, and Kinesis.<p><br></p><strong>Skills and Experience you should possess:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Familiarity with various relational and non-relational databases. </li><li>Proficiency in writing clean and well-tested code using Python. </li><li>Experience handling and working with large datasets and the associated tools. </li><li>Previous exposure to ETL pipelines and familiarity with data modeling and data warehousing best practices (experience with dbt is preferred). </li><li>Strong collaboration and feedback skills, with a willingness to seek and incorporate input from others. </li><li>Excellent documentation and verbal communication skills, capable of conveying technical concepts to peers and non-technical stakeholders. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Skills:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience handling PHI or PII</li><li>Deep understanding of the healthcare domain, particularly with healthcare claims data. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>We offer</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>We're committed to helping you achieve your best work in a supportive, growth-oriented environment. We have seriously big goals, and expectations are high and we'll equip you with the tools and resources you need to be successful. </li><li>Expected base salary: $150k to $180k plus standard company benefits and a generous option grant. Amino values transparency and has included the reasonable estimate of the base salary range for this full-time role at any approved US location. Individual pay is determined by a range of factors, including job-related skills, experience, relevant education or training, licensure or certifications, and other business and organizational needs. Amino does not typically hire at or near the top of a salary range. </li><li>We offer full-time employees 100% paid employee healthcare premiums; dependent premium coverage depends on the plan. </li><li>401(k) and FSA programs</li><li>This position, like all roles at the firm, will have a good deal of autonomy. We're a remote-first team and have designed our culture for a balance of synchronous and asynchronous work with people operating from all over the country. To support your remote office, we provide every new Amino with a generous office set-up allowance plus a monthly stipend for internet/phone. </li><li>PTO is non accrual and we expect Amino's to take a minimum of 15 days a year. </li></ul><p><br></p>We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We know the reputation and track record that the tech industry has, and work hard to be exceptional in this regard.<p><br></p><strong>Our Culture</strong><p><br></p>We are a small team who believes that success is a group activity. You should expect to learn from everyone at Amino, and be excited to share your knowledge. You will play a big part in influencing the shape of the product and be empowered to provide your thoughts and ideas.<p><br></p>We believe in collaboration, respect, and curiosity. We believe in having a growth mindset, and have a passion for solving problems that have never been faced before. Everyone's input is valued, be it about code, data models, business models, or product ideas.

Miles is a universal rewards app empowering anyone to earn miles automatically for all forms of travel and commute. You can then redeem your miles from amazing brands such as HP, Garmin, Pandora, Chewy, Home Chef, Buffalo Wild Wings, Wayfair, Sam’s Club and many more.<p><br></p>Similar to a frequent flyer program, but for all forms of transportation, Miles delivers value for every mile traveled, across every mode of travel, anywhere in the world. Whether by car (as a driver, passenger, or rideshare), plane, train, subway, bus, boat, bicycle, or on foot, the Miles app effortlessly awards users’ travel - regardless of where their journey takes them. Miles can be saved or redeemed at any time - with the value increasing every month as more merchants accept them as a form of payment.<p><br></p>Miles is a Silicon Valley-based startup with backing from prominent VCs (Porsche, Scrum, Panasonic, and Urban.us). Join the Miles family and be part of this revolutionary program!<p><br></p>Miles Engineering<p><br></p>You will be working with a great team from diverse backgrounds in a collaborative and supportive environment. Scheduling/orchestrating pipelines using Databricks and Airflow</li><li>Expertise with data querying (SQL, Redshift, Spark) and analyzing billions of rows of data points</li><li>Familiarity with SQL, especially within cloud-based data warehouses like Snowflake, Google BigQuery, and Amazon Redshift</li><li>Strong understanding of relational DB such as MySQL/PostgreSQL, document-based storage systems such as MongoDB or CouchDB, key-value stores (Memcached, Redis), Column-oriented stores (HBase, Cassandra), graph-oriented stores; their distinct advantages, disadvantages, and trade-offs</li><li>Experience building machine learning, statistical and analytical models, and tuning parameters</li><li>Experience designing experiments and extracting insights</li><li>Knowledge of various ETL techniques and frameworks</li></ul><p><br></p>Bonus points<p><br></p><ul><li>You have worked extensively with location and trip data at scale</li><li>Specialization in spatiotemporal clustering in the presence of noise</li><li>Prior startup experience</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive salary based on experience</li><li>Opportunity to create impact in a high-growth startup environment</li><li>401K program with company matching to help you invest in your future</li><li>Employee healthcare benefits include medical, dental, vision insurance</li><li>Paid time off + sick days</li><li>Work-from-home Fridays</li><li>Wellness Day - One additional holiday each month for employee wellness</li><li>Employee Referral bonus</li><li>Daily office meals and a fully stocked kitchen</li><li>Monthly team-building activities and happy hours</li><li>Stock in an early-stage, fast-growing startup company</li></ul><p><br></p>Our Commitment to Inclusivity and Diversity<p><br></p>Miles is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse environment where people of every background can thrive and feel welcome. We consider applicants without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, marital, veteran, or physical or mental disability status.

As a Data Engineer for our Data Platform Engineering team you will join skilled Scala/ Spark engineers and core database developers responsible for developing hosted cloud analytics infrastructure (Apache Spark-based), distributed SQL processing<p><br></p>frameworks, proprietary data science platforms, and core database optimization. This team is responsible for building the automated, intelligent, and highly performant query planner and execution engines, RPC calls between data<p><br></p>warehouse clusters, shared secondary cold storage, etc. This includes building new SQL features and customer-facing functionality, developing novel query optimization techniques for industry-leading performance, and building a database<p><br></p>system that's highly parallel, efficient and fault-tolerant. This is a vital role reporting to exec leadership and senior engineering leadership<p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p>Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Writing Scala code with tools like Apache Spark + Apache Arrow + Apache Kafka to build a hosted, multi-cluster data warehouse for Web3</li><li>Developing database optimizers, query planners, query and data routing mechanisms, cluster-to-cluster communication, and workload management techniques</li><li>Scaling up from proof of concept to “cluster scale” (and eventually hundreds of clusters with hundreds of terabytes each), in terms of both infrastructure/architecture and problem structure</li><li>Codifying best practices for future reuse in the form of accessible, reusable patterns, templates, and code bases to facilitate meta data capturing and management</li><li>Managing a team of software engineers writing new code to build a bigger, better, faster, more optimized HTAP database (using Apache Spark, Apache Arrow, Kafka, and a wealth of other open source data tools)</li><li>Interacting with exec team and senior engineering leadership to define, prioritize, and ensure smooth deployments with other operational components</li><li>Highly engaged with industry trends within analytics domain from a data acquisition processing, engineering, management perspective</li><li>Understand data and analytics use cases across Web3 / blockchains</li></ul>Skills &amp; Qualifications<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related technical field. Masters or PhD a plus</li><li>6+ years experience engineering software and data platforms / enterprise-scale data warehouses, preferably with knowledge of open source Apache stack (especially Apache Spark, Apache Arrow, Kafka, and others)</li><li>3+ years experience with Scala and Apache Spark (or Kafka)</li><li>A track record of recruiting and leading technical teams in a demanding talent market</li><li>Rock solid engineering fundamentals; query planning, optimizing and distributed data warehouse systems experience is preferred but not required</li><li>Nice to have: Knowledge of blockchain indexing, web3 compute paradigms, Proofs and consensus mechanisms... is a strong plus but not required</li><li>Experience with rapid development cycles in a web-based environment</li><li>Strong scripting and test automation knowledge</li><li>Nice to have: Passionate about Web3, blockchain, decentralization, and a base understanding of how data/analytics plays into this</li></ul>

<strong>Data Engineer</strong><p><br></p><strong>About Booster</strong><p><br></p>At Booster, we believe the world deserves better energy solutions to power the movement of people and things. Our mobile energy platform enables us to simplify the market's access to energy. We deliver conventional and renewable fuels directly to fleet vehicles nationwide, lowering carbon emissions, reducing costs, and providing access to sustainable fuels. At a time when the urgent desire to transition to a more sustainable energy future is far outpacing the development of infrastructure, Booster provides a critical solution for Amazon, Imperfect Foods, UPS, Zum, and hundreds of other customers — no filling stations, truck stops, or off-route trips required. We believe in elevating standards around energy and the environment and are committed to helping our customers seamlessly convert to sustainable energy alternatives while reducing their energy consumption. After all, taking a more holistic approach to sustainability drives value for our employees, customers, and the communities where we live, work and play.<p><br></p><strong>About The Role</strong><p><br></p>Booster is looking for a Data Engineer to join our Data team. The Data team uses data to give visibility to the company and execs, smarter business decisions, and enable efficiencies in our products. We do this by providing accurate, actionable analysis, building sophisticated data science products, and by maintaining a reliable data infrastructure. We are looking for a Data Engineer that is excited about owning and maintaining reliable data infrastructure that is built to scale with a growing business. You will work with every part of the company and a wide variety of data sources. We've implemented an ELT data stack using tools like Airflow,Fivetran, Segment, dbt, Postgres, Circle CI ,Git and Looker<p><br></p><strong>What You Will Be Doing</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Apply a consistent data modeling philosophy to our data warehouse that balances stakeholder requirements, interpretability, and performance</li><li>Help create a roadmap for the next iteration of our data warehouse and its downstream dependencies</li><li>Review engineering specifications to ensure measurement and analytics requirements are met</li><li>Help translate business requirements into feature requests for engineering</li><li>Help create a roadmap to develop infrastructure and tooling to support use of our data outside of Looker by data analysts and data scientists</li><li>Build, maintain, and optimize the backend of our business intelligence tool (we use Looker) </li><li>Develop tooling, testing, and processes to ensure our data infrastructure will be robust and observable</li><li>Write custom ETL scripts or automate tasks using Python </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You Should Already Have</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>4+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role </li><li>Strong Python and SQL skills (experience using dbt and BigQuery is a plus)</li><li>Experience applying data modeling philosophies and aware of their tradeoffs</li><li>Experience using git for version control and collaboration</li><li>Experience working with CI / CD to test and deploy code </li><li>Experience using Airflow to orchestrate data pipelines</li><li>Experience working with cloud services (we use GCP)</li><li>You are open and willing to help others learn and look to learn from others, as well </li><li>You make thoughtful recommendations that consider impact, urgency, and long term implications and know when to say no</li><li>An ability to drive projects forward with strong communication and stakeholder management skills</li><li>Ability to thrive in a fast-moving, evolving, and high growth environment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What makes Booster different? </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Cutting edge tech: We're building the world's first unified energy network </li><li>Competitive medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance coverage for employees! </li><li>Unlimited PTO and up to 12 weeks of parental leave </li><li>Stock Options at a fast-growing startup with strong VC backing</li></ul><p><br></p>Salary Range - $157,000 - $213,000<p><br></p><strong>Check us out!</strong><p><br></p><strong>The Disruptive Voice Podcast, Fueling the Energy Transition: </strong><strong>A Conversation with Frank MyCroft</strong><p><br></p><strong>CNBC</strong>, Booster is Best in Business 2022, Timmy Awards Best Tech for Good San Francisco Bay Finalist 2022, <strong>Forbes Top Startup Employers 202</strong>2, <strong>Women in Trucking's 2022 Top Companies for Women to Work for in Transportation</strong>, Forbes Top Startup Employers 2021, and more.<p><br></p>Connect with us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram<strong>! </strong><em>Individuals seeking employment at Booster are considered without regards to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, age, physical or mental disability or medical condition (except where physical fitness is a valid occupational qualification), genetic information, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state or local laws.</em><p><br></p><em>Booster does not discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant.</em><p><br></p><em>Disclaimer: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by associates assigned to this classification.
