<strong>Job Title: Data Engineer:</strong><p><br></p>We are seeking a Data Engineer to design, build, and maintain the infrastructure necessary for the automated storage, processing, and analysis of measurement data and design information. As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for the entire lifecycle of data pipeline development. This includes working with small, manually generated input datasets with a wide variety of formats, and later developing highly automated and rigorously defined pipelines. In addition, you will drive the adoption of data format specifications from manufacturing suppliers, as well as adhere to data format specifications from customers.<p><br></p>The Test Team is responsible for systems that collect measurements for the Design Teams (R&amp;D, product development), Manufacturing and Operations (quality control screens), and Reliability Teams (product qualification, ongoing reliability testing). You will collaborate with Test Engineers to automate raw-to-parametric data processing in hands-off pipelines and provide Python tools and frameworks for data producers and consumers. This opening is our second Data Engineer on the team. Code for extracting and storing parameters from raw data has been written by many different stakeholders in many different styles, but within Ayar Labs Engineering you will find a collaborative atmosphere with people eager to help our new data engineering development efforts succeed in owning and developing this code into uniform, scalable, professionally maintained systems.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Developing, maintaining, and scaling data pipelines: Designing, developing, and maintaining ETL pipelines to extract data from various sources, transform it, and load it into a data warehouse or other data storage systems.</li><li>Building and maintaining data infrastructure: Designing and maintaining data storage and processing systems such as databases, data lakes, and data warehouses.</li><li>Ensuring data quality and integrity: Ensuring the accuracy, consistency, and reliability of the data by developing and implementing data validation and testing strategies.</li><li>Collaborating with data scientists and analysts: Working closely with data scientists and analysts to understand their data needs and help them to access and analyze data effectively.</li><li>Automating data processing tasks: Developing automation scripts to perform routine data processing tasks, such as data cleaning, data transformation, and data loading.</li><li>Implementing data security and access controls: Ensuring the security and privacy of data by implementing data access controls, data encryption, and data masking.</li><li>Staying up-to-date with the latest technologies: Keeping up-to-date with the latest technologies, trends, and best practices in data engineering and applying them to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of data processing and analysis.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or similar with emphasis on Data Engineering; OR Bachelor’s degree in Applied Physics, Engineering, or similar with 3 years of experience in a Data Engineering role</li><li>Experience processing test and measurement data from electronic engineering, photonics, or similar; and meeting requirements of internal data customers in R&amp;D, product engineering, or manufacturing</li><li>Proficiency in Python, NumPy, Pandas, git.</li><li>Experience with Extract, Transform, Load and/or Extract, Load, Transform paradigms.</li><li>Baseline proficiency with statistical analysis.</li><li>Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL tools.</li><li>Excellent communication and collaboration skills - must be able to present plans, gather feedback, and proactively seek information relevant to assigned projects.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferences</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Familiarity with Dagster or other data orchestration tools</li><li>Proficiency with SQL and relational database systems</li><li>Domain-specific knowledge in electronics or photonics test and measurement, or background in electronic or photonic experiments.</li><li>Experience with MongoDB.</li><li>Familiarity with cloud computing platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.</li><li>If you are a Data Engineer with a passion for building and maintaining data infrastructures, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.</li></ul><p><br></p>Salary Range: $115K to $142K<p><br></p><strong>Note To Recruiters</strong><p><br></p>Principals only. We are not accepting resumes from recruiters for this position. Remuneration for recruiting activities is only applicable subject to a signed and executed agreement between the parties. Please don’t send candidates to Ayar Labs, and do not contact our managers.<p><br></p><strong>About Ayar Labs</strong><p><br></p>At Ayar Labs we’re about to revolutionize computing by moving data with light. We’re unleashing processing power for artificial intelligence, high performance computing, cloud and telecommunications by removing the bottlenecks created by today’s electrical I/O -- making it possible to continue scaling computing system performance. Ayar Labs is the first to deliver an optical I/O solution that combines in-package optical I/O chiplets and multi-wavelength remote light sources to replace traditional electrical I/O. This silicon photonics-based I/O solution enables chips to communicate with each other from millimeters to kilometers, to deliver orders of magnitude improvements in latency, bandwidth density, and power consumption.<p><br></p>With our strong collaborations with industry leaders and government, our deep ties to MIT and UC Berkeley, and our commitment to hiring the best engineers in photonics and electronics, joining our team gives you the opportunity to collaborate with renowned experts on challenging, paradigm-shifting work.<p><br></p>We are passionate about delivering in-package optical I/O at scale, leveraging the strength of our patent portfolio and our team of leading interdisciplinary experts. We believe that deep cross-collaboration between teams facilitated by honest, open debate is the best way to drive innovation and achieve big wins. Join our team and experience the possibilities.<p><br></p><strong>Resources</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Executives from Intel and GLOBALFOUNDRIES share their thoughts on Ayar Labs and the promise of in-package optical I/O (video)</li><li>Ayar Labs in the News and Recent announcements</li><li> LinkedIn and Twitter</li></ul><p><br></p>Ayar Labs is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and is strongly committed to all policies which will afford equal opportunity employment to all qualified persons without regard to age, national origin, race, ethnicity, creed, gender, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

<strong>ABOUT RETOOL: </strong><p><br></p>At Retool, we're changing the way software is built. We've developed the fastest way to build internal tools, saving companies time, resources, and engineering bandwidth. Whether it's refunding orders, underwriting loans, managing marketplaces, rolling out new features, analyzing transactions, or providing customer support, Retool makes it dramatically faster and easier to build internal tools that teams need. We believe that the future of software development lies in being a force multiplier for developers and technical builders, helping them move considerably faster building a lot more software. We're looking for highly collaborative people as we build a world-class team to support this mission and we'd love for you to join us!<p><br></p><strong>WHY WE'RE LOOKING FOR YOU:</strong><p><br></p>Retool is a fast-growing company with quickly evolving business needs. We're looking to hire engineers to help us build out our data ecosystem to serve the needs of our business today and for broader scale years from now. We're looking for someone who is ready to get their hands dirty, is motivated by having an impact on the business, and is constantly curious. This is the right role for someone who thrives while making sense of the blurry space that is data at a high growth startup.<p><br></p><strong>WHAT YOU'LL DO:</strong><p><br></p>You'll design and build a foundation that strengthens Retool's data culture at scale. You'll take on projects that solidify Retool's reporting capabilities and help the company remain data-driven. You'll develop and scale ingestion infrastructure, optimize our ETLs, and design our data architecture for scale, with a keen eye for data warehouse management and tooling. You'll also take on ownership of our data stack to ensure that your teammates are able to access the data they need to make decisions and technical teams are able to quickly implement events. We've already built out a solid stack on top of Segment, Databricks, DBT, and of course, Retool, but we need your help to ensure it scales with the company as our user base grows.<p><br></p><strong>WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH:</strong><p><br></p>You'll work with stakeholders across the business, including data scientists, finance, marketing, engineering, product, operations, and support. You'll be joining a broader team of Retools who are passionate about serving our customers, enjoy collaborating to build an incredibly innovative product, and enjoy swapping stories. If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you!<p><br></p><strong>IN THIS ROLE, YOU'LL:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Architect and scale a modern data platform that will be used internally by all of Retool</li><li>Build and maintain scalable ETL pipelines to efficiently process and transform large volumes of data from source systems into our data warehouse</li><li>Work with our engineering teams to ensure robust instrumentation across areas of the product</li><li>Partner with business stakeholders to synthesize and develop requirements for core tables</li><li>Implement monitoring and observability to guarantee data quality and consistency</li><li>Articulate and implement best practices around ingestion frameworks and data pipeline development</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>THE SKILLSET YOU'll BRING: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Background in Data Engineering, 5+ years of experience building and maintaining scalable data infrastructure, including distributed processing solutions (e.g. Spark), cloud-based data lakes and warehouses (e.g. Databricks, Snowflake, BigQuery), workflow management (e.g. Airflow, Luigi), and data transformation tools (e.g. DBT) </li><li>Experience using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) to automate data infrastructure provisioning and management (i.e. Terraform)</li><li>Experience implementing and defining best data practices at scale</li><li>Experience proactively identifying opportunities to improve ETL &amp; dashboard performance and cost</li><li>Excellent business acumen with the ability to translate stakeholder requirements into data models</li><li>Proficiency with common git workflows and at least one programming language (e.g. Python, Scala, Java)</li><li>A solution-oriented growth mindset. You'll need to be a self-starter and thrive in a dynamic environment</li><li>A bias towards communication and collaboration with business and technical stakeholders</li><li>Quantitative rigor and systems thinking</li></ul><p><br></p>Retool offers generous benefits to all employees. For more information, please visit the benefits and perks section of our careers page!<p><br></p>At this time, Retool is only set up to employ in the US and UK.

Work Location: Sunnyvale, California<p><br></p>iHealth is dedicated to empowering healthier lives. As a pioneer of digital health from Silicon Valley, iHealth was founded in 2010 and launched the world's first Bluetooth-connected blood pressure monitor that worked with iOS devices. Through more than a decade of development, by integrating its FDA-approved, award-winning consumer medical devices and remote patient monitoring platform, iHealth has established a digital health ecosystem, the Unified Care model , for healthcare providers to manage chronic diseases remotely. To date, iHealth is one of the top brands in digital health &amp; wellness and has expanded its Unified Care model to 13 states with significant clinical outcomes in hypertension and diabetes management.<p><br></p>During the first year of COVID-19 pandemic, iHealth was actively supporting the fight against COVID-19 by being one of the leading manufacturers of thermometers, shipping millions of them to its customers.<p><br></p>On November 5th, 2021, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) for over the counter (OTC) sale of iHealth's COVID-19 Antigen Rapid Test. iHealth has since been a major supplier of at-home tests to the federal government, state governments, nonprofit organizations, and individuals.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Our company is going through a transformation from a traditional home-health device business to a nimble, (epidemiological) demand data-driven, service-oriented, outcome-centric health technology company. Data science and automation are the tools that we employ to facilitate this transformation.<p><br></p><ul><li> Design, develop, and optimize data pipelines and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to efficiently collect and process large-scale healthcare data from diverse sources. </li><li> Build and maintain scalable data architecture, data warehousing, and data integration solutions to support analytics, reporting, and machine learning applications. </li><li> Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and implement solutions that meet their needs. </li><li> Ensure data quality, integrity, and security by implementing appropriate data governance practices, validation rules, and access controls. </li><li> Identify and implement performance optimizations to enhance the efficiency and speed of data pipelines and processing workflows. </li><li> Monitor and troubleshoot data infrastructure issues, ensuring high availability and reliability of data systems. </li><li> Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry best practices in data engineering and contribute to the continuous improvement of data engineering processes and tools. </li><li> Document technical specifications, data flows, and process workflows to facilitate knowledge sharing and ensure system maintainability. </li></ul><strong> Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Data Engineering, or a related field. </li><li> Strong experience in designing and implementing scalable data pipelines, ETL processes, and data integration solutions. </li><li> Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala, and expertise in SQL for data manipulation and transformation. </li><li> Solid understanding of data modeling concepts, relational databases, and distributed systems. </li><li> Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or Kafka, and cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP). </li><li> Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and technologies (e.g., Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery). </li><li> Knowledge of data governance practices, data security, and privacy regulations (e.g., HIPAA) is a plus. </li><li> Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex data requirements and develop efficient solutions. </li><li> Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.</li></ul>

CI/CD</li><li>Monitoring and metrics-gathering (e.g. Datadog, NewRelic, Cloudwatch, etc)</li><li>Proficiency with git and working on a shared codebase</li><li>Excellent documentation skills</li><li>Self motivation and a deep sense of pride in your work</li><li>Passion for the outdoors</li><li>Comfort with ambiguity, and an instinct for moving quickly</li><li>Humility, empathy and <strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Constructor.io powers product search and discovery for some of the largest retailers in the world. We serve billions of requests every week, and you’ve probably seen our results somewhere and used our product without knowing it. We differentiate ourselves by focusing on metrics over features, and reinventing search and discovery from the ground up as a machine learning challenge with the specific goal of improving metrics like revenue. We’re approximately doubling year over year despite the market slow down and have customers in every eCommerce vertical. We’re a passionate team of technologists who love solving problems and want to make our customers’ and coworkers’ lives better. We value empathy, openness, curiosity, continuous improvement, and are excited by metrics that matter. We believe that empowering everyone in a company to do what they think is best can lead to great things.<p><br></p>Merchant Intelligence Team<p><br></p><strong><u>The Goal Of The Merchant Intelligence Team Is To</u></strong><p><br></p>An important part of our product is the Customer dashboard that helps merchandizers to analyze and impact user behavior. We provide a number of tools for them to influence which products and product attributes should and will receive more attention to create value for their business.<p><br></p><ul><li>Help merchandizers achieve their e-commerce goals, increasing satisfaction with their sites and retention of customers.</li><li>Provide insights to merchants they can't get anywhere else.</li><li>Become a critical point of merchant team planning, decision making, and evaluation so we become a sticky part of their organization.</li></ul><p><br></p>Challenges you will tackle<p><br></p><ul><li>Deliver new reports and tools for merchandizers and analysts from e-commerce companies.</li><li>Improve the existing dashboard experience by building analytics that provide insights to improve KPIs.</li><li>Perform data exploration and research user behavior.</li><li>Implement end-to-end data pipelines to support realtime analytics for important business metrics.</li><li>Take part in product research and development, iterate with prototypes and customer product interviews.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You are proficient in BI tools (data analysis, building dashboards for engineers and non-technical folks).</li><li>You are an excellent communicator with the ability to translate business asks into a technical language and vice versa.</li><li>You are excited to leverage massive amounts of data to drive product innovation &amp; deliver business value.</li><li>You're familiar with math statistics (A/B-tests)</li><li>You are proficient at SQL (any variant), well-versed in exploratory data analysis with Python (pandas &amp; numpy, data visualization libraries). Big plus is practical familiarity with the big data stack (Spark, Presto/Athena, Hive).</li><li>You are adept at fast prototyping and providing analytical support for initiatives in the e-commerce space by identifying &amp; focusing on relevant features &amp; metrics.</li><li>You are willing to develop and maintain effective communication tools to report business performance and inform decision-making at a cross-functional level.</li><li>Stack: python, numpy, pandas, SQL, pyspark, flask, docker, git</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Unlimited vacation time -we strongly encourage all of our employees take at least 3 weeks per year</li><li>A competitive compensation package including stock options</li><li>Company sponsored US health coverage (100% paid for employee)</li><li>Fully remote team - choose where you live</li><li>Work from home stipend! We want you to have the resources you need to set up your home office</li><li>Apple laptops provided for new employees</li><li>Training and development budget for every employee, refreshed each year</li><li>Parental leave for qualified employees</li><li>Work with smart people who will help you grow and make a meaningful impact</li></ul><p><br></p>Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at Constructor<p><br></p>At Constructor.io we are committed to cultivating a work environment that is diverse, equitable, and inclusive. <p><strong>The Company:<br><br></strong></p><p>Personal Capital is a leading digital wealth management company, founded in 2009. We’re on a mission to transform financial lives through technology and people, providing both insight-driven advice with free financial tools and personalized wealth management from 200+ registered financial advisors across the country. Personal Capital has raised $315 million in capital from accomplished financial and strategic investors (IVP, Venrock, Crosslink, Corsair, Blackrock, BBVA, USAA, IGM/Power) to disrupt the traditional $30 trillion U.S. wealth management market. Our free personal finance app is utilized by over two million users, helping them track over $840 billion of their personal finances, all in one place. Our award-winning apps paved the way for our advisory firm, which now manages over $12 billion in personalized investment portfolios for American families. Personal Capital is headquartered in Redwood Shores with offices in San Francisco, Denver, Dallas and Atlanta.<br><br></p><p> <br><br></p><p><strong>The Opportunity:<br><br></strong></p><p>You will play a critical role on the Data and Analytics team, responsible for transforming data from disparate systems to provide insights and analytics for business stakeholders. divisions.<br><br></p><p><strong>Qualifications:<br><br></strong></p><ul><li>Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science or equivalent.</li><li>At least 7 years of post-degree professional integrations such as Kinesis, Firehose, Aurora Unload, Redshift, Spectrum, Elastic Mapreduce, SageMaker and Lambda</li></ul><ul><li>Experience in mentoring junior team members through code reviews and recommending adherence to best practices</li><li>Deep understanding of writing test cases to ensure data quality, reliability and high level of confidence</li></ul><ul><li>Track record of advancing new technologies to improve data quality and reliability</li><li>Continuously improve quality, efficiency, and scalability of data pipelines </li></ul><ul><li>Expert skills working with SQL queries, <strong><u>Company Overview</u></strong><p><br></p>DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives.<p><br></p>What you'll do<p><br></p>DocuSign is seeking a talented and results-oriented Senior Data Engineer to focus on delivering trusted data to the business. The Senior Data Engineer delivers data for analytics using our Enterprise Data Warehouse, enabling the global DocuSign analytics community via curated, governed and cleansed data. As a member of the Global Data and Analytics team, the Data Engineer leverages a variety of technologies to accomplish this goal, ranging tools like Airflow, Matillion, dbt, Snowflake and Fivetran to languages like SQL and Python. The successful candidate will develop solutions with innovative cloud technologies, work on a variety of fast-paced assignments, and partner with world-class technical and business teams to maximize the value of data.<p><br></p>This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Manager, Data Analytics.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibility</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Build data pipelines using Fivetran, dbt/Matillion, Snowflake and Airflow</li><li>Develop and maintain data documentation including ERD, data dictionaries, data lineage and metadata</li><li>Ensure data quality and integrity by implementing appropriate data validation and cleansing techniques</li><li>Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines to identify and resolve issues in a timely manner</li><li>Build POCs to validate new concepts and new technologies </li><li>Collaborate with business, engineering, and data science teams to understand their data needs and design efficient solutions to support their requirements</li></ul><p><br></p>Job Designation<p><br></p><strong>Hybrid:</strong> Employee divides their time between in-office and remote work. Access to an office location is required. (Frequency: Minimum 2 days per week; may vary by team but will be weekly in-office expectation)<p><br></p>Positions at DocuSign are assigned a job designation of either In Office, Hybrid or Remote and are specific to the role/job. Preferred job designations are not guaranteed when changing positions within DocuSign. DocuSign reserves the right to change a position's job designation depending on business needs and as permitted by local law.<p><br></p>What you bring<p><br></p><strong>Basic</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Information Systems, relevant field or equivalent work experience </li><li>8+ years of relevant experience </li><li>Experience with database and data warehouse concepts such as facts and dimensions to design and develop data models that support enterprise reporting and analytics needs </li><li>5+ years of dimensional and relational data modeling experience </li><li>Experience with modern data integration and transformation tools such as Fivetran, Dbt, and Matillion</li><li>Experience with workflow orchestration tools such as Airflow </li><li>Experience with MPP databases like Snowflake, Redshift and BigQuery </li><li>Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure and GCP </li><li>Experience with versioning tools like git </li><li>Experience working with tools like Jira and Confluence </li><li>Experience with SQL and Python </li><li>Experience with document and data debugging</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to work independently with minimal supervision, as well as in a team environment </li><li>Excellent communication skills </li><li>Eye for detail, good data intuition, and a passion for data quality </li><li>Comfortable working in a rapidly changing environment with ambiguous requirements </li><li>Organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines</li></ul><p><br></p>Wage Transparency<p><br></p>Based on applicable legislation, the below details pay ranges in the following locations:<p><br></p>California: $130,500 - $208,050 base salary<p><br></p>Illinois and Colorado: $123,700 - $174,700 base salary<p><br></p>Washington and New York (including NYC metro area): $123,700 - $184,275 base salary<p><br></p>This role is also eligible for bonus, equity and benefits.<p><br></p>Life at DocuSign<p><br></p><strong>Working here</strong><p><br></p>DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agreeable for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal.<p><br></p>We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better than we found it. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.<p><br></p><strong>Accommodation</strong><p><br></p>DocuSign provides reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in job application procedures. If you need such an accommodation, including if you need accommodation to properly utilize our online system, you may contact us at accommodations@docusign.com.<p><br></p>If you experience any technical difficulties or issues during the application process, or with our interview tools, please reach out to us at taops@docusign.com for assistance.<p><br></p>Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice<p><br></p>States Not Eligible for Employment<p><br></p>This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming.<p><br></p>

<strong>About Us</strong><p><br></p>Constructor.io powers product search and discovery for some of the largest retailers in the world. We serve billions of requests every week, and you’ve probably seen our results somewhere and used our product without knowing it. We differentiate ourselves by focusing on metrics over features, and reinventing search and discovery from the ground up as a machine learning challenge with the specific goal of improving metrics like revenue. We’re approximately doubling year over year despite the market slow down and have customers in every eCommerce vertical. We’re a passionate team of technologists who love solving problems and want to make our customers’ and coworkers’ lives better. We value empathy, openness, curiosity, continuous improvement, and are excited by metrics that matter. We believe that empowering everyone in a company to do what they think is best can lead to great things.<p><br></p>Merchant Intelligence Team<p><br></p>An important part of our product is the Customer dashboard that helps merchandizers to analyze and impact user behavior. We provide a number of tools for them to influence which products and product attributes should and will receive more attention to create value for their business. The goal of the Merchant Intelligence team is to:<p><br></p><ul><li>Help merchandizers achieve their e-commerce goals, increasing satisfaction with their sites and retention of customers</li><li>Provide insights to merchants they can't get anywhere else</li><li>Become a critical point of merchant team planning, decision making, and evaluation so we become a sticky part of their organization</li></ul><p><br></p>Challenges you will tackle<p><br></p><ul><li>Deliver new reports and tools for merchandizers and analysts from e-commerce companies</li><li>Improve the existing dashboard experience by building analytics that provide insights to improve KPIs</li><li>Perform data exploration and research user behavior</li><li>Implement end-to-end data pipelines to support realtime analytics for important business metrics</li><li>Take part in product research and development, iterate with prototypes and customer product interviews</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You are proficient in BI tools (data analysis, building dashboards for engineers and non-technical folks)</li><li>You are an excellent communicator with the ability to translate business asks into a technical language and vice versa</li><li>You are excited to leverage massive amounts of data to drive product innovation &amp; deliver business value</li><li>You're familiar with math statistics (A/B-tests)</li><li>You are proficient at SQL (any variant), well-versed in exploratory data analysis with Python (pandas &amp; numpy, data visualization libraries). Big plus is practical familiarity with the big data stack (Spark, Presto/Athena, Hive)</li><li>You are adept at fast prototyping and providing analytical support for initiatives in the e-commerce space by identifying &amp; focusing on relevant features &amp; metrics</li><li>You are willing to develop and maintain effective communication tools to report business performance and inform decision-making at a cross-functional level</li><li>Stack: python, numpy, pandas, SQL, pyspark, flask, docker, git</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Unlimited vacation time -we strongly encourage all of our employees take at least 3 weeks per year</li><li>A competitive compensation package including stock options</li><li>Company sponsored US health coverage (100% paid for employee)</li><li>Fully remote team - choose where you live</li><li>Work from home stipend! We want you to have the resources you need to set up your home office</li><li>Apple laptops provided for new employees</li><li>Training and development budget for every employee, refreshed each year</li><li>Parental leave for qualified employees</li><li>Work with smart people who will help you grow and make a meaningful impact</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at Constructor</strong><p><br></p>At Constructor.io we are committed to cultivating a work environment that is diverse, equitable, and inclusive. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome individuals of all backgrounds and provide equal opportunities to all applicants regardless of their education, diversity of opinion, race, color, religion, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or affiliation in any other protected group.

Job type: Full-time position. Location: Mountain View, CA<p><br></p>What inspires you? This is the question that drives most career decisions.<p><br></p>Is it working with a fantastic team that is dedicated to a common goal? Is it the ability to make a significant impact on the success of a product and company? Perhaps it is to contribute to a product that ignites the creativity of content creators, small businesses, educators, and schoolchildren worldwide?<p><br></p>We have an immediate opening for a <strong>Senior Data Engineer.</strong> You will be working within the Analytics team at WeVideo to help build out and grow our data infrastructure. The team plays a central role in shaping the data ecosystem in our company, and enables business performance by providing users across the company with the insights, tools, infrastructure, and consulting to make data-driven decisions. Our org is hungry for data and needs you to help us get to the next level.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Do In This Role</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Be the lead engineer that builds and automates data pipelines for our Product data, as well as enable Data Integration projects.</li><li>Develop and improve the technical architecture of current data warehouse (BigQuery)</li><li>Design data models optimized for aggregation, visualization and advanced analytics (machine learning)</li><li>Design, implement and maintain data pipelines from beginning to end. Our Product data pipeline is high velocity and we need to re-architect it using Apache Kafka. Our Business data pipes are standard fare, and we use ‘modern data stack’ tooling (ELT, reverse ETL, DBT, self-serve BI)</li><li>Facilitate data integrations and write optimized data transformations in SQL/Python</li><li>Implement automated QA and data quality checking systems for pipelines and warehouse</li><li>Leverage automation using Apache Airflow where possible to help the team scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Skills And Knowledge You Possess</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>2+ years in data engineering with a Bachelor's degree in CS, Data Science, or similar technical field, or equivalent professional experience</li><li>Demonstrated success building and automating batch and streaming data pipelines, as well as end-to-end Monitoring and Alerting solutions</li><li>High fluency with advanced SQL in BigQuery (or Redshift) environment</li><li>Proficient in creating high quality, fast services and projects in Python</li><li>Experience building data pipes using Apache Kafka or Pub/Sub, Apache Airflow, GCP/AWS</li><li>Strong communication skills and interest in working with Marketing &amp; Sales teams </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits &amp; Perks</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Potential remote opportunity</li><li>Medical, dental, vision and 401(k)</li><li>Generous PTO policy </li><li>Free lunch and snacks </li><li>Enough free caffeine to keep you up for 2 weeks straight</li><li>Employee development resources </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Why You Might Like Working Here</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>We’re a small, close-knit team that enjoys working and learning from each other.</li><li>People stick around. Some of your future colleagues have been for over 8+ years.</li><li>Our users love us; just take a look at the tweets shared by teachers. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About WeVideo</u></strong><p><br></p>WeVideo is a powerful, easy to use, cloud-based video creation platform that is the digital editing and storytelling choice of more than 22 million consumers, students, businesses, and third-party media solutions. WeVideo is available from virtually any computer or device at home, school, work, or on-the-go to capture, edit, view, and share videos. Built for the future in HTML5, WeVideo brings maximum speed, responsiveness, security, and expandability to browser-based video editing. WeVideo is a Google Play Editors' Choice selection with more than 9 million downloads to date. WeVideo is also the exclusive digital storytelling solution of Google’s Education Creative Bundle for Chromebooks and a Microsoft Education Partner. More than 6,500 schools use WeVideo to enhance classroom learning.

<strong>About Amino - What We Do</strong><p><br></p>As a market leader in healthcare innovation, we empower individuals to take control of their healthcare journey by providing powerful tool to navigate and unlock the full potential of health plan options. Amino's cutting-edge digital solutions empower health plan members to effortlessly navigate their benefits and guide them towards optimal care options, considering factors such as available programs, provider network quality, and cost.<p><br></p>We're proud to have recently secured additional outside capital to accelerate our growth and fund the continued development of differentiated, market leading navigation tools. To support this, we're seeking an experienced and driven <strong>Senior</strong> <strong>Data Engineer </strong>to join us on the journey helping millions understand and optimize their health plan options.<p><br></p><strong>The Role</strong><p><br></p>Data Engineers at Amino are the backbone of our organization. They ingest, transform, and curate large and complex data that powers our products. We are in the process of adding new forms of data to add new product offers as well as improving our current products. In order to support this, we are seeking a <strong>Senior Data Engineer </strong>to help us lead the way toward building the most competitive and compliant healthcare guidance products on the market.<p><br></p><em><strong>High level priorities and projects:</strong></em><p><br></p><ul><li>Work directly with Product Managers, Architects and senior leadership to turn high-level requirements into detailed plans. </li><li>Integrate new vendor and internal sources of data into our ETL pipelines</li><li>Build out the next generation of our editorial tools to create and correct data about health entities</li><li>Modernizing our orchestration infrastructure, leveraging open source tools like dbt and Dagster</li></ul><p><br></p><em><strong>Impact you will have:</strong></em><p><br></p><ul><li>You'll revamp and expand critical data pipelines that drive current and future products. </li><li>You'll mentor other data engineers. </li><li>You'll collaborate closely with data scientists and software engineers in adjacent teams. </li><li>You'll Influence the fundamentals of how we model and warehouse data that is accessed by most teams across the company. </li><li>You'll use modern data stack technologies to develop the foundation of Amino's next generation data assets. </li></ul><p><br></p><em><strong>Technologies you will be working with:</strong></em><p><br></p>Snowflake, Python 3, dbt, Docker, AWS, Looker, Databricks, Spark, Jenkins CI/CD, Airflow, Dagster, Terraform, PostgreSQL, RDS, Elasticsearch and Kinesis<p><br></p><strong>Skills and experience you possess:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You are able to design and implement solutions that scale and can be maintained by others. </li><li>You can refractor and or simplify existing processes to improve maintainability and efficiency. </li><li>You're experienced with a variety of relational and non-relational databases</li><li>You are comfortable writing clean, well-tested code in Python</li><li>You have experience handling and working with large datasets and the tools to manage them</li><li>You have worked with ETL pipelines before and are familiar with modeling and data warehousing best practices including data modeling. Experience with dbt is to maintain pipelines is preferred. </li><li>You value and practice collaboration and feedback. You question and seek feedback on your own work and opinions. </li><li>Your documentation and verbal communication skills are excellent. You can communicate technical vision in clear terms to your peers as well as outside of the engineering team</li></ul><p><br></p><em><strong>Bonus if you bring the following:</strong></em><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience dealing with data retention policies</li><li>Experience monitoring Data Quality and working with Operational Analytics</li><li>Experience handling sensitive data (PHI or PII)</li><li>Experience with Apache Airflow and Dagster</li><li>Deep experience in the healthcare domain, specifically dealing with healthcare claims data</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>We offer:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>We're committed to helping you achieve your best work in a supportive, growth-oriented environment. We have seriously big goals, and expectations are high and we'll equip you with the tools and resources you need to be successful. </li><li>Expected base salary: $170k to $195k plus standard company benefits and a generous option grant. Amino values transparency and has included the reasonable estimate of the base salary range for this full-time role at any approved US location. Individual pay is determined by a range of factors, including job-related skills, experience, relevant education or training, licensure or certifications, and other business and organizational needs. Amino does not typically hire at or near the top of a salary range. </li><li>We offer full-time employees 100% paid employee healthcare premiums; dependent premium coverage depends on the plan. </li><li>401(k) and FSA programs. </li><li>This position, like all roles at the firm, will have a good deal of autonomy. We're a remote-first team and have designed our culture for a balance of synchronous and asynchronous work with people operating from all over the country. To support your remote office, we provide every new Amino with a generous office set-up allowance plus a monthly stipend for internet/phone. </li><li>PTO is non accrual and we expect Amino's to take a minimum of 15 days a year. </li></ul><p><br></p>We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We know the reputation and track record that the tech industry has, and work hard to be exceptional in this regard.<p><br></p><strong>Our Culture</strong><p><br></p>We are a small team who believes that success is a group activity. You should expect to learn from everyone at Amino, and be excited to share your knowledge. You will play a big part in influencing the shape of the product and be empowered to provide your thoughts and ideas.<p><br></p>We believe in collaboration, respect, and curiosity. We believe in having a growth mindset, and have a passion for solving problems that have never been faced before. Everyone's input is valued, be it about code, data models, business models, or product ideas.

<strong>About Applied</strong><p><br></p>Autonomy is one of the leading technological advances of this century that will come to impact our lives. The work you'll do at Applied will meaningfully accelerate the efforts of the top autonomy teams in the world. At Applied, you will have a unique perspective on the development of cutting-edge technology while working with major players across the industry and the globe.<p><br></p>Applied Intuition provides software solutions to safely develop, test, and deploy autonomous vehicles at scale. The company's suite of simulation, validation, and drive log management software enables development teams to create thousands of scenarios in minutes, run simulations at scale, and verify and validate algorithms for production deployment. Headquartered in Silicon Valley with offices in Detroit, Washington, D.C., Munich, Stockholm, Seoul, and Tokyo, Applied consists of software, robotics, and automotive experts with experiences from top global companies. Leading autonomy programs and 17 of the top 20 global OEMs use Applied's solutions to bring autonomy to market faster.<p><br></p><strong>About The Role</strong><p><br></p>(We are hiring for all levels of experience.)<p><br></p>We are looking for a Data Infrastructure Engineer who is excited about building products that wrangle autonomous vehicle (AV) data to supercharge our customers. You will drive the design and development of data infrastructure across our products and internal tools. At Applied, we encourage all engineers to take ownership over technical and product decisions, interact closely with users to collect feedback, and contribute to a thoughtful, dynamic team culture.<p><br></p><strong>At Applied, you will:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design powerful data pipelines that efficiently process large volumes of AV sensor and telemetry data</li><li>Enable product workflows that expose performant query interfaces and offer easy-to-use integration hooks</li><li>Build features to tune processing pipeline for fast data ingestion and indexing depending on customer's needs and workloads</li><li>Develop and deploy high-quality software using modern tooling and frameworks</li><li>Work with products and teams across the company</li><li>Work with customers across the AV ecosystem to understand their needs and the innards of their data systems</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>We're looking for someone who has:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with open source data processing frameworks (Spark, RabbitMQ, Kafka, etc.)</li><li>Experience with different data lakes or warehouses</li><li>Experience with containerization and other modern software development workflows</li><li>Proven ability to take initiative and ownership in a fast-paced environment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Nice to have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Expertise with multiple modern programming languages (Python, C++, Go, etc.)</li><li>Prior work experience with enterprise software, including on-prem and/or cloud deployments</li><li>Prior work experience with either autonomy or simulation products</li></ul><p><br></p>The salary range for this position is $65,000 USD to $400,000 USD annually. This salary range is an estimate, and the actual salary may vary based on the Company's compensation practices.<p><br></p><em>Don't meet every single requirement? If you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.</em><p><br></p><em>Applicants will be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 upon commencing employment. Reasonable accommodations will be considered on a case-by-case basis for exemptions to this requirement in accordance with applicable federal and state law. Applicants should be aware that for external-facing roles that involve close contact with Company employees or other third parties on the Company's premises, accommodations that involve remaining unvaccinated against COVID-19 may not be deemed reasonable. The Company will engage in the interactive process on an individualized basis taking into account the particular position.</em><p><br></p><em>Applied Intuition is an equal opportunity employer and federal contractor or subcontractor. These regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disability. <p>Created in 2019 by executives from globally recognized financial and technology firms, MerQube uses state-of-the-art technology to disrupt both the Index creation, and, more broadly, the systematic investing landscapes. Leveraging cloud-based architecture and today's most advanced index-tracking technology, MerQube's platform enables its clients to bring ideas to market quickly and efficiently.</p><p><strong>Summary</strong></p><p>Are you keen to work in an environment that’s stimulating and convivial with countless opportunities for growth and plenty of freedom to make a real impact? This could be the place for you!</p><p>We are looking for a skilled Senior Data Engineer to join our team. </p><p> In this role, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the data architecture that supports our platform indexing operations. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to develop data models and build data pipelines to ingest data into our system. </p><p>Responsibilities:</p><ul><li>Gain a deep understanding of our business and accurately model our business concepts.</li><li>Define a data architecture that enables the development of efficient, maintainable, high quality data pipelines.</li><li>Implement critical infrastructure components and lead design reviews. </li><li>Continuously monitor and improve data architecture to meet changing business needs</li></ul><p>Requirements:</p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology or relevant experience</li><li>5+ years of experience in data architecture, data modeling, and database design</li><li>Proficient in SQL, with experience dealing with explain plans and some familiarity with DBA work.</li><li>Experience with Python.</li><li>Experience or some familiarity with typical data pipeline frameworks, such as dbt and dagster.</li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills</li><li>Excellent communication and collaboration skills</li></ul><p>If you are a highly motivated and skilled data architect looking for a challenging role in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this opportunity!</p>

<strong><u>You Will</u></strong><p><br></p>Desired Skills and Experience<p><br></p><ul><li>Work closely with data scientists to optimize and productize machine learning models.</li><li>Be the expert on end-to-end data flow.</li><li>Design, model and build a scalable data warehouse, using ETL and other related technologies.</li><li>Implement systems for tracking data quality and consistency</li><li>Design and develop new data systems and tools, using languages, such as Java, to make data ingestion and consumption easier.</li></ul><strong>You have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>3+ years experience in data engineering and business intelligence</li><li>Expertise with database development skills including SQL.</li><li>Expertise with various ETL technologies and familiar with ETL tools.</li><li>Have solid understanding of both relational and NoSQL database technologies.</li><li>Experience with visualization, data mining, or statistical tools</li><li>Experience with Vertica in particular is a plus</li><li>Programming experience in Java, Ruby or other language is a plus</li><li>Able to take individual ownership of a project from start to finish.</li><li>Excellent critical thinking, problem solving and analytical skills.</li><li>Excellent communication skills, and the ability to work effectively with others</li><li>BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field</li></ul>

<strong>Company Overview</strong><p><br></p>Founded in 2010, Lynx Analytics is a predictive analytics company run by world-class quantitative marketing scientists and industry-experienced data scientists. Our focus is to become a leading analytics solution provider in our chosen fields of expertise (telecom, retail, life sciences, and financial services) while advancing graph analytics technology.<p><br></p>Lynx is headquartered in Singapore with operations in Hong Kong, Germany, USA, Hungary, South Africa, Indonesia, and several other Southeast Asian countries. We work with some of the world's largest companies and are constantly looking to expand our knowledge base and geographical footprint. Lynx Analytics' technology is deployed with various Clients across Asia and has significant growth potential.<p><br></p>We have a diverse and inclusive global team comprising Professors, PhDs, MSc's, and MBAs from Ivy Leagues, INSEAD and NUS with a broad spectrum of experience in start-ups and blue-chip companies (Google, SAP, Vodafone, GE, Morgan Stanley, Barclays, HSBC to name but a few). It is the combination of our industry insight and experience, scalable proprietary technology, and highly qualified people that drives our compelling value proposition.<p><br></p>We are looking for ambitious, innovative, empathetic and relentless team players to explore the career opportunities that we offer as we continue to scale our operations.<p><br></p>We are looking for a Data Engineer to work on automating and productizing advanced big data transformation and analytics pipelines. You would be working with standard big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, etc,), as well as our proprietary big graph analysis framework.<p><br></p><strong>Key Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>A Data Engineer's responsibility is to implement and deploy data analysis pipelines at various clients of Lynx Analytics. This includes participating in the activities below:<p><br></p><ul><li>Understand deeply the business problem that we are trying to solve by our analytical solution</li><li>Through continuous consultations with employees of our client, discover the client's existing data sources that are relevant to the problem we try to solve. This includes discussions with client IT, data owners, future business users, etc. </li><li>Working together with the IT teams of the client, define the technical architecture for the analytical solution that we are to deploy for the client. </li><li>Implement the data ingestion subsystem: this is the system responsible for moving all the necessary data sources to a single location where the actual analysis will happen. </li><li>Implement the data analysis pipelines. </li><li>Integrate the results into business UIs developed by Lynx or pre-existing client software systems</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Relevant tertiary qualification, preferably at Masters level or above, in Engineering or another relevant discipline with strong academic results</li><li>Strong programming skills</li><li>Experience in GCP, Airflow and Spark</li><li>Solid experience in Python and SQL</li><li>Good problem-solving skills</li><li>Good communication skills</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>DESIRABLE</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience in Big Data</li><li>A minimum of 3 years of experience in Data Science or Analytics</li><li>Industry experience in working for a big enterprise (like our clients)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We Offer</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Opportunity to work on creating innovative, leading-edge data science pipelines using our state of the art, in-house built big graph tool</li><li>Work closely with the developers of the (big graph) tool you will be building upon</li><li>Be a member of a very strong team with mathematicians, ex-Googlers, Ivy League professors, MBA alumni and telecommunications industry experts</li><li>Startup atmosphere</li></ul>

The Company In order to keep climate change to 1.5°C, we'll need 30% of global GDP (all of the energy generation and transportation) to run on batteries by 2035. Zitara Technologies (YCombinator S20) builds predictive battery management software for transportation and energy customers with large deployments. Their customers operate &gt;$100M deployments of batteries in satellites, EVs, and renewable energy storage installations. Our team brings top researchers in physics-based battery algorithms together with seasoned software engineers to build safety-critical firmware and large-scale machine learning systems. We bring with us decades of experience from Toyota, Exponent, Proterra, Tesla, Gogoro, Google, and Facebook, and a passion for technologies that can have an immediate impact on the climate crisis. The Role Zitara's operation team's software spans several domains: large-scale data infrastructure automation of our in-house battery lab scaling battery lab operations profitably to keep up with ever growing customer demands. Our operational tools and processes impact all our product lines and are integral to Zitara's success and bottom line. We're looking for a data engineer who is committed to delivering robust, scalable tools for our operations team. You'll contribute to Zitara's success by creating custom solutions to address operational needs, from test automation and monitoring, to data collection, validation and visualization. To succeed, you'll collaborate with both operations and engineering team members to build tools that support existing and future processes to create a smooth pipeline from data to machine learning to product. In this role, you'll be expected to jump into at least one or two specific well-defined projects immediately, and help define future projects to streamline our operations as we grow. Responsibilities Understand complex problems across multiple disciplines and apply software engineering methodology to attack them Make data engineering choices in the face of evolving product requirements Work with project management team members to scope and schedule work Work with team members to ensure features meet operational needs Write robust, tested code to solve challenges at every scale Contribute to design, code, and internal documentation Minimum Qualification Bachelors' in technical subject or equivalent proficiency 2 years experience in industry data engineering 1 year experience in one or more of the following specialties: Proficiency in SQL and relational databases Automating data collection, storage, and validation Organizing and managing large, complex data sets AWS or other cloud services Networking test equipment Creating data and operations dashboards Proficiency in Python Experience shipping robust internal tools Basic software development workflow processes with git Experience with project management and agile development Clear and effective written and interpersonal communication skills Creative problem solving with limited resources and engineering constraints Preferred Additional Qualifications Experience in mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, chemistry, or physics Experience writing software tools to automate physical processes What We Offer Full-time position: 3 days in office in San Francisco, CA as possible; 2 optionally remote days per week Competitive pay Health, Dental, and Vision care for you and your family 401K savings plan "Unlimited PTO" vacation policy Excellent colleagues that are interested in your happiness and growth Why you should join Zitara Technologies, Inc. In order to keep climate change to 1.5°C, we'll need 30% of global GDP (all of energy generation and transportation) to run on batteries by 2035. Zitara Technologies (YCombinator S20) builds predictive battery management software for transportation and energy customers with large deployments. Their customers operate &gt;$100M deployments of batteries in satellites, EVs, and renewable energy storage installations.

<strong>Description</strong> We are an innovative fast-growing beauty company headquartered in San Mateo, CA. We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join our growing data team. You would be responsible for developing data pipelines, creating ETLs to aggregate data in the data warehouse, and guiding how this data is used by other teams across the organization. The ideal candidate is hands-on and thrives in a fluid, high-performance entrepreneurial environment with a passion for learning and innovating.<p><br></p><strong><u>Must-Have Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Strong knowledge of Java and at least one other programming language</li><li>Experience working with big data (distributed computing and analytics) tools, e.g. Hadoop or Spark</li><li>Experience with relational databases and SQL</li><li>Experience in production environments with large data sets</li><li>Strong communication skills</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice-to-Have Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, or equivalent field</li><li>Experience with AWS</li><li>Experience with ETL tools and processes</li><li>Knowledge of machine learning methods</li><li>Experience with recommender systems, personalization, or search</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>We were founded with one singular mission: to inspire individuals around the world to express their unique beauty. That's how our Glam Bag came to life. With five products personalized for you—plus articles, videos, and more on—you're free to try new things and express who you are. Shopper takes our mission to the next level by making beauty more accessible, rewarding, and liberating than ever before. And with our Gen Beauty, Open Studios, and all the creator content that we post each day, our intention has remained the same: to give every individual the tools to form their own definition of beauty. With over 2.5M members and 8K digital content creators in our community, and generating over half a billion monthly content views, we're just getting started.<p><br></p>We are headquartered in the Bay Area with an office in New York City and a studio production and editing facility in Los Angeles. The company achieved profitability in its first year and raised a series B round of $100M with Sherpa Capital and TPG in 2015. We owe all of our success to our inspiring, energizing employees who make exceptional things happen every single day—fearless thinking, tenacity, and a pioneering spirit push us forward. From marketing and media to engineering and operations, we are united in our goal to democratize beauty, making it accessible and affordable for everyone and fearlessly representing individuality and inclusivity. We dream. We empower. We create. And we have great fun doing it together.

<strong>About Rippling</strong><p><br></p>Rippling is the first way for businesses to manage all of their HR &amp; IT—payroll, benefits, computers, apps, and more—in one unified workforce platform.<p><br></p>By connecting every business system to one source of truth for employee data, businesses can automate all of the manual work they normally need to do to make employee changes. Take onboarding, for example. With Rippling, you can just click a button and set up a new employees’ payroll, health insurance, work computer, and third-party apps—like Slack, Zoom, and Office 365—all within 90 seconds.<p><br></p>Based in San Francisco, CA, Rippling has raised $1.2B from the world's top investors—including Kleiner Perkins, Founders Fund, Sequoia, Bedrock, and Greenoaks—and was named one of America's best startup employers by Forbes (#12 out of 500)<p><br></p><strong>About The Role</strong><p><br></p>We are looking for a hands-on senior engineer to play a key role in Rippling’s data team. As a senior engineering resource on the data engineering team, you will be leading the design and development of systems that will enable analytics, experimentation, and user-facing features. You will be closely involved with multiple data adjacent teams and stakeholders, alongside helping junior talent in the team learn and grow.<p><br></p>The Data Engineering Team at Rippling is a combination of warehousing and data platform engineering, supporting a variety of orgs across the company (Data Science, Marketing, Bizops, Revops, Finance to name a few). Here’s an idea of some of the initiatives we’re working on:<p><br></p><ul><li>A realtime, central data lake to operationalize warehouse data. </li><li>Creating a metrics layer to make reporting more efficient and accurate. </li><li>Building a catalog to make our data assets searchable and easy to discover. </li><li>Making our globally distributed data stack compliant and scalable</li></ul><p><br></p>What You'll Do<p><br></p><ul><li>Help architect, build, and scale our data pipelines from our OLTP database, other internal systems and third party tools to our warehouse (Snowflake)</li><li>Leverage data technologies like Kafka, Presto, Flink, Airflow, Mongo, Snowflake and Spark</li><li>Support reporting, data science, operations and machine learning functions</li><li>Create data platforms, data lakes, and data ingestion systems that work at scale</li><li>Define and enforce data quality checks and audits for code warehousing datasets</li><li>Define and support internal SLAs for core data sets</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ Years experience in Data and Software Engineering</li><li>Expertise in writing complex data transforms in SQL and Python</li><li>Knowledge of data warehousing concepts around building custom ETL integrations, building data infrastructure (SCD,CDC,Snapshots,indexing,partitioning)</li><li>Knowledge on Data Security and Governance (nice to have)</li><li>Experience in analytics, dimensional modeling, and ETL optimization preferred</li><li>BS/BA in a technical field such as Computer Science or Mathematics preferred</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Additional Information</strong><p><br></p>Rippling is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce and do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other legally protected characteristics, Rippling is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities who need assistance during the hiring process. To request a reasonable accommodation, please email accomodations@rippling.com<p><br></p>Rippling highly values having employees working in-office to foster a collaborative work environment and company culture. For office-based employees (employees who live within a 40 mile radius of a Rippling office), Rippling considers working in the office, at least three days a week under current policy, to be an essential function of the employee's role.<p><br></p>This role will receive a competitive salary + benefits + equity. The salary for US-based employees will be aligned with one of the ranges below based on location; see which tier applies to your location here.<p><br></p>A variety of factors are considered when determining someone’s compensation–including a candidate’s professional background, experience, and location. Final offer amounts may vary from the amounts listed below.<p><br></p><strong>The pay range for this role is:</strong><p><br></p>144,000 - 237,000 USD per year(Tier 1)

Tau is a venture-backed advanced technology company based in the Bay Area (Redwood City, CA). We design and develop next-generation products for electrification. The company was started because we believe the key to a more sustainable future requires modern power conversion systems to increase the security of the world's energy. We have pioneered technologies that leverage software-enabled hardware to provide industry leading scale, economics, and efficiencies. Our systems include innovations across electric machines, inverters, controllers, thermal management, simulation, and charging systems.<p><br></p>Tau's team of engineers, scientists, technologists, operators, and industry leaders continue to advance our internal technology roadmap while collaborating with commercial partners to deploy our existing products to market in the relentless pursuit of creating efficient power conversion systems for a more sustainable future.<p><br></p>At our core, Tau is made of exceptionally talented and mission-aligned people. Developing complex electromechanical systems is an interdisciplinary challenge. We are looking to expand our team with diverse engineering, scientific, and operational expertise.<p><br></p>Tau is an equal opportunity employer that guarantees a work environment that respects and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.<p><br></p><strong>About You</strong><p><br></p>We are looking for people who aren't afraid to take on new challenges, and are as passionate about energy and electrification as we are:<p><br></p><ul><li>You find large challenges exciting and enjoy discovering and defining problems as much as solving them. </li><li>You deliver. You may enjoy thoughtful conversations about problems and perfecting design, but in the end you know that what matters is delivering innovative, effective, and reliable solutions. </li><li>You are a cross disciplinary team member. You are excited to work with, learn from, and contribute to technology teams ranging from electromagnetics, power electronics, controls systems, mechanical, materials, software, computational physics, and beyond. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Prior experience in a relevant engineering field is valued, but the team has openings from early career to expert - candidates of all levels are encouraged to apply.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>We are looking for a <strong>Software Engineer - DevOps</strong> to join our growing team to both advance our internal technology roadmap and translate our innovative products to market with our commercial partners.<p><br></p>As a member of the controls team, you will model, design, implement, test and benchmark the motor controls of current and future Tau motor drives - including both high and low voltage applications.<p><br></p>What You'll Do<p><br></p><ul><li>Utilize large-scale data and help Tau engineers design and validate the most compelling and reliable products for our customers</li><li>Collect real-time life data from test and simulation systems including retrieving, analyzing and summarizing results to cross-functional teams</li><li>Provide support through the whole design cycle by building software and statistical tools that orchestrate all the reliability physics analyses</li><li>Answer complex questions on design parameters and behavior</li><li>Build scalable data pipelines to deploy fleet health monitoring models</li><li>Apply modern statistical frameworks to support the engineering team</li><li>Work closely with cross-functional teams to create/interpret/validate numeric models of products and systems</li><li>Build visualizations to effectively communicate results </li><li>Advance Tau's multiphysics simulation infrastructure including scientific computing pipelines, computational cluster, data storage and retrieval, etc</li></ul><p><br></p>What You'll Bring<p><br></p><ul><li>Strong MLOps and DevOps skills </li><li>Solid understanding of statistics, probability, and machine learning, and optimization concepts</li><li>Strong experience with Python and data manipulation tools including SQL, Pandas, Numpy, Scipy, Matplotlib, Scikit-learn, Jupyter Notebooks, etc</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Familiarity with big data and scientific computing frameworks</li><li>Familiar with software engineering best practices including API design, version control, CI/CD, etc</li><li>Ability to thrive in a fast-moving and constantly evolving high growth environment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Desired Skills</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>(Bonus) Ideal candidates with have a background in physics and engineering</li><li>Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, Mathematics, Physics or a related field</li><li>Experience training and maintaining models for real world applications</li><li>Strong knowledge of data structures and architectures</li><li>Experience with scalable machine learning and time-series modeling</li><li>Ability to code robust-apps (potentially interfacing with data streams, etc)</li><li>Comfortable in an environment with unstructured, incomplete, and ambiguous data</li><li>Curious, open-minded, and driven to solve complex problems</li></ul><p><br></p>The level will depend on the candidate's experience. Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches his or her work with vigor and determination. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate excellence in their respective fields, to possess the ability to learn quickly and to strive for perfection within a fast-paced environment.<p><br></p><strong>Perks</strong> <ul><li>Become part of an emerging company during a rapid growth phase—within an industry undergoing dramatic transformation for a global imperative. </li><li>Work with some of the smartest and most talented experts from different fields to: (1) attack some of the most pressing issues of today while (2) contributing to technically demanding and deeply innovative solutions. </li><li>Growth potential—we advance team members who have an outsized impact. </li><li>Competitive compensation based upon experience level, including stock options—we believe in capturing value in the future we create together. </li><li>Flexible time off and paid holidays. </li><li>Centrally located in the Bay Area on the Peninsula in vibrant downtown Redwood City</li><ul><li>Blocks from the Caltrain</li><li>Walking distance to food and entertainment</li><li>Easy access to both the 101 and 280</li></ul><li>Excellent medical, dental, vision, and life insurance for full time team members. </li><li>Comprehensive benefits including HSA and FSA benefits, commuter benefits, ancillary benefits including OneMedical membership, a variety of telehealth services, and more.</li></ul>
