<strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>Reporting to the Interim Associate Chief Information Officer and Senior Director of Enterprise Solutions, the Data Engineer – Campus Data Warehouse (CDW) is responsible for SJSU’s Campus Data Warehousing/Business Intelligence implementation. This position will play an important role in the research, design, architecture, creation, development, implementation, and maintenance of Campus Data Warehouse. This includes identifying and pulling data from 500+ individual databases across SJSU and curating them into a single data source in order to facilitate data-driven decisions. Assist in conducting technical reviews, creating definitions of business problems, including the preparation of business/technical requirements to support the mission of the university and administrative departments, providing systems and technical support of vendor and locally developed software, and work with the Data Warehouse Project Manager, SJSU IT Enterprise Solutions resources, external vendors, and IT team members. Duties and system assignments can be temporarily or permanently changed to meet the needs and goals of the department and university.<p><br></p><strong><u>Key Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop and maintain ETL processes to populate the data warehouse</li><li>Build and maintain Google BigQuery data warehouse interfaces to house data from various sources such as Oracle, MySQL, and Web APIs, etc.</li><li>Building and maintaining production data pipelines for data analytics</li><li>Partner cohesively with campus stakeholders to align with their strategic goals and initiatives through the implementation of Campus Data Warehouse</li><li>Collaborate with key analytical vendors who can provide specialized expertise to assist with solution development while developing the in-house effort and managing CO interface</li><li>Follow project plans, timelines, and vendor relationships to ensure releases are delivered with the highest quality, on-time and within budget</li><li>Provide the data analytics infrastructure that supports and achieves operational organization goals and targets</li><li>Apply performance tuning techniques to existing and new ETL scripts and analytical reports</li><li>Develop efficient database manipulation code to ensure reliable and consistent result sets</li><li>Develop appropriate and reusable data validation scripts to ensure the analytical dashboards are meeting the business requirements</li><li>Assist the development team in performing the troubleshooting of Campus Data Warehouse components as identified by the Business groups</li><li>Develop and deploy ad-hoc query extracts from Campus Data Warehouse as desired by the Business groups</li><li>Participate in overall analytics architecture and application roadmap.</li><li>Assist in the improvement of organization performance by utilizing not only the data already available to the organization, but also utilizing new and innovative sources of data</li><li>Develop custom reports as necessary using visualization tools such as Google Data Studio, Tableau and other visualization tools</li><li>Identify, interpret, analyze and address critical business issues, questions and to develop use cases.</li><li>Organizing and creating an environment that makes data and information accessible with appropriate channels of access controls.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Knowledge, Skills &amp; Abilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Intermediate skills in a Data Engineer role</li><li>Knowledge of Google Cloud Platform components including but not limited to Composer, Airflow, Dataproc, Sqoop, Cloud Storage, and BigQuery</li><li>Advanced knowledge in high level programming languages like: Python, SQL, Java, and JavaScript</li><li>Advanced knowledge of application development, testing and deployment processes and tools</li><li>Knowledge of data visualizations tools like Tableau, Google Data Studio, or equivalent experience</li><li>Knowledge and skills working with large data sets</li><li>Solid knowledge of ETL, ELT, reporting and analytics tools and environments</li><li>Ability to strategically think and build a Data Warehouse to answer important questions across a variety of functional areas</li><li>Ability to collaborate with business stakeholders and IT management to understand solution requirements and system design</li><li>Strong interpersonal, communication, organization and planning skills</li><li>Proficiency in management of multiple priorities to produce quality products for customers</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>A bachelor’s degree, preferably in computer science or business, or equivalent training and applied experience</li><li>5+ years of experience in business applications analysis, design, and programming for medium or large scale, multi-programmed computers</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>3+ years’ experience developing, maintaining and collecting structured and unstructured data sets for analysis and reporting</li><li>3+ years of working experience in implementing cloud-based architecture (i.e. Google Cloud Platform or similar) </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Compensation</u></strong><p><br></p>Classification: Analyst/Programmer-Expert<p><br></p>Anticipated Hiring Range: $9,640/month - $9,834/month<p><br></p>CSU Hiring Range: $6,249/month - $12,100/month<p><br></p>San José State University offers employees a comprehensive benefits package typically worth 30-35% of your base salary. For more information on programs available, please see the Employee Benefits Summary .<p><br></p><strong>Application Procedure</strong><p><br></p>Click Apply Now to complete the SJSU Online Employment Application and attach the following documents:<p><br></p><ul><li>Resume</li><li>Letter of Interest</li></ul><p><br></p>All applicants must apply within the specified application period: <strong>June 9, 2022 through June 26, 2022</strong>. This position is open until filled; however, applications received after screening has begun will be considered at the discretion of the university.<p><br></p><strong>Contact Information</strong><p><br></p>University Personnel<p><br></p>jobs@sjsu.edu<p><br></p>408-924-2252<p><br></p><strong>CSU Vaccination Policy</strong><p><br></p>The CSU requires faculty, staff, and students who are accessing campus facilities to be fully vaccinated against the COVID-19 virus (including all booster doses of an approved vaccine for which an individual is eligible per current CDC recommendations) or declare a medical or religious exemption from doing so. As a condition of employment, any candidates advanced in a currently open search process should be prepared to comply with this requirement as well as with other safety measures established on the campus. The system wide policy can be found at https://calstate.policystat.com/policy/9779821/latest/ and questions may be sent to jobs@sjsu.edu .<p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Information</u></strong><p><br></p>Satisfactory completion of a background check (including a criminal records check) is required for employment. SJSU will issue a contingent offer of employment to the selected candidate, which may be rescinded if the background check reveals disqualifying information, and/or it is discovered that the candidate knowingly withheld or falsified information. Failure to satisfactorily complete the background check may affect the continued employment of a current CSU employee who was offered the position on a contingent basis.<p><br></p>The standard background check includes: criminal check, employment and education verification. Depending on the position, a motor vehicle and/or credit check may be required. All background checks are conducted through the university's third party vendor, Accurate Background. Some positions may also require fingerprinting. SJSU will pay all costs associated with this procedure. Evidence of required degree(s) or certification(s) will be required at time of hire.<p><br></p>SJSU IS NOT A SPONSORING AGENCY FOR STAFF OR MANAGEMENT POSITIONS. (e.g. H1-B VISAS)<p><br></p>All San José State University employees are considered mandated reporters under the California Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act and are required to comply with the requirements set forth in CSU Executive Order 1083 as a condition of employment.<p><br></p><strong>Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Crime Statistics Act and Campus Housing Fire Safety Notification: </strong><p><br></p>Pursuant to the Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act, the Annual Security Report (ASR) is also now available for viewing at https://www.sjsu.edu/clery/docs/SJSU-Annual-Security-Report.pdf. The ASR contains the current security and safety-related policy statements, emergency preparedness and evacuation information, crime prevention and Sexual Assault prevention information, and information about drug and alcohol prevention programming. The ASR also contains statistics of Clery crimes for San José State University locations for the three most recent calendar years. A paper copy of the ASR is available upon request by contacting the Office of the Clery Director by phone at 408-924-1501 or by email at clerycompliance@sjsu.edu .<p><br></p>Pursuant to the Higher Education Opportunity Act, the Annual Fire Safety Report (AFSR) is also available for viewing at https://www.sjsu.edu/clery/docs/SJSU-Annual-Fire-Safety-Report.pdf . The purpose of this report is to disclose statistics for fires that occurred within SJSU on-campus housing facilities for the three most recent calendar years, and to distribute fire safety policies and procedures intended to promote safety on Campus. A paper copy of the AFSR is available upon request by contacting the Housing Office by phone at 408-795-5600 or by email at uhs-frontdesk@sjsu.edu .<p><br></p><strong>Equal Employment Statement</strong><p><br></p>San José State University (SJSU) is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer committed to nondiscrimination on the basis of age, ancestry, citizenship status, color, creed, disability, ethnicity, gender, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, race, religion or lack thereof, sex, sexual orientation, transgender, or protected veteran status consistent with applicable federal and state laws. This policy applies to all SJSU students, faculty and staff programs and activities. Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, and certain other federal and state laws, prohibit discrimination on the basis of sex in all education programs and activities operated by the university (both on and off campus).

<p>As our Senior Data Engineer in the data platform team, you will have the opportunity to build, optimize and grow the core data platforms in our company. Your work will have a direct and huge impact on the company's core competencies, reporting to our VP Engineering.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Create The Circular Economy With Us </strong></p><p>At Reebelo.com, you empower customers to buy their favourite tech devices in a more sustainable way. Our mission is to refresh the way we all consume tech, delivered through a platform built on sustainable values and quality-assured devices. We are looking for motivated team members like yourself with an innovative mindset. In 3 years we launched 8 countries, raised $50M from top investors and scaled to 9-digit gross sales. Change the world, and supercharge your career with Reebelo!</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Your typical day may include:</strong></p><ul><li>Building and maintaining data pipelines to ensure correct data is transferred across platforms</li><li>Empowering the external facing data tool by engineering a robust data repository</li><li>Working closely with internal stakeholders and our engineering team to ensure accurate release of features</li><li>Owning and maintaining the complete infrastructure by ensuring near 100% uptime and proper disaster recovery practices, including but not limited to version control and configuration management</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>We'd love to have a chat if you have:</strong></p><ul><li>BS degree in Computer Science/Engineering</li><li>4+ years of experience in data engineering</li><li>Strong experience in pioneering, scaling, and optimizing data pipelines, data storage, large-scale data processing/analytics platform, dashboards</li><li>Expert level in Python, REST APIs</li><li>Proven experience in version control and CI/CD tools</li><li>In-depth, hands-on experience in AWS cloud infrastructure</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communications skills</li><li>Based in the San Francisco Bay Area or willing to relocate</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>What we offer:</strong></p><ul><li>Competitive remuneration package </li><li>Comprehensive Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance </li><li>Hybrid work environment. </li><li>Work from any of our offices for a couple of months/year (San Mateo, Miami, Melbourne, Auckland, Singapore, Kuala Lumpur, Hong Kong - and more to come)</li><li>Ability to impact and influence business growth</li><li>Team events &amp; a great culture!</li><li>Birthday leave: Enjoy some you time! </li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>We understand that experience comes in many forms so if your experience is close to what we’re looking for, please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you!</strong></p>

Today’s financial system is built to favor those with money. Grid’s mission is to level that playing field by building financial products that help users better manage their financial future. The Grid app lets users access cash, build credit, spend money, file their taxes and lots, lots more.<p><br></p>Grid is a fast growing team that’s deeply passionate about making a difference in the lives of millions. We’re solving huge problems and believe that a merit driven culture allows every team member to play a big role. Join our growing team in our Bay Area headquarters or additional offices across the US.<p><br></p>Our Data Engineers are responsible for converting the data surrounding a customer's financial life into tools that make our customers smarter and better equipped financially for the future. We value making intelligent decisions backed by good data and tools. We're looking for people who share our values, particularly if you have experience analyzing, processing, and learning from large data sets.<p><br></p>We’re looking for a seasoned Senior Data Engineer who can help us lay the foundation of an exceptional data engineering practice. The ideal candidate will be confident with a programming language of their choice, be able to learn new technologies quickly, have strong software engineering and computer science fundamentals and have extensive experience with common big data workflow frameworks and solutions. You will be writing code, setting style guides and collaborating cross-functionally with product, engineering and leadership.<p><br></p>Problems we work on:<p><br></p><ul><li>Analytics: Collect all the data for a user into tools that help our customers</li><li>Machine Learning: Using a variety of techniques to reach better insights</li><li>Data Processing: Managing data &amp; statistics using scalable and efficient technologies</li><li>Visualization: Envision our data as beautiful graphs and tools that allow customers to explore their data &amp; ask their own questions</li><li>Risk: Analyze data for anomalous patterns and build tools that allow us to find bad actors quickly<br><br></li></ul>We Practice:<p><br></p><ul><li>Open collaboration</li><li>Code reviews</li><li>Testing</li><li>Agile development<br><br></li></ul>We Use:<p><br></p><ul><li>Go</li><li>Python</li><li>MySQL</li><li>Google Cloud Platform</li><li>Kubernetes</li><li>Kubeflow</li><li>Docker</li><li>Google Pubsub</li><li>BigQuery</li><li>Firebase<br><br></li></ul>We’re looking for Engineers to:<p><br></p><ul><li>Design and implement platform services, frameworks and ecosystems</li><li>Build a scalable, reliable, operable and performant big data workflow platform for data scientists/engineers, AI/ML engineers, and product/operation team members</li><li>Drive efficiency and reliability improvements through design and automation: performance, scaling, observability, and monitoring<br><br></li></ul>Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li>Strong programming skills with Python</li><li>Strong programming skills with a typed programming language, such as Java, Scala, Go, etc</li><li>Disciplined approach to development, testing, and quality assurance</li><li>Excellent communication skills, capable of explaining highly technical problems in English</li><li>Understand data processing and ETL, hands on experience building pipelines and using frameworks such as Hive hdfs, Presto, Spark, etc<br><br></li></ul>Really strong candidates may have:<p><br></p><ul><li>Really strong candidates may have:</li><li>Actively contribute to open source software</li><li>Worked with a strong, lean-based development environment</li><li>Previous work experience in a start-up environment</li><li>Ability to recognize the right tool for the right situation/problem</li><li>Will have strong programming skill in Go<br></li></ul>

describtion: <strong>Role: Snowflake Data Engineer<br><br></strong><strong>Location San Jose, CA Later it will be onsite- Initial remote (Please take consent letter)<br><br></strong><strong>Duration: 6+ Months<br><br></strong><strong><u>Job Description<br></u></strong><ul><li>Strong Snowflake, Unix Shell Scripting, Python, Experience in any NoSQL, Strong in Programming, Experience in Large volume Data Processing and ETLs and Java</li></ul>

Machinify is a revolutionary healthcare software company with a mission to ensure that patients get the right medical treatment, at the right time, at the right price. Our cloud-based Machinify AI platform leverages the latest advances in machine learning, large language models, data analytics, and cloud processing to solve previously intractable problems, transforming healthcare administration and payment operations.<br><br>Machinify is seeking a <strong>Senior/Staff Data Engineer </strong>to <strong>own the models that power our ML pipelines running in production from start to finish. </strong>Machinify’s customers are at the center of everything we do, so we employ innovative thinkers to solve issues our customers don't even have yet.<br><br>Our people are at the heart of everything we do. Our teams are diverse and thrive on trust. Everyone has a voice. We are humans who understand our customer and work collaboratively to deliver value and make a difference.<br><br><strong>What you’ll do:<br></strong><ul><li>Independently understand all aspects of a business problem including those unrelated to their area of expertise, weigh pros and cons of different approaches and suggest ones likely to succeed</li><li>Work with a cross-functional organization including engineering, delivering, subject-matter experts, product managers, as well as platform engineers to deliver a scalable framework. </li><li>Map the customer data into Machinify canonical form. Identify and ingest non canonical fields and generalize the process to a minimal level of customization. </li><li>Proactively design and adapt the canonical form to suit changing query patterns and needs. </li><li>Ultimately own data availability and quality for the Data Science organization. </li><li>Mentor and train other members of the team, setting frameworks that impact the performance of the Data function at Machinify</li><li>Set best practices and processes to optimize the way the team works towards business objectives</li><li>Proactively researches new tools and technologies, and makes savvy recommendations to drive business success for Machinify and customers</li><li>Enjoy working in an Agile/Scrum/Lean environment. </li><li>Be challenged when faced with solving complex problems</li><li>Bring a passion for improving the lives of others by making their jobs easier and more productive. <br><br></li></ul><strong>What You Bring:<br></strong><ul><li>Masters in Computer Science or STEM disciplines. </li><li>Experience applying modern NLP models in practical settings. </li><li>Plus if the candidate has worked with medical records and/or insurance claims. </li><li>Startup experience. </li><li>8+ years experience as hands-on Data Engineer in either as a lead developer role. SQL proficiency is a must. </li><li>7+ years of experience managing the delivery of complex data. </li><li>Experience understanding business problems and coming up with tech based solutions</li><li>Experience with cloud-based services and enterprise software environments. </li><li>Strong data technical background as evidenced by prior experience as a hands-on data/ETL engineer. </li><li>Familiarity with frameworks and protocols for data transfer, data consumption and data manipulation. </li><li>Analytical approaches to problem solving and data-driven decision making. </li><li>Ability to balance trade-offs among multiple competing priorities. </li><li>HealthCare Domain knowledge is a plus. </li><li>You are scrappy, fast, high bandwidth, adaptable and ambitious</li><li>Critical thinking and problem solving skills. </li><li>Comfortable with ambiguity and taking the initiative when required</li><li>Amazing communication skills<br><br></li></ul>The base salary for this position will vary based on an array of factors unique to each candidate such as qualifications, years and depth of experience, skill set, certifications, etc. The base salary range for this role is $170k-250k. We are hiring for different seniorities, and our Recruiting team will let you know if you qualify for a different role/range. Salary is one component of the total compensation package, which includes meaningful equity, excellent healthcare, flexible time off, and other benefits and perks.<br><br><strong>Equal Employment Opportunity at Machinify<br><br></strong>Machinify is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its positions. Machinify believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.<br><br>

<strong>Introduction<br><br></strong>SymphonyRM helps health systems thrive in the rapidly evolving US Healthcare industry by keeping patients healthy and physicians happy. By analyzing large amounts of data from many sources, we empower clients to make smarter decisions at every turn in their business. Our clients love SymphonyRM’s ability to guide them to take the next best action for both patients and physicians.<br><br>As a Senior Data Engineer, you’ll play a critical role in developing tools to automate data ETL processing, assess data quality from multiple sources, and build a powerful data pipeline, while working closely with our other engineers.<br><br>We care deeply about building long-term careers and offer opportunities for our employees to grow towards project leadership, engineering management, or other roles to make a difference in the lives of patients.<br><br><strong>You’d be a great addition if…<br></strong><ul><li>You have a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics or similar degree OR Bachelor’s degree with at least 3 year related experience with Python programming OR 5+ years related experience with Python programming (e.g. completion of a Python-focused bootcamp).</li><li>You seek to fully understand “big data” problems, and strategize to produce efficient, workable solutions.</li><li>You are curious about emerging technologies, and like to evaluate and adapt where you see fit.</li><li>You’re motivated by high-impact projects via automation or scaling data operations to drive business value. </li><li>You’re excited to work with cross-functional teams in an agile environment.</li><li>You appreciate working with people from diverse backgrounds. </li><li>Building tools to automate data anomaly detection and alerting</li><li>Scaling our data infrastructure and developing software that allows for improved data processing and automation<br></li></ul><strong><u>Bonus Qualifications If...<br></u></strong><ul><li>You’ve worked on large-scale databases using cloud computing platforms like Amazon AWS </li><li>You have strong knowledge with SQL/Relational databases </li><li>You have experience in using data visualization tools (Looker, Matplotlib, Excel, etc.) </li><li>Experience with Apache Airflow and/or Pandas </li><li>You have studied or have experience designing data pipelines and loading large datasets into databases <br></li></ul><strong><u>What You’ll Do<br></u></strong><ul><li>You will work closely alongside a small team of engineers to drive continuous improvements to our Python-based data platform. </li><li>Write and deploy Python code to automate data ingestion using Apache Airflow. </li><li>Support internal and external stakeholders in troubleshooting and resolving issues.</li><li>Contribute new ideas in design to development to our data infrastructure - we are always looking to improve. <br></li></ul>Due to Covid-19, you will be working remotely for the time being. We are actively interviewing and hiring this position based out of our Palo Alto, CA office.

jobs_titles: #10252 - GIS Data Engineer (Apache Spark, Python, GCP, ESRI)
describtion: <strong>Description</strong><p><br></p>Q Analysts (A Qualitest Company) is looking for a <strong>GIS Data Engineer</strong> our client in Mountain View, CA. The GIS Data Engineer will work on various GIS Data projects and software integration projects. We are looking for a professional with good attention to detail, good follow through, and a can-do attitude coupled with a background in Data Engineering. Previous experience with Google Fiber, GCP, Apache Spark, Apache Clusters is very desirable.<p><br></p><ul><li>Responsibilities include, design, develop, optimize, and maintain data storage and reporting. </li><li>Work closely with engineering teams to design and acquire log level data. Create and optimize dashboards. </li><li>Write and review technical documents, including requirements and design documents for existing and future data systems, and data standards and policies. </li><li>Coordinate cross-functionally to enable a seamless communication of risks, dependencies and schedules across hardware and software teams. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p>Minimum Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, a related field, or equivalent practical experience. </li><li>Proficiency in Python/Bash/Linux </li><li>3 to 5 years of experience in data engineering, solution engineering, or technical consulting </li><li>3 or more years of experience in technical troubleshooting and writing code in one or more programming languages (preferred) </li><li>Experience with Apache Spark and Apache Clusters. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Nice To Have</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Master’s Degree in Computer Science or related field (preferred) </li><li>Experience with Esri, GCP, Cloud SQL Server, or Google Fiber </li><li>Experience managing BIG data sets. </li><li>Experience using Machine Learning technologies to build solutions </li><li>Software integration experience </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p>Why Qualitest?<p><br></p><ul><li>Founded in 1997, Qualitest offers a wide range of digital quality solutions designed to provide enterprise customers with end-to-end quality management services across the software lifecycle. Qualitest achieves this by deploying engagement models tailored to the precise quality engineering needs of technology platforms in the financial services, health services, telecom, technology, retail, media, gaming, and utilities industries. It has operations in the US, UK, India, Germany, Romania, Israel, Argentina, Mexico, Switzerland, and Portugal, and serves over 400 blue-chip customers worldwide.</li><li>We provide industry-leading managed services that drive Quality for Quality Assurance and Testing of hardware devices, software apps and experiences as well as Ground Truth Data Services for artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML)</li><li>Be a part of a company who strives to support for diversity and inclusion in the workplace – we are one, we are many at Qualitest. Celebrate culture, share knowledge with engineers from around the globe, and inspire each other through our differences. We have more than 40% women and around 120 different nationalities.</li><li>Local and global opportunities – we offer you internal rotation and international mobility opportunities to grow your career.</li><li>Clear view of your career and progression with the company – Qualitest is growing massively (since 2021 – tripled our employees base – we now have more than 8,000 engineers) and giving you the opportunity to grow with us.</li><li>Work hard and play harder with our flexible and casual culture. Take a break from work and join an employee event, or enjoy the amenities and games provided from one of our Employees Centers.</li><li>Never stop experimenting and learning with QCraft – our Learning &amp; Development platform: 50,000+ courses, 300+ virtual labs, mentorship and leadership programs, professional tribes, sponsored certifications, and much more</li><li>Earn bonuses via our Client Referral and Employee Referral Program’s. Refer and earn – tap your network for net-worth.</li><li>We recognize our employees work via our Qudos platform - You can earn bonuses and spot awards by celebrating your and your peers’ achievements.</li><li>A Competitive pay, the salary range for the role is $100K to $150K.</li><li>Save your earnings and prepare for your future by enrolling in our 401k plan where Qualitest will match your contributions accelerating your savings plan.</li><li>Life and disability insurance.</li><li>Take care of your health with enrollment into one of our competitive healthcare benefits.</li></ul>

jobs_titles: Software Engineer I/Software Engineer II/Software Engineer III
describtion: <strong>Company Description</strong><p><br></p>Hexagon Bio is leveraging its proprietary genomics-based platform and understanding of natural product evolution to develop the next generation of medicines for human disease. Hexagon Bio's algorithms identify biosynthetic gene clusters that encode the machinery needed to produce specialized metabolites that can be used to identify and modulate human disease targets. Our unique synthetic biology platform allows us to produce new chemical leads based on these findings. Hexagon's highly interdisciplinary platform uses data science, genomics, synthetic biology and automation to discover potent, evolutionarily refined small molecules and their cognate targets directly from fungal genomes.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>As a Software Engineer I/Software Engineer II/Software Engineer III at Hexagon Bio, your job will be to use modern software engineering to build the largest automated DNA sequencing and assembly pipeline in the world.<p><br></p>You will interface with our data, biology and chemistry teams, helping us build a machine to marry cutting edge sequencing and synthetic biology techniques with robots, cloud infrastructure, and the power of code to discover novel drugs to combat human disease. We are a small team, so we are looking for people who want to take a leadership role, helping us build a successful, next-generation drug company.<p><br></p><strong>Key Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>experience in software engineering, computer science, math, or a similar field</li><li>familiarity with data structures, storage systems, cloud infrastructure, and other technical tools</li><li>strong coder with extensive expertise in one or more programming languages such as python, JavaScript, Java, or something similar</li><li>experience in working with users covering a broad range of technical backgrounds</li><li>demonstrated ability to work independently and make decisions with minimal supervision</li><li>experience with statistics and/or machine learning is a plus</li><li>an interest in drug development and biotech is a plus</li><li>the flexibility to work at the early stages of a startup</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We Offer:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>A flexible and dynamic work environment, where you pave your own path; Hexagon cultivates the unique strengths of employees at all levels and provides mobility across departments. </li><li>Weekly "All Hands Meetings" provide an opportunity to share company and team updates. These meetings are rooted in our value of transparency, and designed to foster a culture of collaboration, curiosity, and open communication. </li><li>Competitive compensation and a robust benefits package: comprehensive suite of medical, dental, and vision insurance plans through TriNet, which offers additional voluntary benefits (pet insurance, accident insurance, home &amp; auto insurance, and more). </li><li>Equity and a 401(k) plan. </li><li>Rapid career advancement for driven performers. </li><li>Access to scientific conferences all over the country, throughout the year. </li><li>A range of amenities, courtesy of the Menlo Park Labs business park including: shuttle, gym, rock-climbing wall, pool, sports courts, cafe, bike lockers, and free EV charging stations. </li><li>Opportunities to engage with the Hexagon community through team-building events like our monthly Hexagon Happy Hour and holiday parties. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Additional Information</strong><p><br></p>The salary range is dependent on the level of Software Engineer (Level 1, 2, or 3) that is hired. The salary range for this full-time position is $115,000 - $175,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across California locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.<p><br></p>Hexagon Bio is an equal opportunity employer and committed to a diverse workplace. All applicants will be considered equally without regard to race, color, ethnicity, veteran status, religion, national origin, marital status, political affiliation, age, sex, sexual orientation, disability status, membership in an organization or any other non-merit factors.

The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space!<p><br></p>At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our outstanding skills and experiences to create, craft and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture supports employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, encouragement and focus and if you have the passion, we want to build a better tomorrow with you!<p><br></p>You will work real-time next generation payload flight software (FSW) development and integration, while using modern architectural concepts, model-based methodologies and software toolchains to deploy to critical code to existing single-core processors.<p><br></p>You will be responsible for developing and testing payload flight software in software-only and hardware/software environments, including execution of integration tests to validate hardware to software interfaces, software to software interfaces, and functionality. The job responsibilities include analyzing the hardware, software, and system requirements and implementation; developing and testing code utilizing Model Based Design approaches; establishing development and test tools; identifying and resolving anomalies during test on various software- and system-level platforms; identifying and implementing required software modifications and participating in technical reviews/audits of software products. You will primarily provide hands-on development and integration efforts along with perform software engineering in all phases of the software lifecycle following the program Software Development Plan (SDP) while employing an agile development paradigm.<p><br></p><strong><u>Here Are Some Of The Benefits You Can Enjoy</u></strong><p><br></p>To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin fosters an inclusive work environment that encourages differences and big-picture thinking. Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually.<p><br></p><ul><li> Medical</li><li> Dental</li><li> 401k</li><li> Paid time off</li><li> Work/life balance</li><li> Career development</li><li> Mentorship opportunities</li><li> Rewards &amp; recognition</li></ul><p><br></p>https://www.lockheedmartinjobs.com/working-here#benefits Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s competitive and comprehensive benefits package.

jobs_titles: Staff Data Engineer - Activision Blizzard Media
describtion: <strong>Craft:</strong><p><br></p>Technology &amp; Development<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Staff Data Engineer</strong><p><br></p>Activision Blizzard Media is the gateway for brands to the #1 cross-platform gaming company in the western world, with hundreds of millions of players across over 190 countries. Our legendary portfolio includes iconic mobile game franchises such as Candy Crush™, eSports opportunities like the Call of Duty® and Overwatch® Leagues, and some of the top PC and console gaming such as World of Warcraft®, Call of Duty®, and StarCraft®. The idea is simple: great game experiences offer great marketing experiences.<p><br></p>We are seeking a Staff Data Engineer in our Ads Engineering team, crafting ground breaking mobile advertising technologies to build the next generation of our Ads Platform.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design and build Data Pipelines to collect, transform, store, analyze, explore and visualize. </li><li>Craft and build cloud-based data lakes and data warehouses</li><li>Work with the product team to understand data sources, use cases and data models. </li><li>Choose the right technology stack to align with those use cases with scalability. </li><li>Collaborate with the other team members across different teams. </li><li>Develop alert &amp; monitoring systems and procedures for faster disaster recovery. </li><li>Provide technical directions and mentor other specialists and engineers</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BA/BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience. </li><li>Strong experience in Software Development in Java or Python</li><li>Working experience in building data warehouses and data lakes. </li><li>5+ years of demonstrated ability working with relational databases such as MySQL, Postgres etc. </li><li>2+ years of experience in NoSQL databases like Bigtable, Cassandra, HBase etc. </li><li>Expert level SQL skills and database performance concepts. </li><li>Experience in relational and dimensional data modeling. </li><li>Experience with developing extract-transform-load (ETL). </li><li>Understanding of distributed computing frameworks like Apache Spark and Flink. </li><li>Should be able to communicate and articulate their thought process optimally with team members. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience building data warehouse, data lake and data pipeline using Google Cloud Platform (GCP)</li><li>Experience with large scale distributed systems with large datasets. </li><li>Experience in distributed computing framework – Hadoop, Spark, Flink or Storm </li><li>Experience with messaging systems like Kafka and RabbitMQ</li><li>Knowledge of advertising platforms. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Rewards</strong><p><br></p>We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! Subject to eligibility requirements, the Company offers comprehensive benefits including:<p><br></p><ul><li>Medical, dental, vision, health savings account or health reimbursement account, healthcare spending accounts, dependent care spending accounts, life and AD&amp;D insurance, disability insurance;</li><li>401(k) with Company match, tuition reimbursement, charitable donation matching;</li><li>Paid holidays and vacation, paid sick time, floating holidays, compassion and bereavement leaves, parental leave;</li><li>Mental health &amp; wellbeing programs, fitness programs, free and discounted games, and a variety of other voluntary benefit programs like supplemental life & disability, legal service, ID protection, rental insurance, and others;</li><li>If the Company requires that you move geographic locations for the job, then you may also be eligible for relocation assistance. </li></ul><p><br></p>Eligibility to participate in these benefits may vary for part time and temporary full-time employees and interns with the Company. You can learn more by visiting https://www.benefitsforeveryworld.com/.<p><br></p>In the U.S., the standard base pay range for this role is $121,500.00 - $224,880.00 Annual. This base pay range is for the U.S. and is not applicable to locations outside of the U.S. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location. In addition to a competitive base pay, employees in this role may be eligible for incentive compensation. Incentive compensation is not guaranteed.<p><br></p><strong>About King</strong><p><br></p>King is the game developer behind the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as mobile game hits including Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch and Pet Rescue. Candy Crush is the top-grossing franchise in US app stores, a position it has held for the last two years, and King’s games are being played by 245 million monthly active users as of Q3 2021. King, which is part of the Activision Blizzard group since its acquisition in 2016, employs nearly 2,000 people in game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in San Francisco, New York, and Malta.<p><br></p><strong>A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes</strong><p><br></p>Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.<p><br></p><strong>Making the World Playful</strong><p><br></p>Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It’s what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid-core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players - and we’re not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!<p><br></p>Applications need to be in English.<p><br></p>Discover King at careers.king.com

Supernal is at the forefront of creating emerging mobility solutions that will foster the development of human-centered cities. We are designing a completely new electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft tailored to the mobility needs of future cities. This allows passengers a seamless intermodal journey that safely transports them to their final destination. We fuse research in autonomy, robotics, aviation and services to define a new category of mobility for the world’s communities. We believe in creative thinking and collaboration to help build a better mobility experience for everyone, improving people’s ability to move – whether for work or play.<p><br></p><strong>What we do: </strong><p><br></p>Data is the backbone of Supernal from developing our autonomous air vehicles to building the global ecosystem for advanced air mobility to building, scaling, and running an efficient, effective, and data driven business. The new Data team architects and manages UAM’s internal data infrastructure, partners with users across the company to enable data driven solutions and runs strategic projects to stay at the forefront of data and analytical capabilities. We are a team of data engineers, data architects, data scientists, data analysts, data you-name-it, and we’re building out a ground breaking data platform and capability for this new business comprised of modern leading technologies to enable the next generation of mobility solutions.<p><br></p>As a Sr. Platform Engineer, you are part cloud engineer, part database administrator with a strong focus on security and governance. You will be responsible for overseeing the heart of our data tech stack that delivers exciting and innovative internal data products. We want you to help us forge a new mobility eco-system and design the next generation of eVTOL aircraft. You will work within the digital operations group and partner with Engineering, Operations, R&amp;D, Strategy, Manufacturing, Supply Chain, and our leadership team. You will be a leading voice in our data strategy and its delivery.<p><br></p>This position will be required to work on-site 5 days a week.<p><br></p><strong>What you can do:</strong><p><br></p>Own and manage secure and governed database administration<p><br></p><ul><li>Partner with IT and Legal to design secure and automated processes and implement practices that enable data democracy and agility</li><li>Partner closely with critical team members (e.g., test and evaluation, systems engineering, simulations engineers, and more) to ensure safe and secure usage and transmission of our most critical data</li><li>Run, guide, and implement database administration responsibilities and continuously automate relevant processes</li></ul><p><br></p>Help build, manage, and scale our data platform capabilities<p><br></p><ul><li>Help design and build the data integrations for robust pipelines and serving business intelligence, analytics, and engineering needs</li><li>Work with data owners to design and implement role based, row level, and dynamic access control</li><li>Lead processes that ensure site reliability for our data stack.</li><li>Lead and guide standard processes around data governance, security, and quality</li><li>Architect scalable data solutions for Business, Engineering, and R&amp;D with Data colleagues</li><li>Work closely with data engineers, scientists, and analysts across the business</li></ul><p><br></p>Actively enable a data driven and innovative culture across the organization<p><br></p><ul><li>Communicate insights, plans, architecture, and technology decisions clearly and effectively to team members around the company</li><li>Design, prototype, and implement solutions for Engineering groups</li><li>Mentor and guide more junior team members</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What you can contribute:</strong> <ul><li>B.S. in relevant field such as computer science or information science required</li><li>5+ years of relevant work experience (an equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered)</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Excellent knowledge of software engineering fundamentals</li><li>Strong SQL skills</li><li>Strong programming skills with Python, Java, or Scala</li><li>Demonstrated experience in working with:</li><ul><li>Data storage solutions in an administrative capacity</li><li>SCM solutions (Bitbucket/Github/Gitlab)</li><li>Data technologies (e.g., Snowflake, Databricks, Palantir)</li><li>Small, agile teams with rapid growth</li></ul><li>Deep understanding of data management, administration, security, and access control processes and implementation</li><li>Experience and desire to set up data capabilities and platforms as well as managing them</li><li>Familiarity with Docker and K8s</li><li>Self-organizing and self-starting</li><li>Continuous learner, independent worker, and strong decision maker (with minimal supervision)</li><li>Collaborative teammate with dedication to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion</li><li>Experience in industry working with highly regulated data, i.e., aerospace, automotive, healthcare, finance</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>You may also be able to contribute:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Graduate degree in relevant field</li><li>Experience with Cloud-based services (AWS/Azure)</li><li>Experience working with export-controlled data</li><li>Experience with serving business intelligence feeds</li><li>Experience with Azure, Snowflake, and Databricks administration and Data Lakes</li><li>Understanding of CI/CD practices</li></ul><p><br></p>Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background check. describtion: <strong><u>Definition/Purpose</u></strong><p><br></p>Senior Data Analyst: Using complex information technology and analytical tools, and applying a deep knowledge of agency programs, policies, and procedures, oversee the integrity of agency data, program compliance, and process improvement. Collect, organize, and analyze data involved with organizational and functional studies, management information systems, enterprise software, and administrative systems and procedures. Identify workflow and process issues and concerns, and provide leadership and guidance to define system and process requirements that will optimize system performance and technology utilization by staff. Independently perform varied, complex, and difficult analytical work; prepare detailed reports and recommendations for the solution of complex problems. Develop and implement procedures.<p><br></p>Data Analyst: Using complex information technology and analytical tools, assist to oversee the integrity of agency data, program compliance, and process improvement. Collect, organize, and analyze data involved with organizational and functional studies, management information systems, enterprise software, and administrative systems and procedures. Identify workflow and process improvements, and provide recommendations to define system and process requirements that will optimize system performance and technology utilization by staff. Develop reports and tools within Agency software and databases. Independently perform varied, complex, and difficult analytical work; prepare detailed reports and recommendations for the solution of complex problems.

<strong>About Applied</strong><p><br></p>Autonomy is one of the leading technological advances of this century that will come to impact our lives. The work you'll do at Applied will meaningfully accelerate the efforts of the top autonomy teams in the world. At Applied, you will have a unique perspective on the development of cutting-edge technology while working with major players across the industry and the globe.<p><br></p>Applied Intuition provides software solutions to safely develop, test, and deploy autonomous vehicles at scale. The company's suite of simulation, validation, and drive log management software enables development teams to create thousands of scenarios in minutes, run simulations at scale, and verify and validate algorithms for production deployment. Headquartered in Silicon Valley with offices in Detroit, Washington, D.C., Munich, Stockholm, Seoul, and Tokyo, Applied consists of software, robotics, and automotive experts with experiences from top global companies. Leading autonomy programs and 17 of the top 20 global OEMs use Applied's solutions to bring autonomy to market faster.<p><br></p><strong>About The Role</strong><p><br></p>We are looking for bright engineers interested in designing elegant solutions to difficult problems in the autonomy space. Our software engineers work across our suite of products, tackling a variety of full-stack, infrastructure, robotics, and graphics challenges. At Applied, we encourage engineers to take ownership over technical and product decisions, closely interact with users to collect feedback, and contribute to a thoughtful, dynamic team culture.<p><br></p><strong>At Applied you will:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Work across our entire stack to develop new products, features, and tools for our customers' autonomy development workflows</li><li>Have an unparalleled opportunity to work with domain experts across a variety of fields: infrastructure, robotics, and graphics engineers, as well as startup veterans</li><li>Carve out your own area of expertise and influence product decisions</li><li>Collaborate with other members in the autonomy ecosystem and learn about different approaches to solving core issues in autonomy</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>We're looking for someone who:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Is a self-starter and can quickly become comfortable with new technical tools</li><li>Designs efficient and effective solutions to a wide range of engineering challenges</li><li>Takes initiative in a fast-paced environment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Nice to have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Working knowledge of frontend, API layer, database ORM, containerization, or cluster orchestration frameworks (such as React, GraphQL, SQLAlchemy, Docker, or Kubernetes)</li><li>Experience working with simulation tools, modeling physical problems, or using robotics middleware (such as ROS)</li></ul><p><br></p><em>Don't meet every single requirement? If you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.</em><p><br></p><em>Applicants will be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 upon commencing employment. Reasonable accommodations will be considered on a case-by-case basis for exemptions to this requirement in accordance with applicable federal and state law. Applicants should be aware that for external-facing roles that involve close contact with Company employees or other third parties on the Company's premises, accommodations that involve remaining unvaccinated against COVID-19 may not be deemed reasonable. The Company will engage in the interactive process on an individualized basis taking into account the particular position.</em><p><br></p><em>Applied Intuition is an equal opportunity employer and federal contractor or subcontractor. Consequently, the parties agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) and 41 CFR 60-741.5(a) and that these laws are incorporated herein by reference. These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans<br><br>or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin. These regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disability. The parties also agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of Executive Order 13496 (29 CFR Part 471, Appendix A to Subpart A), relating to the notice of employee rights under federal labor laws.</em>

This position focuses on information management - design of data architecture, moving data to the right place, monitoring quality, monitoring pipelines and systems.<p><br></p>Help Tarana build a world-class, high volume data system from the ground up! We have growing data-sets and several exciting Machine Learning systems to create or improve; including automated diagnosis of equipment; network anomaly detection and mitigation; and intelligent RF network optimization; and technical support automation using LLMs. We are looking for experienced Data Engineers who can hit the ground running, and help us make progress on these projects quickly.<p><br></p><strong><u>These Deliverables Will Focus On</u></strong><p><br></p>In your first year at Tarana, you will design highly scalable and performant systems. You will design and implement a detailed data architecture / data modeling, ELT pipelines as part of a fast moving, disciplined and methodical data team.<p><br></p><ul><li>Data Modeling </li><li>Pipeline design, implementation and deployment </li><li>Pipeline performance optimization </li><li>Cluster design and optimization </li><li>Query performance optimization </li><li>Data tool analysis and selection </li><li>Data preparation </li><li>Data monitoring and visualization </li><li>System integration</li></ul><p><br></p>You will work closely with cloud and device engineers, network engineers, DevOps engineers, domain experts and the Data Science team to implement your plan.<p><br></p>This is a hands-on technical role: you will be doing the heavy technical lifting as we grow the team. You must work well with others: you will need to interact with people across the organization to successfully build and maintain a high volume data architecture.<p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills &amp; Experience</u></strong><ul><li>BS or higher in Computer Science </li><li>5-12 years of experience building large scale, ML/AI models and systems </li><li>Strong skills in scripting languages (mainly python, bash) required </li><li>Scala experience a plus </li><li>Experience with AWS ecosystem </li><li>Experience with data integration tools, data governance tools and data quality tools </li><li>Experience with data warehousing and end-to-end data platforms such as DataBricks, Snowflake, BigQuery and/or Redshift/SageMaker </li><li>Highly collaborative, team-oriented approach </li><li>Passionate and excited about working in a fast moving startup with exciting projects and opportunities for growth</li></ul><p><br></p>The salary range for this position is: $130,000 to $175,000<p><br></p>Compensation will be determined based on several factors including, but not limited to: skill set, years of experience and the employee’s geographic location.<p><br></p>Tarana provides competitive benefits to employees in this role including: Medical, dental and vision benefits, 401K match, flexible time off and stock option.<p><br></p>Since our founding in 2009, we’ve been on a mission to accelerate the pace of bringing fast and affordable internet access — and all the benefits it provides — to the 90% of the world’s households who can’t get it. Through a decade of R&amp;D and more than $400M of investment, we’ve created an entirely unique next-generation fixed wireless access technology, powering our first commercial platform, Gigabit 1 (G1). It delivers a game-changing advance in broadband economics in both mainstream and underserved markets, using either licensed or unlicensed spectrum. G1 started production in mid 2021 and has now been installed by over 160 service providers globally. We’re headquartered in Milpitas, California, with additional research and development in Pune, India.<p><br></p>G1 has been developed by an incredibly talented and pioneering core technical team. We are looking for more world-class problem solvers who can carry on our tradition of customer obsession and ground-breaking innovation. We’re well funded, growing incredibly quickly, maintaining a superb results-focused culture while we’re at it, and all grooving on the positive difference we are making for people all over the planet. If you want to help make a real difference in this world, apply now! <p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

The ideal candidate will own data pipelines, investigate data infrastructure, system architecture/scalability, and integrate them with production-software for use within our cloud-based customer-facing infrastructure.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Work within the product team to understand key high-value problems in the enterprise sales productivity domain that can be solved by applying data science</li><li>Enable analytics and data science for delivering innovative solutions to complex business problems</li><li>Design data infrastructure architecture for driving large-scale machine learning algorithms</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>M.S. in computer science or a relevant technical field. </li><li>Minimum of 4-year industry experience in developing high-quality software.</li><li>Strong problem solving skills and algorithm scaling.</li><li>Top-notch in Java, and/or Scala based component development.</li><li>Familiar with SQL, NoSQL, data management and standard machine learning toolkit. </li><li>Knowledge of distributed machine learning platforms like Spark or TensorFlow is a plus.</li></ul>

What you'll be doing<p><br></p><ul><li>You'll be one of the first members of our Data team. Because Z!</li><li>Work closely with our engineers, data scientists and business analysts to optimize our data pipelines and establish best practices for table schemas, data models and data storage.</li><li>Design, build and operate a subset of our stack built on top of GCP and AWS using Kafka, FluentD, Airflow, Redshift and a bit of Python sprinkled in between.</li></ul>What you should have<p><br></p><ul><li>Proven ability to work with varied forms of data infrastructure including relational databases, Mapreduce/hadoop, and column stores (e.g. Vertica/Redshift).</li><li>Love to work with high volume heterogeneous data and preferably with distributed systems such as Hadoop, Storm or Redshift.</li><li>Experience building and maintaining scalable data infrastructure from scratch, including relational databases, real-time data processing and distributed systems.Qualifications</li><li>Proven track record of working with terabyte or petabyte-scale data infrastructure.</li><li>Hungry to be part of a hard working, fast paced startup.</li><li>Have previously crushed orcs. <p>Do you live and breathe databases? Do you forget time solving complex optimization problems? Do you enjoy rolling up your sleeves to work on hard systems projects? As a database engineer on Onehouse, you will work on the guts of Apache Hudi's transactional engine as well as optimize it for diverse customer workloads for Onehouse, by designing algorithms to improve the performance and lower costs for large-scale data processing.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Responsibilities</strong></p><ul><li>Design new concurrency control and transactional capabilities, that maximizes throughput for competing writers.</li><li>Design and implement new indexing schemes, specifically optimized for incremental data processing and analytical query performance.</li><li>Design systems that help scale and streamline metadata and data access from different query/compute engines.</li><li>Solve hard optimization problems to improve the efficiency (increase performance and lower cost) of distributed data processing algorithms over a Kubernetes cluster.</li><li>Leverage data from existing systems to find inefficiencies, and quickly build and validate prototypes.</li><li>Collaborate with other engineers to implement and deploy, safely rollout the optimized solutions in production.</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Skills</strong></p><ul><li>Strong, object-oriented design and coding skills (C/C++ and/or Java preferably on a UNIX or Linux platform)</li><li>Experience with inner workings of distributed (multi-tiered) systems, algorithms, and relational databases</li><li>Deal well with ambiguous/undefined problems; ability to think abstractly; articulate technical challenges and solutions</li><li>Speed and hustle → Ability to prioritize across feature development and tech debt.</li><li>Ability to solve complex programming/optimization problems.</li><li>Ability to quickly prototype optimization solutions and analyze large/complex data.</li><li>Good communication skills.</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Bonus Skills</strong></p><ul><li>Experience working with database systems, Query Engines or Spark codebases.</li><li>Experience in optimization mathematics (linear programming, nonlinear optimization)</li><li>Existing publications of optimizing large-scale data systems in top-tier distributed system conferences.</li><li>PhD degree with 2+ industrial experience in solving and delivering high-impact optimization projects.</li></ul>

<strong>About Onehouse<br><br></strong>Onehouse delivers a new bedrock for your data, through a cloud-native managed lakehouse service built on an open, interoperable, industry-proven technology. Founded by a former Uber data architect and the creator of Apache Hudi, Onehouse accelerates the inevitable transition of the data lake into a lakehouse, unlocking incremental processing to replace old-school batch processing on the lake. Onehouse makes it possible to blend the ease of use of a warehouse with the scale of a data lake into a fully managed product. ability to think abstractly; articulate technical challenges and solutions</li><li>Speed and hustle → Ability to prioritize across feature development and tech debt.</li><li>Ability to solve complex programming/optimization problems.</li><li>Ability to quickly prototype optimization solutions and analyze large/complex data.</li><li>Good communication skills.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Bonus Skills<br></strong><ul><li>Experience working with database systems, Query Engines or Spark codebases.</li><li>Experience in optimization mathematics (linear programming, nonlinear optimization)</li><li>Existing publications of optimizing large-scale data systems in top-tier distributed system conferences.</li><li>PhD degree with 2+ industrial experience in solving and delivering high-impact optimization projects.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Who We Are<br><br></strong>At Onehouse, our mission is to aid companies of all sizes in supercharging their data engineering/data science, by automating painful data infrastructure buildout. Come help build this unicorn-to-be!

<u>Current Employees of LendingClub: Please apply via your internal Workday Account<br><br></u>LendingClub Corporation (NYSE: LC) is the parent company of LendingClub Bank, National Association, Member FDIC, and the only full-spectrum fintech marketplace bank. Members can gain access to a broad range of financial products and services through a technology-driven platform, designed to help them pay less when borrowing and earn more when saving. Since 2007, more than 4 million members have joined the Club to help reach their financial goals. We’re leading the governance of a new industry by developing ethical, responsible ways to bring greater value and better opportunities to our members. Everyone deserves a better financial future and our team is committed to making that a reality. Come join us!<br><br><strong><u>About The Role<br><br></u></strong>Our mission at LendingClub is to empower those who strive to achieve better financial health. Data Platform team plays a crucial role in achieving our mission.<br><br>We are seeking a Principal Engineer for our Data Platform to provide batch data processing, realtime streaming, pipeline orchestration, data lake management, data cataloging capabilities and deliver data on time with quality, supported by metrics. As a key player of our data platform team, you will have opportunity to use your expertise to lead in solving big data problems, architecture, design, coding and analytical skills to build core capabilities, frameworks and data pipelines and leverage our PB scale data with confidence.<br><br><br><br>What You'll Do<br><br><ul><li>Provide technical leadership to the team and work with business partners and product teams in translating requirements to technical approach with pragmatic and sound architecture, design and implementation.</li><li>You will build systems, core capabilities and frameworks that power all our batch and streaming data pipelines. The services you build will integrate directly with LendingClub’s products, opening the door to new features.</li><li>You will work with open-source technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Scala, Python, Airflow etc and Cloud technologies across AWS stack.</li><li>You will understand how LendingClub’s data is used and what it all means.</li><li>Build data pipelines that transform raw data into canonical schema representing business entities and publish into the Data Lake.</li><li>Build data pipelines to process data in the Data Lake to create specific business feeds as per functional requirements from various business units.</li><li>Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, reduce Cloud cost, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.</li><li>Work with stakeholders including the Business, Product, Program and Engineering teams to deliver required data in time with high quality at reasonable cost.</li><li>Implement processes and systems to validate and monitor data quality and support operations to manage the production environment and help in resolving production issues with RCA.</li><li>Write unit/integration tests, adopt Test-driven development, contribute to engineering wiki, and document design/implementation etc.<br></li></ul><strong><u><br>About You<br><br></u></strong><ul><li>You are able to build and understand the big picture and contextualize current requirements and solutions.</li><li>You have excellent listening skills and empathetic to others.</li><li>You believe in simple and elegant solutions and give paramount importance to quality.</li><li>You have a track record of building fast, reliable, efficient and high-quality data pipelines.</li><li>Passionate with good understanding of data, with a focus on having fun, while delivering incredible business results.<br></li></ul><strong><u>What You’ll Need To Succeed<br><br></u></strong>Must have skills:<br><ul><li>B.S., M.S. degree in computer science or a related field or equivalent work experience.</li><li>Strong hands-on experience in distributed systems, Hadoop/MapReduce, Spark, Scala, SQL, Hive, Kafka and pipeline orchestration.</li><li>At least 10 years of solid production quality coding experience in data pipeline implementation in Java, Scala and Python.</li><li>At least 5 years of demonstrated technical leadership in building systems from requirements to delivery.</li><li>Experience working with public cloud platforms, preferably AWS.</li><li>Familiar with Agile methodology, test-driven development, source control management and test automation.</li><li>Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment<br></li></ul><strong><u>Nice To Have Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Working experience with AWS EMR (Hadoop), AWS MSAA (Airflow), and AWS MSK(Kafka).</li><li>Implementation of streaming data pipelines.</li><li>Working knowledge of open-source ML frameworks and end-to-end model development life cycle.</li><li>Previous working experience with running containers (Docker/LXC) in a production environment using one of the container orchestration services (Kubernetes, Docker Swarm, AWS ECS, AWS EKS).<br></li></ul><strong>Work Location<br><br></strong>San Francisco<br><br>We are currently working a hybrid schedule and our teams are in-office Tuesdays and Wednesdays.<br><br><strong><u>Time Zone Requirements<br><br></u></strong>Primarily PT.<br><br><strong><u>Travel Requirements<br><br></u></strong>If you need to travel for work, LendingClub will cover your travel related expenses.<br><br><strong><u>Compensation<br><br></u></strong>The target base salary range for this position is 195,000-230,000 . The position is also eligible to receive a bonus (which is based on company performance, employee performance and eligible earnings), equity, and benefits. Our salary ranges, other compensation and benefits offered are determined by role, experience level and location.<br><br>We’re creating new financial services solutions for our members based on fairness, simplicity, and heart, and we treat our employees the same way. Supernal is at the forefront of creating emerging mobility solutions that will foster the development of human-centered cities. We are designing a completely new electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft tailored to the mobility needs of future cities. This allows passengers a seamless intermodal journey that safely transports them to their final destination. We fuse research in autonomy, robotics, aviation and services to define a new category of mobility for the world’s communities. We believe in creative thinking and collaboration to help build a better mobility experience for everyone, improving people’s ability to move – whether for work or play.<p><br></p><strong>What we do: </strong><p><br></p>Data is the backbone of Supernal from developing our autonomous air vehicles to building the global ecosystem for advanced air mobility to building, scaling, and running an efficient, effective, and data driven business. The new Data team architects and manages UAM’s internal data infrastructure, partners with users across the company to enable data driven solutions and runs strategic projects to stay at the forefront of data and analytical capabilities. We are a team of data engineers, data architects, data scientists, data analysts, data you-name-it, and we’re building out a ground breaking data platform and capability for this new business comprised of modern leading technologies to enable the next generation of mobility solutions.<p><br></p>As a Platform Engineer, you are part cloud engineer, part database administrator with a strong focus on security and governance. You will be responsible for overseeing the heart of our data tech stack that delivers exciting and innovative internal data products. We want you to help us forge a new mobility eco-system and design the next generation of eVTOL aircraft. You will work within the digital operations group and partner with Engineering, Operations, R&amp;D, Strategy, Manufacturing, Supply Chain, and our leadership team. agility</li><li>Partner closely with critical team members (e.g., test and evaluation, systems engineering, simulations engineers, and more) to ensure safe and secure usage and transmission of our most critical data</li><li>Run, guide, and implement database administration responsibilities and continuously automate relevant processes</li></ul><p><br></p>Help build, manage, and scale our data platform capabilities<p><br></p><ul><li>Help design and build the data integrations for robust pipelines and serving business intelligence, analytics, and engineering needs</li><li>Work with data owners to design and implement role based, row level, and dynamic access control</li><li>Lead processes that ensure site reliability for our data stack.</li><li>Lead and guide standard processes around data governance, security, and quality</li><li>Architect scalable data solutions for Business, Engineering, and R&amp;D with Data colleagues</li><li>Work closely with data engineers, scientists, and analysts across the business</li></ul><p><br></p>Actively enable a data driven and innovative culture across the organization<p><br></p><ul><li>Communicate insights, plans, architecture, and technology decisions clearly and effectively to team members around the company</li><li>Design, prototype, and implement solutions for Engineering groups</li><li>Mentor and guide more junior team members</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What you can contribute:</strong> <ul><li>B.S. in relevant field such as computer science or information science required</li><li>15+ years of relevant work experience (an equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered)</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Excellent knowledge of software engineering fundamentals</li><li>Strong SQL skills</li><li>Strong programming skills with Python, Java, or Scala</li><li>Demonstrated experience in working with:</li><ul><li>Data storage solutions in an administrative capacity</li><li>SCM solutions (Bitbucket/Github/Gitlab)</li><li>Data technologies (e.g., Snowflake, Databricks, Palantir)</li><li>Small, agile teams with rapid growth</li></ul><li>Deep understanding of data management, administration, security, and access control processes and implementation</li><li>Experience and desire to set up data capabilities and platforms as well as managing them</li><li>Familiarity with Docker and K8s</li><li>Self-organizing and self-starting</li><li>Continuous learner, independent worker, and strong decision maker (with minimal supervision)</li><li>Collaborative teammate with dedication to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion</li><li>Experience in industry working with highly regulated data, i.e., aerospace, automotive, (AWS/Azure)</li><li>Experience working with export-controlled data</li><li>Experience with serving business intelligence feeds</li><li>Experience with Azure, Snowflake, and Databricks administration Our office is located in Mountain View, within walking distance to the Caltrain station. Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborate closely with senior leaders to understand business objectives, identify opportunities, and develop data-driven strategies aligned with our overall consensus and action</li><li>Drive the development of data models, reporting dashboards, experimentation and visualizations that provide meaningful insights to the whole organization</li><li>Champion methodologies, tools, and technologies, and make recommendations for their application within the organization</li><li>Mentor and coach junior data analysts, fostering their growth and supporting their professional development<br></li></ul><p><br></p>The Right Fit:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree (Master’s degree or higher preferred) in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research or related fields</li><li>6+ years of experience in data science, analytics or engineering roles (preferably at a scaling company)</li><li>Expertise in relational database modeling and
