describtion: <strong>About Column<br><br></strong>For companies building financial technology and transforming the financial services space, the biggest bottleneck to their growth and innovation is often the underlying banks and infrastructure stack they rely on. We have spent our careers founding and scaling companies like Plaid, Square, SoFi, Blend, and Affirm, and have seen this problem firsthand — builders and developers needing to partner with traditional banks, and creating API and abstraction layers over the patchwork that is the bank, its core, and many other vendors. All of this results in a complex (and often expensive) banking supply chain involving a user, fintech, BaaS middleware provider, bank, core and the Federal Reserve.<br><br>At Column, we set out to simplify and fix this. We are a bank and a software company built from the ground up, offering builders and developers technology-forward banking solutions that cut out the hundreds of vendors, middleware providers, and abstraction layers. This means a safer, more transparent, and less costly banking supply chain. Come build with us!<br><br>The opportunity<br><br>We’re a lean and experienced team. We like our current size of six engineers. For an excellent candidate we’re open to hiring one or two more. We write mostly Go, but experience there isn’t that important....it’s a pretty easy language to learn. We generally prefer candidates with at least five years of production coding experience at a high caliber and high velocity team. We’ll require a take-home that does take time, so if that’s a non-starter for you we’re sorry. We find it the best way for you to show your skills, without being overly burdensome on the team!<br><br><strong>We look forward to hearing from you<br><br></strong>Column is committed to working with the best and brightest people from the broadest talent pool possible. We value bringing together a team with different perspectives, educational backgrounds, and life experiences, and believe a diversity of ideas is what allows us to develop the best solutions. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.<br><br>If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation during the application and recruiting process, please reach out to accommodations@column.com.<br><br>We participate in the E-Verify program in certain locations as required by law. Learn more about the E-Verify program here.

<strong>About Applied</strong><p><br></p>Autonomy is one of the leading technological advances of this century that will come to impact our lives. The work you'll do at Applied will meaningfully accelerate the efforts of the top autonomy teams in the world. At Applied, you will have a unique perspective on the development of cutting-edge technology while working with major players across the industry and the globe.<p><br></p>Applied Intuition provides software solutions to safely develop, test, and deploy autonomous vehicles at scale. The company's suite of simulation, validation, and drive log management software enables development teams to create thousands of scenarios in minutes, run simulations at scale, and verify and validate algorithms for production deployment. Headquartered in Silicon Valley with offices in Detroit, Washington, D.C., Munich, Stockholm, Seoul, and Tokyo, Applied consists of software, robotics, and automotive experts with experiences from top global companies. Leading autonomy programs and 17 of the top 20 global OEMs use Applied's solutions to bring autonomy to market faster.<p><br></p><strong>About The Role</strong><p><br></p>We are looking for a senior engineer to own and maintain our HD maps infrastructure. Our product suite uses HD maps to solve our customers' needs in a multitude of applications: calculating localized information, querying data across global-sized maps, as well as visualizing and inspecting maps. This role will have the opportunity to build the future of our maps by collaborating with engineers as well as customers.<p><br></p><strong>At Applied, you will:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Own our maps infrastructure across all of our products</li><li>Define our map storage format to handle more features and distribute map data focusing on UIs, data pipelines and storage, and SDKs </li><li>Collaborate with engineers and customers on existing and future designs and features</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>We're looking for someone who has:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience building software components or (sub) systems that address real-world mapping and localization challenges</li><li>Experience working in either autonomous vehicles or simulation products</li><li>Working knowledge of C++ and/or Python</li></ul><p><br></p>The salary range for this position is $65,000 USD to $400,000 USD annually. This salary range is an estimate, and the actual salary may vary based on the Company's compensation practices.<p><br></p><em>Don't meet every single requirement? If you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.</em><p><br></p><em>Applicants will be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 upon commencing employment. Reasonable accommodations will be considered on a case-by-case basis for exemptions to this requirement in accordance with applicable federal and state law. Applicants should be aware that for external-facing roles that involve close contact with Company employees or other third parties on the Company's premises, accommodations that involve remaining unvaccinated against COVID-19 may not be deemed reasonable. The Company will engage in the interactive process on an individualized basis taking into account the particular position.</em><p><br></p><em>Applied Intuition is an equal opportunity employer and federal contractor or subcontractor. Consequently, the parties agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) and 41 CFR 60-741.5(a) and that these laws are incorporated herein by reference. These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans<br><br>or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin. These regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disability. The parties also agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of Executive Order 13496 (29 CFR Part 471, Appendix A to Subpart A), relating to the notice of employee rights under federal labor laws.</em>

Etleap came to be out of the frustration with how much effort is required to build and maintain robust data pipelines. We want to make data pipelines easy for data engineers and analysts, and so we are creating an intuitive ETL/ELT tool that makes it quick to integrate data from any source without writing code, and efficient to manage hundreds or thousands of data pipelines.<p><br></p>We are looking to add engineers to our core engineering team to build the infrastructure that modern data teams depend on to create and operate their analytics infrastructure! It shouldn’t take a CS degree to build great data pipelines, and abstracting away the difficult parts is our mission.<p><br></p>Are you ready for the challenge?<p><br></p>What you are going to do: - Solve challenging engineering problems related to the performance and robustness of distributed systems infrastructure - Come up with novel ideas on how to make complex data technology user-friendly, and then turn those ideas into software - Be part of the team that builds the next generation of ETL/ELT infrastructure<p><br></p>What we want to see in you: - You are drawn to and have experience solving challenging engineering problems - You build robust and scalable data systems three times as fast as other developers - Coding in Java is second nature to you - You’re living in or willing to work in San Francisco - You’re excited to work in a scrappy environment - You’re down to earth and fun to be around. This is an absolute must!<p><br></p>Big plus if you have the following: - Experience working in a startup engineering team - Working knowledge of S3, EMR, Terraform, and Docker - Know the ins and outs of current big data frameworks like Hadoop, Spark, or Flink, but this is not an absolute requirement - you’re a quick learner!<p><br></p>*** This role is open to individuals living in San Francisco. The role is in-house, working from our SF office ***

San Ramon is the current lab, but the team will be moving a few miles to Dublin in May.<br><br><strong><u>Top Things<br></u></strong><ul><li>IoT (Internet of Things) experience</li><li>Hands on engineering experience</li><li>software / data experience.</li><li>Client laptop will be provided and all necessary computer equipment.<br></li></ul>The Data / IoT engineer will be on a team developing a system to help monitor our extensive service territory of environmental risks. They must also have knowledge of sensors, machine learning and AI and must have experience in working with front-end and back-end systems as well as custom-built firmware and hardware.<br><br><strong><u>Qualifications<br><br></u></strong><strong> Minimum<br></strong><ul><li>BA/BS in Business, Engineering, Computer Science/Information Systems or equivalent</li><li>1-3 years of mixed experience in IoT – architecture, development, system administration and operations</li><li>Ability to work independently, and hands on</li><li>Ability to be creative.</li><li>Firm understanding of IoT architecture and principles.</li><li>Proficient knowledge of sensors</li><li>In-depth understanding of computer programming and network security</li><li>Knowledge of machine learning and AI</li><li>Familiarity with Big Data and machine learning algorithms</li><li>Knowledge of device and data security</li><li>Experience working with front-end and back-end systems.</li><li>Experience with custom-build firmware and hardware.</li><li>Well-versed with multiple programming languages such as Embedded-C, Embedded C++, JavaScript and Python</li><li>Work and collaborate well with teams</li><li>Strong communication skills</li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills<br></li></ul><strong> Desired<br></strong><ul><li>3-5 years of experience within any area of Electric Operations in the electric utility industry</li><li>3-5 years of experience with IoT development and installations.<br></li></ul>Thanks,<br><br><strong>Murali Potugari<br><br></strong><strong>732-272-0284 | murali.p@sunrisesys.com</strong>

Rhombus is purposefully transforming the nation's defense and national security enterprises with Guardian, its Artificial Intelligence platform for strategic, operational, and tactical decision-making at the speed of relevance.<p><br></p>We are looking for people who are driven by a sense of purpose. In this role, you will serve as a <strong>Data Engineer </strong>to solve our customer's uniquely complex problems. We expect you to be a systems-level thinker and a real doer. You will excel in this role if you are hungry to make a difference and are intellectually bold. And we sure hope that you smile when you hear our clients say, "If we can dream it, Rhombus can do it."<p><br></p>Come join our cross-disciplinary and world-class team of technologists who are working hard every day to deliver game-changing solutions to transform national security.<p><br></p><strong>Location</strong><p><br></p>Palo Alto, CA<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>Rhombus' <strong>Data Engineers</strong> are instrumental in designing and implementing data engineering activities on topical, mission-driven projects that inform our national security agenda. They analyze, build, and maintain our organization's data infrastructure and processing systems. As a <strong>Data Engineer, </strong>you'll perform various code development and query needs for integration with new and existing applications, dashboards and machine learning pipelines. You'll work cross functionally with other departments and utilize your skills at all stages of the analytics pipeline to create results that drive business values and customer success! You'll be asked to travel to client sites where you'll engage and collaborate directly with the client to discuss data pipelines, solutioning, and to ensure a strong client connection.<p><br></p>This role will require travel to client sites in Honolulu, HI; Omaha, NE and/or Colorado Springs, CO. Frequency will depend on business needs and may vary at times but can be upwards of twice per month. Last minute notice to travel to client sites may be given at times.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop code using various programming and scripting languages to automate data ingestion and improve data management processes. </li><li>Architect data repositories, stand up data platforms and develop data pipelines for ingestion, transformation, and aggregation. </li><li>Review existing architecture, data strategy, and improve processes for data governance, data quality, and metadata management. </li><li>Extract and analyze raw data from multiple data sources via APIs, SQL Stored Procedures, or Python scripts. </li><li>Ability to develop scripts and programs for converting various types of data into usable formats and support project team to scale, monitor and operate data platforms. </li><li>Collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team of analysts, data scientists, data engineers, developers, and data consumers in a fast-paced, agile environment. </li><li>You'll use your experience in analytical exploration and data examination while you manage the assessment, design, building, and maintenance of scalable platforms for clients. </li><li>Communicate project status and results to various levels of leadership. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>A Bachelor's degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems/Sciences, or other relevant area (or equivalent experience) and at least 1 year of professional experience, or a Master's degree with strong academic project experience. </li><li>Experience with 1 or more programming and scripting languages, with a strong focus on Python, Pandas and Numpy. Other languages include: Shell, PERL, Java, C/C++/C#, Scala, etc. </li><li>Experience with 1 or more of the following relational, noSQL and/or file based storage (e.g. MYSQL, MongoDB, SQL Server, Oracle, Postgres, Hbase, DynamoDB, etc.)</li><li>Experience building and maintaining ETL data pipelines</li><li>Experience with software development life cycle including testing, documenting, delivery and support</li><li>Working knowledge of AWS/cloud technologies</li><li>Experience using query optimization as well as data modeling techniques. </li><li>Familiarity with machine learning frameworks (such as TensorFlow, Scikit-Learn, etc.)</li><li>The ability to obtain and maintain a US security clearance. U.S. citizenship is required as only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearance</li><li>Must be eligible for Secret clearance and for TS/SCI</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Personal Qualities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to contextualize data as it relates to Rhombus' vision. We want someone who can understand the "why" and "so what", and not just the "how". Our Data Engineers help us transmit the enthusiasm we have around the data work to the individuals doing that work. </li><li>Must have strong problem-solving skills and demonstrated excellent oral and written communication skills. </li><li>We're seeking folks with strong intellectual curiosity and creativity, with an ability and willingness to learn new skills and apply novel solutions to problems. </li><li>Comfort in a fast-paced start-up environment is crucial, with the ability to consistently revise your approach in response to new information, and to be flexible and adaptive. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Full medical, dental, vision coverage for employee and dependents</li><li>401k matching program</li><li>PTO and Holidays</li><li>Bonus and other incentive programs</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Rhombus</strong><p><br></p>Rhombus Power Inc. (Rhombus) is a NASA Research Park startup located in the heart of Silicon Valley at Stanford Research Park in Palo Alto. We use cutting-edge cross-disciplinary approaches to solve pressing Big Data and Sensing problems in security, energy and healthcare. Our advisory board includes two Nobel Laureates and a Draper Prize winner.<p><br></p>Rhombus compensates, motivates, and develops employees, who are trusted, empowered, and involved. Employees have clear roles and expectations – and their roles are flexible enough to move at the speed of innovation in order to meet and exceed client expectations. We have a unique culture of global purpose, rooted in the innovation and progress of Silicon Valley.<p><br></p>Rhombus knows that diversity is a condition for success. We are committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

Meta is embarking on the most transformative change to its business and technology in company history, and our Machine Learning Engineers are at the forefront of this evolution. By leading crucial projects and initiatives that have never been done before, you have an opportunity to help us advance the way people connect around the world. The ideal candidate will have industry experience working on a range of recommendation, classification, and optimization problems. You will bring the ability to own the whole ML life cycle, define projects and drive excellence across teams. You will work alongside the world’s leading engineers and researchers to solve some of the most exciting and massive social data and prediction problems that exist on the web.<p><br></p>Software Engineer, Machine Learning Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Leading projects or small teams of people to help them unblock, advocating for ML excellence</li><li>Adapt standard machine learning methods to best exploit modern parallel environments (e.g. distributed clusters, multicore SMP, and GPU)</li><li>Develop highly scalable classifiers and tools leveraging machine learning, data regression, and rules based models</li><li>Suggest, collect and synthesize requirements and create effective feature roadmaps</li><li>Code deliverables in tandem with the engineering team</li></ul><p><br></p>Minimum Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years of experience in software engineering or a relevant field. 3+ years of experience if you have a PhD</li><li>1+ years of experience in one or more of the following areas: machine learning, recommendation systems, pattern recognition, data mining, artificial intelligence, or a related technical field</li><li>Experience with developing machine learning models at scale from inception to business impact</li><li>Knowledge developing and debugging in C/C++ and Java, or experience with scripting languages such as Python, Perl, PHP, and/or shell scripts</li><li>Track record of setting technical direction for a team, driving consensus and successful cross-functional partnerships</li><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience.</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>Masters degree or PhD in Computer Science or a related technical field</li><li>Exposure to architectural patterns of large scale software applications</li></ul><p><br></p>Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. You may view our Equal Employment Opportunity notice here. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Forward is on a bold mission to make high quality healthcare available to a billion people across the globe. We’re building the world’s most advanced healthcare platform from the ground up, combining hardware, software and doctors under one roof. We are scaling our engineering team and looking for world-class engineers with experience and expertise in building robust, scalable APIs and integrating third-party systems. As an early member of our engineering team, you’ll play a key role in building the future of healthcare from first principles.<br><br>Forward was founded in January 2016 by former executives and engineering leaders from Google and Uber. We are funded by some of the world's best investors and entrepreneurs including Founder's Fund, Khosla Ventures, First Round Capital, Eric Schmidt (Google/Alphabet Chairman), Marc Benioff (Salesforce Founder), Joe Lonsdale (Palantir Founder), Joshua Kushner (Oscar co-Founder) and Garrett Camp (Uber co-Founder).<br><br><strong><u>Press And Videos<br><br></u></strong>Virtual Tour of Forward [YouTube]<br><br>Health Moves Forward [CEO Blog Post]<br><br>Series D Funding Funds Doctor-led Programs [TechCrunch]<br><br>Forward - What Quality Healthcare Should Look Like [Mashable]<br><br>Primary Care Start-ups Vying for 170B Market [Business Insider]<br><br>The Pivot to Virtual Care [Chief Medical Officer @ Stanford Medicine]<br><br>The Meaning of Trans Broken-Arm Syndrome [USA Today]<br><br><strong><u>What You'll Do<br></u></strong><ul><li>Design and evolve our cloud data infrastructure for 10x data growth.</li><li>Own foundational datasets used by teams across the company.</li><li>Build platforms that empower non-engineers to create data pipelines and data products.</li><li>Invest in tools that proactively measure, monitor, and improve data quality and accessibility.</li><li>Own entire projects while working alongside cross-functional teams of doctors, designers, and operators.</li><li>Your work will directly contribute to saving and improving people’s lives. For real. :)<br></li></ul><strong><u>What We're Looking For<br></u></strong><ul><li>Data Engineering - You have firsthand experience with database performance tuning, cloud storage and processing technologies (e.g. Redshift, S3, Glue, Lambda, Databricks, DBT), workflow orchestration (e.g. Dagster, Airflow), distributed computing (e.g. Spark, EMR), message queues and streams (e.g. Kafka, Kinesis). </li><li>Good Practices - You care about more than just shipping data, but also doing it in a scalable, efficient, reliable, and secure way.</li><li>Empathy - You spend time understanding the needs, and driving alignment among different data users.</li><li>Entrepreneurship - You’re a self-starter who loves to own things end-to-end. You are excited to try out new technologies and build proof-of-concepts.</li><li>Team player - You know how to make those around you better and feed off their energy. You take care of your teammates.</li><li>You have a BS or MS in computer science or a related technical field.</li><li>You have a minimum of 3 years experience working in a related field.<br></li></ul>The base salary range for this full-time position is $100,000-$220,000, plus equity and benefits. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by factors including job-related skills, experience, relevant education or training, and location.<br><br><strong>WHY JOIN FORWARD?<br><br></strong>We don’t want to just move dollars around the healthcare industry - we want to rebuild it and fix it. All of it. You’d be a major part of the story behind one of the most ambitious startup attempts of the past decade and you’d work with a team of people who want to use their talents for good.<br><br>We are an equal opportunity employer. In accordance with anti-discrimination law, it is the purpose of this policy to effectuate these principles and mandates. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We conform to the spirit as well as to the letter of all applicable laws and regulations. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.<br><br>Information collected and processed as part of any job application you choose to submit is subject to Forward’s Privacy Notice to California Job Applicants .

About the Role:<p><br></p>As Dexterity’s Software Engineer - Data Platform, you will be responsible for building highly reliable applications that serve critical business metrics to internal and external customers to showcase the power of Dexterity’s Robot Platform and to drive the growth of the business. You will be building near real time data processing systems to collect and process robot telemetry data to generate these business insights.<p><br></p>About Dexterity:<p><br></p>At Dexterity, we believe robots can positively transform the world. Our breakthrough technology frees people to do the creative, inspiring, problem-solving jobs that humans do best by enabling robots to handle repetitive and physically difficult work.<p><br></p>We’re starting with warehouse automation, where the need for smarter, more resilient supply chains impacts millions of lives and businesses around the world. Dexterity's full-stack robotics systems pick, move, pack, and collaborate with human-like skill, awareness, and learning capabilities. Our systems are software-driven, hardware-agnostic, and have already picked over 15 million goods in production. And did we mention we’re customer-obsessed? Every decision, large and small, is driven by one question – how can we empower our customers with robots to do more than they thought was possible?<p><br></p>Dexterity is one of the fastest growing companies in robotics, backed by world-class investors such as Kleiner Perkins, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Obvious Ventures. We’re a diverse and multidisciplinary team with a culture built on passion, trust, and dedication. Come join Dexterity and help make intelligent robots a reality!<p><br></p>Day to Day Activities:<p><br></p>Design and deploy software to ingest, process and analyze the data generated by 1000 of robots and robotic systems.<p><br></p>Design and Develop APIs and backend systems to expose business critical data.<p><br></p>Design, Build, analyze and scale data processing pipelines that meet the defined SLIs.<p><br></p>Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive company wide OKRs.<p><br></p>Evangelize the observability stack and other data systems and increase adoption.<p><br></p>Desired Skills:<p><br></p>Degree in Computer Science or related technical discipline, or related practical experience.<p><br></p>Proficiency in any programming language: Golang, Java or Python.<p><br></p>Comfortable working with a lot of data: collection, storage, analysis.<p><br></p>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.<p><br></p>Familiarity with a wide array of software stack technologies such as Relational and NoSql Datastores, Real time processing systems: Flink/Spark, PubSub Systems, Rest APIs/GRPC, Workflow orchestration systems, Public Cloud<p><br></p>Experience with algorithms and data structures<p><br></p>Equal Opportunity Employer:<p><br></p>We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote - Work from anywhere (TimeZone: CST | Partial overlap)</li><li>HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $125 – $150/hr </li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 30h/week - Long term </li><li>BRAINTRUST JOB ID: 6961 </li></ul> <strong><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY</strong></strong> <strong><strong>Requirements</strong></strong> <strong><strong>Job description</strong></strong> <strong> Our client is looking for a talented data engineer who can help us build an internal database. The project involves working with several datasets, entity resolution to create mappings across those datasets, creating derived metrics and data concepts, and then connecting this data to a new internal UI that they are building. </strong> <strong> Fast-moving startup looking to build something exciting and dynamic, and they are looking for someone to join the team and match our energy. </strong> <strong><strong>Must haves<br></strong></strong><ul><li> SQL </li><li> Python </li><li> ETL Superstar </li></ul> <strong> A good understanding of <strong>Snowflake</strong> will be excellent in this position as well. </strong> <strong><strong>What you’ll be working on</strong></strong> <strong><strong>Company Overview</strong></strong> <strong> Our client is a founder-focused seed-stage venture firm combined with an industry-grade therapeutics accelerator focused on one thing: helping entrepreneurial founders launch viable therapeutics companies. The company does this by giving founders access to a team of the world’s best drug hunters and drug makers, seed capital, and best-of-breed services - everything a founder needs to get from concept to a compelling quality dataset that enables an awesome Series A financing. In a nutshell, they want founders in control of their own companies and focused on their expertise and creativity while they help make the rest happen smoothly. </strong> <strong><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong></strong>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

✏️ About the Role Responsibilities include: ⁃ Backend Development: Handle data processing and develop infrastructure to increase the performance of search algorithms in the Sonnet product ⁃ Web Development: Help build web-based tools and applications to improve our products and do more for our customers. ⁃ Our developers are responsible for crafting the direction of our products by considering the architecture, performance, testing, design, and implementation.<br><br>🦄️ Your Impact ⁃ Help lay out the foundational elements of Sonnet’s platform ⁃ Develop robust and fast infrastructure that directly impacts product performance ⁃ Define our engineering culture and build a world-class team with us<br><br>✨ Qualifications ⁃ Strong object-oriented design skills, coupled with a deep knowledge of data structures and algorithms ⁃ Knowledge of scalable software design patterns and experience using tools like message brokers and load balancers ⁃ Proficiency in one or more of the following developer skills: C/C++, Python, NodeJS, React, Express ⁃ Experience in sophisticated data-related methodologies like Data Modeling, Validation, Processing, Hadoop, MapReduce, Mongo<br><br>⁃ A fundamental knowledge of embedded processors, with in-depth knowledge of real time operating system concepts ⁃ Excellent debugging and critical thinking skills ⁃ Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills ⁃ Ability to work in a fast paced environment

<strong>Senior Data Engineer</strong><p><br></p>We are seeking a senior data engineer to join our data science team. You will combine software engineering, algorithm/architecture design, agile development to derive meaningful results in our problem space domain. The ideal candidate will own data pipelines, investigate data infrastructure, system architecture/scalability, and integrate them with production-software for use within our cloud-based customer-facing infrastructure.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Work within the product team to understand key high-value problems in the enterprise sales productivity domain that can be solved by applying data science</li><li>Enable analytics and data science for delivering innovative solutions to complex business problems</li><li>Design data infrastructure architecture for driving large-scale machine learning algorithms</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>M.S. in computer science or a relevant technical field. </li><li>Minimum of 4-year industry experience in developing high-quality software.</li><li>Strong problem solving skills and algorithm scaling.</li><li>Top-notch in Java, and/or Scala based component development.</li><li>Familiar with SQL, NoSQL, data management and standard machine learning toolkit. </li><li>Knowledge of distributed machine learning platforms like Spark or TensorFlow is a plus.</li></ul>

Observe is a SaaS Observability tool that enables Engineering and DevOps teams to troubleshoot modern distributed applications 10x faster. Observe ingests machine-generated data and turns it into a graph of things that are understandable by humans. We enable engineers to spend more time coding features and less time investigating incidents. Because of Observe’s unique elastic architecture, our product is priced based on usage, making it cost 10x less than incumbents.Watch this video to learn more about our mission.<p><br></p>Observe was founded by top enterprise VC Sutter Hill Ventures and has a founding team from leading Enterprise SaaS companies Snowflake, Splunk, and Wavefront. We’re excited to grow our front-end engineering team. You will be working closely with the frontend engineers and designers in implementing and maintaining visualizations that are core to our product features, such as metrics and alerting. Our visualizations are fundamental in delivering a delightful UI that is both simple to use and powerful enough for experts to troubleshoot complex applications.View our demo.<p><br></p>As a Data Visualization Engineer, you will:<p><br></p><ul><li>Work closely with frontend engineers, product managers and UX designers to develop new visualizations</li><li>Develop new techniques for improving the performance and interactivity of our visualizations</li><li>Maintain and improve our current visualization library, built in D3</li><li>Develop an interactive, data-rich user interface using React, Typescript, D3, SASS/SCSS, etc</li><li>Be a strong contributor to the product vision and team planning</li><li>Be a part of a rapidly growing startup with a strong VC backing<br><br></li></ul>What we are looking for:<p><br></p><ul><li>2+ years industry experience building/maintaining data visualizations</li><li>Frontend or full-stack application development experience</li><li>Day-to-day knowledge of modern web technologies like D3, React, Javascript, Typescript, etc</li><li>Passion for front-end development, and the impacts it has on overall customer experience</li><li>Growth mindset, willingness to using every opportunity to learn, discover and grow<br><br></li></ul>What we like:<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience working with canvas visualizations</li><li>Experience with commercial dashboarding and analytics products (e.g. Splunk, Datadog, Looker, Power BI) or experience building systems for data analytics is preferable</li><li>Knowledge of the core building blocks in web browsers, like the DOM, CSS, Canvas, XHR, etc</li><li>Startup or growth-stage experience is also preferable<br><br></li></ul>About Us:<p><br></p>Observe's mission is to turn business data into information. Our SaaS Observability product ingests anything with a timestamp - logs, metrics, traces - and then curates and relates that data to provide unique insights into a customer’s data universe. If a customer has a problem on the application layer, engineering teams can seamlessly find the root cause of the issue whether that’s a new release pushed to production from Jenkins, or an underlying database or memory issue. We enable engineers to spend more time coding features and less time investigating incidents. We reduce outages and issues with customer experience. And we leverage an elastic cloud architecture so that customers only pay for what they use. To learn more about Observe, visit www.observeinc.com or join the conversation on Twitter @Observe_Inc.<p><br></p>Observe Inc. is a diversity-friendly zone. We seek to assemble a heterogeneous team where employees from all backgrounds can feel valued, appreciated, and celebrated, and where individual development does not come second to our collective goals.

LeapYear's secure data platform is deployed by some of the largest enterprises in the world across finance, healthcare, and technology.<p><br></p>Our technology ensures differential privacy, a widely recognized standard of data privacy that enables all data - including sensitive information - to be utilized for analytics, while providing mathematically proven privacy protection.<p><br></p>Our Algorithms team is at the forefront of our efforts to apply differential privacy to real-world problems. We take exciting, cutting-edge ideas from the research community and develop novel implementations that enable our customers and partners to do incredible things with sensitive data.<p><br></p>We work in Python, Haskell, and Scala to develop these algorithms, closely partnered with domain experts as well as the rest of the engineering organization. In the past, we’ve produced everything from Python-based experiments, to safety and performance-critical distributed implementations in Haskell and Scala/Spark.<p><br></p>Our ideal team-mate is someone who loves learning and teaching. We’re challenged to stay current with both the latest research in privacy-preserving technologies, as well as thinking about how to apply and explain those ideas effectively to the complicated worlds of our users and customers.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design and implement novel privacy-preserving algorithms</li><li>Work closely with domain experts to uncover new applications of differential privacy</li><li>Develop sustainable and extendable software systems</li><li>Plan, implement, and optimize new features from idea to release<br><br></li></ul>Requirements<p><br></p><ul><li>PhD, or equivalent experience, in a field involving the application of advanced mathematics (computer science, statistics, math, physics, electrical/systems engineering)</li><li>Exposure to functional programming concepts and languages</li><li>A foundation in data structures, algorithms, and software design</li><li>A love of learning and teaching</li><li>A track-record of project ownership and delivery (either academic or professional)<br><br></li></ul>Nice to Have<p><br></p><ul><li>Familiarity with differential privacy theory and implementation</li><li>Familiarity with other privacy-preserving technologies</li><li>Professional experience with functional programming languages<br><br></li></ul>A Few of the Perks<p><br></p><ul><li>Culture of teaching and learning</li><li>Competitive compensation package of salary and equity: $150,000 – $250,000, depending on skills and experience</li><li>Matching 401k plan</li><li>Generous health insurance plan</li><li>Disability, accident, and life insurance </li><li>Relocation support</li><li>Company outings</li><li>Build your ideal work station<br></li></ul>

Who We Are<p><br></p>rideOS is a wholly owned and operated subsidiary of Gopuff. We are responsible for driving innovation in Gopuff’s delivery optimization, fulfillment center operations, and other strategic initiatives. Collectively, our goal is to accelerate Gopuff’s mission to make daily life effortless.<p><br></p>As pioneers and industry-leaders of the "Instant Needs" category, Gopuff is the go-to solution for consumer’s immediate everyday needs, aiming to complete all deliveries within 30 minutes. Gopuff makes delivering grocery, home, baby &amp; pet essentials and over-the-counter medications easy and affordable for everyone.<p><br></p>The Opportunity<p><br></p>We are looking for a backend engineer who is passionate about developing technology for the next generation of transport. You will be collaborating with other engineers to design and build advanced, scalable mapping and transportation-related applications. You will build scalable services that support matching thousands of vehicles with hundreds of thousands of orders using discrete optimization to find the best solution that satisfies a set of constraints. As part of a high-growth startup, you will also have the opportunity to collaborate closely with company product leaders, partners, and non-engineering parts of the business. Every member of our organization plays a critical role in shaping the future of our services, team, and culture.<p><br></p><strong><u>What We Are Looking For</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>2+ years of industry experience</li><li>Proficiency in Java or C++ or a similar language</li><li>Strong algorithms fundamentals</li><li>Passion for mobility or next generation transport</li><li>A strong desire to learn, collaborate and mentorLocated or willing to commute to San Francisco</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice To Have</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience using gRPC and protocol buffers</li><li>Experience with Docker and Kubernetes</li><li>Experience with Discrete Optimization techniques</li><li>Experience in the mobility, ride-sharing, or autonomous driving industry</li><li>Experience building services and applications at high throughput</li><li>Experience building batch and real-time data pipelines</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>We Provide</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Equity in a well-funded ($3.4b), rapidly-growing startup (Gopuff)</li><li>Top tier medical, dental, and vision insuranceLife insurance policy</li><li>Flexible PTO - We trust employees to manage their time off, most people take around 20 vacation days per year</li><li>Flexible working from home policy, especially for folks with families or commuters</li><li>Lunch provided 3 days a week</li><li>Tax savings from 401K, FSA</li><li>Investment in safety - we provide transport home when you work late</li><li>Investment in health and wellness - we reimburse $80 per month for fitness/gym memberships</li></ul><p><br></p>At rideOS, we place a strong emphasis on our culture, diversity, and employee wellbeing. We are proud to maintain our small startup hustle while also enjoying the benefits and excitement of Gopuff’s hypergrowth. Come join us to be a part of accelerating our collective mission. rideOS is an e-verified company.

<strong>About Refuel.ai</strong><p><br></p>The Mission<p><br></p>The next wave of ML applications (video security, conversational AI and autonomous vehicles) is going to look very different from the last one (search and recommender systems). Teams working in these domains have to deal with large streams of unstructured data (images, video, text and audio), exorbitant labeling costs, and broken feedback loops. For this next wave of ML applications, getting to production takes months and adapting to the long tail is an existential struggle. That’s what we’re solving - Refuel.ai accelerates time to production for ML applications built on top of unstructured data, and enables them to continually improve in the real world.<p><br></p>The team<p><br></p>Refuel.ai was founded in 2021 by Rishabh Bhargava and Nihit Desai. Our founders bring machine learning and product experience from the world's leading technology companies (Facebook, Instagram, Primer.ai and Cloudera) and institutions (Stanford, Cambridge and UIUC). We are backed by General Catalyst, XYZ Ventures and a host of successful and influential angel investors from places like Stanford, OpenAI, Datadog and Facebook.<p><br></p>What you will do<p><br></p><ul><li>Design and build the core backend systems that power our product, and process billions of data points every day. Some examples of this include our data ingestion infrastructure, scalable training and inference of state of the art ML models, semantic search, real-time outlier detection and alerting. </li><li>Work closely with our ML and frontend engineering teams to design the right APIs, data models and technical architecture for Refuel's platform</li><li>Help define and evolve our engineering stack as we scale the product</li><li>Help us hire a world-class team and mentor new team members<br><br></li></ul>You will be a great fit if you have<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience building large-scale distributed systems that process large volumes of data</li><li>Familiarity with Python programming language; experience or willingness to quickly learn technologies like AWS, Docker and Kubernetes</li><li>Strong communication skills and enjoy working in a collaborative environment. We encourage open discussion and want the best ideas to win</li><li>A curiosity about the early startup and company building journey</li><li>Bonus: Experience with data processing technologies (e.g. Spark, Kafka) or machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g. PyTorch, Tensorflow)<br><br></li></ul>Our current tech stack<p><br></p><ul><li>Infrastructure - AWS + Serverless + Kubernetes + secret sauce infra to power modern ML</li><li>Backend - Python + FastAPI + Postgres + DynamoDB</li><li>Frontend - React + Typescript<br><br></li></ul>What we offer<p><br></p>We have raised funding from top-tier investors, including General Catalyst, XYZ Ventures and a host of successful angel investors from places such as Stanford, OpenAI, Facebook and Datadog. We will offer a competitive salary and meaningful equity in the company.<p><br></p>Most importantly, you will have the opportunity to create a massive impact on the product and company as a member of our early team. We care a lot about making a difference for our customers while working on a team where we are empowered to do the best work of our lives.

Etleap came to be out of the frustration with how much effort is required to build and maintain robust data pipelines. We want to make data pipelines easy for data engineers and analysts, and so we are creating an intuitive ETL/ELT tool that makes it quick to integrate data from any source without writing code, and efficient to manage hundreds or thousands of data pipelines.<p><br></p>We are looking to add engineers to our core engineering team to build the infrastructure that modern data teams depend on to create and operate their analytics infrastructure! It shouldn’t take a CS degree to build great data pipelines, and abstracting away the difficult parts is our mission.<p><br></p>Are you ready for the challenge?<p><br></p>What you are going to do: - Solve challenging engineering problems related to the performance and robustness of distributed systems infrastructure - Come up with novel ideas on how to make complex data technology user-friendly, and then turn those ideas into software - Be part of the team that builds the next generation of ETL/ELT infrastructure<p><br></p>What we want to see in you: - You are drawn to and have experience solving challenging engineering problems - You build robust and scalable data systems three times as fast as other developers - Coding in Java is second nature to you - You’re living in or willing to work in San Francisco - You’re excited to work in a scrappy environment - You’re down to earth and fun to be around. This is an absolute must!<p><br></p>Big plus if you have the following: - Experience working in a startup engineering team - Working knowledge of S3, EMR, Terraform, and Docker - Know the ins and outs of current big data frameworks like Hadoop, Spark, or Flink, but this is not an absolute requirement - you’re a quick learner!<p><br></p>*** This role is open to individuals living in San Francisco. The role is in-house, working from our SF office ***

JD-<p><br></p><strong><u>Experience Required-</u></strong><p><br></p>Minimum qualifications :<p><br></p>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.<p><br></p>3+ years of experience developing data pipelines or software applications in general<p><br></p>Experience in developing with SQL/relational databases<p><br></p>Working knowledge or experience in developing Java<p><br></p>Willingness to learn Google infrastructure and coding practice<p><br></p>Roles &amp; Responsibilities-<p><br></p>As a data engineer, you will be responsible for developing the data pipeline in Google infrastructure using Java(80%) and should be able to take tasks in SQL and other Google Infrastructure.<p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>Experience in designing relational databases tables<p><br></p>Experience in data warehousing and data analytics<p><br></p>Experience in test automation/release automation<p><br></p>Ability to adopt agile methodologies<p><br></p>Advocate to simple design<p><br></p>Excellent verbal and written communication skills

The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space!<p><br></p>At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our outstanding skills and experiences to create, craft and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture supports employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, encouragement and focus and if you have the passion, we want to build a better tomorrow with you!<p><br></p>You will work real-time next generation payload flight software (FSW) development and integration, while using modern architectural concepts, model-based methodologies and software toolchains to deploy to critical code to existing single-core processors.<p><br></p>You will be responsible for developing and testing payload flight software in software-only and hardware/software environments, including execution of integration tests to validate hardware to software interfaces, software to software interfaces, and functionality. The job responsibilities include analyzing the hardware, software, and system requirements and implementation; developing and testing code utilizing Model Based Design approaches; establishing development and test tools; identifying and resolving anomalies during test on various software- and system-level platforms; identifying and implementing required software modifications and participating in technical reviews/audits of software products. You will primarily provide hands-on development and integration efforts along with perform software engineering in all phases of the software lifecycle following the program Software Development Plan (SDP) while employing an agile development paradigm.<p><br></p><strong><u>Here Are Some Of The Benefits You Can Enjoy</u></strong><p><br></p>To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin fosters an inclusive work environment that encourages differences and big-picture thinking. Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually.<p><br></p><ul><li> Medical</li><li> Dental</li><li> 401k</li><li> Paid time off</li><li> Work/life balance</li><li> Career development</li><li> Mentorship opportunities</li><li> Rewards &amp; recognition</li></ul><p><br></p>https://www.lockheedmartinjobs.com/working-here#benefits Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s competitive and comprehensive benefits package.

<strong>About Us</strong><p><br></p>ManageCasa is a powerful platform to help landlords, property managers and HOAs to efficiently grow their business. We provide our customers with a transparent and complete picture of their business at every step in the operations lifecycle, so that they can do what they do best. Our application has been recognized as the easiest-to-use property management platform on the market.<p><br></p>About the Job:<p><br></p>We are hiring an experienced Senior Frontend Software Engineer to drive our product in the market. Our frontend UI is a business focused web application and a native mobile app. This role will enhance the current functionality of our front end products. You will take on feature development and selection. You will report directly to our CTO.<p><br></p>Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Work on technical frontend challenges, including developing new features and A/B testing those features</li><li>Collaborate with the CTO to envision and implement an amazing experience for our customers.</li><li>Influence our UI design by collaborating with customers and listening to their feedback</li><li>Build out and enhance our existing mobile application.</li><li>Develop and measure features in a lean environment</li></ul><p><br></p>Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li>You are a strong frontend engineer with 5+ years of experience in developing new features for another web-based or mobile technology startup company.</li><li>You have expert level knowledge in Angular and also preferably React Mobile</li><li>1-2 years of experience with CI/CD, Testing with Cypress</li><li>Strong project leadership and task management expertise.</li></ul><p><br></p>Location:<p><br></p>This is a hybrid role - we work in our San Francisco office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays.<p><br></p>Benefits:<p><br></p><ul><li>World class team with low egos</li><li>A flexible work environment</li><li>Medical insurance</li></ul><p><br></p>Compensation:<p><br></p>$120,000-180,000 depending on expertise and expertise plus competitive equity<p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>iBc1LiEzjV

jobs_titles: Performance Software Engineer, Pixel Camera App
describtion: Note: Google’s hybrid workplace includes remote and in-office roles. By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following:<br><br><strong>In-office locations: Mountain View, CA, USA; San Diego, CA, USA; Seattle, WA, USA; Boulder, CO, USA.<br><br></strong><strong>Remote location(s): California, USA; Colorado, USA; Oregon, USA; Texas, USA; Washington, USA.</strong><strong>Minimum qualifications:<br><br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.</li><li>5 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, and with data structures/algorithms.</li><li>3 years of experience testing, maintaining, or launching software products, and 1 year of experience with software design and architecture.</li><li>Experience with Android, Java, and performance optimization.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred qualifications:<br><br></strong><ul><li>Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical field.</li><li>3 years of experience working with embedded operating systems.</li><li>1 year of experience in a technical leadership role.</li><li>Experience developing accessible technologies. </li><li>Experience with performance analysis, C++, data analysis, benchmarking, and SQL.<br><br></li></ul><strong><u>About The Job<br><br></u></strong>Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.<br><br>The Google Pixel team focuses on designing and delivering the world's most helpful mobile experience. The team works on shaping the future of Pixel devices and services through some of the most advanced designs, techniques, products, and experiences in consumer electronics. This includes bringing together the best of Google’s artificial intelligence, software, and hardware to build global smartphones and create transformative experiences for users across the world.<br><br>The US base salary range for this full-time position is $157,000-$235,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.<br><br>Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google .<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong><ul><li>Lead cross-team initiatives to measure and reduce critical user-perceived latencies in Pixel Camera's Android application code by ensuring collaborator teams are using CPU and RAM system resources efficiently.</li><li>Identify performance roadblocks across the Android app, image processing code, and underlying systems that contribute to poor performance.</li><li>Work closely with performance tooling teams to bring new advanced tools and techniques to bear.</li><li>Measure and optimize managed or C++ app code directly.</li><li>Work outside the application code to drive substantial optimizations to underlying systems like device HAL, runtime optimizations, and memory management.<br><br></li></ul>Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

<strong>AssemblyAI is a remote-first AI company building powerful deep learning models for developers, startups, and enterprises to transcribe and understand their audio data.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Our Automated Speech Recognition (ASR) models already outperform companies like Google, AWS, and Microsoft</strong> - which is why hundreds of companies and thousands of developers are using our APIs to transcribe and understand millions of videos, podcasts, phone calls, and zoom meetings every day. Our APIs power innovative products like conversational intelligence platforms, zoom meeting summarizers, content moderation, and automatic closed captioning.<p><br></p>AssemblyAI's Speech-to-Text APIs are already trusted by Fortune 500s, startups, and thousands of developers around the world, with <strong>well-known customers including Spotify, Algolia, Dow Jones, Happy Scribe, BBC, The Wall Street Journal, and NBCUniversal. </strong>As part of a huge and emerging market, AssemblyAI is well on its way to becoming the leader in speech recognition and NLP.<p><br></p><strong>We're growing at breakneck speed, and recently announced our Series B round. We've raised $63M in total funding, </strong>and are backed by leading investors including Insight Partners, Accel, Y Combinator, Patrick and John Collision (Founders of Stripe), Nat Friedman (Former CEO of GitHub), and Daniel Gross (Entrepreneur &amp; Investor in companies including GitHub, Uber &amp; SpaceX)!<p><br></p>Our ambition is to build an iconic AI company, making advanced deep learning technology accessible to everyday developers through a simple API, good docs, and a great developer experience.<p><br></p><strong>Join our world-class, remote team and help us build an iconic deep learning company!</strong><p><br></p>T<strong>he Role</strong><p><br></p>We're looking for a backend engineer with strong software and cloud engineering skills. Some of your responsibilities will include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Build new API features and endpoints</li><li>Build automated test suites and CI/CD pipelines</li><li>Build highly scalable event-driven and realtime systems</li><li>Instrument systems with metrics, tracing, and logging</li><li>Refactor applications to eliminate tech debt</li><li>Troubleshoot production issues</li></ul><p><br></p>You'll love this job if you....<p><br></p><ul><li>Enjoy taking ownership and solving complex technical problems, even when there is no perfect solution. </li><li>Enjoy being in a fast-paced, customer-facing role. </li><li>You're excited to take initiative and tackle big technical challenges like building highly scalable architectures and achieving zero-downtime deploys. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>3+ years of professional experience building backend applications using Go or Python</li><li>3+ years of working with SQL and NoSQL databases</li><li>2+ years working with common AWS services</li><li>2+ years developing REST APIs in frameworks like Django, Flask, Tornado, Fiber or FastAPI</li><li>1+ years of production support experience</li><li>Has worked at a startup or high growth company</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Skills</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Inquisitive. You're always in search for both novel and effective solutions even when within highly constrained time and resources. </li><li>Fast learner. Ramping up on difficult topics is a trivial task for you. </li><li>Good sense of code structuring. You strive for making your code speak for itself and be readable by other humans. </li><li>Proactive self starter. Driven to accomplish tasks, while acknowledging the value of seeking help when faced with a challenge. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Nice to Have</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Professional experience working with one of the following languages: Java, C#, JavaScript, or C/C++</li><li>Experience with containers</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>US Salary Range: $100,000 - $165,000 USD per year </strong><p><br></p><strong>Remote Locations: North America, LATAM, Europe</strong><p><br></p><strong>Our Team</strong><p><br></p><strong>Our team is made up of problem solvers, innovators and top AI researchers with over 20+ years of experience in Machine Learning, NLP, and Speech Recognition from companies like DeepMind, Google Brain, Meta, Apple and Amazon. </strong>They conduct cutting edge deep learning research and develop novel algorithms &amp; techniques to continually push the state of the art in speech recognition &amp; NLP!<p><br></p>Our team is fully remote, and our culture is super collaborative, low-ego, transparent, and fast-paced. We want to win - and have a flat organization where everyone can openly share ideas (regardless of their title or position) in order to get the best idea.<p><br></p>As a remote company, our team members are given a lot of trust and autonomy to work where and how they want. <strong>About Zipline<br><br></strong>Do you want to change the world? Zipline is on a mission to transform the way goods move. Our aim is to solve the world’s most urgent and complex access challenges by building, manufacturing and operating the first instant delivery and logistics system that serves all humans equally, wherever they are. From powering Rwanda’s national blood delivery network and Ghana’s COVID-19 vaccine distribution, to providing on-demand home delivery for Walmart, to enabling healthcare providers to bring care directly to U.S. homes, we are transforming the way things move for businesses, governments and consumers. The technology is complex but the idea is simple: a teleportation service that delivers what you need, when you need it. Through our technology that includes robotics and autonomy, we are decarbonizing delivery, decreasing road congestion, and reducing fossil fuel consumption and air pollution, while providing equitable access to billions of people and building a more resilient global supply chain.<br><br>Join Zipline and help us to make good on our promise to build an equitable and more resilient global supply chain for billions of people.<br><br><strong>About You And The Role<br><br></strong>Zipline is at the forefront of a logistics revolution, using autonomous aircraft to deliver just-in-time, life-saving medical supplies on multiple continents, 7 days a week. We have completed over 200,000 deliveries; it took over 4 years to reach the first 100,000 deliveries. It took 8 months to reach the last 100,000 deliveries. Do you want to be a part of reaching 1 million life-saving deliveries in the next 2 years?<br><br><strong>We believe access to medical care should not depend on your GPS coordinates. In service of our mission to operate at global scale, we’re growing our perception capabilities to expand quickly and safely into new products and locations, with the ultimate goal of delivering essential packages right to your doorstep. Our Autonomy team is looking for an Autonomy Data Ops Full Stack Engineer to build pipelines for curating datasets for Autonomy development and to build metrics that matter for ensuring we have the right data powering our Autonomy system.<br><br></strong><strong>What You'll Do<br></strong><ul><li>You will be responsible for the architecture, design and development of novel perception data pipelines and annotation tooling to deliver high quality datasets aimed at solving Zipline’s critical autonomy problems</li><li>You will interface with third party vendors to support annotation and audit of our data</li><li>You will partner with software, machine learning and operations teams to capture ground truth specifications, annotation throughput and quality</li><li>You will build pipelines to curate high quality datasets including automating data subsampling, annotation, audit, visualizing and evaluating data</li><li>Raise the bar on data quality by developing methods and processes to find and correct annotation errors</li><li>You will build metrics dashboards for tracking metrics such as data downselection rate, annotation throughput, audit correction rate, and costs</li><li>You will contribute to faster annotation with novel pre-labeling pipelines and annotation tools</li><li>You will work with autonomy teams to identify shortcomings of data and help improve model accuracy by delivering better datasets<br><br></li></ul><strong>What You'll Bring<br></strong><ul><li>Production level experience with data ETL andcuration for ML based solutions</li><li>Deep expertise in one or more of the following areas: Data ETL, Big Data Pipelines, UI/UX for Data Annotation and Audit</li><li>AWS experience with S3, IAM, Lambda, VPC, Redshift</li><li>Strong Python and Javascript/Typescript coding skills</li><li>Strong Background in computer science: algorithms and data structures</li><li>Proficiency with databases and SQL</li><li>3+ years experience with large scale production services and/or web applications</li><li>Experience with AWS Services such as Amazon S3 EC2 EKS / Kubernetes</li><li>Strong technical communication (both written and verbal), prioritization, and time management skills<br><br></li></ul><strong>What Else You Need to Know<br><br></strong>The starting cash range for this role is Please note that this is a target, starting cash range for a candidate who meets the minimum qualifications for this role.
