describtion: Duties<p><br></p>Strong data and analytic skills, knowledge of excel, numbers and data modeling. Reporting and presentation skills a plus. Looking for a person who has a passion for data and numbers.<p><br></p><ul><li> Interpret data, analyze and process data</li><li> Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.</li><li> Filter and “clean” data for system consumption</li><li> Transaction to Account matching</li><li> Triage and research submitted tickets</li><li> Use resources (i.e. Tableau, Box, Internal Systems) to validate data</li></ul><p><br></p>Data Processing - Excel<p><br></p>Support Tickets - Attention to detail, written and verbal communication organizational skills<p><br></p>Strong analytical skills<p><br></p>Demonstrated understanding of business<p><br></p>Demonstrated ability to manage through various customer situations<p><br></p>Seeking and acting on feedback from business partners<p><br></p>Demonstrate understanding of the business and master data management concepts.<p><br></p>Process on average 6 files/week (files range from 5,000 rows to 40,000 rows)<p><br></p>Process on average 30 support tickets/week<p><br></p>Achieve SLA of 5 business days on Support ticket responses<p><br></p>Achieve SLA of 48 hours on data maintenance requests<p><br></p>Achieve SLA of 5 business days on major data change requests<p><br></p>Drive an increase in % first contact resolution for support tickets<p><br></p>Use resources (i.e. Tableau, Box, Sales Central) to validate data<p><br></p>Leverage existing knowledge of master data management (MDM) solutions &amp; best practices

<strong>Who is Recruiting from Scratch: </strong><p><br></p>Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.<p><br></p><strong> From Our Client </strong><p><br></p>Location: New York / Remote<p><br></p>Job Type: Full-time<p><br></p>Experience: 3+ years<p><br></p><strong>About The Role</strong><p><br></p>Our mission is to increase the number of financially independent people. We believe we can achieve this goal by building tools that enable independent business owners to scale their businesses profitably. Our first product combines a virtual credit card system with dynamic spending limits and software tooling to help merchants grow and optimize their profitability. We are growing very fast -- in less than five months, we grew to millions in card volume. We have a significant waitlist of customers waiting to use our product. We are looking to expand our headcount quickly to support the demand. Our investors include Solomon Hykes (founder of Docker), Paul Buchheit (founder of Gmail), Paul Graham (founder of Y Combinator), Robert Leshner (founder of compound.finance), and many more. We have raised over $30M from top-tier fintech investors.<p><br></p><strong>What You'll Be Working On</strong><p><br></p>You'll be involved in projects of varying scope and complexity:<p><br></p><ul><li> Build credit risk models that segment merchants based on their revenue and spend patterns to offer dynamic credit limits that change with business performance given the high seasonality and fast pace of ecommerce </li><li> Use machine learning tools to build realtime credit underwriting models leveraging alternative and traditional data sources </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You'll Need</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Passion for, or curiosity to learn, financial technology </li><li> Track record of high-quality shipping products and features at scale </li><li> Ability to turn business and product ideas into engineering solutions </li><li> Desire to work in a fast-paced environment, continuously grow and master your craft </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We’d Like To See</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Experience with building out data pipelines (e.g. should know data lakes, data warehouses, ETL, etc.) </li><li> Experience working with data analytics, algorithmic decision making, and real-time data systems </li><li> Experience with different business requirements on data freshness and retention </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> PLUSES </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Proven experience and subject matter expertise in e-commerce payments (nice to have) or financial services. </li><li> Has worked with bank account data (e.g. worked with Plaid), payments data (perhaps Stripe), and/or other fintech data sources </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Why you should join us: </strong><p><br></p>Our mission is to increase the number of financially independent people. We believe we can achieve this goal by building tools that enable independent business owners to scale their businesses profitably. Our first product combines a virtual credit card system with dynamic spending limits and software tooling to help merchants grow and optimize their profitability. We are growing very fast -- in less than five months, we have grown to millions in card volume.<p><br></p>We have a significant waitlist of customers waiting to use our product. We are looking to expand our headcount quickly to support the demand. Our investors include Solomon Hykes (founder of Docker), Paul Buchheit (founder of Gmail), Paul Graham (founder of Y Combinator), Robert Leshner (founder of compound.finance), and many more. We recently closed a financing round of $5M from a top-tier fintech investor.<p><br></p><strong> Salary Range: $150,000-$250,000 base.</strong>

<strong>Title: Data Analyst<br><br></strong><strong>Duration: Fulltime /Contract to Hire<br><br></strong><strong>Location: San Francisco, CA or San Jose, CA (Hybrid)<br></strong><ul><li>Drive individual projects end to end right from understanding the use case, exploring data and conveying insights in a compelling manner.</li><li>Partner with various cross-functional teams (Engagement &amp; Retention, Data Science, Finance, Engineering, Product, and Marketing) to drive growth in Document Cloud's Family of Products</li><li>Leverage statistical and data science models to analyze and better understand the end-to-end customer journey, from acquisition and conversion to engagement and retention</li><li>Gather, synthesize, and interpret disparate quantitative data within the context of business objectives, identify trends, and explore data through segments and cohorts<br></li></ul><strong><u>What You'll Need To Succeed<br></u></strong><ul><li>At least 5-6 years of industry experience in data/business analysis or a related field</li><li>A strong proficiency in querying and manipulating large data sets for analytical purposes using SQL-like languages (Hive/Hadoop experience preferred)</li><li>Familiarity with big data platforms such as Hadoop</li><li>Experience with programming language such as Python, R</li><li>Experience with data visualization tool Power BI</li><li>Understanding of statistical modeling, machine learning, or data mining concepts, and a record of solving problems with these methods.</li><li>Excellent communication (verbal and written), relationship skills, and a strong team player<br></li></ul><strong>www.digitaljanet.com</strong>

jobs_titles: Senior Software Engineer - Database Engine Internals
describtion: Our mission at Databricks is to radically simplify the whole data lifecycle from ingestion to ETL, BI, and all the way up to ML/AI with a unified platform. To achieve this goal, we believe the data warehouse architecture as we know it today will be replaced by a new architectural pattern, Lakehouse (CIDR 2021 paper), open platforms that unify data warehousing and advanced analytics. The new architecture will help address several major challenges, including data staleness, reliability, total cost of ownership, data lock-in, and limited use-case support.<p><br></p>A critical part of realizing this vision is the next generation (decoupled) query engine and structured storage system that can outperform specialized data warehouses in relational query performance, yet retain the expressiveness and of general purpose systems such as Spark to support diverse workloads ranging from ETL to data science.<p><br></p><strong> As Part Of This Team, You Will Be Working In One Or More Of The Following Areas To Design And Implement These Next Gen Systems That Leapfrog State-of-the-art </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Query compilation and optimization</li><li>Distributed query execution and scheduling</li><li>Vectorized execution engine</li><li>Data security</li><li>Resource management</li><li>Transaction coordination</li><li>Efficient storage structures (encodings, indexes)</li><li>Automatic physical data optimization</li></ul><p><br></p><strong> What We Look For </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>A passion for database systems, storage systems, distributed systems, language design, or performance optimization</li><li>Experience working towards a multi-year vision with incremental deliverables</li><li>Motivated by delivering customer value and impact</li><li>5+ years of experience working in a related system (preferred)</li><li>Optional: PhD in databases or distributed systems</li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Benefits </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Comprehensive health coverage including medical, dental, and vision</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Equity awards</li><li>Flexible time off</li><li>Paid parental leave</li><li>Family Planning</li><li>Gym reimbursement</li><li>Annual personal development fund</li><li>Work headphones reimbursement</li><li>Employee Assistance Program (EAP)</li><li>Business travel accident insurance</li><li>Mental wellness resources</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement</strong><p><br></p>As a federal government contractor, Databricks requires new U.S. employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Proof of vaccination will be required as a condition of employment. Databricks will make reasonable accommodations based on medical conditions or religious grounds for qualified candidates in accordance with applicable law.<p><br></p><strong>Pay Range Transparency</strong><p><br></p>Databricks is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The pay range(s) for this role is listed below and represents base salary range for non-commissionable roles or on-target earnings for commissionable roles. Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to job-related skills, depth of experience, relevant certifications and training, and specific work location. Based on the factors above, Databricks utilizes the full width of the range. The total compensation package for this position may also include eligibility for annual performance bonus, equity, and the benefits listed above. For more information regarding which range your location is in visit our page here.<p><br></p>Local Pay Range<p><br></p>$166,000—$225,000 USD<p><br></p><strong> About Databricks </strong><p><br></p>Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 9,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Lakehouse Platform to unify their data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe. Founded by the original creators of Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow, Databricks is on a mission to help data teams solve the world’s toughest problems. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.<p><br></p><strong>Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion</strong><p><br></p>At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.<p><br></p><strong>Compliance</strong><p><br></p><strong>If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.</strong>

Join us on the journey to get to net zero<p><br></p>At Carbon Direct, we dedicate our scientific, software, and business expertise to empower organizations around the world to take climate action.<p><br></p>Our Mission<p><br></p>Enable organizations to reduce, remove, and utilize their emissions with carbon science<p><br></p>We are a purpose-driven carbon management firm dedicated to helping organizations around the world reach their climate goals. We make carbon science accessible and actionable with our end-to-end platform.<p><br></p>Global citizens with global impact<p><br></p>Whether a scientist, developer, or carbon markets expert, we are united by our mission to take climate action now. We are experts in our fields and we act with confidence. Located across 4 countries and 10+ states in the U.S., we offer both remote-friendly work options and dynamic, in-person experiences with offices located in Seattle, WA and Oakland, CA.<p><br></p>Diverse backgrounds bring diverse perspectives<p><br></p>We recognize that teams with diverse backgrounds and different experiences are powerful. Bringing together a variety of perspectives only enhances how we can effectively address the climate crisis. Together, we are creating an environment where everyone is celebrated and anyone can succeed.<p><br></p><strong>Overview</strong><p><br></p>We are seeking an analyst to primarily help calculate carbon footprints for clients, in line with existing standards and protocols. Ideally, the analyst will identify opportunities to improve existing data models that can be incorporated into our core product offering. We want somebody who is adept at leveraging machine learning to identify reduction opportunities, compare outcomes against industry averages, and guide product development. While the role will be initially focused on carbon measurement, we are seeking a motivated analyst who wants to expand into other parts of the business, and is also able to manage bespoke client data problems. The role will require close collaboration with multiple teams within Carbon Direct (especially science, product, technology, and customer success).<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Calculate and analyze carbon footprints.</li><li>Work with the product team on automation</li><li>Monitor and stay updated on carbon measurement standards and protocols.</li><li>Compare carbon footprints against industry averages to identify areas for improvement.</li><li>Manage and solve unique data-related issues for our clients.</li><li>Visualize data findings using tools such as Tableau, Looker, or Data Studio, presenting complex data in a way that is easy to understand.</li><li>Use data to help drive decisions and strategies for reducing carbon footprints.</li><li>Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in data analysis, machine learning, and carbon measurement. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Strong experience using SQL </li><li>Basic proficiency in Python and familiarity working with Jupyter Notebooks. Some familiarity with R is a plus. </li><li>Familiarity with Python’s most common data libraries (e.g Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn)</li><li>Some proficiency with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, and/or Data Studio</li><li>Basic familiarity with machine learning and LLM models, with an interest in learning more</li><li>Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.</li><li>Experience and/or interest in carbon measurement is helpful.</li><li>Ability to work cross-functionally and collaboratively with a team.</li><li>Passion for solving climate problems and a keen interest in sustainability.</li></ul><p><br></p>$109,000 - $133,000 a year<p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p>While we love our work, our lives aren’t defined by it. At Carbon Direct, we offer a robust benefits package that considers the whole person, their partners, and their families – and we’re always looking to improve.<p><br></p>Our U.S. benefits* include:<p><br></p><ul><li> Comprehensive nationwide medical, dental, and vision coverage. See a preview of our coverage here .</li><li> Time off as needed: Flexible vacation policy and ten company-wide holidays, plus annual winter break between Christmas and New Year's</li><li> 16 weeks of fully paid parental and family leave with no tenure requirement</li><li> Remote-friendly work culture with annual company-wide retreats</li><li> Reimbursement for your work-from-home setup and monthly work-from-home stipend</li><li>Please note that the benefits described apply to U.S.-based employees only. For our international employees, our benefits package varies by each country and its statutory requirements.</li></ul><p><br></p>Equal Opportunity Employer<p><br></p>Carbon Direct is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, national or ethnic origin, disability, marital status, veteran status, or any other occupationally irrelevant criteria. We adhere rigorously to our equal employment opportunity policies in connection with all employment decisions, including hiring, compensation and promotion.

Leads the design planning, impact analysis, administration, implementation and maintenance of the organization's application Cassandra databases. Consults with and advises senior management and multiple clients on high impact data or database management issues, influencing strategic direction.<p><br></p>Handles and leads various large-scale or highly complex data/database management activities including one or more of the following: designing highly complex logical and/or physical database data model; large volume data transformation and migration; capacity planning; developing database design policies, procedures and standards; and security requirements identification, analysis and development.<p><br></p>Provides mentoring, guidance and general oversight to lesser experienced staff in a variety of database design, performance tuning and/or administration activities.<p><br></p><strong><u>Candidate Will Be Required To</u></strong><p><br></p>Lead or participate in Cassandra database management activities including designing highly complex logical and physical databases<p><br></p>Installation and administration of Cassandra databases<p><br></p>Documentation of guides for production database administrators<p><br></p>Defining standards for installation, deployment, security, authentication and authorization, management issues, influencing strategic direction<p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>4+ years of experience with implementing and administrating Cassandra database<p><br></p>Experience with Data tax Cassandra<p><br></p>Experience with Data tax Ops Centre backup/restoration and monitoring/alarm implementation<p><br></p>Experience with Ansible automation tool or equivalent<p><br></p>4+ years of Shell or Python or Perl experience Preferred Skills<p><br></p>Proven experience with Mongo dB or other SQL and NoSQL databases a plus<p><br></p>Experience with Agile methodology<p><br></p>Demonstrated experience with UNIX and Shell Scripting<p><br></p>Demonstrated experience in designing for high volume OLTP applications<p><br></p>Demonstrated experience in Change Management and SDLC<p><br></p>Experience with Version Control System such as Git<p><br></p>Experience with Issue and Tracking software such as Jira

jobs_titles: Senior Cloud Support Engineer - Data Platform
describtion: Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.<p><br></p>Snowflake Support is committed to providing high-quality resolutions to help deliver data-driven business insights and results. We are a team of subject matter experts collectively working toward our customers’ success. We form partnerships with customers by listening, learning, and building connections.<p><br></p>Snowflake’s values are key to our approach and success in delivering world-class Support. Putting customers first, acting with integrity, owning initiative and accountability, and getting it done are Snowflake core values and are reflected in everything we do.<p><br></p>Snowflake’s Support team is expanding! We are looking for a <strong>Senior Cloud Support Engineer </strong>who likes working with data and solving a wide variety of issues utilizing their technical experience having worked on a variety of operating systems, database technologies, big data, data integration, connectors, and networking.<p><br></p>As a<strong> Senior Cloud Support Engineer</strong>, your role is to delight our customers with your passion and knowledge of the Snowflake Cloud Data Platform. Customers will look to you for technical guidance and for advice in addressing their product usage and issue needs. You will be the voice of the customer into Snowflake’s product and engineering teams for product feedback and improvements. You will play an integral role in building knowledge within the team and be part of strategic initiatives for organizational and process improvements. Ideally, you have worked in a 24x7 environment, handled all tiers of support issues, been on-call during weekends, and are familiar with Salesforce Service Cloud.<p><br></p><strong>Based on business needs, you may be assigned to work with one or more Snowflake Priority Support customers. </strong>You will develop a strong understanding of the customer’s use case and how they leverage the Snowflake platform. You will deliver exceptional service, enabling them to achieve the highest levels of continuity and performance from their Snowflake implementation.<p><br></p>YOU WILL:<p><br></p><ul><li>Provide email, web, and phone support to Snowflake customers and partners</li><li>Utilize the Snowflake environment, connectors, 3rd party partner software, and tools to investigate issues </li><li>Document known solutions to internal and external knowledge base</li><li>Submit well-documented bugs and feature requests arising from customer submitted requests and work with Engineering towards a resolution. </li><li>Work on technical and non-technical projects</li><li>Provide support coverage during holidays and weekends based on business needs</li></ul><p><br></p>OUR IDEAL SENIOR CLOUD SUPPORT ENGINEER WILL HAVE:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent discipline</li><li>5+ years experience in a Technical Support environment or a similar technical function in a customer-facing role</li><li>Experience in a designated customer-focused support role providing a personalized support experience with a deeper knowledge of customer environment</li><li>Good understanding of Amazon AWS (SQS, SNS, API Gateway, S3, Route 53) and/or similar services in Microsoft Azure ecosystems, Google Cloud</li><li>Experience in ETL, ELT tools like AWS Glue, EMR, Azure Data Factory, Informatica, Data Pipelines</li><li>Experience in Spark, Kafka systems</li><li>Experience in using 3rd Party troubleshooting tools like Wireshark, Fiddler, Process Monitor/Explorer</li><li>Experience in analyzing the tcpdump, Fiddler Trace. Capturing the heap dump and analyzing the heap dump</li><li>Capturing the Stack trace and analyzing the trace</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>NICE TO HAVES:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience working with big data and/or MPP (massively parallel processing) databases</li><li>Understanding of Data Warehousing fundamentals and concepts</li><li>Database migration and ETL experience</li><li>Scripting/coding experience In any of the following: .Net, NodeJS, R, GO</li><li>Experience supporting applications running on either Amazon AWS or MS Azure</li><li>Experience with virtualization solutions (VMware, Docker, Virtualbox, etc)</li><li>Understanding of cloud computing security concepts</li></ul><p><br></p>The following represents the expected range of compensation for this role:<p><br></p><ul><li> The estimated base salary range for this role is $109,000 - $166,700.</li><li>Additionally, this role is eligible to participate in Snowflake’s bonus and equity plan.</li></ul><p><br></p>The successful candidate’s starting salary will be determined based on permissible, non-discriminatory factors such as skills, experience, and geographic location. This role is also eligible for a competitive benefits package that includes: medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance; 401(k) retirement plan; flexible spending &amp; health savings account; at least 12 paid holidays; paid time off; parental leave; employee assistance program; and other company benefits.<p><br></p>Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.<p><br></p>How do you want to make your impact?

describtion: <strong>Responsibilities </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Develop and optimize large-scale batch and real-time data pipelines that ingest structured and unstructured data from diverse sources, ensuring data quality and availability.</li><li> Manage incoming data requests and prioritize projects in an organized manner, ensuring that the highest value projects are given priority.</li><li> Assist in scaling our Snowflake and Looker setup, optimizing their performance and ensuring their reliability.</li><li> Utilize advanced SQL skills to craft innovative data solutions that meet the needs of our stakeholders, enabling them to make data-driven decisions.</li><li> Monitor and alert on Airflow jobs and data pipelines to ensure that they are operating as expected and take corrective actions when necessary to ensure that data is delivered on time and of high quality.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Requirements </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science or a related field.</li><li> 8+ years of experience in a data engineer or SQL-heavy data analyst role, preferably in a startup environment.</li><li> Proven track record of success in building new data engineering processes and ability to work effectively in an ambiguous and fast-paced environment.</li><li> Databases: experience with Snowflake, Databricks or equivalent technologies.</li><li> Clouds: experience with AWS, GCP or other cloud providers.</li><li> Excellent SQL knowledge and experience with ETL concepts.</li><li> Experience with reporting tools such as Looker, Tableau, Sisense or similar.</li><li> Knowledge of EMR, Spark, ElasticSearch, Cassandra, Postgres, Airflow, and shell scripting.</li><li> Familiarity with multi-tenancy and monitoring of data pipelines.</li></ul><p><br></p>If you are a motivated data engineering professional with a passion for solving complex problems and developing innovative solutions, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.<p><br></p>Minimum Salary: $159,200.00<p><br></p>Maximum Salary:$228,850.00<p><br></p>The pay range for this position is expected to be between $159,200.00 and $228,850.00/year; however, the base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position also includes medical benefits, 401(k) eligibility, vacation, sick time, and parental leave. Additional details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.<p><br></p>If hired, employee will be in an “at-will position” and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.<p><br></p>Juniper’s pay range data is provided in accordance with local state pay transparency regulations. Juniper may post different minimum wage ranges for permanent residency petitions pursuant to US Department of Labor requirements.<p><br></p>

jobs_titles: Senior MS SQL Server Database Engineer
describtion: <strong><em>Senior MS SQL Server Database Engineer - w2 candidates only</em></strong><p><br></p><strong><em>Oakland, California - Hybrid - Local Candidates only under 60 Min Commute</em></strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Client is seeking <strong>Senior MS SQL Server Database Engineer </strong>to provide Clinical data solutions for Healthcare informatics efforts as part of that team that designs, develops, and delivers a large-scale Data Mart solution.<p><br></p>We are looking for a highly motivated professional with advanced database architectural, organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills who is interested in a multi-year position in a senior-level capacity.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design, develop and optimize large, complex DB schemas, SQL scripts and objects to meet application functionality and performance requirements.</li><li>Working cohesively with stakeholders including data, design, product, and executive teams and assisting them with data-related technical issues.</li><li>Working closely with application developers and business teams at all levels to assist with data-related technical issues and help ensure the successful designing and delivering data driven solutions.</li><li>Implement processes and procedures for the development and release of products/projects that facilitate high quality and rapid deployment</li><li>Provide solutions to promote data integrity in enterprise systems.</li><li>Participate in code reviews to validate effectiveness and quality of code.</li><li>Liaise with Developers to improve applications and establish best practices</li><li>Publish documentation and collaborative information using internal tools.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Expertise in Database Architecture in an environment that handles large volume of data, excess of 500 million of new data records every day.</li><li>Strong analytical and organizational skills. This job involves analyzing existing databases and the client's needs to develop effective data driven solutions.</li><li>Demonstrate expertise in performance tuning including both query and server optimization utilizing SQL tools and/or 3rd party solutions.</li><li>Strong knowledge and experience in data modeling, database design, optimization for performance, SQL, stored procedures.</li><li>Expertise in understanding complex business needs, analyzing, designing, and developing solutions.</li><li>Hands-on development experience in SQL Server 2016 or above using SSIS and SSRS.</li><li>Experience in troubleshooting and resolving data related issues.</li><li>Excellent oral and written communication skills.</li><li>Expertise in performance tuning especially tuning complex queries, procedure, and indexing strategies.</li><li>Monitor and perform tuning on complex ETL jobs using meta-data/variables/parameters.</li><li>Performance tuning experience using 3rd party tools.</li><li>Audit/compliance experience in highly regulated environment.</li><li>Experience using JIRA and Confluence as part of development life cycle.</li><li>Experience with Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau, SSRS, Power BI.</li><li>Familiar with Continual Improvement processes.</li><li>Familiar with Git.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>8 years + relational database and SQL experience</li><li>Creativity, curiosity, initiative, and self-management are key attributes candidate embodies.</li><li>Solid experience (4 years +) in coding complex SQL queries and stored procedures. The ability to explain the details of performance tuning internals of the database.</li><li>Strong understanding of database development methodologies (Source Control, Continual improvement, Release Management, Agile and Scrum)</li><li>Experience with Continuous Integration Tools (Jenkins, TeamCity, Bamboo) and Test-Driven Development (TDD) a big plus Experience with Red Gate Tools a plus (SQL Source Control, SQL Compare, SQL Data Compare, DLM).</li><li>Healthcare domain knowledge a big plus.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Education</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BS or equivalent in engineering or related technical area</li><li>Master's degree preferred</li></ul>

Stanford University is seeking to hire a full-time Data Scientist to join the Immigration Policy Lab (IPL) to work on its GeoMatch research portfolio. Situated within IPL, the GeoMatch team partners with governments to study and implement an algorithm-based matching tool to connect asylum seekers, refugees, and immigrants to locations within a host country where they are most likely to thrive. The tool is currently being piloted by one European resettlement agency, and additional pilots are scheduled to launch in Europe and the United States in 2023. This global research initiative combines high-quality academic research with elements of a social impact tech startup: product design, strategic partnerships, and advances in artificial intelligence.<br><br><strong>About The Lab<br><br></strong>The Immigration Policy Lab (IPL) at Stanford University generates rigorous evidence and drives policy innovation that helps improve the lives of refugees, immigrants, and the communities in which they live. By producing new research and translating it into creative solutions, we seek to improve the lives of these newcomers and strengthen the communities receiving them. We engage with community-based organizations as well as local, state, national, and international governmental agencies to test the effectiveness of current policies, as well as design new programs and tools with the potential to ultimately affect the lives of millions of migrants. Our talented team of faculty, staff, postdocs, and graduate and undergraduate students is creating an innovative research model that combines the quality and rigor of an academic unit with the efficiency and innovation of a civic-tech lab. To learn more about GeoMatch and IPL, visit our website: https://immigrationlab.org/geomatch<br><br><strong>About The Position<br><br></strong>We are looking for a full-time Data Scientist to provide analytical expertise to the GeoMatch research program. This position will report to the Director of GeoMatch and work closely with the GeoMatch research team of staff and faculty. The Data Scientist will co-develop and implement machine learning models and algorithms used by our partners as part of their resettlement processes. The Data Scientist will also be responsible for creating, managing, and updating datasets assuring that the data quality, processing, and analysis meet rigorous replication standards. In collaboration with other team members, the Data Scientist will develop research designs, conduct/interpret analyses, and explore new and creative data collection and analytical methods. This role will also have the opportunity to oversee the work of postdocs and graduate students.<br><br>We are looking for candidates who have the ability and experience to meet the technical requirements of the position and who are enthusiastic about using their skills to build and test a tool with real-world impacts. The Data Scientist will also have the opportunity to co-author papers that report on the results of the implementations of the algorithm-based matching tool, as well as work with an array of affiliated faculty from top institutions.<br><br>IPL is a hybrid (on-campus and remote), highly-collaborative team work environment. Candidates who are available to work in-person are preferred, but we are open to full-time remote candidates based anywhere in the US for this role.<br><br>This is a 100% FTE, one-year, fixed-term position with the possibility of renewal depending on funding and performance.<br><br><strong>Core Duties*:<br></strong><ul><li>Maintain and optimize machine learning models and algorithms, while exploring and evaluating the performance of alternative ML methods and models as needed</li><li>Lead code organization, harmonization, and centralization efforts to ensure the algorithmic matching tool can be used efficiently across multiple contexts and projects</li><li>Work closely with other GeoMatch team members (Data Scientist, Software Engineer, and Faculty) to adapt the code used for data wrangling, machine learning, and optimization to specific contexts based on the needs of external partners</li><li>Conduct statistical analyses to measure the projected or actual performance of the algorithmic matching tool in various country contexts</li><li>Write and maintain codebooks for country-specific datasets and contexts</li><li>Clean, merge, and process raw data from government and non-profit partners</li><li>Respond to descriptive and exploratory questions from faculty or partners </li><li>Create complex tables and figures for internal analyses and external presentations</li><li> Other duties may also be assigned<br><br></li></ul><strong>Additionally, to be successful in this position you will bring:<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree and three years of relevant experience or combination of education and relevant experience. An advanced degree (Master’s or PhD) is highly desired.</li><li>Experience in a quantitative discipline such as economics, finance, statistics, political science, computer science, operations, or engineering.</li><li>Mastery of R.</li><li>Experience implementing machine learning methods and mathematical optimization.</li><li>Commitment to and alignment with GeoMatch research goals and IPL’s mission.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to manage work across many different projects simultaneously, learn skills quickly and efficiently, work well within collaborative and cross-functional team settings, and be highly accountable to deadlines and partner needs.</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to clearly convey information to both technical and non-technical partner organizations. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Desired Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>PhD or advanced degree in a relevant area (e.g., statistics, economics, operations research, computer science) or 5+ years of relevant work experience in data analysis, machine learning implementation, and operations research</li><li>Experience with Python, SQL/database management systems</li><li>Experience working with a large and complex code base</li><li>Experience using version control tools, such as GitHub, to collaborate on projects</li><li>Experience in social science research, causal inference methods, or applying statistical tools to address policy problems </li><li>Knowledge of immigration policy and related academic literature</li><li>Experience creating data visualizations for internal project stakeholders and broad public audiences</li><li>Demonstrated experience managing a wide range of projects and collaborating across various groups and people<br><br></li></ul>We recognize that the job description may not exactly match your qualifications. If you think you may be a good fit, we encourage you to apply.<br><br><strong>How To Apply<br><br></strong>We invite you to apply for this position by clicking on the “Apply for Job” button. To be considered, please submit a cover letter and resume along with your online application. Your one-page cover letter should briefly describe your background and interest in IPL and the GeoMatch research program, your experience doing data science work in collaborative environments, and your motivation for joining a team using data science for social impact. Optional: We also welcome attachments showcasing work samples and portfolios of past projects.<br><br>This role is open to candidates anywhere in the United States. Stanford University has five Regional Pay Structures. The compensation for this position will be based on the location of the successful candidate. The expected pay range for this position is $84,000.00 to $126,000.00 per annum.<br><br>Stanford University provides pay ranges representing its good faith estimate of what the university reasonably expects to pay for a position. The pay offered to a selected candidate will be determined based on factors such as (but not limited to) the scope and responsibilities of the position, the qualifications of the selected candidate, departmental budget availability, internal equity, geographic location, and external market pay for comparable jobs.<br><br><strong>Why Stanford is for You<br><br></strong><strong>Our Culture And Unique Perks Empower You With<br><br></strong>Imagine a world without search engines or social platforms. Consider lives saved through first-ever organ transplants and research to cure illnesses. Stanford University has revolutionized the way we live and enrich the world. Supporting this mission is our diverse and dedicated 17,000 staff. We seek talent driven to impact the future of our legacy.<br><ul><li>Freedom to grow. We offer career development programs, tuition reimbursement, or audit a course. Join a TedTalk, film screening, or listen to a renowned author or global leader speak.</li><li>A caring culture. We provide superb retirement plans, generous time-off, and family care resources.</li><li>A healthier you. Climb our rock wall, or choose from hundreds of health or fitness classes at our world-class exercise facilities. We also provide excellent health care benefits.</li><li>Discovery and fun. Stroll through historic sculptures, trails, and museums.</li><li>Enviable resources. Enjoy free commuter programs, ridesharing incentives, discounts and more<br><br></li></ul><em>The job duties listed are typical examples of work performed by positions in this job classifications and are not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, tasks and responsibilities. Specific duties and responsibilities may vary depending on department or program needs without changing the general nature and scope of the job or level of responsibility. Employees may also perform other duties as assigned. <br><br></em><em>Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of their job.<br><br></em><em>Stanford is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.</em>

Our investors include Solomon Hykes (founder of Docker), Paul Buchheit (founder of Gmail), Paul Graham (founder of Y Combinator), Robert Leshner (founder of compound.finance), and many more. We recently closed a financing round of $5M from a top-tier fintech investor.<p><br></p><strong> Salary Range: $150,000-$250,000 base.</strong>

<strong>About Mashgin</strong><p><br></p>At Mashgin, we are developing the future of checkout experiences. We aim to reduce the friction between customer desires and their ability to be on their way.<p><br></p>In May 2022, Mashgin closed a Series B funding round at a $1.5B valuation. We are backed by some of Silicon Valley’s leading investors including Matrix Partners, NEA and Y Combinator. Our ecosystem is anchored by the only 3D computer vision and deep learning based checkout system in the world. We have 2,000+ locations world wide with customers across a wide spectrum of verticals including the NFL, MLB, Circle K, ampm, Aramark and Compass Group.<p><br></p>We value autonomy of ones work, a culture of respect for one another, and building products with empathy for our customers.<p><br></p>Position Summary<p><br></p>We’re looking for a backend developer to help us build the software that runs our kiosks and powers the extensive infrastructure behind them. You’ll work on code that interfaces with our hardware and visual components, making sure kiosks are reliable, and building scalable backend systems. This is not a specialized position -- we believe in end-to-end ownership of projects, so you’ll be involved throughout the entire product lifecycle, from idea generation, design, and prototyping to execution, and shipping while contributing to many different parts of the codebase in multiple languages.<p><br></p>You Will Be<p><br></p><ul><li>Owning major feature development and working directly with the founders on product development from end to end</li><li>Working with a small interdisciplinary team in hardware, software and design to build new versions of products from scratch</li><li>Work on building new features and dreaming up new architecture to solve challenging problems</li><li>Rethinking and recreating existing codebases for scale</li><li>Continuously improving and maintaining code that’s already in production <br><br></li></ul>Minimum Qualifications<p><br></p><ul><li>8+ years relevant coding experience</li><li>B.S. or higher in Computer Science (or equivalent work experience)</li><li>Excellent knowledge of one or more of these languages: Python, Node.js, C++, Go, C#, Java</li><li>Comfortable learning new languages, libraries, and frameworks when the solution calls for it</li><li>Experience building production-ready code that’s used regularly by lots of people<br><br></li></ul>Preferred Qualifications<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience in a fast-paced work environment, shipping quality code quickly and iterating</li><li>Comfortable with deploying and managing cloud infrastructure</li><li>Good knowledge of algorithms and data structures</li><li>Strong proficiency with SQL and other database technologies<br><br><br><br></li></ul><strong>What We Offer<br></strong><ul><li>An opportunity to work on a small, multidisciplinary team with the potential to break new ground in many different industries</li><li>Excellent health, dental and vision insurance for you and your dependents</li><li>401k plan</li><li>Flexible PTO policy</li><li>Competitive salary and options in a small, rapidly scaling company<br><br></li></ul>Mashgin is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Individuals seeking employment at Mashgin are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation.<p><br></p>For roles based in Palo Alto, CA, the overall market range for Mashgin is typically $250,000 - $600,000 USD annually. Note that total compensation for this position will be determined by candidate’s relevant qualifications, work experience, skills, and other relevant factors. This estimate excludes the value of any benefits offered by Mashgin, and the potential future value of any other long-term incentives.

describtion: <strong>Position Overview</strong><p><br></p>The Database Platform Engineer II will be a key member of the Infrastructure Engineering team at Exact Sciences, supporting data Integration, data modelling, data cleansing, and data migration. The successful candidate will have extensive experience in collecting business and user requirements, developing functional specifications, and integrating data to engineer automated production solutions for robustness, reliability, and operational simplicity. You will manage planning and documentation of database server designs and DB management best practices to ensure system scalability, security, performance and availability.<p><br></p><strong>Essential Duties</strong><p><br></p>Include, but are not limited to, the following:<p><br></p><ul><li>Lead efforts to provision database infrastructure using infrastructure as code tooling.</li><li>Install, configure, test, validate, maintain, and monitor various database systems, application software, and system management tools with automation.</li><li>Maintain expanding portfolio of enterprise database systems and their upgrades, patches, maintenance tasks, performance monitoring and tuning, capacity planning, and availability of sites and services.</li><li>Acts as a technical resource to our business partners in all phases of the development and implementation process; assist with incident and problem resolution as needed.</li><li>Works with Analysts and Business Users to translate functional specifications into technical designs for implementation and deployment.</li><li>Studies data sources by interviewing users; defining, analyzing, and validating data objects; identifying the relationship among data objects.</li><li>Plans data integration process by developing common definitions of sourced data; designing common keys in physical data structure; establishing data integration specifications; examining data applications; examining data models and data warehouse schema; determining best-fit data interchange methods; assessing middleware tools for data integration, transformation, and routing; developing project scope and specifications; identifying factors that negatively impact integration; forecasting resource requirements; establishing delivery timetables.</li><li>Improves data integration by designing and evaluating new data interchange formats; improving physical design; rewriting data policy, standards, and procedures.</li><li>Provide problem-solving expertise and complex analysis of data to develop business intelligence integration designs.</li><li>Build extensible data acquisition and integration solutions to meet the functional and non-functional requirements of the business.</li><li>Design, develop, and deploy data movements using SQL Server Integration Services, TSQL and Stored Procedures.</li><li>Collaborate with business analysts, subject matter experts, and other team members to determine data extraction and transformation requirements.</li><li>Conducts integration testing and maintains all integrations/DB systems.</li><li>Assures adherence to change management processes and security standards.</li><li>Follow data standards, resolve data issues, complete unit testing, and system documentation for data migration processes.</li><li>Provide development, QA, and production support to troubleshoot day-to-day data related issues.</li><li>Establish and maintain policies and procedures for Data Registration\Data Architecture.</li><li>Engages in vendor relationship management.</li><li>Setup and manage tools for database monitoring, diagnostics, and performance optimization for the data migration efforts.</li><li>Provide database infrastructure and architecture recommendations to admins supporting tactical and strategic business needs.</li><li>Engages in developing cloud strategies.</li><li>Work with IT operations teams to troubleshoot ETL and MDM issues and optimize the database server environments.</li><li>Partner with application and operations teams to establish and maintain standard operating procedures for data cleansing, data modelling, and data migration.</li><li>Engages in physical infrastructure maintenance; coordinates work activities with server and network operations team.</li><li>Works closely with SFDC admins to build automated workflows to ease admin activities.</li><li>Familiar working with AWS automation tools (Terraform).</li><li>Knowledge in installation and configuration of database clusters.</li><li>Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment with strong interpersonal and communication skills.</li><li>Results and deadline driven; must be willing to do whatever it takes to meet deadlines.</li><li>Solid analytical, problem solving, and trouble-shooting skills.</li><li>Excellent customer service skills and attention to detail.</li><li>Ability to communicate and negotiate with both technical and non-technical colleagues and stakeholders.</li><li>Uphold company mission and values through accountability, innovation, integrity, quality, and teamwork.</li><li>Support and comply with the company’s Quality Management System policies and procedures.</li><li>Maintain regular and reliable attendance.</li><li>Ability to act with an inclusion mindset and model these behaviors for the organization.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Sciences, or field as outlined in the essential duties. </li><li>5+ years of experience with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS).</li><li>5+ years of experience in T-SQL and writing efficient and highly optimized SQL queries.</li><li>4+ years of complete data analysis/mapping and data profiling.</li><li>4+ years of experience setting up SQL Server 2012/2016/2017/2019 features for large database environments and geographically distributed production data centers.</li><li>3+ years of experience in database modelling and data design of OLTP and OLAP applications.</li><li>3+ years of experience with retrieving and loading data from/to various SaaS-based cloud platforms. </li><li>3+ years of experience with Agile methodologies.</li><li>3+ years of experience in Amazon Web Services or other cloud environments.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to perform the Essential Duties of the position with or without accommodation.</li><li>Authorization to work in the United States without sponsorship.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Microsoft SQL Server DBA Certification and/or AWS Database Certification or equivalent.</li><li>Experience with PostgreSQL in the cloud, including Amazon RDS.</li><li>Experience with MySQL, MongoDB, and MariaDB.</li></ul><p><br></p>Salary Range:<p><br></p>$120,000.00 - $193,000.00<p><br></p>The annual base salary shown is a national range for this position on a full-time basis and may differ by hiring location. In addition, this position is bonus eligible, and is eligible to receive company stock upon hire as well as annually. Benefits offered include a retirement savings plan, paid vacation, holiday and personal days, paid caregiver/parental leave, and health benefits to include medical, prescription drug, dental and vision coverage in accordance with the terms, conditions, and eligibility requirements of the applicable plans.<p><br></p>If you require a reasonable accommodation with the application process, please email hr@exactsciences.com.<p><br></p><em>We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, creed, disability, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other status protected by applicable local, state or federal law. Applicable portions of the Company’s affirmative action program are available to any applicant or employee for inspection upon request.</em><p><br></p>To view the Right to Work, E-Verify Employer, and Pay Transparency notices and Federal, Federal Contractor, and State employment law posters, <em>refer to this link. </em>These documents summarize important details of the law and provide key points that you have a right know.<p><br></p>

describtion: <p><strong>Job Title:</strong> Infrastructure Data Engineer (AWS)</p><p><strong>Location:</strong> San Jose, California, United States</p><p><strong>Type:</strong> Fulltime</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Roles &amp; Responsibilities:</strong></p><ul><li><strong>Design, build and maintain data platform infrastructure on AWS environment.</strong></li><li>Oversee design, build, and maintain data platform<strong>infrastructure on AWS environment</strong>.</li><li>Develop data pipelines to collect the metrics that is required to monitor data refreshes, reports deliveries and track <strong>SLAs</strong>.</li><li>Work with the DWH development team and business users in establishing SLAs for data refreshes and reports.</li><li>Build <strong>continuous integration/deployment (CI/CD)</strong> pipelines to accelerate development and improve team agility.</li><li>Oversee project.</li><li>Monitor all aspects of <strong>data platform system security, performance, storage, incidents</strong>, and <strong>usage</strong> for databases, data pipelines, applications, and infrastructure on AWS. Escalate to respective teams for fixes.</li><li>Ensure data pipelines meet intraday and daily SLAs, as per documented SLA definitions and escalate accordingly.</li><li>develop appropriate instrumentation to collect metrics on system performance, cost, data ingress/egress /storage processes.</li><li>Have a clear understanding of the reports/analyses/insights to be driven by data and build data driven solutions to optimally support the operational analytics needs.</li><li>Documents user stories, epics, and reports</li><li>Coordinate infrastructure enhancements and maintenance with the system/network engineering teams</li><li>Work with <strong>DWH</strong> development team and analytics team to do manual releases where required.</li><li>Onboard users to data analytics systems with appropriate approvals</li><li>Conduct system performance tests and collect metrics. Tune/add capacity.</li><li>Complete knowledge management processes</li><li>Own strategy and communicate potential major shifts in expected workload based on business, market, or operational changes.</li><li>Operate ongoing business relationship management sessions to review operational metrics, understand pain points, identify upcoming projects and engagement efforts.</li></ul>

describtion: <strong>About Glean</strong><p><br></p>We're on a mission to bring people the knowledge they need to make a difference in the world.<p><br></p>Glean was founded by a seasoned team of former Google search and Facebook engineers, who wondered why we don't have an easier way of finding what we need at work. In our personal lives, we have tools to help us find pretty much whatever we need. Why don't we have that at work? And that was the beginning of Glean.<p><br></p>Glean searches across all your company's apps to help you find exactly what you need and discover the things you should know. We're a diverse team of curious and creative people who want to help each other get big things done—so we can help other teams do the same.<p><br></p>We're backed by some of the Silicon Valley's leading venture capitalists—including Sequoia, Kleiner Perkins, Lightspeed, and General Catalyst—and have assembled a world-class team with senior leadership experience at Google, Slack, Facebook, Dropbox, Rubrik, Uber, Intercom, Pinterest, Palantir, and others.<p><br></p><strong>Role</strong><p><br></p>Glean is building a world-class data science org. This is an early-hire, full-stack and hands-on data scientist role spanning product analytics, applied science and building data foundations.<p><br></p><strong>What You Will Do And Achieve</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Analytics: </li><ul><li>You'll refine and measure to improve KPIs for a wide range of knowledge work products like search, generative AI experiences, knowledge management and workplace productivity. </li><li>You'll help measure and improve the efficiency of our ranking and overall infrastructure. </li><li>You'll define, measure and improve the effectiveness of our marketing initiatives to generate more and better sales leads. You'll equip sales teams with quantitative insights to close more and bigger deals. You'll help customer success teams measure and improve how they roll out Glean into customer firms faster, with more adoption and greater partner satisfaction. </li></ul><li>Applied science:</li><ul><li>You'll build tools, techniques and processes to improve the way A/B experimentation is done across the company</li><li>You'll improve tools, techniques and processes in the measurement of the efficacy of ML models used in ranking and various generative-AI products. </li><li>You'll execute on new opportunities to introduce more statistical sophistication into other decision making across the company, e.g. metric forecasting for improved KPI targets, predictive models for more proactive user churn prevention, sophisticated metric alerting systems. </li></ul><li>Data foundations:</li><ul><li>Improve the logging for our products to facilitate improved analytics and applied science techniques</li><li>Build pipelines based on these logs to empower the analytics and applied science applications. </li></ul></ul><p><br></p>You'll have lots of technical learning opportunities across product analytics, applied science and data foundation building in a fast-growing startup with seasoned colleagues. You'll also receive plenty of mentorship on cross-functional collaboration, influence &amp; leadership and career growth. You'll be able to make an outsized impact on Glean's data science culture.<p><br></p><strong>Who You Are</strong> <ul><li>You have a Bachelors/Masters/PhD degree in Statistics, Mathematics or Computer Science, or another quantitative field</li><ul><li>You have 3+ years of industry experience (1+ for Masters degree holders, 1+ for PhD degree holders) with demonstrated </li><ul><li>strong work ethic and evangelism about Glean's vision for improving knowledge work</li><li>ability to bring projects/tasks to fast closure while maintaining high quality execution</li><li>curiosity &amp; ability to learn new skills/tools/business context fast. Turning these learnings into increased independence &amp; scope</li><li>ability to communicate very effectively with collaborators with very different roles</li></ul><li>You are strong at defining good product KPIs/guardrail metrics, dashboarding and analysis of raw data to derive insights</li><li>You are proficient in SQL and the modern data stack (e.g. dbt for analytics engineering / pipelining, Fivetran and Census for ETL/ELT) </li><li>You are proficient in Python. You have experience in writing source-controlled code for pipelines and internal tools for data-oriented decision making. </li><li>You're strong in statistics and/or machine learning. You have experience in applying these skills into tangible improvements in products, internal tools and processes. </li></ul></ul><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Skills And Attributes</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You have experience in B2B SaaS</li><li>You have experience in similar products on ranking, generative AI and knowledge work. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive compensation</li><li>Healthcare</li><li>Flexible work environment</li><li>401k</li><li>Unlimited PTO</li><li>Transparent culture</li><li>Learning and development opportunities</li><li>Company events</li><li>Free meals</li></ul><p><br></p>For California based applicants:<p><br></p>The standard base salary range for this position is $105,000 - $156,000 annually. <em>Compensation offered will be determined by factors such as location, level, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Certain roles may be eligible for variable compensation, equity, and benefits.</em><p><br></p>We are a diverse bunch of people and we want to continue to attract and retain a diverse range of people into our organization. We're committed to an inclusive and diverse company. We do not discriminate based on gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, civil or family status, age, disability, or race.

<strong>Who is Recruiting from Scratch: </strong><p><br></p>Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.<p><br></p><strong> From Our Client </strong><p><br></p>Location: New York / Remote<p><br></p>Job Type: Full-time<p><br></p>Experience: 3+ years<p><br></p><strong>About The Role</strong><p><br></p>Our mission is to increase the number of financially independent people. We believe we can achieve this goal by building tools that enable independent business owners to scale their businesses profitably. Our first product combines a virtual credit card system with dynamic spending limits and software tooling to help merchants grow and optimize their profitability. We are growing very fast -- in less than five months, we grew to millions in card volume. We have a significant waitlist of customers waiting to use our product. We are looking to expand our headcount quickly to support the demand. Our investors include Solomon Hykes (founder of Docker), Paul Buchheit (founder of Gmail), Paul Graham (founder of Y Combinator), Robert Leshner (founder of compound.finance), and many more. We have raised over $30M from top-tier fintech investors.<p><br></p><strong>What You'll Be Working On</strong><p><br></p>You'll be involved in projects of varying scope and complexity:<p><br></p><ul><li> Build credit risk models that segment merchants based on their revenue and spend patterns to offer dynamic credit limits that change with business performance given the high seasonality and fast pace of ecommerce </li><li> Use machine learning tools to build realtime credit underwriting models leveraging alternative and traditional data sources </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You'll Need</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Passion for, or curiosity to learn, financial technology </li><li> Track record of high-quality shipping products and features at scale </li><li> Ability to turn business and product ideas into engineering solutions </li><li> Desire to work in a fast-paced environment, continuously grow and master your craft </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We’d Like To See</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Experience with building out data pipelines (e.g. should know data lakes, data warehouses, ETL, etc.) </li><li> Experience working with data analytics, algorithmic decision making, and real-time data systems </li><li> Experience with different business requirements on data freshness and retention </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> PLUSES </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Proven experience and subject matter expertise in e-commerce payments (nice to have) or financial services. </li><li> Has worked with bank account data (e.g. worked with Plaid), payments data (perhaps Stripe), and/or other fintech data sources </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Why you should join us: </strong><p><br></p>Our mission is to increase the number of financially independent people. We believe we can achieve this goal by building tools that enable independent business owners to scale their businesses profitably. Our first product combines a virtual credit card system with dynamic spending limits and software tooling to help merchants grow and optimize their profitability. We are growing very fast -- in less than five months, we have grown to millions in card volume.<p><br></p>We have a significant waitlist of customers waiting to use our product. We are looking to expand our headcount quickly to support the demand. Our investors include Solomon Hykes (founder of Docker), Paul Buchheit (founder of Gmail), Paul Graham (founder of Y Combinator), Robert Leshner (founder of compound.finance), and many more. We recently closed a financing round of $5M from a top-tier fintech investor.<p><br></p><strong> Salary Range: $150,000-$250,000 base.</strong>

<p><strong>Summary</strong></p><p>My client, a reputable autonomous vehicle start-up based in the SF Bay area, is seeking a senior level Data Infrastructure Engineer to join their team! You would play a crucial role in developing data infrastructure for the company's products and internal tools while contributing to a collaborative team culture.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Responsibilities</strong></p><ul><li>Create efficient data pipelines that can manage large amounts of data.</li><li>Create features that optimize processing pipelines.</li><li>Work with other teams and clients in the AV ecosystem to understand their needs and data system operations.</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Requirements</strong></p><ul><li>Ability to work with open source data processing frameworks.</li><li>Industry experience in autonomy or simulation products.</li><li>Experience working with data lakes/warehouses.</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>FULL-TIME ONLY (NO CONTRACT)</strong></p>
