Prominence is looking for a Data Engineer to assist with dimensional data modeling development for healthcare data architecture project.<p><br></p>Who We Are<p><br></p>Prominence is a healthcare technology strategy and implementation firm, focused on helping the nation’s leading healthcare organizations to do more with their data. Founded by former Epic managers, we understand the technology landscape in healthcare and provide IT staffing, advisory services, and analytics solutions to create robust data ecosystems that support clinical workflows, automate operational processes, and expedite research. Whether it’s guiding a technology implementation, establishing governance principles, or developing leading edge analytics, we help our customers make sense out of the mountain of data at their fingertips in order to deliver higher quality care at a lower cost.<p><br></p>Ranked as a best place to work over 27 times (and counting!), Prominence’s culture provides consultants with a supportive environment that allows you to innovate and grow your career in healthcare IT. Additional information is available on our website.<p><br></p>Your Role<p><br></p>Our consultants guide our customers through complex technology requirements to summit the challenge at hand. You will need to be able to create order out of chaos, and compile ambiguous information into tactical action plans.<p><br></p>Our ideal team members are humble, smart, and driven to ensure our customer’s success. This includes a passion to deliver high-quality results, while teaching our counterparts how to fish and grow the skills needed to support and expand upon the deliverables of our projects.<p><br></p>If this sounds like you, and you meet the requirements below, we encourage you to apply. If you know of someone else how would be a great fit, let us know!<p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p>As a member of our Epic Consulting team, you’ll work closely with our customers to implement and optimize their Epic workflows. In addition to your Epic project work, you will help mentor and grow our customer’s teams, escalate issues, and guide projects to a successful outcome.<p><br></p>Key Responsibilities<p><br></p>Perform Epic-related consulting and advisory services, including but not limited to the following:<p><br></p><ul><li>Apply technical expertise to implement and optimize EMR workflows and data capture</li><li>Mentor customers to up-level their system knowledge and analyst skills</li><li>Analyze operational and business requirements, and translate into system configuration</li><li>Create build documentation and workflow diagrams</li><li>Track and resolve project risks and issues</li><li>Lead meetings and participate in ongoing work-product coordination. </li><li>Transparently report on project status and deliverables. </li><li>Develop robust knowledge transfer documentation to hand-off deliverables to customer teams. </li><li>Additional duties as may be required to successfully deliver a project</li><li>May be invited to participate in corporate functions, events, and meetings</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Desired Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Active Certification(s): Cogito Data Model (Clinical or Revenue Cycle), Cogito Tools, Caboodle Developer</li><li>5+ years of experience as an Epic BI Developer or Data Engineer</li><li>Dimensional data modeling experience</li><li>Caboodle development experience preferred</li><li>SSIS, Azure Data Factory, or Data Lake development preferred</li><li>Demonstrated ability to deliver successful projects remotely</li></ul><p><br></p>Success Criteria<p><br></p>Successful team members at Prominence display the following:<p><br></p><ul><li>High degree of professionalism; treats others with respect, keeps commitments, builds trust within a team, works with integrity, and upholds organizational values. </li><li>Highly organized; able to manage multi-faceted work streams</li><li>Self-motivated; able to maintain schedule, meet deadlines, and monitor your personal work product</li><li>Highly adaptable; able to acclimate quickly to new project assignments and work environments. </li><li>Creative; not paralyzed by problems and able to work collaboratively to find novel solutions</li><li>Clear communication skills; ability to clearly convey messaging that resonates with your audience, in clear and concise written and verbal communications</li><li>Can smell smoke and anticipate issues before they arise, ability to escalate effectively</li><li>Passion to mentor and guide others</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p>Prominence is dedicated to hiring the best and brightest minds in healthcare and maintaining a culture that rewards our employees for following their passion. We are excited to offer the following benefits for this position:<p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive Salaried and Hybrid Compensation Plans</li><li>Health Care Plan (Medical, HSAs, Dental &amp; Vision)</li><li>Retirement Plan (401k)</li><li>Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary &amp; AD&amp;D)</li><li>Dependent &amp; Health Savings Accounts</li><li>Short Term &amp; Long Term Disability</li><li>Paid Time Off (Vacation/Sick &amp; Public Holidays)</li><li>Training &amp; Development Fund</li><li>Technology Stipends (for Qualifying Roles)</li><li>Work From Home</li><li>Charitable Giving to Causes You Believe In</li></ul><p><br></p>Employment Eligibility<p><br></p>Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship.<p><br></p>Commitment to Equal Opportunity<p><br></p>The world’s most talented professionals come from every background. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to age, race, color, religion, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, marital status, veteran or disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. In addition, Prominence will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.<p><br></p>If you are smart and good at what you do, come as you are. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply.<p><br></p>Partnership Eligibility<p><br></p>Our partnerships are extremely important to us. This online application is not intended for anyone who is currently under a non-compete agreement or has an arrangement that precludes employment at Prominence. We appreciate your help in respecting our partners.<p><br></p>Interested in learning more? Apply below to connect with our Talent team about immediate openings and future consulting projects.

<strong>The Challenge<br><br></strong>Crosswire is building the future of enterprise identity. Currently, security engineers spend excessive time granting and auditing permissions for employees. Our product automates this process within minutes. We gather permissions across different enterprise applications, and our access engine automatically provisions access and identifies anomalies. Crosswire provides our customers with the infrastructure they need to manage access at scale.<br><br>And don’t just take our word for it! Within months of our inception, our customers already range from fintech conglomerates transacting billions of dollars per day to unicorn startups looking for best-in-class security. We are rapidly growing and backed by world-class investors. In late 2021, Andreessen Horowitz and General Catalyst co-led our $6M seed round.<br><br><strong>The Role<br><br></strong>We are looking for talented software engineers to join our team as early engineers. You will be working alongside some of the brightest people in the industry to build the next generation of well-designed, robust, and scalable cloud security solution. Our team has a strong engineering culture and believes in delivering beautiful and functional experiences to our customers. The ideal candidate will have significant experience working in a fast-paced, engineering-first organization. The current backend is written in Golang.<br><br>A security background is not required, just a passion for revolutionizing current cloud security access management. While interest in security is always appreciated, we will teach you the security domain knowledge you need during your onboarding.<br><br>Together, we will redefine and transform the security industry.<br><br><strong>What You'll Do<br></strong><ul><li>Tackle interesting algorithms problems to develop novel approaches to risk quantification and prediction</li><li>Design innovative methods for presenting our underlying information architecture to our clients</li><li>Contribute to the direction of the product and see your changes immediately impact the security of our clients</li><li>Help us further build and scale our engineering team as we grow<br><br></li></ul><strong>Benefits At Crosswire<br></strong><ul><li>You will work on challenging problems with world-class peers who enjoy deep thinking and fun debates </li><li>Grow into the leader you aspire to be. At a fast-growing company in an expanding industry, you can enjoy unmatched career growth</li><li>Education is encouraged with our company-wide professional development programs and course reimbursements </li><li>Competitive compensation, top-notch health insurance, maxed-out HSA contribution, and generous 401(k) matching</li><li>Unlimited PTO policy that people actually use — on average, people take three weeks off per year</li><li>Generous equipment budget + Macbook Pro delivered to your door<br><br></li></ul>Compensation Range: $130K - $273K

Company Overview Pattern Energy is a leading renewable energy company that develops, constructs, owns, and operates high-quality wind and solar generation, transmission, and energy storage facilities. Our mission is to transition the world to renewable energy through the sustainable development and responsible operation of facilities with respect for the environment, communities, and cultures where we have a presence. Our approach begins and ends with establishing trust, accountability, and transparency. Our company values of creative spirit, pride of ownership, follow-through, and a team-first attitude drive us to pursue our mission every day. Our culture supports our values by fostering innovative and critical thinking and a deep belief in living up to our promises. Headquartered in the United States, Pattern has a global portfolio of more than 35 power facilities and transmission assets, serving various customers that provide low-cost clean energy to millions of consumers. Job Purpose Pattern Energy is embarking on a major business transformation to scale processes and systems to enable the significant growth of our business. One critical aspect of this transformation is building an enterprise data architecture capable of supporting strong enterprise analytical capabilities and interconnected data across functions for improved and real-time decision making. This new role of Senior Data Engineer will be instrumental in building this future. The Senior Data Engineer will help guide Pattern’s journey by building novel and modern tools, pipelines, and data systems. Through lived experience this role will act in a key strategic resource in our transition from siloed, disparate data assets to a grand, unified, data estate. The senior data engineer will lead development of data systems, namely data lakehouse pipeline, and analytics environments to support data lifecycles across the business. These tools will help drive our efforts toward democratization of data, reducing duplication of effort, and adding value to the data stream. Key Accountabilities Work with the Data team to understand and interpret use cases around the business and develop tools/systems to support data lifecycle from the point of production to the point of consumption. Implement modern technology and concepts to enable Pattern teams’ design of enterprise-grade systems capable of achieving data goals. Develop pipelines and analytics tools, including automations wherever possible Templatize these solutions to help our adoption of infrastructure-as-code Experience/Qualifications/Education Required Previous experience in building enterprise data lifecycle and cloud solutions. 5-7 years experience, specific to data management, analytics, or data reporting. B.S. in a technical field with M.S. preferred. Significant experience delivering Data solutions using the Azure cloud stack Experience with database, data lake, lakehouse design concepts and the use of SQL. Experience with transformations and reporting solutions, namely Power BI Experience with environment management, release management, code versioning, deployment methodologies, and CI/CD tools Additional Requirements Demonstrated excellence and ability to learn new programming skills and languages. Strong understanding of security and governance principles, including access policies Proven record of excellent communication and cooperation with varied stakeholders. Renewable energy industry experience is strongly preferred. Demonstrated experience building scalable data models &amp; ingestion pipelines from a variety of systems including Enterprise Applications (e.g. ERP, CRM), Operational Assets (e.g. SCADA), Big Data (e.g. Weather or product configuration simulators). Technical Skills Experience throughout the Microsoft Integrated Data Platform (IDP) and related stacks including, but not limited to: Azure, AAD, Synapse, Purview, Data Lake, Delta Lake, and Lakehouse design Azure Data Factory, Data Explorer, Logic Apps, Power Automate Databricks; PySpark, and optimized resource consumption, therein The expected starting pay range for this role is $95,000 - $129,000 USD. This range is an estimate and base pay may be above or below the ranges based on several factors including but not limited to location, work experience, certifications, and education. In addition to base pay, Pattern’s compensation program includes a bonus structure for full-time employees of all levels. We also provide a comprehensive benefits package which includes medical, dental, vision, short and long-term disability, life insurance, voluntary benefits, family care benefits, employee assistance program, paid time off and bonding leave, paid holidays, 401(k)/RRSP retirement savings plan with employer contribution, and employee referral bonuses. Pattern Energy Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. LI-AT1 LI-Hybrid ID: 2023-2250 External Company Name: Pattern Energy Group LP External Company URL: www.patternenergy.com Street: 1088 Sansome Street

<strong>About Mashgin</strong><p><br></p>At Mashgin, we are developing the future of checkout experiences. We aim to reduce the friction between customer desires and their ability to be on their way.<p><br></p>In May 2022, Mashgin closed a Series B funding round at a $1.5B valuation. We are backed by some of Silicon Valley’s leading investors including Matrix Partners, NEA and Y Combinator. Our ecosystem is anchored by the only 3D computer vision and deep learning based checkout system in the world. We have 2,000+ locations world wide with customers across a wide spectrum of verticals including the NFL, MLB, Circle K, ampm, Aramark and Compass Group.<p><br></p>We value autonomy of ones work, a culture of respect for one another, and building products with empathy for our customers.<p><br></p>Position Summary<p><br></p>We’re looking for a backend infrastructure developer to help us build the software that runs our kiosks and powers the extensive infrastructure behind them. You’ll work on infrastructure that enables us to develop advanced deep learning solutions that power Mashgin's checkout experience for millions on transactions per month across the world. This is not a specialized position -- we believe in end-to-end ownership of projects, so you’ll be involved throughout the entire product lifecycle, from idea generation, design, and prototyping to execution, and shipping while contributing to many different parts of the codebase in multiple languages.<p><br></p>You Will Be<p><br></p><ul><li>Owning major feature development and working directly with the founders on product development from end to end</li><li>Working with a small interdisciplinary team in hardware, software and design to build new versions of products from scratch</li><li>Work on building new features and dreaming up new architecture to solve challenging problems</li><li>Build backend infrastructure to perform scalable training in the cloud</li><li>Rethinking and recreating existing codebases for scale</li><li>Continuously improving and maintaining code that’s already in production <br><br></li></ul>Minimum Qualifications<p><br></p><ul><li>8+ years relevant coding experience</li><li>B.S. or higher in Computer Science (or equivalent work experience)</li><li>Excellent knowledge of one or more of these languages: Python, Node.js, C++, Go, C#, Java</li><li>Comfortable learning new languages, libraries, and frameworks when the solution calls for it</li><li>Experience building production-ready code that’s used regularly by lots of people<br><br></li></ul>Preferred Qualifications<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience in a fast-paced work environment, shipping quality code quickly and iterating</li><li>Comfortable with deploying and managing cloud infrastructure</li><li>Good knowledge of algorithms and data structures</li><li>Strong proficiency with SQL and other database technologies<br><br><br><br></li></ul><strong>What We Offer<br></strong><ul><li>An opportunity to work on a small, multidisciplinary team with the potential to break new ground in many different industries</li><li>Excellent health, dental and vision insurance for you and your dependents</li><li>401k plan</li><li>Flexible PTO policy</li><li>Competitive salary and options in a small, rapidly scaling company<br><br></li></ul>Mashgin is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Individuals seeking employment at Mashgin are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation.<p><br></p>For roles based in Palo Alto, CA, the overall market range for Mashgin is typically $250,000 - $600,000 USD annually. Note that total compensation for this position will be determined by candidate’s relevant qualifications, work experience, skills, and other relevant factors. This estimate excludes the value of any benefits offered by Mashgin, and the potential future value of any other long-term incentives.

describtion: <strong>Title: Data Analyst</strong><p><br></p><strong>Location: Sunnyvale, CA or Austin, TX or Elk Grove, CA.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Duration: Long term contract</strong><p><br></p><strong>Please make sure that candidates have been using the required skills on a daily/weekly basis for the past 5+ years. </strong><p><br></p><strong><u>The Analyst Role Will</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Use Tableau to create visualizations</li><li>Use SQL to build tables</li><li>Machine learning experience is not required</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>InterSources Inc</strong>, a Certified Diverse Supplier, was founded in 2007 and offers innovative solutions to help clients with Digital Transformations across various domains and industries. Our history spans over 16 years and today we are an Award-Winning Global Software Consultancy solving complex problems with technology. We recognize that our employees and our clients are our strengths as the diverse talents and opportunities they bring to the table enable us to grow as a global platform and they are causally linked with our success. We provide strategic and technical advice, and we have expertise in areas covering <strong>Artificial Intelligence, Cloud Migration, Custom Software Development, Data Analytics Infrastructure &amp; Cloud Solutions, Cyber Security Services, </strong>etc. We make reasonable accommodations for clients and employees and we do not discriminate based on any protected attribute including race, religion, color, national origin, gender sexual orientation, gender identity, age, or marital status. We also are a <strong>Google Cloud partner </strong>company. We align strategy with execution and provide secure service solutions by developing and using the latest technologies that thrive our resources to deliver industry-leading capabilities to our clients and customers, making it convenient for our clients to do business with InterSources Inc. Our teams also drive growth by refining technology-driven client experiences that put the users first, providing an unparalleled experience. This results in strengthening the core technologies of clients, enabling them to scale with flexibility, create seamless digital experiences and build lifelong relationships.

<strong>Electric Hydrogen</strong>’s mission is to make molecules to decarbonize our world! Our outstanding people are our most important asset and will allow us to deliver hydrogen from renewable electrolysis for heavy industry, at prices below fossil fuels.<br><br>We are searching for a <strong>Senior Data Engineer</strong> who will work on Electric Hydrogen's numerous test equipment and manufacturing lines.<br><br>You will be based in <strong>San Carlos, CA.[and can work on a hybrid basis],</strong> <strong>or Remote. </strong>You will report to a Staff Engineer on the Software Engineering team.<br><br><strong>Primary Responsibilities<br><br></strong><ul><li>Ensure data availability to internal and external stakeholders from internal devices and deployed plants</li><li>Architect streaming pipelines, analysis triggers, and notifications</li><li>Work with data from industrial PLCs and other connected devices</li><li>Coalesce data from manufacturing and deployed plant data for use in analysis</li><li>Design data systems for machine learning applications<br><br></li></ul><strong>Basic Qualifications<br><br></strong><ul><li>Familiarity with industrial streaming protocols such as MQTT and Kafka</li><li>Familiarity with OPC servers, OPC UA, and PLC communication</li><li>8+ years working with data pipelines and industrial networks<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br><br></strong><ul><li>A 4-year engineering degree in a relevant domain (all candidates with suitable experience will be considered)</li><li>Knowledge of process historians (OSI PI, FactoryTalk Historian)</li><li>Experience with GCP cloud resources including pub/sub and triggers.</li><li>Experience working with time series data and time series databases</li><li>Knowledge of OSI PI ecosystem including asset framework</li><li>Experience with machine learning data pipelines<br><br></li></ul><strong>Compensation &amp; Benefits<br><br></strong>Electric Hydrogen has three compensation zones: the San Carlos Zone, the Natick Zone, and the National Zone. All employees are assigned to a compensation zone depending on their work location. Remote employees will be assigned a compensation zone once their work location is determined. This can be discussed with your recruiter.<br><br>Senior Data Engineer (P4):<br><br>San Carlos Zone<br><br>$157,000—$208,000 USD<br><br>Natick Zone<br><br>$133,000—$177,000 USD<br><br>National Zone<br><br>$119,000—$159,000 USD<br><br>Actual base salary offered to the hired applicant will be determined based on their work location, level, qualifications, job-related skills, as well as relevant education or training and experience.<br><br>Base salary is just one part of Electric Hydrogen’s total rewards package. We feel strongly that our team should not have to worry about having quality healthcare. In addition to the base salary offered, the hired applicant may receive:<br><br><ul><li>an equity grant </li><li>time off programs </li><li>a $75/month cell phone allowance </li><li>a 4% employer 401(k) match </li><li>100% fully paid premiums for employees and their families: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term &amp; long-term disability coverage </li><li>a discretionary bonus <br><br></li></ul>Electric Hydrogen’s benefits programs are subject to eligibility requirements.<br><br><em>COVID-19 vaccination required for all employees and contingent workers, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved. All prospective hires will be expected to provide proof of vaccination to attend an onsite interview or at their first day of employment.<br><br></em><strong>About Electric Hydrogen<br><br></strong>Electric Hydrogen is a team of the world's experts in scaling technologies for the post-carbon world, with a proven record in transforming the grid and transportation sectors. Backed by some of the world's top venture capital firms, we design and manufacture electrolytic hydrogen systems matched to renewable power sources to create green hydrogen by splitting water. We are building a cost-effective and transformative path between renewable energy and multiple large industrial sectors. Abundant and low-cost renewable energy sources will power the world, and Electric Hydrogen technology will use this energy to decarbonize industry through sustainable materials. We were founded in 2020 and are based in California and Massachusetts.<br><br>Electric Hydrogen is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace for all to belong. We are aware that people from historically underrepresented groups are less likely to apply if they don't meet 100% of the job requirements. We are actively working on efforts to change this social norm. If you are excited about this role, <strong>we encourage you to apply</strong>!

jobs_titles: Senior Software Engineer - Database Engine Internals
describtion: Our mission at Databricks is to radically simplify the whole data lifecycle from ingestion to ETL, BI, and all the way up to ML/AI with a unified platform. To achieve this goal, we believe the data warehouse architecture as we know it today will be replaced by a new architectural pattern, Lakehouse (CIDR 2021 paper), open platforms that unify data warehousing and advanced analytics. The new architecture will help address several major challenges, including data staleness, reliability, total cost of ownership, data lock-in, and limited use-case support.<p><br></p>A critical part of realizing this vision is the next generation (decoupled) query engine and structured storage system that can outperform specialized data warehouses in relational query performance, yet retain the expressiveness and of general purpose systems such as Spark to support diverse workloads ranging from ETL to data science.<p><br></p><strong> As Part Of This Team, You Will Be Working In One Or More Of The Following Areas To Design And Implement These Next Gen Systems That Leapfrog State-of-the-art </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Query compilation and optimization</li><li>Distributed query execution and scheduling</li><li>Vectorized execution engine</li><li>Data security</li><li>Resource management</li><li>Transaction coordination</li><li>Efficient storage structures (encodings, indexes)</li><li>Automatic physical data optimization</li></ul><p><br></p><strong> What We Look For </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>A passion for database systems, storage systems, distributed systems, language design, or performance optimization</li><li>Experience working towards a multi-year vision with incremental deliverables</li><li>Motivated by delivering customer value and impact</li><li>5+ years of experience working in a related system (preferred)</li><li>Optional: PhD in databases or distributed systems</li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Benefits </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Comprehensive health coverage including medical, dental, and vision</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Equity awards</li><li>Flexible time off</li><li>Paid parental leave</li><li>Family Planning</li><li>Gym reimbursement</li><li>Annual personal development fund</li><li>Work headphones reimbursement</li><li>Employee Assistance Program (EAP)</li><li>Business travel accident insurance</li><li>Mental wellness resources</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement</strong><p><br></p>As a federal government contractor, Databricks requires new U.S. employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Proof of vaccination will be required as a condition of employment. Databricks will make reasonable accommodations based on medical conditions or religious grounds for qualified candidates in accordance with applicable law.<p><br></p><strong>Pay Range Transparency</strong><p><br></p>Databricks is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The pay range(s) for this role is listed below and represents base salary range for non-commissionable roles or on-target earnings for commissionable roles. Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to job-related skills, depth of experience, relevant certifications and training, and specific work location. Based on the factors above, Databricks utilizes the full width of the range. The total compensation package for this position may also include eligibility for annual performance bonus, equity, and the benefits listed above. For more information regarding which range your location is in visit our page here.<p><br></p>Local Pay Range<p><br></p>$166,000—$225,000 USD<p><br></p><strong> About Databricks </strong><p><br></p>Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 9,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Lakehouse Platform to unify their data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe. Founded by the original creators of Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow, Databricks is on a mission to help data teams solve the world’s toughest problems. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.<p><br></p><strong>Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion</strong><p><br></p>At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.<p><br></p><strong>Compliance</strong><p><br></p><strong>If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.</strong>

We are <strong> CARIAD </strong> , an automotive software development team with the Volkswagen Group. Our mission is to make the automotive experience safer, more sustainable, more comfortable, more digital, and more fun. To achieve that we are building the leading tech stack for the automotive industry and creating a unified software platform for over 10 million new vehicles per year. We’re looking for talented, digital minds like you to help us create code that moves the world. Together with you, we’ll build outstanding digital experiences and products for all Volkswagen Group brands that will transform mobility. Join us as we shape the future of the car and everyone around it.<p><br></p><strong><u>Role Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>The Principal Data Engineer ML Sr position is responsible for designing, owning and developing highly scalable and available services for data ingestion and data processing. The Principal Data Engineer ML Sr will contribute by developing novel approaches to develop and continuously improve a new end-to-end system for intelligent data collection in the vehicle and machine learning applications in the cloud-based big data platform. The Principal Data Engineer ML Sr will be a member of CARIAD’s senior technical team and interfaces with multiple stakeholders of VW Group’s technical team members.<p><br></p><strong><u>Role </u></strong><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>Data Engineering Data Lake Platform<p><br></p><ul><li>Designs, owns and develops highly scalable and available services for data ingestion and data processing</li><li>Provides an infrastructure and backend system for large-scale datasets, which is of utmost importance for the training of automated driving functions</li><li>Designs the systems’ quality control and data validation </li><li>Analyzes and improves existing data sources and metrics</li><li>Continuously improves efficiency by automating the labeling workflows</li><li>Develops novel approaches to continuously measure and improve the quality of the datasets</li><li>Designs and implements backend services and tools that handle fleet data collection, batch processing, training, simulation, and evaluation based on real-world sensor data </li></ul><p><br></p>Operational Management<p><br></p><ul><li>Owns the relationship with technical interfaces locally, engage in strategic discussions and negotiations.</li><li>Locates, acquires, and retains extraordinary talent for the ramp-up phase of the Engineering Team and for future growth.</li><li>Monitor compliance with relevant local regulations, statutes, Board Directives, process standards (including in respect of Golden Rules and Product Compliance), procedural/operating instructions and occupational safety regulations using appropriate management controls (dual-control principle).</li><li>Identify and mitigate project technology risks and execution risks</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Years Of Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>12+ years of experience with data modelling and data engineering for data and compute-intensive applications</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Education</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> MS in computer science, mathematics or a similar quantitative area with outstanding grades</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Desired Education</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> PhD and relevant publications and/or patents</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Skills:</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Technical leadership skills</li><li>Analytical and conceptual thinking</li><li>Experience in developing software for</li><li>Communication skills - interpersonal, presentation and written</li><li>Integration - joining people, processes or systems</li><li>Influencing and negotiation skills</li><li>Strategic/visionary minded</li><li>Resource management</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills:</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent strategically thinking, negotiation, and communication skills. </li><li>10+ years of experience with data modelling and data engineering for data and compute-intensive applications (incl. Persistent Layer Technology and MLOps) including cloud provider technology (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.)</li><li>7+ years of experience as a tech lead, significantly contributing in overarching system design and SW architecture matters </li><li>Extensive experience with databases (e.g. Cassandra, InfluxDB, MongoDB etc. but the capability to adapt to new technologies is more important)</li><li>Substantial experience with distributed persistent layer technology for data- and compute-intensive applications</li><li>Sound experience with security for data- and compute-intensive applications</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Desired Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>First-author publications in the top notch journals in the field </li><li>Prior experience with autonomous driving, sensor fusion or computer vision at scale</li><li>Experience in working with teams focusing on data analysis and optimizing deep net performance</li><li>Knowledge of Python and deep learning frameworks (e.g. PyTorch, Tensorflow)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Work Flexibility</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Frequent travel to worldwide locations required</li></ul><u><strong>Compensation</strong></u><p><br></p>Salary range is dependent on factors such as geographical differentials, credentials or certifications, industry-based experience, qualification and training. In the city of Santa Clara, California, the salary range for this position is $188,200 - $242,500.<p><br></p>CARIAD is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We welcome and encourage applicants from all backgrounds, and do not discriminate based on race, sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, national origin, religion, color, gender identity/expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by applicable laws.

The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for providing data analysis, delivering meaningful insights, and making strategic recommendations across multiple subscription product lines, including advertising. This role will join forces with cross-functional teams across the company and help define and track business KPIs.<p><br></p>The ideal candidate will be a critical thinker, a competent problem solver, and brings a strong analytical mindset. They must be highly motivated, passionate, organized, and can operate effectively in independent and collaborative teams. Must have a deep understanding of SaaS-based subscription services and a willingness to work towards creative solutions to complex problems in a timely manner. It is a unique opportunity to be part of a growing Data Team at Rockbot.<p><br></p>The Rockbot team is committed to creating uniquely curated brand opportunities by changing the way content is experienced in businesses of every size and shape. We are technologists, music lovers, and content creators all focused on producing the most amazing customer experience possible - and we're having a great time doing it! If this sounds compelling, let's talk.<p><br></p>We're on a rocketship and expanding our business rapidly - reach out to jump aboard!<p><br></p><strong>You Will: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collect, clean, and prepare data from various sources to conduct a deep analysis </li><li>Benchmark and track progress against key operational performance goals and initiatives</li><li>Create reports, dashboards, and visualizations that effectively communicate data insights to internal stakeholders, including executives, product teams, and cross-functional teams</li><li>Integrate business intelligence tools into Rockbot's data stack that includes systems such as Salesforce CRM, Netsuite, Google BigQuery etc. </li><li>Conduct data mining, regression and quantitative analysis while maintaining data documentation for both internal and external consumption</li><li>Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and compliance with relevant data protection and privacy regulations</li><li>Lead the business review process including executive level presentations that include key opportunities and recommendations</li><li>Play a key role in understanding the data architecture that meets our business requirements by partnering with data engineering</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>You Have: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree with a background in Math, Economics, Computer Science, Statistics, or other quantitative fields</li><li>4 - 5 years experience in data analytics and reporting </li><li>Expertise in pulling large and complex data using SQL, database management, writing data pipelines and knowledge of data modeling</li><li>Knowledge of Excel &amp; Google sheet and hands-on experience in SQL</li><li>Working proficiency in Business Intelligence tools, e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker, Domo etc. </li><li>A deep understanding of data science programming languages (e.g., Python, R)</li><li>Ambiguity; able to thrive with minimal oversight and process, while keeping leadership informed on progress against deadlines</li><li>Strong communication, presentation &amp; documentation skills</li><li>Knowledge of data repositories such as data stores, warehouses, and lakes</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Rockbot:</strong><p><br></p>Rockbot is the first streaming platform to seamlessly combine TV, Music, and Digital Signage into one simple interface enabling businesses of all sizes to easily control their guest experience. We power in-location media for dozens of industries such as fitness, retail, hotels, restaurants, major airports and SMBs everywhere. Rockbot is backed by Google Ventures, Detroit Ventures, Universal Music and other leading investors.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation: </strong><p><br></p>Rockbot takes a market-based approach to pay, and pay may vary depending on your location in the U.S. The successful candidate's starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future.<p><br></p>The compensation band for this role is $110K to $150K, plus equity, and benefits for all team members.<p><br></p><strong>Our Values:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Drive: We pursue our mission with relentless tenacity, passion, and optimism and inspire those around us to do the same. We love the journey and are on offense all the time. Yesterday was good enough for yesterday, but today we have to do even better. </li><li>Accountability: We take ownership of our promises, responsibilities, behaviors, and products, and we expect the same of others. Standing behind our mistakes, communicating honestly, and making things right creates trust and strong relationships. </li><li>Curiosity: We are hungry to learn and continually deepen our knowledge, skills, and understandings. We have a growth mindset and are intellectually curious. We challenge our beliefs and seek feedback and insights from others. The "Why" and "How" always matters. </li><li>Empathy: We embrace that no two people or businesses are the same. We strive to understand others as deeply as possible and feel their pains and passions. </li><li>Ingenuity: We work hard but we think smart. We bring creativity, technology, and practicality together to solve tough challenges. </li><li>Integrity: We say what we mean, and do what we say, simply, clearly, honestly. </li></ul><p><br></p><em>Rockbot is an Equal Opportunity Employer, but that's just the start. We believe different perspectives help us grow and achieve more. That's why we're dedicated to hiring and developing the most talented and diverse team – which includes individuals with different backgrounds, abilities, identities and experiences.</em>

Canonical is building a comprehensive automation suite to provide multi-cloud and on-premise data solutions for the enterprise. The data platform team is a collaborative team that develops a full range of data stores and data technologies, spanning from big data, through NoSQL, cache-layer capabilities, and analytics; all the way to structured SQL engines.<p><br></p>We are facing the interesting problem of fault-tolerant mission-critical distributed systems and intend to deliver the world's best automation solution for delivering data platforms.<p><br></p>We have a number of openings ranging anywhere from junior to senior level. We will help you identify a suitable position depending on your experience and interests. Engineers who thrive at Canonical are mindful of open-source community dynamics and equally aware of the needs of large, innovative organisations.<p><br></p>Location: This is a Globally remote role<p><br></p>What your day will look like<p><br></p>The data platform team is responsible for the automation of data platform operations. This includes ensuring fault-tolerant replication, TLS, installation, and much more; but also provides domain-specific expertise on the actual data system to other teams within Canonical. This role is focused on the creation and automation of features of data platforms, not analysing the data in them.<p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborate proactively with a distributed team</li><li>Write high-quality, idiomatic Python code to create new features</li><li>Debug issues and interact with upstream communities publicly</li><li>Work with helpful and talented engineers including experts in many fields</li><li>Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions</li><li>Work from home with global travel for 2 to 4 weeks per year for internal and external events</li></ul><p><br></p>What we are looking for in you<p><br></p><ul><li>Proven hands-on experience in software development using Python</li><li>Proven hands-on experience in distributed systems </li><li>Have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM, or a similar degree</li><li>Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring</strong><p><br></p>You might also bring a subset of experience from the following, which will determine the exact role and level we consider you for:<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience operating and managing data platform technologies like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, OpenSearch, Kafka, Yugabyte, Trino, Superset, Atlas, Ranger, and Redis</li><li>Experience with Linux systems administration, package management, and operations</li><li>Experience with the public cloud or a private cloud solution like OpenStack</li><li>Experience with operating Kubernetes clusters and a belief that it can be used for serious persistent data services</li></ul><p><br></p>What we offer you<p><br></p>Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.<p><br></p>In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, please ask your Talent Partner.<p><br></p><ul><li>Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!</li><li>Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum</li><li>Annual compensation review</li><li>Recognition rewards</li><li>Annual holiday leave</li><li>Parental Leave</li><li>Employee Assistance Programme</li><li>Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'</li><li>Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Canonical</strong><p><br></p>Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.<p><br></p>Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.<p><br></p>Canonical is an equal-opportunity employer<p><br></p>We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.<p><br></p>

<p><strong>Job Title: Infra Solutions Data Engineer</strong></p><p><strong>Locations: San Jose, CA (Hybrid)</strong></p><p><strong>Type of hire: Fulltime</strong></p><p><strong> </strong></p><p><strong>Job Description:</strong></p><p><strong> </strong>Design, build and maintain data platform infrastructure on AWS environment </p><p><strong> </strong>Oversee design, build, and maintain data platform infrastructure on AWS environment</p><p><strong> </strong>Develop data pipelines to collect the metrics that is required to monitor data refreshes, reports deliveries and track SLAs.</p><p><strong> </strong>Work with the DWH development team and business users in establishing SLAs for data refreshes and reports</p><p><strong> </strong>Build continuous integration/deployment (CI/CD) pipelines to accelerate development and improve team agility</p><p><strong> </strong>Oversee project</p><p><strong> </strong>Monitor all aspects of data platform system security, performance, storage, incidents, and usage for databases, data pipelines, applications, and infrastructure on AWS. Escalate to respective teams for fixes.</p><p><strong> </strong>Ensure data pipelines meet intraday and daily SLAs, as per documented SLA definitions and escalate accordingly. </p><p><strong> </strong>develop appropriate instrumentation to collect metrics on system performance, cost, data ingress/egress /storage processes</p><p><strong> </strong>Have a clear understanding of the reports/analyses/insights to be driven by data and build data driven solutions to optimally support the operational analytics needs</p><p><strong> </strong>Documents user stories, epics, and reports</p><p><strong> </strong>Coordinate infrastructure enhancements and maintenance with the system/network engineering teams</p><p><strong> </strong>Work with DWH development team and analytics team to do manual releases where required.</p><p><strong> </strong>Onboard users to data analytics systems with appropriate approvals</p><p><strong> </strong>Conduct system performance tests and collect metrics. Tune/add capacity</p><p><strong> </strong>Complete knowledge management processes</p><p><strong> </strong>Own strategy and communicate potential major shifts in expected workload based on business, market, or operational changes. </p><p><strong> </strong>Operate ongoing business relationship management sessions to review operational metrics, understand pain points, identify upcoming projects and engagement efforts</p>

<strong>Who is Recruiting from Scratch: </strong><p><br></p>Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.<p><br></p><strong> From Our Client </strong><p><br></p>Location: New York / Remote<p><br></p>Job Type: Full-time<p><br></p>Experience: 3+ years<p><br></p><strong>About The Role</strong><p><br></p>Our mission is to increase the number of financially independent people. We believe we can achieve this goal by building tools that enable independent business owners to scale their businesses profitably. Our first product combines a virtual credit card system with dynamic spending limits and software tooling to help merchants grow and optimize their profitability. We are growing very fast -- in less than five months, we grew to millions in card volume. We have a significant waitlist of customers waiting to use our product. We are looking to expand our headcount quickly to support the demand. Our investors include Solomon Hykes (founder of Docker), Paul Buchheit (founder of Gmail), Paul Graham (founder of Y Combinator), Robert Leshner (founder of compound.finance), and many more. We have raised over $30M from top-tier fintech investors.<p><br></p><strong>What You'll Be Working On</strong><p><br></p>You'll be involved in projects of varying scope and complexity:<p><br></p><ul><li> Build credit risk models that segment merchants based on their revenue and spend patterns to offer dynamic credit limits that change with business performance given the high seasonality and fast pace of ecommerce </li><li> Use machine learning tools to build realtime credit underwriting models leveraging alternative and traditional data sources </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You'll Need</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Passion for, or curiosity to learn, financial technology </li><li> Track record of high-quality shipping products and features at scale </li><li> Ability to turn business and product ideas into engineering solutions </li><li> Desire to work in a fast-paced environment, continuously grow and master your craft </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We’d Like To See</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Experience with building out data pipelines (e.g. should know data lakes, data warehouses, ETL, etc.) </li><li> Experience working with data analytics, algorithmic decision making, and real-time data systems </li><li> Experience with different business requirements on data freshness and retention </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> PLUSES </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Proven experience and subject matter expertise in e-commerce payments (nice to have) or financial services. </li><li> Has worked with bank account data (e.g. worked with Plaid), payments data (perhaps Stripe), and/or other fintech data sources </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Why you should join us: </strong><p><br></p>Our mission is to increase the number of financially independent people. We believe we can achieve this goal by building tools that enable independent business owners to scale their businesses profitably. Our first product combines a virtual credit card system with dynamic spending limits and software tooling to help merchants grow and optimize their profitability. We are growing very fast -- in less than five months, we have grown to millions in card volume.<p><br></p>We have a significant waitlist of customers waiting to use our product. We are looking to expand our headcount quickly to support the demand. Our investors include Solomon Hykes (founder of Docker), Paul Buchheit (founder of Gmail), Paul Graham (founder of Y Combinator), Robert Leshner (founder of compound.finance), and many more. We recently closed a financing round of $5M from a top-tier fintech investor.<p><br></p><strong> Salary Range: $150,000-$250,000 base.</strong>

describtion: <strong>Summary:</strong><p><br></p>Micross STS is an independent engineering test services company providing reliability and performance characterization services across a range of electronic components for use in extreme Space and Mil Aerospace applications. The Software Engineer will work closely with all levels of the organization to determine equipment and services that will solve business requirements. Micross is a preferred manufacturer for top-tier prime contractors and the United States government. This requires the Software Engineer to work as a change agent within the organization. This Software Engineer must have the capability and capacity to learn a broad range of skills.
