At Qualia, we've built a new class of real estate technology that simplifies home buying and selling into a simple, secure, and enjoyable process. Our products bring together users from across the real estate ecosystem---homebuyers and sellers, lenders, title and escrow agents, and real estate agents---onto a single shared platform, providing greater clarity and transparency to real estate transactions. Today, millions of consumers use Qualia to close on homes every year.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You'll Work On</u></strong><p><br></p>We are hiring entrepreneurial engineers interested in being a part of our product-focused engineering team. Our engineers are conscientious hackers who like teamwork but are also comfortable with independent projects. Our engineering team releases new software every week, moves at a fast pace, and works directly with our design and customer-facing teams to imagine and build the new experiences our customers love. Because of that, you’ll get a rewarding variety of projects to work on.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Your work will focus on building web technologies, both frontend, and backend. You will develop exciting new products and add new features to our core web applications. </li><li> Our engineers are generalists, and your responsibilities will be flexible based on company needs as well as your skills and interests. </li></ul> <strong><strong>YOUR BACKGROUND THAT LIKELY MAKES YOU A MATCH</strong></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> We are looking for strong full-stack engineers. </li><li> We value engineers who have good product sense, attention to detail, and passion for the impact of the software they build. </li><li> 3+ years of professional experience in software development and a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or in a relevant field of study. </li></ul> <strong><strong>THE TECH STACK YOU'LL USE</strong></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Javascript / NodeJS </li><li> Semantic UI </li><li> MongoDB </li><li> Microservice architecture / Kubernetes </li><li> AWS </li></ul><p><br></p>California and Colorado Applicants: This role has a base annual salary of $130,000-$150,000 plus a competitive equity and benefits package. (Salary to be determined by relevant experience, location, knowledge, and skills of the applicant, internal equity, and alignment with market data.)<p><br></p><strong><strong>WHY QUALIA</strong></strong><p><br></p>Qualia is made up of incredibly bright, mission-driven coworkers who are passionate about using technology to solve real world problems---and we're growing quickly. In order to continue building an engaging and dynamic organization, we're committed to giving everyone the support they need to do great work.<p><br></p>Our benefits package is designed to allow our team members to be their best selves, both in and out of the workplace. In addition to comprehensive health plans, a 401k program, and commuter benefits, we prioritize family and personal well-being through professional development, parental leave, and a flexible time off policy. Qualia offers a robust online onboarding program to train new hires, biweekly all hands meetings, daily meditation sessions, and a variety of internal virtual events to keep employees connected.<p><br></p>We believe diverse perspectives and backgrounds are critical to building great technology, and our goal is to cultivate an environment where people feel equally valued and respected. Qualia is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace, and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, age, citizenship, socioeconomic status, disability, or veteran status.

The <strong> Chan Zuckerberg Biohub San Francisco </strong>( CZ Biohub SF ) ( https://w www.czbiohub.org/sf ) is an independent nonprofit research institute that brings together three powerhouse universities - Stanford, UC Berkeley, and UC San Francisco - into a single collaborative technology and discovery engine. CZ Biohub SF itself supports some of the brightest, boldest engineers, data scientists, and biomedical researchers to investigate the fundamental mechanisms underlying disease and develop new technologies that will lead to actionable diagnostics and effective therapies. We are guided by our values of scholarly excellence; disruptive innovation; hands-on engineering/hacking/building; partnership and collaboration; open communication and respect; inclusiveness; and opportunity for all.<p><br></p><strong>Our Vision</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> We pursue large scientific challenges that cannot be pursued in conventional environments </li><li> We enable individual investigators to pursue their riskiest and most innovative ideas </li><li> The technologies developed at CZ Biohub San Francisco facilitate research by scientists and clinicians at our home institutions and beyond </li></ul><p><br></p>Diversity of thought, ideas, and perspectives are at the heart of CZ Biohub Network and enable disruptive innovation and scholarly excellence. We are committed to cultivating an inclusive organization where all colleagues feel inspired and know their work makes an important contribution.<p><br></p><strong>The Opportunity</strong><p><br></p>The Software Engineering team at the Chan Zuckerberg Biohub works at the intersection of engineering and cutting-edge scientific research. We work on a diverse range of projects, from core internal infrastructure tools, to innovative data visualization tools and novel computer vision models. We are seeking a <strong>Bioinformatics Software Engineer</strong> to lead the development of our core internal bioinformatics pipelines. This position will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining these pipelines, in collaboration with the data science and genomics teams, and with a heavy emphasis on Next Generation Sequencing. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to ambitious, world-class scientific research projects in a highly collaborative and well-funded scientific environment.<p><br></p><strong>What You'll Do</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design, develop, and test new bioinformatics pipelines and maintain existing ones</li><li>Collaborate with key stakeholders to elucidate, understand, and document pipeline specifications and maintenance needs</li><li>Develop tooling to automate pipelines when appropriate, emphasizing quality, reproducibility, and efficiency</li><li>Facilitate clear and effective communication around pipeline development across genomics, software engineering, data science, and scientific computing teams</li><li>Create and update technical documentation on pipelines, procedures, best practices, etc.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You'll Bring</strong><p><br></p>Essential –<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in biology, computational biology, bioinformatics, engineering, computer science, information systems, or a related field from an accredited college or university</li><li>3+ years of relevant work experience, post-bachelor’s, in engineering-centric bioinformatics roles</li><li>Solid understanding of genomics, genetics, and molecular biology concepts related to NGS technologies and data analysis</li><li>Extensive hands-on experience with standard bioinformatics workflows, including demultiplexing (e.g. bcl2fastq, Sabre), read alignment (e.g. CellRanger, kallisto, HISAT2, salmon), variant calling, and annotation</li><li>Extensive hands-on experience with pipeline development tools such as Nextflow and Snakemake</li><li>Experience with Illumina binaries</li><li>Proficiency in a major programming language such as Python or Java.</li><li>Experience with UNIX/Linux and high performance computing (HPC) environments</li><li>Familiarity with professional software development best practices (testing, documentation, version control, CI/CD pipelines)</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex data analysis issues</li><li>Excellent written and oral communication skills and an ability to express technical concepts in an accessible way </li></ul><p><br></p>Nice to have -<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with AWS</li><li>Experience with PacBio tools and data</li><li>Experience with single-cell sequencing and spatial transcriptomics datasets</li><li>Track record of contributions to open-source software projects related to bioinformatics</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Chan Zuckerberg Biohub Networkrequires all employees, contractors, and interns, regardless of work location or type of role, to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination, including a booster vaccine dose, if eligible, by their start date. Those who are unable to get vaccinated or obtain a booster dose because of a disability, or who choose not to be vaccinated due to a sincerely held religious belief, practice, or observance must have an approved exception prior to their start date.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Compensation</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Software Engineer II = $100,000 - $137,500</li><li>Senior Software Engineer = $120,000 - $165,000</li></ul><p><br></p>New hires are typically hired into the lower portion of the range, enabling employee growth in the range over time. To determine starting pay, we consider multiple job-related factors including a candidate’s skills, education and experience, market demand, business needs, and internal parity. We may also adjust this range in the future based on market data. Your recruiter can share more about the specific pay range during the hiring process.<p><br></p><strong>What We Provide</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Resources to disrupt and innovate at the frontiers of our knowledge of biology and disease </li><li> A collegial and collaborative environment consisting of diverse expertise </li><li> Existing collaborations within CZ Biohub: Technology Platforms (Bioengineering, Computational Microscopy, Data Science, Genomics &amp; Mass Spectrometry), Infectious Disease , and Quantitative Cell Science </li><li> Access to collaborators, resources and facilities at our three partner universities (Stanford, UC Berkeley, and UC San Francisco) and at partner organizations in the Bay Area and beyond </li><li> Competitive compensation and benefits commensurate with the experience </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p>We offer a robust benefits program that enables the important work Biohubbers do everyday. Our benefits include healthcare coverage, life and disability insurance, commuter subsidies, family planning services with fertility care, childcare stipend, 401(k) match, flexible time off and a generous parental leave policy. In addition, we honor our commitment to career development and our value of scholarly excellence through regular onsite opportunities to learn from the world's leading scientists.<p><br></p>CZ Biohub Network is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity of thought, ideas and perspectives. We are committed to cultivating an inclusive organization where all Biohubbers feel inspired and know their work makes an important contribution. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law.<p><br></p>Pursuant to the California Fair Chance Act, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.<p><br></p>Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. CZ Biohub does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. CZ Biohub will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with CZ Biohub.

jobs_titles: Staff Software Engineer - Core Data Engineering
describtion: Afresh is on a mission to eliminate food waste and make fresh food accessible to all. Our first A.I.-powered solution optimizes ordering, forecasting, and store operations for fresh food departments in brick-and-mortar grocers. With our Fresh Operating System, regional and national grocery retailers have placed $1.6 billion in produce orders across the US and we've helped our partners prevent 34 million pounds of food from going to waste. Working at Afresh represents a one-of-a-kind opportunity to have massive social impact at scale by leveraging uncommonly impactful software – we hope you'll join us!<p><br></p><strong>About The Role</strong><p><br></p>You’ll be a key member of our Core Data Engineering team. You’ll be owning changes to our common code and standard schemas to fit the company’s product needs (i.e. new products and features), and creating tools to help increase our customer integration velocity. If you're interested in building software to support our mission, we hope you'll join us!<p><br></p><ul><li>Design, build, scale, and deploy fast and reliable ETL pipelines in Python, Pandas, Spark, SQL, and DBT, - across our data platforms (powered by Databricks, Postgres, Snowflake, and Delta Lakes) - to process billions of data points from US retail stores and to power our recommendation engine and ordering system</li><li>Collaborate with an interdisciplinary team of experts in Go-To-Market, machine learning, data science, product, and product engineering to understand how to properly transform customer data and to implement solutions</li><li>Monitor and analyze data, and work with internal stakeholders to either create dashboards, clearly escalate high-priority issues back to the customer, or find novel workarounds to extract the signal we need from customer data</li><li>Develop standard tools that help increase the velocity at which we can integrate new customers and release new product features</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Skills And Experience</strong><p><br></p>The following represents attributes our ideal candidate possesses. We encourage all highly-qualified candidates to apply, even if they do not fulfill all the listed criteria.<p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to identify a problem or area of improvement, design, solution, and see it through to implementation</li><li>Strong understanding and experience with various data stores (databases, data warehouses, key/value stores, etc.). Experience with Apache Spark, Pandas, SQL, or other Big Data frameworks and cloud infrastructure preferred</li><li>Experienced with architecture &amp; design of data driven solutions</li><li>Strong problem-solving ability and ability to work through ambiguity and incomplete specifications</li><li>Dedication to code quality, testing, design processes, automation, and operational excellence</li><li>An active stakeholder in engineering tools discussions and help us build and design for future growth</li><li>Excellent written communication, verbal communication, and collaboration skills</li></ul><p><br></p>Afresh is committed to pay equity and providing highly competitive cash compensation, equity, and benefits package. Afresh conducts a pay equity audit twice each year to ensure that jobs of similar scope and impact are paid similar amounts. The final compensation offered for this role will be based on multiple factors such as the role’s scope, complexity, internal equity, the candidate’s experience/expertise, and success through the interview process.<p><br></p>Salary Band:<p><br></p><strong>About Afresh</strong><p><br></p>Founded in 2017, Afresh is working on the #1 solution to curb climate change: reducing food waste. By combining human insight and transformative technology, we're helping grocers provide fresher food to customers at more affordable prices.<p><br></p>Afresh sits at an incredible intersection of positive social impact, rocket ship financial growth, and cutting-edge technology. Our best-in-class AI research has been published in top journals including ICML, and we've raised over $148 million in funding from investors including former co-CEO of Whole Foods Market Walter Robb and Eric Schmidt's Innovation Endeavors.<p><br></p>Fresh is the past, present, and future of our food system – the waste we create today will impact our planet for years to come. Join us as we continue to build a vibrant, diverse, and inclusive team that embodies our company’s values of proactivity, kindness, candor, and humility.<p><br></p>Afresh provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, marital status, pregnancy or related condition, or any other basis protected by law.<p><br></p><strong>Here at Afresh, many of our employees work remotely provided that they reside in one of the following states: AR, CA, CO, FL, GA, IL, KY, MA, MI, MT, MO, NV, NJ, NY, NC, OR, PA, TX, WA, WI. However, there may be key roles that will require a candidate/employee to be local to our San Francisco, CA office. In which case this requirement will be included in the job posting details under "Skills and experience" for reference.</strong>

SpaceX was founded under the belief that a future where humanity is out exploring the stars is fundamentally more exciting than one where we are not. Today SpaceX is actively developing the technologies to make this possible, with the ultimate goal of enabling human life on Mars.<p><br></p><strong>SOFTWARE ENGINEER (STARLINK)</strong><p><br></p>At SpaceX we're leveraging our experience in building rockets and spacecraft to deploy Starlink, the world's most advanced broadband internet system. Starlink is the world's largest satellite constellation and is providing fast, reliable internet to 1M+ users worldwide. We design, build, test, and operate all parts of the system – thousands of satellites, consumer receivers that allow users to connect within minutes of unboxing, and the software that brings it all together. We've only begun to scratch the surface of Starlink's potential global impact and are looking for best-in-class engineers to help maximize Starlink's utility for communities and businesses around the globe.<p><br></p>As a Software Engineer on the Starlink program, you will be solving challenges underpinning ever aspect of the program's growth. The areas you could have an impact on could include, but are not limited to, building:<p><br></p><ul><li>Next generation networking technologies to direct data through an ever-changing network of satellites, ground stations, and users. </li><li>Firmware, embedded and controls software running on custom hardware that flies the world's largest fleet of spacecraft. </li><li>Infrastructure and tools to enable rapid development and reliable deployment of our code to dynamic production environments. </li><li>Measurement system software and hardware, supporting our in-house RF Silicon designs. </li></ul><p><br></p>Our software engineers are responsible for the complete lifecycle of the software they create, including development, testing, and support.<p><br></p><strong>RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop highly reliable and available software systems for our low latency, high capacity satellite-based global software defined network. </li><li>Design and implement highly available, fault-tolerant network that operates for long periods of time with minimal maintenance at scale. </li><li>Participate in architecture, design, and code reviews. </li><li>Develop prototypes to prove out key design concepts and quantify technical constraints. </li><li>Collaborate with other engineers to plan and organize the development of our products. </li></ul><p><br></p>There are several sub-teams within Starlink software with different focus areas. Applicants will interview for specific teams based on hiring needs and qualifications. Specific team responsibilities might include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Write high quality Linux based software for common processors and microcontrollers (e.g. ARM, PowerPC, x86, etc.). </li><li>Invent new tools that enable more frequent and reliable software deployment, test execution, and data analysis as part of a continuous integration and release system. </li><li>Develop tools that allow for test execution across multiple environments: virtualized hardware, real hardware-in-the-loop simulations, and on-orbit testing. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, math, or science discipline; OR 2+ years of professional experience in software development in lieu of a degree. </li><li>Development experience in C, C++, python, or mobile development languages. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Developed, debugged and deployed software that has been used in real world applications/projects. </li><li>Creative approach to problem solving, exceptional analytical skills and engineering fundamentals. </li><li>Solid fundamental knowledge of networks, electronics, math, and physics. </li><li>Strong skills in debugging, performance optimization, and unit testing. </li><li>Excellent communication skills both written and verbal. </li><li>Ability to work effectively in a dynamic environment with changing needs and requirements. </li></ul><p><br></p>Some preferred skills and experience depend on the specific team within Starlink software, and may include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with networking protocols (UDP, TCP/IP, etc.). </li><li>Experience in C++ for high performance systems. </li><li>Experience with security issues associated with distributed systems and internet services. </li><li>Deep understanding of testing, continuous integration, build, deployment &amp; continuous monitoring. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Must be willing to work extended hours and weekends as needed. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS: </strong><p><br></p>Pay range:<p><br></p>Software Engineer/Level I: $130,000.00 - $155,000.00/per year<p><br></p>Software Engineer/Level II: $150,000.00 - $180,000.00/per year<p><br></p>Your actual level and base salary will be determined on a case-by-case basis and may vary based on the following considerations: job-related knowledge and skills, education, and experience.<p><br></p>Base salary is just one part of your total rewards package at SpaceX. You may also be eligible for long-term incentives, in the form of company stock, stock options, or long-term cash awards, as well as potential discretionary bonuses and the ability to purchase additional stock at a discount through an Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You will also receive access to comprehensive medical, vision, and dental coverage, access to a 401(k)-retirement plan, short &amp; long-term disability insurance, life insurance, paid parental leave, and various other discounts and perks. You may also accrue 3 weeks of paid vacation &amp; will be eligible for 10 or more paid holidays per year. Exempt employees are eligible for 5 days of sick leave per year.<p><br></p><strong>ITAR REQUIREMENTS:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>To conform to U.S. Government export regulations, applicant must be a (i) U.S. citizen or national, (ii) U.S. lawful, permanent resident (aka green card holder), (iii) Refugee under 8 U.S.C. </li><li>1157, or (iv) Asylee under 8 U.S.C. </li><li>1158, or be eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about the ITAR here. </li></ul><p><br></p>SpaceX is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with SpaceX is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.<p><br></p>Applicants wishing to view a copy of SpaceX's Affirmative Action Plan for veterans and individuals with disabilities, or applicants requiring reasonable accommodation to the application/interview process should notify the Human Resources Department at (310) 363-6000.

<strong>About us:</strong><p><br></p>Hazel Health, the national leader in school-based telehealth, was founded in 2015 to address systemic inequities in healthcare access, and ensure all children can get the quality care they need and deserve. We leverage digital health technology to provide on-demand physical and mental health care services to over 2 million students in school districts across the country.<p><br></p>Physical and mental telehealth has become more relevant in the lives of children than ever before. Hazel is experiencing tremendous company growth as we respond to our nation's call for equitable, affordable, and safe virtual access to healthcare.<p><br></p>We are a mission-driven team of healthcare and business leaders, educators, and tech innovators, bringing together our unique skills in a meaningful way to do good in the world. Please consider joining us to share your gifts and talents with a growing and diverse organization, working to make healthcare available to all students.<p><br></p><strong>The Role: Backend Software Engineer</strong><p><br></p><strong>Location:</strong><em> Remote, San Francisco</em><p><br></p><strong>About This Role:</strong><p><br></p>As a Backend Software Engineer, your day to day will primarily involve working on our server and APIs powering our mobile/web applications and data infrastructure but the ideal candidate isn't afraid of pitching in to help on anything including our mobile clients, web dashboards, and more. If you enjoy learning, love to create and just get things done, you'll fit in well.<p><br></p><strong>This role is perfect for you if:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You enjoy the challenge of solving complex technical problems and delivering iterative solutions that provide value each step of the way. </li><li>You enjoy working with partners across the organization, as well as within your own team to solve problems. </li><li>You are a great communicator who enjoys organizing a team around discovering and delivering solutions. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Your Background:</strong><p><br></p><em>We are looking for diverse individuals who want to support our mission and values. Please consider applying even if you don't fully meet 100% of these criteria. </em><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years of backend software development experience. </li><li>Experience with Java or other backend technologies such as Python, .NET, Typescript or Go. </li><li>Experience designing, querying and scaling relational databases. </li><li>Experience building scalable server infrastructure and debugging complex issues in a production environment. </li><li>Experience working in a cloud environment (AWS, GCP, Heroku). </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Hazel's Core Values:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Exceptional Partnership: We seek to understand, align, and then work to exceed the highest expectations of those we serve. </li><li>Always Accountable: We set high standards for ourselves and each other and deliver. We do what we say we are going to do. </li><li>Make it Happen: Every teammate has the power and responsibility to make our company better. We are collectively imagining and building the product and company of our dreams. </li><li>One Team: Our success is driven by building relationships and collaborating across teams, geographies and functions. Bringing in diverse perspectives and understanding everyone's personal story drives to transformative solutions. </li><li>Never Stop Innovating: We are bold. Our goal is to make transformational change. Sometimes we will fail, and we use it to learn and drive forward. </li><li>Drive Impact: Everything comes down to the impact Hazel makes on people - our families and students, our teammates, our partners, our neighbors, ourselves. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Our Benefits:</strong><p><br></p>This is an exciting position in a fast-paced organization. We offer:<p><br></p><ul><li>A highly competitive salary</li><li>Flexible work hours and the option to work remotely</li><li>Generous, high-quality medical, dental and vision coverage </li><li>401K with a 100% employer match for contributions up to 4% of salary</li><li>Unlimited PTO</li><li>Flexible Spending Account (FSA)</li><li>Employer-paid short-term and long-term disability and employer-sponsored life insurance</li><li>Home office setup including a Macbook, iPad (depending on role), and internet and phone reimbursement for remote positions</li><li>A positive, supportive, and passionate team</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Our Stance On Diversity:</strong><p><br></p><em>At Hazel, we don't just accept differences—we thrive on them. We recognize that having diverse perspectives and backgrounds among our teammates makes our company, our solutions, and our service to families and schools stronger. We are committed to making Hazel an inclusive work environment and helping all staff grow professionally.</em><p><br></p><em>Hazel is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability status, or Veteran status. </em><p><br></p><em>All offers of employment are conditioned on a candidate's consent to a background check and our satisfaction with the results. Qualified candidates with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.</em>

<strong>Who is Recruiting from Scratch: </strong><p><br></p>Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.<p><br></p><strong> From Our Client </strong><p><br></p>Location: New York / Remote<p><br></p>Job Type: Full-time<p><br></p>Experience: 3+ years<p><br></p><strong>About The Role</strong><p><br></p>Our mission is to increase the number of financially independent people. We believe we can achieve this goal by building tools that enable independent business owners to scale their businesses profitably. Our first product combines a virtual credit card system with dynamic spending limits and software tooling to help merchants grow and optimize their profitability. We are growing very fast -- in less than five months, we grew to millions in card volume. We have a significant waitlist of customers waiting to use our product. We are looking to expand our headcount quickly to support the demand. Our investors include Solomon Hykes (founder of Docker), Paul Buchheit (founder of Gmail), Paul Graham (founder of Y Combinator), Robert Leshner (founder of compound.finance), and many more. We have raised over $30M from top-tier fintech investors.<p><br></p><strong>What You'll Be Working On</strong><p><br></p>You'll be involved in projects of varying scope and complexity:<p><br></p><ul><li> Build credit risk models that segment merchants based on their revenue and spend patterns to offer dynamic credit limits that change with business performance given the high seasonality and fast pace of ecommerce </li><li> Use machine learning tools to build realtime credit underwriting models leveraging alternative and traditional data sources </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You'll Need</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Passion for, or curiosity to learn, financial technology </li><li> Track record of high-quality shipping products and features at scale </li><li> Ability to turn business and product ideas into engineering solutions </li><li> Desire to work in a fast-paced environment, continuously grow and master your craft </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We’d Like To See</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Experience with building out data pipelines (e.g. should know data lakes, data warehouses, ETL, etc.) </li><li> Experience working with data analytics, algorithmic decision making, and real-time data systems </li><li> Experience with different business requirements on data freshness and retention </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> PLUSES </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Proven experience and subject matter expertise in e-commerce payments (nice to have) or financial services. </li><li> Has worked with bank account data (e.g. worked with Plaid), payments data (perhaps Stripe), and/or other fintech data sources </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Why you should join us: </strong><p><br></p>Our mission is to increase the number of financially independent people. We believe we can achieve this goal by building tools that enable independent business owners to scale their businesses profitably. Our first product combines a virtual credit card system with dynamic spending limits and software tooling to help merchants grow and optimize their profitability. We are growing very fast -- in less than five months, we have grown to millions in card volume.<p><br></p>We have a significant waitlist of customers waiting to use our product. We are looking to expand our headcount quickly to support the demand. Our investors include Solomon Hykes (founder of Docker), Paul Buchheit (founder of Gmail), Paul Graham (founder of Y Combinator), Robert Leshner (founder of compound.finance), and many more. We recently closed a financing round of $5M from a top-tier fintech investor.<p><br></p><strong> Salary Range: $150,000-$250,000 base.</strong>

<strong><u>Job Family</u></strong><p><br></p>Data Engineering &amp; Architecture Consulting<p><br></p><strong><u>Travel Required</u></strong><p><br></p>Up to 10%<p><br></p><strong><u>Clearance Required</u></strong><p><br></p>Ability to Obtain Public Trust<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Do</u></strong><p><br></p>Our consultants on the Advanced Analytics &amp; Intelligent Automation team help clients maximize the value of their data and automate business processes. This high performing team works with clients to implement the full spectrum of data analytics and data science, from data querying and data wrangling, to data visualization and dashboarding, to predictive analytics, machine learning, and artificial intelligence as well as robotic process automation (RPA). Our services enable our clients to define their information strategy, enable mission critical insights and data-driven decision making, reduce cost and complexity, increase trust, and improve operational effectiveness.<p><br></p>Our consultants focus on client services, while also supporting business development, internal firm initiatives, and ongoing professional development.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Need</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum Security Clearance: US Citizenship</li><li>Minimum Years of Experience: 3</li><li>Minimum Education: Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Economics, or similar quantitative discipline</li><li>Bachelor’s degree</li><li>3 years of experience in data and software engineering, data analytics, and machine learning, including design and implementation of end-to-end production level software and/or data engineering solutions.</li><li>3 years of professional software engineering experience in at least one of the following: Python, JavaScript (e.g., Node.js, React, Vue.js), or C#</li><li>3 years of experience working with cloud computing and database services such as Azure App Service, Databricks, Azure Synapse, AWS EKS, etc.</li><li>3 years of experience in data modeling, including transactional and data warehouse design.</li><li>3 years of experience using common continuous integration, orchestration and infrastructure as code tools and services such as Terraform, GitHub Actions, etc.</li><li>Understanding of Machine Learning <u>Current Employees of LendingClub: Please apply via your internal Workday Account<br><br></u>LendingClub Corporation (NYSE: LC) is the parent company of LendingClub Bank, National Association, Member FDIC, and the only full-spectrum fintech marketplace bank. Members can gain access to a broad range of financial products and services through a technology-driven platform, designed to help them pay less when borrowing and earn more when saving. Since 2007, more than 4 million members have joined the Club to help reach their financial goals. We’re leading the governance of a new industry by developing ethical, responsible ways to bring greater value and better opportunities to our members. Everyone deserves a better financial future and our team is committed to making that a reality. Come join us!<br><br><strong><u>About The Role<br><br></u></strong>Our mission at LendingClub is to empower those who strive to achieve better financial health. Big Data Analytics Platform team plays a crucial role in achieving our mission.<br><br>We are seeking a Principal Analytics Engineer for our Analytics Platform to provide warehouse, data marts, ETL, and information model design. On our analytics platform team, you will have opportunity to use your expertise in data warehousing, data mart design, and schema design skills to enable LendingClub to be data driven company. You will enable our business teams to leverage modern cloud native stack to take business decision. We have PB scale data and intend to provide lead edge products.<br><br><br><br>What You'll Do<br><br><ul><li>You will design data warehouse, data marts, information model design for all our analytics use cases.</li><li>You will work with cloud native technologies such as Snowflake, Tableau, Kafka, and AWS stack.</li><li>You will understand how LendingClub’s data is used for analytics, and how to optimize analytics use cases.</li><li>You will empower our business analysts and data science teams to discover new insights and possibilities.</li><li>You will enable business teams, data analysts, data engineers to be able to query data on an ad-hoc basis.</li><li>Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing analytics, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.</li><li>Build the infrastructure required for optimal query of PB scale data at lower cost while meeting query SLA.</li><li>You will build a common analytics information model across all of Lending Club.</li><li>Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, and program teams to assist with analytics-related technical issues and support their analytics infrastructure needs.</li><li>You will closely with Quality Engineers, and lead products and projects across analytics use cases.<br></li></ul><strong><u><br>About You<br><br></u></strong><ul><li>You’re passionate about Big Data Analytics and building efficient data warehouses and data marts.</li><li>You have excellent listening skills and empathetic to others.</li><li>You believe in simple and elegant solutions and give paramount importance to quality.</li><li>You have a track record of building fast, reliable, and high-quality warehouses for fast query performance.</li><li>Passionate with good understanding of data, with a focus on having fun, while delivering incredible business results.<br></li></ul><strong><u>What You’ll Need To Succeed<br><br></u></strong>Must have skills:<br><ul><li>B.S., M.S. degree in computer science or a related field or equivalent work experience.</li><li>At least 15 years of solid professional experience in design data warehouses, data marts, and information modeling.</li><li>At least 10 years of experience with OLTP and OLAP use cases at scale.</li><li>In-depth knowledge of distributed systems, NoSql DBs, and familiarity with Snowflake.</li><li>Experience working with public cloud platforms, preferably AWS.</li><li>Familiar with Agile methodology, test-driven development, source control management and automated testing.</li><li>Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.</li><li>Experience with technical leadership of products, and teams.<br></li></ul><strong>Work Location<br><br></strong>San Francisco<br><br>We are currently working a hybrid schedule and our teams are in-office Tuesdays and Wednesdays.<br><br><strong><u>Time Zone Requirements<br><br></u></strong>Primarily PT.<br><br><strong><u>Travel Requirements<br><br></u></strong>If you need to travel for work, LendingClub will cover your travel related expenses.<br><br><strong><u>Compensation<br><br></u></strong>The target base salary range for this position is 195,000-230,000. The position is also eligible to receive a bonus (which is based on company performance, employee performance and eligible earnings), equity, and benefits. Our salary ranges, other compensation and benefits offered are determined by role, experience level and location.<br><br>We’re creating new financial services solutions for our members based on fairness, simplicity, and heart, and we treat our employees the same way. We offer a competitive benefits package that includes medical, dental and vision plans for employees and their families, 401(k) match, health and wellness programs, flexible time off policies for salaried employees, up to 16 weeks paid parental leave and more.<br><br>LendingClub is an equal opportunity employer and dedicated to diversity, equity, and inclusion in the workplace. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We believe that a variety of perspectives will make our teams and business stronger as we work together to transform the traditional banking system.<br><br>We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at interviewaccommodations@lendingclub.com.

describtion: <strong>Craft:</strong><p><br></p>Technology &amp; Development<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Staff Data Engineer</strong><p><br></p>Activision Blizzard Media is the gateway for brands to the #1 cross-platform gaming company in the western world, with hundreds of millions of players across over 190 countries. Our legendary portfolio includes iconic mobile game franchises such as Candy Crush™, eSports opportunities like the Call of Duty® and Overwatch® Leagues, and some of the top PC and console gaming such as World of Warcraft®, Call of Duty®, and StarCraft®. The idea is simple: great game experiences offer great marketing experiences.<p><br></p>We are seeking a Staff Data Engineer in our Ads Engineering team, crafting ground breaking mobile advertising technologies to build the next generation of our Ads Platform.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design and build Data Pipelines to collect, transform, store, analyze, explore and visualize. </li><li>Craft and build cloud-based data lakes and data warehouses</li><li>Work with the product team to understand data sources, use cases and data models. </li><li>Choose the right technology stack to align with those use cases with scalability. </li><li>Collaborate with the other team members across different teams. </li><li>Develop alert &amp; monitoring systems and procedures for faster disaster recovery. </li><li>Provide technical directions and mentor other specialists and engineers</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BA/BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience. </li><li>Strong experience in Software Development in Java or Python</li><li>Working experience in building data warehouses and data lakes. </li><li>5+ years of demonstrated ability working with relational databases such as MySQL, Postgres etc. </li><li>2+ years of experience in NoSQL databases like Bigtable, Cassandra, HBase etc. </li><li>Expert level SQL skills and database performance concepts. </li><li>Experience in relational and dimensional data modeling. </li><li>Experience with developing extract-transform-load (ETL). </li><li>Understanding of distributed computing frameworks like Apache Spark and Flink. </li><li>Should be able to communicate and articulate their thought process optimally with team members. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience building data warehouse, data lake and data pipeline using Google Cloud Platform (GCP)</li><li>Experience with large scale distributed systems with large datasets. </li><li>Experience in distributed computing framework – Hadoop, Spark, Flink or Storm </li><li>Experience with messaging systems like Kafka and RabbitMQ</li><li>Knowledge of advertising platforms. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Rewards</strong><p><br></p>We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! Subject to eligibility requirements, the Company offers comprehensive benefits including:<p><br></p><ul><li>Medical, dental, vision, health savings account or health reimbursement account, healthcare spending accounts, dependent care spending accounts, life and AD&amp;D insurance, disability insurance;</li><li>401(k) with Company match, tuition reimbursement, charitable donation matching;</li><li>Paid holidays and vacation, paid sick time, floating holidays, compassion and bereavement leaves, parental leave;</li><li>Mental health &amp; wellbeing programs, fitness programs, free and discounted games, and a variety of other voluntary benefit programs like supplemental life & disability, legal service, ID protection, rental insurance, and others;</li><li>If the Company requires that you move geographic locations for the job, then you may also be eligible for relocation assistance. </li></ul><p><br></p>Eligibility to participate in these benefits may vary for part time and temporary full-time employees and interns with the Company. You can learn more by visiting https://www.benefitsforeveryworld.com/.<p><br></p>In the U.S., the standard base pay range for this role is $121,500.00 - $224,880.00 Annual. This base pay range is for the U.S. and is not applicable to locations outside of the U.S. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location. In addition to a competitive base pay, employees in this role may be eligible for incentive compensation. Incentive compensation is not guaranteed.<p><br></p><strong>About King</strong><p><br></p>King is the game developer behind the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as mobile game hits including Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch and Pet Rescue. Candy Crush is the top-grossing franchise in US app stores, a position it has held for the last two years, and King’s games are being played by 245 million monthly active users as of Q3 2021. King, which is part of the Activision Blizzard group since its acquisition in 2016, employs nearly 2,000 people in game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in San Francisco, New York, and Malta.<p><br></p><strong>A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes</strong><p><br></p>Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.<p><br></p><strong>Making the World Playful</strong><p><br></p>Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It’s what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid-core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players - and we’re not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!<p><br></p>Applications need to be in English.<p><br></p>Discover King at careers.king.com

Meta is embarking on the most transformative change to its business and technology in company history, and our Machine Learning Engineers are at the forefront of this evolution. By leading crucial projects and initiatives that have never been done before, you have an opportunity to help us advance the way people connect around the world. The ideal candidate will have industry experience working on a range of recommendation, classification, and optimization problems. You will bring the ability to own the whole ML life cycle, define projects and drive excellence across teams. You will work alongside the world’s leading engineers and researchers to solve some of the most exciting and massive social data and prediction problems that exist on the web.<p><br></p>Software Engineer, Machine Learning Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Leading projects or small teams of people to help them unblock, advocating for ML excellence</li><li>Adapt standard machine learning methods to best exploit modern parallel environments (e.g. distributed clusters, multicore SMP, and GPU)</li><li>Develop highly scalable classifiers and tools leveraging machine learning, data regression, and rules based models</li><li>Suggest, collect and synthesize requirements and create effective feature roadmaps</li><li>Code deliverables in tandem with the engineering team</li></ul><p><br></p>Minimum Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years of experience in software engineering or a relevant field. 3+ years of experience if you have a PhD</li><li>1+ years of experience in one or more of the following areas: machine learning, recommendation systems, pattern recognition, data mining, artificial intelligence, or a related technical field</li><li>Experience with developing machine learning models at scale from inception to business impact</li><li>Knowledge developing and debugging in C/C++ and Java, or experience with scripting languages such as Python, Perl, PHP, and/or shell scripts</li><li>Track record of setting technical direction for a team, driving consensus and successful cross-functional partnerships</li><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience.</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>Masters degree or PhD in Computer Science or a related technical field</li><li>Exposure to architectural patterns of large scale software applications</li></ul><p><br></p>Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. You may view our Equal Employment Opportunity notice here. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. We may use your information to maintain the safety and security of Meta, its employees, and others as required or permitted by law. You may view Meta's Pay Transparency Policy, Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law notice, and Notice to Applicants for Employment and Employees by clicking on their corresponding links. Additionally, Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law

<strong>About Onehouse<br><br></strong>Onehouse delivers a new bedrock for your data, through a cloud-native managed lakehouse service built on an open, interoperable, industry-proven technology. Founded by a former Uber data architect and the creator of Apache Hudi, Onehouse accelerates the inevitable transition of the data lake into a lakehouse, unlocking incremental processing to replace old-school batch processing on the lake. Onehouse makes it possible to blend the ease of use of a warehouse with the scale of a data lake into a fully managed product. Engineers can build data lakes in minutes, process data in seconds, and own data in open source formats instead of being locked away to individual vendors.<br><br>https://www.onehouse.ai<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>Do you live and breathe databases? Do you forget time solving complex optimization problems? Do you enjoy rolling up your sleeves to work on hard systems projects? As a database engineer on Onehouse, you will work on the guts of Apache Hudi's transactional engine as well as optimize it for diverse customer workloads for Onehouse, by designing algorithms to improve the performance and lower costs for large-scale data processing.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Design new concurrency control and transactional capabilities, that maximizes throughput for competing writers.</li><li>Design and implement new indexing schemes, specifically optimized for incremental data processing and analytical query performance.</li><li>Design systems that help scale and streamline metadata and data access from different query/compute engines.</li><li>Solve hard optimization problems to improve the efficiency (increase performance and lower cost) of distributed data processing algorithms over a Kubernetes cluster.</li><li>Leverage data from existing systems to find inefficiencies, and quickly build and validate prototypes.</li><li>Collaborate with other engineers to implement and deploy, safely rollout the optimized solutions in production.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Must Haves<br></strong><ul><li>Strong, object-oriented design and coding skills (C/C++ and/or Java preferably on a UNIX or Linux platform)</li><li>Experience with inner workings of distributed (multi-tiered) systems, algorithms, and relational databases</li><li>Deal well with ambiguous/undefined problems; ability to think abstractly; articulate technical challenges and solutions</li><li>Speed and hustle → Ability to prioritize across feature development and tech debt.</li><li>Ability to solve complex programming/optimization problems.</li><li>Ability to quickly prototype optimization solutions and analyze large/complex data.</li><li>Good communication skills.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Bonus Skills<br></strong><ul><li>Experience working with database systems, Query Engines or Spark codebases.</li><li>Experience in optimization mathematics (linear programming, nonlinear optimization)</li><li>Existing publications of optimizing large-scale data systems in top-tier distributed system conferences.</li><li>PhD degree with 2+ industrial experience in solving and delivering high-impact optimization projects.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Who We Are<br><br></strong>At Onehouse, our mission is to aid companies of all sizes in supercharging their data engineering/data science, by automating painful data infrastructure buildout. We are a team of self-driven, inspired, and seasoned builders that have created large-scale data systems, as well as globally distributed platforms that sit at the heart of some of the most well known companies out there including Uber, Linkedin, Confluent, Microsoft. We are set out on an ambitious goal to build the world's best fully managed and self-optimizing data lake platform. We are very well funded and backed by some of the top-tier VCs in Silicon Valley, and as well as numerous well-known angel investors from top Silicon Valley companies.<br><br><strong>Why join us<br><br></strong>Fun team, challenging problems! One day, we will be managing the largest database in existence!<br><br>Contribute directly to open source, including an exciting and growing data project - Apache Hudi<br><br>Create instant impact by contributing to Hudi, which is already in use by numerous large enterprises globally<br><br>Experienced team with numerous staff level engineers, to learn and grow with.<br><br>Early opportunity on a very happening space, everybody agrees the next few years will reshape the data landscape<br><br>Founding team is the creator of a large, fast-growing technology category - transactional data lakes<br><br>We are growing fast and looking for rising talent who can grow with us to become future leaders of the team. Come help build this unicorn-to-be!

<strong>About GrowthBook</strong><p><br></p>At GrowthBook, we are building an open source feature flagging and A/B testing platform. If you love the data and engineering challenges faced by large tech companies, but want the ownership and flexibility of a small startup, then GrowthBook is for you.<p><br></p>We are a small team, distributed across the US, and backed by YCombinator and Khosla Ventures. We’re helping companies release code quickly and confidently while measuring the impact of what they launch.<p><br></p>As an open source company, we are focused on bottom-up adoption and building a product that engineers love to use. We have an amazing open source community on Slack that gives us constant feedback, feature requests, and ideas. GrowthBook is already used in production by hundreds of companies and we’re just getting started!<p><br></p>Some of the problems you'll be working on<p><br></p><ul><li> Real-time Feature Flag Analytics. When a developer pushes code live, they want to know two things right away - “Did I just break anything?” and “Is anyone using my new feature?”. APM tools like NewRelic only get you part of the way there and we want to build a truly comprehensive solution</li><li> Robust SQL Test Suite. We support 8 different SQL data sources, from Postgres to BigQuery to PrestoDB, and each of them have their own quirks and bugs that we need to work around. Supporting this at scale will require building robust automated test suites and provisioning complex cloud infrastructure on demand</li><li> Streaming Features Service. When someone toggles a feature flag in GrowthBook, we want it to propagate to all of their clients around the world within seconds. And we need to do this reliably (99.999% uptime) and at scale (billions of requests)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Expert in JavaScript (Typescript), React, and Node.js</li><li>Solid understanding of both SQL and NoSQL databases</li><li>Experience building large web applications from scratch</li><li>Fluent English and good communication skills</li><li>Startup experience or interest working in a small company</li><li>Bonus: Contributed to an open-source project</li><li>Bonus: Used feature flags or A/B testing at a previous company</li><li>Bonus: Built data-heavy analytics applications</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive salary and employee-friendly equity in an early-stage fast-growing startup</li><li>Unlimited PTO (that we actually encourage you to use)</li><li>Top-of-the-line insurance (US only): medical, dental, vision, mental health, and more</li><li>Paid parental leave</li><li>Generous work-from-home stipend and IT budget</li><li>Remote-first company with regular off-sites in exciting locations</li></ul><p><br></p>GrowthBook is an equal opportunity employer, and is committed to creating an inclusive, supportive environment for all employees.<p><br></p>We regret that we cannot sponsor new US employment visas at this time, although we can make exceptions for H1B transfers.

<strong>About Applied</strong><p><br></p>Autonomy is one of the leading technological advances of this century that will come to impact our lives. The work you'll do at Applied will meaningfully accelerate the efforts of the top autonomy teams in the world. At Applied, you will have a unique perspective on the development of cutting-edge technology while working with major players across the industry and the globe.<p><br></p>Applied Intuition provides software solutions to safely develop, test, and deploy autonomous vehicles at scale. The company's suite of simulation, validation, and drive log management software enables development teams to create thousands of scenarios in minutes, run simulations at scale, and verify and validate algorithms for production deployment. Headquartered in Silicon Valley with offices in Detroit, Washington, D.C., Munich, Stockholm, Seoul, and Tokyo, Applied consists of software, robotics, and automotive experts with experiences from top global companies. Leading autonomy programs and 17 of the top 20 global OEMs use Applied's solutions to bring autonomy to market faster.<p><br></p><strong>About The Role</strong><p><br></p>We are looking for a software engineer with expertise in perception for autonomous vehicles or mobile robots. Your contributions will focus on building out key capabilities of perception modules within an autonomous vehicle stack. You will also drive the design and development of computer vision and machine learning techniques to enable self-driving vehicles to navigate.<p><br></p>In addition to your engineering contributions, by working in our dynamic and customer-focused team culture, you will contribute to and learn from best practices in the nascent autonomy industry. We move fast and focus on excellence, for our products and for our business. If you are hands-on and looking for a place to have a multiplying effect on making autonomous systems a reality, Applied is the place for you!<p><br></p>We are hiring for all levels.<p><br></p><strong>At Applied, you will:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design and implement capabilities and workflows for cutting-edge real-world perception systems</li><li>Work closely with our sensor simulation team to ensure we build the best range of multi-fidelity simulation models</li><li>Work closely with our infrastructure team to provide the best enterprise software for engineering, testing, and customer product teams</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>We're looking for someone who has:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Passion for turning their domain expertise into tooling that boosts the productivity of teams working on various real-world applications of autonomous systems</li><li>3+ years of experience building software components or (sub) systems that address real-world perception challenges</li><li>Hands-on experience with more than one domain relevant software frameworks or tools, such as middleware, benchmarking suites, data sets and related pipelines, or algorithmic libraries</li><li>Deep understanding of the concepts and methods behind any frameworks or libraries that they worked with</li><li>Experience working with production level ML and DL perception algorithms for autonomous vehicles</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Nice to have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>MSc or PhD in perception or closely related field</li><li>Deep hands-on expertise in relevant algorithms or methods, such as non-linear optimization, computational geometry, numerical analysis, or distributed systems</li><li>Experience building and shipping software frameworks or tools</li></ul><p><br></p>The salary range for this position is $65,000 USD to $400,000 USD annually. This salary range is an estimate, and the actual salary may vary based on the Company's compensation practices.<p><br></p><em>Don't meet every single requirement? If you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.</em><p><br></p><em>Applicants will be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 upon commencing employment. Reasonable accommodations will be considered on a case-by-case basis for exemptions to this requirement in accordance with applicable federal and state law. Applicants should be aware that for external-facing roles that involve close contact with Company employees or other third parties on the Company's premises, accommodations that involve remaining unvaccinated against COVID-19 may not be deemed reasonable. The Company will engage in the interactive process on an individualized basis taking into account the particular position.</em><p><br></p><em>Applied Intuition is an equal opportunity employer and federal contractor or subcontractor. Consequently, the parties agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) and 41 CFR 60-741.5(a) and that these laws are incorporated herein by reference. These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans<br><br>or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin. These regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disability. The parties also agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of Executive Order 13496 (29 CFR Part 471, Appendix A to Subpart A), relating to the notice of employee rights under federal labor laws.</em>

<br><br></li></ul><strong>_____________________________________________________________________________________________<br><br></strong><strong>About FDB:<br><br></strong>FDB is the leading provider <strong>Company Overview - Outpatient, Inc</strong><p><br></p>Outpatient is a simple and modern software application that helps Healthcare teams, patients, and families collaborate and coordinate for better health. We’ve built a secure and compliant app for Messaging, Calendaring and Workflow automation designed to make caring for anyone easier while improving health outcomes. We’re leveraging messaging, data analysis, OCR, and machine learning to radically improve the overwhelming logistics of care management. This is a vastly underserved market opportunity. Our customers include Health Systems, the US military, Senior Housing communities, Home Health providers, and everyday families at home.<p><br></p>We're building a mission-driven company with a culture based on Openness, Trust, and Determination to Succeed. Outpatient is venture-backed, rapidly growing and profitable.<p><br></p>Outpatient - Simplifying Healthcare Logistics &amp; Communication for All (http://GetOutpatient.com/)<p><br></p><strong>Job Summary</strong><p><br></p>Be part of the early developer team building this cutting edge system from the ground up targeting a huge and growing known problem. We’re looking for full stack engineers who are thoughtful, responsible and passionate individuals who appreciate user experience and efficient technical architecture. We’re looking for someone who is not only well versed in backend and infrastructure development, but also has a strong understanding of good UX and is excited to learn about and contribute to the front-end. Befitting an early stage startup, all of our teammates have broad talents in more than one area.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Architect and build core infrastructure for our mobile and web apps and messaging system</li><li>Build out back end services and persistence solutions</li><li>Explore technical feasibility</li><li>Deliver clean, well-documented code that our users can rely on</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Demonstrated node.js and/or Javascript; Redux know-how is an awesome bonus</li><li>Passion for creating robust systems to minimize ops impact</li><li>Experience with databases (Postgres, Redis)</li><li>Excellent troubleshooter and problem solver</li><li>Possess ability to adequately size projects and provide status updates</li><li>Understanding of code documentation best practices and style</li><li>Strong communication skills with developers and non-technical staff</li><li>Must learn and work well independently, and also within a collaborative team environment</li><li>Generalist engineering experience in order to get things done fast</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>tE6sY8T4f7

<strong>Why you should join Channel99?</strong><p><br></p>Channel99 ("C99") is pioneering the next generation of B2B marketing technology. Delivered in a subscription model, the solutions will replace today's do-it-yourself spreadsheets and other ad hoc systems to allow CMO's and CFO's to better benchmark thousands of vendors on the same KPI's, and then compare their results to industry averages in a uniform manner. The company's Founder &amp; CEO is Chris Golec who created the ABM technology category and has 20 years experience in the marketing technology space. Chris has already secured significant venture funding and is planning to launch C99's its first product in October.<p><br></p>Candidates for this position should have a passion for innovation, building a world-class culture, and making a long lasting impact on an ever evolving B2B industry where $100 billion is spent every year on marketing with very little financial control. The company is open to discussing various hybrid and remote arrangements in a U.S. location.<p><br></p><strong>What you'll be doing:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Write code in Python, Scala and Clojure</li><li>Collaborating with Solution Architects, DevOps Engineers, and Data Scientists in implementing complex end-to-end solutions. </li><li>Providing technical leadership and actively participating in building scalable data architectures that will ingest, store, process, and organize the data critical for supporting analytics of near real-time data streams and historical data. </li><li>Design, develop and deploy big data processing applications: Spark, Elasticsearch and SQL&amp; NoSQL</li><li>Maintain security and data privacy</li><li>High-speed querying like Snowflake</li><li>Web-Application's integration with products (Web &amp; Mobile)</li><li>Growth with C99 and influence the future</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What we're looking for:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Exceptional communicator (verbal and written) and exhibit excellent organizational and presentation skills</li><li>Excellent at problem solving and analytical skills with attention to detail and quality; ability to think strategically and logically</li><li>Ability to learn new technology and concepts quickly</li><li>Willingness to take on tasks outside the normal day-to-day responsibilities</li><li>Able to work independently and as an integral part of a team</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Essential Experience:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's or master's degree in Software Engineer, Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field</li><li>Analytical skills: ability to think strategically and rapidly analyze, interpret and integrate data information from varied sources into clear conclusions and recommendations</li><li>Hands-on working experience with data modeling and building ETL/ELT pipelines using lake house architectural patterns. </li><li>Communication skills: strong writing and data presentation skills, including data visualization</li><li>Self-starter: ability to take the initiative and work independently. </li><li>5+ years of experience with Python / Scala</li><li>Strong knowledge of distributed data processing systems (e.g., Spark), distributed data storage systems (e.g., HDFS), column-oriented data file formats (e.g., Apache Parquet), and real-time streaming systems (e.g., Spark Structured Streaming). </li><li>3+ years of experience with one of main Cloud providers (AWS / GC)</li><li>Strong knowledge and working experience with Agile Software Development methodologies. </li><li>Strong teamwork orientation, good interpersonal skills</li><li>Enthusiasm for, and commitment to, development work</li></ul><p><br></p>US / GC only

jobs_titles: Senior Software Engineer, Google Cloud Data Management
describtion: <strong>Minimum qualifications:<br><br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience. </li><li>5 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, and with data structures/algorithms.</li><li>3 years of experience testing, maintaining, or launching software products, and 1 year of experience with software design and architecture. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred qualifications:<br><br></strong><ul><li>Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical field. </li><li>1 year of experience in a technical leadership role. </li><li>Experience developing accessible technologies. <br><br></li></ul><strong><u>About The Job<br><br></u></strong>Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.<br><br>With your technical expertise you will manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables. You will design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions.<br><br>Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.<br><br>The US base salary range for this full-time position is $157,000-$235,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google .<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong><ul><li>Write and test product or system development code.</li><li>Participate in, or lead design reviews with peers and stakeholders to decide amongst available technologies. </li><li>Review code developed by other developers and provide feedback to ensure best practices (e.g., style guidelines, checking code in, accuracy, testability, and efficiency).</li><li>Contribute to existing documentation or educational content and adapt content based on product/program updates and user feedback. </li><li>Triage product or system issues and debug/track/resolve by analyzing the sources of issues and the impact on hardware, network, or service operations and quality.<br><br></li></ul>Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer.
