jobs_titles: Data Engineer (Sr. Business Systems Analyst) - JO#5695
describtion: <p>**To complete the online application, please visit https://www.courts.ca.gov/careers.htm and search for <strong>JO# 5695</strong>**</p><p><br></p><p><strong>OVERVIEW</strong></p><p>The Judicial Council of California is accepting applications for the position of Data Engineer (Senior Business Systems Analyst) in the Statistics and Information unit.</p><p><br></p><p>This position provides high level technical and business process support for Judicial Branch Statistical Information System (JBSIS). With an agency mandate to produce more frequent and timely insights with JBSIS data, the incumbent will lead technical projects related to JBSIS data and analytics, including internal collaboration with IT and subject matter experts, and working with case management system vendors to implement those changes. The Senior Business Systems Analyst will also support the JBSIS data collection process, execute complex data engineering projects to implement new or revised JBSIS reporting requirements or technical fixes, and provide training and subject matter expertise regarding JBSIS. This position requires independent decision-making on complex and high-profile projects that have statewide implications for funding and resource allocation.</p><p><br></p><p>The Judicial Council strives for work life balance and includes substantial vacation and holiday time. In addition, we offer an excellent benefits package including pension, medical, dental and vision coverage, flexible spending, up to $130 per month reimbursement for qualifying commuting costs, and retirement savings plans. In San Francisco, the office is only a 7-minute walk from the Civic Center BART station in downtown San Francisco.</p><p><br></p><p>The successful candidate will be expected to work in the Judicial Council’s San Francisco office; hybrid work options for employees who live in areas surrounding this location may be considered.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong></p><p>Oversee and lead technical execution of JBSIS data collection policies and procedures</p><ul><li>Coordinate project planning and implementation with IT counterparts, court testers, case management system vendors</li><li>Assess and maintain data pipeline, data quality in the database, and address data reporting issues</li><li>Develop and implement testing protocols for data and system quality</li></ul><p><br></p><p>Support JBSIS data collection and validation</p><ul><li>Track data submissions, troubleshoot errors, interface with courts to obtain data submissions</li><li>Develop and implement protocols and process to certify courts for JBSIS reporting</li><li>Create metrics and dashboards to report on various JBSIS data points</li></ul><p><br></p><p>Support JBSIS data reporting and auditing processes</p><ul><li>Research and answer courts’ questions regarding data definitions, court processing, and data collection</li><li>Work with courts’ data contacts to validate JBSIS data</li><li>Conduct internal analysis of JBSIS data to assess reporting quality for auditing purposes</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS</strong></p><p>EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE</p><p>Bachelor’s degree, and five (5) years of experience providing technical and business process support, analysis, or project management for systems/applications.</p><p><br></p><p>Possession of a bachelor’s degree in a directly related field such as computer science, management information systems, etc., may be substituted for one of the years of required experience. An additional four years of professional experience as noted above may substitute for the bachelor’s degree. Or, additional directly related experience and/or education may be substituted on a year for-year basis.</p><p><br></p><p>OR</p><p><br></p><p>One year as a Business Systems Analyst with the Judicial Council of California or one year of experience performing the duties of a class comparable in the level of responsibility to that of a Business Systems Analyst in a California Superior Court or California state-level government entity.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Desirable Qualifications:</strong></p><ul><li>Knowledge of court case processing</li><li>Expertise in database creation, management</li><li>Knowledge in R, SQL, Stata and other data management programs</li><li>Experience using Tableau, Power BI</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>OTHER</strong></p><p>Please note, if you are selected for hire, verification of employment eligibility or authorization to work in the United States will be required.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>HOW TO APPLY</strong></p><p>This position is <strong>Open Until Filled</strong>. Submission of our official application, a resume, and a response to the supplemental questions are required.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>To complete the online application, please visit https://www.courts.ca.gov/careers.htm and search for JO# 5695.</strong></p><p><br></p><p>The Judicial Council provides reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities who request such accommodation. Reasonable accommodation needs should be requested through Human Resources at (415) 865-4260. Telecommunications Device for the Deaf (415) 865-4272.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>PAYMENT &amp; BENEFITS</strong></p><p>Salary Range: $7,267 - $10,901 per month</p><p><br></p><p>Some highlights of our benefits package include:</p><ul><li>Health/Dental/Vision benefits program</li><li>14 paid holidays per calendar year</li><li>Choice of Annual Leave or Sick/Vacation Leave</li><li>1 personal holiday per year</li><li>Up to $130per month reimbursement for qualifying commuting costs</li><li>CalPERS Retirement Plan</li><li>401(k) and 457 deferred compensation plans</li><li>Employee Assistance Program</li><li>Basic Life and AD&amp;D Insurance</li><li>FlexElect Program</li><li>Pretax Parking</li><li>Long Term Disability Program (employee paid/optional)</li><li>Group Legal Plan (employee paid/optional)</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>The Judicial Council of California Is an Equal Opportunity Employer.</strong></p><p><br></p><p>**To complete the online application, please visit https://www.courts.ca.gov/careers.htm and search for <strong>JO# 5695</strong>**</p>

<strong>About TruEra</strong><p><br></p>TruEra provides the first AI Quality platform, to help enterprises analyze machine learning, improve model quality and build trust. Powered by enterprise-class Artificial Intelligence (AI) Explainability technology based on six years of research at Carnegie Mellon University, TruEra’s platform helps eliminate the black box surrounding widely used AI and ML technologies. This visibility leads to higher quality, explainable models that achieve measurable business results, address unfair bias, and ensure governance and compliance.<p><br></p>We are excited about the amazing team we’re building at TruEra. One of the core cultural principles at TruEra is: “Create what’s not there.” We’re building a team of creator-builders who are excited about our mission and keen to build large-scale systems and drive cutting-edge research in support of it.<p><br></p>We are a rapidly growing Series B company funded by Greylock, Wing, and Menlo Ventures, and working with both Fortune 100 customers and startups throughout the world!<p><br></p><strong>About The Job</strong><p><br></p>As a Software Engineer on the TruEra SaaS team, you will be designing, building, and managing a scalable and highly available SaaS platform, AI/ML data infrastructure ecosystems. We're developing the platform for both public and private cloud environments with the container as first-class citizens. Infrastructure is at the core of our platform, and we're constantly innovating to make our systems more performant, timely, cost-effective, and capable while maintaining high reliability.<p><br></p>What You Will be Doing:<p><br></p><ul><li>Design, develop, and lead platform features </li><li>Collaborate with ML Engineers, Backend Engineers, and Products Managers to deliver new Platform capability</li><li>Architect and implement systems with 99.99% uptime</li><li>Design Truera to be deployed on multi-cloud, cross-platform for On-Prem and SaaS</li><li>Participate in early customer engagements and PoCs, and use that context to drive new product features</li><li>Review design and code, and make sure what we ship is awesome</li><li>“Create what’s not there”<br><br></li></ul>Prior Experience<p><br></p><ul><li>BS in Computer Science or equivalent</li><li>Strong product mindset and 3+ years of experience building high-quality data Infrastructure</li><li>Solid background in the fundamentals of computer science and distributed systems</li><li>Ability to build systems that balance scalability, availability, and latency</li><li>Advocate for the continuous deployment and automation tools, monitoring, and self-healing systems</li><li>Experience working with “always-on” SaaS systems in the cloud</li><li>Have worked in a small cross-functional team with multiple internal stakeholders </li><li>Has a broad understanding of how the overall software stack works - from build systems to pipelines and deployments</li><li>Great communication skills and a team player<br><br></li></ul>Nice-To-Haves<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience building machine learning models or ecosystems</li><li>Having been a part of an engineering team at an early-stage startup</li><li>Exposure to or hands-on work with Kubernetes </li><li>Experience deploying enterprise software on-prem and cloud<br><br></li></ul>Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our website or to personal email accounts of employees of Truera are considered property of Truera and are not subject to payment of agency fees.

describtion: <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Software Engineer</strong><p><br></p><strong>Location</strong>: Menlo Park, Ca.<p><br></p><strong>Direct Hire</strong><p><br></p><strong>Hybrid</strong><p><br></p><strong>Salary</strong>: $115k - $135k Base + pre-IPO stock options + benefits<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>The Linear Generator relies on software for every aspect of operation and interaction. The software created by every member of our team immediately impacts the performance of our machine and the ability of the entire company to understand what is working well and improve the machine operation and performance.<p><br></p><strong><u>As a Member Of The Software Team, You Will</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop reliable and maintainable platform-appropriate software for a variety of networked platforms including cloud (AWS and GCP), gateway/edge server and data analysis </li><li>Collaborate and share responsibility with the whole team for code reviews, retrospectives, testing, documentation, and devops chores </li><li>Share values with the team to balance different requirements pragmatically - with an optimistic can-do perspective, create a great work-product and have an interest to improve your capability with collaboration </li></ul><em>In the first week</em>, you will close your first issue and review a colleague's merge request.<p><br></p><em>In the first month</em>, you will acquire enough understanding of a subsystem to design a feature including a design review with requirements, appropriate test coverage for continuous integration, a manual test plan for QA, and the devops chores for provisioning and deployment.<p><br></p><em>In the first year</em>, you will gain sufficient knowledge of the entire architecture to add or improve a new feature that connects multiple platforms - for example a data channel for the operations and maintenance team to issue a command to start and stop specific machines in the field with all the nuance of considering the user need, speed and latency, and reliability in the architecture.<p><br></p>Critically, you should enjoy doing these things collaboratively as part of a tightly-coupled and highly interactive team.<p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>You have...<p><br></p><ul><li>Examples of software work-products in more than one domain, including CI test coverage </li><li>Sufficient language knowledge or polyglottism to navigate a complete code base consisting of C++17, Python3, and Bash and implement good interfaces in each context </li><li>Experience and interest beyond just full-stack or front-end development - you are just as passionate about the purpose and need for your software as you are about how well it is implemented</li></ul><strong>Apply Now!</strong><p><br></p>We are an equal opportunity employer and make hiring decisions based on merit. Recruitment, hiring, training, and job assignments are made without regard to race, color, national origin, age, ancestry, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, disability, or any other protected classification. We consider all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles' Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.<p><br></p>To apply please email your resume to mjtgarcia@ledgent.com

Looking for a company that inspires passion, courage and creativity, where you can be on the team shaping the future of global commerce? Want to shape how millions of people buy, sell, connect, and share around the world? If you’re interested in joining a purpose driven community that is dedicated to crafting an ambitious and inclusive work environment, join eBay – a company you can be proud to be with.<p><br></p>Join the dynamic and challenging environment of Search Engine Optimization (SEO) at eBay, where you will find solutions for eBay's global scale and diverse inventory on a daily basis. Your work will have a direct impact on the experience of millions of buyers and sellers around the world as they interact with billions of listings.<p><br></p>As a recognized industry leader, eBay's SEO team collaborates with major search engines, piloting the latest initiatives and pioneering new techniques and approaches. This role is crucial in ensuring that eBay's most valuable pages are easily discoverable by search engines, appearing in relevant search results. You will also have the opportunity to shape the initial impression of users landing on eBay, creating an engaging, modern experience for them.<p><br></p><strong>Your Impact</strong><p><br></p>As a Backend Developer, you will play a vital role in developing major applications and components that serve millions of users daily and respond to over a billion requests daily within tight SLAs. This is your chance to directly impact eBay's site performance.<p><br></p><strong>Additionally, Your Responsibilities Will Include</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Developing high-quality Java applications that integrate with backend systems</li><li>Demonstrating expertise in design and implementation</li><li>Documenting code and systems</li><li>Supporting production applications</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We're Looking For</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum 6 years of experience in server-side development with Java</li><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent (BSc)</li><li>Proficiency with the Spring framework</li><li>Strong understanding of object-oriented design and design patterns</li><li>Experience in building RESTful services</li><li>Familiarity with agile development methodologies</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>The Following Competencies Would Be An Advantage</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Extensive experience in multi-threading development</li><li>Experience with databases</li><li>Hands-on experience with Hadoop, Hive, and HDFS</li></ul><p><br></p>If you possess experience with clean code, design patterns, code quality, and open-source technologies, we would be delighted to consider your application. Join us in shaping the future of eBay's SEO, enhancing the user experience, and making a significant impact on our platform.<p><br></p>Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you’re single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs. Including maternal &amp; paternal leave, paid sabbatical, and plans to help ensure your financial security today and in the years ahead because we know feeling financially secure during your working years and through retirement is important.<p><br></p>Here at eBay, we love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel eBay is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work. To learn about eBay’s Diversity &amp; Inclusion click here: https://www.ebayinc.com/company/diversity-inclusion/<p><br></p>The pay range for this position at commencement of employment in California, Washington, or New York City is expected in the range below.<p><br></p>$135,200 - $205,700<p><br></p>Base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including location, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements, including a target bonus and restricted stock units (as applicable) in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits (including 401(k) eligibility and various paid time off benefits, such as PTO and parental leave). Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.<p><br></p>If hired, employees will be in an “at-will position” and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.<p><br></p>eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible. View our accessibility info to learn more about eBay's commitment to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities. For more information see: EEO is the Law Poster and EEO is the Law Poster Supplement.<p><br></p>Jobs posted with location as "Remote - United States (Excludes CO, HI, NM)" excludes residents of Colorado, Hawaii and New Mexico.<p><br></p>This website uses cookies to enhance your experience. By continuing to browse the site, you agree to our use of cookies. Visit our Privacy Center for more information.

Adept's mission is to build Useful General Intelligence. We are solving open problems in AI in order to train models that can do arbitrary things on a computer, and we are solving open product problems in order to package these models into a form factor that best enhances human experience and performance.<p><br></p>We’ve recently raised a $350M Series B led by General Catalyst and Spark, on top of a $65M Series A in 2022 with Addition and Greylock. We’re fortunate to be supported by amazing firms and angels such as Chris Re, Andrej Karpathy, Root Ventures, Howie Liu, Dara Khosrowshahi, and others, and were recently highlighted by Forbes. Adept is backed by a coalition of strategic partners, including Atlassian, Microsoft, NVIDIA, and Workday.<p><br></p>We're looking for passionate team members who want to swing for the fences to accomplish our mission, are excited by a startup environment where the hardest problems are yet to be solved, and are eager to learn and collaborate together in our San Francisco office.<p><br></p>For more information, check out our blog!<p><br></p>Position Summary<p><br></p><strong><u>Some Problems We’re Working On Across Engineering Right Now Include</u></strong><p><br></p>We’re growing rapidly and hiring software engineers to work across a broad and exciting range of challenges.<p><br></p><ul><li>Connecting neural networks to APIs, browsers, and applications</li><li>Scaling up model inference and running predictions at scale</li><li>Designing and implementing large-scale data pipelines to train cutting-edge models</li><li>Improving our iteration speed by identifying and fixing bottlenecks in our tools</li><li>Building reliable and secure systems to power our web-based applications</li><li>Creating scalable product infrastructure so we can deliver amazing experiences quickly to people all around the world</li><li>Inventing new UI/UX approaches for human computer interaction when LLMs are involved</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>If You Have Some Of These, You Might Be a Good Fit</u></strong><p><br></p>We deeply value generalist software engineers who can engage with new problems and get things done at a startup, and our team members come from a variety of backgrounds and experiences.<p><br></p><ul><li>4+ years of experience as a software engineer</li><li>Experience building and serving machine learning models</li><li>Expertise building scalable web applications</li><li>Experience at fast-growing companies or startups</li><li>A high level of end-to-end ownership and self-direction</li><li>The ability to move fast and learn by doing new things</li></ul><p><br></p><em>The pay range for this position in California is $175,000 - $350,000yr; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, candidate location, and experience.</em><p><br></p><strong><u>Our Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Comprehensive health insurance coverage - 100% for employees</li><li>Dental and vision insurance</li><li>Unlimited vacation time for exempt employees</li><li>4 remote weeks per year - work from anywhere</li><li>Competitive salary </li><li>Stock options </li><li>Daily meals for those in our comfortable SF office </li><li>Commuter benefits</li><li>Dog friendly </li></ul><p><br></p><em>Adept is an equal opportunity employer. We're excited about candidates who will raise the bar of our team, regardless of specific experiences -- we encourage applicants from a range of backgrounds to apply.</em>

Location: San Francisco, California, United States<p><br></p>Full-time Allows Remote<p><br></p>We are is seeking a Sr. Python Engineer to join our Software Engineering team. We are the world's most popular cloud-based enterprise-class log management solution. We've recently received $11.5M in new funding to accelerate our rapid growth and we're staffing up in San Francisco and other parts of the United States. We believe in hiring talent where it exists.<p><br></p>Our customers send us an explosive volume of log data 7x24x365. Our challenge? Make it easy for our users to instantly search and understand what their logs are telling them. This is real-time big data that is mission critical for our customers. When their applications are acting up they look to our service to help them figure out what's wrong and get things back on track. Do you have the code-writing capabilities to take on this task?<p><br></p><strong><u>About The Team</u></strong><p><br></p>The engineering team believes that the quality of our code reflects directly on us as professionals. And because our customers are all engineers themselves, they notice. We're relentless about crafting a product that is innovative, delivers a user experience that people remember and is ever faster and more robust.<p><br></p>As a key engineer on our team, you will collaborate with other engineers, product management, and operations. We're a small team so every individual matters.<p><br></p>Our culture is fun, fast-paced, performance-oriented, open, collegial, and we are constantly pushing the technology envelope to the edge! Our headquarters are located in the financial district of San Francisco, CA right on top of a BART and Muni stop.<p><br></p><strong><u>About The Job</u></strong><p><br></p>You'll be helping us build awesome and new capabilities for our users. You'll be working with Python, Django, REST interfaces, and MySQL.<p><br></p>Because you'll be making user-facing features, we believe strongly in collecting and analyzing quantitative data to help guide our decisions. To that end, you'll be able to use our in-house analytics tools to gather information and gain insights. We're regularly pushing out new code, so expect your contributions to be put to use quickly.<p><br></p>You will have full lifecycle responsibilities to create robust, scalable, multi-threaded, and distributed systems that operate always. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a highly innovative environment with new technologies as we continue to extend our market leading position.<p><br></p><strong><u>About You</u></strong><p><br></p>You're an engineer who can turn ideas into extremely fast and reliable code that other people - or you, six months into the future - will find easy to comprehend and modify. You believe in the power of data to transform how people work. You will be successful in this role if you:<p><br></p><ul><li>Enjoy helping others around you grow and be successful as developers</li><li>Have excellent written and verbal communications skills</li><li>Can be autonomous and self-driven</li><li>Get inspired on a daily basis, thinking of new ideas and sharing them with others</li><li>Take pride in creating new ways to do things and know that the creative process requires momentum, chaos, vibrancy, spontaneity, debate, and silence</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Do</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Build and support the systems and applications to support the customer facing application</li><li> Build and support the gateway to be a conduit between the customers' browser and their stored data</li><li> Scale out the architecture to prepare for the huge growth in both data and web-requests</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What We Are Looking For</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Solid software engineering, problem-solving and analytical skills</li><li>At least 3 years of experience working with Python/Django, and preferably more in server-side technologies</li><li>Experience with Linux and SQL is a strong plus</li><li>Strong knowledge of REST interfaces and web technologies</li><li>Startup mentality : a resourceful self-starter who relishes the opportunity to figure out solutions to problems they have never before faced.</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills, able to create strong working relationship with cross-functional teams</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What's Next</u></strong><p><br></p>If you're interested in joining the team. Let us know how you fit the bill for each of our requirements. We are a place that values individuality, variety, and diversity. We have lots of hikers, bikers, gamers, musicians and other interesting folks so use your judgment and write to us in your own voice about your talents. If you have a presence on the web that we can easily access where you contribute to an open source project, write a blog, or practice another craft besides designing powerful software, we'd love to hear about it.<p><br></p>We'll start with an initial phone interview and based on that, we'll invite you in to meet the team - starting with the CTO and CEO; as we said, we're a small team and every member is important! We hope you'll do some research on us and try out our product before you arrive.<p><br></p><strong><u>The Company</u></strong><p><br></p>We are the world's most popular cloud-based log management solution, used by more than 9,000 customers to effortlessly spot problems in real-time, easily pinpoint root causes and resolve operational issues faster to ensure application success. Our simple to scale and consume log management service is designed around the needs of modern DevOps teams and purposely built to dramatically simplify the chore of log management for start-ups through Fortune 500 organizations. Founded in 2009 and based in San Francisco, the company is backed by Trinity Ventures, True Ventures, Matrix Partners, Cisco, Data Collective Venture Capital and others.<p><br></p>We are a proud to be an equal opportunity employer.<p><br></p>**Immigration sponsorship will be considered**

<strong>About Liminal Insights</strong><p><br></p>Liminal’s mission is to accelerate the clean energy transition by improving the cost, quality, and reliability of battery manufacturing. We do this by providing customers with better analytics and insights during production. Our breakthrough EchoStat® platform uses ultrasound and machine learning technology to supply customers with the information needed to accelerate production ramp-up, improve productivity and reliability, and detect critical defects early. We will be deploying our first fully-automated process inspection solutions in a major cell manufacturing factory in late 2023.<p><br></p>Liminal is based in Emeryville, California. Our investors include ArcTern Ventures, Ecosystem Integrity Fund, Chrysalix Ventures, Volta Energy Technologies and Northvolt. We also have funding support from the Department of Energy’s ARPA-E, the National Science Foundation and California Energy Commission.<p><br></p>Our Culture and Values<p><br></p><ul><li>We are dedicated to building a world-class, world-positive company</li><li>We work closely on a foundation of mutual trust and informed decisions</li><li>Our core values are trust, empathy, and curiosity</li><li>We encourage personal growth, continuous learning, and safety</li><li>We believe the most innovative teams are inclusive of and celebrate all forms of diversity</li></ul><p><br></p>Role<p><br></p>We are looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer to work on designing and developing cutting-edge battery inspection technology. We are developing an on-premise metrology tool that integrates with factory systems, as well as cloud systems for ingesting and analyzing the collected data. You will be instrumental in creating and analyzing requirements as well as designing, implementing, testing, and delivering software that is modular, scalable, robust, and meets customer requirements. You will work closely with our product development and engineering teams on a variety of projects.<p><br></p>On a typical day, you may integrate a new data acquisition (hardware) component into our toolchain, build integrations for industrial devices (servers, PLCs, MES) to communicate with one another, integrate process monitoring and traceability tools onto deployed devices, or develop a system for evaluating hardware system performance. There are many hats to wear based on need and interest – you may get involved in defining data pipelines in our cloud ecosystem, refactor how we store data on premise, or develop systems for commissioning, tracking and updating field-deployed industrial computers.<p><br></p>You value active listening, thoughtful questions, and data-driven discussions. You are comfortable with gathering and distilling information to drive the direction of open-ended projects. The ideal candidate will approach this work with a mixture of intellectual curiosity, thoughtful creativity, and methodical rigor. You will get great satisfaction from seeing people do great things with your work, and, above all, are excited to solve hard problems that have a positive impact on the world’s clean energy future. This is a potentially hybrid position with expectations of in-office work for the first 6 months.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborate on data modeling and data ingestion rules – on premise or on cloud</li><li>Implement communications between a Linux server and factory-floor devices using IIoT design patterns like OPC-UA, MQTT in a (possibly) closed-network system</li><li>Refactor/design how hardware and various communication mechanisms are abstracted and implemented in a modular way</li><li>Develop simulation systems for endpoints &amp; industrial devices to make the software more modular and easily testable</li><li>Build core services for ingesting and securing data</li><li>Collaborate with the team to develop internal tools &amp; processes to simplify the development, prototyping and testing process for software developers, data scientists and research engineers</li><li>Research, design and implement device tracking, authentication and update solutions with (field) deployable devices</li><li>Unit, integration and system testing</li><li>Evaluate customer security &amp; encryption requirements</li><li>UI or HMI development for systems intending to reside on a factory floor</li><li>Other duties as assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>If you don't have 100% of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply!</li><li>A passion for working to accelerate the global transition to clean energy, as well as passion for building scalable and well-documented software</li><li>Bachelor's with 4+ years of professional (backend) software development in core programming languages like Python, C++, Java, C#</li><li>A core philosophy that testing is a core component at every stage of the SDLC</li><li>Strong fundamentals in data modeling &amp; security</li></ul><p><br></p>Nice to haves<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with the AWS ecosystem</li><li>Experience in developing software in an industrial or manufacturing setting including safety requirements, error handling. Experience with IoT, PLCs, MES, ERP, SCADAs</li><li>Controls/PLC experience</li><li>A working knowledge of Linux systems (e.g., administration)</li><li>Computer Networking experience </li><li>Security experience</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Annual salary of $155,000 to $195,000 plus stock options, based on skill level and experience, to help you and your family build a healthy and secure future</li><li>Group health benefits that provide support for employee well-being and preventative care, including comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance</li><li>A retirement program that helps build future financial security through both traditional and Roth 401(k) options with employer matching</li><li>Flexible working hours and a hybrid working model so you can be productive when and how is best for you</li><li>Generous time-off policy to allow you to renew and refresh through vacation, personal leave, and holidays</li><li>For new parents, 8 weeks of fully-paid parental leave that you can take at any point during the first year</li></ul><p><br></p>Liminal is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate all forms of diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. However you identify or whatever your path here, please apply if this job excites you. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the hiring process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

We have raised over $30M from top-tier fintech investors.<p><br></p><strong>What You'll Be Working On</strong><p><br></p>You'll be involved in projects of varying scope and complexity:<p><br></p><ul><li> Build credit risk models that segment merchants based on their revenue and spend patterns to offer dynamic credit limits that change with business performance given the high seasonality and fast pace of ecommerce </li><li> Use machine learning tools to build realtime credit underwriting models leveraging alternative and traditional data sources </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You'll Need</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Passion for, or curiosity to learn, financial technology </li><li> Track record of high-quality shipping products and features at scale </li><li> Ability to turn business and product ideas into engineering solutions </li><li> Desire to work in a fast-paced environment, continuously grow and master your craft </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We’d Like To See</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Experience with building out data pipelines (e.g. should know data lakes, data warehouses, ETL, etc.) </li><li> Experience working with data analytics, algorithmic decision making, and real-time data systems </li><li> Experience with different business requirements on data freshness and retention </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> PLUSES </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Proven experience and subject matter expertise in e-commerce payments (nice to have) or financial services. </li><li> Has worked with bank account data (e.g. worked with Plaid), payments data (perhaps Stripe), and/or other fintech data sources </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Why you should join us: </strong><p><br></p>Our mission is to increase the number of financially independent people. We believe we can achieve this goal by building tools that enable independent business owners to scale their businesses profitably. Our first product combines a virtual credit card system with dynamic spending limits and software tooling to help merchants grow and optimize their profitability. We are growing very fast -- in less than five months, we have grown to millions in card volume.<p><br></p>We have a significant waitlist of customers waiting to use our product. Our investors include Solomon Hykes (founder of Docker), Paul Buchheit (founder of Gmail), Paul Graham (founder of Y Combinator), Robert Leshner (founder of compound.finance), and many more. We recently closed a financing round of $5M from a top-tier fintech investor.<p><br></p><strong> Salary Range: $150,000-$250,000 base.</strong>

jobs_titles: Staff Software Engineer, Datasets and ML infrastructure
describtion: Who We Are<br><br>Aurora (Nasdaq: AUR) is delivering the benefits of self-driving technology safely, quickly, and broadly to make transportation safer, increasingly accessible, and more reliable and efficient than ever before. The Aurora Driver is a self-driving system designed to operate multiple vehicle types, from freight-hauling semi-trucks to ride-hailing passenger vehicles, and underpins Aurora Horizon and Aurora Connect, its driver-as-a-service products for trucking and ride-hailing. Aurora is working with industry leaders across the transportation ecosystem, including Toyota, FedEx, Volvo Trucks, PACCAR, Uber, Uber Freight, U.S. Xpress, Werner, Covenant, Schneider, and Ryder. For Aurora’s latest news, visit aurora.tech and @aurora_inno on Twitter.<br><br>Aurora hires talented people with diverse backgrounds who are ready to help build a transportation ecosystem that will make our roads safer, get crucial goods where they need to go, and make mobility more efficient and accessible for all. We’re searching for a <strong>Staff </strong><strong>Software Engineer</strong> on the<strong> ML Data Engine org: Datasets and Pipelines team</strong>. The ideal candidate will have a passion for diving into our datasets to help keep it interesting, clean, and diverse, and work with our Autonomy model developer partners as if you were on the same team. You’ll develop tools, data pipelines &amp; APIs to accelerate data consumption, model training &amp; landing workflows.<br><br><strong>In this role, you will<br></strong><ul><li>Support feature development and for our labeling applications and data access</li><li>Collaborate with autonomy engineers to improve the quality and composition of our datasets</li><li>Leverage production best practices to guarantee a reliable platform for labeling operations and model training workflows</li><li>Optimize data pipelines handling sensor data from millions of miles of on-road</li><li>driving and richly-structured label data</li><li>Collaborate across teams and functions (product, program, operations, data science) to drive projects from inception to delivery</li><li>Depending on the project, you might</li><ul><li>Design and develop new features for a variety of labeling applications</li><li>Leverage production best practices to guarantee a reliable platform for thousands of labeling operators</li><li>Leverage MLOps best practices to design and develop scalable model training, evaluation and landing workflows<br></li></ul></ul><strong><u>Required Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>BS in Computer Science, or a related field</li><li>Excellent Python / Basic C++ programming and software design skills</li><li>Experience with storage and database management systems (e.g., one of SQL, no-SQL, protobuf, parquet, HDFS)</li><li>Experience working in a cloud environment (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure, etc)</li><li>Knowledge and experience in at least one of Perception, 3D geometry, autonomous driving, 3D computer vision, robotics, mapping, 3D labeling<br></li></ul><strong><u>Desirable Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>Excellent C++ programming and software design skills</li><li>Distributed System design patterns (high availability, scaling, load balancing, caching, sharding etc.)</li><li>Experience with Web frameworks and frontend development in React.js and JavaScript/TypeScript (not a primary focus of this role, but a very nice to have)<br></li></ul>The base salary range for this position is $168,000-$252,000 per year. Aurora’s pay ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range, the successful candidate’s starting base pay will be determined based on factors including job-related skills, experience, qualifications, relevant education or training, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future. The successful candidate will also be eligible for an annual bonus, equity compensation, and benefits.<br><br>#Mid-Senior<br><br>Working at Aurora<br><br>At Aurora, we bring together extraordinarily talented and experienced people united by the strength of our values. We operate with integrity, set outrageous goals, and build a culture where we win together — all without any jerks.<br><br>We have offices in several locations across the United States, where we encourage team and cross-functional collaboration. Aurora offers competitive medical, dental, and vision benefits, and additional healthcare support including medical transportation reimbursement, fertility, adoption, and surrogacy benefits. We empower our employees and their families with options to further their unique physical, mental, and financial well-being.<br><br>Our Learning and Development offerings include Aurora Academy, where our people learn, develop, and practice the essential skills that drive Aurora’s mission, continually up-leveling our team along the way. Our Careers page provides insight into career opportunities at Aurora, and you can find all the latest news on our Blog.<br><br>Safety is central to everything we do. Every employee at Aurora has a role in contributing to safety, every step of the way. We seek candidates who take active responsibility, can contribute to building an atmosphere of trust, and invest in the organization's long-term success by working safely — no matter what.<br><br>We believe that self-driving technology has broad benefits – including increased access to transportation. To realize those benefits, we need a workforce with diverse experiences, insights, and perspectives — a workforce that reflects the communities our technology will serve.<br><br>Aurora is committed to providing access to anyone who seeks information from our website. We invite anyone using assistive technologies, such as a screen reader or Braille reader, to email us at careersiteaccommodations@aurora.tech if they experience difficulty using our website. Please describe the accessibility problem and include a URL (if available).<br><br><em>Aurora considers candidates without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy status, parent or caregiver status, ancestry, political affiliation, veteran and/or military status, physical or mental disability, or any other status protected by federal or state law. Aurora considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. We are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at careersiteaccommodations@aurora.tech. <br><br></em><em>For California applicants, information collected and processed as part of your application and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to</em> <em>Aurora’s California Employment Privacy Policy</em><em>.<br><br></em>Diversity, Equity and Inclusion<br><br>At Aurora, every employee is empowered to take an active role in building an inclusive, collaborative, and unified culture that leverages our diverse strengths, perspectives, and backgrounds.<br><br>Transforming how the world moves people and goods involves seeking to understand backgrounds, insights, and lived experiences that differ from our own. One way we accomplish that is with our 15 employee-led Aurora Unified Groups, which support diverse voices and drive inclusive collaboration. We believe that teamwork, belonging, and trust motivate and support our employees to do their best work. As our team grows, we strive to attract and retain exceptional talent that adds new perspectives and experiences and continues to drive innovation. Learn more on our Culture Page.<br><br>

The worldwide data management software market is massive (IDC forecasts it to be $138 billion by 2026!). At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading modern data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.<p><br></p>The Search Web platform team is responsible for the tools that enable MongoDB developers to implement fast, relevance-based search experiences powered by Atlas. Whether it’s helping onboard new developers by reducing the boilerplate code they have to write, building IDE extensions, or automatically re-scoring search results to maximize end-user engagement.<p><br></p>We are looking for a Sr. Software Engineer that thrives in ambiguity, enjoys project ownership, and has extensive experience taking projects from idea to production.<p><br></p>If you love building for developers, and/or the search or recommendation system space, this role is for you!<p><br></p>We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in San Francisco, CA.<p><br></p><strong>Position Expectations/Role Responsibilities/What You’ll Do...</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design, implement, and test both client-side and server-side code. For example, you could work on:</li><ul><li>A debugger to visualize traces, and common performance issues</li><li>An IDE extension</li><li>A pipeline to process a stream of events asynchronously</li><li>An error reporting API</li><li>Code-generation tool to produce artifacts for different clients</li></ul><li>Collaborate with partner teams to deliver end-to-end systems</li><li>Investigate and prototype new technologies. For instance, use ML models to solve customer’s biggest problems</li><li>Perform code reviews</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications/Requirements/We’re Looking For Someone With…</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or equivalent work experience</li><li>Strong CS fundamentals including data structures, and algorithms</li><li>Strong technical problem solving, communication, and collaboration skills</li><li>6+ years of experience in full-stack software development (client-side development in TypeScript/React, and server-side in Java, Golang or other)</li><li>Big plus if you have distributed system experience</li></ul><p><br></p>To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!<p><br></p>MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.<p><br></p>MongoDB, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and makes all hiring decisions without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Affinity stitches together billions of data points from massive datasets to create a powerful, accurate representation of the world's professional relationship graph. Based on this data, we offer our users the insights and visibility they need to nurture and tap into their team's network of opportunities.<p><br></p>Reporting to the Director of Engineering, you'll support creating the magic that underlies Affinity's industry-leading relationship intelligence model as the key technical leader of Affinity's Data Enrichment team.<p><br></p>In this role, you'll leverage your past experiences and deep understanding of back-end technologies to help shape and execute Affinity's roadmap for dataflow and system architecture, champion engineering best practices, delivery velocity, and act as a technical mentor for other engineers on the team. You'll play a significant role in defining the future of how businesses around the world use their relationships.<p><br></p><strong>What you'll be doing:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Drive complex technical, architecture, design, and product discussions. </li><li>Lead data domain, technical and business discussions in relation to future architecture direction. </li><li>Design, implement, and build data solutions that deliver data with measurable quality using Spark, Python, Databricks, and the AWS ecosystem (S3, Redshift, EMR, Athena, Glue). </li><li>Help define our data roadmap. You'll collaborate with our fast-growing team of data engineering, machine learning engineering, product, and business leaders to help to answer these questions and more. </li><li>Mentoring, coaching, and inspiring the engineers on the team. </li><li>Identify and fill gaps in the team, and create the processes necessary for the teams' success. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every qualification. At Affinity, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you're excited about this role, but your past experience doesn't perfectly align with the qualifications above, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.<p><br></p>Required:<p><br></p><ul><li>You have 10+ years of experience working in data engineering, with at least 3+ years of acting as a senior team lead or staff engineer, leading complex, sometimes ambiguous engineering projects across team boundaries. </li><li>You have extensive hands-on experience in building scalable data platforms and reliable data pipelines using technologies such as Spark, Hadoop, DataBricks, AWS SQS, AWS Kinesis, and/or Kafka. </li><li>You have experience working with large, multi-terabyte datasets and are comfortable with high-scale data ingestion, transformation, and distributed processing tools such as Apache Spark (Scala or Python). </li><li>Experience with AWS, DBX or related cloud technologies. </li><li>You're comfortable with the building blocks of modern back-end systems, such as horizontally scalable data infrastructure, event-driven architecture, and beyond and can clearly articulate the pros/cons of different approaches, while also providing a recommended solution based on the current context. </li><li>You have familiarity with databases and analytics technologies in the industry, including Data Warehousing, Data Lakes, ETL and Relational Databases. </li><li>You have experience mentoring and helping the engineers around you grow. </li><li> You have experience partnering with product and machine learning teams on large, strategic data projects and routine partner work. </li><li>You take pride in delivering exceptionally high quality work in terms of data accuracy, performance, and reliability. </li><li>You're eager to contribute your ideas and experiences to help Affinity continuously improve as a product and company. </li></ul><p><br></p>Nice to have:<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience leveraging machine learning to improve the quality of ingested data. </li><li>You have worked with multiple third party data vendors and have experience in conflict resolution approaches. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>How we work:</strong><p><br></p>Our culture is a key part of how we operate as well as our hiring process:<p><br></p><ul><li>We iterate quickly. As such, you must be comfortable embracing ambiguity, be able to cut through it, and deliver incremental value to our customers each sprint. </li><li>We are candid, transparent, and speak our minds while simultaneously caring personally with each person we interact with. </li><li>We make data driven decisions and make the best decision for the moment based on the information available. </li></ul><p><br></p>Join us in enabling every professional on the planet to succeed by harnessing the power of their relationships.<p><br></p>If you'd want to learn more about our values click here.<p><br></p><strong>What you'll enjoy at Affinity:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>We live our values as playmakers, obsessed with learning, caring personally about our colleagues and clients, are radically open-minded, and take pride in everything we do. </li><li>We pay your medical, dental, and vision insurance with comprehensive PPO and HMO plans. And provide flexible personal &amp; sick days. We want our team to be happy and healthy :) </li><li>We offer a 401k plan to help you plan for retirement. </li><li>We provide an annual budget for you to spend on education and offer a comprehensive L&amp;D program – after all, one of our core values is that we're #obsessedwithlearning! </li><li>We support our employee's overall health and well-being and reimburse monthly for things such as; transportation, Home Internet, Meals, and Wellness memberships/equipment. </li><li>Virtual team building and socials. Keeping people connected is essential. </li></ul><p><br></p>Please note that the role compensation details below reflect the base salary only and do not include any variable pay, equity, or benefits. This represents the salary range that Affinity believes, in good faith, at the time of this posting, that it will pay for the posted job.<p><br></p>A reasonable estimate of the current range is $165,000 to $278,000 USD. Within the range, individual pay is determined by factors such as job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.<p><br></p><strong>About Affinity</strong><p><br></p>We have raised over $120M and are backed by some of Silicon Valley's best firms, with over 2,700 customers worldwide on our platform. We are proud to have a 4.5 Star Glassdoor rating and recently ranked; Inc.'s Best Workplaces of 2022 and Great Places to Work 2022. Passionate about helping dealmakers in the world's biggest relationship-driven industries to find, manage, and close the most important deals; our Relationship Intelligence platform uses the data exhaust of trillions of interactions between Investment Bankers, Venture Capitalists, Consultants, and other strategic dealmakers with their networks to deliver automated relationship insights that drive over 450,000 deals every month.

<strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Perfict Global is a leading IT consulting services provider focused on providing innovative and successful business workforce solutions to Fortune 500 companies. Our trained and experienced professionals constantly strive to bring together the best technologies available to manage client's complex business and technology, participate in implementation activities and collaborate in new ways to meet client needs.<p><br></p>We provide excellent benefits such as Medical, Dental, Vision ++ a fun company to work!!!<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Role: Data Test Engineer<p><br></p>Location: Remote<p><br></p><ul><li> Master's degree</li><li> 10+ years of overall experience</li><li> Data science, python, java, test frameworks</li><li> QA Automation Test tools expertise in Selenium, Test Ng, Cucumber, Appium, etc.,</li><li> 3+ Years of Software Quality Assurance experience on enterprise level applications which includes Digital Twin or Simulation Testing.</li><li> Experience in writing complex SQL queries,</li><li> Should have experience testing multiple test phases in medium to large projects.</li><li> Should have adequate experience and clear understanding of data warehouse and data mart testing.</li><li> Identification and Test Data Preparation Techniques.</li><li> Ability to transform complex Business logic into SQL or PL/SQL queries</li><li> Ability to run, read from, debug batch processes</li><li> Thorough knowledge of Software Test Life Cycle, Test Case Life Cycle, Defect Life Cycle etc.</li><li> Creating requirements traceability matrix (RTM)</li><li> Proficiency with Test Case Preparation and Execution. Extensive exposure to ETL testing with high-level of</li><li> SQL skills is required.</li><li> Should have exposure to large data sets and understand Data Quality Framework.</li><li> Must have experience in using ETL Tool.</li><li> Defect tracking experience (i.e. Jira, Bugzilla, etc) Experience in tuning SQL queries, Stored Procedures, Views, etc for performance improvements</li></ul>

Adept's mission is to build Useful General Intelligence. We are solving open problems in AI in order to train models that can do arbitrary things on a computer, and we are solving open product problems in order to package these models into a form factor that best enhances human experience and performance.<p><br></p>We’ve recently raised a $350M Series B led by General Catalyst and Spark, on top of a $65M Series A in 2022 with Addition and Greylock. We’re fortunate to be supported by amazing firms and angels such as Chris Re, Andrej Karpathy, Root Ventures, Howie Liu, Dara Khosrowshahi, and others, and were recently highlighted by Forbes. Adept is backed by a coalition of strategic partners, including Atlassian, Microsoft, NVIDIA, and Workday.<p><br></p>We're looking for passionate team members who want to swing for the fences to accomplish our mission, are excited by a startup environment where the hardest problems are yet to be solved, and are eager to learn and collaborate together in our San Francisco office.<p><br></p>For more information, check out our blog!<p><br></p>Position Summary<p><br></p><strong><u>Some Problems We’re Working On Across Engineering Right Now Include</u></strong><p><br></p>We’re growing rapidly and hiring software engineers to work across a broad and exciting range of challenges.<p><br></p><ul><li>Connecting neural networks to APIs, browsers, and applications</li><li>Scaling up model inference and running predictions at scale</li><li>Designing and implementing large-scale data pipelines to train cutting-edge models</li><li>Improving our iteration speed by identifying and fixing bottlenecks in our tools</li><li>Building reliable and secure systems to power our web-based applications</li><li>Creating scalable product infrastructure so we can deliver amazing experiences quickly to people all around the world</li><li>Inventing new UI/UX approaches for human computer interaction when LLMs are involved</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>If You Have Some Of These, You Might Be a Good Fit</u></strong><p><br></p>We deeply value generalist software engineers who can engage with new problems and get things done at a startup, and our team members come from a variety of backgrounds and experiences.<p><br></p><ul><li>4+ years of experience as a software engineer</li><li>Experience building and serving machine learning models</li><li>Expertise building scalable web applications</li><li>Experience at fast-growing companies or startups</li><li>A high level of end-to-end ownership and self-direction</li><li>The ability to move fast and learn by doing new things</li></ul><p><br></p><em>The pay range for this position in California is $175,000 - $350,000yr; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, candidate location, and experience.</em><p><br></p><strong><u>Our Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Comprehensive health insurance coverage - 100% for employees</li><li>Dental and vision <strong>Location</strong>: Mountain View, CA<br><br>Search is an innovative and highly impactful team at Wayfair and looking for experienced engineers. We develop and maintain high performing, scalable, fault-tolerant and highly available stable services to provide a high quality search experience to our customers. This team develops and maintains all the RESTful API and services that a customer interacts with when they click into the search bar on Wayfair’s sites.<br><br>The Search platform provides text-search capabilities to nearly every application in our storefront, with minimal latency and pinpoint accuracy. Our Search infrastructure is vast, serves over 10 billion requests in a day and is virtualized across a cloud-based multi-datacenter environment. We strive to create a more usable search platform for all teams building text-search driven experiences. We create automated processes, tools and coach our peers to ease the burden of using, developing and maintaining large search applications. We partner with our infrastructure teams to provide a stable search platform, and with nearly every team at Wayfair to produce a quality search experience.<br><br>What You'll Do<br><ul><li>Perform backend application development using technologies such as Java, Python, SQL, ElasticSearch, Solr, Kafka and Kubernetes.</li><li>Develop and design scalable distributed systems with deep understanding of object oriented design, modern programming languages, and design patterns.</li><li>Provides high quality reviews, both for code changes and architectural design of moderate complexity.</li><li>Define monitoring plans using technologies like Elasticsearch, InfluxDB, Kibana, Datadog and Grafana.</li><li>Tune application performance by investigating the slow performing requests and analyzing the resource utilization of the application infrastructure.</li><li>Work with a highly collaborative cross-functional team that includes product managers, data scientists, and infrastructure engineers.</li><li>Deliver direct measurable results for our business and customers through improved search results.</li><li>Deploy code to both development and production environments.<br></li></ul>What You'll Need<br><ul><li>A graduate of a computer science, mathematics, engineering, physical science related degree program with 5+ years of relevant industry experience.</li><li>4+ years of Java experience in developing and maintaining high performing, scalable, fault-tolerant and highly available RESTful API.</li><li>Strong experience in Spring Framework.</li><li>Experience with Service-Oriented architecture (REST &amp; GraphQL) and ability to architect scalable microservices.</li><li>Experience with Lucene-based Search engines like Solr or Elasticsearch is a plus.</li><li>Ability to maintain a stable application infrastructure with appropriate metrics, logging and monitors.</li><li>Experience using Docker, Kubernetes or other containerization technologies is a plus.</li><li>Experience with streaming technologies like Spark, Storm, Kafka, etc are a plus.</li><li>Good understanding of SRE/DevOps and experience in cloud-computing technologies and puppet is a big plus.</li><li>A continuous drive to explore, enhance, automate and optimize distributed systems.</li><li>Experience with Test-Driven Development and CI/CD tools like Buildkite, Cucumber or Karate.</li><li>Good understanding of Version control tools, preferably Git and GitHub.</li><li>Experience with large-scale data processing and design of distributed systems is a plus.</li><li>Understanding of machine learning principles, algorithms, and applications is a plus. </li><li>Comfortable working in a collaborative, fast-paced and dynamic work environment.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Assistance For Individuals With Disabilities<br><br></u></strong>Wayfair is fully committed to providing equal opportunities for all individuals, including individuals with disabilities. As part of this commitment, Wayfair will make reasonable accommodations to the known physical or mental limitations of qualified individuals with disabilities, unless doing so would impose an undue hardship on business operations. If you require a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, please let us know by completing our Accomodations for Applicants form.<br><br><strong>Need Assistance?<br><br></strong>For more information about applying for a career at Wayfair, visit our FAQ page here.<br><br><strong><u>About Wayfair Inc.<br><br></u></strong>Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.<br><br>No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic.<br><br>We are interested in retaining your data for a period of 12 months to consider you for suitable positions within Wayfair. Your personal data is processed in accordance with our Candidate Privacy Notice (which can found here: https://www.wayfair.com/careers/privacy). If you have any questions regarding our processing of your personal data, please contact us at dataprotectionofficer@wayfair.com. If you would rather not have us retain your data please contact us anytime at dataprotectionofficer@wayfair.com.

<strong>Title:Software Engineer - Windows<br><br></strong><strong>Location: Mountain View<br><br></strong><strong>Full time<br><br></strong><strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong>We are looking for a motivated Windows Platform Development Engineer - Windows Platform to join our backend API team. Our Windows Engineer will be responsible for developing Windows services that integrate with Active Directory, Registry Services, Process Management, and Named Pipes. You will be instrumental in the core services that we build and work in concert with our backend SaaS team. You will need an understanding networking protocols, and how to move data through TCP/UDP to RESTful end points on the internet.<br><br>What You Will Do<br><br>An example of what you may do is receive a request to create an agent that intercepts http protocol traffic of the local computer and parses the data flow looking for any pizza order placed by the user. You would then send that data as a JSON payload from the windows system to the RESTful API on the internet provided by the backend team. In addition, you will need to update the local registry to increment a counter by one for every pizza order you detect from your agent. You likely won't be asked to become a pizza spy, but hopefully you understand this process to become one, should you make that career choice later.<br><br><strong><u>Essential Duties And Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Building and debugging Windows Installer packages<br><br>Ground up development of various Windows services that interface with our SaaS<br><br>TCP/UDP is required to move<br><br>Provide specifications to the backend team so they can provide you with required<br><br>APIs and networking services.<br><br>Configuration of Domain Controllers and Configuring GPOs for your development<br><br>needs.<br><br>Using Networking tools (Ping, Traceroute, nslookup) to ensure connectivity<br><br>Some configuring of Windows firewall to test various conditions<br><br>Participate and work closely with our software architects to transfer technical<br><br>specifications into highly scalable software.<br><br><strong><u>Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Strong to expert knowledge of .NET C#<br><br>Some experience with Remote Windows Event Log subscription<br><br>Experience with relational databases (Postgres, MYSQL, etc.).<br><br>Understanding of Git (GitHub is a plus) and branching<br><br>Good understanding of RESTful API's, Streaming Data, and Kafka<br><br>Good written skills. Documentation is an important part of the development<br><br>process.<br><br>Communicate you must be able to communicate clearly and concisely with your<br><br>team. Don't work in a bubble.<br><br>Experience working in agile teams with a basic understanding of sprints and sprint rituals (standup, refinement, planning, retrospective).<br><br>Startup experience is a strong plus.

<strong>About Refuel.ai</strong><p><br></p>The Mission<p><br></p>The next wave of ML applications (video security, conversational AI and autonomous vehicles) is going to look very different from the last one (search and recommender systems). Teams working in these domains have to deal with large streams of unstructured data (images, video, text and audio), exorbitant labeling costs, and broken feedback loops. For this next wave of ML applications, getting to production takes months and adapting to the long tail is an existential struggle. That’s what we’re solving - Refuel.ai accelerates time to production for ML applications built on top of unstructured data, and enables them to continually improve in the real world.<p><br></p>The team<p><br></p>Refuel.ai was founded in 2021 by Rishabh Bhargava and Nihit Desai. Our founders bring machine learning and product experience from the world's leading technology companies (Facebook, Instagram, Primer.ai and Cloudera) and institutions (Stanford, Cambridge and UIUC). We are backed by General Catalyst, XYZ Ventures and a host of successful and influential angel investors from places like Stanford, OpenAI, Datadog and Facebook.<p><br></p>What you will do<p><br></p><ul><li>Build our web application frontend. Frameworks/languages you will use on a regular basis include React, NextJS, Javascript and CSS</li><li>Work closely with our design and engineering teams to implement new features and own them across the product life cycle. </li><li>Prototype and rapidly experiment with new product features and UI improvements in response to customer feedback</li><li>Help define and evolve our engineering stack as we scale the product</li><li>Help us hire a world-class team and mentor new team members<br><br></li></ul>You will be a great fit if you have<p><br></p><ul><li>Expertise with building frontend applications using React and Javascript</li><li>The ability and passion to lead product-defining initiatives from ideation to execution while maintaining a high bar for design and correctness</li><li>Strong communication skills and enjoy working in a collaborative environment. We encourage open discussion and want the best ideas to win</li><li>A curiosity about the company building journey</li><li>Bonus: prior experience with building interactive frontend interfaces for data-intensive software applications<br><br></li></ul>Our current tech stack<p><br></p><ul><li>Infrastructure - AWS + Serverless + Kubernetes + secret sauce infra to power modern ML</li><li>Backend - Python + FastAPI + Postgres + DynamoDB</li><li>Frontend - React + Typescript<br><br></li></ul>What we offer<p><br></p>We have raised funding from top-tier investors, including General Catalyst, XYZ Ventures and a host of successful angel investors from places such as Stanford, OpenAI, Facebook and Datadog. We will offer a competitive salary and meaningful equity in the company.<p><br></p>Most importantly, you will have the opportunity to create a massive impact on the product and company as a member of our early team. We care a lot about making a difference for our customers while working on a team where we are empowered to do the best work of our lives.
