describtion: Who We Are<p><br></p>Aurora (Nasdaq: AUR) is delivering the benefits of self-driving technology safely, quickly, and broadly to make transportation safer, increasingly accessible, and more reliable and efficient than ever before. The Aurora Driver is a self-driving system designed to operate multiple vehicle types, from freight-hauling semi-trucks to ride-hailing passenger vehicles, and underpins Aurora Horizon and Aurora Connect, its driver-as-a-service products for trucking and ride-hailing. Aurora is working with industry leaders across the transportation ecosystem, including Toyota, FedEx, Volvo Trucks, PACCAR, Uber, Uber Freight, U.S. Xpress, Werner, Covenant, Schneider, and Ryder. For Aurora’s latest news, visit aurora.tech and @aurora_inno on Twitter.<p><br></p>Aurora hires talented people with diverse backgrounds who are ready to help build a transportation ecosystem that will make our roads safer, get crucial goods where they need to go, and make mobility more efficient and accessible for all. We’re searching for a Software Engineer to focus on ML Accelerators<p><br></p><strong>In this role, you will</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Work closely with our autonomy and hardware teams to understand our on-vehicle ML technology</li><li>Develop perspectives on where opportunities and gaps might be in our machine learning software and hardware strategy with a longer-term horizon in mind</li><li>Maintain relationships and intel across the ML ecosystem including both established players and start-ups (accelerators, software modules, etc.) for both existing and future products</li><li>Execute internal research and development of ML software and hardware technology</li><li>Surface high-impact findings to relevant Engineering leadership, keeping feedback loop going to influence Aurora’s ML strategy</li><li>Help drive value to key engineering stakeholders</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum 5+ years of professional experience </li><li>BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science or related field</li><li>Strong programming skills in C++, Python</li><li>Familiarity with at least one deep learning framework (PyTorch, TensorFlow, MXNet, etc.)</li><li>Basic understanding of computer vision deep learning models.</li><li>Strong analytical skills, especially for performance troubleshooting (e.g. profiling, roofline model)</li><li>Familiarity with CUDA, OpenCL, OpenVX, Halide or other SIMD programming models</li><li>Familiarity with ML-specific accelerators (NPUs, TPUs, IPUs, etc…)</li><li>Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new technology</li><li>Ability to work on large code bases and a fast growing environment.</li><li>Strong communication skills</li><li>Comfortable with Linux/other unix environments</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Desirable Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with inference on edge platforms</li><li>Experience with cloud ML training pipelines</li><li>HPC experience</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Pay Range</u></strong><p><br></p>The base salary range for this position is $189,000 - $302,000. Aurora’s pay ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range, the successful candidate’s starting base pay will be determined based on factors including job-related skills, experience, qualifications, relevant education or training, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future. The successful candidate will also be eligible for an annual bonus, equity compensation, and benefits.<p><br></p>#Mid-Senior<p><br></p>Working at Aurora<p><br></p>At Aurora, we bring together extraordinarily talented and experienced people united by the strength of our values. We operate with integrity, set outrageous goals, and build a culture where we win together — all without any jerks.<p><br></p>We have offices in several locations across the United States, where we encourage team and cross-functional collaboration. Aurora offers competitive medical, dental, and vision benefits, and additional healthcare support including medical transportation reimbursement, fertility, adoption, and surrogacy benefits. We empower our employees and their families with options to further their unique physical, mental, and financial well-being.<p><br></p>Our Learning and Development offerings include Aurora Academy, where our people learn, develop, and practice the essential skills that drive Aurora’s mission, continually up-leveling our team along the way. Our Careers page provides insight into career opportunities at Aurora, and you can find all the latest news on our Blog.<p><br></p>Safety is central to everything we do. Every employee at Aurora has a role in contributing to safety, every step of the way. We seek candidates who take active responsibility, can contribute to building an atmosphere of trust, and invest in the organization's long-term success by working safely — no matter what.<p><br></p>We believe that self-driving technology has broad benefits – including increased access to transportation. To realize those benefits, we need a workforce with diverse experiences, insights, and perspectives — a workforce that reflects the communities our technology will serve.<p><br></p>Aurora is committed to providing access to anyone who seeks information from our website. We invite anyone using assistive technologies, such as a screen reader or Braille reader, to email us at careersiteaccommodations@aurora.tech if they experience difficulty using our website. Please describe the accessibility problem and include a URL (if available).<p><br></p><em>Aurora considers candidates without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy status, parent or caregiver status, ancestry, political affiliation, veteran and/or military status, physical or mental disability, or any other status protected by federal or state law. Aurora considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. We are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at careersiteaccommodations@aurora.tech. </em><p><br></p><em>For California applicants, information collected and processed as part of your application and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to</em> <em>Aurora’s California Employment Privacy Policy</em><em>.</em><p><br></p>Diversity, Equity and Inclusion<p><br></p>At Aurora, every employee is empowered to take an active role in building an inclusive, collaborative, and unified culture that leverages our diverse strengths, perspectives, and backgrounds.<p><br></p>Transforming how the world moves people and goods involves seeking to understand backgrounds, insights, and lived experiences that differ from our own. One way we accomplish that is with our 15 employee-led Aurora Unified Groups, which support diverse voices and drive inclusive collaboration. We believe that teamwork, belonging, and trust motivate and support our employees to do their best work. As our team grows, we strive to attract and retain exceptional talent that adds new perspectives and experiences and continues to drive innovation. Learn more on our Culture Page.<p><br></p>

Positions: 1 Full Time Associate, Mid-Senior level Experience 3 – 6 Years We are seeking a highly skilled Technical Enablement Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have strong SQL, computer science, and big data skills, as well as expertise with Snowflake and AWS cloud technologies. In addition to technical expertise, the successful candidate will have excellent customer-facing and communication skills. As a Technical Enablement Engineer, you will work closely with our customers to understand their technical needs and provide expert guidance on the use of our products and services. You will also work with our internal technical teams to troubleshoot and resolve customer issues. Responsibilities: Work hands-on with prospects and customers to deliver standard, customized and/or strategic solution demonstrations, white boarding, presentations, and best practices that showcase functional capabilities, competitive advantages, and business benefits of the Snowflake solutions throughout the sales cycle, from demo to proof of concept to design and implementation Provide technical guidance and support to customers on the use of our products and services Troubleshoot and resolve customer technical issues Work with internal technical teams to identify and resolve technical issues Demonstrate our products and services to customers Collaborate with the sales team to identify and pursue new business opportunities Stay up-to-date on the latest industry trends and technologies Requirements: Snowflake expert having completed the snowflake university workshops obtaining all 5 badges. SnowPro core cetification a plus. 3+ hand-on experience with Snowflake ecosystem including expert knowledge of SnowPipes, Streams, Views, performance tuning, Snowflake data modeling, ELT using SnowSQL, data visualizations using StreamLit, implementing complex stored procedures and standard DWH and ETL concepts Minimum 1 year experience using the Jinja templating language to create dynamic SQL templates Able to demonstrate working knowledge of data clean-room technologies including creating secure data shares using RBAC. Knowledge of Snowflake Native apps (v6+) 6+ years of documented experience as a back-end data/software engineer working on various data technologies with proficiency in Python and/or Javascript (Node.js) Knowledge of all aspects of the SDLC, experience with Jenkins and setting up CI/CD processes.Zero copy clone experience a plus. 3+ years experience using UNIX bash command line utilities – ssh, vim, curl, etc. Minimum 4 years experience with various AWS cloud technologies and data lake management – S3, Lambda, Redshift/Athena, Glue Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field (preferred) Specific technology tools and methodologies you’ll be using on the job include: Snowflake Technologies – SnowSQL, Snowpipe, SnowPark, etc. JinjaSQL templates AWS S3, Redshift, Athena, Glue Python JavaScript (Node.js)

<strong>About Anyscale<br><br></strong>At Anyscale , we're on a mission to democratize distributed computing and make it accessible to software developers of all skill levels. We’re commercializing Ray , a popular open-source project that's creating an ecosystem of libraries for scalable machine learning. Companies like OpenAI , Uber , Spotify , Instacart , Cruise , and many more, have Ray in their tech stacks to accelerate the progress of AI applications out into the real world.<br><br>With Anyscale, we’re building the best place to run Ray, so that any developer or data scientist can scale an ML application from their laptop to the cluster without needing to be a distributed systems expert.<br><br>Proud to be backed by $250+ million from top-tier investors like Andreessen Horowitz, NEA, and Addition .<br><br>Anyscale is based in San Francisco, CA. Employees are required to come in office 3x a week.<br><br><strong>About The Role<br><br></strong>The Experience team is responsible for creating the suite of tools and services that help create production quality applications using Ray. The product is the user’s primary interface into the world of Anyscale and by building a polished, stable, and well-designed product, we are able to enable a magical developer experience for our users.<br><br>Applications engineers help design and implement the features that can simplify or automate many of the processes and components of creating a production-grade application, including development, debugging, deployment, operations, and monitoring. Beyond the user-facing features, applications engineers help build out critical pieces of infrastructure and architecture needed to power our platform at scale.<br><br>With a taste for good products, a willingness to work with and understand the user base, and technical talent to build high quality software, the applications engineer can help build a delightful experience for our users from new developers learning to use Ray to businesses powering their products on Anyscale.<br><br><strong>A Snapshot Of Projects You Can Work On<br><br></strong><ul><li> Creating UIs for monitoring the activity of your application or its resource usage</li><li> A jobs platform to reliably schedule tasks and view the results of those jobs in the UI</li><li> Building tools to administer and manage the users and clusters within your organization<br><br></li></ul><strong>As Part Of Your Role You Will<br><br></strong><ul><li>Develop high quality backend business logic or delightful UIs that empower software developers and simplify programming</li><li>Work with a team of leading distributed systems and machine learning experts</li><li>Communicate your work to a broader audience through talks, tutorials, and blog posts</li><li>Help us to build and shape a world class company<br><br></li></ul><strong>What We're Looking For<br><br></strong><ul><li>At least 2 years of full stack, backend, or frontend</li><li>Familiarity with technologies such as Python, React, Typescript, FastAPI, or SQLAlchemy</li><li>Motivated people who are excited to build tools to power the next generation of cloud applications!<br><br></li></ul><strong>Compensation<br><br></strong><ul><li>At Anyscale, we take a market-based approach to compensation. We are data-driven, transparent, and consistent. The target salary for this role is $170,112 ~ $237,000. As the market data changes over time, the target salary for this role may be adjusted.<br><br></li></ul>This role is also eligible to participate in Anyscale's Equity and Benefits offerings, including the following:<br><br><ul><li>Stock Options</li><li>Healthcare plans, with premiums covered by Anyscale at 99%</li><li>401k Retirement Plan</li><li>Wellness stipend</li><li>Education stipend</li><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Flexible Time Off</li><li>Commute reimbursement</li><li>100% of in office meals covered<br><br></li></ul><em>Anyscale Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Candidates are evaluated without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, disability, national origin, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal or state law.</em> <em><strong>Anyscale Inc. is an E-Verify company and you may review the </strong></em> <em><strong>Notice of E-Verify Participation</strong></em> <em><strong> and the </strong></em> <em><strong>Right to Work posters in English and Spanish</strong></em>

Who we are<p><br></p>Fizz is a private and authenticated platform designed to revolutionize the social fabric of communities, starting with colleges. After verifying a university email address, students use Fizz to post questions, memes, polls, and chat directly with other verified students, all while maintaining full control of their identity and privacy. Fizz communities are safe, authentic, and inclusive, made possible through community-based moderation.<p><br></p>Launched by two Stanford dropouts, Fizz is currently expanding into colleges all across the US. In a time when social media is plagued by curated highlight reels and lack of authenticity, Fizz is on a mission to redefine the definition of a true social network.<p><br></p>What we’ve done<p><br></p>We first launched Fizz at Stanford in July 2021 and have since seen &gt;95% of undergraduates join the app, half of which use Fizz every day. Since then, we have raised over 16M from NEA, Owl Ventures, and Lightspeed, built a rock-solid engineering team with decades of experience at top tech companies, and expanded Fizz to be the dominant community platform at 70+ colleges.<p><br></p>Where we’re going<p><br></p>Our near term goal is to expand to all US universities by the end of the 2023-2024 academic school year. To get there, we give engineers at Fizz a lot of autonomy and ownership of our product. Some of the things you can expect to work on include:<p><br></p><ul><li> Designing and implementing new features from the ground up to drive app engagement</li><li> Building scalable community moderation systems</li><li> Utilizing NLP systems to automatically categorize and target content to users</li><li> Using data to drive product decisions<br></li></ul><p><br></p>We are open to candidates of all experience levels who are passionate about being an early employee and want to help drive our company forward.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Architect, design, and develop scalable services that can support high traffic retail facing applications involving user interactions typical of a social network</li><li>Design and implement RESTful APIs that are scalable, reliable, and secure</li><li>Setup tools and processes that promote great software development practices</li><li>Imagine, design, deploy, and iterate new product features<br><br></li></ul>Qualifications<p><br></p><ul><li>Strong fundamentals of CS concepts such as Algorithms, Data Structures, Networking, Operating Systems, Databases</li><li>Experience as a lead engineer for at least one large scale system that supports at least a million users using a distributed system</li><li>Ability to articulate and demonstrate common security practices from a developer point of view</li><li>Strong grasp on product and ability to develop features that college students will use and love</li><li>Ability to find appropriate new technologies and tools for our stack<br><br></li></ul>Bonus Points<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience working with User-Generated Content or a Trust &amp; Safety team</li><li>Experience with SwiftUI, TypeScript, Firebase, or Google Cloud Platform<br><br></li></ul>Fizz is committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant, candidate, or employee on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital/domestic partner status, military or veteran status, genetic information or any other legally-recognized protected basis under federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances.

describtion: <strong>Job Title: </strong> Software Engineer – System<p><br></p><strong>Department:</strong> Software Engineering<p><br></p><strong><strong>FLSA: </strong></strong>Exempt<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>This position is responsible for the firmware of Bear Robotics’ custom PCBA board, which is one of the most critical components of Bear Robotics’ robots. You are expected to be highly autonomous and to lead technical directions as well as work with high-level product requirements and manage individual project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables with your technical expertise.<p><br></p><strong><u>About The Position</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Responsible for the firmware of our custom PCBA board</li><li>Work closely with electrical engineers and software engineers, to design, prototype, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve the PCBA board design and its firmware. </li><li>Expected to architect and develop the whole firmware stack. </li><li>Expected to work with high-level requirements, and to manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables with your technical expertise.</li><li>Mentor interns or other junior engineers</li><li>Perform other related duties as assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills/Abilities/Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BS in EE/CS or related field</li><li>5+ years of relevant work experience</li><li>Development experience within embedded systems/firmware design</li><li>Solid coding in C/C++</li><li>Microcontrollers, ARM processors, SoC</li><li>Hardware bringup, hardware/software integration</li><li>RTOS, application/driver integration</li><li>Peripherals including BLDC motor, UART, SPI, CAN, BLE, USB, PWM, ADC, LED</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>3+ of the following must-have experiences:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Expert at the Linux Kernel, POSIX, filesystems, networking, and automated deployment</li><li>Devop (Bash, Docker, CI/CD)</li><li>Able to identify and mitigate security issues following industry best practices - secure by default</li><li>Experience with optimizing system boot-up time</li><li>Experience with creating system services for cleaning logs, uploading logs, monitoring disk usage, etc</li><li>Ability to troubleshoot database performance and availability issues</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Skills/Abilities/Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>STM32 MCU</li><li>C2000 MCU &amp; MotorWare</li><li>PCBA and wire harness design</li><li>Manufacture &amp; mass production</li><li>ROS1 or ROS2 experience</li><li>Large-scale ETL and data analysis/mining pipeline in the cloud</li><li>Mobile robot performance evaluation</li><li>Python data analysis</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Physical Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><em>The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.</em><p><br></p><ul><li>Prolonged periods of sitting/standing at a desk and working on a computer. The employee routinely is required to type, sit, stand, walk, talk, and hear.</li><li>Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.</li><li>Ability to lift 20 lbs.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Bear Robotics</u></strong><p><br></p><em>Bear Robotics was founded in 2017 and we are 250+ motivated Bears who work tirelessly everyday to make our robots a reality. We have developed robotic solutions that autonomously navigate indoor environments for a variety of consumer solutions, like restaurants, senior living facilities, hotels &amp; casinos just to name a few. Working for a dynamic start-up gives you a chance for rapid personal development. While building expertise in your field you’ll have countless opportunities for growth as we expand our product line and global reach. We’re not a big tech company yet, but we’re striving every day to be THE global player when it comes to hospitality robotics. In 2022 we raised $81 Million in Series B funding to accelerate growth and expand into new markets in southeast Asia and Europe. If you feel you’re ready for an adventure in robotics, we would love to hear from you.</em><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits Summary</u></strong><p><br></p><em>We hire the best, not only will you be surrounded by exceptionally smart and motivated people, but we believe excellent compensation and benefits are an essential part of our company's success.</em><p><br></p><em>Comprehensive Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance Plans</em><p><br></p><em>Company-Paid Long-Term and Short-Term Disability</em><p><br></p><em>Company-Paid Life/AD&amp;D Insurance</em><p><br></p><em>Health Savings Account/Flexible Spending Account</em><p><br></p><em>Stock Options</em><p><br></p><em>Employee Assistance Program (EAP)</em><p><br></p><em>Wellness Reward Programs</em><p><br></p><em>Mental Health Benefits</em><p><br></p><em>Paid Vacation Time</em><p><br></p><em>Paid Sick Time</em><p><br></p><em>401K Plan Employer Match (No Vesting Schedule)</em><p><br></p><em>Paid Bearental (Parental) Leave (16 weeks)</em><p><br></p><em>Paid New Bearental (Parental) Transitional Time Off (2 weeks)</em><p><br></p><em>Annual Paid Holidays (11 days)</em><p><br></p><em>Annual Paid Family Time-Off (Between Christmas Holiday and New Year)</em><p><br></p><em>Employee Recognition Bonus Program</em><p><br></p><em>Peer Recognition Bonus Program</em><p><br></p><em>Employee Referral Reward Program</em><p><br></p><em>Patent Reward Program</em><p><br></p><em>Monthly Mobile Phone Reimbursement</em><p><br></p><em>Monthly Internet Reimbursement</em><p><br></p><em>Casual Dress Policy</em><p><br></p><em>Financial Wellness Education Sessions</em><p><br></p><em>Free Daily In-Office Lunch</em><p><br></p><em>Unlimited Office Snacks and Drinks</em><p><br></p><em>Wellness Room with Massage Chair</em><p><br></p><em>Day-Friendly Office</em><p><br></p><em>Flexible Work Schedule</em><p><br></p><em>Office Parties and Family Events</em><p><br></p><em>The pay range is $120K-$215K. If you have worked on robust, highly-available web services, thought hard about making APIs simple and elegant, and worked closely with front-end engineers to building amazing user experiences, we would love to chat. Ideally, you'll also love instrumenting and operating the services you build. We use JS/TS/Node on public clouds. If you're a good fit for us, you'll be able to help us organize our engineering efforts and help inform the technical decisions we make.<p><br></p><strong>You might be a good fit if you</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Thrive in an unstructured environment and take initiative</li><li>Have experience working with distrubuted and highly-available systems</li><li>Have amazing attention to detail</li><li>Create just enough process to get stuff done</li><li>Are an expert in Node, Typescript, and React</li><li>Know your way around AWS or other public clouds</li><li>Think carefully about database schema design</li><li>Have built robust, highly-available web services</li><li>Enjoy owning the development, testing, instrumentation, and operations of services you build</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What We Offer</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive salary</li><li>Meaningful and significant equity in a fast-growing startup</li><li>Untracked vacations policy, with an annual minimum</li><li>A world-class environment in which to learn and do your best work</li><li>A commitment to remote-first tooling</li><li>An opportunity to help shape our engineering culture and our company destiny</li></ul>

<strong>Who is Recruiting from Scratch: </strong><p><br></p>Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.<p><br></p><strong> From Our Client </strong><p><br></p>Location: New York / Remote<p><br></p>Job Type: Full-time<p><br></p>Experience: 3+ years<p><br></p><strong>About The Role</strong><p><br></p>Our mission is to increase the number of financially independent people. We believe we can achieve this goal by building tools that enable independent business owners to scale their businesses profitably. Our first product combines a virtual credit card system with dynamic spending limits and software tooling to help merchants grow and optimize their profitability. We are growing very fast -- in less than five months, we grew to millions in card volume. We have a significant waitlist of customers waiting to use our product. We are looking to expand our headcount quickly to support the demand. Our investors include Solomon Hykes (founder of Docker), Paul Buchheit (founder of Gmail), Paul Graham (founder of Y Combinator), Robert Leshner (founder of compound.finance), and many more. We have raised over $30M from top-tier fintech investors.<p><br></p><strong>What You'll Be Working On</strong><p><br></p>You'll be involved in projects of varying scope and complexity:<p><br></p><ul><li> Build credit risk models that segment merchants based on their revenue and spend patterns to offer dynamic credit limits that change with business performance given the high seasonality and fast pace of ecommerce </li><li> Use machine learning tools to build realtime credit underwriting models leveraging alternative and traditional data sources </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You'll Need</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Passion for, or curiosity to learn, financial technology </li><li> Track record of high-quality shipping products and features at scale </li><li> Ability to turn business and product ideas into engineering solutions </li><li> Desire to work in a fast-paced environment, continuously grow and master your craft </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We’d Like To See</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Experience with building out data pipelines (e.g. should know data lakes, data warehouses, ETL, etc.) </li><li> Experience working with data analytics, algorithmic decision making, and real-time data systems </li><li> Experience with different business requirements on data freshness and retention </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> PLUSES </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Proven experience and subject matter expertise in e-commerce payments (nice to have) or financial services. </li><li> Has worked with bank account data (e.g. worked with Plaid), payments data (perhaps Stripe), and/or other fintech data sources </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Why you should join us: </strong><p><br></p>Our mission is to increase the number of financially independent people. We believe we can achieve this goal by building tools that enable independent business owners to scale their businesses profitably. Our first product combines a virtual credit card system with dynamic spending limits and software tooling to help merchants grow and optimize their profitability. We are growing very fast -- in less than five months, we have grown to millions in card volume.<p><br></p>We have a significant waitlist of customers waiting to use our product. We are looking to expand our headcount quickly to support the demand. Our investors include Solomon Hykes (founder of Docker), Paul Buchheit (founder of Gmail), Paul Graham (founder of Y Combinator), Robert Leshner (founder of compound.finance), and many more. We recently closed a financing round of $5M from a top-tier fintech investor.<p><br></p><strong> Salary Range: $150,000-$250,000 base.</strong>

jobs_titles: Principal Data Engineer, Tech Lead (Store No.8 Health & Wellness)
describtion: Position Summary...<p><br></p>What you'll do...<p><br></p><strong><u>About Store No 8</u></strong><p><br></p>We are the incubation arm of Walmart. Store No 8 was formed in 2017 as part of Walmart's larger innovation mission to shape the future of commerce. We pursue big ideas and take risks by stepping outside of Walmart's core business to focus on leapfrog capabilities across conversational commerce, mixed reality, in-store digitization, and more. Our ultimate goal: fuel Walmart's core business, create new operational efficiencies, and unlock amazing experiences for our customers in the long-term.<p><br></p><strong><u>About The Role</u></strong><p><br></p>We are the Health &amp; Wellness venture at Store No 8, looking for a Lead Data Engineer to join our Data Engineering team! You will collaborate with the data science team to design, build, and scale high-leverage datasets and infrastructure that enables analytics, modeling, and experimentation. As a Principal Data Engineering Tech Lead, you will establish and drive a vision for data architecture, foundational datasets and data quality. We are seeking a self-starter with a bias for action and excellent communication skills.<p><br></p>This is a rare opportunity, moving at the speed of a start-up, with the backing and in house data (lots of data) of the Fortune 1 company.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You'll Do</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop and execute a roadmap to build and optimize high-quality ergonomic foundational datasets and the relevant data pipelines</li><li>Develop and execute on a roadmap to establish data quality management processes at scale</li><li>Improve our data infrastructure to meet business needs and balance between agility, reliability, and scalability, and move us from proof-of-concept to pilot and scale</li><li>Inform and make architectural decisions, establish best practices, develop lean scalable processes, and contribute to the overall direction of the data organization</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience as a tech lead who can own and drive products and work with key business stakeholders, while mentoring and growing junior team members.</li><li>Expert knowledge of Python and SQL, with experience building complex, scalable cloud-based systems and data pipelines</li><li>Experience in developing robust data models at massive scale</li><li>Experience working with DS team and ML systems</li><li>Ability to proactively identifying opportunities to improve ETL and pipeline performance and infra cost</li><li>Ability to navigate environments where problems/requirements are not well-defined (and evolve quickly).</li><li>Excellent communication skills with ability to explain complex technical concepts in easy-to-understand ways</li><li>Last but not least - a humble collaborative can-do attitude and natural curiosity</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>A Plus If You Have</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with healthcare data</li><li>Experience with modern data storage and processing technologies (i.e. BigQuery, GCS, Dataproc, Airflow, etc)</li><li>Experience owning and proactively improving data models, implementing best practices, and influencing change of existing architect</li><li>Experience designing data architecture to power a variety of uses cases, including machine learning, data analytics and visualization</li><li>Experience with MLOps systems, including data pipelines and production-level machine learning (ML) infrastructure to support large-scale data workflow from data collection, ingestion, storage, preparation, to data query/analytics</li><li>Passion for Health &amp; Wellness</li></ul><p><br></p>At Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based incentive awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. Other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more.<p><br></p>You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. It will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable. For information about PTO, see https://one.walmart.com/notices .<p><br></p>Live Better U is a Walmart-paid education benefit program for full-time and part-time associates in Walmart and Sam's Club facilities. Programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including English Language Learning and short-form certificates. Tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by Walmart.<p><br></p>Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms. For information about benefits and eligibility, see One.Walmart at https://bit.ly/3iOOb1J .<p><br></p>The annual salary range for this position is $168,000.00-$252,000.00<p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Compensation Includes Annual Or Quarterly Performance Incentives.</u></strong><p><br></p>Additional compensation for certain positions may also include:<p><br></p><ul><li> Regional Pay Zone (RPZ) (based on location)</li><li> Stock equity incentives</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications...</u></strong><p><br></p>Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.<p><br></p>Option 1: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science and 5 years' experience in software engineering or related field. Option 2: 7 years' experience in software engineering or related field. Option 3: Master's degree in Computer Science and 3 years' experience in software engineering or related field.<p><br></p>4 years' experience in data engineering, database engineering, business intelligence, or business analytics.<p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications...</u></strong><p><br></p>Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.<p><br></p>Data engineering, database engineering, business intelligence, or business analytics, ETL tools and working with large data sets in the cloud, Master's degree in Computer Science or related field and 5 years' experience in software engineering or related field<p><br></p>Primary Location...<p><br></p>850 Cherry Avenue, San Bruno, CA 94066-3031, United States of America

<strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 4+ years of professional software engineering experience</li><li> Experience delivering production code of significant technical complexity in C++, Java, Go, or Typescript</li><li> Strong grounding in distributed systems, databases, and operating systems fundamentals</li><li> Experience maintaining production data infrastructure in on-premises and cloud-hosted deployments.</li><li> Deep knowledge of security and privacy best practices</li><li> Strong written communication skills</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Bonus Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Deep knowledge of Unix internals</li><li> Experience evaluating hardware performance</li><li> Experience with robotics or automation technologies</li><li> Experience with both packaged and SaaS software deployment</li><li> A love for great tools (e.g. fast, correct, and reproducible builds, releases, test suites)</li></ul>

Title: Software Engineer<p><br></p>Company: Frame<p><br></p>Location: Remote / San Francisco / London<p><br></p>Existing Investors: Episode 1, Kleiner Perkins, Bonfire Ventures, Stellar Capital<p><br></p>Existing Advisors: CTO of Intercom, COO of Moonfare, COO of Kipoti, CEO of Symmetric, Sr. Director of Engineering at Slack, VP Growth at Amplitude<p><br></p><strong><u>Overview</u></strong><p><br></p>Frame is a suite of minimalist collaboration apps built to empower cross-teams and cross-department work in a beautiful minimalist digital environment. As a fast-growing Seed stage startup, we are seeking experienced Software Engineers to join our team and help drive the success of our company.<p><br></p>As a Software Engineer at Frame, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining software applications for our suite of collaboration apps using Node.js, React, and Typescript. You will work closely with the product and engineering teams to understand customer requirements, and will be responsible for implementing new features and functionality using these technologies as needed.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>Design, develop, and maintain software applications for our suite of collaboration apps using Node.js, React, and Typescript<p><br></p>Work closely with the product and engineering teams to understand customer requirements<p><br></p>Implement new features and functionality using Node.js, React, and Typescript as needed<p><br></p>Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure that software applications are properly integrated and tested<p><br></p>Write clean, maintainable, and scalable code<p><br></p>Participate in code reviews and contribute to the continuous improvement of our engineering practices<p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p>3-7 years of experience as a Software Engineer, with a strong foundation in computer science and software development<p><br></p>Proficiency in Node.js, React, and Typescript, with experience using other technologies such as StoryBook, AWS, MongoDB, AntUI, and KoaJS a plus<p><br></p>Ideally, you have startup and/or FAANG experience<p><br></p>Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and creatively<p><br></p>Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work

Greetings Of The Day<p><br></p>Hope you are doing great.<p><br></p>Please find the requirement below, if you are comfortable send me your updated resume along with<p><br></p>Software Engineer<p><br></p>3 month contract<p><br></p>Hybrid in Livermore, CA (Bay Area) -LOCAL ONLY<p><br></p>Must be US Citizen<p><br></p><strong><u>Jd</u></strong><p><br></p>Looking for a contractor with extensive knowledge of the Advanced-TCA (ATCA) chassis experience. This is hybrid opportunity and meetings would be supported by Teams.<p><br></p>The engineer must have prior Red Hat Fedora experience to set up Linux drivers for a TFTP server.<p><br></p><ul><li>This role can be classified as a Software Engineer with expertise in Linux systems, Red Hat Fedora Linux, ATCA chassis, and</li></ul><p><br></p>TFTP server setup. The engineer will primarily be responsible for the following:<p><br></p><ul><li>Linux Software Experience (Red Hat Preferred): This role requires strong knowledge and experience in Linux software development, with a preference for Red Hat Fedora Linux. The engineer will be involved in setting up Linux drivers for various components of the system, ensuring compatibility, stability, and optimal performance.</li><li>ATCA Chassis Experience: ATCA (Advanced Telecom Computing Architecture) is a standard for telecommunications infrastructure equipment. Experience with ATCA chassis suggests that the engineer will be working with the hardware components specific to ATCA architecture. They may be responsible for configuring, deploying, and testing software systems on the ATCA blades.</li><li>TFTP Server Experience: The engineer will be responsible for setting up and configuring a TFTP server. This involves managing the file transfer protocols, ensuring reliable file transfers between network devices, and troubleshooting any issues related to the TFTP server.</li><li>In summary, this role requires a software engineer with expertise in Linux software development, specifically Red Hat Fedora Linux. They should have experience with ATCA chassis and setting up software systems for testing on the blades. Additionally, knowledge of TFTP server setup and configuration is necessary for efficient file transfers within the system.</li></ul>

jobs_titles: Machine Learning Engineer, Payments ML Accelerator
describtion: Who we are<p><br></p><strong>About Stripe</strong><p><br></p>Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.<p><br></p><strong>About The Team</strong><p><br></p>The newly formed Payments ML Accelerator team is developing capabilities that will unlock the proliferation of ML based techniques across Stripe’s payment products. We are developing cutting edge deep learning models tailored to Stripe’s payment data, and infrastructure to enable rapid ML exploration and very fast experiment cycles. We are exploring novel applications powered by ML as well as improving core product features such as detecting fraudulent transactions across all payment methods or optimizing payment acceptance rate.<p><br></p>What you'll do<p><br></p>As a machine learning engineer, you will design and build platforms and services that are configurable and scalable. You will have the opportunity to build and deploy advanced ML applications and generalizable feature engineering pipelines, with the aim to produce business impact and raise the bar for technical excellence. You will also have the opportunity to contribute to and influence ML architecture at Stripe.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Build shared Payments ML infrastructure such as a centralized Payments Feature Store</li><li>Build and deploy deep learning architectures and feature embeddings for Payment entities such as merchant, issuer, or customer</li><li>Design and architect generalizable ML workflows for rapid expansion of existing ML solutions</li><li>Experiment with advanced ML solutions in the industry and ideate on product applications</li><li>Collaborate with our machine learning infrastructure team to leverage new infra services for business solutions</li><li>Collaborate with data scientists to build ML models</li></ul><p><br></p>Who you are<p><br></p>We are looking for ML Engineers who are passionate about using ML to improve products and delight customers. You have experience developing streaming feature pipelines, building ML models, and deploying them to production, even if it involves making substantial changes to backend code. You are comfortable with ambiguity, love to take initiative, and have a bias towards action<p><br></p><strong>Minimum Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>At least 5 years of industry experience doing end-to-end ML development on a machine learning team and bringing ML models to production</li><li>Advanced degree in a quantitative field (e.g. computer science, statistics, physics, …)</li><li>Proficient in Python, Scala, Spark</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Knowledge about how to manipulate data to perform analysis, including querying data, defining metrics, or slicing and dicing data to evaluate a hypothesis.</li><li>Experience evaluating niche and upcoming ML solutions</li></ul>

jobs_titles: Sr System Analytics Engineer, Cell Manufacturing
describtion: <strong>What To Expect<br></strong>We are looking for an exceptional Systems Analytics Engineer who will focus on advanced diagnostics and data driven predictive analysis for cell manufacturing equipment. You will develop data analytics methods which will boost productivity metrics such as matching, yield and throughput. If needed, you will work with characterizing new sensors and lead their integration with process tools.<br><br><strong>What You’ll Do<br></strong><ul><li> Develop algorithms or use data analytics methods to optimize equipment throughput, yield or help with failure analysis</li><li> Define diagnostic tests and measurement conditions for tool health check with cross-functional teams</li><li> Use data driven approach to accelerate matching across the fleet of tools</li><li> Apply first principles thinking and scientific methodologies to screen and identify suitable sensors to improve the tool performance</li><li> Work hands-on with new sensors, test them on bench in order to understand operational space, identify risks and failure modes. Based on this analysis, scope out hardware and process operation window.</li><li> Install new sensors on tool and confirm that they meet functional and process requirements. If needed, develop algorithms to further improve the sensor performance.</li><li> You will work with a cross-functional team to test new algorithms or sensors, characterize their performance on equipment, and establish operational guidelines.<br><br></li></ul><strong>What You’ll Bring<br></strong><ul><li> MS or Ph.D in Mechanical Engineering, Chemical, Physics, Math or equivalent.</li><li> Capable of troubleshooting complex systems</li><li> Experience of working with data from various types of sensors (e.g., force sensors, load cells, thermocouples, accelerometers, etc.) and actuators (e.g., hydraulic, pneumatic, electrical, etc.).</li><li> Familiarity with C/C++, Python, or Matlab and data analysis libraries such as pandas, numpy, scikit-learn or equivalent</li><li> Proficiency with statistical analysis, design of experiments, data analysis software such as Excel, Mintab and/or JMP.</li><li> 3+ years of experience in manufacturing product development, process engineering or testing in energy, automotive, semiconductor, aerospace or related industries.</li><li> Excellent teamwork/interpersonal skills, willingness to gain and share new knowledge and the ability to communicate effectively.</li><li> Remain engaged, proactive and positive in tough circumstances. Own assignments and take full accountability for their success.</li><li> Positive attitude, eager to learn and ability to change direction quickly.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Benefits<br></strong>Along with competitive pay, as a full-time Tesla employee, you are eligible for the following benefits at day 1 of hire:<li> Aetna PPO and HSA plans &gt; 2 medical plan options with $0 payroll deduction</li><li> Family-building, fertility, adoption and surrogacy benefits</li><li> Dental (including orthodontic coverage) and vision plans, both have options with a $0 paycheck contribution</li><li> Company Paid (Health Savings Account) HSA Contribution when enrolled in the High Deductible Aetna medical plan with HSA</li><li> Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)</li><li> LGBTQ+ care concierge services</li><li> 401(k) with employer match, Employee Stock Purchase Plans, and other financial benefits</li><li> Company paid Basic Life, AD&amp;D, short-term and long-term disability insurance</li><li> Employee Assistance Program</li><li> Sick and Vacation time (Flex time for salary positions), and Paid Holidays</li><li> Back-up childcare and parenting support resources</li><li> Voluntary benefits to include: critical illness, hospital indemnity, accident insurance, theft &amp; legal services, and pet insurance</li><li> Weight Loss and Tobacco Cessation Programs</li><li> Tesla Babies program</li><li> Commuter benefits</li><li> Employee discounts and perks program<br><br></li>Expected Compensation<br><br>$88,000 - $276,000/annual salary + cash and stock awards + benefits<br><br>Pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements dependent on the position offered. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.<br><br>#MFG

describtion: Trendpop is looking for a Senior Data Infrastructure Engineer to help us reverse engineer the algorithms that power virality on social media. Trendpop Core, our large-scale data infrastructure platform, ingests millions of social media posts and processes multiple terabytes per day to surface valuable insights for our customers. This person will work closely with our CTO to build the next phase of Trendpop Core infrastructure to support additional data sources, scale to the next order of magnitude, and glean smarter insights using cutting edge machine learning techniques. This person should be excited to work in a tiny but effective engineering team at a fast-paced startup. They will be given broad autonomy to tackle the toughest infrastructure problems we face every day!

Tau is a venture-backed advanced technology company based in the Bay Area (Redwood City, CA). We design and develop next-generation products for electrification. The company was started because we believe the key to a more sustainable future requires modern power conversion systems to increase the security of the world's energy. We have pioneered technologies that leverage software-enabled hardware to provide industry leading scale, economics, and efficiencies. Our systems include innovations across electric machines, inverters, controllers, thermal management, simulation, and charging systems.<p><br></p>Tau's team of engineers, scientists, technologists, operators, and industry leaders continue to advance our internal technology roadmap while collaborating with commercial partners to deploy our existing products to market in the relentless pursuit of creating efficient power conversion systems for a more sustainable future.<p><br></p>At our core, Tau is made of exceptionally talented and mission-aligned people. Developing complex electromechanical systems is an interdisciplinary challenge. We are looking to expand our team with diverse engineering, scientific, and operational expertise.<p><br></p>Tau is an equal opportunity employer that guarantees a work environment that respects and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.<p><br></p><strong>About You</strong><p><br></p>We are looking for people who aren't afraid to take on new challenges, and are as passionate about energy and electrification as we are:<p><br></p><ul><li>You find large challenges exciting and enjoy discovering and defining problems as much as solving them. </li><li>You deliver. You may enjoy thoughtful conversations about problems and perfecting design, but in the end you know that what matters is delivering innovative, effective, and reliable solutions. </li><li>You are a cross disciplinary team member. You are excited to work with, learn from, and contribute to technology teams ranging from electromagnetics, power electronics, controls systems, mechanical, materials, software, computational physics, and beyond. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Prior experience in a relevant engineering field is valued, but the team has openings from early career to expert - candidates of all levels are encouraged to apply.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>We are looking for a <strong>Software Engineer - Data Scientist</strong> to join our growing team to both advance our internal technology roadmap and translate our innovative products to market with our commercial partners.<p><br></p>As a member of the controls team, you will model, design, implement, test and benchmark the motor controls of current and future Tau motor drives - including both high and low voltage applications.<p><br></p>What You'll Do<p><br></p><ul><li>Utilize large-scale data and help Tau engineers design and validate the most compelling and reliable products for our customers</li><li>Collect real-time life data from test and simulation systems including retrieving, analyzing and summarizing results to cross-functional teams</li><li>Provide support through the whole design cycle by building software and statistical tools that orchestrate all the reliability physics analyses</li><li>Answer complex questions on design parameters and behavior</li><li>Build scalable data pipelines to deploy fleet health monitoring models</li><li>Apply modern statistical frameworks to support the engineering team</li><li>Work closely with cross-functional teams to create/interpret/validate numeric models of products and systems</li><li>Build visualizations to effectively communicate results </li><li>Advance Tau's multiphysics simulation infrastructure including scientific computing pipelines, computational cluster, data storage and retrieval, etc</li></ul><p><br></p>What You'll Bring<p><br></p><ul><li>Strong MLOps and DevOps skills </li><li>Solid understanding of statistics, probability, and machine learning, and optimization concepts</li><li>Strong experience with Python and data manipulation tools including SQL, Pandas, Numpy, Scipy, Matplotlib, Scikit-learn, Jupyter Notebooks, etc</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Familiarity with big data and scientific computing frameworks</li><li>Familiar with software engineering best practices including API design, version control, CI/CD, etc</li><li>Ability to thrive in a fast-moving and constantly evolving high growth environment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Desired Skills</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>(Bonus) Ideal candidates with have a background in physics and engineering</li><li>Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, Mathematics, Physics or a related field</li><li>Experience training and maintaining models for real world applications</li><li>Strong knowledge of data structures and architectures</li><li>Experience with scalable machine learning and time-series modeling</li><li>Ability to code robust-apps (potentially interfacing with data streams, etc)</li><li>Comfortable in an environment with unstructured, incomplete, and ambiguous data</li><li>Curious, open-minded, and driven to solve complex problems</li></ul><p><br></p>The level will depend on the candidate's experience. Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches his or her work with vigor and determination. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate excellence in their respective fields, to possess the ability to learn quickly and to strive for perfection within a fast-paced environment.<p><br></p><strong>Perks</strong> <ul><li>Become part of an emerging company during a rapid growth phase—within an industry undergoing dramatic transformation for a global imperative. </li><li>Work with some of the smartest and most talented experts from different fields to: (1) attack some of the most pressing issues of today while (2) contributing to technically demanding and deeply innovative solutions. </li><li>Growth potential—we advance team members who have an outsized impact. </li><li>Competitive compensation based upon experience level, including stock options—we believe in capturing value in the future we create together. </li><li>Flexible time off and paid holidays. </li><li>Centrally located in the Bay Area on the Peninsula in vibrant downtown Redwood City</li><ul><li>Blocks from the Caltrain</li><li>Walking distance to food and entertainment</li><li>Easy access to both the 101 and 280</li></ul><li>Excellent medical, dental, vision, and life insurance for full time team members. </li><li>Comprehensive benefits including HSA and FSA benefits, commuter benefits, ancillary benefits including OneMedical membership, a variety of telehealth services, and more.</li></ul>

At Synack, we create technology that unleashes the best cybersecurity talent to secure our digital world.<p><br></p>We protect leading global organizations by reducing companies' security risk and increasing their resistance to cyber attack. How do we do this? By utilizing the world's best and most trusted team of ethical hackers who test through our powerful and controlled platform to deliver real security without compromise.<p><br></p>Backed by top-tier venture capital firms including Kleiner Perkins Caufield &amp; Byers, Microsoft, and Google Ventures, Synack's mission is to leverage global security talent coupled with advanced technology to help enterprises discover security vulnerabilities before they become business problems. Discover the possibilities at Synack!<p><br></p>We are looking for an experienced and innovative full-stack focused engineer to join our team. Your primary responsibility will be to build scalable web applications and data driven products. If you're ready to take on the challenge of building cutting edge software that will revolutionize the field of cybersecurity we want to hear from you! Sounds interesting? Keep reading…<p><br></p><strong>Here's What You'll Do</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design, develop, and maintain web applications and services in a full-stack environment</li><li>Responsible for designing, architecting, and delivering scalable, highly available services </li><li>Responsible for owning and ideating technical solutions for product requirements and user stories</li><li>Actively engaging and participating heavily in code and design reviews</li><li>Offer guidance and support to junior team members, encouraging and cultivating a culture of continuous learning within the team </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Here's What You'll Need</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years of experience in full-stack or frontend engineering</li><li>Strong experience with Ruby on Rails and/or Go. Front end development using frameworks like React. </li><li>Strong experience and understanding with service oriented architecture, service-to-service communications (gRPC), writing REST API's, unit testing, BDD testing, and architectural design</li><li>Experience with backend and frontend messaging solutions such as PubSub , Websockets</li><li>In depth knowledge of No-SQL and RDBMS technologies </li><li>Excellent project management skills with ability to accurately estimate development and testing efforts, identify tasks on the critical path, and assess risk in the overall project</li><li>Experience working on agile teams</li><li>Excellent communication and collaboration skills in all mediums</li><li>Experience working on and scaling a microservice-based application</li><li>A proven ability to thrive in a collaborative environment involving different stakeholders and subject matter experts</li><li>You are regarded as an expert in your field and act as a trusted advisor to your colleagues and leaders</li><li>You have a demonstrated expertise in constructing and upkeep systems that are both scalable and highly available. </li><li>Experience scaling highly available, mission-critical systems</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Nice to have</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Interest in security / penetration testing</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Ready to join us?</strong><p><br></p>Synack is committed to embracing diversity. Our people are our strength. Each addition to our team is an opportunity to grow and diversify our ideas, experiences, and viewpoints. We strive to be inclusive of Race, Ethnicity, Religion, Sex, LGBTQ+, Veterans, Disabilities, and Age. Synack welcomes you!<p><br></p>As a candidate, Synack cares about your privacy. Please view our candidate privacy policy here.<p><br></p><strong>($115,000 - $185,000 USD p/y)</strong> Salary is determined by a combination of factors including location, level, relevant experience, and skills. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. The compensation package for this position may also include equity, and benefits.<p><br></p>For more details about our benefits, please see here. Then for the Employer code, enter: <strong>synack</strong>

<ul><li>Develop highly performant and scalable backend services</li><li>Utilize Java/Spring technologies &amp; explore new tools to build a cohesive system</li><li>Genomics/bioinformatics, LIMS, predictive analytics, and ReactJS</li></ul><p><br></p>The Software Developer will initially report to the VP of Engineering and be part of a team responsible for the development of our services layer. You will help drive the architecture and implementation of a robust, highly performant, and scalable backend system. This is a hands-on position, providing the opportunity to build a NextGen DNA processing, analytics and reporting platform that long-term aims to integrate Machine Learning, as well as Blockchain technologies.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop highly performant and highly scalable backend services and data stores, specifically with regards to reporting and dashboards, alerts and notifications, as well as inventory management features. </li><li>Suggest, assess and translate system requirements into implementation designs and data models. </li><li>Utilize new technologies and tools, as needed, while helping to build a cohesive system. </li><li>Ensure comprehensive test coverage, effective performance and load tests, timely resolution of issues, and other actions to assure delivery of quality software. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Required Skills and Experience:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BS in Computer Sciences</li><li>3+ years of experience in a relevant software engineering position</li><li>In-depth experience building software using Java/Spring technologies</li><li>Experience building, optimizing, and scaling distributed analytical systems that handle large amounts of data</li><li>Experience utilizing Relational databases, ORM concepts, as well as NoSQL data stores</li><li>Proficient with API design and understanding of Microservices</li><li>Comfortable with Linux environments</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>MS in Computer Sciences</li><li>Experience building or using LIMS or related software</li><li>Predictive Analytics and Machine Learning</li><li>Web technologies (HTML/CSS/JavaScript and ReactJS)</li><li>Exposure to genomics or bioinformatics</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Keywords: </strong>Java, Spring, Scala, JavaScript, ReactJS, Reactive, Python, Kafka, Kinesis, Akka, Spark, GCP, Kubernetes, AWS, S3, MySQL, MongoDB, Cassandra, Redshift, BigQuery, MariaDB, Postgres, Redis, Hadoop, Analytics, Big Data, Lambda, LIMS, SQL, Caching Layer, Distributed Systems, Query Engine, Streaming Data, SOA, Microservices, REST, ActiveMQ, Clustering, Machine Learning, AI

<strong>What Gather Is Building And Why</strong><p><br></p>Gather lets you have all of your data at your fingertips, just like your photos, videos, texts and emails are today. Gather's app enables you to download your data from across the internet, create visualizations, and share your findings with others. Gather is building towards a future in which users take their rightful place in the center of the data ecosystem. Users will exert their influence not only over their own data, but also over entities that wish to operate on their data. Because of Gather, entire new generations of apps will emerge, consumers will never feel "locked into" a service/company, and users will gain a substantial share of the data economy.<p><br></p>Position overview: We’re looking for an entrepreneurial AI/ML engineer to lead Gather’s efforts to develop the definitive personal AI assistant - one that would combine the problem-solving skills of GPT with Gather's deep context about your life. This AI assistant could remind you of events from the past, get insights about the present and make decisions about the future! In this role, you will be expected to have a keen interest in artificial intelligence, machine learning, and staying current with the latest developments in a rapidly changing field. You will collaborate with a diverse team of software engineers, data scientists, and designers to apply AI to solve real-world problems and change the future for consumers.<p><br></p>You will:<p><br></p><ul><li> Keep up with the latest development in Generative AI (reading latest papers, be current on new developments and product trends)</li><li>&gt; Have exemplary technical research chops. Evaluate level of effort for use cases described above and deliver demos one use case at a time</li><li>&gt; Be a hands-on tinkerer, be willing to experiment with new technology and code. Push our thinking on state-of-the-art possibilities with AI and be able to brainstorm with CTO, CPO, CEO etc</li><li>&gt; Be creative and communicate effectively understand the full context of GATHER’s vision and potential use cases</li><li>&gt; Think strategically and like a product manager. Lead a small team to deliver a product to make the full bot/assistant launch successful -&gt; exhibit leadership and some management experience<br></li></ul><p><br></p>Relevant skills sets:<p><br></p>Bachelor’s degree or several years of experience in computer science, data science, software development, or another related field; a master’s degree is recommendedSolid understanding of common programming languages used in AI, such as Python, Java, C++, and Advanced knowledge of statistical and algorithmic models as well as of fundamental mathematical conceptsExperience working with large data sets and writing efficient code capable of processing large data streams at speedFamiliarity with deep learning and machine learning algorithms and the use of popular AI/ML frameworksExcellent communication skills<p><br></p>Gather summed up is big vision, major hustle, lots of laughter. When you step into our office, the energy is palpable, and we can't wait to add the next member of this team to the mix. Here are a few of the people you’ll be working with:<p><br></p>Sumit Agarwal - CEO &amp; youngest-ever Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense<p><br></p>Mengmeng Chen - CPO, previously built 3 successful zero-to-one products<p><br></p>Zan Doan - CTO, was the first engineer at Turing

describtion: <p><strong><u>Who We Are</u></strong></p><p>At Verkada, we’re rethinking what it means to be physically safe. Designed with simplicity in mind, we currently offer five product lines (video security cameras, access control, environmental sensors, alarms and visitor management), which provide seamless visibility through an integrated secure cloud-based software platform. Over 9,700+ organizations worldwide trust Verkada as their physical security layer for easier management, frictionless scalability and cutting-edge innovation. But this is just the beginning. We envision a world in which security systems feel as seamless and modern as the organizations they protect and our enterprise solution becomes a model for not just business security, but public security as well.</p><p>As a Senior Software Engineer on this team, you will help architect, design and develop projects targeted at making Verkada’s infrastructure the most reliable and cost efficient while scaling to millions of connected devices. Example projects include rolling out a service mesh or designing a cost efficient service ingesting and storing terabytes of video footage. You'll have the opportunity to lead cross-team efforts, mentor your team members and establish engineering best practices across the entire organization.</p><p><br></p><p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong></p><ul><li>Design and implement data analytics web UI to allow teams to visualize data and gain insights </li><li>Work cross-functionally to build data analytics solutions </li><li>Lead whole projects from design to implementation</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong></p><ul><li>5+ years of frontend related development experience</li><li>Deep understanding of JavaScript and CSS</li><li>Experience in data analytics and data visualization </li><li>Familiarity with REST APIs</li><li>Flexible and adaptive in a fast-paced startup environment</li><li>Passion for product quality and building systems to ship high quality products</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong><u>Nice To Have</u></strong></p><ul><li>Experience with distributed data processing systems such as Spark, Presto, etc. </li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong><u>Perks &amp; Benefits</u></strong></p><ul><li>Generous company paid medical, dental &amp; vision insurance coverage</li><li>Unlimited paid time off &amp; 11 companywide paid holidays</li><li>Wellness allowance</li><li>Commuter benefits</li><li>Healthy lunches and dinners provided daily</li><li>Generous paid parental leave policy &amp; fertility benefits</li></ul><p><br></p><p>Verkada is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to be a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure all people feel supported and connected at work. A big part of that effort is support for members and allies of our internal communities like Women at Verkada, Pride at Verkada, Multicultural at Verkada and Parents at Verkada.</p>

Position Summary...<p><br></p>What you'll do...<p><br></p><strong><u>About The Team</u></strong><p><br></p>The AdTech Quality Engineering team builds scalable testing solutions for the growing Marketing and Advertising organization. As a G1 company Walmart operates at a massive scale, pushing the limits of opens source and cloud solutions. We support teams by building stable foundation to drive toward success. If your passionate about testing and want to manage a team pushing the limits of scalability in open-source tooling this is the place to do it.<p><br></p>We are looking for an experienced QA Engineer with a strong background in front-end testing for consumer facing web applications. The ideal candidate will have the following experience and knowledge, but above all, must be PASSIONATE about being a part of the solution to deliver high-quality products.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You'll Do</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Lead/participate quality assurance testing for large-scale, eCommerce web applications, tools and/or software</li><li>Support continuous integration process improvement and innovation</li><li>Write test plans and test cases (automated)</li><li>Improve, optimize, and identify opportunities for improved software development lifecycle</li><li>Troubleshoot critical defects in software coding</li><li>Work closely with the Developers and Engineers to achieve a high level of code coverage</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You'll Bring</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>3-5+ years of experience developing and testing highly distributed, complex eCommerce Platforms</li><li>Hands-on programming, Automation Scripting, testing experience in JAVA, Selenium Web Driver</li><li>Extensive hands-on automation, some Manual testing</li><li>Experience with Agile Methodologies preferred</li><li>Proactive problem solving skills</li><li>Master / Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with Continuous Integration and related tools (Jenkins)</li><li>Experience with distributed source control systems such as Git</li><li>Experience testing software at API level</li><li>Tablet and mobile app testing experience desirable</li></ul><p><br></p>The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed in the role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The full Job Description can be made available as part of the hiring process.<p><br></p><strong><u>About Walmart</u></strong><p><br></p>At Walmart, we help people save money so they can live better. This mission serves as the foundation for every decision we make, from responsible sourcing to sustainability-and everything in between. As a Walmart associate, you will play an integral role in shaping the future of retail, tech, merchandising, finance and hundreds of other industries-all while affecting the lives of millions of customers all over the world. Here, your work makes an impact every day. What are you waiting for?<p><br></p><strong><u>Future Ways Of Working</u></strong><p><br></p>Our company's success can be attributed to our employees. While technology has allowed us to be effective while working remotely, there is no substitute for being in the office together; it helps to shape our culture, collaborate, innovate, build relationships, and move more quickly. We strive to provide flexibility in order to promote a healthy work-life balance but recognize that in-person interactions are important to our culture and shared success. We'll meet in person on a regular and purposeful basis.<p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>Beyond our great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.<p><br></p><strong><u>Equal Opportunity Employer</u></strong><p><br></p>Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer - By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions - while being inclusive of all people.<p><br></p>At Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based incentive awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. Other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more.<p><br></p>You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. It will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable. For information about PTO, see https://one.walmart.com/notices .<p><br></p>Live Better U is a Walmart-paid education benefit program for full-time and part-time associates in Walmart and Sam's Club facilities. Programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including English Language Learning and short-form certificates. Tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by Walmart.<p><br></p>Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms. For information about benefits and eligibility, see One.Walmart at https://bit.ly/3iOOb1J .<p><br></p>The annual salary range for this position is $120,000.00-$170,000.00<p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Compensation Includes Annual Or Quarterly Performance Incentives.</u></strong><p><br></p>Additional compensation for certain positions may also include:<p><br></p><ul><li> Regional Pay Zone (RPZ) (based on location)</li><li> Stock equity incentives</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications...</u></strong><p><br></p>Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. <strong>Principal Engineer - Data Platform (Remote - US /Canada based W2 position)</strong><p><br></p>You will be owning the entire data strategy and Data Platform of Freestar that interfaces with multiple products such as Pubfig, Prebid Server and Mediation Platform. Cloud dataflow, Cloud Composer, Bigquery, etc. You will be mentoring and leading a 6-8 member team and closely working with an engineering manager to deliver the data engineering technical roadmaps and supporting data system monitoring, cost optimization and performance.<p><br></p><strong>Pathway to Success</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Take the needs and challenges of the business requirements and formulate the technical roadmap and technology solution that will support their business strategies and goals.</li><li>Provide architectural recommendations, solution and approach given tradeoffs and
