batch, workflows, etc.)</li><li>Credentialize roadmap and architecture</li><li>Enhance Data Engineering capability through coaching, mentoring and leadership</li><li>Co-create and shape strategy and approach to engagements to achieve the desired business outcomes</li><li>Collaborate with cross departmental team in the org to learn and share best practices and techniques</li><li>Provide technical leadership in an enterprise environment to ensure delivery of exceptional technical solutions.</li><li>Mentor on approach and execution of solutions, coach on technologies and establishing a team-wide comprehension of solution capabilities and direction.</li><li>Ensure technical expectations of deliverables are met.</li><li>Maintaining strong expertise and knowledge of current and emerging technologies and products.</li><li>Qualifications *</li><li>You are equally happy coding as leading a team to implement a solution!</li><li>You have a track record of innovation and execution in Data Engineering</li><li>You have a deep understanding of data modeling and experience with data engineering and have built large-scale data pipelines and data-centric applications using Big Data tooling platforms such as Kafka, Pub/Sub, and Cloud Dataflow, Apache Airflow, Apache Beam, Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Kinesis, Redshift, S3 and/or HDFS, BigQuery, Dataprep, Composer, etc.</li><li>You have demonstrated experience designing and implementing complex data pipelines in a cloud environment such as GCP, AWS or Azure.</li><li>Hands-on experience with event streaming with modern event streaming tooling like Google Dataflow, Pub/Sub, Kafka, Kinesis, Glue, etc</li><li>Understanding of when streaming vs. batch processing is appropriate, and tradeoffs in a given context</li><li>Hands-on experience with MPP query engines like Presto, BigQuery, and Spark SQL.</li><li>You are comfortable applying data security strategy to solve business problems</li><li>You are able to contrast the use of managed services vs custom built ones</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>"Good to Have" experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience working with Google Cloud data products (CloudSQL, Spanner, Cloud Storage, Big Table, etc)</li><li>Experience with schema design, dimensional data modeling and data engineering concepts.</li><li>Experience with analytics stacks include Looker, Tableau, Redash, etc</li><li>Experience designing, building, and maintaining data processing systems</li><li>Previous background in the ad tech or media landscape (linear, digital, or social) is a plus</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You Can Expect In Return</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Full-Time, Salaried Position</li><li>Working remotely</li><li>Generous Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits</li><li>401K with company match, vested immediately</li></ul><p><br></p>The opportunity to be part of something high value, high impact, and high growth...Who doesn't love that!<p><br></p>Freestar is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.

At Coactive AI, we are empowering data practitioners and data-driven teams to unlock insights in unstructured image and video data. This visual data increasingly captures everyday life from our online experiences on e-commerce sites and social media to guiding the cars we drive and monitoring the plants we eat. This year, unstructured visual data accounts for more than 82% of all internet traffic. This metric is up from 75% in 2017. We make this unstructured visual data useful by bringing it into the world of SQL and the big data tools that teams already love.<p><br></p>Coactive was founded by experts who shaped the fields of high-performance deep learning and data-centric AI. We have the scars from building and working with the first generation of modern machine learning systems at Google, Meta (formerly Facebook), Pinterest, eBay, Lyft, and other leading organizations. Through our decades of experience, we have developed a playbook to democratize the toughest parts of machine learning systems; no PhD required.<p><br></p>As a software engineer, you will work coactively with the best in ML and data systems, building the foundation for understanding unstructured image and video data.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You’ll Do</u></strong><p><br></p>Build production-grade data systems that you’ll be proud of<p><br></p>Tackle challenging problems at the intersection of machine learning and systems<p><br></p>Collaborate with a world-class team of engineers, researchers, and scientists<p><br></p>Shape engineering best practices and company culture as we grow<p><br></p><strong><u>What We Look For</u></strong><p><br></p>BS (or higher) in Computer Science or related fields, or equivalent experience.<p><br></p>3+ years of production-level experience in one of: Python, Java, C++, or similar language<p><br></p>Experience developing data intensive systems that power critical business processes<p><br></p>Experience working on enterprise software or cloud native platforms.<p><br></p>Experience with security and systems that handle sensitive data<p><br></p>Equally comfortable working on a white-board, pair programming, or presenting to small groups<p><br></p>Good knowledge of SQL<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Can Expect From Us</u></strong><p><br></p>100% medical, dental &amp; vision coverage for you<p><br></p>Medical, dental &amp; vision partially covered for your dependents<p><br></p>401K<p><br></p>Unlimited PTO<p><br></p>An allowance to set up workstations however you want<p><br></p>A supportive environment. We build products, but we develop people.<p><br></p>Social events ranging from happy hours and hiking to board game nights and games of Mario Kart.<p><br></p>We embrace and celebrate the diversity of our employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, national origin, gender, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or parental status, disability, veteran status, or other class protected by applicable law. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.<p><br></p>We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

The worldwide data management software market is massive (IDC forecasts it to be $138 billion by 2026!). At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading modern data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.<p><br></p>Atlas Search is a growing cloud service that allows users to execute complex search queries using the MongoDB Query Language. Our users are free to focus on relevance and data retrieval instead of the machinery needed to search data at scale.<p><br></p>Our team is building a cloud-based distributed systems software responsible for the core components of search including: data ingestion, performance, query language and execution, and aggregation. Our product is being adopted quickly and there are many interesting projects you can help with.<p><br></p>This role is based in the San Francisco area.<p><br></p>Ideally you will be:<p><br></p><ul><li>Proficient in modern programming languages and techniques </li><li>Eager to impact and envision the technological future of a complex system </li><li>Experienced in developing distributed systems, cloud services and SaaS products </li><li>Experienced in designing and maintaining search platforms or distributed databases is preferred but not required </li><li>Experienced in debugging and profiling multithreaded JVM applications is preferred but not required </li></ul><p><br></p>You would get to:<p><br></p><ul><li>Build and design our integrated search platform, written in Java </li><li>Contribute to two leading open source platforms, MongoDB and Lucene </li><li>Participate in product and design discussions </li><li>Perform code reviews with peers and make recommendations on how to improve our code and software development processes </li><li>Collaborate with other teams including cloud services, database, enterprise tools, drivers and support to coordinate changes or contribute to their projects </li></ul><p><br></p>Success Measures:<p><br></p><ul><li>In 3 months, you'll contribute to the improvement of our core "mongoT" repository </li><li>In 6 months, you'll be working on features such as query features or platform improvements </li><li>In 12 months, you'll be building POCs, designing new features, and collaborating with other teams from across the company on complex projects </li></ul><p><br></p>To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!<p><br></p>MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.<p><br></p>MongoDB, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and makes all hiring decisions without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Founded in Silicon Valley in 2009 by Marc Andreessen and Ben Horowitz, Andreessen Horowitz (known as "a16z") is a venture capital firm that backs bold entrepreneurs building the future through technology. We are stage agnostic: We invest in seed to venture to late-stage technology companies, across bio + healthcare, consumer, crypto, enterprise, fintech, games, and companies building toward American dynamism. a16z has $35B in assets under management across multiple funds.<p><br></p>We’ve established a team that is defined by respect for the entrepreneur and the company-building process; we know what it’s like to be in the founder’s shoes. We’ve invested in companies like Affirm, Airbnb, Coinbase, Databricks, Devoted Health, EQRx, Figma, GitHub, Instacart, OpenSea, Roblox, Stripe, and Substack. Our team is at the forefront of new technology, helping founders and their companies impact and change the world.<p><br></p>The Role<p><br></p>You will join a fully-functional team of autonomous, senior ICs developing internal software tools for the firm’s investing and operations teams. You should be an experienced, detail-oriented, and focused software engineer with an enthusiasm for building feature-rich, data-driven applications. Your primary responsibilities will involve the identification, acquisition, and normalization of alternative data sources for use in our products. You will be required to design and implement performant backend systems that operate securely and at scale.<p><br></p>The BUILD software team operates in the mode of an internal startup. We own a tight feedback loop with our users and take on requests from all corners of the firm. This is a high-visibility role that requires a clear architectural vision, the desire to code, exacting communication skills, and the ability to engage and educate our firm on the technology we are developing and shipping.<p><br></p><strong><u>To Join Our Team, You Should Be Excited To</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Understand and optimize the workflows of teams across the firm</li><li>Contribute directly to ideation and implementation of new software products for our investing and operational teams</li><li>Ship new and unique technology quickly and often, engage our users, and continuously iterate on our products</li><li>Operate autonomously, advocate for yourself, and own the team’s success</li><li>Write elegant, principled logic that is both powerful and easy to understand</li><li>Bring positive energy in every interaction with the team and foster inclusive collaboration</li><li>Engage with the latest academic research and tooling</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ yrs. professional software engineering experience</li><li>Familiarity with cloud infrastructure deployments on GCP, AWS, and/or Azure</li><li>Experience with production SQL and NoSQL (ideally Elasticsearch) database management</li><li>Professional development of containerized services and use of container orchestration systems, ideally Kubernetes</li><li>Deep knowledge of Python3 – or another backend language and willingness to learn</li><li>Experience in rapid iteration and consistent excellence in process, ideally at a successful early-stage startup or as a senior IC at a larger company</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills and mathematical intuition</li><li>Bonus: excited about advances in LLM space, ideally already using them or trying them out</li></ul><p><br></p>The anticipated salary range for this role is between $172,000-$201,000, actual starting pay may vary based on a range of factors which can include experience, skills, and scope.<p><br></p>This role is eligible to participate in the a16z carry program and various discretionary bonus programs as well as benefit and perquisite plans including health, dental, vision, disability, life insurance, 401K plan, vacation, and sick leave.<p><br></p><strong>a16z culture </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>We do only first class business and only in a first class way</li><li>We take a long view of relationships, because we are in the relationship business </li><li>We believe in the future and bet the firm that way</li><li>We are all different, we recognize that, and we win</li><li>We celebrate the good times</li><li>We do it for the team</li><li>We play to win</li></ul><p><br></p>At a16z we are always looking to hire the absolute best talent and recognize that diversity in our experiences and backgrounds is what makes us stronger. We hire candidates of any race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital or family status, disability, Veteran status, and any other status. These differences are what enables us to work towards the future we envision for ourselves, our portfolio companies, and the World.<p><br></p>Our organization participates in E-Verify. <strong>Who is Recruiting from Scratch: </strong><p><br></p>Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.<p><br></p><strong> From Our Client </strong><p><br></p>Location: New York / Remote<p><br></p>Job Type: Full-time<p><br></p>Experience: 3+ years<p><br></p><strong>About The Role</strong><p><br></p>Our mission is to increase the number of financially independent people. We believe we can achieve this goal by building tools that enable independent business owners to scale their businesses profitably. Our first product combines a virtual credit card system with dynamic spending limits and software tooling to help merchants grow and optimize their profitability. We are growing very fast -- in less than five months, we grew to millions in card volume. We have a significant waitlist of customers waiting to use our product. We are looking to expand our headcount quickly to support the demand. Our investors include Solomon Hykes (founder of Docker), Paul Buchheit (founder of Gmail), Paul Graham (founder of Y Combinator), Robert Leshner (founder of compound.finance), and many more. We have raised over $30M from top-tier fintech investors.<p><br></p><strong>What You'll Be Working On</strong><p><br></p>You'll be involved in projects of varying scope and complexity:<p><br></p><ul><li> Build credit risk models that segment merchants based on their revenue and spend patterns to offer dynamic credit limits that change with business performance given the high seasonality and fast pace of ecommerce </li><li> Use machine learning tools to build realtime credit underwriting models leveraging alternative and traditional data sources </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You'll Need</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Passion for, or curiosity to learn, financial technology </li><li> Track record of high-quality shipping products and features at scale </li><li> Ability to turn business and product ideas into engineering solutions </li><li> Desire to work in a fast-paced environment, continuously grow and master your craft </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We’d Like To See</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Experience with building out data pipelines (e.g. should know data lakes, data warehouses, ETL, etc.) </li><li> Experience working with data analytics, algorithmic decision making, and real-time data systems </li><li> Experience with different business requirements on data freshness and retention </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> PLUSES </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Proven experience and subject matter expertise in e-commerce payments (nice to have) or financial services. </li><li> Has worked with bank account data (e.g. worked with Plaid), payments data (perhaps Stripe), and/or other fintech data sources </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Why you should join us: </strong><p><br></p>Our mission is to increase the number of financially independent people. We believe we can achieve this goal by building tools that enable independent business owners to scale their businesses profitably. Our first product combines a virtual credit card system with dynamic spending limits and software tooling to help merchants grow and optimize their profitability. We are growing very fast -- in less than five months, we have grown to millions in card volume.<p><br></p>We have a significant waitlist of customers waiting to use our product. We are looking to expand our headcount quickly to support the demand. Our investors include Solomon Hykes (founder of Docker), Paul Buchheit (founder of Gmail), Paul Graham (founder of Y Combinator), Robert Leshner (founder of compound.finance), and many more. We recently closed a financing round of $5M from a top-tier fintech investor.<p><br></p><strong> Salary Range: $150,000-$250,000 base.</strong>

<strong>About Anyscale<br><br></strong>At Anyscale , we're on a mission to democratize distributed computing and make it accessible to software developers of all skill levels. We’re commercializing Ray , a popular open-source project that's creating an ecosystem of libraries for scalable machine learning. Companies like OpenAI , Uber , Spotify , Instacart , Cruise , and many more, have Ray in their tech stacks to accelerate the progress of AI applications out into the real world.<br><br>With Anyscale, we’re building the best place to run Ray, so that any developer or data scientist can scale an ML application from their laptop to the cluster without needing to be a distributed systems expert.<br><br>Proud to be backed by $250+ million from top-tier investors like Andreessen Horowitz, NEA, and Addition .<br><br>Anyscale is based in San Francisco, CA. Employees are required to come in office 3x a week.<br><br><strong>About The Role<br><br></strong>We're looking for passionate, motivated people who are excited to build infrastructure and tooling for next generation machine learning applications. We're hiring exceptional Software Engineers for the distributed training team at Anyscale, which is responsible for building and maintaining open source machine learning libraries widely adopted across the industry.<br><br>We are particularly looking for Senior or staff and above candidates who can help cast and execute on a vision for the future of machine learning training infrastructure. We are open to both Individual Contributors and people who are primarily technical but have prior experience managing a small team.<br><br><strong>About The Distributed Training Team<br><br></strong>The team's mission is to make it really easy to do distributed machine learning on Ray and Anyscale. Specifically, our team maintains and develops features for a broad number of libraries — including Ray Train (distributed deep learning), Ray Tune (distributed hyperparameter tuning), and XGBoost-on-Ray.<br><br>Our team is the most user-facing engineering team on the open source side, collaborating with ML engineering teams at organizations like Shopify, Uber, and Bytedance.<br><br><strong>As Part Of This Role, You Will<br><br></strong><ul><li>Build performant, scalable, fault-tolerant distributed machine learning libraries that power the next generation of machine learning platforms around the world</li><li>Work on difficult architectural problems and turn them into reality </li><li>Work with a team of leading experts in the areas of distributed systems and machine learning</li><li>Work with engineering managers and product managers to lead and grow an extremely talented team of software engineers</li><li>Work closely with open source community (with ML researchers, ML engineers, data scientists) to scope and build new abstractions for scalable machine learning</li><li>You like to work closely with end users and iterate on the product with them</li><li>Help us build and shape a world-class company<br><br></li></ul><strong>We'd Love To Hear From You If You Have<br><br></strong><ul><li>5+ years of building, scaling and maintaining software systems in production environments</li><li>Solid fundamentals in algorithms, data structures, system design</li><li>Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries (PyTorch, Tensorflow)</li><li>Experience designing fault-tolerant distributed systems</li><li>Strong architectural skills<br><br></li></ul><strong>Bonus points!<br><br></strong><ul><li>Experience working with a cloud technology stack (AWS, GCP, Kubernetes)</li><li>Experience building machine learning training pipelines or inference services in a production setting</li><li>Experience with managing and maintaining open source machine learning libraries</li><li>Experience managing small teams in pursuit of an ambitious technical goal</li><li>Experience using Ray<br><br></li></ul><strong>Compensation<br><br></strong><ul><li>At Anyscale, we take a market-based approach to compensation. We are data-driven, transparent, and consistent. The target salary for this role is $170,112 ~ $237,000. As the market data changes over time, the target salary for this role may be adjusted.<br><br></li></ul>This role is also eligible to participate in Anyscale's Equity and Benefits offerings, including the following:<br><br><ul><li>Stock Options</li><li>Healthcare plans, with premiums covered by Anyscale at 99%</li><li>401k Retirement Plan</li><li>Wellness stipend</li><li>Education stipend</li><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Flexible Time Off</li><li>Commute reimbursement</li><li>100% of in office meals covered<br><br></li></ul><em>Anyscale Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Candidates are evaluated without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, disability, national origin, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal or state law.</em> <em><strong>Anyscale Inc. is an E-Verify company and you may review the </strong></em> <em><strong>Notice of E-Verify Participation</strong></em> <em><strong> and the </strong></em> <em><strong>Right to Work posters in English and Spanish</strong></em>

<strong><u>Required</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Complete Root Cause Analysis with supporting analysis &amp; documentation </li><li> Fault Tree analysis modeling Inform of which subsystems/components are influencing the reliability of the product</li><li> Identify TPP (Technical Performance Measure INCOSE Terminology, to detail path to achieve technical measures with project direction)</li><li> Identify feasible alternatives with team Not limited to singular solution space, but rather inform a system level view that can leverage other projects to improve on product if different architectures are explored.</li><li> Develop mathematical models to detail TPP burndown plans</li><li> Complete a Trade study and resolve with team the path to achieving the TPPs</li><li> ID risks with proposed trade space, to include working with PMO to communicate ROI</li><li> Knowledgeable of IBM Tools (DOORS, IBM Requirements Management DOORS Next) </li><li> Python Development of feasibility engineering tools to inform of design/process improvements </li><li> MATLAB Development of NPSW tools for engineering assessment of root cause</li><li> C++ : Read SW code to determine if desired process/procedures match engineering intent </li><li> UML/SYSML knowledge is a plus</li></ul>

At FreeWire, we fundamentally change the way businesses and utilities electrify. We build battery-based energy storage systems that provide clean and quiet power anywhere it’s needed, reducing the cost and accelerating deployment of electric vehicle charging infrastructure. FreeWire’s solutions are evolving from providing ultrafast EV charging services to a full suite of energy services to accelerate sustainable electrification and provide resiliency to customers and a distributed power source to utilities. FreeWire has secured major strategic investors from Fortune 100 companies and serves leading corporate, utility, and retail customers. The feedback on the Boost Charger, FreeWire’s DC fast charger, has been overwhelmingly positive as we electrify locations that would have been too expensive to power on using conventional charging solutions. Utilities are releasing RFPs with requests for battery backed solutions, their regulatory teams are including our technology as eligible for incentives, and they are seeking cost effective solutions as they electrify their fleets and provide utility owned charging solutions for the public.<p><br></p>FreeWire has deployed battery-integrated chargers with Fortune 100 companies, commercial customers, fleets, retail locations, and gas stations. In addition to its partnership with bp pulse, FreeWire and am/pm, a bp subsidiary and convenience store chain with over 1,000 locations, have already deployed multiple public charging stations in the U.S. FreeWire’s regulatory affairs and policy team keeps customers up to date on federal, state, and utility incentive opportunities, which in some cases cover up to 80% of the cost of the charging station, and the company recently announced that the Boost Charger is Buy America compliant. Learn more at www.freewiretech.com and follow us @FreeWireTech.<p><br></p><strong>Sr. Software Engineer – Java </strong><p><br></p><strong>Newark, CA / Longmont, CO / Boston, CA</strong><p><br></p>The Software Platform Team at FreeWire is looking for exceptional Java developers to help us build a world-class software platform. In this role, you will have the opportunity to design, implement and deploy business-critical services in Java.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You'll Do</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design, implement and deploy business-critical enterprise-grade Java services.</li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and translate them into technical solutions.</li><li>Write clean, engineering goals however you see fit (e.g. coaching, mentoring, new initiatives, etc.)</li><li>Have fun.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Extensive experience in software development with a strong focus on Java.</li><li>Proficiency in designing and developing large-scale, high-performance applications using Java, Spring framework, and related technologies.</li><li>In-depth understanding of software engineering principles, design patterns, and best practices.</li><li>Experience with modern software development methodologies such as Agile or Scrum.</li><li>Solid knowledge of databases, SQL, and ORM frameworks.</li><li>Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to propose innovative solutions to complex technical challenges.</li><li>Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.</li><li>All other duties as assigned.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.</li><li>Strong proficiency in Java.</li><li>Proven experience as a software engineer, with a focus on platform development, distributed systems, and data storage at scale.</li><li>Solid understanding of distributed systems, microservices architecture, and cloud platforms (preferably AWS).</li><li>Experience with developing and maintaining observability capabilities.</li><li>Familiarity with infrastructure-as-code tools (e.g., Terraform, CloudFormation) and configuration management tools (e.g., Ansible, Chef).</li><li>Knowledge of database systems, both SQL and NoSQL, and their integration with platform components.</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex technical challenges.</li><li>Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to learn new technologies quickly and adapt to a fast-paced, evolving development environment.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>FreeWire Offers Competitive Benefits, Including</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Health, Dental &amp; Vision Insurance</li><li>Short- &amp; Long-Term Disability Insurance</li><li>Life Insurance</li><li>Unlimited PTO</li><li>Dog Friendly</li></ul><p><br></p><em>We provide compensation packages that include base pay, benefits and equity, and it is not typical for someone to be hired at the top end of range for the role. describtion: Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: <strong>Mountain View, CA, USA; Kirkland, WA, USA; San Diego, CA, USA</strong>.<strong>Minimum qualifications:<br><br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience. </li><li>5 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, and with data structures/algorithms. </li><li>3 years of experience testing, maintaining and/or launching software products, and 1 year of experience with software design and architecture. </li><li>3 years of experience with ML/AI algorithms and tools, deep learning and/or natural language processing.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred qualifications:<br><br></strong><ul><li>Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical field. </li><li>1 year of experience in a technical leadership role. Experience developing accessible technologies.<br><br></li></ul><strong><u>About The Job<br><br></u></strong>Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. This includes bringing together the best of Google’s artificial intelligence, software, and hardware to build global smartphones and create transformative experiences for users across the world.<br><br>The US base salary range for this full-time position is $157,000-$235,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

This position is responsible for the design, specifications, coding, testing, implementation, maintenance, documentation, debugging, and troubleshooting of data warehouse solutions. Its work includes analyzing source system data, designing dimensional data models, developing ETLs, and creating data visualization products such as reports and dashboards. The position plays a critical role in requirement gathering, project plan planning, technical architecture design, go-live implementation, and ongoing system support. In addition to these duties, the position is required to perform any other tasks assigned to support the department’s function.<p><br></p>A data engineer is responsible for designing, developing, testing, documenting, and maintaining data warehouse and analytics architecture to meet UCSF’s data and analytics needs.<p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborate with business and technology partners to gather business requirements and create architectural designs.</li><li>Use business domain knowledge to profile data and determine the best approaches to extract data into data warehouses.</li><li>Contribute to the development and creation of a new data APeX Warehouse for the hematology team, including the sickle cell, thalassemia, bone marrow transplant, etc. teams</li><li>Apply the Kimball dimensional data modeling technique to build and enhance the enterprise data warehouse.</li><li>Design, develop, test, document, and support new and existing ETL processes using Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), Microsoft Azure Data Factory, IBM InfoSphere DataStage, or other tools.</li><li>Demonstrate proficiency in SQL programming and performance tuning.</li><li>Develop business healthcare, education, research, finance, or business administration.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>To see the salary range for this position (we recommend that you make a note of the job code and use Experienced in creating database objects and applying security.</li><li>Demonstrate effective communication and interpersonal skills. Demonstrate ability to communicate technical information to technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organization.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Epic Clarity or Caboodle certification</li><li>Understanding of advanced statistical analytics, machine learning, and data science principles.</li><li>Experience cloud computing and technologies.</li><li>Experience in an Agile working environment is desired.</li><li>Experience in one programming language such as Python, R, Java, C++, C+, etc.</li><li>Advanced knowledge of secure software development</li><li>Highly advanced skills associated with software specification, design, modification, implementation, and deployment of large-scale scope.</li><li>Excellent project leadership and management skills.</li><li>Able to resolve and improve performance issues. Experience in working with other technical and business teams to carry out system performance tuning.</li><li>Experience with clinical and healthcare administration data</li><li>Experience with healthcare, education, research, financial, or business administrative data.</li><li>Experience with the Epic electronic health record databases including Clarity and Caboodle.</li><li>Knowledge of Epic data and workflows and know how to use these data effectively in data modeling, reporting, and analytics.</li><li>Experience with the data and business processes in ERP, CRM, business administration, tertiary education, and research proposals/grants is a plus.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About UCSF</u></strong><p><br></p>The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. <strong>About Applied</strong><p><br></p>Autonomy is one of the leading technological advances of this century that will come to impact our lives. The work you'll do at Applied will meaningfully accelerate the efforts of the top autonomy teams in the world. At Applied, you will have a unique perspective on the development of cutting-edge technology while working with major players across the industry and the globe.<p><br></p>Applied Intuition provides software solutions to safely develop, test, and deploy autonomous vehicles at scale. The company's suite of simulation, validation, and drive log management software enables development teams to create thousands of scenarios in minutes, run simulations at scale, and verify and validate algorithms for production deployment. Headquartered in Silicon Valley with offices in Detroit, Washington, D.C., Munich, Stockholm, Seoul, and Tokyo, Applied consists of software, robotics, and automotive experts with experiences from top global companies. Leading autonomy programs and 17 of the top 20 global OEMs use Applied's solutions to bring autonomy to market faster.<p><br></p><strong>About The Role</strong><p><br></p>(We are hiring for all levels of experience.)<p><br></p>We are looking for bright software engineers interested in extending and adapting our products for Applied's global customers. Our Application Software Engineers have a unique mix of software expertise, domain knowledge, and an execution-driven mindset. Using these skills, our engineers work closely with autonomy developers to ensure that Applied's products are providing maximum impact to advance customers autonomy initiatives. This is an important role for the company, bringing together our product and engineering expertise with our customer-centric culture.<p><br></p>Check out what a typical day would look like as an Application Software Engineer here!<p><br></p><strong>At Applied, you will:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Work closely with customers to understand their development needs and use cases for autonomy to propose effective use of Applied's products</li><li>Collaborate with engineering teams to ensure the product roadmap enables current and prospective customers</li><li>Ensure customer needs are supported by the broader engineering team through effective prioritization </li><li>Collaborate with our sales team to gather requirements through detailed technical discussions and workshops </li><li>Explore new product development areas driven by strategic understanding of the customer landscape</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>We're looking for someone who has:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with interacting with end-customers as an application engineer or a developer</li><li>Familiarity with best practices in large scale software development</li><li>Strong communication skills and focus on solving customer problems</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Nice to have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Prior background in technical sales or application engineering for simulation products</li><li>Experience with automotive OEMs or suppliers</li><li>Prior work in autonomous vehicle development domains</li><li>Prior work in software simulation</li></ul><p><br></p>The salary range for this position is $65,000 USD to $400,000 USD annually. This salary range is an estimate, and the actual salary may vary based on the Company's compensation practices.<p><br></p><em>Don't meet every single requirement? If you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.</em><p><br></p><em>Applicants will be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 upon commencing employment. Reasonable accommodations will be considered on a case-by-case basis for exemptions to this requirement in accordance with applicable federal and state law. Applicants should be aware that for external-facing roles that involve close contact with Company employees or other third parties on the Company's premises, accommodations that involve remaining unvaccinated against COVID-19 may not be deemed reasonable. The Company will engage in the interactive process on an individualized basis taking into account the particular position.</em><p><br></p><em>Applied Intuition is an equal opportunity employer and federal contractor or subcontractor. Consequently, the parties agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) and 41 CFR 60-741.5(a) and that these laws are incorporated herein by reference. These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans<br><br>or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin. These regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disability. The parties also agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of Executive Order 13496 (29 CFR Part 471, Appendix A to Subpart A), relating to the notice of employee rights under federal labor laws.</em>

JetInsight's best-in-class quoting and fleet management software helps aircraft charter operators run and grow safer, more efficient, and more profitable businesses. We work with hundreds of operators across the US and are building the world's largest network of on-demand aircraft.<p><br></p>We're looking for a full stack Software Engineer to join our growing engineering team. You'll work on all areas of the JetInsight product and help solve challenging problems involving route optimization, dynamic pricing, real-time flight data, and others that will have a major impact on our rapidly growing network of operators.<p><br></p><strong>Your responsibilities will include:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Architecting scalable solutions for new products and major product enhancements</li><li>Independently shipping production-quality code with an eye towards usability, performance, and extensibility</li><li>Maintaining customer empathy and a customer-focused engineering mindset</li><li>Building and maintaining automated testing on your contributions to the product</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>You resonate with the following skills, traits, and experience:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>2+ years of proven success as a Software Engineer in a technology company working on a web-based product</li><li>Raw intelligence in engineering, with a track record of high performance and results</li><li>A history of shipping production-quality software</li><li>Self-motivation and an attitude that gets things done</li><li>A desire to learn and immerse yourself in a new industry to truly understand the customer</li><li>Strong ability to communicate and collaborate in teams</li><li>Specific language experience is not required, but experience with Rails, React, and/or PostgreSQL is a plus</li></ul>

Lead Bank is a chartered banking-as-a-service platform for builders and innovators. Despite broader economic headwinds, the continued proliferation of fintech companies and a 20x increase in fintech investment ($20.5 billion in 2020) signals that the market’s interest in embedding financial services products into their offerings is resilient and sustainable. Whether it’s a travel company that wants to offer credit for an expensive trip, a social network that wants to enable in-feed shopping solutions, or an ecommerce platform that wants to provide client rewards cards, the broader tech ecosystem has enjoyed a step-change in the sophistication, variety and complexity of client-facing products they can offer. This means that the underlying infrastructure powering those fintechs needs to evolve to meet these modern demands.<p><br></p>While fintech companies continue pushing boundaries, they have largely accepted that directly integrating with banks is costly, time-consuming and operationally burdensome. This frustration comes in many forms: gaps in technical acumen, product scalability, client risk appetite, and company culture. These gaps clearly illustrate the need for a new paradigm in banking technology.<p><br></p>Lead Bank is bridging those gaps. We see a massive opportunity for a tech-savvy developer-focused bank to augment a sophisticated financial services platform with the compliance, regulatory, capital markets, and legal expertise required to help our clients succeed. Come join us on our journey.<p><br></p>What we offer<p><br></p><ul><li>At Lead, we design our benefits to support company culture and principles, to foster an efficient and inspiring work environment, and to create the conditions for our team to give their best in both work and life</li><li>Competitive compensation, including opportunities for equity grants and cash bonus, based on experience, geographic location, and role</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, 401k Matching, and other wellness benefits, including FSA, HSA and HRA</li><li>Paid parental leave</li><li>Flexible vacation policy, including PTO and paid holidays</li><li>A fun and challenging team environment in a dynamic industry with ample opportunities for career growth<br><br></li></ul>Basic Qualifications<p><br></p><ul><li>You are passionate about changing the banking system to meet the needs of a digital economy</li><li>You bring 2+ years of production experience, core fundamentals, and a strong command of at least one language (preference for Java and/or GO)</li><li>Have passion for building scalable and performant RESTful API’s</li><li>Experience building with AWS technologies and services</li><li>Hands-on coding: Develop and maintain a high quality code base, consistently delivering challenging, stable, and maintainable projects on schedule</li><li>Ability to collaborate/compromise to get to the best, most efficient outcome</li><li>Strong communication skills and the ability to work cross-functionally to align stakeholders on the goals and deliverables</li><li>You are curious, have humility and are open to learning </li><li>Familiarity with relational databases<br><br></li></ul>Preferred Qualifications<p><br></p><ul><li>Fintech experience is a plus</li><li>Ability to perform in a fluid environment with high autonomy<br><br></li></ul>*Lead Bank is proud to have an inclusive culture committed to ensuring equal employment opportunity in all employment decisions regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, military status, veteran status or any other legally protected status.<p><br></p><ul><li>Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions</li><li>Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records</li><li>Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $125,000 year in our lowest geographic market up to $170,000 year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience</li><li>Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. Pay is based on a number of factors and may vary depending on geographical market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. These ranges may be modified in the future<br></li></ul><p><br></p>Zone 1: $125,000 - $170,000 (SF/Bay Area, NYC, Seattle, LA)<p><br></p>Zone 2: $105,000 - $150,000 (Austin, Boston, Chicago, Denver, San Diego, DC)<p><br></p>Zone 3: $100,000 - $162,000 (Other US Metros)

describtion: <strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Synergistic IT is a full-service staffing and placement firm servicing client in America for the past 12+ years. We are dedicated towards fulfilling the IT needs of our clients. From staffing to full implementation of projects we provide the highest quality IT Services. We Intend to deliver exceptional student outcome. We don't just help you secure a tech job but build a solid career in technology.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Managing master data, including creation, updates, and deletion.</li><li>Managing users and user roles</li><li>Assessing tests and implementing new or upgraded software and assisting with strategic decisions on new systems.</li><li>Generating reports from single or multiple systems.</li><li>Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports</li><li>Evaluating changes and updates to source production systems.</li><li>Training end-users on new reports and dashboards.</li><li>Providing technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Skill Required</strong>-<p><br></p><ul><li>Data Visualization.</li><li>Data Cleaning.</li><li>MATLAB.</li><li>R.</li><li>Python.</li><li>SQL and NoSQL.</li><li>Machine Learning.</li><li>Linear Algebra and Calculus.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education Requirement: -</strong><p><br></p>Bachelors, Masters in Computer Science/ Computer Engineering/ Information Systems/Information Technology/ Electrical Engineering/ Mechanical Engineering.<p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>On Job Technical support</li><li>E- verified</li><li>Help to get H1b Employer</li><li>Full time position </li></ul><p><br></p>Candidate who are missing the required skills, might be provided an option to enhance their skills, so that they can also apply for the role and can make a career in IT industry.<p><br></p>If you do respond via e-mail, please include a daytime phone number so that we can reach you. In considering candidates, time is of the essence, so please respond ASAP. Thank you

jobs_titles: Senior Software Engineer - Distributed Data Systems
describtion: At Databricks, we are passionate about enabling data teams to solve the world's toughest problems — from making the next mode of transportation a reality to accelerating the development of medical breakthroughs. We do this by building and running the world's best data and AI infrastructure platform so our customers can use deep data insights to improve their business. Founded by engineers — and customer obsessed — we leap at every opportunity to solve technical challenges, from designing next-gen UI/UX for interfacing with data to scaling our services and infrastructure across millions of virtual machines. And we're only getting started.<p><br></p>Modern data analysis employs sophisticated methods such as machine learning that go well beyond the roll-up and drill-down capabilities of traditional SQL query engines. As a software engineer on the Runtime team at Databricks, you will be building the next generation distributed data storage and processing systems that can outperform specialized SQL query engines in relational query performance, yet provide the expressiveness and programming abstractions to support diverse workloads ranging from ETL to data science.<p><br></p><strong> Below Are Some Example Projects </strong><p><br></p><strong>Apache Spark</strong>: Develop the de facto open source standard framework for big data.<p><br></p><strong>Data Plane Storage</strong>: Provide reliable and high performance services and client libraries for storing and accessing humongous amount of data on cloud storage backends, e.g., AWS S3, Azure Blob Store.<p><br></p><strong>Delta Lake</strong>: A storage management system that combines the scale and cost-efficiency of data lakes, the performance and reliability of a data warehouse, and the low latency of streaming. Its higher level abstractions and guarantees, including ACID transactions and time travel, drastically simplify the complexity of real-world data engineering architecture.<p><br></p><strong>Delta Pipelines</strong>: It's difficult to manage even a single data engineering pipeline. The goal of the Delta Pipelines project is to make it simple and possible to orchestrate and operate tens of thousands of data pipelines. It provides a higher level abstraction for expressing data pipelines and enables customers to deploy, test &amp; upgrade pipelines and eliminate operational burdens for managing and building high quality data pipelines.<p><br></p><strong>Performance Engineering</strong>: Build the next generation query optimizer and execution engine that's fast, tuning free, scalable, and robust.<p><br></p><strong> What We Look For </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BS (or higher) in Computer Science, related technical field or equivalent practical experience.</li><li>Comfortable working towards a multi-year vision with incremental deliverables.</li><li>Motivated by delivering customer value and impact.</li><li>5+ years of production level experience in either Java, Scala or C++.</li><li>Strong foundation in algorithms and data structures and their real-world use cases.</li><li>Experience with distributed systems, databases, and big data systems (Spark, Hadoop).</li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Benefits </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Comprehensive health coverage including medical, dental, and vision</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Equity awards</li><li>Flexible time off</li><li>Paid parental leave</li><li>Family Planning</li><li>Gym reimbursement</li><li>Annual personal development fund</li><li>Work headphones reimbursement</li><li>Employee Assistance Program (EAP)</li><li>Business travel accident insurance</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement</strong><p><br></p>As a federal government contractor, Databricks requires new U.S. employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Proof of vaccination will be required as a condition of employment. Databricks will make reasonable accommodations based on medical conditions or religious grounds for qualified candidates in accordance with applicable law.<p><br></p><strong>Pay Range Transparency</strong><p><br></p>Databricks is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The pay range(s) for this role is listed below and represents base salary range for non-commissionable roles or on-target earnings for commissionable roles. Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to job-related skills, depth of experience, relevant certifications and training, and specific work location. Based on the factors above, Databricks utilizes the full width of the range. The total compensation package for this position may also include eligibility for annual performance bonus, equity, and the benefits listed above. For more information regarding which range your location is in visit our page here.<p><br></p>Local Pay Range<p><br></p>$166,000—$225,000 USD<p><br></p><strong> About Databricks </strong><p><br></p>Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 9,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Lakehouse Platform to unify their data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe. Founded by the original creators of Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow, Databricks is on a mission to help data teams solve the world’s toughest problems. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.<p><br></p><strong>Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion</strong><p><br></p>At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.<p><br></p><strong>Compliance</strong><p><br></p><strong>If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.</strong>

At Nuna, our mission is to make high-quality healthcare affordable and accessible for everyone. We are dedicated to tackling one of our nation’s biggest problems with ingenuity, creativity, and a keen moral compass.<p><br></p>Nuna is committed to simple principles: a rigorous understanding of data, modern technology, and most importantly, compassion and care for our fellow human. We want to know what really works, what doesn't—and why.<p><br></p>Nuna partners with healthcare payers, including government agencies and health plans, to turn data into learnings and information into meaning.<p><br></p><strong>YOUR TEAM </strong><p><br></p>We build technology to enable users (from data scientists to analysts to policy-makers) to understand healthcare data while ensuring its integrity, security, and privacy. Our work runs the gamut from joining streams of messy real-world data to building queryable data warehouses to constructing visualizations and dashboards that provide actionable insight. We build systems that are auditable, automated, an accurate representation of the underlying data, and, most importantly, responsive to our end users' needs. We strive for a creative, collaborative engineering environment that implements best practices of peer review, readability, maintainability, and security of the code base and infrastructure.<p><br></p>The Nuna Data Platform team is responsible for building the pipeline, tooling, and processing to power our apps. We work closely with our Health Data Engineering and Health Data Analyst teams to combine engineering excellence with healthcare knowledge to accommodate our customer’s diverse data.<p><br></p><strong>YOUR OPPORTUNITIES</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Build products that change the dynamics and incentives of the healthcare industry, changing a zero-sum game of competition between payers and providers into patient-centered collaboration</li><li>Build interactive features including predictive analytics and dynamic modeling for our customers to gain insight into ways to improve</li><li>Build the engine that will enable data scientists to build, iterate, and deploy analytics as code</li><li>Manage our high stakes production environment, ensuring high availability/low latency and protecting our sensitive data with rigorous security</li><li>Identify big opportunities to improve our technology and our products, blazing trails through ambiguity</li><li>Mentor more junior engineers and, in turn, learn from more senior engineers, because we are learners, not knowers, and growing Nuna’s people is the most reliable way to scale our impact</li><li>Work as part of a team, not in a silo - at Nuna, we rise by lifting others!</li></ul> <strong>REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience building production-hardened data pipelines, with consideration for performance, scalability, reliability, and repeatability</li><li>Familiarity with orchestration tools like Airflow or Prefect</li><li>Experience with rules-based engines that lets internal and external users define business logic in a controlled fashion</li><li>Experience rapidly prototyping new product concepts, especially for enterprise clients</li><li>Understanding of data testing concepts and the ability to consistently apply them.</li><li>Knowledge of database fundamentals like indexing and SQL queries</li><li>Experience managing production services and designing smooth deployment processes, ideally in AWS</li></ul> <strong>TECHNOLOGIES USED AT NUNA</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Python, Scala, SQL, testing tools (e.g. pytest), build tools (Bazel, poetry) </li><li> Spark, Prefect, JupyterHub, k8s </li><li> Linux, OS X </li><li> AWS ECS, RDS, IAM, Lambda; Hashicorp Terraform and Vault </li></ul><p><br></p>We take into account an individual’s qualifications, skillset, and experience in determining final salary. This role is eligible for health insurance, life insurance, retirement benefits, participation in the company’s equity program, paid time off, including vacation and sick leave. The expected salary range for this position is $165,000 to $230,000. The actual offer will be at the company’s sole discretion and determined by relevant business considerations, including the final candidate’s qualifications, years of experience, and skillset.<p><br></p>Nuna is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics and/or veteran status.
industry: IT Services and IT Consulting,Hospitals and Health Care

jobs_titles: Software Engineer, Full Stack - AI Team (US-Remote)
describtion: Transcend believes everyone should be in control of their personal information. We’re pioneering Data Privacy Infrastructure—a powerful technology that lets individuals reclaim control of their data and ensures companies can easily comply with global data privacy laws.<p><br></p>Our platform enables companies like Robinhood, Brex, and Clubhouse to provide users with control over their information.<p><br></p>From uncovering new data systems and schema, to capturing and enforcing user opt-outs, to globally deleting and exporting a person's data across your stack, Transcend is built to scale every privacy workflow to complete automation. In fact, each month, Transcend executes millions of global user deletions and governs billions of tracking events across thousands of data systems.<p><br></p>We allow these users to request, identify, and delete their personal information from a growing suite of integrated companies: from Salesforce to Slack, Facebook, Zendesk, Intercom, Databases, and beyond.<p><br></p>Please note that we are a remote-first company, and ALL our positions are remote.<p><br></p>This position is for US only.<p><br></p>———<p><br></p>As an Software Engineer in the AI Team, you will be responsible for developing and improving our AI-related products. You will work on projects that interact with large language models, and machine learning models.<p><br></p>What You'll Do<p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborate with the product team to develop and implement tools that interact with Large Language Models</li><li>Develop and maintain a scalable and reliable infrastructure for the newly developed projects that will interact with large language models</li><li>Work on prototyping and updating the product based on feedback from customers and internal stakeholders</li><li>Proactively fix production and development issues</li><li>Optimize our deployment pipeline and our testing strategy</li><li>Work on improving the performance of existing products<br><br></li></ul>Who You Are<p><br></p><ul><li>You have around 3 or more years of experience in software development</li><li>You know how to ship production-ready code and develop rapid prototypes. You should know what tests to write, what to log, what metrics to capture, what alerts to set up</li><li>You're effective at tackling large, somewhat open-ended problems. We're a small team, and not every problem will have a fully spec-ed out solution for you to implement. Spec-gathering, writing design docs, validating potential solutions with teammates, and decomposing work are all part of the job</li><li>You’re able to identify trade-offs and take them into consideration when making decisions (e.g, speediness vs tech debt vs cutting scope). You can articulate which factors have higher priority depending on the context</li><li>You are effective at async and online methods of communication. Our team is entirely distributed, so the ability to clearly and thoughtfully communicate despite the space and time barriers is very important</li><li>You have experience with unit testing and integration testing. We use mocha for unit testing and a mix of Cypress and playwright for E2E testing</li><li>You know when to ask for help. We want you to succeed, but you have to let us know how to best do that! We don't want you to be stuck debugging something for hours, especially if it's something very particular to our codebase. If something is unclear, make sure to ask your mentor or manager for clarification!</li><li>You have experience with client-side and backend JavaScript as well as typed languages (ideally TypeScript)<br><br></li></ul>Bonus Points<p><br></p><ul><li>Amazon Web Services (e.g. Lambda, DynamoDB)</li><li>RDBMS (PostgreSQL)</li><li>Sequelize knowledge</li><li>GraphQL</li><li>Experience with python</li><li>Experience with productionizing ML models or experience working with LLMs<br><br></li></ul>Why joins us?<p><br></p>The people at Transcend are driven, kind and know how to balance work, life and memes. We learn from each other and have a strong support system.<p><br></p>You’re joining a fast growing start up, with opportunities to help define and grow the engineering team.<p><br></p>We have a strong mission to protect user privacy rights everywhere. The privacy compliance landscape is growing, and we are at the forefront of building solutions that protect user privacy rights with modern infrastructure and automation.<p><br></p>You will have autonomy and trust to drive initiatives from the start.<p><br></p>We believe that turning the principles of data privacy into exercisable human rights is one of the most high-impact ways we can spend our time, and so we're building an ambitious team that’s passionate about solving important problems and having fun while doing it.<p><br></p>As the best-in-class solution in a new market, Transcend is a fast-paced and exciting workplace. The product evolves quickly to meet new client needs and adapts to the rapidly advancing world of privacy law. As one of Transcend’s earliest hires, you’ll get to work on a wide array of exciting projects.<p><br></p>Transcend is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity, inclusion and belonging. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will consider for employment all qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in a manner consistent with applicable law.<p><br></p>Our comprehensive compensation package plays a big part in how we recognize you for the impact you have on our path to bringing data rights to everyone.<p><br></p>For this role, the estimated annual salary range is between $120,000 USD/year - $160,000 USD/year. The actual annual salary will vary based on various factors, including market and individual qualifications objectively assessed during the interview process.<p><br></p>The listed range above is a guideline, and the annual salary range for this role may be modified. Transcend offers attractive perks in addition to cash compensation.
industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage

describtion: We are looking for an experienced machine learning engineer to join us. We have a close-knit team and unusually challenging work to do! We have a growing need for machine learning ranging from NLP to to computer vision. Delightfully solving users' travel planning needs is a big problem with almost every type of technical challenge.<p><br></p>We value being a top-notch engineering organization, and have the same high standards with our code and people. We value learning and growth (and you not getting bored) so we invest regular time in pushing ourselves. For example, every other Friday is Foo Friday - open time for you to spend time becoming a better engineer. Whether that be a new technology you want to learn, an online class you want to take, or a fun side project you want to work on, how you spend these Fridays is up to you!<p><br></p>Our stack is built primarily with Python but our philosophy is to use the best tool for the job so we're not opposed to using different languages. You would be responsible for helping architect, develop, and integrate machine learning into our product.<p><br></p>We hire diverse, well-rounded, communicative people whom we can envision being friends with and trusting. Our projects tend to be 1-2 engineers maximum, so trust and accountability is required for us to work. Trust also helps us keep processes &amp; overhead to a minimum. So far, we've built a reasonably-sized, high-powered team and are always striving to be the best place to work we can be.<p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent</li><li>Familiarity with core machine learning techniques and patterns</li><li>Experience using machine learning in a production environment</li><li>You're curious, humble, and able to learn</li><li>Exceptionally strong communication &amp; interpersonal skills: you like and value people</li><li>You're a winner - you deeply care about being the best and producing the best, have an extremely high sense of accountability, and love huge challenges</li></ul><strong>Bonus Points</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with Python</li><li>Startup experience</li><li>Contribute to open source</li><li>Functional programming experience</li></ul>

<strong>Why you should join Channel99?</strong><p><br></p>Channel99 ("C99") is pioneering the next generation of B2B marketing technology. Delivered in a subscription model, the solutions will replace today's do-it-yourself spreadsheets and other ad hoc systems to allow CMO's and CFO's to better benchmark thousands of vendors on the same KPI's, and then compare their results to industry averages in a uniform manner. The company's Founder &amp; CEO is Chris Golec who created the ABM technology category and has 20 years experience in the marketing technology space. Chris has already secured significant venture funding and is planning to launch C99's its first product in October.<p><br></p>Candidates for this position should have a passion for innovation, building a world-class culture, and making a long lasting impact on an ever evolving B2B industry where $100 billion is spent every year on marketing with very little financial control. The company is open to discussing various hybrid and remote arrangements in a U.S. location.<p><br></p><strong>What you'll be doing:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Write code in Python, Scala and Clojure</li><li>Collaborating with Solution Architects, DevOps Engineers, and Data Scientists in implementing complex end-to-end solutions. </li><li>Providing technical leadership and actively participating in building scalable data architectures that will ingest, store, process, and organize the data critical for supporting analytics of near real-time data streams and historical data. </li><li>Design, develop and deploy big data processing applications: Spark, Elasticsearch and SQL&amp; NoSQL</li><li>Maintain security and data privacy</li><li>High-speed querying like Snowflake</li><li>Web-Application's integration with products (Web &amp; Mobile)</li><li>Growth with C99 and influence the future</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What we're looking for:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Exceptional communicator (verbal and written) and exhibit excellent organizational and presentation skills</li><li>Excellent at problem solving and analytical skills with attention to detail and quality; Who We Are<br><br>Aurora (Nasdaq: AUR) is delivering the benefits of self-driving technology safely, quickly, and broadly to make transportation safer, increasingly accessible, and more reliable and efficient than ever before. The Aurora Driver is a self-driving system designed to operate multiple vehicle types, from freight-hauling semi-trucks to ride-hailing passenger vehicles, and underpins Aurora Horizon and Aurora Connect, its driver-as-a-service products for trucking and ride-hailing. Aurora is working with industry leaders across the transportation ecosystem, including Toyota, FedEx, Volvo Trucks, PACCAR, Uber, Uber Freight, U.S. Xpress, Werner, Covenant, Schneider, and Ryder. For Aurora’s latest news, visit aurora.tech and @aurora_inno on Twitter.<br><br>Aurora hires talented people with diverse backgrounds who are ready to help build a transportation ecosystem that will make our roads safer, get crucial goods where they need to go, and make mobility more efficient and accessible for all. We’re searching for a <strong>Senior Machine Learning Engineer (Simulation)</strong>.<br><br>Our Simulation ML and Data Science team is responsible for developing data-driven approaches to advance development and validation of the Aurora Driver. We build technology that helps make the most use of our on-road data by improving signals from simulation tests and creating variations that challenge the Aurora Driver’s capabilities. We help establish offline testing as a trusted and efficient complement to on-road driving.<br><br>While interviewing, you will be expected to intelligently reason about data-driven approaches to leverage offline simulation in the verification and validation of autonomous driving. Your role will interface with Product, Autonomy Development, Systems and Safety Engineering teams and will drive mission-critical decisions in a multi-trillion dollar industry.<br><br><strong>In this role, you will<br></strong><ul><li>Developing new actor models and/or performance metrics to serve our use cases</li><li>Support our model development workflow, such as data collection, processing and other infrastructure.</li><li>Meet with partners in autonomy and validation teams to understand their use case and constraints that will inform our projects and technical approach.</li><li>Work with our sibling team in Core Simulation to add any core functionality required to support our actor models</li><li>Develop tooling for any necessary visualization or extraction of insights from developing and running our models. </li><li>Support your team with code reviews and ideas as part of a collaborative environment.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Required Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>BS (3yrs+), MS (1yr+ with exceptions for strong candidates) or PhD in a robotics/AV/ML related area</li><li>CV/ML model building experience (data preparation, training, evaluation)</li><li>Robotics-related domain knowledge (need not be AV-specific. eg. general controls, manipulation, CV etc. would be fine)</li><li>Must have working knowledge of either C++ or Python, as a minimum requirement <br></li></ul><strong><u>Desired Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>Experience with simulation, perception or motion planning for autonomous vehicles.</li><li>Knowledge of Pytorch or other ML frameworks </li><li>Experience deploying ML models in production environments </li><li>Publications in top-tier conferences (not workshops).<br></li></ul>The base salary range for this position is $168K-$210K per year. Aurora’s pay ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range, the successful candidate’s starting base pay will be determined based on factors including job-related skills, experience, qualifications, relevant education or training, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future. The successful candidate will also be eligible for an annual bonus, equity compensation, and benefits.<br><br>#Mid-Senior<br><br>Working at Aurora<br><br>At Aurora, we bring together extraordinarily talented and experienced people united by the strength of our values. We operate with integrity, set outrageous goals, and build a culture where we win together — all without any jerks.<br><br>We have offices in several locations across the United States, where we encourage team and cross-functional collaboration. Aurora offers competitive medical, dental, and vision benefits, and additional healthcare support including medical transportation reimbursement, fertility, adoption, and surrogacy benefits. GRAIL is a healthcare company whose mission is to detect cancer early, when it can be cured. GRAIL is focused on alleviating the global burden of cancer by developing pioneering technology to detect and identify multiple deadly cancer types early. The company is using the power of next-generation sequencing, population-scale clinical studies, and state-of-the-art computer science and data science to enhance the scientific understanding of cancer biology, and to develop its multi-cancer early detection blood test. GRAIL is headquartered in Menlo Park, CA with locations in Washington, D.C., North Carolina, and the United Kingdom. GRAIL, LLC is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Illumina, Inc. (NASDAQ:ILMN). For more information, please visit www.grail.com .<p><br></p>Are you passionate about unlocking the value of data to make an impact on the lives of patients? If so, join us in Software Engineering at GRAIL! We are looking for a Staff Cloud / Data Engineer to join our growing team to build out a data platform in support of GRAIL’s commercial products and research activities.<p><br></p><strong>You Will:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Be part of a highly collaborative team that focuses on delivering value to our internal partners by providing secure access to data</li><li>Work cross-functionally to translate business needs into efficient, scalable, and easy to maintain data engineering solutions</li><li>Prototype, implement, scale, and maintain our cloud data platform as we continue to bring in new data sources</li><li>Develop batch and streaming data extraction pipelines</li><li>Contribute to the design and execution of a data governance framework</li><li>Grow together with the team as we meet the next set of business needs and technical challenges</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Your Background Should Include:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>B.S. / M.S. in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Computational Biology) with at least 8 years of related industry experience, or Ph.D. with at least 3 years of related industry experience</li><li>Experience in architecting and delivering secure, scalable cloud-based data warehouses and data lakes on AWS, Azure, or GCP</li><li>Advanced knowledge in data warehousing architecture and concepts (ETL and ELT) and data modeling</li><li>Experience with relational databases, query authoring, and performance tuning</li><li>Solid object-oriented and/or functional programming experience</li><li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferences Highly Considered:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with AWS and data
