describtion: <strong><u>About EveryDay Labs<br><br></u></strong>EveryDay Labs improves student outcomes through the power of behavioral science. How? We partner with school districts across the country to reduce absenteeism. By providing comparative and actionable data to schools and families, through our advanced behavioral science and data analytics, chronic absenteeism is reduced 10-15%.<br><br>We are passionate about making an impact on the lives of students, families, and educators.<br><br><strong>How Can You Help?<br><br></strong><strong><u>As a Software Engineer At EveryDay Labs, You Will<br><br></u></strong>Hey there! We’re still a small team (4 software engineers and 4 data engineers) and we’ve got big projects on our roadmap with a steadily growing client base. Rather than push projects further into the future, we’re hoping to bring in someone (maybe you!) to help take a share of our roadmap and help us “keep the lights on” for our current products. But, we know that every job description says something like this, so let’s get down to the details we’re guessing you care most about below:<br><ul><li>Write clean, extensible, well-tested code</li><li>Collaborate on architecture, design and implementation decisions</li><li>Engage internal stakeholders to determine requirements for new software</li><li>Participate in code reviews</li><li> Help our non-technical, delivery teams by building tools and automating manual processes</li><li>As a founding member, help us keep our engineering culture fresh and robust by being yourself and introducing us to new ideas. We’re excited for how your unique strengths will push us to grow and be better!<br></li></ul><strong>What Are We Looking For?<br></strong><ul><li>Java and Python expertise (heads up: our homework assignment during the interview process is in Java)</li><li>SQL proficiency (we use PostgreSQL)</li><li>UNIX command line tool knowledge/comfort</li><li>Git or a similar version control systems knowledge/comfort</li><li>Strong creative problem solving/troubleshooting skills</li><li>Collaborative and flexible; willing to teach and be taught</li><li>Passion for mission-driven work</li><li> We are a remote-only team, although candidates must be fully, legally eligible to work in the United States (visa sponsorship is not available)<br></li></ul>Nice to Also Have<br><ul><li>Passion for education</li><li>AWS or similar cloud computing platforms proficiency</li><li>Basic, web development concepts (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc.) knowledge</li><li>Modern web frameworks such as React familiarity</li><li>Systems administration and microservices knowledge</li><li>Docker or similar, container development tools proficiency</li><li>Startup experience<br></li></ul><strong><u>More About EveryDay Labs<br><br></u></strong>Our customers include 3 of the largest school districts in the US and many others. We are committed to iterating on our products, refining our processes, and embracing and cultivating change.<br><br>To date, we have served students across more than 2,000 schools, preventing more than 1,000,000 absences, equating to over 180 million minutes of instructional time they would have otherwise missed.<br><br>EveryDay Labs is an Equal Opportunity Employer – including disability/vet status. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.<br><br>We are actively seeking to build a team and workplace that reflect the diversity of the communities we serve. We especially encourage people underrepresented in the tech industry to apply, and welcome your application even if you do not meet every one of the above requirements.

Role<strong>: R&amp;D Software Engineer II<br><br></strong>Location: <strong>Sunnyvale, CA 94085<br><br></strong>Duration: <strong>9 Months on W2<br><br></strong>Shift Timings: <strong>9 AM to 5 PM<br><br></strong><strong>Job Description:-<br></strong><ul><li>Experience with any Object-Oriented Programming like Java or C#, scripting, multi-threading,</li><li>formal software development methodologies, and source code management.</li><li>Experience on one or more of the major cloud platforms, such as Azure, Google Cloud, and AWS</li><li>Working knowledge of cloud computing technology, familiar with Docker, Kubernetes, and other cloud platforms/tools.</li><li>Working knowledge of Linux and Windows operating systems</li><li>Ability to work in a highly matrixed and geographically diverse business environment.</li><li>Ability to work within a team and as an individual contributor in a fast-paced, changing environment.</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication with the ability to effectively communicate at multiple levels in the organization.</li><li>Multitasks prioritizes and meets deadlines in a timely manner.</li><li>Strong organizational and follow-up skills, as well as attention to detail.</li><li>Ability to maintain regular and predictable attendance<br></li></ul><strong>Education &amp; Experience:-<br></strong><ul><li>Master's Degree preferred</li><li>Strong in Core Java/object-oriented programming principles, multithreaded applications,</li><li>Design Patterns, and their practical implementation.</li><li>Design and implement software using core Java (J2SE application coding as well as GUI development using SWING).</li><li>Experience with unit- testing.</li></ul>

Parade is the leader in providing capacity management tools to freight brokers and 3PLs. Our technology platform revolutionizes the digital landscape for our customers with the vision of becoming the Bloomberg Terminal for Trucking, an $800B industry. Our platform has already been recognized by Inc. Magazine, Business Insider, and FreightTech 100... and we're just getting started!<p><br></p>Staff Software Engineer (Full-Stack)<p><br></p>Parade is looking for world-class software engineers to join our small, but growing engineering team. We are looking for anyone that loves building, designing, and solving hard problems. If you have a passion for software and love getting things done, Parade is for you. As a software engineer, you will own independent features all the way from technical design to launch. We are looking for people who can bring their architecture, implementation, and communication skills and build products from top-to-bottom.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Architect, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable code for new product releases while working with a small team of engineers. </li><li>Work closely with our product and design teams to transform user requirements into technical specifications. </li><li>Contribute to all phases of the development lifecycle, from concept to deployment and beyond. </li><li>Troubleshoot, debug, and upgrade existing systems to ensure optimal performance and user experience. </li><li>Provide leadership and technical mentorship to other engineers, fostering an environment of continuous learning and improvement. This includes conducting code reviews, sharing industry best practices, and guiding team members in their professional development and problem-solving efforts. </li><li>Write comprehensive and robust tests to ensure code quality and functionality. </li><li>Collaborate effectively within a small team environment, communicating technical issues clearly and effectively. </li><li>Keep up-to-date with the latest industry trends and technologies to keep our applications at the cutting edge. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Basic Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or a related field, or equivalent work experience. </li><li>Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in software development with a focus on full stack applications and backend technologies. </li><li>Proven experience with Python, Django, React, TypeScript, and NextJS. </li><li>Ability to work well in a small team-oriented environment, with strong communication and collaboration skills. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Strong problem-solving skills with a knack for tackling complex development challenges. </li><li>Experience with version control systems such as Git. </li><li>Familiarity with continuous integration and deployment. </li><li>Experience with containerization technologies like Docker, Kubernetes. </li><li>Experience with cloud platforms, preferably Google Cloud. </li></ul><p><br></p>Perks<p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive salary and compensation/equity package</li><li>Unlimited Paid Time Off</li><li>100% Remote </li><li>Company Offsites to get to know your teammates</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation</strong><p><br></p>The expected compensation for this role is between $150,000-$250,000 for work performed in the United States. Starting pay for the successful applicant will depend on a variety of job-related factors, which may include experience level, transferrable skills, education, location, business needs, training, and market demands. This range may be modified in the future.<p><br></p>Parade is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive, positive, professional, and respectful environment for all our employees.

optimize our intelligent systems that improve Meta’s products and experiences</li><li>Effectively communicate complex features and systems in detail while advocating for higher product quality and engineering efficiency</li><li>Assist in goal setting related to project impact, AI system design, and ML excellence</li><li>Develop custom/novel architectures, define use cases, and develop methodology &amp; collaborate with organizational leaders to help improve the level of performance of the team &amp; organization</li></ul><p><br></p>Minimum Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>Vast experience communicating and working across functions to drive solutions</li><li>Experience in driving large cross-functional/industry-wide engineering efforts</li><li>Proven track record of planning multi-year roadmap in which shorter-term projects ladder to the long term-vision</li><li>Experience leading projects with industry-wide impact</li><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience.</li><li>Significant experience in mentoring/influencing senior engineers across organizations</li><li>Specialized experience in one or more of the following machine learning/deep learning domains: ML systems: AI infrastructure, machine learning accelerators, high performance computing, machine learning compilers, GPU architecture, machine learning frameworks, on-device optimization</li><li>Experience developing AI algorithms or AI-System infrastructure in C/C++ or Python</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with distributed systems or on-device algorithm development</li></ul><p><br></p>Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Padlet is building software for a good education. A good education is one that inspires curiosity, creativity, and community. Our software enables that through visual content creation and collaboration in millions of classrooms worldwide.<br><br>Exceptional products are exceptional in all dimensions that matter. Take the Dyson vacuum cleaner. Not only is it a good at vacuuming, it’s beautiful, feels good in the hand, is portable, and is easy to use. We are looking for Fullstack Engineers to build exceptional software products for a billion people.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Owning and implementing new features that touch multiple layers of the tech stack. E.g. creating a beautiful search experience. </li><li>Creating delight. E.g. through animations and micro UI. </li><li>Making the web apps faster and more reliable. E.g. reducing javascript payload or making network requests more resilient. </li><li>Improving how we work. E.g. improving our component library or tools we use to translate the web app into 40+ languages. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>At some point in your life, someone has told you: “you write good code.”</li><li>You know how to copy-paste code from Stack Overflow. </li><li>Bonus: you have a good sense of humor. <br><br></li></ul><strong>About Padlet<br></strong><ul><li>Vision: Every child in the world will grow up with Mickey Mouse and Padlet. </li><li>Product: We are making the default way of collecting and sharing thoughts on the Internet. People love the product. </li><li>Impact: We have over 50 million active users making Padlet one of the most used apps on the planet. Our goal is to be THE the most used app on the planet. </li><li>Money: We are venture backed AND profitable. We are built to last one hundred years. </li><li>Badassery: We are 36 people (plus a baby crane that we've adopted but it doesn't really do much). That's over a million active users per employee. Some badass people work here. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Tech stack<br></strong><ul><li>Web: VueJS, Tailwind. </li><li>Backend: Ruby (Rails), Typescript, Elixir (Phoenix), and Python. </li><li>Storage: Postgres, Redis, Elasticsearch, Firestore, and Snowflake. </li><li>Mobile apps: React Native (with Swift and Java where necessary.)<br><br></li></ul><strong>Joys of engineering at Padlet<br></strong><ul><li>We have very few meetings. We value keeping you in flow. </li><li>A lot of people use Padlet. We have to solve interesting scale and concurrency problems. </li><li>Our users are in over 200 countries, using all kinds of devices and connections, and speaking over 40 languages. We have to solve interesting internationalization problems. </li><li>We like to craft delightful user experiences. They’re satisfying to build. </li><li>We try to solve problems creatively instead of just throwing money at them. We are engineers! We thrive in constraints, not in the absence of them. </li><li>We ship often. </li><li>We value beautiful code. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Sorrows of engineering at Padlet<br></strong><ul><li>We grew pretty fast last year and our processes are still catching up. E.g. we don't have 100% code coverage yet. Our deployment process isn't as painless as it could be. This sometimes leads to spending time on things that aren't the most fun. We’re working on it!</li><li>Our project management process could be better. This sometimes leads to re-speccing in the middle of development, getting in the way of programming flow. We’re working on it!<br><br></li></ul><strong>Some people you'd work with<br></strong><ul><li>Josh Hewitt: insists that wallabies and kangaroos are different animals, artificially inflating the biodiversity of his homeland. Is excellent at surgically improving an existing, complicated system. </li><li>Colin Teahan: lives for one-liners. E.g: Colleague: “Wouldn’t it be funny if Iron Man were anemic?” Teahan: “It would be IRONIC.” Single-handedly wrote early versions of our iOS and Android apps. <br><br></li></ul><strong>The office<br></strong><ul><li>Our office is in the middle of Presidio, a beautiful national park. We’re 5 minutes from the beach, a walk we take often. The WiFi works outdoors. You can work sitting in a lawn overlooking the Golden Gate Bridge. </li><li>The office itself is designed to be a space for all your interests and hobbies. We have a meditation room, game room, library, podcasting studio, art studio, kids room, and full makerspace with 3d printers, presses, laser cutters, sewing machines, and more. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Benefits<br></strong><ul><li>Top tier medical, dental, and vision insurance for you and your family. </li><li>One Medical and Cue memberships for you and your family. </li><li>401(k) with matching. </li><li>Commuter benefits. </li><li>FSA. </li><li>Good stock options. </li><li>Catered lunches and dinners. </li><li>20 vacation days. Plus sickness and bereavement days for when life happens. </li><li>All the gadgetry you need, including a new phone every year. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Special time to join<br><br></strong>Because we're small, there's a lot of energy. And because we have tremendous traction, your first commit touches millions. This combination is rare and quite satisfying.

Job Description: Embedded Software Engineer<br><br>Location: Cupertino CA, Hybrid<br><br><strong>Key Skills: </strong>10 years of Embedded development experience, embedded firmware, Experience with any of these languages - Python, Objective-C, Swift, C, C++, Firmware validation experience, Board design experience, serial communication protocols, and ability to read bus traces (I2C, SPI, UART, USB, etc.)<br><br><strong><u>Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>5+ years of experience in embedded firmware with good EE skills - preferably on consumer hardware/software products. </li><li>Automation experience in modern scripting or compiled languages (Python, Objective-C, Swift, C, C++, etc.) </li><li>Firmware validation efforts include hands-on functional, white box testing, bug reporting, maintaining test guidelines, development and execution, and triage of automated tests. </li><li>Able to read board schematics and know EE fundamentals. </li><li>Experience with board design (ex: schematic capture, layout, etc) or hardware validation. </li><li>Experience with triage and troubleshooting automated tests and failures to determine product issues across the hardware-software domain. </li><li>Experience with hardware and/or software development lifecycle processes. </li><li>Ability to tackle hard problems with creative and balanced solutions. </li><li>UI software development on MacOS, Windows, or iOS applications for simple engineering applications. (Qt and/or SWIFT preferred) </li><li>Experience with CI/CD software frameworks like Jenkins. </li><li>Knowledgeable about serial communication protocols and ability to read bus traces (I2C, SPI, UART, USB, etc.) </li><li>Able to use tools such as oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, and on-chip debuggers. </li><li>Version control systems such as Git, and Perforce. </li><li>Simple soldering and rework experience is a plus. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Additional Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Promote innovation and new technology to further improve Apple's display performance and user experience. </li><li>Build and give presentations before and after prototyping new insights. </li><li>Communicate and demonstrate prototypes to multi-functional Teams. </li><li>Demonstrate creativity in problem-solving and adapt quickly to new technical areas. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Education &amp; Experience<br><br></u></strong>MS with 5+ years, or BS with 7+ years of relevant embedded/EE experience.

<strong>Who is Recruiting from Scratch: </strong><p><br></p>Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.<p><br></p><strong> From Our Client </strong><p><br></p>Location: New York / Remote<p><br></p>Job Type: Full-time<p><br></p>Experience: 3+ years<p><br></p><strong>About The Role</strong><p><br></p>Our mission is to increase the number of financially independent people. We believe we can achieve this goal by building tools that enable independent business owners to scale their businesses profitably. Our first product combines a virtual credit card system with dynamic spending limits and software tooling to help merchants grow and optimize their profitability. We are growing very fast -- in less than five months, we grew to millions in card volume. We have a significant waitlist of customers waiting to use our product. We are looking to expand our headcount quickly to support the demand. Our investors include Solomon Hykes (founder of Docker), Paul Buchheit (founder of Gmail), Paul Graham (founder of Y Combinator), Robert Leshner (founder of compound.finance), and many more. We have raised over $30M from top-tier fintech investors.<p><br></p><strong>What You'll Be Working On</strong><p><br></p>You'll be involved in projects of varying scope and complexity:<p><br></p><ul><li> Build credit risk models that segment merchants based on their revenue and spend patterns to offer dynamic credit limits that change with business performance given the high seasonality and fast pace of ecommerce </li><li> Use machine learning tools to build realtime credit underwriting models leveraging alternative and traditional data sources </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You'll Need</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Passion for, or curiosity to learn, financial technology </li><li> Track record of high-quality shipping products and features at scale </li><li> Ability to turn business and product ideas into engineering solutions </li><li> Desire to work in a fast-paced environment, continuously grow and master your craft </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We’d Like To See</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Experience with building out data pipelines (e.g. should know data lakes, data warehouses, ETL, etc.) </li><li> Experience working with data analytics, algorithmic decision making, and real-time data systems </li><li> Experience with different business requirements on data freshness and retention </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> PLUSES </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Proven experience and subject matter expertise in e-commerce payments (nice to have) or financial services. </li><li> Has worked with bank account data (e.g. worked with Plaid), payments data (perhaps Stripe), and/or other fintech data sources </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Why you should join us: </strong><p><br></p>Our mission is to increase the number of financially independent people. We believe we can achieve this goal by building tools that enable independent business owners to scale their businesses profitably. Our first product combines a virtual credit card system with dynamic spending limits and software tooling to help merchants grow and optimize their profitability. We are growing very fast -- in less than five months, we have grown to millions in card volume.<p><br></p>We have a significant waitlist of customers waiting to use our product. We are looking to expand our headcount quickly to support the demand. Our investors include Solomon Hykes (founder of Docker), Paul Buchheit (founder of Gmail), Paul Graham (founder of Y Combinator), Robert Leshner (founder of compound.finance), and many more. We recently closed a financing round of $5M from a top-tier fintech investor.<p><br></p><strong> Salary Range: $150,000-$250,000 base.</strong>

Company Overview Pattern Energy is a leading renewable energy company that develops, constructs, owns, and operates high-quality wind and solar generation, transmission, and energy storage facilities. Our mission is to transition the world to renewable energy through the sustainable development and responsible operation of facilities with respect for the environment, communities, and cultures where we have a presence. Our approach begins and ends with establishing trust, accountability, and transparency. Our company values of creative spirit, pride of ownership, follow-through, and a team-first attitude drive us to pursue our mission every day. Our culture supports our values by fostering innovative and critical thinking and a deep belief in living up to our promises. Headquartered in the United States, Pattern has a global portfolio of more than 35 power facilities and transmission assets, serving various customers that provide low-cost clean energy to millions of consumers. Job Purpose Pattern Energy is embarking on a major business transformation to scale processes and systems to enable the significant growth of our business. One critical aspect of this transformation is building an enterprise data architecture capable of supporting strong enterprise analytical capabilities and interconnected data across functions for improved and real-time decision making. This new role of Senior Data Engineer will be instrumental in building this future. The Senior Data Engineer will help guide Pattern’s journey by building novel and modern tools, pipelines, and data systems. Through lived experience this role will act in a key strategic resource in our transition from siloed, disparate data assets to a grand, unified, data estate. The senior data engineer will lead development of data systems, namely data lakehouse pipeline, and analytics environments to support data lifecycles across the business. These tools will help drive our efforts toward democratization of data, reducing duplication of effort, and adding value to the data stream. Key Accountabilities Work with the Data team to understand and interpret use cases around the business and develop tools/systems to support data lifecycle from the point of production to the point of consumption. Implement modern technology and concepts to enable Pattern teams’ design of enterprise-grade systems capable of achieving data goals. Develop pipelines and analytics tools, including automations wherever possible Templatize these solutions to help our adoption of infrastructure-as-code Experience/Qualifications/Education Required Previous experience in building enterprise data lifecycle and cloud solutions. 5-7 years experience, specific to data management, analytics, or data reporting. B.S. in a technical field with M.S. preferred. Significant experience delivering Data solutions using the Azure cloud stack Experience with database, data lake, lakehouse design concepts and the use of SQL. Experience with transformations and reporting solutions, namely Power BI Experience with environment management, release management, code versioning, deployment methodologies, and CI/CD tools Additional Requirements Demonstrated excellence and ability to learn new programming skills and languages. Strong understanding of security and governance principles, including access policies Proven record of excellent communication and cooperation with varied stakeholders. Renewable energy industry experience is strongly preferred. Demonstrated experience building scalable data models &amp; ingestion pipelines from a variety of systems including Enterprise Applications (e.g. ERP, CRM), Operational Assets (e.g. SCADA), Big Data (e.g. Weather or product configuration simulators). Technical Skills Experience throughout the Microsoft Integrated Data Platform (IDP) and related stacks including, but not limited to: Azure, AAD, Synapse, Purview, Data Lake, Delta Lake, and Lakehouse design Azure Data Factory, Data Explorer, Logic Apps, Power Automate Databricks; PySpark, and optimized resource consumption, therein The expected starting pay range for this role is $95,000 - $129,000 USD. This range is an estimate and base pay may be above or below the ranges based on several factors including but not limited to location, work experience, certifications, and education. In addition to base pay, Pattern’s compensation program includes a bonus structure for full-time employees of all levels. We also provide a comprehensive benefits package which includes medical, dental, vision, short and long-term disability, life insurance, voluntary benefits, family care benefits, employee assistance program, paid time off and bonding leave, paid holidays, 401(k)/RRSP retirement savings plan with employer contribution, and employee referral bonuses. Pattern Energy Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. LI-AT1 LI-Hybrid ID: 2023-2250 External Company Name: Pattern Energy Group LP External Company URL: www.patternenergy.com Street: 1088 Sansome Street

describtion: We are a deeply data-driven company with data driving not only business decisions but also product features and directions. Our team is responsible for supporting one of the biggest in-house Hadoop/Spark infrastructure in Silicon Valley. We build infrastructure and tools to power thousands of AI engineers, data analytics, and software engineers within the company. We are also committed to being an early adopter and contributor to open source big data technologies, including Hadoop, Spark, and TensorFlow. We are looking for a data engineer with a focus on Hadoop and Spark to develop our Spark infrastructure and grow our Spark user groups. Your work will impact thousands of Spark users inside and outside the company.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Prepare training material and hold technical training sessions for internal Spark users</li><li> Developing Spark infrastructure, Spark user libraries and tooling to make direct impact to users</li><li> Interact with multiple groups on a daily basis to design data solutions and promote the best Spark practices among users</li><li> Solve production issues related to user Spark applications</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Basic Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> BS/MS in Computer Science or related technical discipline</li><li> 1+ years of relevant work experience in Spark and Hadoop</li><li> Excellent communication and presentation skills</li><li> Good understanding of Spark, Hadoop, HDFS, YARN, Hive technologies</li><li> Good understanding of distributed storage and computing systems</li><li> Good understanding of programming language like Java and Scala</li><li> Good understanding of scripting language like Shell and Python</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Good understanding in Spark Core and Spark SQL engine</li><li> Experience in building large scale applications with Spark SQL</li><li> Experience in writing, analyzing, and debugging SQL queries using Hive and Spark SQL</li><li> Experience with tuning large scale Spark jobs</li><li> Experience in working with a data format on Hadoop/Spark like Avro, Orc, and Parquet</li><li> Experience with Interactive Spark Notebooks (Jupyter Notebooks)</li></ul>

Good Fit</u></strong><p><br></p>We deeply value generalist software engineers who can engage with new problems and get things done at a startup, and our team members come from a variety of backgrounds things</li></ul><p><br></p><em>The pay range for this position in California is $175,000 - $350,000yr; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, candidate describtion: <strong>About Kiddom</strong><p><br></p>There’s a lack of high quality core curriculum in the K-12 marketplace and it’s exacerbating educational inequities, directly impeding our children’s ability to pursue the college or career pathways of their dreams. We believe high quality instructional materials are critical for an outstanding education. Kiddom’s technology helps teachers understand, utilize, and measure the impact of curriculum. Our platform offers school districts only the best curriculum in the marketplace, rebuilt inside simple, flexible technology to enable teachers and learners to unlock their full potential.<p><br></p>We are a passionate, collaborative team focused on building transformative education technology and making a measurable impact in K-12 education.<p><br></p>We strive to create an inclusive, positive team culture where everyone is respected and valued for everything they bring to Kiddom, not just what they produce.<p><br></p>To tackle this challenge, Kiddom is looking for a Backend Engineer who will embody forward-thinking best practices and bring a positive attitude to work with our team and strive for the betterment of our children's education and the future of our society.<p><br></p>You will...<p><br></p><ul><li>Design and build a scalable, generalized framework for third-party API integrations</li><li>Leverage existing infrastructure and components to build RESTful web services</li><li>Build APIs and robust testing environments for internal and external developers</li><li>Bring an attention to detail - what we do affects people’s educational opportunities and we have to be mindful of that</li><li>Craft delightful user experiences</li><li>Own the product - we love people who pick up things and run with them<br><br></li></ul>What we look for<p><br></p><ul><li>BS or MS in Computer Science or a related field</li><li>5+ years professional software engineering experience</li><li>Experience designing and building REST APIs</li><li>Exposure to authorization technologies (OAuth)</li><li>Experience with continuous integration and automation tools and processes</li><li>Strong knowledge of design patterns and software engineering best practices</li><li>You've been through the planning, launching and refactoring phases of code you wrote</li><li>Excellent problem solving and debugging skills</li><li>Ability to work as part of a collaborative team in a fast-paced environment</li><li>Motivated and responsible individual who strives to exceed expectations</li><li>Sincere interest in working at a startup and scaling with the company as we grow<br><br></li></ul>Nice to have<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with educational technologies</li><li>Experience or interest in education</li><li>Experience working at a startup</li><li>Experience with React/Redux</li><li>Experience with Go(lang)</li><li>Experience with Cassandra, Elasticsearch, and AWS (EC2, DynamoDB, SNS/SQS, Lambda)</li><li>Experience with Terraform<br><br></li></ul>Salary range is dependent on Geography and demonstrated technical ability during the interview process.<p><br></p>Potential range: 100k-225k<p><br></p>What we offer<p><br></p>We are a passionate, collaborative team focused on building transformative education technology and making a measurable impact in K-12 education.<p><br></p>We strive to create an inclusive, positive team culture where everyone is respected and valued for everything they bring to Kiddom, not just what they produce.<p><br></p>Full time permanent employees are eligible for the following benefits from their first day:<p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive salary</li><li>Meaningful equity</li><li>Health benefits: medical (various PPO/HMO/HSA plans), dental, vision, disability and life insurance</li><li>10 paid sick days per year</li><li>Unlimited vacation time policy (subject to internal approval). Average use 4 weeks off per year</li><li>Paid family leave after birth/adoption of caretakers and minimum of 16 paid weeks for birthing parents. Meant to supplement benefits offered by State<br></li></ul><p><br></p>COVID Vaccination Policy<p><br></p>Kiddom policy requires employees to be vaccinated before they visit an office or attend company events..<p><br></p>We have remote roles but in certain positions where office attendance is deemed to be essential to the role, offers of employment shall be conditional upon proof of vaccination.

describtion: At Cache DNA, we have one ambitious mission: to make data widely accessible and useful by providing the best format for storing biomolecules in the world. We believe that DNA and RNA are the modern bits, so we're bringing together hardware, software, and biochemistry to develop the first wet operating system for storing, accessing, and computing nucleic acids at scale.<p><br></p>You are interested in the intersection of molecular biology, computer science, and chemistry and are eager to help us leverage tools from these areas to create the future of computing.<p><br></p>We are rebuilding the backbone of precision medicine, and we are looking for experienced software engineers with a track record of developing products that scale. As one of the early builders of Cache, you’ll have a direct and lasting impact on what we’re building while also learning emerging technologies in the biotechnology space.<p><br></p>Together, we will build and validate new processes that will enable the future of biological computing.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Developing minimum viable product for handling large-scale multi-omic/sequencing data with academic and commercial stakeholders</li><li>Design and implement effective database solutions to store and retrieve information, integrating with other software solutions accordingly</li><li>You will frequently operate at the leading edge of technology and provide leadership to define specifications for significant new projects and design and develop solutions according to those specifications</li><li>Examine and identify database structural necessities by evaluating client operations, applications, and programming. Recommend and justify major changes to existing data storage products/services/processes.</li><li>You will be involved in running the complex projects, including management of project timelines, deliverables, and resources during all project phases, from requirements gathering through go-live and project close out.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>B.S. in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Bioinformatics or a related field</li><li>At least 3 years identifying and documenting process requirements, developing process flow analysis, data modeling, functional design experience, and creating project plans</li><li>Experience with database solutions applicable to AWS/Azure (or other cloud providers) and on-prem computing environments</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills and ability to manage teams internally and externally</li><li>Strong project management skills and track record of successfully building technology-based solutions</li><li>Mastery of at least 1 programming language and ability to debug, code from scratch, and build on other bases effectively.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>At least 5 years of software engineering or related industry experience</li><li>Experience dealing with privacy and security for health-related data (or other highly regulated environments like banking or energy)</li><li>Has worked in the field of genomics or biotechnology with an interest in laboratory automation and life science tools</li><li>Experience in using different database types, including relational and NoSQL databases</li><li>Strong math and analytical skills</li><li>Fluency in multiple programming languages (e.g. Python, SQL, R, Julia, C#, Perl, PHP)</li></ul><p><br></p>This might be a good fit for you if you...<p><br></p><ul><li>Are hoping to join the leadership of an early stage deeptech company</li><li>Are passionate about learning and trying new technologies at the intersection of biology, genomics, and computer science</li><li>Have a keen eye for detail and like to build</li><li>Like working with small teams</li><li>Have a sharp focus on getting things done, troubleshoot challenges in startups as they arise, and can thrive on uncertainty in an ever-changing and fast-paced environment</li></ul><p><br></p>What we offer...<p><br></p><ul><li>Equity</li><li>Medical/dental/vision insurance</li><li>Worker's compensation</li><li>Unlimited PTO subject to manager approval.</li><li>100% remote work options.</li><li>A culture of growth with a talented team around you equally committed to success and ensuring each individual's mental health is supported.</li><li>Coming soon: 401k.</li></ul><p><br></p>All Cache DNA employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.<p><br></p>Cache DNA is an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce. Compensation is commensurate with experience.

From making valuable connections between people and businesses to building premium services that deliver high-value experiences, the monetization organization at Meta empowers people and businesses to succeed in the global economy. As Meta focuses on building the next evolution of social experiences, the monetization team plays a crucial role in shaping the communication pathways and financial tools that all sized businesses, especially small to medium ones, need to thrive in the new digital economic environment. And we achieve that from end-to-end product and technology innovation.As a Machine Learning Engineer on the monetization team at Meta, you can help build cutting-edge full-stack technologies that will transform the way people and businesses connect and communicate. You’ll help develop industry-leading solutions that power next-generation, large-scale platforms and AI services to help connect billions of people around the world.<p><br></p>Software Engineer, Machine Learning - Monetization Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Develop highly scalable classifiers and tools leveraging machine learning, data regression, and rules based models</li><li>Suggest, collect and synthesize requirements and create effective feature roadmap</li><li>Code deliverables in tandem with the engineering team</li><li>Adapt standard machine learning methods to best exploit modern parallel environments (e.g. distributed clusters, multicore SMP, and GPU)</li></ul><p><br></p>Minimum Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>2+ years of experience in one or more of the following areas: machine learning, recommendation systems, pattern recognition, data mining or artificial intelligence</li><li>Proven experience to translate insights into business recommendations</li><li>Experience with Hadoop/HBase/Pig or MapReduce/Sawzall/Bigtable</li><li>Knowledge developing and debugging in C/C++ and Java</li><li>Experience with scripting languages such as Perl, Python, PHP, and shell scripts</li><li>Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience. Degree must be completed prior to joining Meta.</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>Exposure to architectural patterns of large scale software applications</li></ul><p><br></p>Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. You may view our Equal Employment Opportunity notice here. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. We may use your information to maintain the safety and security of Meta, its employees, and others as required or permitted by law. You may view Meta's Pay Transparency Policy, Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law notice, and Notice to Applicants for Employment and Employees by clicking on their corresponding links. Additionally, Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law

jobs_titles: Software Engineer, Database - Languages & Relational Technologies
describtion: At Yugabyte, we are on a mission to become the default transactional database for the cloud. We are well underway on this journey with YugabyteDB, the open source, high-performance, distributed SQL database that runs on any cloud and enables developers to get instantly productive using well-known APIs. We are looking for talented and driven people to join us on our ambitious mission and help us build a lasting and impactful company.<p><br></p>We announced a $188M Series C round at a $1.3B valuation in October 2021, however we very much believe we are still in the early stages of our company's journey. The transactional database market is estimated to grow from $40B in 2021 to $64B by 2025. Given our database is cloud-native by design, has on-demand horizontal scalability, and allows for geographical distribution of data using built-in replication, we are extremely well-positioned to address the market need for geo-distributed, high-scale, high-performance wordloads.<p><br></p>The LRT group is responsible for the language layer and relational execution engine powering the YugabyteDB database. We care deeply about correctness, performance, and usability of the system we are building. We are always looking for innovative solutions to these challenges, be it from other industry applications, academic research or original contributions, as our team's work powers a broad range of components. The team's work areas include query planning and optimization, consistent online schema changes, as well as a broad set of SQL features including stored procedures, triggers, geo-partitioned tables, or GIN indexes for text search.<p><br></p><strong>Role And Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Research, design, implement, test and release new database features and enhancements</li><li>Write high quality C/C++ code and comprehensive test cases. Participate in the code review process</li><li>Troubleshoot correctness, stability or performance issues related to statement planning and execution in a complex distributed system</li><li>Identify and implement performance improvements such as enhancing plan selection, batching or parallelizing work, or pushing down plan subtrees to the data nodes</li><li>Improve database scalability as we expand cluster sizes and transaction throughput</li><li>Contribute to the growth of our open source database product, YugabyteDB</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Required Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with compiled languages, e.g. C/C++ (preferred), Java, Go, Rust. </li><li>Knowledge of database internals, compilers, query planning/optimization is a plus. </li><li>Systems engineering fundamentals (e.g.: distributed systems, operating systems, databases) is a plus. </li><li>BS/MS/PhD in CS (or related field) or equivalent experience. </li></ul><p><br></p>We feel strongly about equal pay for equal work, and transparency in compensation is one way to help achieve that. The cash compensation for this role is market competitive, with a range of $120,000-$250,000, as well as equity (when applicable), and benefits including health plans, retirement plans, and unlimited paid time off (PTO). Some roles also include variable/incentive compensation, or a competitive On Target Earnings (OTE) incentive compensation structure. The pay range for this position is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. The actual pay will vary based on factors including experience, qualifications, and skill level.<p><br></p><strong>Equal Employment Opportunity Statement</strong>:<p><br></p>As an equal opportunity employer, Yugabyte is committed to a diverse workforce. Employment decisions regarding recruitment and selection will be made without discrimination based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, genetic information or characteristic, gender identity and expression, veteran status, or other non-job related characteristics or other prohibited grounds specified in applicable federal, state and local laws.<p><br></p>To review Yugabyte's Privacy Policy please visit Yugabyte Privacy Notice.
